BEGGIE, ALFRED GLYNN, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., July, 1861; arrived, Nov., 1870; joined the dept., Feb., 1871, as asst. engr. in the railway dept., Central India; exec. engr., Oct., 1871; Agra-Gwalior railway survey, Nov., 1872; offg. dep. controller of accts., Bengal, Aug., 1874; controller of accts., Mysore, Aug., 1875; examr., guaranteed railway accts., Calcutta, 1878; Punjab N. railway accts., 1880; dep. acctnt.-gen., and under sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., Jan., 1886; acctnt.-gen. and dep. sec., Oct., 1889; retd., July, 1893.

BEHARI LAL GUPTA, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Colootola Branch Sch., Calcutta, Calcutta Univ., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 29th Sept., 1871, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine relief duty, Sept., 1874; presidency mag. and coroner, Calcutta, June, 1881; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1888.

BEIGHTON, THOMAS DURANT, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at King Edward's Sch., Birmingham; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867; and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; on special duty in connection with boundary disputes on the Bhutan frontier, Jan., 1878; district and sessions judge, May, 1885; acted as supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs in 1894; member of provl. legisl. council, March, 1895; retd., May, 1896; author of 'The Ethnography of the Bhutan Frontier,' and two pamphlets.

BELCHAMBERS, ROBERT, Jud. Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service, 15th Sept., 1848; dep. registrar, Calcutta high court, Feb., 1851; registrar, Oct., 1862; is also keeper of records, taxing officer, acctnt.-gen., and sealer; author of 'Practice of the Civil Courts,' and other legal publns.

BELL, CHARLES ALFRED, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 3rd Nov., 1891, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. settlt. officer.

BELL, HENRY JAMES, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Gordon's Coll., Aberdeen, Aberdeen Univ., and St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 26th Nov., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag.
Jan., 1896; asst. supt. and judge, small cause court, Mar., 1896.

BELL, HORACE, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. proby. asst. engr., 7th July, 1862; served in the Central Prov. and Central India, and was promoted to exec. engr., 1st grade, March, 1871; subsequently served on the Punjab, Rajputana, and Sindia and Nimach state railways; suptg. engr., Jan., 1880; transfd. to Bengal, Nov., 1881; engr.-in-chief, Dacca and Maimansingh railway surveys, Dec., 1881; manager and engr.-in-chief, Tirhut state railway, Feb., 1884; acting dir., N.W. railway, July - Oct., 1887; engr.-in-chief, Great Western of India railway survey, Sept., 1888, and of the Moghal Sarai Howrah railway survey, Feb., 1889; consulting engr. to the govt. of India for railways, Aug., 1890; chief engr., Oct., 1890; offig. dir.-gen. of railways, and dep. sec., Jan. to April, 1893, when he reverted to his post of consulting engr.; retd., June, 1894; author of 'Laws of Wealth,' a work on pol. economy for native readers, and of 'Railway Policy in India.'

BELL, JAMES RICHARD, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 8th Oct., 1868, and served as asst. engr., exec. engr., and supt. of works in various projects; engr.-in-chief, Haidarabad-Umarkot railway survey, Jan., 1890; in charge of Mari extension of the Sind-Sagar branch of the N.W. railway, Feb., 1890; suptg. engr., Oct., 1890; engr.-in-chief of the Mari-Attock extension railway and frontier railway surveys, Dec., 1891; engr.-in-chief, E. Coast railway, May, 1893; consulting engr. to the govt. of India for state railways, June, 1894; rank of chief engr., July, 1894.

BELL, JOHN MACKENZIE, M.I.C.E., late Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd Dec., 1867, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Sept., 1877; retd., April, 1895.

BELL, MATTHEW DENNY, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch., and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 25th Nov., 1881, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; sub-collr. and joint mag., Dec., 1894.

BELL, WILLIAM, M.A., Educl. Dept., Punjab.—Joined the service, 16th Oct., 1885, as principal, central training coll., Lahore; profir. in the govt. coll. there, March, 1888; principal, April, 1892; author of a number of educ. works.

BELLASIS, EDWARD SKELTON, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and employed on irrig. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., May, 1883.

BELLETT, GEORGE, M.A., late Educl. Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service, 1st Feb., 1861; served successively as 2nd master, head master, and profir., Dacca coll.; inspr. of schools, Nov., 1868; profir., Presidency coll., Dec., 1873; principal, Berhampur coll., May, 1875; inspr. of schools, Nov., 1881; offig. dir. of public instrn., Jan., 1883; retd., April, 1893.

BELLINGHAM, HORACE COHEN, Finl. Dept., India Office.—Writer, India office, 18th May, 1875; clerk specially attached, Sept., 1892.

BENNETT, WILLIAM CHARLES, late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll., and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867, and served in Oudh as asst. commr. and asst. settlt. officer; manager of encumbered estates, Gonda, 1872-75; offig. sec. to govt. Oudh rev. dept., Sept.-Nov., 1879; dir. of agric. and commerce, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, April, 1891; sec., board of rev., May, 1886; sec. to govt., rev. and jud. depts., Nov., 1888; sec. in jud. dept., April, 1889; member of legisl. council, 1889-91; settlt. commr. and addl. commr., Oudh, July, 1894; retd., Oct., 1896; author of 'History of the Chief Clans of the Rae Bareli District,' contributions to the Oudh Gazetteer, and the Gonda settlt. report.

BENGERO, ALFRED, India Audit Office.—Temporary clerk, 20th Nov., 1866; junr. asst., June, 1867; senr. examr., July, 1877; designation changed to senr. clerk, Oct., 1892.

BENIMADHAB MITTRA, Bengal Jud. Dept.—Joined the service, 2nd May, 1866, as munsif; subord. judge, Nov., 1879.

BENNETT, JOHN, M.D., Brigade-Surgn., late Med. Dept., Punjab.—Joined the dept., 1865; from Sept., 1870, served in the Punjab as civil surgn. at various stations, jail supt., supt. of vaccn., and dep. sanitary commr.; med. adviser to the Maharaja of Patiala, Aug., 1885; retd., Sept., 1890.

BENSLEY, EDWIN CLEMENT, Surgn.-Major, late Bengali Med. Service.—First commn., 1859; served from 22nd July, 1863, as civil asst. surgn. at Midnapur and Rajshahi; civil surgn., Rajshahi, Oct., 1875; retd., Nov., 1885.

BENSON, CHARLES, M.R.A.C., Madras Rev. Dept.—Joined the service, 30th Jan., 1874, as asst. supt., Saidapet farms; asst. dir. of agric., April, 1883; asst. commr. of land records and agric., April, 1887; asst. dir. of that dept., Nov., 1887; dep. dir., Jan., 1892.

BENSON, RALPH SILLERY, M.A., LL.B., B.L., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Rathmines Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 29th Oct., 1873, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; acted as head asst. collr. and mag. of Cuddapah during the famine of 1876-78; specially apptd. officer for the settlt. of lands in the Nilgiri districts; head asst., N. Arcot, June, 1882; sec. to the local self-govt. committee, Oct., 1882; forest settlt. officer, May, 1883; acting under sec. to govt. in 1885 and 1887; acting sec. to the commrs. of land rev., 1887-88; sub-collr. and joint mag., Oct., 1887; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1889; collr. and mag., Feb., 1895; judge, High Court, March, 1896; author of the settlt. registers and report, and descriptive memoirs, of the Nilgiri district.

BENSON, THOMAS, B.A., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Tavistock Gr. Sch., Marlborough Coll., and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 14th Nov., 1868, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., asst. settlt. officer, and manager of the Awa estate; asst. commr., Oudh, Oct., 1883; joint mag., Nov., 1883; district and sessions judge, April, 1887; retd., Jan., 1896.

BENTINCK, BARON JOHN, late Punjab Commn.—Educ. at Leyden Univ. (doctor of Roman and Dutch law); joined the service, 6th Dec., 1869, as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Jan., 1892; retd., Dec., 1894.

BENTON, ALEXANDER HAY, M.A., late Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the Univ. and King's Coll., Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 20th Feb., 1864, and served in the
N.W. Prov. and Punjab as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; jud. asst., Nov., 1876; dep. commr., Jan., 1879; divl. judge, Nov., 1882; judge of chief court, Nov., 1889; retd., July, 1894.

BENTON, JOHN, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1873, and employed on irrig. work in the Punjab; exec. engr., Oct., 1881.

BERESFORD, JOHN STUART, M.E., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service as asst. engr., N.W. Prov., 26th July, 1867; exec. engr., Sept., 1872; personal asst. to chief engr., irrign., May, 1877, and 1884-85; suptg. engr., Dec., 1889; joint sec. to govt., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Aug., 1892; chief engr., Feb., 1893; sec. to chief commr., Central Prov., public works dept., June, 1895.

BERESFORD, LORD WILLIAM LESLIE DE LA POER, K.C.I.E., V.C., Col.—First commn., June, 1867; served in the Jowaki-Afriki expdn., 1877-78 (medal and clasp); also in the Zulu war of 1879 (V. C., medal, and clasp); and in the Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal and clasp); A.D.C. to viceroy of India, 1875-81; mil. sec. to viceroy, Dec., 1881 to Dec., 1883; K.C.I.E., Jan., 1884; served with the Burmese expdn. of 1886, as mil. sec. to govr.-gen. (clasp).

BERKELEY, JAMES CAVAN, C.I.E., Maj.-Gen., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Madras infantry, Oct., 1857; served from June, 1862, as asst. to the govr.-gen.'s agent in Central India; also as boundary settlt. officer, dep. opium agent in Malwa, asst. gen. supt. for thagi and dakaiti, and sessions judge and registrar for Mhow; pol. agent, Haraoti and Tonk, 1873; pol. agent, Baghelkhand, Jan., 1879; pol. agent, Jacobabad, 1882; offg. rest., Gwalior, March, 1883; on special duty, Kashmir, 1884; pol. agent, Bundelkhand, 1884; offg. rest., Nipal, 1885; rest. and govr.-gen.'s agent at Baroda, April, 1886; reverted to mil. dept., Nov., 1887.

BERNARD, SIR CHARLES EDWARD, K.C.S.I., late Bengal C.S., Rev. and Statistics Dept., India Office.—Apptd. to the Bengal civil service from Haileybury; arrived, 12th Feb., 1858, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; under sec., govt. of India, finl. dept., Aug., 1861; from Oct., 1862, served in the Central Prov. as judge of the small cause court, Nagpur, settlt. officer, sec. to the chief commr. (July, 1864), commr. of Nagpur (Feb., 1869) and acting jud. commr.; from May, 1871, to Jan., 1875, served in Bengal as member of legisl. council, and acting sec. to govt., first in the jud., then in the rev., and lastly in the scarcity and relief dept.; from Nov., 1876, served as commr. of Nagpur divn.; sec. to Sir Richard Temple, depd. on a special mission to Bombay and Madras, Jan., 1877; jud. commr., Central Prov., Aug., 1877; addl. sec. to govt. of India in the dept. of rev., agric., and commerce, Aug., 1877, and in the finl. dept., Dec., 1877; sec. to govt. of India in the home dept., May, 1878, and in rev. and agric. dept., July, 1881; from July, 1880, acted as chief commr. of British Burma; confd., April, 1882; retd., March, 1888, and was apptd. sec. in the rev. and statistics dept., India office.

BERNARD, JAMES HENRY, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 30th Dec., 1884; asst. mag. and collr., Midnapur, Jan., 1885; personal asst. to chief commr., British Burma, June, 1886; returned to Bengal, Feb., 1887, as offg. under sec.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Dec., 1891; mag. and collr., Feb., 1896.

BERRILL, EDWARD, Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Served in the Mutiny in Barrow's volunteer cavalry; adjutant, mil. police, Central Prov., 14th Aug., 1858; inspr. of police, N.W. Prov., Feb., 1861, and asst. inspr.-gen., Dec., 1861; district supt., May, 1867; dep.-inspr.-gen. of police, March, 1893.

BERTHOUD, CHARLES HENRY, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Uppingham Sch., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 4th Dec., 1895, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

BEST, JAMES WILLIAM, B.A., B.L., late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Wimborne Gr. Sch., and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 8th Dec., 1862; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-collr. and joint mag. in various districts; from Jan., 1875, served in the jud. dept. as district and sessions judge; judge of the high court, March, 1893; retd., Nov., 1895, and was apptd. chief justice of Mysore.

BEVAN, JAMES FORBES, late India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the service as asst., 21st June, 1866; arrived 14th Sept., 1866, and served on various lines in Bengal and the Punjab; supt., June, 1880; offg. dir., construction branch, 1891-92; retd., Sept., 1895.

BEVERIDGE, HENRY, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1857; arrived, 20th Jan., 1858; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and mag. and collr.; on special duty in Manipur, Nov., 1863; from Oct., 1874, served in the jud. dept.; district and sessions judge, March, 1875; retd., Jan., 1893; author of 'History of Backergunge,' 'The Trial of Nandakumar,' &c., &c.

BEVERLEY, HENRY, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Sedbergh Sch., and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., dep. commr., and joint mag.; registrar-gen. of assurances, March, 1867; inspr.-gen. of registrn., Dec., 1870; suptd. the first census of Bengal in 1872; also the census of Calcutta, 1876; district and sessions judge, and adnl. judge, 24-Parganas and Hugli, Dec., 1877; census officer, Calcutta, Dec., 1880, and publ. a report on the census, 1881; member of Bengal legisl. council, Jan., 1884; judge of the high court, Calcutta, May, 1885; has publ. a 'Registration Manual' and 'The Land Registration Act.'

BHAGWAN CHUNDER CHAKARBUTTI, late Jud. Dept., Bengal.—From 9th Oct., 1861, served in the subord. jud. service, Bengal, and was apptd. subord. judge, 1st grade, May, 1884; retd., Nov., 1891.

BIHARAT SINGH, Kunwar, Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. probr. under native civil service rules, 16th Feb., 1880; confd., March, 1882; served as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. commr.; joint mag., March, 1892; dist. and sess. judge, June, 1895.
BICKERTON, Charles Howard Cotton, A.M.I.C.E., Indian Public Works Dept.—Apptd. from Royal Indian Engrg. Coll., 1st Oct., 1875, as asst. engr., and posted to state railways; exec. engr., July, 1886.

BIDDULPH, Cuthbert Edward, M.A., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Educ. at Westminster Sch. and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; joined the service as proby. asst. settlt. officer, Sind, 19th Jan., 1878; services placed at disposal of agent to govr.-gen. for Baluchistan, Nov., 1878; served during the Afghan war of 1878-80 (medal); asst. to the pol. supt., Sawantwari, in charge of the Sir Dasai, Feb., 1880; asst. survey and settlt. commr., Baroda, Nov., 1883; rev. settlt. officer, Mewar, Dec., 1886; asst. commr., Berar, Feb., 1891; cantonmt. mag., Secunderabad, Jan., 1895; author of 'Our Western Frontier of India,' 'Afghan Politics,' 'Afghan Poetry of the 17th Century,' 'Army Reforms in Native States,' 'Four Months in Persia,' &c.

BIDDULPH, John, Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Cornet, Bengal cavalry, Jan., 1858; arrived, 4th March, 1858, and served in the Mutiny campaign (medal); A.D.C. to the Viceroy, 1872-77; member of mission to Yarkand, &c., 1872-74; employed on a secret mission to the countries beyond Gilgit, 1876; on special duty in Gilgit, Sept., 1877; acting agent to govr.-gen., Baluchistan, May-Nov., 1882; pol. agent, Bhopawar, Dec., 1882; pol. agent in Haraoi and Tonk, April, 1886; rest. and commr., Ajmir, April, 1890; offg. agent in Baluchistan, July, 1891; offg. rest., Gwalior, April, 1892; agent, Baroda, Jan., 1893; reverted to mil. dept., July, 1895; author of 'Tribes of the Hindukush.'

BIDDULPH, Thomas Henry Stillingfleet, Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Educ. at Lancing Coll.; from 17th July, 1866, served as acctnt., public works acctts., in Central India and Punjab, and as examr. of railway acctts.; probr. in finl. dept., March, 1871; asst. to the acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov., Feb., 1874; from Jan., 1879, served as asst. acctnt.-gen. in the N.W. Prov., and in the Punjab, and as dep. acctnt.-gen. in Madras; comptr., Haidarabad, Dec., 1884; comptr. of India treasuries, Nov., 1894; author of a work on the silver question.

BIDEN, William Maxwell, B.A., Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at St. Mark's Coll., Chelsea, and King's Coll., London; B.A., London Univ., 1830; provisional asst., art library, South Kensington Museum, 1870; clerk, 2nd class, India store depot, 1st July, 1875; supervisor, 2nd grade, June, 1886.

BIDIE, George, C.I.E., M.A., M.B., F.L.S., F.R.C.S.E., Surgn.-Gen., late Madras Med. Dept.—Educ. at the univ. of Aberdeen; joined the service, 20th Feb., 1856; employed from June, 1859, as civil surgn. of Guntur, med. officer of the Mysore farm commissariat establs., probr. in the med. coll., Madras, &c.; served in Mysore and Coorg, 1867-68, on special duty in the coffee districts; sec. to surgn.-gen., 1870-72, and again in 1880-84 and 1884-85; supt. of the govt. central museum, 1872-84, and 1885; on special duty in connection with cinchona commn., 1873; fellow of Madras univ., 1879; served in public dept., 1883, in connection with Calcutta exhibtn.; sanitary commr., Madras, April, 1883; surgn.-gen. with the govt. of Madras, Oct., 1886; retd., April, 1890; in 1891, acted as Madras delegate at the international congress of hygiene and demography, and drew up an abstract of its proceedings; author of numerous publns. connected with the botany and zoology of Madras.

BIERNACKI, Andrew, late India Public Works Dept.—First sub-engr., Punjab N. railway, temporary, Jan., 1870; confd., 10th Oct., 1871; asst. locomotive supt., Jan., 1876; locomotive and carriage supt., Sind section, N.W. railway, May, 1887; dep. locomotive supt., July, 1889; retd., 1890.

BIGG-WITHER, Archibald Cuthbert, Lieut.-Col., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr. from Thomason Coll., Oct., 1866, after serving in the Bengal infantry from Jan., 1862; exec. engr., Sept., 1871; served chiefly on the Indus valley state railway, and in Baluchistan from 1885; sec. to agent to govr.-gen., Baluchistan, and suptg. engr., May, 1890; sec. to chief commr., Assam, public works dept., May, 1894; transfd. to Bengal, June, 1895.

BIGGE, William, M.A., B.L., Jud. Dept., Burma.—Educ. at New Coll., Oxford; 1st judge of the small cause court, Rangoon, 28th Sept., 1886; offg. judge of Maulmain, 1892-93.

BIGGS, Charles, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 3rd April, 1882.

BIGGS, Thomas Hesketh, Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the dept., 26th Sept., 1868, and served as asst. acctnt.-gen. in Bombay, the Central Prov. and Madras; asst. comprt.-gen., Dec., 1873; served subsequently in the Punjab, Central Prov., Bengal, Bombay, and Assam, as asst. to acctnt.-gen.; comprt., Assam, May, 1879; comprt. and commr. of paper currency, Burma, March, 1887; comprt., Indian Treasuries, April, 1896; author of 'The Grammar of Indian Finance.'

BIGNELL, Edward Duncan Frederick, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 7th July, 1869; served in the Afghan war, 1880; adjutant, Malwa Bhil corps, 1881-87, and again in 1889 and 1890; second in command of Mewar Bhil corps, and second asst. rest., Mewar, April, 1890; commandant of the corps, and pol. supt., hilly tracts, Mewar, Nov., 1894.

BIGNELL, William Kyd D'Oyley, late India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. to the dept., Feb., 1857; supt., Nagpur, Jan., 1868; served in the Punjab from 1873; offg. dir., construction branch, 1883-84, and 1886-87; arranged telegraphs during Hazara expedit., 1888; chief supt., Sept., 1892; retd., Sept., 1895.

BILDERBECK, James Bourdillon, M.A., Madras Educ. Dept.—Joined the dept., 1st April, 1875, and served as asst. master, provl. sch. and profr., Rajmahendri and presidency cols.; profr. of English literature, presidency coll., March, 1884.

BINGHAM, Charles Thomas, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Forest Dept., Burma.—First commn., 8th July, 1868; joined the dept. as acting asst. conservator, Dec., 1876; confd., Dec., 1878; dep. conservator, July, 1880; conservator, Jan., 1883.

BIRCH, Edward Alfred, M.D., F.R.C.S., Brigade-Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., late Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the service, 1866; served through the Behar famine, 1874, and afterwards as civil surgn. at various stations; surgn. supt., presidency hosp., Jan., 1885; civil surgn., Hugli,
July, 1889; principal and profr. of medicine, med. coll., Calcutta, June, 1890; in addn., temporary inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., Bengal, Nov., 1892; retd., Oct., 1893.

BIRCH, ERNEST G., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Eton and Haileybury; apptd., 1849; served in the rev. and survey depts., Bengal, and was apptd. supt. of survey, northern divn., 1854; joint mag. and dep. collr., Barasat, 1858; mag. and collr., Bardwan, 1860; civil and sessions judge, Murshidabad, 1864, and subsequently of Shahabad; addl. judge of Chittagong, 1870; district and sessions judge of Bardwan, 1872; judge of the high court, Calcutta, 1873; retd., 1879.

BIRCH, FREDERICK MACDONALD, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 15th May, 1854; from Jan., 1860, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., small cause court judge, and dep. commr., and was placed on special duty in Kashmir, July, 1864, and again, Dec., 1878; offg. commr. and supt., Delhi, 1879-80, and subsequently in the Multan and Hissar divns.; reverted to mil. dept., 1891.

BIRCH, WILLIAM BRETON, Col., I.S.C., late Punjab Administration.—Arrived as ensign, 30th Nov., 1858; served with the China forces, 1861-62 (medal); joined the Bengal police dept., July, 1863, and served as supt. in various districts; vice-chairman, Burdwan municipality, March, 1867; offg. dep. commr. of police, Calcutta, Feb., 1869; commanded Sylhet frontier police battalion, on Lushai expdn., 1871-72; 2nd asst. supt., Andamans, April, 1873; 1st asst. supt., 1885; reverted to mil. dept., March, 1888; offg. cantmnt. mag., Punjab, July, 1889; retd., Nov., 1890; author of a report on sugar manufacture in the N.W. Prov. and Bengal (1881), of a report on jail manufactures in India (1881), and of the Andamans and Nicobar Manual (1886).

BIRD, CHARLES AUGUSTUS, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1863; served in Madras from June, 1866, and was apptd. principal asst. collr., May, 1881, district and sessions judge, Cuddapah, Oct., 1884, and collr. and mag. in the same district, Feb., 1885; district and sessions judge, Godavari, Sept., 1888; retd., Aug., 1890.

BIRD, CHARLES PAVIN, B.L., late Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Bromsgrove Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 6th Jan., 1870, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Punjab as asst. mag. and collr., asst. commr., and jud. asst.; district judge, Sept., 1886; divl. judge, April, 1892; retd., July, 1896.

BIRD, GEORGE ROWLAND, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 10th Sept., 1867, and employed on road works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; services lent to Allahabad municipality, 1882-83.

BIRD, HUBERT MOORE, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Portarlington Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 4th Nov., 1872, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. and joint mag. and asst. commr.; dep. commr., July, 1890; mag. and collr., April, 1891.

BIRDWOOD, SIR GEORGE CHRISTOPHER MOLESWORTH, Kt., K.C.I.E., C.S.I., M.D., LL.D., Rev. and Statistics Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Plymouth Gr. Sch., and Edinburgh Univ.; entered the Bombay med. service, 1854, and was employed under the mil. dept., including service in the Persian war of 1856-57 (medal and clasp); from 1857 to 1868, held successively the professorships of anatomy and physiology, and of botany and materia medica in the Grant med. coll., Bombay; curator of the govt. central museum, 1857, and founded the Victoria and Albert Museum and Victoria Gardens; sheriff of Bombay, 1864, and subsequently registrar of the univ.; special commr. for the govt. of Bombay at the Paris exhibn. of 1867; apptd. to assist Dr. Forbes Watson in connection with the annual exhibns. at S. Kensington commenced in 1871; special asst. in the statistics and commerce dept., India office, from Jan., 1878; is also visitor to the India museum; C.S.I., 1877; Kt., 1881; LL.D., Cambridge, 1886; was a royal commr. for the Colonial and Indian exhibn. of 1886, and a member of the finance committee; K.C.I.E., Feb., 1887; chairman of the committee of the Indian section of the Paris exhibn. of 1886; a royal commr. for the Chicago exhibn. of 1893; member of committee of the British section of the Antwerp exhibn. of 1894; author of 'The Economic Vegetable Products of the Bombay Presidency'; 'On the Genus Boswellia (Frankincense Trees)', Linn. Trans. of 1899; 'Handbook to the British Indian Section of the Paris Exhibn. of 1878'; an official 'Report on the Miscellaneous Old Records of the India Office,' 1879; 'The Industrial Arts of India,' 1880; 'The Arts of India,' a handbook to the collection of H.R.H. the Prince of Wales, 1881, and several other handbooks on Indian art in connection with Indian exhibns. held at York, Berlin, Copenhagen, Stockholm, and Amsterdam; an introduction to the 'Dawn of British Trade to the East Indies,' 1886; an appendix on Aryan fauna and flora to Professor Max Müller's 'Biographies of Words,' 1888; a 'Report on Spanish Chestnuts,' 1892; a monograph on the history of carpets, contributed to the work on Oriental carpets publ. by the Austrian govt. in 1894; and an introduction to the English edition of Count d'Alviella's 'Migration des Symboles,' 1894; and editor of 'The Register of Letters, &c., of the East India Company, 1600-19,' 1893.

BIRDWOOD, HERBERT MILLS, C.S.I., M.A., LL.D., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ. and Peterhouse, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1858; arrived, 26th Jan., 1859, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., under sec. to govt. in the jud. dept., acting pol. asst. in Kathiawar, senr. asst. judge, and registrar of the high court; judge and sessions judge, Surat, March, 1875; on special duty at Udaipur, Sept., 1880; jud. commr. in Sind and judge of the sadar court, Feb., 1881; judge of the high court, Bombay, Jan., 1885; member of council, Bombay, April, 1892; C.S.I., June, 1893; acted as govr. of Bombay, 17th Feb., 1895; edited vols. iv and v and (in collaboration with Mr. H. J. Parsons) vols. vi to viii of 'West's Code of Acts and Regulations'; compiled a catalogue of bills introduced into the Bombay legisl. council in 1862-65, and also papers relating to the constitution and functions of that body.

BIRKS, ARTHUR RAWSON, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Highgate Sch., and Corpus Christi Coll., Cambridge; called to the bar at Lincoln's Inn; apptd. after exam. of 1871;
arrived, 29th Oct., 1873, and served in Oudh as asst. commr.; transfd. to Burma, April, 1874, as asst. commr.; acted as collr. of customs, Bassein, March, 1878, and as judge of Maulmain, 1880-82; offg. dir. of public instrn., Aug., 1882; dep. commr., May, 1884; commr., Arakan divn., Dec., 1895.

BISHOP, EDWARD FRANCIS, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Jnr. clerk, 15th March, 1866; senr. clerk, June, 1882; assessor of income tax, 1892.

BISETT, WILLIAM SINCLAIR SMITH, C.I.E., Lieut.-Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, Dec., 1866, as asst. engr.; railway branch, Bengal, 1870; asst. consulting engr., Bengal, July, 1870; supt., Darjiling railway survey, Oct., 1870; Holkar state railway, Nov., 1870; exec. engr., March, 1871; dep. consulting engr. for guaranteed railways, Calcutta, April, 1872; manager, Holkar state railway, Dec., 1875; on special duty, Madras famine relief works, 1877; served in the Afghan war, 1877-80 (medal); manager, Rajputana and Sindia railway, Sept., 1879; agent, Bombay, Baroda, and Central India railway co., Jan., 1883; C.I.E., June, 1888; offg. dir.-gen. of railways, and dep. sec. to gov't. of India, public works dept., Dec., 1893; sec., public works dept., July, 1894.

BLACK, HENRY SOMERS, commander, Royal Indian Marine.—Entered the Indian Marine, July, 1877; commander, May, 1886; port officer, Rangoon, Nov., 1895.

BLACKWOOD, JOHN ROSS, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Glasgow Univ., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 21st Dec., 1895; and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

BLAIR, HARRISON FALKNER, B.A., B.L., High Court, N.W. Prov.—Educ. at Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; called to the bar (Inner Temple), June, 1864; apptd. puisne judge, high court, N.W. Prov., 1st April, 1892.

BLAKESLEY, EDMUND HOLMES, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Charterhouse and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 30th Oct., 1889, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

BLANC, HENRI JULES, M.D., F.R.C.P., M.R.C.S. (Lon.), Dep. Surgn.-Gen., late Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the dept., 10th Feb., 1859; arrived, 7th Aug., 1859, and served in the mil. dept. and also as acting civil surgn. in various stations, and as supt. of vaccn.; served in the China war, 1860-62; was a member of the Abyssinian mission, 1864, and was confined in chains during 21 months by the Emperor Theodore; subsequently joined the expedit. force, and was present at the storming of Magdala (medal); supt. of Yerrowda central jail, April, 1875; senr. surgn., Jamsetji Jijibhoy hosp., Bombay, and prof. Grant med. coll., May, 1876; physician, European gen. hosp., Aug., 1882; retd., April, 1887.

BLATHWAYT, CHARLES GEORGE, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Marlborough Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 2nd Jan., 1865, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; jnr. collr. and mag., Kanara, Oct., 1882; senr. collr., March, 1886; retd., July, 1890.

BLENKINSOP, EDWARD ROBERT KAYE, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch. and Christ Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 19th Oct., 1892, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

BLENKINSOP, FREDERICK HENRY, Surgn.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Arrived, 7th May, 1859, and served with various regts. to Oct., 1888, including service in the Burmese expedit.; med. officer, Coonoor, May, 1889; civil surgn. and supt. of jail, Cuddapah, July, 1890; Trichinopoly, May, 1891; services lent to mil. dept., April, 1893; offg. principal med. officer, Bangalore and southern dists.

BLENNERHASSETT, ARTHUR CHARLES FRANCIS HENRY MARIA BERNARD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 6th Dec., 1895, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

BLENNERHASSETT, WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Wimborne Gr. Sch. and Eton; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 1st Nov., 1865, and served in Oudh as asst. commr.; from Feb., 1882, served in the jud. dept.; district and sessions judge, May, 1885; offg. judge, High Court, March, 1896.

BLIGH, WILLIAM GEORGE, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., July, 1869, and employed on irrigtn. works in N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., May, 1883; from Nov., 1889, served in Burma (medal with clasp) on the Mu valley railway and on irrigtn. works.

BLISS, HENRY WILLIAM, C.I.E., B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 15th Dec., 1863, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; on famine duty, 1877-78; from Feb., 1878, served as commr. of salt rev., and of abkari rev., and was apptd. customs collr. under the sea customs act, Aug., 1882; on duty to Bombay, 1879, and to Calcutta and N.W. Prov. and Oudh, 1880, to examine the working of the salt dept.; fellow of Madras univ., 1882; on duty to Orissa to report on the system of salt administration, Jan., 1884; addl. member of the board of rev. in addn. to his duties as commr. of salt rev., Feb., 1886; member of fin. committee under gov't. of India, April, 1886; member of board of rev. and commr. of salt and abkari rev., April, 1887; C.I.E., May, 1889; member of legisl. council, 1890-91 and 1891-92; commr. of land rev., Madras, April, 1891; member of council, Madras, Nov., 1893; acted as Gov'r of Madras March, 1896.

BLISSETT, T., late India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. to the dept., 1st March, 1859; asst. supt., 1st grade, Jan., 1866; supt., Arakan divn., Aug., 1869; personal asst. to dir.-gen., 1873-75; served subsequently in the Dacca and Sind divns., and in the store dept., and from 1882 in Bombay; 1st grade supt., Aug., 1883; retd., Jan., 1889.

BLOOD, BAGOT WILLIAM, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 7th Aug., 1866, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Sept., 1872; supt. of way and works, Rajputana state railway, Nov., 1879; suptg. engr., Dec., 1890; retd., May, 1893.

BLOOD, SIR BINDON, K.C.B., Brig.-Genl., R.E., Mil. Works Dept., Gov't.of India.—Apptd. to Bombay public works dept., 13th March, 1871; transfd. to Bengal sappers and miners, Sept., 1871; on famine duty, 1874; exec. engr., March, 1874; took part in Jowaii expedit., 1877-78 (medal with clasp); on special duty, Calcutta
torpedo defence, April, 1878; served in S. African war (medal with clasp), and Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal); rejoined Indian establ., Feb., 1880, as offg. commandant, Bengal sappers and miners; took part in Egyptian expdn., 1882 (medal, star, and 4th class Osmanlie); supernumerary exec. engr., mil. works dept., Simla, April, 1885; second in command, Bengal sappers and miners, Aug., 1885; commandant, 1886-93; apptd. to mil. works dept. as suptg. engr., Sept., 1893; col. on staff, Rawal Pindi, Oct., 1894; chief staff officer, Chitral relief force, 1895; K.C.B., Jan., 1896; commr. Bandelkhand dist., Jan., 1896.

BLOOMFIELD, ALFRED, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., March, 1856; served in the Central Prov. from July, 1864, as asst. commr., asst. sec. to the chief commr., and dep. commr.; inspr.-gen. of regt., supt. of stamps, and commr. of excise, Oct., 1876; reverted to mil. dept., March, 1892; author of 'Notes on the Baigas of the Central Prov.', 1885.

BLYTH, WILLIAM DUNBAR, M.A., LL.D., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Liverpool Coll. Instn., and Queen's Coll., Cork; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 16th Nov., 1874; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr. and jur. sec., board of rev.; under sec., govt. of Bengal, finl. dept., April, 1882; inspr. of registrn. offices, Oct., 1886; inspr.-gen. of registrn., April, 1887; mag. and collr., Nov., 1890.

BOAS, HENRY JULIUS, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Clifton Coll. and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 19th Nov., 1891, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. commr.

BODDAM, WELBY WROUGHTON, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Punjab.—First commn., 12th Dec., 1851; arrived, 2nd July, 1852; served with the mil. police, 1857-61; district supt. of Lahore police, Feb., 1861; dep. inspr.-gen., March, 1878; offg. inspr.-gen., Punjab, 1883 and 1885; reverted to mil. dept., March, 1888.

BODDY, OWEN VIDAL, Major, R.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Arrived, 11th Feb., 1873; asst. engr., April, 1873; exec. engr., March, 1883; employed in the mil. works branch, govt. of India, Aug., 1877, to Feb., 1883; dep. chief engr. and under sec. in the public works dept., Feb., 1891, to April, 1894; suptg. engr. April, 1896.

BODY, CHARLES STUART, India Audit Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 29th Jan., 1895.

BOILEAU, LESTOCK FRANCIS, Brevet Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., 24th March, 1865, and served at Aden, and in Rajputana; exec. engr., March, 1871; transf. to N.W. Prov., and Oudh, May, 1873; returned to mil. dept., 1880; re-apptd. to public works dept., 1885, and served in N.W. Prov. and Oudh, and Rajputana; retired, 1st Oct., 1895.

BOLSTER, JOHN ABRAHAM, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept, India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 22nd Feb., 1872.

BOLTON, CHARLES WALTER, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch., Royal Coll., Mauritius, and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 7th Oct., 1872; asst. mag. and collr. in Bengal, Oct., 1872; offg. pol. agent, Hill Tippera, April, 1877; under sec., govt. of Bengal, March, 1879; offg. under sec., govt. of India, home, rev., and agric. dept., Feb., 1880; under sec. in the jud. &c., depts., govt. of Bengal, Feb., 1883; senr. marriage registrar, Calcutta, Nov., 1884; joint mag. and dep. collr., 1st grade, May, 1885; mag. and collr., Sept., 1888; sec. to the board of rev., Dec., 1891; acted in 1894 and 1895 as addl. commr., Patna, and opium agent, Bihar; sec. to govt., genl. rev. and statistics dept., April, 1896.

BOMFORD, GERALD, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 30th Sept., 1874, and served in the mil. dept., and as prof. and rest. surgn. in the med. coll., Calcutta; supt., Calcutta lunatic asylum, April, 1890; sec. to the surgn.-gen. and sanitary commr., Aug., 1891; principal, med. coll., Calcutta, Nov., 1893.

BOMPAS, CECIL HENRY, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Westminster, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 5th Nov., 1889, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; offd. as under sec. in 1893; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1896.

BONAVIA, EMANUEL, M.D., Brigade-Surgn., late Med. Dept., N.W. Prov.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., 4th Aug., 1857; served under the mil. dept. up to Dec., 1861, and was present at the capture of Lucknow, March, 1858, and in the trans-Gogra campaign; asst. civil surgn., Lucknow, Dec., 1861; health officer, Lucknow, and supt. of museum, &c., April, 1867; principal of med. sch. at Balrampur, in addn. to other duties, Jan., 1873; offg. sanitary commr., Oudh, 1874 and 1877, also offg. as inspr.-gen. of prisons, Oudh; civil surgn., Etawah, Dec., 1881; retd., April, 1888; has publd. works on date culture in India, 'The Villager's Domestic Medicine,' 1885, and 'Studies in the Evolution of Animals,' 1895.

BONHAM-CARTER, NORMAN, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Rugby and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived 28th Nov., 1888, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec., fin. and municipal depts., Jan., 1894; transf. to gen., &c., depts., April, 1895; joint mag. and dep. collr., May, 1896.

BONUS, ARTHUR RIVERS, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Clifton Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 17th Jan., 1887, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; transf. to Burma as asst. commr., Aug., 1889; retransf., March, 1892.

BONUS, JOSEPH, Major-Gen., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Bombay.—First commn., Bombay engrs., June, 1855; arrived, March, 1857; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasp); joined the dept., June, 1859, and was employed on the Bombay harbour defences, Oct., 1860; from Sept., 1861, served as dep. consulting engr. for railways in Sind; offg. dep. consulting engr., N. W. Prov., March, 1870; from Nov., 1871, served as suptg. engr. on Indus valley state railway; engr.-in-chief, Sindia state railway, Sept., 1876; transf. to Punjab N. state railway, May, 1877; offg. consulting engr. for guaranteed railways, Lahore, July-Oct., 1878; engr.-in-chief, Pindi-Peshawar section, Oct., 1879; medal for services in the Afghan war,
1879-80; acting consulting engr. for railways, and joint sec. to govt., Bombay, 1882 and 1885-86; senr. dep. consulting engr. and under sec. to govt., railway branch, from Nov., 1883; chief engr., Dec., 1885; retd., Nov., 1888.

**BOOTH, WILLIAM**, B.A., Bengal Educ. Dept.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; served from 27th Nov., 1876, as prof. in the presidency coll.; principal, Dacca coll., June, 1884; prof. of physics, presidency coll., Nov., 1890; principal, Hugli coll., Dec., 1892.

**BOOTY, PERCY ABBEY**, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch. and Trin. Coll. Camb.; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived 16th Dec., 1895, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

**BOSANQUET, OSWALD VIVIAN**, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Clifton Coll. and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 17th Sept., 1887, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; asst. to rest. at Haidarabad, April, 1892; first asst. to govt.-gen.'s agent, Rajputana, Oct., 1893; acting under sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., May, 1895.

**BOSE, BHOOBUN MOHUN, RAI BAHADUR**, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. from Calcutta Civil Engrg. Coll., Sept., 1867, as apprentice engineer, and posted to Oudh; asst. engr., Sept., 1868; transf. to State Rlwys., Dec., 1869; exec. engr., Oct., 1886.

**BOUGHEY, GEORGE FLETCHER OTTLEY**, C.S.I., Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—First commn., June, 1862; arrived, 5th Jan., 1865; served in the Bhotan expedit., 1865-66 (medal and clasp); joined the dept., Nov., 1866, as asst. engr., railway branch, N.W. Prov.; exec. engr., Rajputana railway, Sept., 1870; dep. consulting engr. for guaranteed railways, Lucknow, May, 1877; asst. sec., railway branch, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, 1879; served in the Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal); manager, Indus valley and Kandahar railway, Jan., 1882; manager, E. Bengal state railway, Nov., 1885; manager, N.W. railway, Oct., 1892; C.S.I., Jan., 1896.

**BOULNOIS, CHARLES**, B.A., LL.B., B.L., late Punjab Chief Court.—Educ. at King's Coll., London, and London Univ.; called to the bar (Middle Temple), 30th April, 1855, and in the same year was admitted advocate of the Calcutta supreme court; prof. of law in the presidency coll., Calcutta, 1857-61 and 1882-83; judge of the court of small cases, Bengal, 1860; offg. sec. to govt. of Bengal, in the legisl. dept., 1862-64; offg. dep. sec. to the govt. of India, legisl. dept., 1864; apptd. judge of the chief court, Punjab, in Feb., 1866, and was senr. judge from 1867 until his retirement in 1877; from 1881 has acted as reporter of appeal cases; fellow of the Punjab univ., 1882; editor of law reports in the supreme court, 1856-60; joint author of 'Notes on Customary Law,' by Boulnois and Rattigan, 1876.

**BOURDILLON, JAMES AUSTIN**, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1870; asst. mag. and collr. in Bengal, Dec., 1870; offg. under sec., govt. of India, finl. dept., Sept., 1874, and in the home dept., March, 1876; inspr. of registrn. offices, Aug. 1876; dep. supt. of census, Dec., 1880; inspr.-gen. of registrn., Dec., 1881; mrg. and collr., April, 1887; offg. sec., finl. and municipal depts., 1892 and 1893; member of Bengal legisl. council, 1893 and 1895; acting commr., Bardwan, April, 1895.

**BOUSTEAD, ROBINSON**, F.R.C.S., Surg.-Major, late Bombay Med. Dept.—Civil surgn., Thana, 21st Jan., 1876; acted as supt. of vaccn., 1876; supt. of Matheran, Feb., 1882; acted as surgn., Gokuldas Tejal hosp., 1883; civil surgn., Ahmadnagar, July, 1887; retd., Feb., 1889.

**BOUTFLOWER, WILLIAM NOLAN**, B.A., Educ. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Cambridge; joined the dept., 6th Aug., 1869, as prof. in the Agra coll.; prof. in Muir coll., Allahabad, Oct., 1874; offg. meteorological reporter to govt., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, April-June, 1881; inspr. of schools, Feb., 1892; offd. as dir. of public instrn. from April, 1896; author of 'Elementary Statics and Dynamics,' and 'The Indian Arithmetic.'

**BOVILL, EDWARD**, M.B., Surg.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1872, and served on gen., jail, and hosp. duty, and as civil surgn., at various stations, from Dec., 1885.

**BOWDEN, WILLIAM JAMES**, Finl. Dept., India Office.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, 1st Jan., 1893; clerk, 2nd class, 28th Aug., 1895.

**BOWEN, CHARLES**, Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—First commn., Dec., 1885; arrived, April, 1885; joined the dept., Nov., 1883, and, from June, 1884, served under the Mysore govt.; exec. engr., March, 1887; asst. to chief engr., and sec. to chief commr., Mysore, June, 1889; offg. engr.-in-chief and joint sec. to govt., 1888; served in Madras, April, 1883, to Sept., 1885, as dep. chief engr. and under sec. to govt.; served again under the Mysore govt. from Sept., 1885, to July, 1892; suptg. engr., April, 1886; retd., Feb., 1894.

**BOWER, GEORGE**, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Caistor Gr. Sch., Eton, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 10th Dec., 1884, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr. and offg. under sec. to govt.; joint mag., March, 1890; dep. supt., family domains of the Maharaja of Benares, April, 1890, to April, 1893; dep. commr., April, 1896.

**BOWIE, MATHEW MORTON**, Col., I.S.C., Arrived, 20th June, 1883; from June, 1863, served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and dep. commr., and was placed on special duty in connection with the Delhi assemblage, Nov., 1876; commr. of excise, &c., June, 1880; dep. commr., Nagpur, Sept., 1880; inspr.-gen. of police and prisons, Central Prov., April, 1882; commr., Nerbudda divn., April, 1892; reverted to mil. dept., June, 1896.

**BOWRING, LEWIN BENTHAM**, C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Mount Radford Sch., Exeter, and at Leipzig; apptd. from Haileybury, 1843; asst. mag. and collr., Bengal, 1845; asst. to treasurer, Calcutta, 1846; asst. to rest. at Lahore, 1847; dep. commr., Punjab, 1849-54; private sec. to Lord Canning, 1858; chief commr. of Mysore and Coorg, 1862; retd., 1870; has publ. 'Eastern Experiences,' 'Haidar Ali and Tipu Sultan,' &c.

**BOYD, CHARLES CLIFFORD**, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Haileybury Coll., and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1890, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

**BOYD, HENRY WALKER BUTLER**, F.R.C.S.I.,
surgeon-lieut.-col., I.M.S., Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1876; served as civil surgeon at various stations; supt. of lunatic asylum, Colaba, June, 1890.

BOYD, JOHN EWART EDWARDS AGINCOURT, Madras Police Dept.—Joined the service, Nov., 1869, and served in the police dept. as inspr., asst. supt., and supt.

BOYS, HENRY SCOTT, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Harrow, and Trinity Hall, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 30th Oct., 1863; from Dec., 1864, served in Oudh as asst. commr. and asst. settl. officer, and was apptd. supt. of the encumbered estates of Sitapur and Kheri, June, 1872; dep. commr., Dec., 1881; mag. and collr., Nov., 1884; acted as commr. in 1883, 1887, and 1888; retd., 1889.

BRACKENBURY, SIR HENRY, K.C.B., K.C.S.I., Lieut.-Gen., R.A.—First commn., 7th April, 1856; served in the Mutiny, 1858, the Ashanti expdn., 1873, and the S. African war, 1879-80; asst. adjutant and quarter-master-gen., Cyprus, July, 1878; mil. sec., S. Africa, May, 1879; private sec. to viceroy of India, March to June, 1880; mil. attache, Paris, Jan., 1881; dep. adjutant and quartermaster-gen., Egypt, Sept., 1884; brigadier-gen., Egypt, Jan., 1885; dep. quartermaster-gen. at head-quarters (intelligence branch), Jan., 1886; dep. adjutant-gen., and director of mil. intelligence, June, 1887, to March, 1891; mil. member of viceroy's council, April, 1891, to April, 1896; prest. ordnance commn., War Office, May, 1896; K.C.B., May, 1894; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1896.

BRACKENBURY, MAULE CAMPBELL, Lieut.-Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—First commn., June, 1865; arrived and joined the dept., June, 1875; exec. engr., March, 1877; served in the Perak expdn., 1875-76 (medal and clasp), and the Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal and two clasps and bronze star); offg. dep. consulting engr. for guaranteed railways, Lahore, 1881; asst. manager, Punjab N. state railway, Feb., 1883; offg. manager and traffic supt., Mysore railway, April, 1883; acting dep. consulting engr., Bombay, Oct., 1884; dep. manager, N.W. state railway, Sind section, Dec., 1885; manager, Sind section, March, 1887; under sec. to govt. of India, railway branch, Nov., 1887, and dep. dir.-gen. of railways, April, 1888, to July, 1890; manager, Oudh and Rohilkhand railway, May, 1892.

BRADBURY, JAMES FRANCIS, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 16th Oct., 1868; served in rev. and jud. dept., Bengal, and was apptd. joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1878; also acted as pol. agent, Hill Tippera, and junr. sec., board of rev.; district and sessions judge, Aug., 1885.

BRADDON, JOHN BLOOMFIELD, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the dept., 12th Sept., 1871, and was employed on various public works and railway accts.; examr., Feb., 1884; offg. dep. acctn.-gen. for inspn. duty, March, 1895; govt. examr. of accts., Bengal and N.W. railway, Nov., 1895.

BRADFORD, SIR EDWARD RIDLEY COLBORNE, K.C.B., K.C.S.I., Col., I.S.C.—Cornet, 6th light cavalry, Madras, Feb., 1854; proceeded to Persia under Gen. Jacob in 1856; pol. asst. in W. Malwa, and in command of 1st regt. Central India horse, Nov., 1860; pol. agent, Baghelkhand, 1871; pol. agent, Bhartpur, Jan., 1873; gen. supt. of operations for suppression of thagi and dakhait, May, 1874; agent to gov.-gen., Rajputana, Dec., 1878; also chief commr. of Ajmir; sec., pol. and secret dept., India office, Feb., 1887; accompanied H.R.H. Prince Albert Victor on his visit to India in 1889-90; K.C.B., May, 1890; resigned on his appt. as chief commr., metropolitan police, London, June, 1890.

BRADLEY, HERBERT, B.L., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Winchester Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1878, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag. and sec. to the commr. of salt, abkari and separate rev., April, 1888; collr. and mag., July, 1894.

BRADLEY, JOSEPH ADNUM, Legal Adviser's Dept., India Office.—Clerk to the legal adviser to the sec. of state, 25th June, 1877.

BRADLEY, RICHARD, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd. to the dept., 1st Nov., 1868, and employed on irrig. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; retd., 1896.

BRANDIS, SIR DIETRICH, K.C.I.E., Ph.D.—Educ. at Univs. of Copenhagen, Gottingen, and Bonn; lecturer on botany at Univ. of Bonn, 1849; served in the India forest dept. from 16th Jan., 1856, and was apptd. inspr.-gen. of forests, April, 1864; C.I.E., Jan., 1878; retd., 1883; apptd. a member of the board of visitors of Cooper's Hill Coll., 1886; K.C.I.E., Feb., 1887; author of 'Forest Flora of N.W. and Central India,' 1874, of the article on 'Teak' in the Encyclopaedia Britannica, &c., &c.; is dir. of the practical course of forestry on the Continent in connection with Cooper's Hill Coll.

BRANDRETH, ASHTON MILNES, Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—First commn., Dec., 1855; arrived, 30th Dec., 1857; served in the public works dept. from 8th Jan., 1858, as asst. engr., asst. principal, Thomason coll., and exec. engr.; transf'd. to the Punjab, Sept., 1861, and served on the W. Jumna canal; asst. sec., govt. of India, May to Dec., 1863; asst. sec., public works dept., Punjab, May, 1867; principal, Thomason coll., 1879-91.

BRANDT, FRANCIS, M.A., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Brasenose Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1861; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., under sec. to govt., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; acting collr. of sea customs, Madras, April, 1874; collr. and mag., S. Kanara, Oct., 1877, and in the Nilgiris, 1883; district and sessions judge, Trichinopoli, June, 1878; judge of the high court, Madras, Sept., 1884; fellow of Madras univ., 1886; retd., Dec., 1887.

BRANFOOT, ARTHUR MUDGE, M.B., M.R.C.S., L.R.C.P., Brig.-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 30th March, 1872; arrived, 28th Dec., 1872, and served under the mil. dept. till March, 1873, and subsequently as civil surgn. at Coconada and Madras, rest. surgn. at the gen. hosp., Madras, and profr. in the med. coll.; asst. physician, gen. hosp., and profr. of hygiene, med. coll., July, 1878; supt. of the lying-in hosp., and profr. of midwifery, med. coll., July, 1881; fellow of Madras univ., 1886.
BRANSON, James Charles Everton, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Harrow, and Balliol College, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 16th Jan., 1882, and served in Oudh as asst. commr.; transf. to Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., Dec., 1883; offg. asst. acctnt.-gen., Madras, March, 1886; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, April, 1889; acting acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, April, 1892; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, Nov., 1892; returned to the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as offg. mag. and collr., Aug., 1894; dep. commr., Oct., 1894; mag. and collr., Feb., 1896.

BRENDON, Benjamin Adams, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. on the Continent and at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 6th Nov., 1892, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

BRERETON, Alfred, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept. as asst. engr., March, 1873, and served in the railway branch; exec. engr., April, 1880; asst. dir., N.W. railway, Nov., 1887; district traffic supt., Nov., 1888; dep. manager, July, 1891; offg. manager, E. Bengal railway, March, 1893; manager and engr.-in-chief, E. Coast railway, Nov., 1893.

BRERETON, Ashley Francis, Rev. and Statistics Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Bedford Sch.; supernumerary writer, 13th Feb., 1860; temporary clerk, Dec., 1860; clerk in registry dept., Jan., 1869; junr. clerk, finl. dept., April, 1874; senr. clerk, Nov., 1885; transf. to rev. and statistics dept., 1886.

BRERETON, Herbert James, Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch.; joined the service, 7th April, 1873; from Feb., 1874, served in the office of the acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov.; asst. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, July, 1877; N.W. Prov., Nov., 1877; Burma, April, 1878; Punjab, Aug., 1879; N.W. Prov., March, 1884; Central Prov., March, 1888; N.W. Prov., July, 1888; compt., Assam, June, 1890; asst. compt.-gen., India (in charge of paper currency), July, 1892; dep. acctnt.-gen., March, 1895.

BRERETON, Reginald Hugh, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 14th Dec., 1882, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Dec., 1874; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1878; retd., Aug., 1894.

BRETT, Cecil Michael Wilford, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Guildford Gr. Sch. and Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 30th Nov., 1874, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1885; registrar, high court (appellate side), April, 1886; district and sessions judge, Oct., 1890; offg. jud. commr., Chota Nagpur, April-Sept., 1891.

BRIDGES, Albert, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 29th Nov., 1887, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., &c.

BRIDGES, James Émile, B.L., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Royal Coll., Tournai, and Univ. of Bonn; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 16th Nov., 1876, and served in Burma as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; offg. sec. to chief commr., land rev. and agricr. dept., and offg. dir. of agric., Nov., 1884; dep. commr., Aug., 1886, and Dec., 1888; offg. chief sec., March-July, 1890; commr., March, 1891.

BRIGGS, W. H., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Army Med. Staff.—First commr., 30th Sept., 1875; served in the Jowaki campaign, 1877-78 (medal and clasp), the Afghan campaigns, 1878-80 (medal), and the Nile campaign, 1884-85 (medal and clasps and Khedive's star); med. officer on personal staff of govr. of Madras, Dec., 1886 to March, 1889; retd. from the army, Dec., 1893.

BRIGHT, William Robert, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 13th Dec., 1880, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1890; dep. commr., Palanum, March, 1892; mag. of Midnapur, Dec., 1895.

BRIGSTOCKE, Arthur Montague, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Heidelberg Coll., and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 15th Dec., 1892, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

BRIND, Michael Joseph, India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. asst. supt., 9th Nov., 1870; served in the construction of several lines in the Punjab, Assam, &c.; supt., April, 1891.

BROADBENT, John Edward, Lieut.-Col., R.E., India Mil. Works Dept.—First commr., 17th July, 1866; arrived, Dec., 1868, and served as asst. engr.; exec. eng., June, 1879; asst. sec., mil. dept., Dec., 1882; second dep. sec., March, 1892; dep. dir.-gen., mil. works, for fortifications, April, 1892; transf. to Bombay command as chief engr., April, 1894; transf. to Punjab, March, 1895.

BROADFOOT, Ramsay Douglas, B.L., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Kensington Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 27th Dec., 1880, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Nov., 1888; sub-collr. and joint mag., Feb., 1893; dist. and sess. judge, June, 1896.

BROADWAY, Philip Neville, Police Dept., Punjab.—Joined the service, 27th Feb., 1861, as asst. district supt. of police; district supt., April, 1873.

BRODIE, Norman Somerville, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch. and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 12th Dec., 1887, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and acting asst. sec. to govt.; head asst., Malabar, Feb., 1893; dep. commr. of salt, &c., rev., April, 1896.

BRODIE, Vernon Alexander, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 6th Jan., 1878, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag. and forest settlt. officer; senr. asst., Vizagapatam, Feb., 1885; sub-collr. and joint mag., Jan., 1891; district and sessions judge, March, 1894; collr. and mag., March, 1895.

BRODIE, William Patrick, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1872, and employed on irrigtn. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., July, 1881.

BROJENDRA COOMAR SEAL, B.L., Sta-
tutory C.S. (Bengal).—From 23rd Oct., 1865, served in the subord. jud. dept., Bengal, and was appointed subord. judge, 4th grade, May, 1873, and district judge, Bankura, and asst. sessions judge, Bardwan, April, 1881; district and sessions judge, June, 1887.

BROJENDRA NATH DE, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Hare Sch., Calcutta, Canning Coll., Lucknow, Calcutta Univ., and St. Mary’s Hall, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 6th Sept., 1875, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Oct., 1886; mag. and collr., Aug., 1891.

BROOK-FOX, FREDERICK GEORGE, M.I.C.E., M.I.M.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd. to the dept., Sept., 1873, and employed on mil. works in the Punjab; transf. temporarily to Madras on famine relief work, 1877–78; employed in Burma, 1880–85; exec. engr., May, 1883; transf. temporarily to state railways, April, 1885; and permanently, Oct., 1892.

BROOKE, HERBERT OTTO WILDMAN GOODWYN, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 6th Nov., 1892, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

BROOKE, THOMAS HENRY BARSTOW, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., April, 1855; arrived, 13th May, 1855, and was employed under the mil. dept. up to 1864, including service in the China expdn., 1857–59; from Feb., 1864, served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; cantonmt. mag., Saugor, Nov., 1874; dep. commr., March, 1883; reverted to mil. duty, 1889.

BROOKE, SIR WILLIAM ROBERT, K.C.I.E., late India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. to the dept., 13th Sept., 1857; supt., Bombay, Jan., 1866; served in the Punjab, 1869–71; 1st grade supt., Aug., 1877, offg. as dir. of traffic; dir. construction branch, June, 1883; dep. dir.-gen., July, 1889; dir.-gen.of telegraphs, April, 1890; C.I.E., Jan., 1894; retd., April, 1895; K.C.I.E., May, 1895.

BROOKE, WILLIAM SAURIN, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., Dec., 1858; arrived, 3rd Jan., 1859; served in the Central Prov., from Jan., 1863, as asst. commr., &c.; cantonmt. mag., Jabalpur, May, 1869; dep. commr., Feb., 1873; acting inspr.-gen. of police and jails, Aug.–Nov., 1883; reverted to mil. dept., May, 1893.

BROWN, JOHN ALEXANDER, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at foreign schs., Univ. Coll., London, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1879, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., asst. commr. and cantonmt. mag.; joint mag., April, 1888; dep. commr., April, 1894; mag. and collr., Feb., 1896.

BROWN, CHARLES, Punjab Police Dept.—Joined the service, 8th Feb., 1868; asst. district supt. of police, Nov., 1868; district sup’t, April, 1876; served in Afghanistan, 1879; in charge of Gen. Daud Shah in 1880; rejoined the dept., Feb., 1882, and served as personal asst. and as asst. to the inspr.-gen.; dep. inspr.-gen., Dec., 1894.

BROWN, CHARLES DALLAS, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Charterhouse and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1887, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; retd., June, 1895.

BROWN, FREDERICK LATHAM, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service as asst. engr., 15th July, 1869; transf. to superior accs. establ., April, 1878; examr., state railway accs., Lower Burma, Nov., 1885; offg. engr.-in-chief and manager, Burma state railway, 1885 and 1886; examr., telegraph accs., March, 1889; dep. acctnt.-gen. for inspn. duty, Nov., 1891; retd., April, 1893.

BROWN, JAMES SAMUEL, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper’s Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., Feb., 1885; offg. dep. manager, N.W. railway, 1889–90.

BROWN, RICHARD CECIL, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Clergy Orphan Sch., Canterbury, and Keble Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 1st Dec., 1889, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer.

BROWN, THOMAS EDWIN BURTON, C.I.E., M.D., Brigade-Surgn., late Med. Dept., Punjab.—Joined the dept. in 1858; from Nov., 1860, served as profr. and principal, med.sch., Lahore; also offg. as civil surgn. of Lahore on several occasions, and as meteorological reporter, 1879; retd., Oct., 1889; C.I.E., Jan., 1891; author of a work on the symptoms and treatment of the poisons used in the Punjab.

BROWN, WILLIAM BARCLAY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Ayr Acad., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 8th Dec., 1886, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf. to Assam as asst. commr., June, 1889; returned to Bengal as offg. mag. and collr., Nov., 1894.

BROWNE, LORD HENRY ULLICK, late Benga C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, Dec., 1850; arrived, 1st Sept., 1851; served in rev. and jud. dept., and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1st grade, March, 1866; also served as private sec. to the prest. of the govr.-gen.’s council, Feb., 1858, under sec. to the govt. of Bengal, July, 1859, offg. under sec. to the govt. of India, home and finl. dept., April, 1860, registrar of the Sadar-Diwan and Nizamat Adalat, April, 1861, supt. of stamps and stationery, Oct., 1865, and offg. addl. judge, Jessur and Nuddea, Feb., 1867; commr., Dec., 1869; chairman of the justices of the peace, Calcutta, Feb., 1872, and offg. member, board of rev., June, 1878; retd., Oct., 1886.

BROWNE, Ven. JAMES FRANCIS, B.D., late Ecclesl. Dept., Madras.—Joined the service as junr. chaplain, Madras, 20th July, 1870; senr. chaplain, July, 1880; arch-deacon of the diocese of Madras and commissary to the lord bishop, Feb., 1884; senr. joint chaplain of St. George’s Cathedral, Feb., 1884; fellow of Madras univ., 1886; retd., April, 1893.

BROWNE, SAMUEL HASLETT, C.I.E., M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Punjab Med. Dept.—Joined the service, March, 1874, and arrived, 14th Nov., 1874; served on hosp. duty and on mil. duty in Afghanistan in 1878; from Aug., 1879, served in the Central Prov. on gen. and jail duty; served under the govt. of India from Dec., 1886, in joint med. charge, Simla; principal of med. coll., Lahore, Oct., 1889; offg. surgn. supt., presidency gen. hosp., Calcutta, April-Nov., 1893; hon. surgn. to the viceroy, Jan., 1894; C.I.E., Jan., 1896.
BROWNE, WILLIS, F.I.A., India Office.—Writer, 15th Oct., 1867; clerk, 2nd class, Aug., 1878; actuarial clerk, Feb., 1882; fellow of inst. of actuaries, 1887; actuary, funds dept., Dec., 1889; actuary to India office, Oct., 1892.

BROWNE, WILLIAM RICHARD, M.D., Ch.M., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, April, 1873; arrived, 1st Nov., 1873, and served on mil. and civil and jail duty in Madras; rest surgn. in gen. hosp., and profr. of pathology, med. coll., Nov., 1883; surgn. in gen. hosp., and profr. of surgery, med. coll., May, 1890; fellow of Madras univ., 1892; field service in Rumpa hill tracts and Jaipur territory in 1879-80; princpl. and profr. of medicine, med. coll., April, 1896.

BROWNING, COLIN ARROTT ROBERTSON, C.I.E., M.A., late Educt. Dept., Central Prov.—Senr. inspr. of schools, N.W. Prov., 26th June, 1862; acted as dir. of public instrn., Central Prov., 1864-65, and as inspr.-gen. of educn., Central Prov., 1868, and 1869-70; dir. of public instrn. in Oudh, July, 1870; inspr.-gen. of educn., Central Prov., Oct., 1873; C.I.E., Jan., 1886; retd., Jan., 1889; author of 'The Indian Official Thesaurus,' 'The Annals of the Indian Empire,' 'Mahomedan Education in Oudh,' 'A List of Sanscrit Manuscripts existing in Oudh,' &c.; has edited several school and text books, and was joint editor of the 1st edition of the Central Prov. Gazetteer.

BROWNING, HERBERT ARROTT, Capt., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—First commn., 21st Jan., 1881; employed in Burma as asst. commn., Sept., 1886.

BROWNING, WINTHROP BENJAMIN, Surgn.-Major, Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1880; arrived, 18th Sept., 1880, and served in Madras under the mil. dept. and as acting civil surgn.; district surgn. and jail supt., Madura, Sept., 1890; surgn., 2nd district, Madras, May, 1895; surgn. to the govr., from May, 1892.

BROWNLOW, HENRY ALEXANDER, Lieut.-Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Bengal engrs., Dec., 1849; dep. supt., Ganges canal, Feb., 1852; and afterwards on the E. and W. Jumna canals; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasp); suptg. engr., N.W. Prov., irrign., March, 1865; offg. chief engr. and joint sec., irrign., N.W. Prov., Feb., 1872; suptg. engr., Bari Doab, Punjab, April, 1874; acted as chief engr. and joint sec., Punjab, Feb.-May, 1876, and as chief engr. and sec. to govt., N.W. Prov., irrign., June, 1876; offg. inspr.-gen. of irrign. and dep. sec. to govt. of India, April, 1877; chief engr. and sec. to govt., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, July, 1878; inspr.-gen. of irrign. and dep. sec. to govt. of India, Feb., 1882; retd., Nov., 1886.

BROWNRIGG, FRANCIS WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Rossall, and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 31st Dec., 1881, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; asst. settlt. officer, Nov., 1888; joint mag., April, 1890; settlt. officer, Sultanpur, Nov., 1893; dep. commr., Jan., 1895; mag. and collr., March, 1896.

BRUCE, ALEXANDER BANNERMAN, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Glasgow Acad., Chanowry Sch., Aberdeen, Milne's Instn., Fochabers, and St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 11th Nov., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Nov., 1892.

BRUCE, RICHARD ISAAC, C.I.E., late Punjab Commn.—Served in the Punjab as extra asst. commr. from May, 1863; on special duty in connection with Major Sandeman's 2nd Kalat mission, 1876; 1st asst. to agent to govr.-gen., Baluchistan, Feb., 1877; acted as agent, in 1878, 1882 and 1885; pol. agent at Thal-Chotiali from 1882; rejoined Punjab commn. and was apptd. dep. commr., May, 1888; commr. and supt., Derajat, Feb., 1893; on special duty as British joint commr. for demarcation of Afghan-Waziri boundary, Oct., 1894; retd., April, 1896; author of a gazetteer of Dera Ghazi Khan district, a manual of the Baluch language, and a history of the Marri-Baluchi tribe.

BRUERE, ROBERT SALE ELPHINSTONE RICHARD, Punjab Police.—Joined the service as asst. dist. supt., June, 1862; dist. supt., June, 1873.

BRUNYATE, JAMES BENNETT, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 9th Dec., 1891, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., asst. settlt. officer, and asst. commr.

BRYANT, JOHN FORBES, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Weymouth Coll., and Clare Coll., Camb.; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived 16th Dec., 1895, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

BUCK, SIR EDWARD CHARLES, K.C.S.I., B.L., LL.D., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived 2nd Feb., 1862; from May, 1863, served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., settlt.officer, and offg. sec., board of rev.; dir. of agric. and commerce, N.W.Prov., Feb., 1875; commr. for the govt. of India at the Melbourne exhibn. of 1880; sec. to the govt. of India in the rev. and agric. dept., April, 1882; retd., Dec., 1896; Kt., Aug., 1886; C.S.I., May, 1892; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1897.

BUCKLAND, CHARLES EDWARD C.I.E., B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Eton and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 29th Nov., 1870; asst. mag. and collr. in Bengal, Dec., 1870; attache' foreign dept., Nov., 1871; on famine duty, March, 1874; private sec. to lieut.-govr., 1874-77; asst. sec., govt. of Bengal, Aug., 1876; private sec. to Sir R. Temple during his mission to Madras and Bombay, 1877; private sec. to govt. of Bombay, May, 1877; offg. under sec., govt. of India, home dept., May, 1878; private sec. to prest. of govr.-gen.'s council, Nov., 1878; offg. press commr. with govt. of India, Feb., 1879; supt. of stamps and stationery, Bengal, May, 1880; junr. sec., board of rev., May, 1887; sec., May, 1890; sec. to govt. of Bengal, gen. rev. and statistical depts., Dec., 1891; member of Bengal legisl. council, Dec., 1893; C.I.E., May, 1895; commr. Burdwan divn., April, 1896; edited 'Excise Manual,' etc.

BUCKLE, HENRY, Jud.Dept., Burma.—Served in the Burma commn. from 7th Aug., 1867, as asst. commr., and was in charge of the town mag.'s office, Akyab, 1871-74; and of the hill tracts of N. Arakan, 1874-76; in command of an expedit. against the Shandus, Nov., 1876; from June, 1878, served as dep. commr. in various districts; prest., Henzada municipal committee
Dec., 1884; offg. commr., 1883, 1890, 1892; addl. sessions judge, Pegu and Irawadi, Jan., 1891.

BUCKLEY, LLEWELLYN EDISON, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and at New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 16th Sept., 1887, and served in Madras as asst. mag. and collr.; acted as rev. under sec., 1894; head asst., Dec., 1894; senr. asst. dist. mag., and agent to govt., Nov., 1895.

BUCKLEY, ROBERT BURTON, M.I.C.E., M.I.M.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept. as asst. engr., July, 1869; exec. engr., March, 1876; services lent to Calcutta corporation, June, 1881; offg. under sec., public works dept., Bengal, July, 1886, and again, Feb., 1887; under sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., April, 1887, to Dec., 1889; suptg. engr., March, 1892; author of ‘Irrigation Works in India,’ 1893.

BULL, CHARLES ALBERT, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the dept. as exec. engr., Nov., 1868, and served in the railway branch; engr.-in-chief, Madras railway surveys, Nov., 1834, and Cuddapah-Nellore railway, Sept., 1886; also in charge of Madras state railway surveys, July, 1887; supt. of way and works, Cuddapah-Nellore railway, Sept., 1887; supt. of works, Burma state railway, Sept., 1891; rank of suptg. engr., June, 1892.

BULLOCK, FREDERICK D’OLBERT, LL.B., B.L., late Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Kingstown Gr. Sch., St. Aubin’s Gr. Sch., and Christ’s Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 11th Jan., 1865, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; judge, small cause court, Delhi, Jan., 1873; jud. asst., Dec., 1877; district judge, Nov., 1884; div. judge, Oct., 1885; offg. judge, chief court, Punjab, in 1892 and 1893; retd., June, 1894.

BULLOCK, FREDERICK SHORE, Indian C.S. (Berar).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 7th Nov., 1870, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as mag. and collr., joint mag., asst. supt. of Dehra Dun, and small cause court judge; mag. and collr., April, 1889; jud. commr., Berar, April, 1892; commr., Hyderabad assigned dists., Oct., 1895.

BULLOCK, ROBERT, Col., I.S.C., late Berar Commn.—First commn., Madras infantry, 11th Dec., 1858; from July, 1862, served in the Berar commn. as asst. commr., offg. asst. rest., and dep. commr. for demarcation of the Dhans frontier, 1886; jud. commr., Aug., 1888; civil and sessions judge, July, 1889; retd., April, 1891.

BULMAN, ALBERT ROBINSON, late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Richmond Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and offg. sec. to finl. commr.; jud. asst., March, 1878; dep. commr., Dec., 1882; offg. commr. and supt., Lahore, Aug., 1884; and Ambala, Jan., 1887; retd., April, 1889.

BUNBURY, CECIL EDWARD FRANCIS, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Wellington Coll. and Keble Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 21st Nov., 1885, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., &c.

BURGESS, GEORGE DOUGLAS, C.S.I., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 9th Nov., 1870, and served in British Burma as asst. commr., asst. collr. of customs, and dep. commr.; offg. sec. to chief commr., and officer in charge of state prisoners, Jan., 1879; sec. to chief commr., July, 1881; commr., April, 1886; C.S.I., Jan., 1889; jud. commr., Upper Burma, Jan., 1892.

BURGESS, JAMES, C.I.E., LL.D., Hon. A.R.I.B.A., M. Soc. As. Paris, late Archaeological Survey of India.—Educ. at Dumfries, Glasgow, and Edinburgh; apptd. archaeological surveyor and reporter for W. India, 15th Jan., 1874; also archaeological surveyor for S. India, Nov., 1881; dir.-gen. of the archaeological survey of India, March, 1886; fellow of the univ. of Bombay; retd., 1889; in 1894, attended the Geneva oriental congress as representative of India; editor of ‘The Indian Antiquary,’ 1872-84; author of ‘Views of Architecture and Scenery in Gujarat and Rajputana,’ ‘The Temples of Satrunjaya,’ ‘Somanath, Girnar, &c.,’ ‘Reports of the Archaeological Survey of W. and S. India,’ ‘Notes on the Rock Temples of Ajanta, their Paintings and Sculptures,’ ‘Elephanta,’ ‘Epigraphia Indica,’ &c., and conjointly with the late J. Ferguson, ‘The Rock Temples of India.’

BURKE, CHARLES TOLER, B.E., M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd July, 1868, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., March, 1876; under sec., May, 1892; author of articles on various waterworks schemes.

BURKE, JOHN, M.I.E.E., India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the dept., and June, 1864; supt., Aug., 1883; offg. dir. of traffic, Feb.-June, 1886; has held charge of various divns.

BURKITT, WILLIAM JOHN DWYER, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Marlborough and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 1st Nov., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

BURKITT, WILLIAM ROBERT, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; called to the bar at the Middle Temple; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 11th Oct., 1861; from Oct., 1862, served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and mag. and collr.; district and sessions judge, Aug., 1887; addl. jud. commr. in Oudh, March, 1891; jud. commr. in Oudh, July, 1891; acting puisne judge, high court, N.W. Prov., Nov., 1892.

BURLS, EDWIN GRANT, Store Dept., India Office.—Temporary clerk, India office, 20th Oct., 1863; junr. clerk, store dept., Dec., 1865; senr. clerk, Jan., 1875; asst. dir.-gen. of stores, June, 1891; designation changed to dep. dir.-gen. of stores, June, 1895; dir.-gen. of stores, August, 1896.

BURLTON, CHARLES HENRY BEAUMONT, Madras Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper’s Hill Coll.; joined the service, 1st Oct., 1875; exec. engr., March, 1887; dep. chief engr. and under sec. to govt., public works dept., April, 1894.

BURLTON, HENRY MONTGOMERY BARTON, Col., I. S. C.—Ensign, Bengai infantry, Aug., 1855; served in the Mutiny (medal and clasp); served subsequently in the Bhutan campaign, 1862, and the Abyssinian expdn., 1867-68 (medal); asst. cantonmt. mag., Morar, 1870; cantonmt. mag., Mhow, 1881, Morar, Dec., 1884, and Ambala, Nov., 1886; reverted to mil. duty, 1891.
BURN, JOHN GUNN, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Inverness Coll. and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 24th Dec., 1894, and served in Madras as ass't collr. and mag.

BURN, RICHARD, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Liverpool Inst., and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1891, and served in the W. Prov. and Oudh as ass't mag. and collr.

BURN, ROBERT NATHANIEL, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the dept., Aug., 1870; dep. examr., Jan., 1880; examr., Jan., 1882; auditor, Oudh and Rohilkhand railway, April, 1886; govt. examr. of accts., E. Indian railway, Feb., 1880; examr. of telegraph acts, April, 1890; dep. acctnt.-gen. for inspn. duty, Jan., 1895; offd. under sec., public works dept., March, 1895.

BURN-MURDOCH, JOHN, Major, R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the dept., 14th Feb., 1876, and employed on state railways; served in the Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal with two clasps); employed in mil. works dept., 1880; offd. consulting engr. for railways, Bombay, Dec., 1881; on service with the Egyptian expdn., 1882 (medal with two clasps, star, and 5th class Medjidie); dep. consulting engr. for railways, Lahore, Nov., 1882; in same capacity at Bombay, March, 1890; exec. engr., Jan., 1887; in 1890-92 offd. as under sec. to govt. of Bombay, railway branch; services lent to Assam-Bengal railway co., Sept., 1892; and to S. Mahratta railway co., Dec., 1894.

BURNE, HENRY KNIGHTLEY, C.B., Gen., I.S.C.—Ensign, Dec., 1843; arrived, 25th May, 1844, and served throughout the Sutlej campaign, 1845-46 (medal and clasp), and during the Burmese war of 1852-53 (medal and clasp); acted as cantonmt. joint mag., Ambala, Nov., 1849; also as brigade major, Ambala, 1849-51, and as dep. asst. adjtant-gen., Sirhind divn., 1851-52; dep. judge advocate-gen., April, 1852; 2nd asst. sec. to govt. of India, mil. dept., July, 1856; 1st asst. sec., Jan., 1858; dep. sec., March, 1862; sec., June, 1870, to Dec., 1881; C.B., May, 1875.
