BURNE, KNIGHTLEY GREY, Burma Commn.—Served in the Bengal police as asst. supt., from 26th Oct., 1865 to May, 1872; from the latter date served in the Burma commn. as asst. commr., and acted as town mag. and supt. of jail at Maulmain, 1872-75; offd. dir. of public instrn., 1882; dep. commr., July, 1886; acting addl. sessions judge, March, 1895, and January, 1896.

BURNE, SIR OWEN TUDOR, G.C.I.E., K.C.S.I., Major-Gen., Council of India.—Ensign, 20th foot, 15th April, 1855; served in the Crimea; also in the Mutiny of 1858-56, and was present in fifteen actions and received two steps of rank for gallantry in the field; apptd. mil. sec. to the commander-in-chief in India (Lord Strathnairn), 1861-62, and afterwards A.D.C., and at times offd. mil. sec., to that gen. officer when commander of the forces in Ireland, 1865-68; private sec. to viceroy of India (Earl of Mayo), 1860-72; pol. A.D.C. to sec. of state for India, 1872; asst. sec. in pol. and secret dept., India office, 1873; sec. in that dept., 1874; on special duty in India as private sec. to the viceroy (Lord Lytton), 1876-78; member of the council of India, Jan., 1887 to Dec., 1896; G.C.I.E., Jan., 1897; was a royal commr. of the Health and the Colonial and Indian exhibns. of 1882 and 1886; vice-prest. of the society of arts, 1888-94; apptd. by H. M. the Queen a govr. of the Imperial Institute, 1891; and a royal commr. for the World's Exposition in Chicago, 1891-93; vice-prest. of the council of India, 1891-92; ret'd. from the army, Jan., 1894; chairman of the society of arts, 1896-97; a knight of grace of the order of St. John of Jerusalem; author of 'Clyde and Strathnairn,' &c.

BURRARD, SIDNEY GERALD, Capt., R.E., Survey of India Dept.—First commn., 6th April, 1879; attached to mil. works dept., Baluchistan, March, 1883; asst. supt., trigon. survey, Sept., 1884; dep. supt., June, 1889.

BURRIDGE, CHARLES EDWARD, Store Dept., India Office.—Apptd. and class clerk, 16th March, 1888.

BURROWS, LEONARD ROBERT, M.A., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Lincoln Diocesan Sch., St. Nicholas Coll., Lancing, and St. Catherine's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1862; asst. collr. and mag., Dec., 1865; prest. of municipal commn., Madras, 1875-80; sub-collr. and joint mag., March, 1882; acting collr. of sea customs, Madras, and protector of emigrants, Sept., 1883; collr. and mag. and addl. sessions judge, Nilgiris, Sept., 1884; ret'd., Aug., 1889.

BURT, HENRY PARSSL, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. from Royal Indian Engrg. Coll. as asst. engr., Sept., 1878; employed at Liverpool on works of L. and N. W. railway; posted to state railways, July, 1879; exec. engr., Nov., 1892; offd. as under sec. to govt. of India, March, 1895.

BURTON, WILLIAM HENRY, Col., R.E., late Madras Public Works Dept.—Arrived, 26th July, 1857; was apptd. to the dept., May, 1858, and served in Oudh and Haidarabad; exec. engr., July, 1865; exchanged for temporary service out of India, and apptd. to Portsmouth district, and charge of Needles divn., Aug., 1867; proceeded to China, Nov., 1875, where he acted in 1876-77, as commanding royal engrs.; returned to India, Nov., 1877; member of defence committee on coast defences, Dec., 1877; exec. engr., Madras, Jan., 1878; suptg. engr., April, 1889; ret'd., Dec., 1890.

BUSHELL, WILLIAM DONE, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Harrow and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 5th Dec., 1895, and served in Bombay.

BUSTED, HENRY ELMSCLEY, C.I.E., M.D., Brigade-Surgn., late Mint Dept., Calcutta.—First commn., Indian med. service, Aug., 1855; arrived, March, 1856, and served through the Mutiny campaign (medal with clasp); civil surgn., Cuddalore, Jan., 1861; asst. assay master, Madras mint, Feb., 1865; acted as assay master for various periods, and also as mint master and commr. of paper currency; dep. assay master, Bombay, April, 1868; dep. assay master, Calcutta mint, Nov., 1870; assay master, Sept., 1872; also acted as mint master in 1873 and 1875; ret'd., June, 1886; C.I.E., Jan., 1887; author of 'Echoes from Old Calcutta.'

BUTLER, JAMES, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—Ensign, 19th foot, Feb., 1866; arrived in Madras, 24th May, 1866; served in the Burma commn. from Oct., 1868, as asst. commr. and town mag.; dep. commr., July, 1881; author of the 'Mergui Gazetteer.'

BUTLER, SPENCER HARDCOURT, Indian C.S.
BUTLER, WILLIAM GEORGE, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Bradford and Eton; junr. clerk, store dept., India office, 31st Jan., 1867; asst. private sec. and précis writer to sec. of state, 1874-78; senr. clerk, Dec., 1889.

BUTTERWORTH, ALAN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Elizabeth Coll., Guernsey, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 15th Dec., 1885, and served as asst. collr. and mag.; under sec., rev. dept., Aug., 1893.

BUTTS, HENRY HILL, B.L., late Oudh Commn.—Extra asst. commr., 3rd June, 1863; from Nov., 1865, served as asst. settl. officer and asst. commr.; subord. judge, Faizabad, Aug., 1879; district judge, Faizabad, Jan., 1882; dep. commr., Jan., 1882; district and sessions judge, Sept., 1892; retd., Aug., 1893; author of the Lucknow settl. report.

BUYERS, JOHN WALKER, C.I.E., M.A., M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. exec. engr., N.W. Prov., 18th Nov., 1869; engr.-in-chief, Garo hills survey, Dec., 1881; suptg. engr., March, 1887; C.I.E., May, 1889; engr.-in-chief, Mu valley railway, July, 1889; retd., 1891.

BYATT, JOHN, Store Dept., India Office.—Asst. clerk, educn. dept., May, 1866; clerk, 2nd class, India store depot, May, 1873; supervisor, 2nd grade, Nov., 1880; 1st grade, July, 1888.

CABELL, WILLIAM HENRY LAWSON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Eton and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived 30th Dec., 1895, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

CADELL, ALAN, C.S.I., B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Edinburgh Acad., Guetersloh Gymnasium, Westphalia, and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 10th Oct., 1862, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; from April, 1867, to March, 1881, served in the settl. dept.; mag. and collr., May, 1880; offg. commr. of excise and stamps and inspr.-gen. of registrn., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, March, 1883; offg. commr., May, 1889; junr. member, board of rev., April, 1893; senr. member, March, 1894; also member of provl. legisl. council, Nov., 1893; lieut.-govr. of N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Jan. to Nov., 1895; C.S.I., May, 1895; member of govr.-gen.'s legisl. council, Oct., 1895; member of govr.-gen.'s council, Feb., 1896; member board of rev., May, 1896.

CADELL, ALEXANDER, Lieut.-Gen., late R.E.—2nd lieut., Bengal engrs., 13th June, 1845; joined the public works dept., April, 1848; exec. engr., Rawal Pindi, 1850; Nagpur, 1856; Oudh road dept., Dec., 1858; suptg. engr., Punjab, 1864; from 1867 to 1878 served in Indore, as suptg. engr., and chief engr., and sec. to the govr.-gen.'s agent for Central India; also offd. as chief engr. and sec. to govt., N.W. Prov., 1874-75; chief engr. and sec. to govt. of Bengal, 1879-80; dep. inspr.-gen. of mil. works, 1881; inspr.-gen., mil. works, 1881-82; retd., March, 1882.

CADELL, PATRICK ROBERT, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Haileybury Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 7th Dec., 1891, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and administrator of Sachin state.

CADELL, THOMAS, V.C., Col., I.S.C.—Ensign, Bengal infantry, April, 1854; arrived, July, 1854; served during the Mutiny (medal clasp, and Victoria cross); second in command, Malwa Bhil corps, dep. Bhil agent, and pol. ass't., April, 1861; pol. agent, E. states, Rajputana, April, 1870; pol. agent, Alwar, Nov., 1870; pol. agent, Marwar, Nov., 1877, and in Mewar, April, 1878; commandant, Erinpura force, and pol. agent, W. Rajputana, Oct., 1879; chief commr. and supt., Port Blair and the Nicobars, Dec., 1879; reverted to mil. dept., April, 1892.

CALCRAFT-KENNEDY, BENNET CHRISTIAN HUNTINGDON, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., Queen's Coll., Oxford, and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1891, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

CALDECOTT, RANDOLPH, B.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the Indian med. service, 9th May, 1870; acted for various periods as residency surgn., Indore, and civil med. officer in Central India; and was apptd. to that post, March, 1894.

CALLAGHAN, THOMAS, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Apptd. and 2nd class clerk, 27th March, 1885.

CALNAN, DENIS, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at French Coll., Blackrock, Ireland, and Queen's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 13th Dec., 1886, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr. and asst. mag.; joint mag., Oct., 1891.

CAMERON, CHARLES, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Indian Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., 27th July, 1859; arrived, 28th Jan., 1860; was employed under the mil. dept., 1860-66, and served in the Bhutan campaign (medal); from April, 1866, served in Oudh as civil surgn. and supt. of jail; retd., Sept., 1892.

CAMERON, DUNCAN, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Aberdeen Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 30th Nov., 1876, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1887; in 1889 served in the Punjab as offg. divl. judge; district and sessions judge, Aug., 1894.

CAMERON, LEWIS, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 1866; from Feb., 1873, served as civil asst. surgn. and surgn. in Bengal; retd., Aug., 1891.

CAMPBELL, ALEXANDER WILLIAM DENNISTOWN, Major, I.S.C., Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service, 30th Sept., 1871; served under the mil. dept. to April, 1882, when he was apptd. cantonmt. mag., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.

CAMPBELL, ARCHIBALD COLIN, late Assam Commn.—Served in Assam from 27th April, 1861, as asst. commr. and personal asst. to chief commr.; was personal asst. to the chief civil officer, Bhutan field force, 1865 (medal and clasp); supt. of emigration and embarkation agent, Dubri, Sept., 1875; dep. commr., Dec., 1878; acted as commr., Assam valley districts, in 1889; retd., 1890.

CAMPBELL, ARCHIBALD EDWARDES, Major-
Gen., I.S.C., late Assam Commn.—First commn., Jan., 1851; served in the Sonthal campaign, 1855-56, and in Central India, 1857-58 (medal and clasp); from May, 1862, served in the Assam commn.; dep. commn., Dec., 1866; inspr. of labourers, Sibsagar, Feb., 1882; reverted to mil. dept., 1890.

CAMPBELL, ARTHUR FREDERICK TRAVERS, India Audit Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 18th March, 1893.

CAMPBELL, COLIN GEORGE, Pol. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Rugby, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; junr. clerk, mil. dept., 13th Jan., 1876; private sec. to permanent under sec. of state, 1877-92; senr. clerk, Feb., 1889; reading clerk to council, Aug., 1890; private sec. to sec. of state (Right Hon. H. H. Fowler), March, 1894, to July, 1895; sec. to royal commn. on Indian expenditure, Aug., 1895.

CAMPBELL, DUNCAN JOHN ALFRED, Indian C.S. (Cent. Prov.).—Educ. at Tonbridge Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 24th Nov., 1877, and served in Bengal as asst. mag.; transf'd to Burma, Aug., 1878, and served as asst. commr. and boundary officer; cantonmt. mag., and small cause court judge, Thayetmyo, 1883; on special duty in Upper Burma, Feb., 1886; dep. commr., May, 1888; addl. sessions judge, June-Oct., 1894; transf'd to Cent. Prov. as dep. commr., Nov., 1895; div. judge, May, 1896.

CAMPBELL, DUNCAN MCNEIL, Lieut.-Col., R.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Arrived, 8th April, 1869, and served as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; under sec. to govt. public works dept., 1885-86; suptg. engr., July, 1890; chief engr. and sec. to govt. public works dept., Mysore, July, 1892, to July, 1894; joint sec. to govt. of Madras, gen. buildings and roads branch, Jan., 1896; chief engr., Jan., 1896.

CAMPBELL, FRANCIS JOHNSTONE GRAHAM, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 20th Jan., 1864, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and district and sessions judge; ret'd., Oct., 1866.

CAMPBELL, GEORGE ALLEN, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 5th Aug., 1873, as asst. engr., and was employed in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh on prov'l railways and other duties; exec. engr., May, 1883; services lent to Indian Midland railway co., 1887-88; transf'd to state railways, March, 1891; supt. of works, Cawnpore-Gogra connection, Dec., 1894.

CAMPBELL, GERALD EDWARD LYON, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 11th Dec., 1883, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and head asst.; sub. collr. and joint mag., Mar., 1896.

CAMPBELL, JAMES McNABB, C.I.E., M.A., LL.D., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Glasgow Acad., and Glasgow Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 13th Nov., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine duty, April-Aug., 1877; acting municipal commn., Bombay, April, 1880; acting under sec. to govt. in the rev., finl., and gen. depts., Oct., 1880; acted as collr. of Bombay and supt. of stamps and stationery in 1881; C.I.E., Jan., 1885; junr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1890; collr. of land rev., customs and opium, and supt. of stamps and stationery, Nov., 1891; senr. collr., Aug., 1893; compiler of 'Bombay Gazetteer.'

CAMPBELL, JOHN SCARLETT, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at the Grange, Sunderland; apptd. from Haileybury, 1847; arrived, Jan., 1848, and served as asst. mag. and collr. in the N.W.Prov.; joint mag., 1856; during the Mutiny was present at the siege of Delhi, and subsequently took charge of the Rohtak district as dep. commr.; commr., Saugor divn., Central Prov., Jan., 1862; jud. commr., Central Prov., 1864; offg. chief commr., Central Prov., 1865; judge of the chief court, Punjab, 1871; on assassination of Lord Mayo in 1872, was depd. to enquire into the administration of the convict settl. in the Andaman Islands; ret'd., 1878; author of a 'Memo. on proposed changes in the mode of selection and training of candidates for the Indian Civil Service.'

CAMPBELL, JOHN STRATHEDEN, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Rugby, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 14th Dec., 1883, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; joint mag., Nov., 1890; dep. commr., Feb., 1896.

CAMPBELL, RICHARD HAMILTON, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 18th Dec., 1885, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and head asst.; acting under sec., rev. dept., in 1892 and 1893.

CAMPBELL-WALKER, INCHES, Col., I.S.C., late Forest Dept., Madras.—Arrived, 27th Dec., 1859; from May, 1865, served in the Madras forest dept. as asst. and dep. conservator; apptd. a commr. for the Vienna exhibn., 1873; knight commander of the order of Francis Joseph of Austria for services there; offg. inspr. of forests, Feb., 1874, to Sept., 1875; on duty at the forest conference, Simla, Sept., 1875; on special duty to New Zealand, 1876-77, and in the Nilgiris, S. Coimbatore, and Tinnevelly, Dec., 1877; conservator of forests, 1st grade, Dec., 1884; ret'd., Jan., 1892; author of reports on forest management in Germany, Austria, and Great Britain (1872), and on the forests of New Zealand.

CAMPION, JOHN MONTRIOU, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the dept., 1st July, 1869, as asst. engr., and employed on state railways; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; transf'd. to Punjab prov'l establt., Aug., 1881; served temporarily in mil. works dept., 1881, and on state railways, 1884-85.

CANDY, CHARLES HARRISON, B.A., LL.M., Bombay Educl. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st March, 1875, as acting vice-principal, Elphinstone high sch.; head master, Maharaja's coll., Mysore, June, 1876; principal and profr. of English literature, Rajaram coll., Kolhapur, June, 1880; principal, Jan., 1886.

CANDY, EDWARD TOWNSHEND, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 9th Nov., 1865, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge and sessions judge; jud. asst. to the pol. agent, Kathiawar, Feb., 1878; acting jud. commr. and judge of the sadar court in Sind, May, 1883; judge and sessions judge, Aug., 1883; acting remembrancer of legal affairs, July-Nov., 1885; judge of high court, Bombay, April, 1892.
CANDY, RICHARD EDWARD, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 9th Nov., 1865, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; acting dir. of public instrn., Berar, June, 1872, to Dec., 1873; first asst. collr. and mag., Oct., 1877; junr. collr. and mag., May, 1885; senr. collr., Sept., 1888.

CANTOPHER, BERNARD WILLIAM, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the dept., 29th Aug., 1873, and posted to state railways; transfd. to Bengal, Aug., 1881; again employed on railways, from Nov., 1883; exec. engr., May, 1884; services lent to Mahrratta railway co., 1883-84; offg. engr.-in-chief, Burma state railway, Sept.-Dec., 1893.

CAPPEL, SIR ALBERT JAMES LEPPOC, K.C.I.E., late India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. to the dept., 10th Feb., 1857; 1st grade supt. and personal asst. to dir.-gen., Dec., 1866; dir. of traffic, May, 1869; dep. dir.-gen., Feb., 1879; dir.-gen. of telegraphs, June, 1883; K.C.I.E., Feb., 1887; retd., 1889.

CAPPEL, EDWARD LOUIS, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 28th Oct., 1878, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; from May, 1882, served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; dir. of land records and agric., June, 1891, to April, 1893; junr. collr. and mag., June, 1896.

CARD, HENRY CHARLES, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Christ's Hosp.; clerk, 2nd class, India store depot, 22nd Jan., 1875.

CARDEW, ALEXANDER GORDON, M.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Somersetshire Coll., Bath, and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 7th Dec., 1882, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; sec. to the Malabar land tenures committee, Dec., 1885; asst. sec., jud. and legisl. dept., Nov., 1888; inspr.-gen. of jails, Aug., 1892.

CARDEW, CORNELIUS EDWARD, A.M.I.C.E., M.I.M.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the superior rev. establ., state railways, locomotive dept., March, 1876; locomotive supt., April, 1881; served on the Rajputana, Nagpur-Chhattisgarh, Rajputana - Malwa, and other railways.

CARDOZO, HENRY O'CONNELL, Rev. Survey Dept., Madras.—Served in the dept. from 21st March, 1859, and was promoted to dep. supt., 1st class, March, 1883, and to supt., July, 1887.

CAREY, ARTHUR DOUGLAS, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at the City of London Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 9th Nov., 1865, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. collr. of salt rev.; collr. of salt rev., April, 1881; from Feb., 1882, served under the govt. of India as offg. commr., inland customs; commr., salt rev., N. India, Dec., 1882; commr. of customs, salt, opium, and abkari, and reporter-gen. of external commerce for Bombay, May, 1891; on special duty in Lisbon for Goa treaty negotiations, 1891-92; retd., March, 1893.

CAREY, HORACE RICHARD LE MARCHANT, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., India Public Works Dept.—First commn., 15th Jan., 1861; served in the Hazara campaign, 1868 (medal with clasp); apptd. to the dept., 24th Dec., 1870, as asst. engr., and employed on irrig. works in the Punjab; transfd. to superior accts. dept., Sept., 1874; examr., Jan., 1882; employed on public works accts. in Burma, April, 1883; and in Bengal, June, 1888.

CAREY, HERZEL DENIS DE MUSSENDEN, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Marlborough and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 25th Nov., 1891, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

CAREY, LIONEL SLADE, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Elizabeth Coll., Guernsey, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 14th Dec., 1882, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; registrar, jud. commr.'s court, June to Dec., 1885; settlt. officer, Oct., 1886; dep. commr. and rev. sec., Dec., 1891; commr. of settlt. and agric., Jan., 1895.

CARGILL, JAMES DUDLEY, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the Brighton Gr. Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 13th Nov., 1891, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

CARLESS, GEORGE PROCTOR, A.M.I.C.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service as asst. engr., February, 1866; exec. engr., October, 1888.

CARLYLE, ROBERT WARRAND, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Glasgow Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 13th Dec., 1880, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; undersec. to govt., Dec., 1883; joint mag. and dep. collr., June, 1890; has offd. also as under sec. to the govt. of India, home dept.; mag. and collr., June, 1894.

CARMICHAEL, CHARLES PAGET, C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Harrow and Haileybury; apptd., 1849; arrived, March, 1849, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. sec. to govt.; joint mag. and dep. collr., 1st grade, Jan., 1856; depd. as civil officer with the relieving force to Shahjahanpur, April, 1858; mag. and collr., Budaun, Feb., 1862; inspr.-gen. of police, N.W. Prov., Feb., 1870; commr. and agent to govr.-gen., Benares, March, 1877; also held the substantive appt. of district and sessions judge, Jan., 1877; member of the board of rev., 1882; retd., March, 1884.

CARMICHAEL, DAVID FREMANTLE, late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1851; asst. collr. and mag., Dec., 1857; head asst. registrar, court of Sadar and Foujdari Adalat, Feb., 1855; dep. sec. to govt., Oct., 1856; sec. to board of exams, Oct., 1856; private sec. to govt. of Madras, March, 1859; fellow of Madras univ., Oct., 1859; collr. and mag. and agent, July, 1863; acting judge, high court, Madras, April to July, 1869; employed in preparation of Vizagapatam district manual; acting member, board of rev., Aug., 1871; inam commr., Aug., 1871; sec. to govt., rev. dept., Nov., 1872; member of legisl. council, Feb., 1874; on special duty at imperial assemblage, Delhi, Dec., 1876; chief sec. to govt., June, 1877; ordinary member of council, Madras, Dec., 1878; on tour as special commr. through hill tracts of Ganjam, Vizagapatam, and Godavari, Feb., 1881; retd., 1886.

CARMICHAEL, GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Aberdeen Gr. Sch., Univ. of Aberdeen, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; arrived, 4th Dec., 1886, and served in Bengal as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settlt. officer; transfd. to Burma as asst. commr., Aug., 1889; returned to Bombay as and asst., Oct., 1894.

CARNDUFF, HERBERT WILLIAM CAMERON, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Edinburgh Coll.
Sch., Univ. of Edinburgh, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 30th Nov., 1883, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec. to govt. of Bengal, May, 1888; registrar, appellate side, high court, Calcutta, Oct., 1890; acted as dep. sec. to govt. of India, legisl. dept., from Jan., 1895; dist. and sess. judge, December, 1895.

CARR, REGINALD CHILDERS CULLING, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Cheam Sch., the Charterhouse, and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 7th Dec., 1885, and served in Madras as assst. collr. and mag.; addl. special asst. to district mag. and collr., March, 1889; asst. sec., jud. and legisl. depts., Sept., 1891; acted as private sec. to govrn. in 1891, 1893, and 1895; under sec., rev. dept., Aug., 1892; under sec., in depts. under the chief sec., May, 1894.

CARR, WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Lancaster Gr. Sch., and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 14th Nov., 1893, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

CARSTAIRS, ROBERT, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Edinburgh Acad., and Edinburgh Coll. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 16th Nov., 1874, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1886; dep. commr., Aug., 1888; author of 'British Work in India.'

CARTER, ALBERT MICHAEL, Accntn.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; temporary clerk, India office, 4th Nov., 1861; junr. clerk, March, 1866; senr. clerk, Aug., 1882; assessor of income tax, 1892.

CARTER, GEORGE MARKHAM STRANGE, Burma Commn.—Apptd. chief inspr. of police, June, 1875; asst. district supt., Feb., 1880, and district supt., Oct., 1882; apptd. asst. commr., March, 1886; dep. commr., Dec., 1890; acted as prest., Rangoon municipality, Dec., 1893, and Jan., 1894.

CARTER, HENRY VANDYKE, M.D. (Lon.), Dep. Surgn.-Gen., late Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the Indian med. service, 27th Jan., 1858; arrived, 29th March, 1858, and served on mil. duty and as profr. at the Grant med. coll., and asst. surgn., Jamsetji Jijibhoy hosp.; also as civil surgn. and supt. of jail, Satara; surgn. to the Gokuldas Tejpal hosp., Bombay, Nov., 1870; principal and profr. of medicine, Grant med. coll., and first physician, Jamsetji Jijibhoy hosp., 1886; retd., July, 1888.

CARTER, PHILIP JOHN, Burma Forest Dept.—Arrived in India, 27th Dec., 1875, and was apptd. to Burma as asst. conservator; dep. conservator, April, 1881; on duty at Port Blair, Nov., 1886; rejoined his Burma appt., June, 1889; conservator, Feb., 1892.

CARTER-CAMPBELL, THOMAS TUPPER, Col., R.E., late Survey of India.—First commn., Dec., 1857; arrived, Dec., 1859; served with the Sikkim field force, 1860-61, as survey officer; from May, 1861, served as asst. engr. in the public works dept., Punjab; apptd. to the great trigonl. survey of India, March, 1862, and served as asst. in the Kashmir and Kumaon and Garhwal surveys; served in the Ambela campaign, 1863 (medal and clasp); surveyor, April, 1866; in charge of the survey party with the Abyssinian expdn., 1867-69; dep. supt., 1st grade, March, 1886; retd., Jan., 1887.

CASEY, ARTHUR EDWIN COMERFORD, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Portora Royal Sch., and Marlborough Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1874, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; asst. commr., Kumaon, May, 1882; retd., Oct., 1889.

CASPERSZ, CHARLES PETER, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Harrow and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 21st Dec., 1878, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and settlt. officer; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1889; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1894.

CASSON, HERBERT ALEXANDER, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Newton Abbot Proprietary Coll., Marlborough Coll., and Hertford Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 15th Nov., 1889, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; on special duty with Waziristan delimitation commn., 1894-95.

CAVE-BROWNE, EDWARD RABAN, C.S.I., Accntn.-Gen., India Office.—Educ. at the Coll. Sch., Taunton; junr. clerk in the treasury, East India house, 12th April, 1854, and from 1858 in the India office; accntn.-gen.'s dept., 1860; senr. clerk, June, 1867; asst. in the accts. branch of the finl. dept., Jan., 1872; assessor of income tax, 1872; dep. accntn.-gen., Feb., 1879; C.S.I., Jan., 1888; accntn.-gen., June, 1893.

CAWLEY, GEORGE JOHN, late Police Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service, 1st May, 1862, as asst. supt. of police, Assam; district supt., Dec., 1876; transf. to Bengal, Dec., 1883; retd., Sept., 1894.

CAYLEY, HENRY, Dep. Surgn.-Gen., late Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 1857; from April, 1872, served as civil surgn. and offg. supt. of vacnn., supt. of royal botanical gardens, ophthalmic surgn. and profr. of ophthalmic surgery, med. coll., Calcutta, supt. of the eye infirmary, and marine surgn.; med. board, Indic office, 1885; retd., April, 1887.

CENTER, WILLIAM, M.B., M.A., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Med. Dept., Punjab.—Joined Indian med. dept. in 1865; arrived, 11th April, 1866; from March, 1871, served in the Punjab as chemical examr. and profr. in the Lahore med. sch.; offg. meteorological reporter in addn., May, 1872; served under the govt. of India, 1882, as statistical officer in sanitary dept.; civil surgn., Lahore, and supt., lunatic asylum, 1884; profr. Lahore med. coll., April, 1888; retd., April, 1893.

CHADWICK, WILLIAM, A.M.I.C.E., Indian Public Works Dept.—Apptd. from Royal Indian Engrg. Coll. as asst. engr., Sept., 1878, and posted to State Rlys.; exec. engr., Oct., 1892.

CHAMBERLAIN, SIR NEVILLE BOWLES, G.C.B., G.C.S.I., Gen.—Ensign, Bengal infantry, 1837; served through the Afghan campaigns of 1839-42 (medal); present with the govt.-gen.'s body-guard at the battle of Maharajpur, Dec., 1843 (bronze star); dep. asst. quartermaster-gen. to the army, 1843; hon. A.D.C. to Lord Dalhousie, 1848; served in the Punjab campaign of 1848-49, including the actions of Chilianwala and Gujrat (medal and two clasps); mil. sec. to the chief commr. for affairs of the Punjab, March, 1853; commandant, Punjab irregular force, Dec., 1854; adjutant-gen. of the Bengal army, July, 1857;
C.B., 1857; A.D.C. to the Queen for services in the Mutiny; commanded the force on the N.W. frontier of India in various expds. against the hill tribes (medal and clasp); commander-in-chief, Madras, and member of the govr.'s council, Feb., 1876, to 1881; was apptd. head of the special mission to Kabul, Aug., 1878, which, however, was not allowed to enter the Amir's territory.

CHAMBERLAIN, WILLIAM JOHN, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. traffic supt., Dhond-Manmad railway, 29th Oct., 1878; served upon Berar, Punjab N., Rajputana-Malwa, and other railways; dep. traffic supt., N.W. railway, April, 1892.

CHAMIER, EDWARD MAYNARD DES CHAMPS, (barr.-at-law).—Entered the service as public prosecutor in the High Court, N.W.P., and standing counsel to govt., Jan., 1896.

CHAMIER, FRANCIS EDWARD ARCHIBALD, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Oudh Commn.—Arrived, as ensign, 7th April, 1850; A.D.C. to Gen. Outram throughout the Oudh campaign; commanded the Kapurthala contingent during its service in Oudh, in 1858 (medal and two clasps); from March, 1858, served in Oudh as asst. commr., dep. commr., and offg. commr.; district judge, Rae Bareli, Feb., 1882, and afterwards at Faizabad; returned to Europe, 1888.

CHANNING, FRANCIS HORLEY, late Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 25th Nov., 1870, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and settlt. officer; settlt. sec. to finl. commr., Jan., 1878; senr. sec. to the finl. commr., March, 1882; dep. commr., March, 1886; district judge, Jan., 1888, but to continue to act as divl. judge; divl. judge, May, 1889; acting judge, chief court, May-Dec., 1894; retd., Aug., 1895.

CHAPMAN, CHARLES, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 6th Aug., 1834.

CHAPMAN, EDMUND PELLY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 12th Nov., 1889, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and collr., Dec., 1895.

CHAPMAN, REGINALD CORRIE, Fin. and Commerce Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the service, 28th Sept., 1874, and was employed at Nagpur, and afterwards at Rangoon; asst. comptr.-gen. at Calcutta, Feb., 1879; transf. to Madras as acting asst. acctnt.-gen., March, 1879; confd., July, 1880; in addn., inspr. of local fund accts., April, 1882; asst. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, Nov., 1891.

CHAPMAN, ROBERT ALEXANDER BOSWELL, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Haileybury Coll., and St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 15th Nov., 1888, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; transf. to Central Prov. as asst. commr., Nov., 1891; dep. commr., May, 1896.

CHAPMAN, ROBERT BARCLAY, C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1859; arrived, 6th March, 1850; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; under sec. to govt. of India, home, finl., and foreign depts., April, 1856, to April, 1860; called to the bar (Inner Temple), Jan., 1863; junr. sec., board of rev., Lower Prov., June, 1863; acting commr., Nuddea divn., Nov., 1866, to Jan., 1869; served subsequently as sec. to govt. of India, finl. dept., and govt. dir. of Bank of Bengal; retd., 1881.

CHARLES, FENDALL, LOWIS, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Repton Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 13th Nov., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; on special duty, demarcation of forests in Nasik, July, 1875; forest settlt. officer, Dharwar, Nov., 1881; acting municipal commr., Bombay, Oct., 1886; junr. collr. and mag., April, 1890; senr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1892.

CHARLES, GEORGE GWTHER, M.I.E.E., India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the dept., 9th May, 1857; arrived, 3rd Oct., 1857, and held charge of various offices in Bengal and the N.W. Prov.; inspr., April, 1862; asst supt., Feb., 1863; supt., April, 1880.

CHARLES, JOHN GEORGE, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 15th Dec., 1865, and served in Bombay as asst. mag. and collr., and offg. under sec.; member of cattle plague commn., June, 1870; offg. dep. collr. of customs, Calcutta, July, 1871; offg. dep. commr.of police, Calcutta, March, 1876; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1876; acted as presidency and as chief presidency mag., Calcutta; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1885; retd., Jan., 1893.

CHARLES, RICHARD HAVELOCK, M.D., M.Ch., F.R.C.S.I., Surgn.—Major, Bengal Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1882, and served as prof. of anatomy, Lahore med. coll.; apptd. in similar capacity to Calcutta med. coll., April, 1894.

CHARLTON, ALFRED, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 8th April, 1882.

CHATFIELD, KYRLE MITFORD, M.A., Educ., Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; served from 29th March, 1866, as principal and prof. of logic and moral philosophy at the Elphinstone coll., Bombay; dir. of public instrn., Nov., 1874.

CHATTERTON, FRANK WILLIAM, Col., Bengal Infantry.—Arrived in India as ensign, 4th Nov., 1859; employed under the mil. dept. till Feb., 1860, from which date he served in Jhansi and Kumaon as offg. asst. commr.; from May, 1873, served as cantonmt. mag. of Rurki; also small cause court judge, Rurki, March, 1879; cantonmt. mag., Agra, Dec., 1880, to Nov., 1886, when he was apptd. commandant of administrative battalion Bengal presidency volunteers; hon. A.D.C. to viceroy, Dec., 1888.

CHENEVIX-TRENCH, GEORGE FREDERICK, Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 22nd Jan., 1879; served in the Burma expdn., 1886; offg. asst. to govr.-gen.'s agent in Rajputana, June, 1888; on depn. in Kotah and Jhallawar, 1888-89; acting asst. district supt. of police, Quetta, Dec., 1889; also asst. commr., April, 1890; offg. first asst. to pol. rest., Persian Gulf, Aug., 1890; acting pol. agent, Basra, April, 1891; British joint commr. at Leh, Dec., 1891; asst. rest. for Leh, Kashmir, Dec., 1894.

CHERRY, JOHN WILLIAM, Forest Dept., Madras.—Joined the service, 5th Feb., 1869, as asst. conservator; dep. conservator, Jan., 1872; conservator, Oct., 1891.

CHEVIS, WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Lancing Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford;
apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 4th Dec., 1885, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; district judge, April, 1893.

CHICHELE-POLOWDEN, Trevor John, C.S.I., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Winchester Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 31st Oct., 1868, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and offg. under sec.; offg. under sec., govt. of India, home dept., Feb., 1873; inspr.-gen. of police, Assam, Nov., 1876; sec. to the prison conference, Jan., 1877; sec., govt. of India, foreign dept., Dec., 1878; rest. and pol. agent, Turkish Arabia, March, 1880; consul-gen., Baghdad, June, 1880; commr. of Ajmir-Merwara, June, 1885; rest. in Mewar, Nov., 1885; rest. in Kashmir, Nov., 1887; commr., Haidarabad assigned districts, Nov., 1888; rest., Haidarabad, March, 1892; C.S.I., Jan., 1893; author of several reports on journeys in Kurdistan, &c.

CHIPPER, Ernest, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 3rd Dec., 1875.

CHISHOLM, James Wright, late Central Prov. Commn.—Served in the Central Prov. from 24th Oct., 1850, as dep. collr., asst. commr., dep. commr., and settl. officer; inspr.-gen. of registrm., supt. of stamps, and commr. of excise, Oct., 1871; inspr.-gen. of police and jails, Oct., 1876; sec. to the chief commr., June, 1880; commr. of the Chhattisgarh divn., March, 1883; retd., 1889.

CHISHOLME, John James Scott, Lieut.-Col., 5th Lancers.—First commn., 9th lancers, 10th Jan., 1872; served in the Afghan war, 1878-80; mil. sec. to govr. of Madras (Lord Connemara, G.C.I.E.), 10th Aug., 1888; reverted to mil. dept. Dec., 1890.

CHITPAL SINGH, Raja, Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. under native civil service rules, 12th Dec., 1881, and served in Oudh as asst. commr.; joint mag., Nov., 1893, offd. as dep. commr., March, 1896.

CHITTY, Charles William, B.A., B.L., Bombay Jud. Dept.—Called to the bar (Inner Temple), 17th Nov., 1884; acting chief judge, Bombay small cause court, Feb.-May, 1891, and again from Oct., 1891; confd., July, 1892.

CHOLMELEY, Norman Goodford, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Charterhouse, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 22nd Dec., 1884, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Oct., 1890.

CHRISTIE, Archibald, B.L., late Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 7th Nov., 1871, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; on special duty, Kurram field force, Oct., 1878; offg. under sec. to govr., Aug. to Dec., 1884; district judge, Sept., 1887; divl. judge, April, 1893; acting judge, chief court, June, 1895; retd. Aug., 1896.

CHRISTIE, Charles Howard Peregrine, Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—First commn., April, 1866; joined the dept., March, 1869; served as asst. engr. and asst. consulting engr. for railways; dep. controller, public works accts., Madras, irrign. branch, Jan., 1873; examr., Jan., 1880; transf. to Central India, Sept., 1880; examr. of guaranteed railway accts., Calcutta, April, 1881; examr., public works accts., Madras, March, 1887; N.W. Prov. and Oudh, March, 1894.

CHRISTIE, George Francis Stephen, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Caius Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 14th Dec., 1891, and served in Burma as asst. commr., cantonmt. mag., and small cause court judge.

CHRISTIE, James Thomas, C.I.E., Police Dept., Punjab.—Entered the acctnt.-gen.'s office, Jan., 1858; served in the police dept. from March, 1861, and under the govt. of India in the foreign dept., Sept., 1887, and Feb., 1880 (in Afghanistan); C.I.E., March, 1881; district supt. of police, first grade, Dec., 1886; asst. inspr.-gen., railway police, April, 1893, to June, 1894.

CHRYSTIE, George, Col., Police Dept., Madras.—Joined the service, 12th Dec., 1857; arrived, 12th Feb., 1858, and served in the suppression of the Mutiny, &c.; from Aug., 1863, served in Madras as asst. supt. of police; supt., April, 1873; dep. inspr.-gen., Dec., 1891; vacated, Dec., 1895.

CHUCKERBUTTY, Alfred William Goodeve, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch. and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 30th Dec., 1891, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

CHUCKERBUTTY, Arthur Goodeve, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch. and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 25th Nov., 1886, and served as astt. mag. and collr. in Bengal; asst. comptr., India treasuries, June, 1893; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, May, 1894.

CHUNDER MADHUB GHOSE, Jud. Dept., Bengal.—Member of the legislt. council of Bengal, 1883-85; fellow, Calcutta univ., 1885; prest., faculty of law, 1886-88; prest., board of examrs. for pleaders, &c., 1892; puisne judge, high court, Calcutta, 12th Jan., 1885.

CHURCH, William Thomas, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Rugby, and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 30th Oct., 1863, and served in the N.W. Prov. as astt. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; supt., Dehra Dun, Jan., 1882; mag. and collr., July, 1883; offd. as commr., Rohilkhand, in 1889; retd., April, 1890.

CLARK, John, M.A., Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Old Aberdeen Gr. Sch., Aberdeen Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 3rd Jan., 1887, and served in Bengal as astt. mag. and collr.; transf. to Assam as astt. commr., April, 1890.

CLARK, William Ovens, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Portora Sch., Enniskillen, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 11th Nov., 1871, and served in the Punjab as astt. commr.; on famine duty, Bengal, Feb., 1874; on special duty in the public works dept., March, 1882, and in the secretariat, March, 1885; dep. commr., Jan., 1888; district judge, Sept., 1890; divl. judge, Nov., 1892.

CLARKE, Sir Andrew, G.C.M.G., C.B., C.I.E., Lieut.-Gen.—First commn., royal engineers, June, 1844; in 1848 was employed on special service in New Zealand, and was A.D.C. to lieut.-govr., Tasmania, 1849-53; gov. and commander-in-chief, Straits Settlements 1873-75; member of council of govr.-gen. of India in charge of public works, June, 1875, to 1880; commandant, sch. of mil. engrg., Chatham
1881-82; inspr.-gen. of fortifications and dir. of works, ordnance dept., war office, 1882-86.

CLARKE, CHARLES, Funds Dept., India Office.—Writer, India office, 18th Nov., 1872; clerk specially attached, March, 1893.

CLARKE, C.B., M.A., late Educl. Service, Assam.—Apptd. to the Bengal educ. dept., 8th Dec., 1865; served as prof. at the presidency coll., and as inspr. of schools; offig. supt. of the Calcutta botanical garden, May, 1869; offig. dir. of public instrn., Dec., 1884; transf'd to Assam as inspr. of schools, March, 1885; ret'd., June, 1887.

CLARKE, CHARLES MANSFIELD, C.B., Lieut.-Gen.—First commn., 1st March, 1856; served in the New Zealand wars, 1861-66 (medal), and S. African war, 1879 (medal and C.B.), and the subsequent operations in Basutoland; commandant-gen. of the colonial forces, Cape of Good Hope, 1880-82; asst. adjutant-gen., southern district, 1882, Aldershot, 1882-84, headquarters, 1884-86; dep. adjutant-gen., Ireland, 1886-88; in command of 3rd infantry brigade at Aldershot, 1889-92; dep. adjutant-gen., headquarters, 1892; commander-in-chief, Madras, and second member of council, Oct., 1893, till the abolition of that post, April, 1895; lieut.-gen. commanding the forces in Madras, April, 1895.

CLARKE, EDWARD HENRY SCAMANDER, Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Held various non-gazetted appts. from 20th Sept., 1875; was apptd. extra asst. commr. in the Punjab, Feb., 1880; served on the staff of Sir Lepel Griffin at Kabul, till the withdrawal of the forces in eastern Afghanistan (medal); accompanied Afghan boundary commn. to Herat frontier, Aug., 1884, to Nov., 1886; and on duty in connection therewith in London and Petersburg, Dec., 1886, to Sept., 1887; asst. pol. sec. with Kabul mission, 1893; asst. sec. to gov't. of India, foreign dept., Oct., 1894.

CLARKE, GEOFFREY ROTE, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Dublin Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived 5th Dec., 1895, and served in N.W. Prov. and Oudh, as asst. mag. and collr.

CLARKE, HERVEY MORRIS STANLEY, Col., I.S.C.—Arrived in India as ensign, Madras native infantry, 13th March, 1854; served with the Central India horse, 1858-60; from Sept., 1861, served in the N.W. Prov. police dept.; district supt., April, 1863; personal asst. to inspr.-gen. of police, Dec., 1871; dep. inspr.-gen., Oct., 1885; inspr.-gen. of prisons, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, May, 1886; reverted to mil. duty, 1890.

CLARKE, LEYCESTER ANNAND GREY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch., and Jesus Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 23rd Dec., 1893, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

CLARKE, LOFTUS OTWAY, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Charterhouse, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 14th Dec., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

CLARKE, ROBERT, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Royal Sch., Raphoe, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 8th Dec., 1870, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; offig. registrar, chief court, Punjab, May, 1881; offig. divl. judge, Oct., 1886; dep. commr., Nov., 1886; commr. and supt., March, 1896.

CLARKE, ROBERT LUCAS HYRAPET, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 25th Dec., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.

CLARKE, ROBERT THOMAS, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Raphoe Royal School and Dublin Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 14th Dec., 1895, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

CLARKE, SYDENHAM CUBBON, Col., late Madras Public Works Dept.—Arrived, 9th Jan., 1862; apptd. asst. engr., Mysore, Oct., 1862; exec. engr., Sept., 1867; served at Chatham, March to Sept., 1874; acting prof'r. of surveying, Cooper's Hill Coll., Sept., 1874; returned to Madras, Nov., 1876; served under the gov't. of India on the Peshawar-Jalalabad state railway, Nov., 1879, and in Baluchistan; temporary supt. of works, Madras, April, 1883; offig. for various periods as suptg. engr., and in May, 1889, was in charge of public works, stores, and workshops; ret'd., March, 1891.

CLARKE, TREDWAY GEORGE, Col., I.S.C.—Ensign, Madras infantry, 1853; served in the Mysore commn. from Oct., 1857; dep. supt., Nov., 1862; dep. commr., 1873; sec. to chief commr., 1877; commr., Nagar divn., May, 1879; commr. of Coorg, 1881; offig. rest. in Mysore and chief commr. of Coorg, Dec., 1884, to March, 1885; and afterwards commr.; reverted to mil. duty, Jan., 1891.

CLARKE, WILLOUGHBY CHARLES STANLEY, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Assam Commn.—First commn. as ensign, June, 1851; arrived, 15th Oct., 1851; was employed on mil. duty till 1862, including service in the Sonthal expedit., 1855, and in the China expedit., 1860-61; also served as supt. of police and mag., gov't.-gen.'s camp, 1859-60; from June, 1862, served in the Assam commn.; dep. commr., July, 1867; returned to Europe, 1880.

CLARKSON, JOHN WILKINS, Surg. Lieut.-Col., I.M.S., Bombay Sanitary Dept.—Joined the service, 30th Sept., 1875; arrived, 17th May, 1876; dep. sanitary commr., May, 1881; sanitary commr., April, 1896.

CLAY, ARTHUR LLOYD, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Cholmeley Gr. Sch., Highgate, at Cologne, and at St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 29th Nov., 1862, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr. and joint mag. and dep. collr.; from Sept., 1874, to June, 1877, served in Assam as dep. commr., and district and sessions judge of Sylhet; mag. and collr., July, 1879; dep. commr., Manbhurn, Aug., 1879; mag. and collr., Bakarganj, March, 1886; offig. as commr. of various divns.; ret'd., July, 1890.

CLAY, WILLIAM MCKINLEY, B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 28th Oct., 1862; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., asst. commr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; on famine relief duty, 1873-74; mag. and collr., 1st grade, March, 1887; ret'd., 1888.

CLEGG, ROBERT BAILEY, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Manchester Gr. Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 12th Jan., 1885, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and head asst.

CLEGHORN, JAMES, M.D., Surgn.-Major-Gen., Indian Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., March,
1865; arrived, 26th Sept., 1865; held various mil. med. charges, and offd. as civil surgn. at several stations; from Feb., 1870, served in the N.W. Prov., as civil surgn., at various stations; offg. surgn. supt., presidency gen. hosp., Calcutta, June, 1885, to March, 1886, when he was apptd. civil surgn. of Lucknow; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., Punjab, Sept., 1891; in 1893 was employed on special duty in connection with the cantonmts. act; dir. gen., Indian Med. Serv., and sanitary commr. with govt. of India, March, 1895.

CLEMENTS, ERNEST, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1893, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

CLEMENTSON, EDWARD HENRY, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. from Royal Indian Engrg. Coll., 1st Oct., 1876, and posted to Mysore as asst. engr.; transf'd. to State Railways, July, 1880; exec. engr., Feb., 1890.

CLENCH, ROBERT CHERRETT, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, 1st Jan., 1893.

CLERK, GEORGE PERCY, Madras Rev. Dept.—Joined the service as proby. asst. dir., rev. settlt., 14th Sept., 1871; asst. dir., July, 1872; on special duty, N. Arcot, in connexion with famine relief works; dep. dir., Sept., 1880; dep. commr. of rev. settlt., April, 1887; special asst. to collr., Cocanada, 1896.

CLEVELAND, CHARLES RAIT, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Christ's Coll., Finchley, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1887, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; asst. settlt. officer, Jan., 1890; asst. to commr. of settlt. and agric., Nov., 1890; settlt. officer, Oct., 1891; commr. of excise, &c., Nov., 1894.

CLIFFORD, SAMUEL LE POER TRENCH, Punjab Commn.—From 1st April, 1861, served in the subord. jud. dept.; in Jan., 1872, was apptd. registrar of the jud. commr.'s court in Oudh; dep. registrar of chief court, Punjab, Oct., 1872; offd. for various periods as judge, small cause court; jud. asst., Jan., 1881; dist. judge, Mar., 1895; author of 'Notes on the Code of Criminal Procedure.'

CLIFFORD, WILLIAM WIGRAM, Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the dept., 10th Sept., 1868, as acting asst. district supt.; confd., Feb., 1871; district supt., March, 1875.

CLIFT, HENRY WILKINS, late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. 8th Oct., 1868, and employed in buildings and roads branch in Mysore; exec. engr., Sept., 1871; served also in irrig. branch, and on famine relief works; transf'd. to state railways, July, 1879, and employed on Mysore and S. Mahratta lines, and on Bengal-Assam railway survey; E. Coast railway, Nov., 1880; retd., Dec., 1895.

CLIFTON, CHARLES NAPIER, Bombay Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, 1st Oct., 1876, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Oct., 1886.

CLINTON (BARON), RIGHT HON. CHARLES HENRY ROLLE HEPBURN STUART TREFUSIS.—Educ. at Eton, and at Christ Church, Oxford; M.P. for N. Devon from 1857 to 1866; parly. under sec. of state for India, July, 1867, to Dec., 1868; apptd. a charity commr. for England and Wales, 1874.

CLOETE, HENRY NEWMAN CUNNINGHAM, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., and posted to Bombay, 10th Aug., 1868; exec. engr., March, 1873; transf'd. to state railways, Dec., 1873, and employed on W. Rajputana railway survey, and on the Punjab N. and Kandahar state railways; transf'd. to Bengal, May, 1881; supt. engr., May, 1893.

CLOETE, JOSIAS GORDON, Lieut.-Gen., late Rev. Survey Dept., Madras.—Ensign, Madras infantry, Feb., 1857; arrived, May, 1857; served in the Madras police as asst. supt., June, 1861, to June, 1863, and from the latter date in the rev. survey; dep. supt., Jan., 1872; retd. from the dept., 1888.

CLOUGH, JOHN WILLIAM, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 25th July, 1892.

COBB, HENRY VENN, LL.B., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at King's Sch., Canterbury, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 18th Nov., 1886, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst. collr., Feb., 1892; acting asst. rest., Mysore, and sec. to chief commr., Coorg, Aug.-Nov., 1893, and from April, 1895; in 1894 acted as dep. dir., land records, and as dep. commr. of salt, &c., rev.

COBB, ROBERT M.D., Surgn.-Lt.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—First commr., 31st Mar., 1876; civil surgn. at various stations from April, 1877; civil surgn., Patna, March, 1896.

COBB, WILLIAM HEY, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at St. Peter's Sch., York, Winchester, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 25th Dec., 1884, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; city mag., Lucknow, July, 1889; also wasika officer, Oct., 1891; joint mag., Aug., 1893; dep. commr., Jan., 1896.

COCKERELL, HORACE ABEL, C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 31st Oct., 1853; served as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and mag. and collr. also as supt. of survey, Sept., 1859, offg. chairman, justices of the peace, Calcutta, and commr. of police, March, 1869, and Dec., 1872; commr. of divn., June, 1872; sec. to the govt. of Bengal, jud. and pol. depts., April, 1878; member of Bengal legisl. council, 1878, 1880, and 1882; board of rev., March, 1883; offg. lieut.-govr. of Bengal, Aug., 1883; retd., Aug., 1887.

CODRINGTON, GEORGE HENRY FORBES, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 4th May, 1857; served on mil. duty till Dec., 1865, and subsequently in the Bombay police dept. as asst. supt. and district supt.; 1st grade supt., April, 1883; reverted to mil. dept., 1892.

COGHLAN, ROBERT NESBIT, Customs Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 23rd April, 1871; from March, 1872, served as gen. manager of the customs bonded warehouses, Bombay; from March, 1874, served as asst. collr. of salt rev.; collr. of sea customs, Karachi, and asst. commr. of salt rev. in Sind, Sept., 1882; collr. of customs and salt rev. in Sind, March, 1891.

COLDSTREAM, WILLIAM, B.A., late Indian C.S.—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; jud. asst., July, 1876; dep. commr., March, 1877; acted as commr. in various divns. from 1880; retd., June,
1894; author of a work on the grasses of the Southern Punjab.

COLE, WILLIAM HAMMOND, M.A., late Survey of India Dept.—Served in the educn. dept., N.W. Prov., April, 1862, to March, 1864, as profr. of mathematics at the govt. coll., Agra; from Jan., 1867, served in the great trigonl. survey; asst. supt. of surveys, Sept., 1869; dep. supt., July, 1882; apptd. to charge of head quarters office, Dehra Dun, and survey detachment in Kashmir, Jan., 1884; retd., April, 1892; author of various contributions to the survey publns., and of translns. relating to geodesy.

COLE, WILLIAM HENRY, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. 1st Oct., 1876, and posted as asst. engr. to state railways; asst. supt. of way and works, N.W. Railway, Jan., 1883; exec. engr., Feb., 1883.

COLEBROOK, HENRY WILLIAM VAUGHAN, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrigtn. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., May, 1883; transfd. to Burma, April, 1894, and placed in charge of central irrigtn. divn.

COLERIDGE, FRANCIS ARTHUR, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Malvern Coll., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 5th Dec., 1894, and served in Madras as asst. colls. and mag.

COLES, GEORGE EDWARD, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrigtn. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., May, 1883.

COLLEN, SIR EDWIN HENRY HAYTER, K.C.I.E., Major-Gen., I.S.C.—First commn. royal artillery, July, 1863; served with the Abyssinian expdn., 1868 (medal); commissary of ordnance, India, 1869-70; admitted to the Bengal staff corps, May, 1873; acted as asst. mil. sec. to govt. of India, 1870 and 1873-74; sec. to Indian ordnance commn., 1874-75; 3rd asst. sec. to govt. of India, mil. dept., March, 1875; and asst. sec., April, 1876; 1st asst. sec. Dec., 1876; dep. asst. quarter-master-gen., imperial assemblage, Delhi, 1876-77; on special duty in intelligence branch, London, 1877-79; sec. to Indian army organisation commn., 1879-80; served during the Afghan war as asst. controller-gen. of supply and transport, 1880-81 (medal); dep. sec. to govt. of India, mil. dept., April, 1884; served in Egypt with Suakim field force and as mil. sec. to Sir G. Graham, 1885 (medal with clasp, and Khedive's star); acctnt.-gen., mil. dept., govt. of India, July, 1886; sec. to govt. of India, mil. dept., Nov., 1887; C.I.E., Jan., 1889; K.C.I.E., Jan., 1893; mil. member of govr.-gen.'s council, April, 1896.

COLLIER, FRANK ROBERT STANLEY, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at King's Coll. and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 6th Nov., 1872, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine duty, March, 1874; offg. collr. of customs, Calcutta, May, 1884; joint mag. and dep. collr., Oct., 1886; mag. and collr., April, 1889; member of Bengal legisl. council, July, 1893; publd. an annotated edition of the Bengal municipal act, 1884, another of the Bengal local self-govt. act and rules, 1886, and the 'Bengal Municipal Manual,' 1887.

COLLIER, GEORGE HERMAN, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Uppingham Sch.; junr. clerk, India office, 17th Feb., 1876, senr. clerk, Aug., 1896.

COLLIN, EDWARD WOODFIELD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Eton, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1878, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; private sec. to finl. member of govr.-gen.'s council, Jan., 1880; served under the foreign dept., Jan. to July, 1881, and in the finl. dept., March to Sept., 1885; settlt. officer, Muzaafarpur, Jan., 1886; offd. as dir. of land records, Bengal, April, 1888; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1886; mag. and collr., Jan., 1894, mag. of 24-pergunnahs, Dec., 1895.

COLLINS, ARTHUR HERBERT, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 1st Jan., 1879, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr. and joint mag. and dep. collr.; transfd. to Burma as asst. commr., Aug., 1894; dep. commr., Aug., 1895.

COLLINS, SIR ARTHUR JOHN HAMMOND, Kt., Q.C., B.L., Madras High Court.—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Cambridge, of which he was fellow; called to the bar (Gray's Inn), 1860; Q.C. and bencher of his inn, 1877; recorder of Poole, 1873-79, and of Exeter from 1879, until he was apptd. chief justice of the high court, Madras, 28th Nov., 1885; vice-chancellor, Madras univ., 1889.

COLLINS, GEORGE GOWER, Burma Commn.—Held subord. appts. from 25th July, 1879; apptd. to the Burma police dept. as asst. district supt., Oct., 1882; joined the commn. as supernumerary asst. commr., March, 1884; asst. supt., Rangoon jail, Oct., 1884; asst. commr., March, 1886.

COLLINS, SIDNEY ARTHUR, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, India store depot, 4th Dec., 1885.

COLQUHOUN, ARCHIBALD ROSS, A.M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Entered the dept. in Oct., 1871, and served as asst. and exec. engr. in Burma; on special duty as personal asst. to Major Street on his mission to Siam, Jan.-May, 1879; posted to special duty in Upper Burma as civil officer and apptd. a dep. commr., Feb., 1885; transretd. to public works dept., and posted to Baluchistan, Aug., 1889; services lent to British S. Africa Co., 1891-92; retd., Nov., 1893; author of 'Across Chryste,' 'Among the Shans,' 'The Truth about Tonquin,' 'The Opening of China,' 'Burma and the Burmans.'

COLQUHOUN, HENRY ARCHIBALD COLEBROOKE, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Wellington Coll. and Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 18th Dec., 1895, and served in Assam as asst. commr.

COLVIN, SIR AUCKLAND, K.C.M.G., K.C.S.I., C.I.E., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Eton; apptd. from Haileybury, 1857; arrived, 17th Jan., 1858, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. settlt. officer; offg. under sec. to the govt. of India in the home dept., May, 1864, and in the foreign dept., Jan. to Nov., 1865; settlt. officer, July, 1869; sec., board of rev., N.W. Prov., March, 1870; on special duty for revision of Allahabad settlt., June, 1870; offg. sec. to govt., N.W. Prov., April, 1873, and again in 1875; offg. commr. of excise and stamps, and inspr.-gen. of registrn., June, 1873; mag. and collr., Basti,
Feb., 1877, and afterwards at Bijnaur; offg. commr. of inland customs under the govt. of India, Nov., 1877; transfd. for employment in Egypt, Jan., 1879, and served as controller of Egyptian finance, and subsequently as finance minister to the Egyptian govt.; acted as consul-gen. in Sir E. Malet's absence; finl. member of council of the govt.-gen. of India, Oct., 1883; lieut.-govr. of the N.W. Prov., and chief commr. of Oudh, Nov., 1887, to Nov., 1892; retd., Dec., 1892.

COLVIN, BAZETT WETENHALL, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Eton; apptd. from Haileybury, 1850; arrived, 29th June, 1850; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr. till Jan., 1854, and subsequently in the N.W. Prov.; asst. commr., Kumaon, April, 1855; mag. and collr., Mainpuri, July, 1865; civil and sessions judge, Allahabad, July, 1873; on special duty at Agra during visit of H.R.H. the Prince of Wales, Feb., 1876; offg. sec. to govt., N.W. Prov., May, 1876; commr., Meerut, Jan., 1879; addl. member, govt.-gen.'s council, Jan., 1877, to May, 1881; member, board of rev., N.W. Prov., Jan., 1862; retd., April, 1885.

COLVIN, CLEMENT SNEYD, Public Works Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Brighton Coll., and by private tuition in England and on the Continent; temporary clerk, 1863; junr. clerk, mil. dept., 1864; funds dept., 1867; private sec. to sec. of state (the Duke of Argyll), 1873-74; private sec. to permanent under sec. of state, 1874-77, and accompanied Sir Louis Mallet on his depn. to India in 1875-76; senr. clerk, rev. statistics, and commerce dept., 1877; rest. clerk, 1877-85; public works dept., 1877; govt. dir. of Madras irrign. and canal co., 1880-82; asst. sec. in the public works, railway and telegraph dept., Sept., 1882; asst. govt. dir. of Indian railway cos., 1882; sec., public works dept., March, 1892.

COLVIN, ELLIOT GRAHAM, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Charterhouse, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 4th Jan., 1883, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transfd. to Assam as personal asst. to chief commr., May, 1884; asst. pol. agent, Rajputana, Sept., 1886; private sec. to lieut.-govr. of Bengal, April, 1887; 1st asst. to govt.-gen.'s agent in Baluchistan, April, 1889; served under finl. dept. of govt. of India from June, 1890; offg. postm.-gen., Bengal, July, 1890; joint mag. and dep. collr., May, 1891; mag. and collr., March, 1895.

COLVIN, JOHN RUSSELL COLQUHOUN, Capt., I.S.C.—Joined the service, 13th Aug., 1879, and was employed under the mil. dept. to Aug., 1886, including service in the E. Soudan, 1885; apptd. asst. to the agent in Rajputana, Aug., 1886; private sec. to lieut.-govr., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Nov., 1887; govr. to the Nawab of Rampur, April, 1889; rest. pol. officer, Rampur state, April, 1894.

COMINS, DENIS WOOD DEANE, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Jail Dept.—Joined the service, 22nd Oct., 1881, and served on gen. and jail duty, and as offg. first rest. surgn., med. coll. hosp., Calcutta; protector of emigrants, Calcutta, Jan., 1889; from Jan., 1891, served under the govt. of India, fin. and commerce dept.; apptd. inspr.-gen. of jails, Bengal, March, 1892.

CONDER, JAMES, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the public works dept., Sept., 1870; exec. engr., Oct., 1873; personal asst. to engr.-in-chief, Punjab N. railway, June, 1875; provisional asst. dir. of state railways, western system, 1877; traffic supt., Indus valley state railway, May, 1878; manager, Holkar, Sindia-Nimach, and Nimach-Nasirabad railways, Feb., 1881; traffic supt., Rajputana-Malwa railways, Sept., 1884; retd., 1890.

CONDON, JAMES HUNT, M.D., Brigade-Surgn., late Med. Dept., N.W. Prov.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., Feb., 1859; arrived, 25th July, 1859; served under the mil. dept. till Oct., 1861, when he was apptd. civil asst. surgn. in Oudh; from April, 1868, served in the N.W. Prov.; civil surgn. and supt. of jail, Cawnpore, March, 1871; retd., March, 1891.

CONINGHAM, HENRY EVELYN, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Madras.—Arrived, 18th March, 1855; served in the dept. from Dec., 1861, as asst. supt. and supt., and acted as dep. inspr.-gen., Sept., 1883, to May, 1884; retd., Feb., 1886.

CONNAN, WILLIAM, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 22nd Dec., 1868, and posted to Bengal; exec. engr., Aug., 1879; offg. under sec. to govt. of Bengal, public works dept., 1888 and 1889; offg. suptg. engr., Orissa irrign. circle, April, 1891.

CONNAUGHT AND STRATHEARN (DUKE OF), H.R.H. ARTHUR WILLIAM PATRICK ALBERT, K.G., K.T., K.P., G.C.S.I., G.C.M.G., G.C.I.E., K.C.B., P.C., Gen.—First commn., 19th June, 1868; asst. adjutant-gen., Gibraltar, Oct., 1875; brigadier-gen., Aldershot, Sept., 1880; accompanied the expedy. force to Egypt, Aug., 1882 (medal with clasp, 2nd class Medjidie, and C.B.); commander-in-chief, and 2nd member of council, Bombay, Dec., 1886, to March, 1890; on return to England was apptd. to command of southern divn., Aug., 1890; commanding at Aldershot, Oct., 1893.

CONNEMARA (BARON), RIGHT HON. ROBERT BOURKE, G.C.I.E., P.C.—Educ. at Enniskillen Royal Sch. and at Trinity Coll., Dublin; called to the bar at the Inner Temple, Nov., 1852; M.P. for Lynn Regis from Dec., 1868; parly. under sec. of state for foreign affairs, Feb., 1874, to April, 1880; a royal commr. on the laws relating to copyright, Oct., 1875; privy councillor, April, 1880; again parly. under sec. for foreign affairs, June, 1885, to Feb., 1886; apptd. govr. of Madras, Sept., 1886; took his seat, 7th Dec., 1886; created a peer, 12th May, 1887; resigned, 1st Dec., 1890.

CONNOLLY, JOHN FRANCIS, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Belvedere Coll., Dublin, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 6th Nov., 1890, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; under sec. to govt., March, 1894.

CONOLLY, EDWARD ROBERT, Col., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 9th April, 1888; from Sept., 1866, served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; on special duty as asst. to Major Cavagnari, Feb., 1879, and again at Khairar, Feb., 1880; jud. asst., Sept., 1883; dep. commr., Bannu, Nov., 1884; also district judge; retd., Aug., 1890.

CONSTABLE, EDWIN THEOBALD, M.A., late Educl. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service as mathematical profr., Bareilly coll.,
25th Feb., 1862; inspr. of public instrn., 1st circle, Aug., 1870; inspr. of schools, Dec., 1877; offg. dir. of public instrn., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Feb., 1883, and again, April, 1890; retd., Sept., 1891.

CONSTABLE, WILLOUGHBY VERNER, Major, R.E., India Public Works Dept.—First commn., 12th Sept., 1872; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1876, and posted to state railways; asst. manager, Rajputana state railway, July, 1882; employed in mil. dept., on Suakim-Berber railway, 1885; dep. consulting engr. for railways, Bombay, Nov., 1886; exec. engr., Feb., 1887; offg. manager, Bhaunagar, Gondal and Morvi railways, April-June, 1887; dep. agent, Bengal-Nagpur railway co., 1887-89; offg. dep. consulting engr. for railways, and under sec. to govt., public works dept., Madras, Feb., 1891; dep. manager, N.W. railway, Nov., 1893.

CONYBEARE, HENRY CRAWFORD ARTHUR, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Westminster Sch., King's Coll., London, and Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 3rd Nov., 1873, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Jan., 1885; dep. commr., Aug., 1890; mag. and collr., Aug., 1891; author of 'An Account of Pargana Dudhi, in S. Mirzapur,' and of contributions to the provl. gazetteer.

COODE, MONTGOMERY PENROSE, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1876, and posted to Haidarabad; exec. engr., Jan., 1885; transfd. to Burma, Oct., 1889; asst. to chief engr. and under sec. to chief commr., Feb., 1895.

COOK, HENRY, M.D., Surgn.-Maj.-Gen., Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the Indian med. service, 31st March, 1865; arrived, 31st Aug., 1865, and served as civil surgn. at various stations, supt. of vacen., and supt. of jail; acted as surgn., Jamsetji Jijibhoy hosp., and profr., Grant med. coll., 1879-80, and 1881-82; civil surgn., Poona, with med. charge of the Deccan coll. and coll. of science, and supt. of lunatic asylum, April, 1883; also supt. and teacher of medicine and therapeutics at the med. school; acted as dep. sanitary commr., Oct., 1884; reverted to mil. dept., 1891; surgn.-gen. with govt. of Bombay, March, 1896.

COOK, HENRY, M.D., F.R.C.P., Dep. Surgn.-Gen., late Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the Indian med. service, 24th Jan., 1855; arrived, 28th July, 1855, and served under the mil. dept. up to 1859, also holding the civil surgery of Karachi in 1856; served with the Persian expedy. force in 1857 (medal); apptd. med. officer to pol. agency, Khalat, April, 1859; from April, 1861, served as civil surgn. in Ahmadnagar and Satara, and as supt. of Mahabalishwar, and asst. collr. and mag. at that station; scientific officer, Abyssinian field force, Dec., 1867 (medal); physician, Jamsetji Jijibhoy hosp., and profr., Grant med. coll., May, 1873; retd., Nov., 1886; author of various papers publd. in the transactions of the med. and physical society of Bombay, on the geology, &c., of Baluchistan, and of other reports and papers on scientific and med. subjects.

COOK, HENRY DAVID, M.B., C.M., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service as asst. surgn., 1st April, 1870; arrived, 22nd Dec., 1870, and served on mil. gen. and jail duty; surgn., 1st district, and med. inspr. of emigrants, Madras, May, 1888.

COOK, JOHN HOME, Madras Rev. Survey Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd Jan., 1868, as proby. asst. supt.; confd., July, 1876; dep. supt., May, 1887.

COOKE, ARTHUR GEORGE, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Bath Coll., and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 11th Jan., 1895, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

COOKE, CRAWFORD BOYD, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—First commn., March, 1864; served under the mil. dept. up to Dec., 1868; and subsequently as asst. commr. in Burma; from Feb., 1874, to May, 1877, served as pol. agent at Bhamo, and from May, 1879, as cantonmt. mag. in Nowgong; from Jan., 1884, served as dep. commr. in Burma, and was apptd. to special duty in Upper Burma, Dec., 1885; commr., Oct., 1890; acted as finl. commr. in 1894; author of the 'British Burma Manual.'

COOKE, FREDERICK JAMES, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Bath Coll. and Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1886, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; transfd. temporarily to Central Prov. as asst. commr., Nov., 1891; dep. commr., Sept., 1895.

COOKE, GORDON HENRY, Survey of India Dept. (Burma).—Joined the dept., 6th Dec., 1866, and was apptd. asst. supt., May, 1871; in 1871-72, served with the Lushai expedy. force (medal); served in various districts, and at head-quarters, Calcutta, and was apptd. dep. supt., Oct., 1885; supt., Jan., 1895.

COOKE, HENRY GIRAUD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 12th Nov., 1869, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., June, 1886; commr., Orissa, and supt., tributary mahals, March, 1895.

COOKE, JOHN EDWARD, Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—From Oct., 1863, to April, 1868, served as asst. sec. to the govt. of India in the finl. dept.; dep. acctnt-gen., Central Prov., Sept., 1870, and in Madras, Jan., 1874; asst. compt-r-gen., May, 1875; dep. acctnt-gen., Bengal, Oct., 1878; dep. acctnt-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, July, 1883; dep. acctnt-gen., Bengal, Oct., 1888; dep. auditor-gen., April, 1891.

COOKE, SAMUEL M.A., F.I.C., F.G.S., A.M.I.C.E., Educl. Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; arrived, 27th Dec., 1868, and served as profr. of chemistry and geology at the civil engrg. coll. (now the coll. of science), Poona; apptd. principal, Oct., 1893.

COOKE, THEODORE, C.I.E., M.A., M.Eng., LL.D., late Educl. Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; arrived, Nov., 1860; from June, 1865, served as principal of the civil engrg. coll., Poona; acted as dir. of public instrn. and also as dir. of land records and agric.; retd., Oct., 1893, and was apptd. technical sub-dir., Imperial Institute.

COOPER, CHARLES PHILIP, late Police Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 28th Jan., 1863; served from June, 1864, as examr. of the insolvent debtors' court, Bombay; police mag., Bombay, from Oct.
1871; acting first judge of the small cause court, Sept., 1873; senr. mag. of police and rev. judge, Bombay, June, 1874; chief presidency mag. and rev. judge, Bombay, June, 1878; retd., March, 1895.

COOPER, HARRY ALBERT, B.A., India Audit Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, acctnt.-gen.'s dept., India office, 3rd June, 1880; junr. examr., India audit office, Nov., 1881; B.A., London univ., 1887; designation changed to junr. clerk, Oct., 1892.

COPESTON, FREDERICK SELWYN, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 23rd Oct., 1873, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; transf'd to Burma, as asst. commr., Sept., 1874; on forest demarcation duty, Toungoo, Jan., 1880; dep. supt. of census, Sept., 1880; judge under the land acquisition act, March, 1881; commr. of excise and stamps, March, 1885; addl. sessions judge, Tenasserim and Pegu, March, 1886; dep. commr., Jan., 1887; commr., Dec., 1890; offd. as jud. commr., Upper Burma, in 1894-95.

CORBETT, FRANK VINCENT, Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Arrived, 13th Dec., 1866; asst. engr., Feb., 1867; exec. engr., March, 1871; employed chiefly on the Betwa canal; suptg. engr., Dec., 1889; chief engr. and sec. to govt. of N.W. Prov. and Oudh, irrign. branch, June, 1894.

CORDERY, JOHN GRAHAM, M.A., C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1855; arrived, 22nd Oct., 1855, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; from Oct., 1864, to Sept., 1868, served in Berar as dep. commr. and asst. resp.; offg. dir. of public instrn., Punjab, 1872-73; offg. sec. to govt. of Punjab, April-Aug., 1878; commr. and supt., Multan, April, 1879; commr., Peshawar, April, 1881; rest., Haidarabad, April, 1883; C.S.I., Feb., 1887; retd., July, 1883.

CORDNER, ROBERT ALLEN, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 20th Feb., 1868, and employed on irrign. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., March, 1871; on famine relief works in Bengal, 1873-74; member of accts. committee, Nov., 1888; suptg. engr., June, 1894.

CORNISH, ROBERT, M.A., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Lancing Coll., and Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1870, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine relief duty, 1874; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1882; mag. and collr., Dec., 1887; retd., Aug., 1895.

CORNISH, WILLIAM HENRY, Bengal Police Dept.—Joined the service, 21st Jan., 1859; served in the mil. dept., to May, 1863, when he joined the police dept. as asst. supt.; district supt., April, 1870; served in Assam, 1870-74, and 1879-83; asst. supt., May, 1896.

CORNISH, WILLIAM ROBERT, C.I.E., F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Gen., late Madras Med. Service.—Studied at St. George's Hosp. (scholar and prizeman); apptd. to the Madras med. service, April, 1854; served under the mil. dept., and also as civil surgn. of Coimbatore, 1857-58; sec. to the dir.-gen. of the med. dept., Oct., 1858, to Feb., 1870; Madras member and sec. to the commn. for the reorganization of med. estblts., 1865-66; sec. of Madras med. fund, 1864-70; sanitary commr., Madras, March, 1870, to April, 1880; during the famine of 1876-78, was specially engaged in organising a system of sanitary and med. inspection; supt. of Madras census, 1878; C.I.E., Jan., 1880; surgn.-gen. with the govt. of Madras, 1880-85; member of legisl. council, Madras, Dec., 1883; retd., April, 1885; fellow of Madras univ., Feb., 1867, and president of the med. faculty, 1880-85; hon. physician to the Queen; author of various contributions to the med. press, and of the Madras census report, 1873; was for some time editor of the 'Madras Quarterly Journal of Medical Science.'

CORNWALL, WILLIAM WOLFRAN GARDNER, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 17th Nov., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and asst. settlt. officer; mag. and collr., March, 1881; retd., Aug., 1887.

COSTELLO, CHARLES PETER, F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Col., late Bengal Med. Dept.—Joined the service as asst. surgn., 10th Feb., 1850; served in the Ambela campaign, 1863-64 (medal and clasp), the Jowaki expdn., 1877-78 (clasp), and the Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal); sanitary commr., Assam, Sept., 1888; principal med. officer and sanitary commr., Assam, June, 1892; retd., Jan., 1894.

COTGRAVE, THOMAS MANSON, Salt Dep., Bombay.—Joined the service as acting asst. commr. of customs, salt and opium, 30th Jan., 1866; opium inspr., Bombay, May, 1866; confd. as asst. commr., July, 1867; asst. collr., salt rev., Feb., 1874; dep. collr., April, 1890.

COTTON, SIR ARTHUR THOMAS, Kt., K.C.S.I., Gen., R.E.—Joined Addiscombe, 1818; arrived in Madras, Sept., 1821, as 2nd lieut. of engrs.; asst. to suptg. engr., tank dept., May, 1822; served with the Burmese expdn., 1824-26; from June, 1826, served as suptg. engr. in the tank dept., and in 1828 was apptd. to the charge of the Cauvery irrign., being also employed in the survey and improvement of the Paumbe pass; in 1844 was employed in carrying out the systematic irrign. of the Godavari delta; promoted to chief engr., 1852; in 1858 planned works for the irrign. of the Mahanadi delta; was afterwards employed under the govt. of Bengal, reporting upon water communication between the Ganges and Calcutta; resigned govt. service in 1862; in 1863, was employed under the Madras irrign. co., reporting on their works, and also inspecting the Ganges canal works, and proposed addl. works, which were afterwards carried out as the Lower Ganges canal; also projected works for the Sone irrign., which have since been partially executed; retd. from the army in 1877.

COTTON, HENRY JOHN STEADMAN, C.S.I., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Magdalen Coll. Sch., Brighton Coll., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 29th Oct., 1867; served in the Bengal rev. and jud. dept., and as offg. under sec. to govt. and offg. registrar, high court; asst. sec., govt. of Bengal, June, 1875; junr. sec., April, 1876; mag. and collr., Nov., 1878; offg. commr., Chittagong, 1879, and 1884; sec., board of rev., Jan., 1882; port commr., Calcutta, May, 1887; sec. to govt. of Bengal, finl. and municipal depts., May, 1890; member of Bengal legisl. council, June, 1892; chief sec. to govt., July, 1892; author of a
Memo. on the Rev. History of Chittagong,' 1880; 'Memo. on the Land Tenures of Bengal,' 1884; 'England and India,' 1883, and 'New India, or India in Transition,' 1885.

COTTON, JULIAN JAMES, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Sherborne Sch., and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 24th Dec., 1893, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.
