DUNLOP, ALEXANDER JOHNSTON, Berar Commn.—Apptd. asst. to cotton commr., Central Prov. and Berar, 1st May, 1869, and asst. commr., Feb., 1876; from 1859 to 1874 held charge in addn. to other duties of a govt. experimental farm; inspr.-gen., rev. dept., Nizam's govt., April, 1885, and survey and settlt. commr., Nizam's govt., April, 1887; rank of dep. commr., Berar, July, 1889.

DUNLOP-SMITH, JAMES ROBERT, M.A., Capt., Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 24th Oct., 1879; from March, 1883, served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; private sec. to lieut.-govr., Dec., 1883; asst. commr. and settlt. collr., April, 1888; dep. commr., April, 1895.

DUNN, GEORGE OWEN WILLIAM, Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1876, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., April, 1886; under sec. to govt., public works dept., May, 1894.

DUPERNEX, HUBERT EMILE LEOCE PAUL, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch. and Caius Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 31st Oct., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; author of 'The Enhanced Excise Duties' and 'Tenancies in Oudh.'

DURAND, ALGERNON GEORGE ARNOLD, C.B., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C.—First commn., 21st Dec., 1872; served in the Afghan war, 1879–80 (medal with clasp, and bronze star); A.D.C. to the viceroy, 1881–82; on special duty on N.W. frontier, 1888; British agent, Gilgit, July, 1889; in 1891 commanded Hunza-Nagarfield force (medal with clasp; C.B.); mil. sec. to viceroy, Jan., 1894.
DURAND, Sir Edward Law, Bart., C.B., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 10th Oct., 1865; arrived, June, 1866; served with the 96th regt., and was transd. to Bengal staff corps, Oct., 1868; A.D.C. and private sec. to lieut.-govr. of the Punjab, June, 1870; from Feb., 1871, served in the foreign dept. in Rajputana and Central India; acting pol. agent, Manipur, Feb.-Oct., 1877; acting asst. rest., Bushire, April, 1878; in charge of ex-Amir of Kabul, March, 1881; asst. commr., Afghan boundary commn., Oct., 1885; rest., Nepal, May, 1889; retd., Oct., 1893; author of 'Report on Fars and Sketch Map of part of the Country,' and 'Report on Pearl Fisheries.'

DURAND, Sir Henry Mortimer, K.C.S.I., K.C.I.E., B.L., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Blackheath Proprietary Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 3rd March, 1873, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine duty, 1873; from June, 1874, served in the foreign dept. of the govt. of India, and was apptd. offg. 1st asst. to the govr.-gen.'s agent, Rajputana, July, 1876; offg. asst. sec., foreign dept., Nov., 1877; pol. sec. to major-gen. Sir F. Roberts with the Kabul field force, Sept., 1879 (medal and two clasps); under sec., foreign dept., March, 1880; C.S.I., Feb., 1881; offg. private sec. to the viceroy, June, 1880; sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., Feb., 1885; K.C.I.E., Jan., 1889; sent on a special mission to Afghanistan, Aug., 1893; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1894; envoy and minister plenipotentiary in Persia, May, 1894; has publ. a work on the first Afghan war, 1871, and a life of Sir H. M. Durand, 1883.

Durrant, William Scott, M.A., Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Whitgift, and Lycée St. Omer; B.A., London (with honours in French), 1888; M.A. (Classics), 1891; junr. clerk, India office, 18th Sept., 1879.

Duthoit, William, D.C.L., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Exeter Coll., Oxford; called to the bar at the Inner Temple; apptd. after exam. of 1857; arrived, 17th Dec., 1857; served from Sept., 1858, in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and dep. supt., family domains, Maharaja of Benares; offg. inspr.-gen. of registrn. and commr. of excise and stamps, March, 1875; mag. and collr., Shahjahanpur, April, 1877; offg. puisne judge, high court, June, 1881; district and sessions judge, Aug., 1881; offg. jud. commr., Oudh, May, 1882; employed on the opium commn., under govt. of Bengal, 1883; jud. commr. of Oudh, March, 1884; retd., Aug., 1886.

Dutt, Russick Lall, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1872; served in the civil dept. from 30th Nov., 1872, in acting appts., and as civil surgn. at various stations.

Dymott, Donald Frederick, M.B., Surgn.-Major, Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1880; asst. physician, gen. hosp., July, 1884; rest. physician, March, 1885; inspr. of vaccn., and dep. sanitary commr., June, 1888; reverted to mil. dept., Dec., 1893; acting med. and sanitary officer, Salem, Oct., 1894; offg. jail supt., Feb., 1895; acting surgn., 2nd district, May, 1895.

Dyson, Herbert Jekyl, F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Capt., Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 1st April, 1885; acted as civil surgn. in various stations from Jan., 1889; acting dep. sanitary commr., Panjab., Nov., 1889; confd., Oct., 1889, sanitary commr., Bengal, Aug., 1895.

Dyson, John, late Oudh Commn.—Joined the service, 8th June, 1858, as dep. mag. and dep. collr. in Bengal; from Dec., 1861, served in Oudh as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; small cause court judge, Lucknow, 1869; district judge, Faizabad, Aug., 1886; offg. commr., Sept., 1886; offg. jud. commr., Oudh, Aug., 1889; addl. jud. commr., July, 1890; retd., March, 1891.

Eades, Frederick Talbot, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 22nd Jan., 1875; staff clerk, July, 1896.

Eales, Charles Lindstedt Modellier, B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 4th Dec., 1878, and served in Oudh as asst. commr.; joint mag., Nov., 1887; small cause court judge, March, 1893; district and sessions judge, Aug., 1893.

Eales, Herbert Lovely, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 30th Oct., 1879, and served in British Burma as asst. commr.; on special duty in Upper Burma, Dec., 1885; dep. commr., May, 1888; offg. sec. to chief commr., April-May, 1890; supt. of prov. census, 1890-92; offd. as prest. Rangoon municipality, April, 1896.

Eardley-Wilmot, Saint-Hill, India Forest Dept.—Joined the service, 27th Sept., 1873, as asst. conservator in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; dep. conservator, Nov., 1883; conservator, Oct., 1891.

Earle, Archdale, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Uppingham, and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 18th Dec., 1882, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; offg. private sec. to the lieut.-govr., Feb., 1886; offg. under sec. to govt., jud., &c., depts., Feb., 1889; joint mag. and dep. collr., Jan., 1891; mag. and collr., Jan., 1895.

East, William Albert, M.A., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 26th Nov., 1863, and served in Bombay as asst. registrar, dep. registrar and sealer of the high court, and asst. collr. and mag.; supt. of Panchganj, Nov., 1876; junr. collr. and mag. and pol. agent, Dharwar, June, 1881; senr. collr., June, 1885; retd., May, 1891.

Ebden, Edward James, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Queen Elizabeth's Sch., Ipswich, and Caius Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 6th Dec., 1867, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; from Sept., 1872, served in the forest dept. as acting dep. conservator; on famine duty, Dharwar, 1877, and in Mysore, 1877-78; from July, 1878, served as asst. collr., railway mag., and forest settlt. officer; first asst., Aug., 1881; junr. collr. and mag., June, 1888; senr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1890.

Edgar, Sir John Ware, K.C.I.E., C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 2nd Feb., 1862, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; served in Cachar from Dec., 1863, as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; on special duty with the Lushai expdn., 1871; mag. and collr., Shahabad, Feb., 1878; commr. of Chittagong, Dec., 1885; chief sec. to govt. of Bengal, Aug., 1887; K.C.I.E., May, 1889;
member of gov.r.-gen.'s legisl. council, Jan., 1892; retd., July, 1892.

EDGE, Sir John, Kt., Q.C., B.A., LL.B., LL.D. (hon.), B.L., Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; called to the bar, Middle Temple, 1866; Q.C., 1886; went the northern and north-eastern circuit, and was apptd. chief justice, N.W. Prov., Aug., 1886; vice-chancellor, Allahabad univ., 1887-93.

EDGELL, William, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at St. Peter's Coll., Radley; writer, India office, 1st July, 1869; temporarily employed as shipping inspr. of railway stores, Jan., 1872; receiver of wharf stores, Jan., 1873; supervisor, 2nd grade, March, 1877; 1st grade, June, 1886.

EDGERLEY, Steynning William, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Shrewsbury, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 29th Nov., 1879, and served as asst. collr. and mag.; from May, 1881, served in acting appts. in Sind; and asst. collr. in Sind, 1885 and 1886; under sec. to govt. of India, home dept., Oct.-Dec., 1888; private sec. to the govt. of Bombay, March, 1889, to July, 1895; C.I.E., May, 1895; jun. collr. and mag., July, 1896; joint compiler of a manual of village accts. for Sind, 1887, which he also transld. into Sindhi.

EDGINGTON, Arthur, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Charterhouse and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 21st Dec., 1894, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

EDMONSTONE-MONTGOMERIE, Charles Waterton, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Copenhagen and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 7th Dec., 1887, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; offd. as dep. commr. from June, 1896.

EDWARDES, Stephen Meredyth.—Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Eton and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1895, and served in Bombay.

EDWARDS, Alfred Clarke, M.A., B.L., Bengal Educl. Service.—Educ. at Lincoln Coll., Oxford; apptd., 24th April, 1878; arrived, 28th Sept., 1878, and served as profr. in the presidency coll. and principal, Rajshahye coll.; principal, Dacca coll., Nov., 1887.

EDWARDS, Thomas Cecil, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch., Univ. Coll., London, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 29th Dec., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

EGERTON, Francis William, Major, I.S.C., Punjab Commn.—Joined the service, Aug., 1873; was in mil. employ till April, 1879; served in Punjab as asst. commr. from April, 1879; dep. commr., June, 1894.

EGERTON, Sir Robert Eyles, K.C.S.I., C.I.E., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at the Edinburgh Acad., and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. from Haileybury, in 1850; served in the Punjab as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. settlt. officer, and was in charge of the Lahore settlt., 1854-58; dep. commr., 1856; addl. commr., Peshawar, Nov., 1863; commr., Nagpur, Central Prov., March, 1864; offd. as jud. commr., Central Prov., at various times from 1865 to 1867; finl. commr. of the Punjab, March, 1868; addl. member, govt.-gen.'s council, 1871, and again in 1872 and 1877; lieut.-govr. of the Punjab, April, 1877, to April, 1882, when he retired from the service.

EGERTON, William, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Rossall Sch., and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 5th Dec., 1890, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec. to govt., finl., &c., depts., April, 1895.

ELGIN AND KINCARDINE (Earl of), Right Hon. Victor Alexander Bruce, P.C., LL.D., G.M.S.I., G.M.I.E.—Born, 16th May, 1849; succeeded his father (viceroy and govt.-gen. of India, 1862-63) in the earldom in 1863; educ. at Eton, and Balliol Coll., Oxford (M.A., 1877); received the hon. degree of LL.D. from the Univ. of St. Andrews in 1886; was treasurer of Her Majesty's household and first commr. of works in Mr. Gladstone's third administration (1886); sworn of the privy council, Feb., 1886; apptd. lord lieut. of Fifeshire, Aug., 1886; and is also a univ. commr. for Scotland; assumed office as viceroy and govt.-gen. of India, 27th Jan., 1894.

ELIAS, Nev, C.I.E., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Extra attaché, foreign dept., March, 1874; second in command, Yunan expdn., and asst. to rest., Mandalay, Sept., 1874; offg. pol. agent, Bhamo, April-Aug., 1875, in addn. to other duties; extra attaché, foreign dept., Oct., 1875; from Oct., 1877, served as joint commr. of Ladakh; on special duty to Yarkand, 1879; and to Kashgar, 1880; pol. agent with the Kashgar mission, May, 1885; C.I.E., Jan., 1888; boundary settlt. officer, Jaipur, 1887-88; asst. agent, Rajputana, March, 1888; on special duty in connection with Sikkim expdn., Nov., 1888; British commr., Anglo-Siamese boundary commn., Oct., 1889; agent to the govt.-gen. in Khorassan and Seistan, Dec., 1891; has publd. the 'Tarikh-i-Rashidi,' 1895.

ELIOT, John, C.I.E., M.A., F.R.S., Meteorological Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the service, June, 1869; from 27th Dec., 1869, to Feb., 1876, served in the N.W. Prov. as profr. at Thomason and Muir colls., supt. of the meteorological observatory, Allahabad, and meteorological reporter to govt.; from Feb., 1876, served in Bengal, as profr., presidency coll., and meteorological reporter; meteorological reporter to govt. of India, May, 1880; C.I.E., Jan., 1897.

ELLIOTT, Lawrence Edward, Capt., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—First commr., Aug., 1880; employed in Burma as asst. commr., July, 1886; offg. supt., N. Shan states, July-Nov., 1890; and from May, 1894; dep. commr., Jan., 1896.

ELLENOR, Thomas Ralph, Acctnt.—Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, and class, 17th Feb., 1872.

ELLERCAMP, Herbert McDonald, Acctnt.—Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, Oct., 10th 1879.

ELLIOT, Frederick Augustus Hugh, C.I.E., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Harrow, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 21st Nov., 1870, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; from June, 1873, to Nov., 1875, served in Berar as educ. inspr., and acting dir. of public instrn.; principal of the Raja's sch., and tutor and govt. of the Gaekwar of Baroda, Dec., 1875; C.I.E., May, 1883; on duty to England with the Gaekwar of Baroda, 1884; survey and settlt. officer, Baroda, March, 1890; retd., June, 1896.
ELLIOT, FREDERICK EDEN, late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1858; arrived, 16th March, 1858; served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as ass't. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., April, 1877; district and sessions judge, March, 1881; retd., March, 1894.

ELLIOTT, ALGERNON, Berar Commn.—Educ. at Repton Sch.; joined the service, 16th March, 1869, as acting ass't. district supt. of police, Central Prov., transf'd. to Berar as acting ass't. commr., June, 1869; conf'd., April, 1874; dep. commr., July, 1889; civil and sess. judge, Oct., 1895.

ELLIOTT, SIR CHARLES ALFRED, K.C.S.I., LL.B., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1856; arrived, 30th Nov., 1856, and served in the N.W. Prov. as ass't. mag. and collr., and joint mag., and in Oudh as ass't. commr.; from Feb., 1863, to Oct., 1866, served in the Central Prov. as settl. officer, Hoshangabad; served subsequently as settl. officer, Farakhabad, and as sec. to govt., N.W. Prov., 1870-77; commr., Meerut, Oct., 1877; famine commr., Mysore, Sept., 1877; addl. sec. to govt. of India, famine branch, May, 1878; sec. to famine commr., June, 1878; census commr., Oct., 1880; chief commr. of Assam, March, 1881; pres't. of the public expenditure committee, Feb., 1886; K.C.S.I., Feb., 1887; ordinary member of govr.-gen.'s council, Dec., 1887; lieut.-govr. of Bengal, Dec., 1890, to Dec., 1895; author of 'Chronicles of Unao' and of the reports of the famine commn., 1879, and finance commn., 1887.

ELLIS, LOYES EDWARD, India Audit Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 25th Sept., 1894.

ELLISON, THOMAS EDWARD, late Bengai C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at St. Andrew's Coll., Bradford; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 19th Oct., 1864; asst. commr., Delhi, Aug., 1865; transf'd. to Central Prov., Oct., 1868; judge, small cause court, Nagpur, Sept., 1883; dep. commr., Nov., 1884; retd., Dec., 1890.

ELPHINSTONE, GRAHAM WARBURTON, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Eton and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived in Madras, 19th Nov., 1887, and served as ass't. collr. and mag.; head asst., July, 1894.

ELSMIE, GEORGE ROBERT, C.S.I., B.L., late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 12th Feb., 1878, and was apptd. ass't. commr., Punjab; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, Oct., 1868; dep. commr., May, 1870; from 1871 to 1877 offd. as addl. commr.; civil and sessions judge, March, 1877; commr. and supt., Lahore, 1880-82, and 1885-87; judge, chief court, Punjab, 1882-85; 2nd finl. commr., May, 1887; also member of govr.-gen.'s legisl. council, 1888; 1st finl. commr., March, 1889; on special duty at Rawal Pindi durbar, March, 1885; C.S.I., Jan., 1893; retd., Feb., 1893; author of 'Notes on Peshawur Crime.'

ELSTON, JOSEPH, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd. apprentice engr., 16th Oct., 1871, and posted to state railways; asst. engr., Sept., 1872; exec. engr., May, 1883.

ELWES, VEN. WILLIAM WESTON, M.A., Ecclesl. Dept., Madras.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. junr. chaplain, 20th Oct., 1870; domestic chaplain to bishop, June, 1874; senr. chaplain, Oct., 1880; archdeacon of Madras, April, 1893.

ELWIN, EDGAR ALFRED, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Dover Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 7th Nov., 1883, and served in Madras as ass't. collr. and mag.; manager, Jaipur estate, July-Oct., 1890; senr. ass't. collr., Vizagapatam, Feb., 1891; sub-collr. and joint mag., June, 1896.

ELWIN, ERNEST BARNES, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Dover Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 5th Jan., 1891, and served as ass't. collr. and mag.

EMERSON, THOMAS, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Clongowes Wood Coll., the Royal Univ. of Ireland, and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 23rd Dec., 1894, and served in Bengal as ass't. mag. and collr.

ENGLISH, ALEXANDER EMANUEL, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Rugby, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 15th Nov., 1892, and served in Burma as ass't. commr.

ENTHOVEN, REGINALD EDWARD, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Wellington Coll. and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 1st Dec., 1889, and served in Bombay as ass't. collr. and mag., and inspr. of factories; 2nd ass't., June, 1896.

ERSKINE, GEORGE ELPHINSTONE, Col., late Kumaun Commn.—Arrived, as cornet, Bombay light cavalry, 9th Dec., 1857; employed under the mil. dept., including service with the Rajputana field force, till Feb., 1863, when he joined the Oudh commn. as ass't. commr.; ass't. settl. officer, May, 1865; personal ass't. to chief commr., Oudh, July, 1871, to April, 1878; offg. sec. to chief commr., May to Aug., 1876; sec. to govt. of N.W. Prov. in forest branch, and Oudh rev. dept., April, 1878; commr., Jan., 1882; on special duty to inquire into condition of tenantry in Oudh, 1882-83; wrote a report on that subject, and a digest of Oudh rev. circulars; reverted to mil. dept., Nov., 1895.

ESTCOURT, ERNEST ALFRED, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll. and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 29th Dec., 1894, and served in the Punjab as ass't. commr.

ETESON, ALFRED, M.D., Dep. Surgn.—Gen., late Med. Dept., Assam.—Joined the Indian med. dept. as ass't. surgn., May, 1854; arrived, 30th June, 1854; held various mil. med. charges (medal for services during the Mutiny); sec. to surgn.-gen., Indian med. dept., March, 1879; dep. surgn.-gen., eastern frontier district, and sanitary commr., Assam, Jan., 1884; retd., Jan., 1889.

EUAN-SMITH, SIR CHARLES BEAN, K.C.B., C.S.I., D.C.L., Col.—Ensign, Madras infantry, March, 1859; served in Abyssinian expdn., 1867-68 (medal); sec. to Sir F. Goldsmid's mission to Persia, 1870-72; C.S.I., Nov., 1872; private sec. to Sir Bartle Frere, on special mission to Zanzibar and Muscat, 1872-73; on special duty in India office, 1873-74; pol. agent and consul-gen., Zanzibar, May, 1875; on special duty, foreign dept., on occasion of Prince of Wales's visit to Calcutta, 1875; first ass't. rest., Haidarabad, March, 1876; pol. agent, and consul-gen., Muscat, July, 1879; during the Afghan war, 1879-80, was on special pol. duty on the staff of Lieut.-Gen. Sir D. Stewart, and subsequently
with Gen. Hill's divn., and with the Kabul-Kandahar force under Gen. Roberts (medal with two clasps, and bronze star); acted as rest, Mewar, in 1882 and 1884; asst. pol. agent, Banswara, Dec., 1882; from May, 1883, served as addl. pol. agent, Bhartpur and Karauli; apptd. consul-gen. at Zanzibar, 1888; retd. from the army, March, 1889; K.C.B., Nov., 1890; envoy extraordinary and minister plenipotentiary at Tangiers, 1891-93; hon. D.C.L., Oxford, 1893.

EVANS, CHARLES THOMAS, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; from Aug., 1860, served in subord. offices; apptd. to the dept., Sept., 1869, as asst. engr., and employed on irrig. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., June, 1876.

EVANS, ERNEST SYDNEY, India Audit Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 11th March, 1895.

EVANS, HENRY FARRINGTON, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll., and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., settlt. officer; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1880; special judge, Jhansi, July, 1882; joint mag., 1st grade, Oct., 1882; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1887; on special duty in Madras and Bombay, 1890-91, and as member of Deccan agriculturists relief commn., 1891-92; offg. jud. commr., Oudh, May-July, 1893; commr. and agent, Benares, Dec., 1893; commr., Agra, Nov., 1895; offd. as sec. to govt. from April, 1896; author of Farukhabad and Agra settlt. reports, &c.

EVANS, LOFTUS GEORGE, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 13th Nov., 1876, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; joint mag., Sept., 1886; judge, small cause court, Allahabad, March, 1891; district and sessions judge, April, 1891.

EVANS-GORDON, WILLIAM EDEN, Maj., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 15th July, 1876; from Feb., 1883, served under the foreign dept. with the Central India horse; boundary settlt. officer, Central India, 1883-84; attache, foreign dept., Oct., 1885; also translr. of foreign European languages, Aug., 1887; asst. sec., Nov., 1887; pol. officer in charge of Sardar Ayub Khan, March, 1888; asst. rest., Kashmir, Nov., 1890; joint commr., Ladakh, March, 1890; pol. officer in attendance on the Gaekwar in Europe, 1894; offg. pol. agent, Jhalawar, March, 1895.

EVERETT, STEPHEN HENRY, India Audit Office.—Educ. at Dulwich Coll.; writer, India office, May, 1872; junr. examr., India audit office, Dec., 1873; designation changed to junr. clerk, Oct., 1892.

EVERS, BENJAMIN, M.D., C.M., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Med. Dept., Central Prov.—Joined the service, April, 1868; arrived, 27th Oct., 1868; served as civil surgm. and supt. of jail at various stations from April, 1876; retd., April, 1896.

EWART, CHARLES HENRY, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Punjab.—First commn., 20th Feb., 1857; arrived, 2nd April, 1857; from Feb., 1861, served in the police dept., Punjab, as district supt., and dep. inspr.-gen.; inspr.-gen., and under sec. to govt., police dept., Aug., 1892; reverted to mil. dept., Dec., 1894.

EWBANK, ALFRED LLOYD VANDYKE, M.A., Educn. Dept., Bengal.—Apptd., 16th Jan., 1868; arrived, 28th Feb., 1868, and served as prof., Patna coll., and principal, Dacca coll.; prof., Patna coll., Oct., 1879; principal, Oct., 1881.

EYRE, GERVAS SELWYN, B.L., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—First commn., 12th June, 1869; served in mil. dept. until July, 1879, when he was apptd. asst. commr. in Burma; on duty with the Burma field force, 1887; and with the force operating against the Chins, 1888; dep. commr., May, 1888; offg. inspr.-gen. of police, 1893, and from March, 1894; royal humane society's medal for saving lives of two brother officers.

EZECHIEL, JOSEPH ALOYSIUS, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 25th Nov., 1892, and served in Assam as asst. commr.

FAGAN, PATRICK JAMES, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Blundell's Sch., Tiverton, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 26th Nov., 1887, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; settlt. officer, Bikaniir, 1892-93.

FAICHNIE, ALEXANDER GEORGE, late Postal Dept., Central Prov.—Joined the service, 1st May, 1858; served for some time as supt. of the Rawal Pindi mil. horse van and bullock train; dep. postmr.-gen., Central Prov. and Berar, Nov., 1879; retd., 1894.

FAIRWEATHER, JAMES, M.D., Dep. Surgn.-Gen., late Med. Dept., Punjab.—Arrived, 20th March, 1856; in civil charge of Rawal Pindi and its jail, April, 1869; civil surgm. at Gurdaspur, April, 1874, and subsequently at other stations in the Punjab; offd. as sanitary commr., surgn.-gen., Punjab, and inspr.-gen. of prisons; also acted for various periods as med. adviser to the Maharaja of Patiala; retd., 1886; author of several papers on professional subjects.

FANSHAWE, ARTHUR UPRON, C.S.I., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Repton; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, Nov., 1871, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., and inspr.-gen. of registrn.; asst. sec. to the chief commr., July, 1880; in charge of model farm, Nagpur, 1880-81; from April, 1881, served in the postal dept.; postmr.-gen., Bombay, March, 1882; offg. sec. to govt. of India, fin. and commerce dept., Dec., 1888; on special duty under home dept., Jan., 1889; dir.-gen. of the post office of India, May, 1889; member of the royal commn. on opium, 1893-95; C.S.I., Jan., 1896.

FANSHAWE, HERBERT CHARLES, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Bedford, Tonbridge, and Repton; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 6th Nov., 1873, and was apptd. asst. commr. in the Punjab; on famine duty in Bengal, 1874; offg. settlt. officer, Rohtak, 1875-76 and 1877; asst. to the officer on special duty in Kashmir, June to Sept., 1879; junr. sec. to govt., Punjab, Nov., 1888; rev. sec., March, 1890; offd. for various periods as chief sec.; dep. commr., April, 1892; chief sec. to govt., Punjab, Sept., 1895; author of the Rohtak settlt. report, and 'Punjab Famine Code.'

FARDUNJI KUVARJI TARAPURVALLA, B.A., L.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service 28th March, 1876, and served as asst. engr.; exec. engr., March, 1888.

FARMER, HENRY RICHARD, late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Loughborough, Broms-
grove, and Uppingham Gr. Schs.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 4th Dec., 1868, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; district and sessions Judge, Dec., 1887; retd., June, 1896.

FARQUHAR, WILLIAM, M.D., Dep. Surgn.-Gen., late Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 28th May, 1853; arrived, 31st Dec., 1858, and served under the mil. dept. in Madras, Burma, and the Straits Settlements; also held civil med. charge, Tounghoo, in 1859; med. officer, Utakamand, Nov., 1882; dep. surgn.-gen., Belgaum and W. districts, July, 1885; retd., July, 1890.

FARRAN, Sir CHARLES FREDERICK, Kt., B.L., Bombay, High Court.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; called to the bar (Middle Temple), 1864; served as reporter, high court, Bombay, 1868-74; clerk of the crown, May, 1880; acting advocate gen., Bombay, May-Dec., 1884; acted as addl. judge of the high court, Bombay, Nov., 1886, to Nov., 1887; apptd. judge of the high court, April, 1890; chief justice, July, 1895; Kt., Jan., 1896.

FARRAN, G. H., M.A., Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Served from 17th May, 1866, as head asst. in the prothonotary's office, high court, Bombay; dep. registrar, commr. for taking affidavits, and judge's clerk, Nov., 1873; asst. commr. for taking accts. and asst. taxing master, July, 1876; master and registrar in equity, commr. for taking accts., and taxing officer, Sept., 1893.

FARRELL, GEORGE, C.B., Dep. Surgn.-Gen., late Punjab Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 4th Aug., 1856; dep. surgn.-gen., Sept., 1886; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., Punjab, March, 1889; hon. surgn. to the viceroy, 1888-89; retd., Sept., 1891.

FARRER, HENRY, Indian C.S.—Educ. at Heversham Gr. Sch., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 15th Nov., 1875, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; postmr.-gen., Madras, June, 1886.

FAULDER, CECIL JOSEPH SALKELD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Harrow; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 9th Dec., 1876, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Dec., 1887; mag. and collr., March, 1892.

FAUNTHORPE, JOHN CHAMPION, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Rossall Sch. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 26th Oct., 1892, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and offg. under sec.

FAWCETT, CHARLES GORDON HILL, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Harrow and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 9th Nov., 1890, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

FAYRER, SIR JOSEPH, Bart., K.C.S.I., LL.D., M.D., F.R.S., F.R.C.P., F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Gen.—Acting asst. surgn., R.N., Aug., 1847; asst. surgn., royal artillery, 1849; joined the East India Company's service, April, 1850, and served under the mil. dept., also holding civil surgncy. of Cherra Punji, 1850; served in the Burma campaign, and offd. as civil surgn., Rangoon, 1853; apptd. residency surgn., Lucknow, by Lord Dalhousie, for services during war in Burma; hon. asst. rest. at Lucknow, Sept., 1854; civil surgn., Lucknow, March, 1856; brevet rank of surgn. for services in defence of Lucknow residency during the siege, Sept., 1858; profr. of surgery and surgn. of med. coll. hosp., Calcutta, June, 1860; med. charge of Mysore princes, June, 1860; fellow of univ. of Calcutta, March, 1861, and served for two years as prest. of the med. faculty; prest. of the Asiatic Society of Bengal, 1867; offg. surgn. to viceroy, 1869; accompanied H.R.H. the Duke of Edinburgh in his tour through India, 1870; hon. physician to the Queen, July, 1871; accompanied H.R.H. the Prince of Wales to India, 1875-76, in med. charge of his party; retd., 1874; prest. of med. board, India office, 1874-95; also member of army sanitary commn. and of senate of army med.sch. at Netley; bart., Jan., 1896; author of 'Clinical Surgery in India'; 'Clinical and Pathological Observations in India'; 'Thanatophidia of India,' and other works.

FELL, GEORGE BUTLER HUNTER, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Eton and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 7th Dec., 1895, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

FENNER, HENRY ALGERNON SHRAPNEL, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 20th June, 1861; exec. engr., Sept., 1868; suptg. engr., March, 1887; offg. chief engr. and joint sec. to govt. of the Punjab, Jan.-Feb., 1892; retd., May, 1893.

FENTON, LAYARD LIVINGSTONE, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Bombay Pol. Dept.—Joined the service, 8th Jan., 1870, and after serving under the mil. dept. was transf'd. to the rev. survey dept. as asst. supt., Nov., 1873; asst. to pol. agent, Kathiawar, March, 1880; supt. of surveys under the rajasthanik court, Dec., 1890; prest. rajasthanik court, April, 1896.

FENTON, MICHAEL WILLIAM, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the Royal Sch., Armagh, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 18th Nov., 1883, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; under sec. to govt., Oct., 1887, to Nov., 1891; senr. sec. to finl. commrs., July, 1892; author of 'Punjab Municipal Manual.'

FENTON, THOMAS CHARLES, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 22nd May, 1873; attached to the store dept. till Aug., 1879, and subsequently to the registry dept.

FERARD, HENRY CECIL, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Eton, and Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 17th Nov., 1885, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; joint mag., April, 1893.

FERARD, JOHN EDWARD, India Office.—Educ. at Eton, and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; upper divn. clerk, local govt. board, 2nd Feb., 1892; junr. clerk, India office, 7th April, 1893; private sec. to parly. under sec. of state, Feb., 1894.

FERET, CHARLES JAMES, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 22nd Jan., 1875.

FERGUSON, HENRY TANNER, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the public works dept. as locomotive supt., Rangoon and Irwadi valley railway, Oct., 1879; Punjab N. state railway, Aug., 1881; dep. locomotive supt., N.W. railway, Jan., 1886; E. Bengal railway, Oct., 1887; retd., 1888.

FERGUSSON, Rt. Hon. Sir James, Bart., G.C.S.I., K.C.M.G., C.I.E., M.P.—Born in 1832; educ. at Rugby, and Univ. Coll., Oxford;
entered the grenadier guards, and served in the Crimean campaign, 1854-55 (medal and three clasps); retd. from the army in 1855; M.P. for Ayrshire, 1854-57, and 1859-68, and for N.E. Manchester, from 1885; under sec. of state for India, June, 1866; under sec. for the home dept., July, 1867; govr. of S. Australia, 1868-73; govr. of New Zealand, 1873-74; govr. of Bombay, April, 1880, to March, 1885; parly. under sec. of state for foreign affairs, Aug., 1886; royal commr. for the Adelaide exhibn. of 1887; postmr.-gen., Sept., 1891, to Aug., 1892.

FERRAR, MICHAEL LLOYD, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Belfast Acadl. Instn., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 21st Jan., 1863, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf'd. to Oudh, Sept., 1865, as asst. commr.; from July, 1868, to April, 1875, served in the settlt. dept.; dep. commr., April, 1883; mag. and collr., March, 1884; commr. in Oudh, Aug., 1889; commr., Gorakhpur, July, 1891; author of Sitapur settlt. report, 1873; retd., April, 1896.

FERRIS, WILLIAM BUTLER, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Bombay Pol. Dept.—First commn., 18th Oct., 1869; in pol. employ from May, 1874; rest. and pol. agent, Somali coast, March, 1896.

FINCH, BENJAMIN TRAILL, Dir.-in-Chief, Indo-European Telegraph Dept., India Office.—Apptd. to the Indian telegraph dept., 5th Nov., 1857; transfd. to Indo-European telegraph dept. as dep. dir. of the Persian Gulf section, April, 1875; officially designated dir., March, 1884; in pol. charge, Makran coast, Aug., 1879; justice of the peace for Makran, Aug., 1880; dir.-in-chief, Indo-European telegraph dept., 1st April, 1893.

FFORDE, ARTHUR BROWNLOW, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch., and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 31st Oct., 1892, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr. and asst. mag. and collr.

FIDDIAN, WILLIAM, M.A., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Huddersfield Coll., Shrewsbury Gr. Sch., and St. Catherine's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 14th Nov., 1868, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine duty, May, 1874; offg. commr., Sundarbans, Jan., 1879; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1880; mag. and collr., April, 1886; retd., June, 1894.

FIELD, CHARLES DICKENSON, M.A., LL.D., B.L., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 11th Oct., 1860; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and registrar, high court; from Dec., 1870, served in the jud. dept.; district and sessions judge, Oct., 1879; member of provl. legisl. council, Dec., 1879; judge, high court, Oct., 1880; retd., Sept., 1886; author of 'Essays on Indian Topics,' 'Chronological Table of, and Index to, the Indian Statute Book,' and other legal works.

FIELD, GEORGE ALFRED, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Christ's Hosp.; supernumerary writer, 30th May, 1859; clerk in registry dept., Sept., 1860; employed in mil. dept., 1867; asst. to registrar, March, 1882.

FIELD, GEORGE MOYLE ROBERT, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 16th Oct., 1872, and employed on irrig. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Oct., 1881; services lent to Patiala state, 1887-93.

FILGATE, ALEXANDER JEROME, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., 1857; served in the China war, 1860 (medal and clasps); joined the Madras public works dept., Oct., 1863; dep. comptr., public works acct., July, 1865; dep. consulting engr. for railways, and examr. of acct., Feb., 1866; from March, 1867, served in the India public works dept. as asst. acctnt.-gen.; dep. acctnt.-gen., and under sec. to govt., March, 1872; acctnt.-gen. and dep. sec., Sept., 1881; member of fin. committee, 1886-87; retd., Oct., 1890.

FILGATE, TOWNLEY MACARTNEY, Registrn. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 1st March, 1867, and served as mil. sec. to govr. of Bombay, and registrar-gen. of assurances; from July, 1871, served as inspr.-gen. of registrn.; inspr.-gen. of prisons, in addn., April, 1887; also registrar-gen. of births, deaths, and marriages, Sept., 1888.

FINCH, CHARLES THOMAS, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 17th Feb., 1872.

FINK, WILLIAM ROBERT, High Court, Calcutta.—Joined the service, 12th April, 1869, as clerk to the chief justice; asst. registrar, and asst. to the clerk of the crown, June, 1875; chief clerk, Feb., 1885; 1st asst. or dep. registrar, June, 1896.

FINLAY, HERBERT BLAKEY, late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the High Sch. and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, Dec., 1865, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., settlt. officer, and joint mag. and dep. collr.; dep. commr., July, 1885; mag. and collr., Aug., 1885; offd. as commr. in 1887, 1891, and 1893; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1893; retd., March, 1896.

FINLAY, JAMES FAIRBAIRN, M.A., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Edinburgh Acad. and Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 17th Nov., 1875, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; transf'd. to fin. dept. of govt. of India, May, 1881, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, as offg. asst. and dep. acctnt.-gen.; asst. comptr.-gen., July, 1882; offg. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, June, 1886; dep. auditor-gen., Nov., 1887; under sec. to govt.of India, finl. dept., Nov., 1887; offg. acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Dec., 1887; dep. sec. to govt. of India, finl. dept., April, 1889; sec., May, 1892.

FINNEY, STEPHEN, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., Oct., 1874; asst. manager, N. Bengal state railway, May, 1881; and dep. manager, E. Bengal state railway, July, 1889; manager, Oct., 1892.

FINUCANE, MICHAEL, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at St. Munchin's Coll., Limerick, Limerick Acad. and Queen's Coll., Cork; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 11th Nov., 1872, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., manager, Raj Darbhanga, settlt. officer, and offg. under sec., &c.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Feb., 1884; dir., agric. dept., Dec., 1884; dir. of the dept. of land records and agric., March, 1888; in 1893 offd. as sec. to govt., and as sec., board of rev.; in 1894 acted as sec. to govt. of India, dept. of rev. and agric.; resumed his post as offg. sec. to rev. board, April, 1894; sec.
board of rev., April, 1896; edited the Bengal tenancy act of 1885.

FIREBRACE, FREDERICK, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Dec., 1861; joined the dept. as asst. engr., N.W. Prov., May, 1865; asst. principal, Rurki Coll., 1865-68; manager, Calcutta and S.E. railway, Feb., 1870; exec. engr., Sept., 1870; asst. dir. of state railways, March, 1875; manager, Rajputana state railway, Nov., 1876; on duty at Cooper's Hill Coll., 1878-79; under sec. to govt. of India, railway branch, Jan., 1880; suptg. engr., Feb., 1882; consulting engr. and joint sec. to govt. (railway branch), Bombay, Feb., 1887; chief engr., July, 1891; retd., Oct., 1894; author of 'Manual of Surveying.'

FISCHER, FRANCIS NORTON, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Fettes Coll., Edinburgh, and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 20th Dec., 1889, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

FISHER, CECIL, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Charterhouse and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 15th Dec., 1890, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

FISHER, FREDERICK HENRY, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Boston Gr. Sch., and Univ. of London; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 4th Dec., 1870, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; asst. supt. and small cause judge of Dehra Dun, March, 1879; on special duty in connection with the preparation of the 'N.W. Prov. Gazetteer,' Dec., 1881; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1885; retd., Aug., 1885.

FISHER, JOHN HADDEN, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Harrow Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 16th Nov., 1861; from June, 1863, served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., from Jan., 1872, served in the Central Prov. as dep. commr.; and from April, 1879, in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as joint mag. and dep. collr.: mag. and collr., April, 1880; retd., July, 1890.

FISHER, WILLIAM ROGERS, B.A., late Indian Forest Service.—Apptd. asst. conservator, 28th Sept., 1872; arrived, 16th Dec., 1872; dep. dir. of forest sch., Dehra Dun, April, 1881, and Feb., 1884; conservator and dir. of the sch., March, 1885; retd., Jan., 1893; asst. profr. of forestry, Cooper's Hill Coll., from Nov., 1890; editor of 'The Indian Forester;' and author of a transltn. of the 'Aménagement des Forêts.'

FITZGERALD, EDWARD AMBROSE, Brigade-Surgn., late Med. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establtn., 27th July, 1859; arrived, 27th Jan., 1860, and was employed under the mil. dept.; from Feb., 1868, served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as civil asst. surgn., civil surgn., and supt. of jail; retd., March, 1890.

FITZGERALD, SIR GERALD, K.C.M.G.—Educ. at St. Mary's Coll., Galway, and in France; apptd. to the late ordnance office, Aug., 1855; junr. clerk, war office, Jan., 1856, and estimate clerk, 1861-63; asst. commr. for the investigation of public works acts., India, Sept., 1863; offg. dep. comptr.-gen. of mil. expenditure, March, 1864; transf'd. to the finl. dept., India, Feb., 1868; personal asst. to finl. member of govr.-gen.'s council, July, 1869; asst. comptr.-gen., Aug., 1869; dep. acctnt.-gen., Madras, April, 1871; in charge of the office of acctnt.-gen., British Burma, Dec., 1871; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, Aug., 1872; and dep. comptr.-gen., Nov., 1876; served under the Egyptian govt. from Jan., 1877, and was apptd. dir.-gen. of acctts. in Egypt, Dec., 1878, and member of fin. committee, March, 1884; attached to the intelligence dept. for the mil. operations at Alexandria in 1882 (medal and bronze star); C.M.G. in 1880; 3rd class Osmanieh, 1880; 2nd class Medjidie, 1884; grand cordon Medjidie, 1885; acctnt.-gen. of the navy, June, 1885, and dep. asst. to the parly. and finl. sec., Nov., 1885; K.C.M.G., 1885; retd., Nov., 1896.

FITZGERALD, JAMES, Col., I.S.C., late Berar Commn.—Ensign, Bengal infantry, June, 1856; arrived, Sept., 1866; was employed under the mil. dept. up to 1862, including service in the Mutiny, 1857-59 (medal and clasp), and in the China war, 1860 (medal and two clasps); from Aug., 1862, served in the Haidarabad assigned districts as asst. commr., railway mag., and dep. commr.; retd., April, 1889.

FITZGERALD, JAMES RICHARD, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Uppingham Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 5th Nov., 1870, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; from Aug., 1875, served under the foreign dept., govt. of India, as asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakaiti dept., and asst. to rest., Haidarabad; held charge of the office of rest., May, 1882; from July, 1882, served in Ajmir, as asst. commr. and district mag.; first asst., govr.-gen.'s agent, Baluchistan, May, 1883; pol. agent, Oct., 1883; held charge of the agent's office in 1883-84, and of the Kalat pol. agency, 1884; from April, 1885, acted as 1st asst. and sec. for Berar, Haidarabad; retd., 1888.

FITZGERALD, PERCY SEYMOUR VESEY, Bombay Pol. Dept.—Joined the service, 17th June, 1871, and was employed in the Bombay rev. survey; apptd. asst. to the pol. agent, Kathiawar, June, 1878; asst. to the pol. agent, Kolhapur, Aug., 1884; resumed his appt. in Kathiawar, Oct., 1886; acting pol. agent, Mahi Kantha, in 1894, and from March, 1895.

FITZGERALD, SIR WILLIAM GERALD SEYMOUR VESEY, K.C.I.E., C.S.I., India Office.—Educ. at Harrow, and Oriel Coll., Oxford; called to the bar (Lincoln's Inn), 1865; private sec. to govr. of Bombay, 1867-72; pol. A.D.C. to the sec. of state for India, 14th Aug., 1874; C.S.I., Feb., 1887; K.C.I.E., Aug., 1887.

FITZMAURICE, JOHN DAY STOKES, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Royal Sch., Armagh, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, Jan., 1884, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settlt. officer; under-sec., pol., &c., depts., and sec. to council, July-Nov., 1892; 1st asst. collr., May, 1894; joint judge and sessions judge, July, 1895.

FITZPATRICK, Sir DENNIS, K.C.S.I., B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1883; served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and dep. commr., and small cause court judge, and was placed on special duty in England in connection with Begam Samru's case, March, 1869, and at Calcutta in the legisl. dept. of govt. of India, May, 1873; dep. sec. in that dept., 1874; sec. from 1877 to 1885; was also sec. to the govr.-gen.'s council; acted as judge of chief court, Punjab, in 1876-77, and as sec. to govt. of India, home
dept., Jan.-April, 1885; acting chief commr., Central Prov., Dec., 1885; C.S.I., Feb., 1887; member of the public service commn., 1887, and acting rest. in Mysore; chief commr. of Assam, Sept., 1887; rest. at Haidarabad, Aug., 1889; lieut.-govr. of the Punjab, 6th March, 1892; K.C.S.I., May, 1890.

FLEET, JOHN FAITHFULL, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 6th Dec., 1867, and served as asst. collr. and mag. and educ. inspr.; epigraphist to the govt. of India, Jan., 1883; junr. collr. and mag. and pol. agent, Sholapur, June, 1886; senr. collr., Nov., 1889; acting commr., Dec., 1891; commr. of customs, &c., Bombay, March, 1893.

FLEMING, ALLAN STOFFORD, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Harrow, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 13th Dec., 1882, and served in Burma as asst. commr., and offg. under sec.; dep. commr., April, 1890.

FLETCHER, WILLIAM MORRIS, late Rev. Survey Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 2nd June, 1865, and served in Bombay as asst. supt. of rev. survey; on famine duty, Nov., 1876; supt. of survey, Sept., 1879; acted as survey and settl. commr. in 1891 and 1892; retd., Nov., 1893.

FOLEY, BLANCHARD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Highgate Sch., and Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 14th Dec., 1893, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec. to govt. finl. dept., May, 1896.

FOORD, EDWARD ARCHIBALD, Major-Gen., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—Second lieut., Madras engrs., 6th Dec., 1842; arrived, July, 1844; asst. civil engr., Oct., 1846; adjutant of engrs., 1850-52; 1st class district engr. in S. Arcot and Tanjore, Dec., 1856; suptg. engr., Tanjore and Trichinopoli, May, 1863; inspgr. engr. for civil and mil. buildings, Madras, Dec., 1872; suptg. engr., Kistna and Nellore, June, 1874; dep. chief engr. and under sec. to govt., Dec., 1875; chief engr. and joint sec. to govt., buildings and roads branch, Feb., 1877; chief engr. and sec. to govt., public works dept., April, 1877; retd., Dec., 1878.

FOOTE, ROBERT BRUCE, F.G.S., late Geological Survey of India.—Apptd. asst. in the geological survey, and joined, 28th Sept., 1853; served in various districts of Madras, the Nizam's territory, and Bombay; joint charge of the survey collections, Vienna exhibn., 1873; dep. supt., June, 1881; fellow of Madras univ., 1884; designation changed to supt. of survey, Sept., 1885; offd. as dir. in 1887; retd., Oct., 1891; state geologist, Baroda, Oct., 1891; dir. geological dept., Mysore, Oct., 1894; author of contributions to the survey publns.

FORBES, ARTHUR, C.S.I., B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Sedbergh Sch., Yorkshire, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867; asst. mag. and collr., Bardwan, Dec., 1867; offg. dep. collr. of customs, Calcutta, Sept., 1873; also sec. to the central relief committee, Jan., 1874; asst. commr. in Assam, Nov., 1874, to May, 1876; joint mag. and dep. collr., May, 1878; junr. sec., board of rev., April, 1882; mag. and collr., May, 1887; offg. commr. of excise, March, 1890; commr., Patna, June, 1892; C.S.I., May, 1895.

FORBES, GEORGE FORREST GREENLAW, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 28th Nov., 1883, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; joint mag., Nov., 1889; dep. commr., Dec., 1895.

FORBES, GEORGE STUART, M.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Aberdeen Gr. Sch. and Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 16th Oct., 1872, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; from Sept., 1880, was employed as acting under sec. in the rev. dept., asst. sec., jud. and legisl. dept., and under sec. in the depts. under the chief sec.; from Jan., 1883, served under the govt. of India in the home dept. as offg. under sec., also in the foreign dept., on special duty, Dec., 1884, and as junr. under sec., Jan., 1885; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., March, 1887; acting rst asst. and sec. for Berar to the rest. at Haidarabad, Dec., 1887; sub-collr. and joint mag., Sept., 1888; district and sessions judge, April, 1890; collr. and mag., Jan., 1891; acted as rev. sec. in 1895.

FORBES, JOHN GREENLAW, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn. as lieut., 9th Dec., 1854; arrived, 1st Feb., 1857, and served during the Mutiny, 1857-58 (medal and three clasps); served in the public works dept., Punjab, from 21st June, 1858, as asst. engr. and exec. engr., and from July, 1863, in the N.W. Prov.; on special duty in Madras, Feb., 1867, reporting on the Kaveri, Krishna, and Godavari canals; supt. of irrign. works, Oudh, Dec., 1867; offg. chief engr. and sec. to chief commr., Oudh, 1872; from Nov., 1872, served as suptg. engr. in the irrign. branch in the N.W. Prov., the Punjab, and Bengal, and offd. as chief engr. and joint sec., irrign. branch, Bengal, 1877; suptg. engr. and sec. to rest., Haidarabad, Dec., 1879; chief engr. and joint sec., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, buildings and roads branch, April, 1881, and in the irrign. branch from Nov., 1881; sec. to govt., Nov., 1887; inspr.-gen. of irrign. and dep. sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., Dec., 1889; sec. in the same dept., Nov., 1890; retd., Aug., 1892.

FORBES, L. R., late Bengal Non-Regulation Commn.—Served in the jud. dept., Bengal, from March, 1864, and was apptd. asst. commr., May, 1875; dep. commr., Aug., 1887; retd., March, 1891.

FORBES, WILLIAM A., C.B., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Rugby and Haileybury Coll., from which he was apptd. in 1847; served in the N.W. Prov., Punjab, and Oudh, and as pol. officer throughout the Mutiny (medal with clasp for Lucknow); mag. and collr., Jaunpur, 1862; commr., Allahabad divn., 1872; retd., 1875.

FORD, ERNEST, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., and St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 6th Dec., 1890, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

FORD, WILLIAM, C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1842; arrived, 7th July,
1842; attached to the N.W. Prov., and served in the grades of asst. mag. and collr.; asst. commr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; on special duty in the Sikh states, April, 1846; asst. to the govr.-gen.'s agent, N.W. Frontier, May, 1846; served subsequently in the Punjab as asst. commr. and supt., cis-Sutlej territory; mag. and collr., Gurgaon, 1856; dep. commr., 1858; on special duty to Kashmir, 1860; commr. and supt., Hissar, Oct., 1864; Multan, March, 1865; in charge of the state of Bhawalpur, 1866; retd., 1869; author of a report on native govt. as contrasted with the English system.

FORDHAM, JOHN WILLIAM, late India Public Works.—Joined the dept. as asst. acctnt., July, 1859; asst. comptr., July, 1869; dep. comptr., Holkar and Nimach state railways, Dec., 1871; examr., Jan., 1880; retd., 1889.

FORREST, GEORGE WILLIAM, B.A., Dir. of Records, Govt. of India.—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Cambridge; joined the service, 10th Dec., 1872, as head master, Surat high sch.; profr. of mathematics, Deccan coll., July, 1879; acting census commr. for Bombay, 1882; on special duty in connection with the Bombay records, 1884-86; profr. of English history, Elphinstone coll., Aug., 1887; in addn., dir. of records, Bombay, April, 1888; profr. of English literature, Elphinstone coll., March, 1889; officer in charge of records of the govt. of India, and of the imperial library, March, 1891; in addn., officer in charge of patent office, Jan., 1894; author of 'Selections from Bombay State Papers,' 'Selections from the State Papers preserved in the Foreign Office of the Government of India, 1772-1785,' 'The Administration of Warren Hastings,' 'Selections from the State papers relating to the Indian Mutiny,' and 'The Administration of the Marquess of Lansdowne'; has also edited 'Selections from the Writings of Mountstuart Elphinstone.'

FORREST, HENRY TELFORD STONOR, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Plymouth Coll., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 26th Dec., 1893, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

FORRESTER, EDWARD ELLIS, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Marlborough and Brasenose Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 19th Dec., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

FORSYTH, WILLIAM, F.R.C.S., Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the service, 9th May, 1876, and served at various stations as civil med. officer; health officer, Calcutta, March, 1892.

FOSTER, HENRY FREDERICK EDWARD BERTON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Christ's Hospital, and Peterhouse, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 14th Dec., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

FOSTER, WILLIAM, B.A., Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 22nd Sept., 1882; B.A., London univ., 1888; editor, India Office List, 1891-95; in 1892 assisted in editing 'The Register of Letters, &c., of the E. India Co., 1600-19,' and in 1893 prepared a catalogue of the paintings, &c., in the India office.

FOSTER, WILLIAM SHIRUBSOLE, M.A., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1859; served in Madras from Nov., 1861, as asst. mag. and collr., and sub-collr.; fellow of univ. of Madras, April, 1873; collr. and mag. and pol. agent, Godavari, April, 1875; retd., 1885.

FOWLER, RIGHT HON. SIR HENRY HARLEY, G.C.S.I., M.P.—Born, 16th May, 1830; educ. at Woodhouse Grove Sch., and St. Saviour's Gr. Sch.; mayor of Wolverhampton, 1863, and first chairman of the Wolverhampton sch. board; dep. lieut. for Staffordshire; has represented Wolverhampton in parliament since 1880; under sec. of state, home dept., 1884-85; finl. sec. to the treasury, 1886; prest., local govt. board, Aug., 1892; sec. of state for India, March, 1894, to July, 1895; G.C.S.I., July, 1895.

FOWLER, JAMES TOWNSEND, late Educat. Dept., Madras.—Principal, govt. normal sch., Madras, 2nd Dec., 1855; fellow of Madras univ., Sept., 1857; on special duty suptg. formation of normal schools, May, 1858; from Jan., 1859, served as inspr. of schools; on special duty to Calcutta as member of the educ. committee, 1882-83; acting dir. of public instrn., Madras, April-June, 1883; retd., Dec., 1888.

FOWLER, WILFRID, Madras Salt Dept.—Entered the service, March, 1879, and served in the salt dept. as asst. collr. and asst. commr.; dep. commr., April, 1896.

FOX, CHARLES EDMUND, B.L., Jud. Dept., Burma.—Offd. as govt. advocate, British Burma, 1879-80, and 1884-85, and as addl. recorder, Rangoon, 1885-86, and 1888; apptd. govt. advocate, March, 1886.

FOX, CHARLES EDWARD, M.A., B.L., late Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Served from 9th Jan., 1866, as master and registrar in equity, commr. for taking accts. and local investigations, and taxing officer, high court, Bombay; retd., Aug., 1893.

FOX, FRANCIS WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Independent Coll., Taunton, and Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 20th Oct., 1873, and served in the Central Prov., and from March, 1877, in Burma, as asst. commr.; supt. of central jail, Maulmain, in 1877 and 1878; transf. to N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Dec., 1883, and served as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; judge of the small cause court, Allahabad, Jan., 1889; district and sessions judge, April, 1890.

FOX, GEORGE JAMES BUSCALL, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 6th July, 1877.

FOX, HARRY CROKER, Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 12th July, 1872, and posted to Haidarabad; exec. engr., Oct., 1875; employed temporarily in mill works dept., 1890-91, and in Burma, 1892-93; public works sec. to rest., Haidarabad, May, 1893; rank of suptg. engr., June, 1895.

FOX-STRANGWAYS, MAURICE WALTER, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Charterhouse, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 26th Nov., 1882, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and settl. officer; judge, small cause court, Jan., 1892; commr. of excise, March, 1892; dep. commr., April, 1892.

FOYSTER, GERALD MOWBRAY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Marlborough, and Jesus Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 18th Dec., 1895, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

FRANCIS, EDWARD BELCHAM, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Repton Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 9th Nov., 1872,
and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; on famine duty in Bengal, 1874; dep. commr., May, 1889; offg. dir. of land records and agric., Nov., 1892, to Dec., 1893.

FRANCIS, FREDERICK WILLIAM, Haidarabad Administration.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; joined the service, 15th Sept., 1873, as asst. supt., Bombay rev. survey; divl. inspr., land records and agric., Dharwar, May, 1891; dir. of land records and agric., Haidarabad, Aug., 1891.

FRANCIS, WALTER, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Repton and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 11th Nov., 1890, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

FRANKLIN, BENJAMIN, M.D., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Indian Med. Service.—First commn., April, 1860; arrived, 13th Nov., 1869; civil surgn. in Oudh, Dec., 1860; supt., central prison, Lucknow, July, 1876; on special duty with the viceroy, Dec., 1880; civil surgn. of Simla, Dec., 1881, to Nov., 1886; hon. surgn. to the viceroy, Jan., 1886; on special duty with the lieut.-govr. of the Punjab, Nov., 1886, to March, 1887; civil surgn. and supt. of lunatic asylum, Jabalpur, Oct., 1887; surgn. to the viceroy, Jan., 1894.

FRANKS, CHARLES NASH BAYLEY, Public Works Dept., India Office.—East India house writer, old establ., 19th Nov., 1856; junr. clerk, railway dept., India office, 1860; senr. clerk, Feb., 1875.

FRANKS, EDWARD, Mil. Dept., India Office.—East India house writer, old establ., 1st Sept., 1858; junr. clerk, finl. dept., India office, Dec., 1866; funds dept., 1867; senr. clerk, mil. dept., Aug., 1881.

FRASER, ALEXANDER, C.B., Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—2nd lieut., Bengal engrs., 8th Dec., 1843; joined the dept., Sept., 1850, as exec. engr., Lower Prov.; exec. engr., Arakan, 1853, and subsequently at Rangoon; garrison engr., presidency, Feb., 1856; under sec. to gov't. of India, public works dept., 1859; supt. of lighthouses, 1860; chief engr., Feb., 1862; offg. sec. to gov't. of Bengal, 1862; chief engr. and sec. to chief commr., British Burma, Aug., 1867; chief engr. and sec. to gov't. of N.W. Prov., May, 1871; sec. to gov't. of India in the public works dept., Jan., 1879, to Feb., 1882.

FRASER, ALEXANDER THOMAS, Col., R.E., late Madras Public Works Dept.—Arrived, 2nd March, 1860, and served from that date in the dept.; exec. engr., Oct., 1866; transfd. to Central Prov., Dec., 1866; and to Rajputana, June, 1867; posted to N.W. Prov., mil. works branch, April, 1872; served also in Jhansi and Mysore; returned to Madras, as exec. engr., March, 1881; acted as dep. chief engr. and under sec. to gov't., public works dept.; reverted to mil. dept., Aug., 1894; retd., June, 1895.

FRASER, ANDREW HENDERSON LEITH, C.S.I., M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at the Acad., Instn., and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 23rd Oct., 1871, and served in Central Prov. as asst. commr.; asst. sec. to the chief commr., April, 1877; commr. of excise, &c., Aug., 1881; junr. sec. to the chief commr., and dir. of agric., Feb., 1882; sec. to the chief commr., April, 1890; commr., Jan., 1891; member of hemp drugs commn., 1893-94; C.S.I., Jan., 1897.

FRASER, EDWARD ALEXANDER, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 13th Sept., 1864; served under the foreign dept. from July, 1874, as asst. rest. in the Persian Gulf, asst. to the agent to the gov'r.-gen. in Rajputana, asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakaiti, and asst. to rest., Haidarabad; 2nd asst. agent in Central India, May, 1878, to April, 1879; British joint commr., Ladakh, April, 1884; asst. sec. to gov't. of India, foreign dept., Nov., 1884; asst. rest. in Mysore, and sec. to the chief commr. of Coorg, April, 1885; addl. pol. agent, and guardian to the heir apparent of Jodhpur, Dec., 1886; 1st asst. to the agent to the gov'r.-gen. in Rajputana, and to the chief commr., Ajmir-Merwara, June, 1887; pol. agent, Alwar, Oct., 1891; acting pol. agent in Jhalawar, Jan., 1895; and in E. states of Rajputana, Feb., 1895; retd., Sept., 1896; has transl'd. the 'Tanszimat-I-Hasanah.'

FRASER, HENRY, Col., late Police Dept., Central Prov.—First commn., Madras cavalry 1854; arrived, 14th March, 1854; asst. to gen. supt., thagi and dakaiti dept., Nagpur, July, 1860; joint mag., Nagpur and Berars, Aug., 1861; from Nov., 1861, served in the police dept., Central Prov.; acted as inspr.-gen., July-Aug., 1868; 1st class district supt., Nov., 1885; reverted to mil. duty, 1890.

FRASER, HUGH, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Wellington Coll., and Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 15th Nov., 1874, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and asst. commr.; registrar of high court, N.W. Prov., April, 1889; dep. commr., March, 1892; mag. and collr., April, 1892.

FRASER, JAMES DENHOLM, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Christ's Hosp., and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 21st Dec., 1891, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

FRASER, STUART MITFORD, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Blundell's Sch., Tiverton, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 25th Nov., 1884, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; tutor and guardian to the Raja of Kholapur, the Chief of Kagal, and Kunvar Saheb of Bhaunagar, May, 1889, to April, 1894; 1st asst., Sept., 1895; tutor to Maharaja of Mysore, May, 1896.

FRASER, WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Glasgow Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 6th Dec., 1894, and served in Assam as asst. commr.

FRAZER, ROBERT WATSON, B.A., LL.B., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Rathmines Sch., Kingstown Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 7th Nov., 1877, and served as asst. collr. and mag., engr. and manager of the Parla Kimedi estate, and acting dep. dir. of rev. settl.; retd., 1886; author of 'Silent Gods and Sun-steeped Lands.'

FREMANTLE, SELWYN HOWE, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Eton and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 27th Nov., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., asst. settl. officer, and asst. commr., joint mag., Jan., 1896.
FRENCH, Francis Coope, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Marlborough and Eton, and at Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 20th Dec., 1889, and served in Assam as asst. commr.; and personal asst. to chief commr.; joint mag., March, 1896.

FRIZELLE, Joseph, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the Royal Sch., Dungannon, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 20th Dec., 1863, and served in the N.W. Prov., as asst. mag. and collr.; transfd. to Punjab, May, 1864, and served as asst. commr.; jud. asst., July, 1876; dep. commr., April, 1877; divil. judge, Nov., 1884; judge, chief court, Punjab, May, 1889.

FROST, Charles Evitt, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Kensington Gr. Sch., and abroad; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 31st Oct., 1870, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; second asst., Dec., 1884; first asst. collr., Aug., 1887; junr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1891; senr., June, 1894.

FRY, Henry James Wakely, B.A., Store Dept., India Office.—Junr. clerk, 18th Aug., 1873; B.A. (honours in logic and moral phil.), London univ., 1875; senr. clerk, July, 1896.

FRY, Thomas Duncan, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch. and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 1st Dec., 1889, and served as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; and asst., July, 1896.

FRYER, Sir Frederick William Richards, K.C.S.I., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at foreign schs., and at Bromsgrove Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 28th Nov., 1864, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settl. officer; jud. asst., April, 1877; on special duty with the Quetta field force, 1878, and 1879; dep. commr., Jan., 1882; offg. supt., Kapurthala state, May, 1883; commr. in Burma, Aug., 1886; finl. commr., Burma, June, 1888; C.S.I., May, 1890; retransfd. to Punjab, and apptd. commr. and supt., March, 1891; offg. chief commr., Burma, May, 1892, to May, 1894, when he returned to the Punjab as offg. finl. commr.; member of govrn.-gen.'s legislt. council, Dec., 1864; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1895; chief commr. of Burma, April, 1895; author of the Dera Ghazi Khan settl. report.

FRYER, William Herbert, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 25th July, 1892.

FULLER, Joseph Bampfylde, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (N.W.Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Marlborough; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 13th Nov., 1875; and served in the N.W. Prov., as asst. mag. and collr.; asst. dir. of agric. and commerce, Feb., 1878; transfd. to Central Prov., July, 1882; asst. sec. to chief commr., Aug., 1882; commr. of settlts. and agric., Oct., 1885; also junr. sec. to chief commr., April, 1890, to Dec., 1891; C.I.E., Jan., 1892; offg. commr., July-Oct., 1894; re-transfd. to the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as district and sessions judge, Jan., 1895; mag. and collr., March, 1895; author of 'A Primer of Agriculture,' 'Field and Garden Crops of the N.W. Prov. and Oudh,' 'The Central Prov. Settlt. Code,' 'Progress of the Central Prov., 1862-92,' &c.

FULLERTON, John Campbell, M.B., Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1874; med. officer, gen. hosp., Calcutta, 1874-75, and 1875-76; acting civil surgn., 1877 and 1878; served in the Afghan war, 1878-80; med. officer, Baluchistan agency, Aug., 1885; agency surgn., Quetta, and administrative med. officer for Baluchistan, April, 1891.

FULTON, Edmund McGildowny Hope, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Rugby; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 8th Nov., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., branch inspr.-gen. of registrn. and educ. inspr. in Sind, and agent for sardars in the Deccan; registrar of the high court, Bombay, Feb., 1881; judge and sessions judge, Feb., 1886; served in Lower Burma as jud. commr., May, 1891 to Nov., 1892; acted as judge of the high court, Bombay, 1892-93, 1894-95, and in 1896.

FURLONG, Malcolm, Col., I.S.C., late Burma Commn.—Joined the Madras army as ensign, and arrived, 16th Feb., 1857; served at the capture of Copul, 1858; and with the Bellary movable column, 1859 (medal); personal asst. to inspr.-gen. of police, Burma, June, 1865; served in the Burma commn. from Aug., 1867; dep. commr., May, 1884; prest., Maulmain municipal committee, Jan., 1885; reverted to mil. dept., 1891.

FURNIVALL, W. C., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., May, 1859, as suptg. engr. on the Delhi and Rewari railway; under sec. to govt. of India, railway branch, Oct., 1873; offg. dir. of railways, central system, and joint sec. to govt. of N.W. Prov., May, 1877; joint sec. and offg. chief engr., N.W. Prov., Jan., 1879; dir. of construction for state railways, March, 1880; chief engr., and sec. to chief commr., British Burma, Oct., 1880; services lent to the Bengal Central and Bengal and N.W. railway cos., May, 1883; Nizam's guaranteed railway co., March, 1884; retd., 1886.

GABBETT, Joseph Edward, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. 1st Oct., 1877, and posted as asst. engr. to state railways; exec. engr., July, 1892.

GABBETT, Poole Robert, Brigade-Surgn.—Lieut.-Col.—Joined the service in Oct., 1871, and served in Madras, in England (Woolwich), at Gibraltar, and in Egypt with expedy. force; surgn. to the govr. of Madras, Jan., 1891, to May, 1892; senr. medl. officer, Barbados.

GAFFNEY, John Burke, late Brigade-Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., Med. Dept., Central Prov.—Apptd. to the Indian med. service, 1st Oct., 1866, having previously served as asst. surgn., home service, 1864-65; was employed under the mil. dept., including service in the Nicobar expdn., 1867; house surgn., med. coll. hosp., Calcutta, March, 1868; from June, 1868, served in the Central Prov. as civil asst. surgn., civil surgn. and jail supt., &c.; retd., Oct., 1894.

GAHAN, Henry Herbert, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the dept., 18th Sept., 1873, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., May, 1883; services lent to Dhrolpur state, 1883-86; offg. dep. consulting engr. to govt. of India for railways, Lucknow, May, 1893; supt. of works, Wazirabad-Lyallpur state railway, Dec., 1894.

GAISFORD, Gilbert, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt.of India.—Joined the service, 22nd Feb., 1868; from May, 1870, served with
the Punjab frontier force, and took part in the Jowaki expedit., 1877-78 (medal), and the Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal); asst. supt. of levies in Baluchistan, April, 1883; asst. pol. officer on expedit. to Zobh, Sept., 1884; pol. agent and dep. commr., Quetta and Pishin, Feb., 1891.

GAIT, EDWARD ALBERT, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 11th Dec., 1882, and served as asst. commr. in Assam; provl. supt. of census, 1890, and wrote the provl. report; acted as sec. to the chief commr., 1891-92 and 1895-96; dep. commr., Nov., 1892; dir. of land records and agric., Nov., 1893.

GAITSKELL, ARTHUR, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Cheltenham, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 9th Dec., 1889, and served in Burma as asst. commr. and settlt. officer.

GALBRAITH, EDGAR, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Portora Royal Sch., Enniskillen, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1876, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., asst. supt. and small cause court judge, Dehra Dun, joint mag., asst. commr., and dep. commr.; mag. and collr., April, 1894.

GALTON, CHARLES ARTHUR, M.A., late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at St. Peter's Coll., Radley, Magdalen Gr. Sch., and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 10th Nov., 1863; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., asst. commr. (Nilgiri Hills), and sec. to the board of rev.; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1883; collr. and mag., Oct., 1884; acting commr. of salt and abkari rev., April, 1886; acting member, board of rev., April, 1887; sec. to govt. rev. dept., Nov., 1888; acting chief sec., and member of legisl. council, Jan. to April, 1893; retd., Sept., 1894.

GAMBLE, JAMES SYKES, M.A., F.L.S., India Forest Dept.—Educ. at Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. asst. conservator of forests, Oct., 1871; arrived, 27th Dec., 1871, and served in British Burma and Bengal; asst. to the inspr.-gen. of forests, 1877-79; dep. conservator, Bengal, July, 1880; conservator, Sept., 1882; transf. to Madras, Dec., 1882; transf. to N.W. Prov. as conservator of sch. circle, and dir. of the forest sch., Dehra Dun, Oct., 1890; author of a 'Manual of Indian Timbers.'

GAMBLE, REGINALD ARTHUR, B.A., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 30th Dec., 1884, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; transf. to finl. dept., govt. of India, as acting asst. compt. of India treasuries, Nov., 1889; acting dep. acctnt.-gen., Allahabad, June, 1890; under sec. in the fin. and commerce dept., Dec., 1894.

GANPATRAO DAMODHAR PANSE, Statutory C.S. (Bombay).—Apptd. probr. under the native civil service rules, and asst. collr. and mag., 13th Dec., 1881; confd., 5th June, 1884; 2nd asst. Dec., 1890; 1st asst., June, 1894.

GARBETT, COLIN HUBERT, Col., I.S.C., Bengal Non-Regulation Commn.—First commn., 27th June, 1859; from 4th Dec., 1866, served in Bengal as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Nov., 1879.

GARBETT, HUBERT, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., Nov., 1854, and was employed on irrigtn. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Feb., 1860; supt. of works, Derajat circle, Punjab, 1870; suptg. engr., July, 1878; retd., 1890.

GARDINER, JOHN WILLIAM, late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the Lycée Imperial Bonaparte, Paris; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 24th Nov., 1864, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; jud. asst., Dec., 1880; dep. commr., Nov., 1885; also settlt. officer, 1887-88; retd., Nov., 1889.

GARDINER, RICHARD, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Lieut., 8th Jan., 1868; 2nd asst. engr., Rajputana state railway, 10th Nov., 1870; exec. engr., W. Rajputana section, Feb., 1875; dep. manager, July, 1882; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, railway branch, Nov., 1886; manager and engr.-in-chief, Bhau-nagar-Gondal railway, June, 1887; also charge of Morvi railway, June, 1887; retd., April, 1893.

GARRETT, ABRAHAM, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Bath Coll. and Brasenose Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 19th Dec., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

GARRETT, ALFRED HOWARD, Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1874, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., May, 1883.

GARRETT, ANNESLEY JOHN, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., late Haidarabad Administration.—Educ. at Marlborough; first commn., 29th May, 1866; mil. sec. to the rest., Haidarabad, March, 1890, to March, 1895.

GARRETT, CHARLES BAZETT, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived in India, 2nd March, 1858, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., district and sessions judge, and mag. and collr.; judge of the principal court of small causes in Nudda and Jessor, Dec., 1882; district and sessions judge, 1st grade, Feb., 1883; retd., March, 1893.

GARRETT, HENRY WILLIAM, Pol. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at the King's Sch., Ely; clerk, 2nd class, acctnt.-gen.'s dept., 12th April, 1882; transf. to pol. dept., June, 1890.

GARRETT, JAMES HUGH ELIOT, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Reading Gr. Sch., Clifton Coll. and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 25th Nov., 1887, and served as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Oct., 1894.

GARRETT, ROBERT VERNON, Major, I.S.C., Haidarabad Administration.—Entered the service, 11th Feb., 1875; regimental duty with 54th Foot till Jan., 1879; entered staff corps Jan., 1879; with 5th and 4th Infantry, Haidarabad contingent to June, 1887; asst. commr., June, 1887; special asst. commr., June, 1895; dep. commr., May, 1896.

GARSTIN, JOHN HENRY, C.S.I., late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1857; arrived, 1st Dec., 1857; served in rev. and jud. depts., Madras, and was apptd. private sec. to Lord Napier, March, 1866; collr. and mag., S. Arcot, and pol. agent, Pondicherry, May, 1871; served as acting sec. and addl. sec. to govt., rev. dept., 1876-80; C.S.I., May, 1878; collr. and mag. and agent, Vizagapatam, March, 1880, to April, 1881; board of rev., July, 1882; apptd. to revise the estblts. of collrs. and divl. officers, Feb., 1883; fellow of Madras univ., March, 1886; second member of board of rev. and commr. of land rev., April, 1887; member of council of
govr. of Madras, Jan., 1889; acting gov. of Madras, 1st Dec., 1890, to 23rd Jan., 1891; retd., Jan., 1894; author of a 'Review of the Madras Famine of 1876-78'; and compiler of the 'District Manual of S. Arcot,' 1878.

GARSTIN, NORMAN ANTHONY, late Police Dept., N.W.Prov.and Oudh.—Joined the service, 22nd Oct., 1857, as dep. collr. and mag., Bengal; transf. to Oudh, Sept., 1859, as extra asst. commr.; asst. district supt. of police, Dec., 1863; district supt., Jan., 1867; retd., Dec., 1863.

GARTH, RIGHT HON. SIR RICHARD, Kt., M.A., Q.C.—Educ. at Eton, and Christ Church, Oxford; called to the bar in Lincoln's Inn in 1847, and went the home circuit; M.P. for Guildford, 1866-68; nominated chief justice, Calcutta, March, 1875; retd., March, 1886; sworn of the privy council, Feb., 1888.

GARTHWAITE, LESTON, B.A., late Educn. Dept., Madras.—Served from 8th April, 1857, as head master of various schs., and as dep. inspr. of schs.; from Sept., 1869, served as inspr. of schs.; fellow of Madras univ., March, 1884; retd., Dec., 1888; compiled Kanarese and Malayalam arzis for the sec. of state, and also various text-books.

GARWOOD, JOHN FREDERICK, Lieut.-Col., R.E., Indian Mil. Works Dept.—First commn., 17th April, 1866; arrived, 17th Feb., 1872, and served in the public works dept. in the N.W. Prov.; suptg. engr., Sept., 1860; on field service in the Zob valley, 1860; acted as suptg. engr., Baluchistan civil works, and public works sec. to agent, in 1886, 1890, and 1892; transf. to Bombay command, March, 1895; and to headquarters as dep. dir., April, 1895.

GASKIN, LIONEL EDWARD PALMER, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Kingswood Sch., Bath, Bedford Gr. Sch., and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 20th Nov., 1893, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

GATES, FRANK CAMPBELL, B.L., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 18th Dec., 1882, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; from Aug., 1884, served in Burma as asst. commr.; on special duty in Upper Burma, March, 1887; junr. sec. to chief commr., April, 1887; under sec., Oct., 1887; dep. commr., Aug., 1889; junr. sec., March, 1891; sec., March, 1893; rev. sec., Jan., 1895.

GATHERER, ARTHUR BRANDER, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Arrived, 8th Nov., 1864, and served in the public works dept., Madras and Mysore; exec. engr., Sept., 1873; asst. sec. to rest. public works dept., Haidarabad, Dec., 1885; suptg. engr., March, 1886; transf. to Burma, April, 1889.
