GAULD, WILLIAM, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 28th Dec., 1895.

GAUNTLETT, MAGER FREDERIC, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 27th Nov., 1893, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; and asst. settl. officer.

GAY, EDWARD, M.A., late Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Apptd. asst. in the fin. dept., Sept., 1865; asst. comptr.-gen. of acct., June, 1867; acting dep. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, April, 1868; dep. comptr.-gen., Calcutta, Sept., 1869; acting acctnt.-gen., Bengal, 1874-75; acctnt.-gen.,

Bombay, and commr. of paper currency, April, 1879; comptr. and auditor-gen. and head commr. of paper currency, Nov., 1888; retd., Nov., 1891.

GEAKE, EDWARD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Plymouth Coll. and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 25th Nov., 1886, and served as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1893.

GEE, HERBERT WALTER, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Sherborne Sch. and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 28th Nov., 1887, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; pol. officer, Tochi, April, 1896.

GEIDT, BERNARD GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Shrewsbury; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 30th Nov., 1876, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in Assam as asst. commr. and personal asst. to the chief commr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Jan., 1888; district and sessions judge, April, 1894.

GELL, RIGHT REV. FREDERICK, D.D., Ecclesl. Dept., Madras.—Fellow of Christ Coll., Cambridge; nominated lord bishop of Madras, 16th May, 1861; arrived in India, 25th Nov., 1861; acting metropolitan bishop, Calcutta, March, 1876, to Feb., 1877.

GEOGHGAN, HENRY THOMAS, B.A., M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; joined the dept., Nov., 1868, as exec. engr., Punjab N. state railway; suptg. engr., Indus valley railway, May, 1877; offg. consulting engr. to govt. of India for state railways, Feb., 1879; engr.-in-chief, Bhopal railway, June, 1879; and Madras state railway surveys, Feb., 1885; retd., 1890.

GEORGE, EDWARD CLAUDIUS SCOTNEY, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Dulwich and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 7th March, 1887, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; C.I.E., Jan., 1894.

GERRARD, ARTHUR STAPLES, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 2nd Aug., 1873, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., July, 1881; offg. consulting engr. to govt. of India for railways, Lucknow, 1892-93.

GHOSE, MAHIMOHUN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at St. Xavier's Coll., Bombay, St. Peter's Coll., Exmouth, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 11th Feb., 1893, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

GIBB, MALCOLM COOPER, LL.B., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Harrow, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 11th Dec., 1882, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., Nov., 1890; 1st asst., Feb., 1893.

GIBBONS, JAMES BARRY, SURGN.-MAJOR, Bengal Med. Dept.—First commn., 1st Oct., 1881; from Aug., 1884, acted as civil surgn.; rest. physician, med. coll. hosp., Calcutta, Feb., 1885; supt., Campbell med. sch. and hosp., Sealdah, Jan., 1896.

GIBSON, EDWARD, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at St. Alban's Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 25th Nov., 1864, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine duty in Karnul, 1876-78; acting under sec. to govt., Feb., 1880; private sec. to govt. of Madras, Dec., 1880; sub-collr. and joint mag., June, 1882; sec. to the board of rev., Jan., 1884; collr. and mag., Sept., 1888; member of board of rev., Nov., 1893; member of legisl. council, Jan., 1894; sec. to govt., rev. dept., Nov., 1894; retd., Dec., 1896.
GIBSON, Frederick Edward, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Bath Gr. Sch., London Univ., and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1865; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; sub-collr. and joint mag., Nellore, Oct., 1883; retd., Aug., 1887.

GIBSON, Henry William, B.L., late Oudh Commn.—Volunteer in the Meerut light horse, 1857-58; served subsequently in the mil. police, 1858-61; asst. district supt. of police, Oudh, June, 1861; district supt., April, 1863; from July, 1864, served in the Oudh commn. as asst. commr.; acted as supt. of encumbered estates, Sitapur, 1874; dep. commr., Nov., 1877; retd., April, 1894.

GIBSON, J.R., late Rev. Survey Dept., Bombay.—Joined the service, 27th Feb., 1862; arrived, Sept., 1860, and served as asst. supt., asst. settl. officer, and dep. supt.; from 1881 to 1885 served in Egypt, being attached to the intelligence dept. during the campaign of 1882 (medal and Khe-dive's star); supt., rev. survey, Ratnagiri, May, 1885; from 1885 to 1890, was again employed under the Egyptian govt., and received the order of the Osmanich; resumed his post in May, 1890, but returned immediately to Egypt; retd. from the dept., June, 1892.

GILCHRIST, William Gilchrist, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., Aug., 1870, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; services lent to S. Indian railway co., 1887-88, and to Nilgiri railway co., 1890-91; in charge of Kalka-Simla railway survey, March, 1892; engr.-in-chief, Arsikere-Mangalore railway survey, Nov., 1894.

GILES, Arthur Henry, Police Dept., Bengal.—Joined the dept. as asst. supt., 14th Feb., 1863; district supt., Jan., 1866; dep. inspr.-gen., Oct., 1890; served temporarily under the govt. of Ceylon in 1888; has publd. report on police of Bombay, Madras and Calcutta, 1887; and report on administration of Police, Ceylon, 1889.

GILES, Edward, M.A., Bombay Educl. Dept.—Educ. at Christ Church, Oxford; arrived, 14th May, 1873, and served as profir. of history and pol. economy, Elphinstone coll., Bombay; educ. inspr., May, 1875.

GILES, Frank, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 26th Oct., 1873, and served in the N.W. Prov., as asst. mag. and collr. and joint mag.; under sec. to govt., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Oct., 1886; offid. sec. to board of rev., Sept., 1887; senr. asst. commr., May, 1888; offid. commr., Kumaun, 1889, 1891, and 1893; dep. commr., Oct., 1891; acted as legal remembrancer in 1893; member and sec. of provl. legisl. council, Nov., 1893, to Jan., 1894; supt., Dehra Dun, April, 1896.

GILES, Robert, M.A., Sind Commn.—Arrived 3rd Dec., 1868; asst. settl. officer, Indus survey, March, 1869; served from Jan., 1870, as dep. collr., supt. of police, and educ. inspr. in Sind; 2nd asst. collr. in Sind, July, 1884; dep. commr., Dec., 1885; coll. and mag., Nov., 1895.

GILL, John Edward, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Harrow, and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 23rd Jan., 1878, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Aug., 1887; asst. commr., Nov., 1889; settl. officer, March, 1890; joint mag., July, 1890; district and sessions judge, March, 1893; author of 'Gazetteer of the Ghazipur District.'

GILLAN, Rev. G.G., M.A., late Ecclesl.Dept., Bengal.—Asst. chaplain of the Church of Scotland, 4th Jan., 1866; chaplain, Jan., 1876; senr. chaplain of the church of Scotland in Bengal, and of St. Andrew's church, March, 1880; retd., 1889.

GILLAN, Robert Woodburn, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Ayr Acad. and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 11th Nov., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Aug., 1893; offid. city mag. and wasika officer; Lucknow, March, 1894; asst. commr., May, 1896.

GILLESPIE, James Thomas, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Newry Intermediate Sch., the Royal Univ. of Ireland, and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 21st Dec., 1893, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

GILLILAND, John Howard, B.A., Bengal Educl. Dept.—Apptd., 15th June, 1877, and served in the presidency and Howrah colls. as profr. of civil engnr.; profr. in presidency coll., Nov., 1888; has acted as second asst. meteorological reporter to the govt. of India.

GILLMAN, Herbert Francis Webb, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll. and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 1st Dec., 1888, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Nov., 1895.

GIRINDRA NARAIN DEB, Kumar, Statutory C.S. (Bengal).—Offid. dep. mag. and dep. collr., Bardwan, Aug., 1878; apptd. under the native civil service rules proby. asst. mag. and collr., Dec., 1880; confid., 19th Feb., 1886; joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1892.

GLADSTONE, Cecil Ernest, late Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 13th Nov., 1869, and served in the Punjab as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. commr.; on special duty at Delhi at the imperial assemblage, Dec., 1876; transf. to Burma as dep. commr.; Sept., 1886; offid. as commr., April, 1889; re-transf. to the Punjab, as dep. commr., Dec., 1889; retd., Sept., 1894.

GLASS, James George Henry, C.I.E., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—2nd asst. engr., Central Prov., 27th June, 1867; exec. engr., April, 1871; sec. to chief commr., public works dept., Central Prov., July, 1885; suptg. engr. and sec., Aug., 1888; C.I.E., May, 1890; chief engr. and sec., Jan.-March, 1893; chief engr. and sec. to govt. of N.W. Prov. and Oudh, buildings and roads branch, March, 1894; transf. to Bengal in similar capacity, Jan., 1896.

GLAZIER, Edward George, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at N. London Coll. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 25th Sept., 1861; from April, 1862, served in Bengal rev. and jud. depts., and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1st grade, Oct., 1879; retd., 1891; author of 'Report on the district of Rungpore,' 'Further Notes on the Rungpore Records,' 'Report on the Famine in Rungpore.'

GLENNY, William Henry, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Newry Sch., Royal Sch., Dungannon, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1861; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-collr. and joint mag.;
collr. and mag., Karnul, April, 1880; acting dir. of rev. settl. and agric., Oct., 1885; collr. and mag., N. Arcot, May, 1886; retd., 1888.

GLOSTER, JOHN CLERKE, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Middleton Coll., Cork, and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 15th Nov., 1890, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

GODFREY, CHARLES WILLIS, Col., I.S.C. Rev. Survey Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at foreign schs.; arrived, 9th Sept., 1858, and served in the Bombay artillery; from Aug., 1864, served in the dept. as asst. supt., and was promoted to supt. of survey, Jan., 1885.

GODFREY, FRANCIS EDWARD, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. comptr., and posted to Bombay, 1st April, 1871; dep. examr., Jan., 1880; examr., Jan., 1882; offg. dep. acctnt.-gen. for inspnr. duty, Dec., 1892; examr. of telegraph accts., April, 1894.

GODFREY, GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 20th Oct., 1873, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine duty, May, 1874; served in Assam, 1874-80, and again from Oct., 1883; dep. commr., Jan., 1885; acting inspnr.-gen. of police, &c., April, 1892; judge and commr., Assam valley districts, Oct., 1892.

GODELEY, SIR ARTHUR, K.C.B., Under Sec. of State, India Office.—Educ. at Rugby, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; Hertford scholar, 1868; Ireland scholar, 1870; Eldon law scholar, 1874; called to the bar at Lincoln's Inn, 1876; private sec. to the first lord of the treasury, 1872-74; and again, 1880-82; commr. of inland rev., 1882-83; C.B., 1882; permanent under sec. of state for India, 30th Sept., 1883; member of the Indian currency committee, 1892-93; K.C.B., Jan., 1893.

GODSELL, WILLIAM, Auditor, India Office.—Jnr. asst., India audit office, 30th Sept., 1860; jnr. inspr., Dec., 1868; asst. to the auditor, Oct., 1892; auditor, Jan., 1895.

GODWIN-AUSTEN, HAROLD, Berar Administration.—Educ. at the Royal Acad., Gosport; joined the service, 27th Feb., 1877, and held offg. appts. at Port Blair and in the Nicobars; on special duty with the joint commr. of Ladakh in 1880; extra asst. supt., Port Blair, Feb., 1883; transf. to Berar as asst. commr., Nov., 1889; special asst. commr., June, 1893; dep. commr., June, 1895.

GOLDINGHAM, JOHN DARYMPLE, late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1853; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-judge; judge of small causes, July, 1862; civil and sessions judge, Oct., 1868; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1872; retd., Sept., 1888.

GOLDSMITH, SEPTIMUS JESSE, Surgn.-Major.—Joined the Bombay med. service, April, 1873; arrived, 1st Nov., 1873; served as civil surgn. in N. Kanara and Gujarat; agency surgn., Bhaghelkhand, Sept., 1875; also tutor to Maharaja of Rewah from Oct., 1883; afterwards in med. charge of Bhaghelkhand agency and dispensaries; retd., March, 1891.

GOLDWYER-LEWIS, VEN. ALEXANDER, B.A., B.D., Ecclesl. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the service as chaplain, 19th May, 1875; senr. chaplain, May, 1885; archdeacon of Bombay and commissary, Oct., 1890.

GOMPERTZ, HENRY JAMES COLLEY, late Madras Rev. Survey Dept.—Apptd., 10th Aug., 1859; dep. supt., 1st class, July, 1887; employed in 1888 on special duty on boundary questions, Pudukottai, and in 1889, Karikal and Tanjore; retd., Jan., 1893.

GOMPERTZ, RICHARD LOUIS DALZIEL, India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. asst. supt., 9th Nov., 1870, and employed on various lines in Bombay, Bengal, Madras, &c.; supt., Oct., 1887.

GOOD, WILLIAM, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 15th July, 1869, and employed on irrign. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Jan., 1879; suptg. engr., Feb., 1895.

GOODFELLOW, CHARLES AUGUSTUS, V.C., Lieut.-Gen., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Bombay.—Joined Addiscombe, July, 1853; 2nd lieut., June, 1855; arrived, March, 1857; served with the Central India field force, 1857-58 (medal and clasp, V.C.), and with the Okhamandal and Kathiawar field force, 1859; joined the dept. as special asst. engr., harbour defences, Bombay, April, 1860; exec. engr., Feb., 1862; served in the Abyssinian expdn., 1867-68 (medal); suptg. engr., May, 1884; chief engr. for irrign., Sept., 1887; returned to mil. dept., Nov., 1891.

GOODFELLOW, WILLIAM WEST, C.B., Gen., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Bombay.—2nd lieut., Bombay engrs., Dec., 1851; arrived, Oct., 1853; joined the dept., July, 1854; served with the Persian expdn., 1856-57 (medal and clasp), and with the Abyssinian expdn., 1867 (C.B. and medal); exec. engr., Bombay defences, 1869-70; served subsequently at Aden and in the Poona districts; suptg. engr., June, 1876; chief engr. and sec. to govt. of Bombay, public works dept., April, 1885; returned to Europe, 1887.

GOODRICH, HARRY ST. AUBYN, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Eton, and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1861; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., dep. dir. of rev. settl., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; collr. and mag., March, 1882; member of govr.-gen.'s legisl. council, 1884-85, and 1885-86; retd., Feb., 1890.

GOODRICKE, G. M., late Bengal Customs Dept.—Served from 30th Nov., 1859, as preventive officer and appraiser, Calcutta custom house, and was apptd. asst. collr. of customs, July, 1871, and dep. collr. of Calcutta, March, 1880; also supt. of excise rev., collr. of stamp rev., and a collr. under the licence tax act; retd., 1889.

GOODRIDGE, JOHN PERCH, late Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 3rd Nov., 1869, and served as asst. commr., &c., in the Central Prov.; on famine duty in Madras, Sept., 1877; dep. commr., Sept., 1889; in addn. pol. agent, Chhattisgarh feudatories, Dec., 1889; offd. as commr. of settls. and agric. in 1889; and as commr., Chhattisgarh, in 1890; addl. sessions judge, Jan., 1892; retd., July, 1895.

GOPAL DAS, Rai Bahadur, late Punjab Commn.—Served in the settl. dept. and subord. jud. dept. of the Punjab from 6th July, 1851; extra jud. asst., Oct., 1888; retd., 1889; author of a 'Manual for preparation of Records of Rights' and of histories of the Gujranwala and Peshawur districts.

GOPENDRA KRISHNA DEB, KUMAR, M.A., B.L., Statutory C.S. (Bengal).—Served in the subord. exec. service, Bengal, from 27th
Jan., 1876, and offd. as registrar of Calcutta and inspr. of registrn. offices; apptd. under the native civil service rules, Nov., 1882, and served as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Sept., 1891; inspr.-gen. of registrn., Nov., 1894; dist. and sess. judge, April, 1895.

GORDON, ALEXANDER EVANS, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Bengal Non-Regulation Commn.—First commn., 18th April, 1865; from May, 1872, served in Bengal as asst. commr.; on special duty with the Maharaja of Johore, Dec., 1875; cantonmt. mag. and small cause court judge, Dum-Dum, March, 1876; tutor to the Maharaja of Darbhanga, June, 1877; on depn. to Kuch Behar, Dec., 1883; dep. commr., March, 1887; acted as jud. commr., Chota Nagpur, in 1893.

GORDON, DONALD CLUNES, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept. in 1868, as asst. comptr. of accts., N.W. Prov.; served subsequently as dep. comptr. in the Punjab; comptr., July, 1874; examr. of guaranteed railway accts., Bombay, 1877-79, and afterwards in Madras; examr., public works accts., Madras, May, 1881; in same capacity in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, March, 1887; and in the Punjab, March, 1891.

GORDON, GEORGE, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Radley Coll., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 4th Dec., 1885, and served in Assam as asst. commr.; dep. commr., April, 1893; transf'd. to Bengal as joint mag. and dep. collr., May, 1894.

GORDON, HAMILTON WINKUP, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 12th Nov., 1864, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1879; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1881; has offd. at various periods as judge of high court, Calcutta.

GORDON, HUNTLY PRYSE, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at New Coll., London, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1861; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., small cause court judge, and asst. commr.; collr. and mag., Dec., 1878; retd., Oct., 1887.

GORDON, JOHN JAMES HOOD, C.B., General, Indian Staff Corps.—First commn., 21st Aug., 1849; entered Bengal Staff Corps, 29th May, 1867; has received medals for the Indian mutiny, Jowaki, Afghan and Burma campaigns; asst. mil. sec. for Indian affairs at Horse Guards, Oct., 1890; member of the Council of India, Jan., 1897.

GORE, ST. GEORGE CORBET, Major, R.E., Survey of India Dept.—Joined the service, 8th Jan., 1870; arrived, 15th Nov., 1872; from March, 1873, served on the great trigonl. survey of India; on service in Afghanistan, 1879-80, with Sir D. Stewart's column on march from Kandahar to Kabul, as officer in charge of survey; attached to Afghan boundary commn., Aug., 1884; dep. supt., March, 1886; supt., trigonl. surveys, Dehra Dun, May, 1894.

GORST, RIGHT HON. SIR JOHN ELDON, Q.C., M.P.—Graduated at St. John's Coll., Cambridge, as 3rd wrangler, 1857; M.A., 1860; fellow of his coll.; called to the bar at the Inner Temple, 1865; Q.C., 1875; solicitor-gen. in Lord Salisbury's first administration, 1885-86; under sec. of state for India, in Lord Salisbury's second administration, Aug., 1886, to Nov., 1891; finl. sec. to the treasury, 1891-92; was British plenipotentiary at the labour conference at Berlin, 1890; lord rector of Glasgow univ., 1893; vice-pres. of committee of council on educn. in Lord Salisbury's third administration July, 1895; author of 'The Maori King.'

GOSS, LOUIS ALLAN, Educn. Dept., Burma.—Held non-gazetted appts. from 5th Aug., 1874, to 7th April, 1878, when he was apptd. junr. inspr. of schs.; senr. inspr., March, 1893; in 1894, acted in addn. as dir. of public instrn.; author of 'The Story of Wethan-da-ya.'

GOUDGE, JOSEPH ERNEST, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Taunton, London Univ., and Pembroke Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 7th Dec., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.

GOUGH, ARCHIBALD EDWARD, M.A., late Educn. Service, N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Educ. at Lincoln Coll., Oxford; joined the dept., and Nov., 1868, and served as prof'r., Benares coll., and Muir coll., Allahabad; served in Bengal, 1878-86, as prof'r. in the Hugli and presidency colls., and principal of the Calcutta Madrassa; principal, Muir coll., Allahabad, July, 1886; retd. July, 1895; author of 'Papers relating to the Collection and Preservation of the Records of Ancient Sanskrit Literature in India,' 1878, &c., &c.

GOULDSBURY, DUDLEY ELPHINSTONE, Lieut.-Col., Punjab Administration.—Joined the service, 16th Oct., 1866; arrived, 1st March, 1867; served in mil. dept. to June, 1882, when he was transf'd. to the Punjab as offg. cantonmt. mag.; re-transf'd. to mil. dept., Oct., 1882; resumed his appt., May, 1883; confd., March, 1887.

GOVAN, GEORGE MONCRIEFF, M.D., L.R.C.S., L.R.C.P.E., Brigade-Surg'n., late Med. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Asst. surg'n., Bengal med. establ., Dec., 1851; arrived, 2nd Feb., 1852, and served under the mil. dept. in Bengal, Burma, and Assam, and throughout the Bhutan campaign, 1864-66 (medal and clasp for Burma); from Jan., 1883, served under the govt. of the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as civil surg'n., &c.; retd., March, 1887.

GRACE, CHARLES HALLYBURTON, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., as ensign, Madras infantry, March, 1854; served in the Central Prov. from Sept., 1859, as asst. commr., dep. commr., and settl. officer; acted as commr. of Jabalpur, 1882; reverted to mil. dept., 1892.

GRACEY, HUGH KIRKWOOD, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at City of London Sch., London Univ., and St. Catherine's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 17th Dec., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; joint mag., Nov., 1894.

GRACEY, THOMAS, Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Educ. at Enniskillen Royal Sch.; 1st commn., 17th Dec., 1862; 1st asst. engr., N.W. Prov., Sept., 1867; exec. engr., Sept., 1870; engr.-in-chief, Pindi-Kohat section of Punjab N. railway, 1879; engr.-in-chief, prov'l. railways under construction, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Oct., 1882; sec. to chief commr., public works dept., Burma, April, 1887; suptg. engr., Feb., 1888; offg. consulting engr. for railways, and joint sec. to govt., railway branch, Madras, July, 1890; consulting engr. to the govt. of India for railways, central divn., June, 1891; in similar capacity, Lucknow, June, 1892; chief engr., June, 1892; dir.-gen. of rail-
ways, and dep. sec., railway branch, Aug., 1895.

GRAHAM, ROBERT ARTHUR, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Winchester, and Brasenose Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 11th Nov., 1891, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

GRAHAME, WILLIAM FITZWILLIAM, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at the Charterhouse, and Trinity Hall, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 15th Nov., 1892, and served in Burma as asst. commr. and offg. under sec.

GRAHAME, WILLIAM FRANCIS, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 4th Jan., 1864, and served in the Madras rev. and jud. depts.; on special duty in 1868 with Dr. Janssen in connection with the solar eclipse; collr. and mag., June, 1882; district and sessions judge, Oct., 1882.

GRANT, ALEXANDER, A.M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., July, 1867, and employed in N.W. Prov. and Oudh on irrig. works; exec. engr., March, 1873; under sec. to govt. irrig. branch, in 1888; suptg. engr., Jan., 1893; retd., Oct., 1895.

GRANT, ALEXANDER, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 15th Oct., 1873, and posted to mil. works; transf. to Punjab, Nov., 1880; exec. engr., May, 1883; transf. to Burma, Aug., 1889; and to Assam, May, 1894; to Haidarabad, Oct., 1895.

GRANT, ALFRED HAMILTON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Fettes Coll., Edinburgh, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 9th Dec., 1895, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

GRANT, ARTHUR JAMES, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Berkhamsted Gr. Sch., Dulwich Coll., and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 17th Nov., 1889, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and offg. under sec. to govt.; junr. sec. to finl. commrs., March-Nov., 1892; on special duty with Waziristan delimitation commn., Oct., 1894; pol. officer, Wano, March, 1896.

GRANT, SIR CHARLES, K.C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Harrow, Trinity Coll., Cambridge, and Haileybury Coll., from which he was apptd. in 1858; arrived, 8th April, 1858, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Central Prov.; sec. to chief commr., Central Prov., Nov., 1861; commr., Nov., 1870; acting jud. commr., Aug., 1877; acting chief commr., April to Nov., 1879; addl. member of govt.-gen.'s council, Dec., 1879; acting sec., govt. of India, home, rev., and agric. depts., May, 1880; foreign sec., govt. of India, Sept., 1881; retd., Feb., 1885; compiled the 'Central Provinces Gazetteer.'

GRANT, CHARLES, Major-Gen., late Pol. Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, 4th Jan., 1857; arrived, 6th Feb., 1857; special officer in charge, Kathiawar local battalion, and extra asst. pol. agent, Dec., 1867; in charge of state prison, Asirgarh, March, 1870; asst. rest., Persian Gulf, June, 1871, and acted as rest. in 1877; pol. agent, E. states, Rajputana, April, 1878; pol. agent, Muscat, Feb., 1880; supt., Rajputana railway police, Dec., 1880; from Feb., 1881, served as cantonmnt. mag., Nimach; retd., Jan., 1887.

GRANT, DONALD ST. JOHN DUNDAS, Surgn.-Major, M.A., M.B., Punjab Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1881; served in the Punjab from Oct., 1886, as civil surgn.; chemical examr. to govt., and profr., Lahore med. coll., Sept., 1891.

GRANT, GEORGE, Brigade-Surgn., M.B., late Med. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., 10th Feb., 1859; arrived, 11th July, 1859; from June, 1860, served under the govt. of the N.W. Prov. as civil asst. surgn.; offg. supt., govt. press, and curator of govt. books, N.W. Prov., and chemical examr., Aug., 1866; supt. of new central prison, Farakhabad, Dec., 1866; offg. inspr.-gen. of prisons and civil hosp., N.W. Prov., in 1877, 1879, and 1882; supt., Bareilly jails, Dec., 1877; dep. sanitary commr., 1st circle, Dec., 1883; retd., Oct., 1885.

GRANT, GEORGE FRANCIS MYTON, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Eton, and Brighton; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 12th Dec., 1864, and served as asst. collr. and mag., branch registrar-gen., and educ. inspr. in Sind; in charge of the Sachin state, May, 1879; junr. collr. of salt rev., Bombay, Dec., 1882; junr. collr. and mag. and pol. agent, Thana, March, 1885; senr. collr., Sept., 1886; commr., N. divn., April, 1890; retd., Nov., 1890.

GRANT, GREGORY COLQUHOUN, Col., I.S.C., late Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 4th Nov., 1853; on mil. duty till Nov., 1860, including service with the Okhamandal field force in 1859; served subsequently as dep. collr. and mag. in Sind; judge and sessions judge, March, 1865; also acted as jud. commr. in Sind, and judge of the sadar court; reverted to mil. dept., 1890.

GRANT, J. G. GARROW, Dr., late Emigration Dept., Bengal.—Served in the dept. from 22nd May, 1863, as med. inspr. and protector of labourers, Kushtia; protector of emigrants and supt. of labour transports, Calcutta, Feb., 1871; supt. of emigration, Calcutta, Jan., 1874; retd., 1889.

GRANT, JOHN ANDREW, late Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 3rd Jan., 1878, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; served under the foreign dept., govt. of India, at Kuran, 1880; settlt. officer, Dec., 1883; offg. registrar, chief court, June, 1885; settlt. officer, Feb., 1888; retd., 1896.

GRANT, JOHN HAY, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1856; arrived, 6th Feb., 1857, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., railway mag., and asst. rev. and police commr.; junr. collr., Sept., 1877; municipal commr., Bombay, Nov., 1877; collr. of Bombay, and supt. of stamps and stationery, Aug., 1883; special commr. for Bombay for international exhibn. at Calcutta, 1883; retd., Jan., 1888.

GRANT, JOHN PYNE, Col., I.S.C., late Rev. Survey of Mysore.—First commn., Bombay infantry, Jan., 1856; joined the rev. survey, 1860; supt., Jan., 1868; retd., Jan., 1890.

GRANT, THOMAS, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 28th May, 1875.

GRANT, TREVOR JOHN CHICHELE, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 27th Jan., 1858; served in Bengal as asst. and joint mag.; mag. and collr., May, 1874; offg. sec., board of rev., April, 1874; retd., Jan., 1893.

GRANT-BROWN, GEORGE EUSTACE RIOU, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch.,
and St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 9th Dec., 1889, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

GRANT-DUFF, Rt. Hon. Sir Mountstuart Elphinstone, G.C.S.I., C.I.E., F.R.S.—Born in 1829; educ. at Edinburgh, and at Balliol Coll., Oxford (M.A., 1853); called to the bar at the Inner Temple in 1854; represented the Elgin burghs in parliament from 1857 to 1881; under sec. of state for India, Dec., 1868, to Feb., 1874; under sec. of state for the colonies, April, 1880, to Aug., 1881; gov. of Madras, Nov., 1881, to Dec., 1886; was lord rector of the univ. of Aberdeen, 1866-72; author of 'Studies in European Politics,' 'Elgin Speeches,' 'A Political Survey,' &c.

GRAVES, Somerset Henry Paul, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., late Burma Police Dept.—First commn., 2nd Sept., 1868; served in the 26th native infantry, and in June, 1885, was apptd. supt. of police, Port Blair; dep. inspr.-gen. of police, Upper Burma, May, 1887; reverted to mil. duty, 1888.

GRAY, Evelyn, B.L., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 27th Dec., 1878, and served as asst. collr. and mag. and forest settl. officer; transf'd to Central Prov. as asst. commr., Dec., 1891; dep. commr., Jan., 1892.

GRAY, Malcolm Alexander, B.A., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Assam Commn.—Ensign, 3rd (Buffs) regt., 7th Nov., 1868; arrived, 1st Feb., 1870; served in the Assam commn., from Aug., 1873, as offg. asst. commr. and asst. inspr. of immigrants; confd. as asst. commr., July, 1877; forest settl. officer, Oct., 1885; dep. commr., Sept., 1888.

GRAY, Percy, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Wellington Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 30th Dec., 1878, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; junr. sec., board of rev., April-July, 1885; joint mag., Sept., 1887, and asst. commr., Feb., 1890; judge, small cause court, Allahabad, May, 1891; registrar, high court, March, 1892; dep. commr., March, 1894; mag. and collr., Nov., 1895.

GRAY, Robert, M.B., Brigade-Surgn., late Med. Dept., Punjab.—Joined the Indian med. dept. in 1859; arrived, 11th March, 1860, and served in the Punjab from Feb., 1863, as civil asst. surgn., jail supt. and surgn. at various stations; inspr.-gen. of prisons, Sept., 1884; retd., April, 1891.

GRAY, Wellington, L.M., L. Ch., Brigade-Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., late Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the Indian med. service, 31st March, 1866; arrived, 9th Nov., 1866, and served as profr. and principal, Grant med. coll., surgn. at the Jamsetji Jijibhoy hosp., curator of Victoria and Albert museum, and sec. to the surgn.-gen.; retd., April, 1893.

GREANY, John Philip, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1875, and was employed on mil. duty, and in various acting civil posts; apptd. civil surgn., July, 1883; acted as dep. sanitary commr. in 1888 and 1893.

GREAVES, Sir George Richards, K.C.B., K.C.M.G., Gen.—First commn., 30th Nov., 1849; served in the Mutiny, the Yusufzai expdn. of 1858 (medal with clasp), and the war in New Zealand, 1862-66 (medal); chief of the staff in the Ashanti expdn. of 1873-74 (medal with clasp and C.B.), and in the Soudan campaign in 1885 (K.C.B., medal with clasp); commander-in-chief of Bombay army, and second member of council of Govr. of Bombay, March, 1890; resigned, April, 1893; retd., from the army, June, 1896.

GREAVES, Richard Herbert, late Indian C.S. (Assam).—Apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 19th Jan., 1870, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; transf'd to Assam as district and sessions judge, Silhet, Oct., 1882; retd., July, 1896.

GREENE, Walter James, Finl. Dept., India Office.—Writer, 1st July, 1867; clerk, 2nd class, Aug., 1878; clerk for exam. of army non-effective accts., March, 1885.

GREENSHIELDS, Robert Scott, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Birkenhead Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 9th Dec., 1879, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf'd to Assam, March, 1882, as asst. commr.; asst. sec. to the chief commr., March, 1886; offl. as dir. of land rev. and agric. in 1889; dep. commr., Nov., 1889.

GREENSTREET, William Lees, Lieut.-Col., R.E., Mil. Works Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Oct., 1864; arrived, Jan., 1870; joined the public works dept., Feb., 1871, as asst. engr., N.W. Prov.; transf'd to mil. works branch, 1872; exec. engr., Nov., 1874; suptg. engr., July, 1885; took part in the Hazara expdn., 1891; chief engr., Sept., 1893; posted to Bombay command, April, 1895.

GREER, Richard Townsend, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Erasmus Coll., Drogheda, and Kingstown Sch., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 10th Dec., 1877, and served in Assam as asst. commr., and asst. sec. to chief commr.; transf'd to Bengal, Nov., 1888, as joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., March, 1893.

GREGG, William Henry, M.B., D.P.H., Brigade-Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 1869; served in the Lushai campaign, 1871-72 (medal and clasp); civil surgn., Dinajpur, 1873, Jessore, 1875, Hugli, 1876-86; lecturer on botany, Hugli coll., 1877-86; offg. protector of emigrants, Calcutta, April, 1888; sanitary commr., Bengal, Jan., 1889; civil surgn., Burdwan, April, 1896.

GREIG, George, late Forest Dept., N.W. Prov.—Arrived, 20th Sept., 1857, as a lieut., 93rd Sutherland highlanders; retd. from the army, June, 1865; joined the forest dept., Dec., 1868, and was apptd. dep. conservator, March, 1871, and conservator, Nov., 1876; retd., 1880.

GREY, Leopold John Herbert, C.S.I., Col., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 3rd Jan., 1857; asst. commr. in Assam, Feb., 1865; offg. civil officer with Bhutan Duar field force, Dec., 1865; from April, 1866, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., but was employed under the govt.
of Bengal, 1868-69; pol. agent, Bahawalpur state, 1871-73, and 1877; jud. asst., July, 1876; on special duty in connection with imperial assemblage, 1876-77; dep. commr., Nov., 1876; sec. to board of examrs. (under govt. of India), March, 1882; commr. and supt., Delhi divn., March, 1886; offd. as first finl. commr. in 1891; and as second in 1893; reverted to mil. dept., Dec., 1894.

GREY, WILLIAM FRANCIS HUNGERFORD, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—First commn., Aug., 1868; served in Burma from April, 1874, as asst. commr., and offg. asst. sec.; boundary officer, Paungde, Aug., 1881; cantonmt. mag., and small cause court judge, Thayetmyo, Sept., 1882; dep. commr., Aug., 1886; offg. commr., April, 1896.

GRIERSON, GEORGE ABRAHAM, C.I.E., B.A., Ph.D., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at St. Bees, Shrewsbury, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 25th Oct., 1873; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and small cause court judge; on famine duty, 1874; on special duty in the rev. dept., Dec., 1882; joint mag. and dep. collr., Oct., 1884; mag. and collr., March, 1890; acting opium agent, Bihar, April, 1896; C.I.E., May, 1894; hon. Ph.D. (Halle), Aug., 1894; has publd. various works in connection with the Behari language and its dialects, translns., collections of folk songs, &c.; also 'Curiosities of Indian Literature,' 1885; 'Vidyapati and his Contemporaries,' 1885; 'Modern Vernacular Literature of Hindustan,' 1890; and 'Inscriptions of Piyadasii,' 1891.

GRIERSON, JOHN, Col., I.S.C., late India Public Works Dept.—2nd lieut., Bombay artillery, Dec., 1857; arrived, 24th Jan., 1858; joined the dept., Feb., 1864; exec. engr., Jan., 1871; from May, 1872, served in various parts of India as dep. controller of accts., dep. examr., and examr. of accts.; reverted to mil. dept., Aug., 1894.

GRIESEBACH, CARL LUDOLF, C.I.E., F.G.S., Geological Survey of India.—Apptd. asst. supt., 26th Sept., 1878; arrived, 11th Nov., 1878; on special duty with troops in S. Afghanistan, 1880; employed on Afghan boundary commn., 1884-86; dep. supt., Nov., 1886; on depn. as geologist to the Amir of Kabul, 1888-89; supt., June, 1889; dir., July, 1894; author of numerous contributions to the survey publs.

GRIFFIN, HENRY DALY, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at French Coll., Blackrock, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1885, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; asst. supt., Dehra Dun, April, 1889; joint mag., July, 1890; dist. and sess. judge, April, 1896.

GRIFFIN, SIR LEPHEL HENRY, K.C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 17th Nov., 1860, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; under sec. to govt., Punjab, April, 1870; supt., Kapurthala state, April, 1875; dep. commr., April, 1877; sec. to govt., Punjab, Nov., 1878; on special duty at the Paris exhibn., July, 1878; during the occupation of Afghanistan, held the special appt. of chief pol. officer in north and west districts of that country (medal); rest. and agent to the govt.-gen., Central India, Feb., 1881; K.C.S.I., May, 1881; royal commr., Indian and colonial exhibn., 1886; retd., Jan., 1889; author of 'Punjab Chiefs,' 1865; 'The Law of Inheritance to Chiefships,' 1869, 'The Great Republic,' 1884, and 'Famous Monuments of Central India,' 1886.

GRIFITH, HUGH, Brigade-Surgn., late Med. Dept., Burma.—Joined the Indian med. dept. (Madras establ.), 1859; apptd. civil surgn. and health officer, Rangoon, April, 1871; also supt. of lunatic asylum, June, 1871, and supt. of vaccn., May, 1875; retd., May, 1890.

GRIFITH, RALPH THOMAS HOTCHKIN, C.I.E., M.A., late Educn. Dept., N.W. Prov.—Arrived 1st Dec., 1853, and served as profr. and head master, Benares coll.; principal, Benares coll., Jan., 1861; supt. of observatory, Benares, May, 1866; inspr.-gen. of schs., N.W. Prov., March, 1878 dir. of public instrn., Feb., 1879; retd., 1885.

GRIFFITHS, WILLIAM, M.A., B.L., Educn. Dept., Bengal.—Apptd., 1st July, 1869; arrived, 20th Jan., 1870, and served as asst. profr. and profr., presidency coll.; fellow of Calcutta univ., 1879; principal, Hugli coll., April, 1880; principal, presidency coll., Dec., 1892.

GRIGG, EDWARD EVANS, Lieut.-Col., Bengal Infantry, Kumaun Commn.—Arrived, as ensign, Dec., 1861; served under the mil. dept. till Jan., 1864, and subsequently as asst. commr. in Assam up to March, 1867, when he was transfd. to the Oudh commn. as asst. commr.; dep. commr., May, 1855; offg. commr., 1892, and from April, 1894; commr., Kumaun, Nov., 1895.

GRIMES, HENRY ROBERT, late Jail Dept., Madras.—Asst. dep. commr. of paper currency, Vizagapatam, 29th Nov., 1864; from April, 1866, served as supt. of the central jail, Coimbatore; inspr.-gen. of jails, Madras, July, 1884; retd., April, 1886.

GRIMLEY, REGINALD FEARN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at King Edward's Sch., Birmingham, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 9th Nov., 1891, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

GRIMLEY, WILLIAM HENRY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at King Edward's Sch., Birmingham, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 12th Dec., 1863, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; junr. sec. to the board of rev., 1877-79; mag. and collr., March, 1879; offg. collr. of customs, Calcutta, April, 1881; served under the finl. dept. from April, 1885; commr. of income tax in Bengal, 1886-87; commr., Chota Nagpur, Oct., 1889; member, board of rev., Calcutta, April, 1896; author of 'The Sea Customs Law,' 'Tariff Act, with notes,' an 'Income Tax Manual,' 'Manual of Rev. Sale Law, and Certificate Procedure.'

GRINDLAY, WALTER, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Fettes Coll., Edinburgh, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 18th Dec., 1881, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; retd., 1883.

GRISH CHANDER CHAUDHURI, B.L., Bengal Jud. Dept.—Served from 29th March, 1866, in non-gazetted appts.; subord. judge, Dec., 1877; small cause court judge, Hugli, Nov., 1891; Midnapore, Sept., 1895.

GROSE, JAMES, C.I.E., M.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 7th Oct., 1860; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., under sec. to govt., and receiver of the Carnatic property; fellow of Madras univ., May, 1868; sec. to board of rev., 1870; collr. and mag., Nellore,
March, 1877; acting dir. of rev. settlt., Nov., 1886; on special duty to Delhi, March, 1888; acting inam. commr., May, 1892; member of legisl. council in 1888, and 1891-92; member of board of rev., and commr. of land rev., Jan., 1889; member of exec. council, Jan., 1894; C.I.E., Jan., 1896.

GROVES, Henry Samuel, B.A., Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the service as prob'finl. dept., July, 1873; asst. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, Nov., 1887; dep. acctnt.-gen., Punjab, Nov., 1890; Madras, April, 1893; offg. compr., Central Prov., June, 1893.

GROVES, Herbert, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 23rd July, 1868, and posted to Mysore; exec. engr., Feb., 1876; transf'd. to Central India, Oct., 1882, and employed on state railways; transf'd. to Burma, May, 1887 (medal, with clasp); services lent to Mysore state, July, 1890; under sec. to govt. of Mysore, railway branch, July, 1891; joint sec., July, 1892; transf'd. to Burma, April, 1895; suptg. engr., Nov., 1895.

GROWSE, Edward Frederick, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Charterhouse, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 18th Nov., 1881, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., July, 1890; mag. and collr., July, 1894; mag. of Cuttack, Dec., 1895.

GRUNING, John Frederick, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Eastbourne Coll., and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 23rd Dec., 1893, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

GUBBINS, Frederick Bebb, C.B., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1835; served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr. of Benares, 1852; civil and sessions judge, Benares, 1857; commr. of rev. and circuit, Benares, agent, and supt. of ex-raja of Coorg, 1858; ret'd., 1863.

GUN, William Henry Maffett, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Greenock Acad. and Glasgow Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 17th Nov., 1871, and served in Bengal as asst. mag.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Feb., 1883; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1888.

GUNGARAM, Rai Bahadur, M.I.M.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 2nd Oct., 1873, and posted to Punjab prov'l. establ.; exec. engr., May, 1883.

GUNTER, Austin Herbert, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Dover Coll., and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1891, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

GUPTA, Nanendra Nath, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Calcutta Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 12th Dec., 1893, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

GUPTA, Kali Pada, M.A., M.B., F.R.C.S., Surgn. - Lieut.-Col., Bengal Medical Dept.—Joined the service, 13th June, 1872, and served as supt. of vaccn., and on gen. and jail duty; in 1888 acted in addn. as sanitary commr. for Bengal; civil surgn., July, 1891.

GURDON, Evelyn Pulteney, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 2nd April, 1852; from Aug., 1860, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., dep. commr., and small cause court judge; addl. commr., Nov., 1881; commr. and supt., Aug., 1884; divl. judge, Oct., 1885; ret'd. from civil employment, Jan., 1890.

GURDON, Philip Richard Thornhagh, Capt., I.S.C., Assam Commn.—Joined the army, 2nd Sept., 1882; apptd. asst. commr. in Assam, 2nd June, 1886; dep. commr., Feb., 1895.

GURDYAL SINGH, Sirdar, Punjab Commn.—Probr. under native civil service rules, 26th Jan., 1886; asst. commr., Jan., 1882; district judge, Nov., 1892.

GUTERSLOH, Frederic Nicholas, late Railway Branch, Govt. of India.—Joined the dept., June, 1874, as asst. engr. on the Indus valley state railway; manager, Wardha valley railway, Dec., 1878; locomotive supt., Rajputana railways, March, 1880; ret'd., June, 1891.

GWYTHER, Henry Thomas, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll., Roorkee; apptd. as apprentice engr., 21st March, 1874, and posted to Bengal; asst. engr., March, 1875; transf'd. to State Railways, Aug., 1875; exec. engr., Oct., 1889.

HABIB-ULLAH, Saiyid, Maulvi, Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. asst. mag. and collr., N.W. Prov., under the statutory rules, 14th Feb., 1887; joint mag., Sept., 1892; asst. commr., Nov., 1895.

HACKETT, Charles Augustus, late Geological Survey Dept.—Joined the dept. as asst., 15th Nov., 1861; served in the Sone valley, on the Vindhya, in Central India, and in Jabalpur and S. Rewa; designation changed to dep. supt.; ret'd., July, 1888.

HACKETT, Arthur Luke, Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 1st April, 1867; arrived, 25th Oct., 1867; served under the mil. dept., and in various acting civil appts.; from Oct., 1878, served as civil surg'n. at various stations, health officer and supt. of lock hosp., Madras, &c.; ret'd., May, 1895.

HADDON, Henry Edmonds, B.A., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. 1st Oct., 1876, and posted as asst. engr. to State Railways; exec. engr., May, 1888.

HAIG, Charles Thomas, Major-Gen., R.E., late Survey of India Dept.—Obtained his first commn. from Addiscombe, June, 1854; lieut., Bombay engrs., May, 1856; served with the Persian expdn., 1856-57 (medal and clasp), and with the Rajputana field force, 1857 (medal and clasp); asst. exec. engr. at Nimach, May, 1858; apptd. as asst. in the great trigonl. survey of India, Sept., 1859; served with the Okhamandal field force in 1859; dep. supt., Oct., 1867; on depn. as commr., Venice geographical exhibn., 1881; dep. surveyor-gen. in charge of trigonl. survey branch, Feb., 1887; ret'd. from civil employment, 1890; and from the army, April, 1891.

HAILEY, Hammet Reginald Clode, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch., and St. John's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 7th Dec., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.

HAILEY, William Malcolm, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch. and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 6th Dec., 1895, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

HAINES, Sir Frederick Paul, G.C.B.,
G.C.S.I., C.I.E., Field-Marshal.—Entered the army as ensign in 1839; mil. sec. to Sir Hugh Gough in the war on the Sutlej, 1845; was present at the battles of Mudki and Firozshah (medal and clasp); served through the Punjab campaign of 1848 and 1849, and was present at Rannagar, the passage of the Chenab, and the battles of Chillianwala and Gujrat; served with the 21st fusiliers through the campaign of the Crimea, 1854-55 (medal with four clasps, 5th class of the Medjidie and Turkish medal); K.C.B., 1871; G.C.B., 1877; commander-in-chief of the Madras army, and member of the govr.'s council, May, 1871, to 1875; commander-in-chief of the forces in India, with local rank of gen. and extraordinary member of the govr.-gen.'s council, April, 1876, to 1881, and directed the mil. operations of the Afghan campaigns of 1878-79 and 1879-80 (G.C.S.I.; thanked by both houses of parliament, 1879 and 1881).

HAINTS, HERMANN ANDERSON, Pol. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Wellington Coll., and Keble Coll., Oxford; junr. clerk, finl. dept., 15th Nov., 1881; pol. dept., 1886; précis writer, Dec., 1889, to Dec., 1894; senr. clerk, Feb., 1894.

HALL, CHARLES FREDERICK, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., Budaun, Feb., 1883; retd., Dec., 1886.

HALL, GEOFFREY CRAYTHORNE, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Jail Dept., N.W. Prov. anc Oudh.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1872, as asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ.; served under the mil. dept. until March, 1875, when he entered civil employ as offg. civil surgn. and supt. of jail, Jhansi; supt., central prison, Allahabad, Nov., 1877; inspr.-gen. of prisons, July, 1896; author of three med. works.

HALL, MONTAGU STANLEY, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Writer, India office, 21st Jan., 1875; clerk, 2nd class, Oct., 1878.

HALL, WILLIAM THOMAS, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Rossall, Kingstown Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 5th Dec., 1878, and served in British Burma as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; dir. of land records and agric., Oct., 1887; on special duty to Perak tin mines in 1888-89; dep. commr., Nov., 1892; acting prest., Rangoon municipality, March, 1894; offg. commr. and sessions judge, April, 1896.

HALLEN, JAMES HERBERT BROKENCOTE, C.I.E., F.R.C.S., Veterinary Lieut.-Col., late Civil Veterinary Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the service, 23rd May, 1850; acted as principal veterinary surgn., Abyssinian field force, Dec., 1867; prest. of the Indian cattle plague commn., Nov., 1869; inspecting veterinary surgn., Bengal army, July, 1872; ditto, horse-breeding operations, May, 1875; inspr.-gen., civil veterinary dept. in India, April, 1892; C.I.E., June, 1893; retd., May, 1894; author of 'Manual of the more deadly forms of Cattle Disease in India,' and the report of the cattle plague commn.

HALLETT, HENRY HONYWOOD HUGHES, Col., I.S.C., Police Dept., Central Prov.—First commn., July, 1838; arrived, 11th Aug., 1838; served with the Bundelkhand field force, 1859; from 26th Dec., 1868, served in the Central Prov. as personal asst. to chief commr., asst. commr., &c., and was apptd. supt. of the sch. of industry and central jail, Jabalpur, Aug., 1878; also supt. of reformatory sch., June, 1891; inspr.-gen. of police and jails, Oct., 1894.

HALLETT, JOHN REVANS, M.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at the Univ. of Melbourne; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 17th Oct., 1864; asst. mag. and collr., Bardwan, May, 1865; inspr. of schs., Aug., 1870; second inspr. of registrn. offices, March, 1876; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1878; district and sessions judge, Sept., 1880; retd., Feb., 1890.

HALLIDAY, SIR FREDERICK JAMES, K.C.B., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. in 1824; arrived, 8th June, 1825; served in Bengal as junr. asst. to the agent in the Saugor divn. and asst. registrar of the sadar court; joint mag. and dep. collr. in Bundelkhand, and afterwards in Noakhali and Balua, 1831-35; mag. and collr. at Dacca, Feb., 1835; mag., collr., and salt agent, Cuttack, Feb., 1836; sec. to the sadar board of rev., April, 1836; sec. to the govt. of Bengal, jud. and rev. depts., May, 1838; junr. sec. to the govt. of India, rev., jud. and legisl. depts., in addn. to his other duties, March, 1840, to 1843; sec. to the govt. of India, home dept., 1849; member of govr.-gen.'s council, Dec., 1853; lieut.-govr. of Bengal, May, 1854; retd. in 1859; member of council of India, Sept., 1868, to Dec., 1886.

HALLIDAY, FREDERICK MYTTON, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 30th Oct., 1856, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and mag. and collr.; offd. as opium agent, Benares, in 1876 and 1877; commr., April, 1878; chairman, port commrs., Calcutta, April, 1887; offd. at various periods as addl. member of govr.-gen.'s council; member of board of rev., April, 1889; retd., Nov., 1891.

HALLIFAX, ARTHUR GEORGE, B.A., Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Blundell's Sch., Tiverton, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 28th Dec., 1890, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf. to Assam as asst. commr., Nov., 1892.

HALLIFAX, CHARLES JOSEPH, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Blundell's Sch., Tiverton, and All Souls' Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 31st Dec., 1888, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; councillor to the Raja of Šuket, 1891-93.

HALLIFAX, HENRY FRANCIS, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Blundell's Sch., Tiverton, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 20th Sept., 1893, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

HAM, WILLIAM JAMES, Postal Dept. Govt. of India.—Joined the service, and was attached to the sea post office, Bombay, 6th May, 1868; supernumerary inspr., Oct., 1877; dep. postmr.-gen., Central India, May, 1880, and at Calcutta, attached to the railway mail service, April, 1882; asst. dir.-gen., June, 1887; inspr.-gen., railway mail service, Sept., 1890; has acted as postmr.-gen. at Lucknow, Calcutta, Madras, N.W. Prov. and Oudh.

HAMBLIN, RICHARD EBB, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., and Christ Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 4th Jan., 1878, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; asst. commr., June, 1887; joint
HAMILTON, FRANK SUMNER, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Manchester Gr. Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 10th Dec., 1885, and served as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1892.

HAMILTON, RIGHT HON. LORD GEORGE FRANCIS, M.P.—Born Dec., 1845; educ. at Harrow; ensign, rifle brigade, 1864; transd. to the Coldstream guards, 1868; was elected member for Middlesex, Dec., 1868, and represented that county in parliament until the election which followed the reform bill of 1885, when he was returned for the Ealing divn.; under sec. of state for India, Feb., 1874; vice-pres. of the committee of council on educn., April, 1878; first lord of the admiralty in the Marquis of Salisbury's first and second administrations, 1885-86, and 1886-92; chairman, London school board, 1894-95; sec. of state for India in Lord Salisbury's third administration, July, 1895.

HAMILTON, RICHARD ERRIS, Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the dept., 1st Aug., 1868; served as asst. acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov., and British Burma, asst. comptr.-gen., and asst. commr. of paper currency; offig. asst. sec., govt. of India, finl. dept., March, 1882; comptr. and dep. commr. of paper currency, Central Prov., Jan., 1883; comptr., India treasuries, Nov., 1891; acctnt.-gen., Punjab, April, 1894; acctnt.-gen., Bengal, March, 1896.

HAMILTON, ROBERT CLIFTON, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Christ's Hosp. and Keble Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 1st Dec., 1893, and served in Assam as asst. commr.

HAMILTON, THOMAS SHARP, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Old Trafford Sch., Manchester, Chester Coll., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 6th Nov., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; asst. judge, Nov., 1887; judge and sessions judge, April, 1890.

HAMILTON, WILLIAM HENRY, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, and class, 1st Nov., 1893.

HAMILTON, WILLIAM ROBARTS, B.L., Police Dept., Bombay.—Joined the service, 1st Feb., 1869; asst. to the rev. and police commr., Oct., 1869; dep. collr., May, 1874; city mag., Sept., 1874; Huzur dep. commr., July, 1876; presidency mag., Jan., 1888; author of a police manual, and works on local self-govt. and village customs.

HAMILTON, WILLIAM STIRLING, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Winchester, and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1893, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

HAMMICK, MURRAY, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Charterhouse; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 18th Dec., 1877, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and in Coorg as asst. commr. and mag.; from Jan., 1883, served in the Madras secretariat as asst. sec., jud. and legisl. depts., and acting under sec. in the rev. dept.; head asst., S. Kanara, April, 1885; acting postmr.-gen., Madras, 1886; sec. to the commrs. of land rev., Oct., 1887; collr. and mag., Malabar, Nov., 1893; inspr.-gen. of Madras police, Dec., 1894.

HAMMICK, STEPHEN, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Marlborough, and Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 21st Nov., 1868, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and tutor to the Maharaja of Kolhapur; on famine duty, Kaladgi, Sept., 1877; jud. asst. to the pol. agent, Kathiawar, Aug., 1883; judge and sessions judge, Shikarpur, Feb., 1885; member of Deccan agriculturists relief act comm., 1891-92; retd., June, 1894.

HAMNETT, FREDERICK HARPER, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Clifton Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 17th Nov., 1879, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; asst. acctnt.-gen., Madras, March, 1885; acting sub-collr., Godavari, April, 1886; head asst., Nov., 1887; sub-collr. and joint mag., June, 1891; district and sessions judge, Feb., 1895.

HAMNETT, GEORGE, C.I.E., late Regstrn. Dept., Madras.—Joined the service, 11th March, 1843; uncov. asst. to the consulting engr., Jan., 1859; marriage registrar for town of Madras, Jan., 1866; first uncov. asst., chief sec.'s office, Feb., 1867; receiver of the Carnatic property, Feb., 1875; inspr.-gen. of regstrn., Nov., 1880; C.I.E., June, 1885; was also registrar-gen. for Mysore, including Bangalore; retd., 1889; member of legisl. council, 1890-92.

HANCOCK, GEORGE EDWARD, Col., I.S.C., late Pol. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 13th Nov., 1859, and served under the mil. dept.; from Nov., 1863, served as asst. supt. of rev. survey and assessment, Gujarat; acting supt. of the Rajkot and Limbdi states, and acting asst. rest. at Aden, and at Baroda; asst. gen. supt. for thagi and dakiati, Oct., 1871; asst. pol. agent, Mahi Kantha, July, 1872; from Oct., 1873, served as supt. of surveys under rajasthanik court, Kathiawar; acting joint administrator of Gondal state, 1880-81, and was on special duty with the Thakur Saheb in Europe, 1883; on special duty to inquire into administration of Rajpipla state, Nov., 1883; third asst. pol. agent, Kathiawar, Feb., 1885, continuing to be supt. of surveys; prest. of the rajasthanik court, Jan., 1886; pol. supt., Savantvadi, May-Oct., 1891; pol. agent, &c., Kolhapur; offd. in Kathiawar, Jan., 1894; and again from March, 1895; returned to Europe, May, 1896.

HANDLEY, ALFRED PERCIVAL, B.L., Jud. Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service, 14th March, 1890, as offig. chief presidency mag. and judge of the court for trial of pilots, Calcutta, and served until Oct., 1891; from Feb., 1892, acted as presidency mag., and was apptd. judge of Calcutta small cause court, May, 1892; chief judge, Oct., 1893.

HANDLEY, FRANCIS FREDERICK, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Sydenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 7th Oct., 1872, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; senr. marriage registrar, Calcutta, Dec., 1880; first inspr. of regstrn. offices, Dec., 1881; acting inspr.-gen. of regstrn., April, 1885; joint mag. and dep. collr., Nov., 1885; district and sessions judge, April, 1889.

HANDLEY, JAMES WILLIAM, M.A., B.L., late Jud. Dept., Madras.—Served as govt. pleader from 29th Oct., 1868; fellow of Madras univ., March, 1881; first judge of the court of small causes, Madras, July, 1881; offig. judge of
the high court, 1885, and from July, 1889; retd., April, 1893.

HANKEY, Herbert, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Harrow, and Haileybury; apptd. in 1856; served in the Punjab till 1862, and subsequently in the Lower Prov., and was apptd. mag. and collr., Maldah, 1867, and subsequently at Chittagong; supt. of transport during famine of 1874; inspr.-gen. of police, Lower Prov., 1876; retd., 1878.

HANKIN, Edward Lewis, Lieut.-Gen., I.S.C., late Madras Police Dept.—Ensign, Dec., 1847; arrived, 16th June, 1848; served in the public works dept., Madras, from Aug., 1853, to July, 1859; served subsequently in the police dept. as supt. of police; acting mag. of police for town of Madras, March, 1870; joint mag., Utakamand, Nov., 1870; supt. of family payments and pensions, Oct., 1876; sec. to govt. mil. dept., Madras, Dec., 1882; returned to Europe, 1883.

HANKIN, Ernest Hanbury, M.A., Chemical Examin., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service, 26th Oct., 1892, as chemical examin., analyst, and bacteriologist.

HANNAGAN, John Salisbury, Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service, 18th Nov., 1859, and held various non-gazetted appts. till May, 1880, when he was apptd. sub-judge at Lucknow; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1892; served through the Mutiny (medal); retd., 1896.

HANNAN, John, Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 31st July, 1866, and served as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; suptg. engr., Dec., 1891; offg. joint sec. to govt., public works dept., April-Nov., 1893.

HANNAY, Alexander Lidderdale, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Uppingham, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 5th Dec., 1891, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

HAPPELL, William Alexander, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Crosshill Sch., Maybole, Glasgow Univ., and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 25th Nov., 1864, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; acting commr. of salt rev., Madras, 1881; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1883; collr. and mag., Nov., 1883; retd., Jan., 1892.

HARCOURT, Alfred Frederick Pollock, Col., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 15th Oct., 1855; from Sept., 1862, served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; jud. asst., March, 1877; dep. commr., April, 1877; retd., March, 1889; author of 'Down by the Drawl,' 'The Royal Umbrella,' and 'Kulu, Lahoul, and Spitti.'

HARDIE, Robert, Council of India.—Apptd. to the council of the sec. of state for India on 17th March, 1887; vice-pres., 1892-93; was previously engaged in the profession of banking, and held the office of sec. and treasurer of the Bank of Bengal for 15 years; in 1886 was a member of the finance committee apptd. by the govt. of India for the reduction of expenditure.

HARDING, Francis Henry, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Tonbridge Sch., and St. Catherine's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 24th Nov., 1874, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1885; district and sessions judge, May, 1890.

HARDING, Herbert Olive Denman, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 8th Dec., 1886, and served in Madras as asst. to mag. and collr.; head asst. collr., Coimbatore, Feb., 1893; special asst., Malabar, Dec., 1894.

HARDING, Herbert William, India Audit Office.—Associate of King's Coll., London; writer, India office, 27th April, 1868; junr. examin., India audit office, Nov., 1873; designation changed to junr. clerk, Oct., 1892; senr. clerk, Jan., 1895.

HARDY, Richard Gillies, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Witney Gr. Sch., and Victoria Coll., Jersey; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 1st Nov., 1871, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and asst. commr.; mag. and collr., July, 1889; offg. as commr., 1889, and from April, 1896.

HARE, Lancelot, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Hurstpierpoint, and City of London Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 5th Nov., 1873; served in Bengal and Assam as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; on famine duty, July, 1874; asst. sec. to chief commr. of Assam, March, 1879, and offg. sec., March, 1880; offg. inspr.-gen. of police, Assam, July, 1880; joint mag. and dep.collr., Nov., 1884; mag. and collr., June, 1890; offg. commr., April, 1896.

HARE, Robert Douglas, Berar Commn.—Joined the service as extra asst. commr., Chota Nagpur, 14th June, 1869; served on famine duty, May, 1874, and in Berar from Oct., 1875; asst. commr., May, 1878; judge of small cause court, June, 1883; dep. commr., July, 1889; dir. of land records and agric., July, 1890, to Aug., 1891.

HARE, William Ernest Kent, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Haversham Gr. Sch. and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 28th Dec., 1894, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

HARI KISHEN KAUL, Pandit, M.A., Punjab Commn.—Probr. under native civil service rules, 17th April, 1890; extra asst.commr., April, 1892; junr. sec. to finl. commrs., Dec., 1895.

HARINGTON, Arthur Henry, M.A., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 10th Oct., 1862; served in Oudh from Aug., 1863, as asst. commr. and junr. sec. to chief commr.; from Dec., 1866, to Jan., 1868, served under the govt. of India as offg. asst. sec., foreign dept., and offg. under sec., home dept.; offg. supt. of excise and stamps, Oudh, July, 1868; offg. settl. officer, Hardoi, March, 1870; manager of encumbered estates, Faizabad and Gonda, 1872-75; dep. commr., Aug., 1879; mag. and collr., Saharanpur, Oct., 1883; commr. in Oudh, June, 1889; commr., Allahabad, Nov., 1889; Meerut, May, 1891; retd., June, 1896; author of 'Economic Reform in Rural India.'

HARINGTON, Herbert Baring, M.A., late Oudh Commn.—Arrived, 2nd Feb., 1857, as asst. in telegraph dept.; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasp); from Feb., 1860, served in the Oudh commn. as asst. commr., and asst. settl. officer; offg. sec. to chief commr., 1869-73; also offg. dir. of public instr., 1870; dep. commr., July, 1875; district judge, Lucknow, 1879-81; retd., Nov., 1887.
HARINGTON, HERBERT SEPTIMUS, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., Jan., 1885; engr.-in-chief, Mari-Attock railway, April, 1893.

HARMAN, JOHN MACDONALD, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at the Calcutta Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd., 29th May, 1872, and employed on mil. works in the N.W. Prov.; transf'd. to state railways, Jan., 1880; exec. engr., May, 1883; offig. engr.-in-chief, N.W. railway (frontier section), April, 1895; Burma State railway, April, 1896.

HARRIDANCE, HENRY, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 8th March, 1878.

HARRIS, EDWARD BRANSON, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Bedford Commercial Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 14th Dec., 1877, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Feb., 1888; mag. and collr., June, 1892.

HARRIS (BARON), RIGHT HON. GEORGE ROBERT CANNING, G.C.S.I., G.C.I.E.—Educ. at Eton, and at Christ Church, Oxford, where he graduated B.A. in 1874; is J. P. and D. L. for Kent, and dep. chairman of the East Kent quarter sessions; under sec. for India in Lord Salisbury's first administration, June, 1885, to Feb., 1886; under sec. of state for war, Aug., 1886; gov'r. of Bombay, 12th April, 1890, to 18th Feb., 1895; G.C.I.E., May, 1890; G.C.S.I., May, 1895; apptd. a lord-in-waiting to Her Majesty, July, 1895.

HARRIS, GEORGE STEEL TRAVERS, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to Burma; exec. engr., Nov., 1881; lent to Rewa state, Dec., 1883; and to Gwalior, 1886-94.

HARRIS, HENRY NEVILLE, Bengal Police Dept.—Joined the service, 3rd April, 1866, as asst. supt. of police; employed in Assam in 1870; district supt., Feb., 1874.

HARRIS, LEONARD TATHAM, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Falmouth Gr. Sch., Bath Coll., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 10th Dec., 1893, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

HARRIS, ROBERT LISTON, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., London; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 1st Dec., 1877, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; dep't. to settlt. dept., 1883-84; district judge, Nov., 1889; divl. judge, July, 1894.

HARRISON, CHARLES HOLMES, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Rugby, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 30th Nov., 1893, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

HARRISON, CHARLES WILLIAM INGLEBY, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., 11th June, 1858; arrived, 9th Sept., 1860; served in the public works dept., irrig branch, N.W. Prov., from 10th April, 1863, as asst. engr., exec. engr., and asst. to chief engr.; suptg. engr., Dec., 1881; offig. as joint sec. to gov't., Bengal, July 1886, and as sec., April-June, 1888; chief engr., Dec., 1889; joint sec. to gov't., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Jan., 1890; sec., July, 1891; reverted to mil. dept., June, 1894; ret'd., Nov., 1894.

HARRISON, FRANCIS CAPEL, Indian C.S.—Educ. at Rugby, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 27th Nov., 1884, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in Assam as asst. commr.; offig. asst. acctnt.-gen., Madras, May, 1889; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, Sept., 1890; offig. under sec. to gov't. of India, fin. dept., May, 1892; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, Oct., 1892; acting acctnt.-gen., Madras, April, 1895.

HARRISON, HENRY ANTHONY, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1855; arrived, 3rd April, 1855; served from May, 1856, to Sept., 1858, in Bengal, as asst. mag. and collr., Cuttack, and subsequently in the N.W. Prov.; joint mag. and dep. collr., 1st grade, April, 1862; asstt. settlt. dept., Feb., 1864; mag. and collr., March, 1872; offig. commr., Jhansi divn., Sept., 1875; civil and sessions judge, March, 1878; ret'd., June, 1887.

HARRISON, PERCY, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 4th Nov., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.; under sec., March, 1894.

HARRISON, WILLIAM PRINGLE, Lieut.-Col., Oudh Commn.—Arrived as ensign, 10th Feb., 1861; employed under the mil. dept. till Oct., 1867, from which date he served in the Oudh commn. as asst. commr., offig. district supt. of police and supt. of encumbered estates in Sultanpur; sub-judge, Partabgarh, Aug., 1879; cantonmt. mag., July, 1881; dep. commr., Feb., 1888.

HART, GEORGE HENRY REEVES, Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Probr. in finl. dept., 20th July, 1869; asst. to comptr.-gen., Dec., 1870; asst. to private sec. to viceroy, 1874-76; asst. to acctnt.-gen., Bombay, 1877; private sec. to gov't. of Bombay, March, 1880; asst. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, Aug., 1887; dep. acctnt.-gen., Lahore, Jan., 1889; Bombay, Feb., 1891; has acted as comptr., India treasuries, Aug., 1893, and as asst. sec., fin. and commerce dept.

HART, JOHN HENRY EUSTACE, M.I.C.E., late Public Works Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 23rd Nov., 1854; joined the dept., Jan., 1855, and served as civil engr., acting exec. engr. for reclamations, Bombay, architectural exec. engr. and surveyor, Bombay, and acting supt., harbour works, Karachi; acting chief engr. for irrign., Sept., 1877; suptg. engr., March, 1880; joint sec. for irrign., March, 1880; chief engr., Dec., 1885; sec., public works and irrign. dept., Sept., 1887; ret'd., 1888.

HART, SIDNEY GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at King's Sch., Rochester, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 4th Dec., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

HART, WILLIAM, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. in 1834; served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag. and asst. judge and sessions judge; commr. for enquiring into claims, &c., S. Mahatta country, 1847; sec. to gov't., gen. and eccles. depts., 1855, also in the public works dept., and railway branch, 1856; puisne judge of the court of sadar diwani, 1860; rev. and police commr., S. divn., 1862; member of Bombay legisl. council, 1864; ret'd. in 1865.

HART-DAVIES, THOMAS, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Marlborough; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 13th Nov., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; from May,
1876, served in Sind as educl. inspr. and manager of encumbered estates; 1st asst. collr., April, 1887; judge and sessions judge, June, 1891; acted in May, 1895, as jud. commr. in Sind.

HARTNOLL, Henry Sullivan, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Exeter Gr. Sch., and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1883, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; dep. commr., July, 1890.

HARTT, William Edward, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 19th April, 1876; asst. traffic supt., state railways, 1878; district traffic supt., 1882.

HARTWELL, Sydney Charles Elphinstone, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. traffic supt., Oudh and Rohilkhand railway, 1st Jan., 1880; offg. manager, 1891-92, and from April, 1895.

HARVEY, Edward, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., 22nd Dec., 1859; served in the dept. from April, 1864; exec. engr., mil. works branch, June, 1871; served in the Lushai expdn., 1871-72 (medal and clasp), in the Jowaki Afridi campaign, 1878-79 (clasp), and in the Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal); supt. engr., May, 1880; retd., Oct., 1892.

HARVEY, John, Educl. Dept., Punjab.—Served as asst. and head master of various schs. from 1st Nov., 1869; asst. inspr. of schs., April, 1877; tutor to the Raja of Chamba, Nov., 1879; inspr. of schs., Nov., 1883.

HARVEY, Robert, D.S.O., M.D., Surgn.—Major-Gen., Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 31st March, 1865; from 1867 served as civil surgn., offg. sanitary commr., Bengal, med. inspr. of emigrants, and supt. of emigration; profr. of midwifery, med. coll., and obstetric physician to the coll. hosp., Sept., 1882; hon. surgn. on personal staff of the viceroy, May, 1883; reverted to mil. dept., March, 1890; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., Bengal, May, 1894; principal med. officer, Punjab, April, 1895.

HARVEY, William Leathem, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Royal Acadl. Instn., Belfast, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 23rd Dec., 1883, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settlt. officer; under sec. to govt., rev., finl. and gen. depts., Aug., 1891; 1st asst., Aug., 1894; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, July, 1895.

HARWARD, Alfred Edgar, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Rossall Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 12th Dec., 1885, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Feb., 1892; transfd. to Assam as asst. commr., April, 1894.

HASHMAT-ULLA, Maulvi, M.A., Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. a profr. under the native civil service rules, March, 1886; confd., 13th June, 1889, as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1894.

HASTED, John Ord, Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—2nd lieut., Madras engrs., Dec., 1853; served in the dept. from 30th Jan., 1856, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., April, 1865, and suptg. engr., Feb., 1877; chief engr. for irrign., and joint sec. to govt., April, 1884; fellow of Madras univ., 1883; sec., gen. and buildings and road branches, 1886; retd., July, 1890.

HASTINGS, Charles Godolphin William, Punjab Police.—Entered the service as asst. dist. supt., Sept., 1873; dist. supt., Dec., 1882; on special duty in Kabul, Feb.-Oct., 1880; with Chitral relief force, June-Sept., 1895; special duty in Kurram from March, 1896.

HASTINGS, Francis Theophilus Clinton, India Office.—Educ. at Haileybury Coll.; admiralty writer, 8th Oct., 1868; civil service copyist, Jan., 1874; clerk specially attached to the pol. and secret dept., India office, 7th March, 1877; rest. clerk, July, 1888; asst. private sec. to the sec. of state, June, 1892; précis writer, Nov., 1896.

HASTINGS, Warren, Major, I.S.C., Berar Commn.—Educ. at Brighton Coll.; first commn., 28th Feb., 1874; served in Bengal as cantonmt. mag. and small cause court judge from Jan., 1881; special asst. commr., Berar, Sept., 1887; dep. commr., July, 1891; in charge of provl. census operations, 1890-92.

HATCH, George Washington, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 20th Nov., 1893, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

HATCH, Henry Frederick, Bombay Survey Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Dec., 1873, and served as asst. supt.; supt. of surveys and asst. to pol. agent, Kathiawar, April, 1896.

HATCH, William Keith, M.B., C.M., F.R.C.S., Surgn.—Major, Bombay Med. Dept.—Arrived, 10th Nov., 1877; second surgn. of the Jamsetji Jijibhoy hosp., and profr. of anatomy, &c., Grant med. coll., May, 1884; senr. med. officer and senr. surgn. of the hosp., and profr. of surgery at the coll., April, 1893.

HATCHELL, Charles, Surgn.—Major, late Med. Dept., N.W. Prov.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., 23rd July, 1858; served in N.W. Prov. as civil asst. surgn. from Dec., 1859, to Oct., 1864, and subsequently under the mil. dept.; took part in the Bhutan expdn.; served again under govt. of N.W. Prov. from Nov., 1869, as civil asst. surgn., jail supt., and civil surgn.; retd., Oct., 1888.

HATHERLY, John Rodney, Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd July, 1863, as asst. engr., and was employed on various irrign. works; exec. engr., Feb., 1876.

HATHORNTHWAITE, James Thomas, M.A., Educl. Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Cambridge; arrived, 3rd Oct., 1872, and served from that date as profr. of mathematics at the Elphinstone coll., Bombay; also principal of the coll., April, 1894.

HATTEN, John James, B.A., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 12th Oct., 1875, and employed on irrign. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., May, 1883.

HAVELOCK, Sir Arthur Eliabk, G.C.M.G., G.C.I.E.—Entered the army, Jan., 1862; private sec. and A.D.C. to the officer administering the govt. of Mauritius, 1873-74; acting chief civil commr., Seychelles Islands, 1874-75; member of council, Fiji, and for a time colonial sec. and receiver-gen., 1875; prest. of Nevis, 1877; administering the govt. of St. Lucia, 1878-79; chief civil commr., Seychelles, 1879; govr. of W. Africa settls., 1881, and assisted in Anglo-French negotiations at Paris regarding that territory; consul for Liberia, 1881; K.C.M.G., 1884; govr. of Trinidad,
1884; govr. of Natal and special commr. for Zulu affairs, 1885; also govr. of Zululand, 1887; attended Brussels conference on the suppression of the slave trade, 1889; govr. of Ceylon, 1890; G.C.M.G., 1895; govr. of Madras, March, 1896; G.C.I.E., March, 1896.

HAWES, ARTHUR BRISCOE, Capt., India Office.—Educ. at Westminster; ensign, Bengal army, 14th Dec., 1849; chief exec. officer of telegraph from Bagdad to Constantinople, 1857-58; retd., Oct., 1858; asst. auditor, India office, March, 1859; member of committee for valuation of mil. equipments, April, 1863; author of a work on small arms ammunition.

HAWKINS, ROBERT WILLIAM LYONS, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 3rd Oct., 1873, and employed on irrign. works in N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Jan., 1884.

HAY, GEORGE WILLIAM ROBERTSON, M.D., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bombay Med.
