Dept.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1863; arrived, 24th Oct., 1868; served in the mil., civil, and jail branches of the service, and was apptd. port surgn. at Aden, June, 1876; sec. to the principal med. officer, Poona, Oct., 1890.

HAYDON, WILLIAM HENRY, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 17th Dec., 1862; arrived, 1st March, 1865; exec. engr., Jan., 1870; employed on Bombay reclamation works and defences, Tapti bridge, and with the Kandahar field force; employed under mil. works dept., 1890-91; ret., Dec., 1894.

HAYES, ALFRED, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 15th Feb., 1873, and employed on irrign. works in Bengal; on duty in Madras on famine relief works, 1877-78; exec. engr., May, 1883.

HAYWARD, MAURICE HENRY WESTON, LL.B., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Harrow and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 19th Nov., 1889, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; under sec. to govt. of Bombay, pol., &c., depts., Aug., 1895; jud. asst. to pol. agent, Kathiawar, Sept., 1896.

HAZLETT, HENRY JAMES, M.D., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1867; arrived, 8th Nov., 1867, and was employed on mil. and jail duty; analyst to salt commn., Madras, 1876; surgn., 4th district, Jan., 1887, to May, 1888; also profr. in med. coll., Aug., 1887; employed in mil. acts. dept. of govt. of India, 1888 and 1889; surgn., 3rd district, Feb., 1893.

HEAD, EDGAR ALFRED, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at King Edward's Gr. Sch., Bath; clerk, 2nd class, 30th May, 1895.

HEADLEY, ROBERT HOLLOWELL, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 9th March, 1896.

HEANEY, JOHN SAMUEL, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Royal Univ. of Ireland, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 4th Dec., 1895, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

HEATON, JOSEPH JOHN, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Bradford Gr. Sch., and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 24th Dec., 1881, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and acting under sec.; asst. judge and sessions judge, July, 1889; private sec. to govr. of Bombay, July, 1895.

HEAVISIDE, WILLIAM JAMES, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late Survey of India Dept.—Joined Addiscombe, Aug., 1857; lieut., Bengal engrs., June, 1859; served in the public works dept. as asst. engr. from Sept., 1862; asst. field engr. with the Bhutan force, 1865-66 (medal and clasp); joined the great trigonl. survey, Jan., 1866; dep. supt., April, 1872; served in Afghanistan, 1878-79 (medal), and subsequently in Khandesh and Bombay native states; retd., July, 1888.

HEBBERT, FREDERICK BENBOW, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1874; exec. engr., Sept., 1883; ofig. dep. consulting engr. for railways, Lucknow, April, 1887; under sec. to govt. of Bengal, public works dept., March, 1888; under sec. and dep. dir.-gen. of railways, May, 1892; ofig. manager, Burma state railway, Jan.-May, 1896.

HEINIG, JOSEPH, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 26th July, 1897, and posted to N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Oct., 1877; suptg. engr., Oct., 1895.

HEMING, DEMPSTER, Lieut.-Col., late Police Dept., Madras.—First commn., 16th Nov., 1861; proby. asst. supt. of police, Dec., 1865; dep. commr., Oct., 1874; asst. with the govt. of Madras, 1888, and 1890; supt. of police, Jan., 1892; retd., Feb., 1894.

HENDERSON, EDWARD PIERCY, B.L., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Edinburgh Acad., and St. Peter's Coll., Radley; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 10th Oct., 1871, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; govt. advocate, Feb., 1878.

HENDERSON, GEORGE, M.D., Surgn.-Major, late Med. Dept., Punjab.—Joined the Indian med. dept. in 1859; civil asst. surgn., Shahpur, May, 1862; supt. of Lahore central jail, April, 1868; ofig. supt., botanical gardens in Bengal, Dec., 1872; civil surgn., Gujranwala, Dec., 1875, and subsequently at other stations in the Punjab; retd., Nov., 1889.

HENDERSON, PHILIP DURHAM, C.S.I., Maj.-Gen., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Madras cavalry, Feb., 1857; attache, foreign dept., May, 1871; under sec. to the govt. of India, foreign dept., Nov., 1872; on special duty in Kashmir, 1874; pol. officer on staff of H.R.H. the Prince of Wales, Sept., 1875; C.S.I., March, 1876; gen. supt. of operations for suppression of thagi and dakitai, March, 1878; rest in Mysore, and chief commr., Coorg, April, 1892; reverted to mil. dept., Feb., 1895.

HENNESSY, SEPTIMUS HOPE, late Jud. Dept., Central Prov.—Joined the service as acting extra asst. commr., 13th July, 1864, and was confd., 8th July, 1867; judge, small cause court, Sept., 1889; acted also as cantonmt. mag. from Nov., 1888; retd., Jan., 1892.

HENNIKER, FREDERICK CHANDOS, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 26th Nov., 1887, and served in Assam as asst. commr.

HENRY, EDWARD RICHARD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at St. Edmund's Coll., Warc, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 22nd Oct., 1873, and served in Bengal; joint mag. and dep. collr., 1st grade, June, 1882; on famine duty, Tirhut, 1873; private
sec. to lieut.-govr. in 1879 and 1880; mag. and collr., May, 1890; offg. sec. to board of rev., 1890-91; inspr.-gen. of police, May, 1892.

HENSLOWE, CECIL WILLIAM EDWARD, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., June, 1866, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, and in the Central Prov.; transf'd to railway establ., Jan., 1880; engr.-in-chief and manager, Cawnpore-Farukhabad and Muttra-Hathras railways, Dec., 1880; manager, Cawnpore-Achnera state railway, 1884; transf'd to Burma state railway, Dec., 1886; retd., 1890.

HENVEY, FREDERICK, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Rugby Sch.; apptd. after exam.of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., under sec. to govt., offg. sec. to board of rev., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; on special duty in 1871 for purpose of compiling a narrative of the famine of 1869-70; under sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., July, 1874; offg. rest., Nepal, 1877-78; on special duty, Kashmir, April, 1878; commr., Haidarabad assigned districts, Jan., 1883; rest., E. Rajputana states, Dec., 1885; agent to the govrn.-gen. in Central India, Jan., 1889; retd., Jan., 1891.

HERALD, JOHN LUMGAR, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Arbroath High Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 24th Dec., 1883; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in Assam as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., May, 1884; mag. and collr., Aug., 1895; dep. commr., March, 1896.

HERBERT, CHARLES, Major, I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., June, 1874; served under the mil. dept. to 1882, including Afghan war of 1879-80; extra A.D.C. to viceroy, 1878 and 1882; offd. as asst. to the govrn.-gen., Rajputana, June, 1882; mag. of Abu, Nov., 1882; on depn. to Mewar states to settle boundary disputes, 1883; offg. cantonmt. mag., Nasirabad, 1884 and 1885-86; asst. commr., Ajmir, April, 1889; asst. to the agent, Rajputana, and chief commr., Ajmir-Merwara, March, 1891; offg. pol. agent in E. states of Rajputana, 1891-92; 1st asst. to agent, Central India, Oct., 1892; pol. agent, Kotah, March, 1894.

HERBERT, PATRICK HERBERT COGHLAN, Jud. and Public Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; junr. clerk, accts. branch, 11th March, 1872; jud. and public dept., 1877; rest. clerk, 1885-88; senr. clerk, May, 1891; private sec. to parl. under sec. of state (Mr. G. W. E. Russell, M.P.), 1892-94; editor of India Office List, 1897-91; compiled jointly with Mr. Newmarch the India office cypher code.

HERRON, HERBERT GEORGE WHITLEY, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Rugby and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 27th Dec., 1887, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf'd to Burma as asst. commr., Nov., 1888, and offg. under sec.; returned to Bengal, Nov., 1890.

HERSCHEL, JOHN, F.R.S., Col., R.E., late Survey of India.—Joined Addiscombe, Feb., 1855; first commn., Dec., 1856; arrived at Calcutta, Jan., 1859; served in the great trigonl. survey from Nov., 1859, in the grades of asst. surveyor and dep. supt.; retd., March, 1886.

HERVEY, HAMILTON LAW, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Giggleswick Sch. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 27th March, 1887, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., May, 1894.

HEWETSON, JOHN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Repton, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 13th Dec., 1880, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; served in Burma, from March, 1886, as asst. commr., judge, civil court, Mandalay, and district officer; returned to Madras, Oct., 1888; senr. asst., Ganjam, July, 1889; head asst., Aug., 1893; sub-collr. and joint mag., Dec., 1894.

HEWETT, JOHN PRESCOTT, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Winchester, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 17th Dec., 1877, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; in charge of provl. gazetteer, Aug., 1883; acted as asst. acctnt.-gen., Jan., 1884; junr. sec. to board of rev., April, 1884; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, home dept., Oct., 1886; confd., Aug., 1887; offd. as private sec. to the viceroy in 1888 and 1892, and as sec. to govt. of India, home dept., March, 1890; offg. census commr. for India, July, 1890; dep. sec. to govt. of India, home dept., Dec., 1890; C.I.E., May, 1891; dep. commr., March, 1893; sec. of royal commn. on opium, Oct., 1893; mag. and collr., April, 1894; sec. to govt. of India, home dept., Dec., 1895; author of contributions to provl. gazetteer.

HEWETT, WILLIAM SELWOOD, Major, I.S.C., Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—First commn., 30th Dec., 1871; arrived, 13th March, 1872, and was employed on mil. duty, including service in the Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal and clasp); cantonmt. mag., March, 1887.

HEWISH, JOHN, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Junr. clerk, 1st Feb., 1869; senr. clerk, Sept., 1883.

HEWITT, JAMES FRANCIS KATHERINUS, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1853; arrived, 12th Feb., 1859, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and settlt. officer; dep. commr., wards' estate in Behar, Feb., 1873; offg. sec., board of rev., Sept., 1874; mag. and collr., Oct., 1878; commr., Chota Nagpur, March, 1879; retd., July, 1885; author of 'The Ruling Races of Pre-Historic Times in India,' &c.

HEYWOOD, JOHN MAGEE, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined Addiscombe, Aug., 1854; 1st commn., Bengal engrs., June, 1856; served in the Bengal public works dept. from April, 1858, as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; suptg. engr., May, 1881; offg. chief engr., and joint sec. to govt. of Bengal, public works dept., 1883-84; chief engr. and joint sec., irrign. branch, Punjab, 1886; retd., Dec., 1889.

HIGGENS, ALFRED WILLIAM BUCKLE, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Haileybury; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 6th Dec., 1876, and served as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine duty, 1877-78; sec. to the draft forest bill committee, 1882; dep. conservator of forests, Cuddapah, Dec., 1882; also forest settlt. officer, July, 1886; sub-collr. and joint mag., June, 1890; principal asst. to collr., Jan., 1891; collr. and mag., Jan., 1892.

HIGGINS, ANDREW FRANK, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 23rd Oct., 1873, and posted to Haidarabad; exec. engr., May, 1881.

HIGGINS, JOHN JAMES, late Police Dept.,
Central Prov.—Apptd. acting adjutant, mil. police, Narsinghpur, for services rendered during the Mutiny under Sir Henry Havelock, Dec., 1858; from March, 1861, served in the police dept. of the Central Prov., and was promoted to district supt., 1st class, June, 1879; retd., March, 1894.

HIGHAM, THOMAS, C.I.E., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. proby. asst. engr., July, 1867; arrived, Oct., 1867, and served in the irrign. dept., Punjab; exec. engr., Sept., 1873; asst. sec. to govt., irrign. branch, Nov., 1882; supt. of works, Derajat, Sept., 1883; suptg. engr., Aug., 1886; offd. as chief engr. and joint sec. to govt., Punjab, July-Oct., 1891; chief engr. and sec., irrign. branch, Oct., 1894; author of 'Hydraulic Tables'; C.I.E., May, 1896.

HILDEBRAND, ARTHUR HEDDING, C.I.E., Burma Commn.—From Feb., 1868, served in the Burma police dept. as asst. supt.; from March, 1872, served in the Burma commn. as asst. commr., and was sent on special mission to Chiangmai, 1875, and in charge of expdn. to W. Karenni, 1876; dep. commr., Jan., 1885; supt., S. Shan states, May, 1888; C.I.E., May, 1888; supt. and pol. officer, S. Shan states, Aug., 1891.

HILDEBRAND, GODFREY, Col., R.E., late Mil. Works Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Oct., 1864; arrived, Jan., 1868; joined the public works dept., March, 1866, and served in Bengal and the N.W. Prov.; transf'd. to mil. works, May, 1872; sec. to defence committee, 1881; suptg. engr., March, 1886; dep. dir.-gen., mil. works, 1890-91; ass't. insp.-gen. of fortifications, War Office, July, 1894.

HILL, CHARLES H., B.L., Calcutta High Court.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1889, as public prosecutor to govt. of N.W. Prov. and Oudh; judge, Calcutta high court, April, 1892.

HILL, CLAUDE HAMILTON ARCHER, Indian C.S.—Educ. at St. Mark's Sch., Windsor, and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1887, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; under sec., pol., &c., depts., and sec. to legisl. council, Nov., 1892; under sec. to govt. of India, home dept., Aug., 1895.

HILL, FREDERICK GEORGE, Funds Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 6th July, 1882.

HILL, HARRY CHARLES, India Forest Dept.—Arrived, 16th Dec., 1872, and was apptd. asst. conservator of forests; dep. conservator of forests, April, 1879; transf'd. to the Punjab as offg. conservator, Jan., 1883; conservator of forests, and ex officio sec. to chief commr., Burma, in the forest dept. for Upper Burma, March, 1887; conservator, Naini Tal, March, 1893; acting inspr.-gen., 1889, 1893, and from Feb., 1895.

HILL, HENRY, Public Works Dept., India Office.—Educ. at the Edinburgh Acad. and Edinburgh Univ.; India office writer, old establ., 1859; junr. clerk, finl. dept., 1860; asst. private sec. and précis writer to the sec. of state, 1867-74; senr. clerk, Jan., 1872; rev. statistics and commerce dept., 1874; asst. sec. in that dept., Sept., 1877; asst. in the public works dept., and asst. govt. dir. of guaranteed Indian railway cos., June, 1892.

HILL, JOHN, Col., R.E., late Survey of India Dept.—Lieut., royal engrs., June, 1862; arrived, 10th Dec., 1865; apptd. to the trigonl. survey as asst. surveyor, Dec., 1866, and employed in Kumaon and Garhwal, Bombay, &c.; dep. supt., July, 1882; attached to Afghan boundary commn., Sept., 1884; supt. (new scale), Aug., 1892; in charge of tidal and levelling operations, Poona, Nov., 1890; reverted to mil. dept., Dec., 1895; retd., March, 1896.

HILL, THOMAS COUTTS, M.I.E.E., late India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd., 1st Aug., 1857; supt., British Burma, Feb., 1879; employed in connection with occupation of Upper Burma, 1886; chief supt., Sept., 1892; retd., March, 1894.

HILL, WILLIAM, Maj.-Gen., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Madras infantry, Aug., 1853; served in the Mysore commn. from July, 1859; dep. supt., Nov., 1862; dep. commr., April, 1873; acted for various periods as commr. of divn.; acting commr. of Coorg, 1881; from March, 1885, served as civil and sessions judge, Bangalore; returned to Europe, 1891.

HILTON, JOHN EDWARD, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 8th Oct., 1868, and posted to the Punjab; transf'd. to mil. works dept., May, 1872; exec. engr., Aug., 1877; transf'd. to Punjab provl. establt., Nov., 1880; under sec. to govt., Sept., 1892; suptg. engr., May, 1893.

HIRTZEL, FREDERIC ARTHUR, B.A., Jud. and Public Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Dulwich Coll. and Trinity Coll., Oxford (Craven scholar); fellow of Brasenose, 1895; apptd. junr. clerk, 11th June, 1894.

HITTU RAM, C.I.E., Rai Bahadur, Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1859, and held non-gazetted appts. till Feb., 1877, when he was apptd. native asst. to govr.-gen.'s agent in Baluchistan; on special duty with Afghan boundary commn., 1884; extra asst. commr., Jan., 1890; on special duty under Kalat state, May, 1893; author of a Baluchi manual, and a history of Dera Ghazi Khan.

HLA OUNG, MAUNG, Burma Accts. Dept.—Entered the service, 1872; and served in the finance dept.; asst. comptr., Nov., 1880; has published a revision of 'Gordon's Burma manual.'

HOARE, HERBERT JAMES, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at private schs. and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 4th Nov., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1895.

HOBART, ROBERT THOMPSON, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov., as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; dep. inspr.-gen. of police, Dec., 1873; inspr.-gen. of prisons, Oct., 1882; inspr.-gen. of police, May, 1886; retd., Dec., 1880.

HOBDAY, JAMES RAMSAY, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Survey of India Dept.—First commn., 13th Jan., 1869; proby. asst. supt., survey dept., Sept., 1874; confid., July, 1875; served in the Afghan war, 1879, and with Upper Burma field force, 1886; dep. supt., Jan., 1887; accompanied special expdn. in Upper Burma along the Chinese frontier, 1890-91.

HOBHOUSE (BARON), RIGHT HON. ARTHUR HOBHOUSE, K.C.S.I., C.I.E., Q.C.—Born 10th Nov., 1819; educ. at Eton and Balliol Coll.,
Oxford, where he gained a first-class in classics in 1840; called to the bar, 1845, and practised in the Rolls court; Q.C. in 1865; apptd. a charity commr. in 1866; endowed schools commr., 1869; legal member of council of the govrn.-gen. of India, 1872-77; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1877; arbitrator under the Epping Forest Act, 1878; privy councillor, and member of the jud. committee, 1881; created a baron in 1885; one of the quorum of the House of Lords for jud. purposes; author of 'The Dead Hand,' a collection of addresses connected with endowments and the settlements of land, 1880; contested Westminster unsuccessfully in the general election of 1880.

HOBHOUSE, Sir Charles Parry, Bart., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Rugby; apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 22nd July, 1844, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in the finl. dept., govt. of India, as asst. to sub-treasurer, and asst. to acctnt.-gen.; collr. of Bardwan, 1857-59; mag. and collr., 1859; on special duty in 1860 to adjudicate on suits arising out of the indigo disturbances, Nuddea and Jessoor; supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, and govt. advocate, 1862; also member of Bengal legisl. council, 1863-64; civil and sessions judge, 1864-66; member of govrn.-gen.'s legisl. council, 1866; chairman of the Orissa famine fund, 1867; judge of the high court, 1868-71; retd., 1872.

HODGES, Robert Nathaniel, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 15th Oct., 1873, and posted to N.W. Prov. and Oudh; transf'd. to state railways, Nov., 1879; exec. engr., Sept., 1880; employed as engr.-in-chief on several railway surveys, including Saugor-Katni scheme.

HODGSON, George Robert, Lieut.-Col., Madras Police Dept.—Admitted to Bombay staff corps, 23rd June, 1863; after service under the mil. dept., was apptd. acting asst. supt. of police in Madras, March, 1869; confd., Dec., 1872; supt., Oct., 1882; retd., July, 1895.

HODGSON, Godfrey Beckett, Capt., I.S.C., Survey of India Dept.—First commn., 1st May, 1878; served in Afghan war, 1880; apptd. proby. asst. supt., 13th Sept., 1883; confd., July, 1884; dep. supt., May, 1889.

HODSON, Charles William, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1873, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., April, 1883; supt., way and works, N.W. railway, Nov., 1891; engr.-in-chief, Mushkat-Bolan railway, July, 1894; services lent to Ceylon Govt., June, 1896.

HODSON, Richard George, late Educn. Dept., Burma.—Joined the dept. as dep. inspr. of schs., Mysore, April, 1861; inspr., April, 1867; acting dir. of public instrn., 1879-80; transf'd. to Burma as acting principal, high sch. Rangoon, April, 1880; from Oct., 1881, served as inspr. of schs. in Burma, and offf. as dir. of public instrn.; retd., Feb., 1893; has transf'd. Munshi Srinivasaya's 'Dialogues in Kanarese.'

HODSON, Thomas Callan, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Christ's Hosp. and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 11th Dec., 1895; and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

HOEY, William, M.A., D.Lit., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Wesleyan Connexional Sch., and Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 18th Oct., 1872, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., asst. mag., and joint mag.; employed on archaeological explorations in Gonda in 1884; dep. commr., Feb., 1890; mag. and collr., Aug., 1890; author of 'Trades and Manufactures in N. India,' 'A History of Asaf-ud-Daulah, Nawab Wazir of Oudh,' 'Buddha; His Life, His Doctrine, and His Order,' 'Memoirs of Delhi and Fyzabad,' &c., &c.

HOGAN, John Lemon Poictevin, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 1st Nov., 1873, and posted to mil. works; transf'd. to Mysore, Sept., 1877; to Central Prov., Sept., 1878; and to state railways, Jan., 1880; services lent to Bombay, Baroda and Central India railway co., Jan., 1885; exec. engr., Feb., 1885.

HOGG, Adam George Forbes, C.B., Lieut.-Gen., I.S.C., late Pol. Dept., Bombay.—First commn., Bombay infantry, Jan., 1854; served with the Persian expdn., 1857 (medal and clasp), in the Mutiny, the China war, 1860, the Abyssinian expdn., 1867-68 (medal), and the Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal and clasp); apptd. pol. rest. and collr. of stamp rev., with charge of the vice-admiralty court, Aden, May, 1885; reverted to mil. duty, 1890.

HOGG, Sir Frederic Russell, K.C.I.E., C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1856; arrived, 12th Feb., 1857, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; postmr.-gen., Punjab and Sind, July, 1863; postmr.-gen., Bengal, Nov., 1868; representative of the govt. of India at the postal congress, Paris, 1878; dir.-gen. of post office of India, March, 1882; C.S.I., Feb., 1887; K.C.I.E., May, 1888; retd., April, 1889.

HOGG, Stapleton Cotton, Finl. Dept., India Office.—Temporary clerk, 25th July, 1861; junr. clerk, accts. dept., 1862; transf'd. to finl. dept., 1863; senr. clerk, Dec., 1875; asst. sec., Sept., 1895.

Hogg, Sir Stuart S., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1853; arrived, Jan., 1853; served in the Punjab as asst. commr. till 1859, and afterwards in Oudh as dep. commr.; mag. and collr., Bardwan, 1861; chairman, justices of the peace, Calcutta, 1866; commr. of police, Calcutta, and member of Bengal legisl. council, 1874; retd., 1878.

HOGG, Theodore William, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., 4th Dec., 1857; arrived, 28th Jan., 1858; and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. from Aug., 1867; small cause court judge, March, 1883; dep. commr., Aug., 1889.

HOJEL, Abraham Nickson, Brigade-Surgn., M.K.Q.C.P., L.R.C.S. (Ir.), late Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the Indian med. service, 27th July, 1859, and served under the mil. dept.; profr., Grant med. coll., and asst. surgn., Jamsetji Jijibhoy hosp., Feb., 1865; from July, 1866, to Nov., 1871, served in the Persian Gulf as civil surgn., Bushire, and asst. to the rest.; served subsequently under the mil. dept., and as acting ophthalmic surgn., presidency surgn., and marine surgn., Bombay; profr. of physiology, Grant med. coll., and second physician, Jamsetji Jijibhoy hosp., Sept., 1876; physician of the European hosp., April, 1887; retd., April, 1891.

HOLBROW, Stanley Charles, Police
Dept., Punjab.—Joined the service, 16th May, 1864, as asst.; district supt., April, 1873.

HOLDERNESS, THOMAS WILLIAM, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 17th Feb., 1873, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., asst. sec. to govt., and junr. sec. board of rev.; under sec. to govt. of India, rev. and agric. dept., Sept., 1881; joint mag., N.W. Prov., April, 1885; under sec. to govt., N.W. Prov., Nov., 1886; dir. of land records and agric., Nov., 1888; sec. to govt., finl. dept., March, 1892, at the same time acting as sec. in the jud. dept.; member of legisl. council, Aug., 1892; mag. and collr., Aug., 1893; sec. to govt., judl. dept., July, 1894.

HOLDICH, THOMAS HUNGERFORD, C.B., C.I.E., Col., R.E., Survey of India.—Lieut. royal engrs., Dec., 1862; arrived, 3rd March, 1865, and served in the Bhutan campaign, 1865 (medal and clasp); joined the topogr. survey, July, 1866; on duty with the Abyssinian expedit., 1867-68 (medal); joined the Afghanistan field force in 1879, and was in charge of survey operations in N. Afghanistan during second period of the campaign, and asst. field engr. during defence of Sherpur (medal and clasp); in charge of Kohat topogr. survey, Feb., 1881; dep. supt., April, 1883; in charge of Baluchistan topogr. survey, Oct., 1883; attached to the Afghan boundary comm., Sept., 1884; survey officer with the Zhob field force in 1890; supt. (new scale), Aug., 1892; C.B. and C.I.E., May, 1894; on special duty with Khaibar-Asmar delimitation commn., 1894-95; in charge, Purna detachment, June, 1895; temporary appt. to Ceylon, Sept., 1896; author of articles on the geography of Afghanistan and the Indian frontier, and on mil. instrn., topography, &c.

HOLIDAY, FREDERICK CHARLES, India Audit Office.—Temporary clerk, 17th June, 1861; junr. asst., June, 1863; senr. examr., Dec., 1868; designation changed to senr. clerk, Oct., 1892; asst. auditor, Jan., 1895.

HOLME, ALAN THOMAS, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch., Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 15th Nov., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr.

HOLME, CHARLES HENRY, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll., apptd. 1st Oct., 1876, and posted as asst. engr. to N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., March, 1891.

HOLME, HENRY EDWARD, B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 27th Sept., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; under sec. to govt., May, 1894.

HOLMES, ROBERT ANDREW KING, M.A., M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Jail Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1872, as asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ.; jail supt., Meerut, April, 1876; transfld. in similar capacity to Lucknow, Feb., 1885; in 1892 acted as inspr.-gen. of prisons.

HOLMES, WILLIAM, late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Windermere Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 21st Nov., 1868, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; in charge of Amir Yakub Khan, March, 1880; joint mag., April, 1881; private sec. to lieut.-govrn., N.W. Prov., March, 1883; asst. commr., Oudh, Dec., 1883; joint mag., June, 1884; dep. commr., Aug., 1887; mag. and collr., Dec., 1888; acted as inspr.-gen. of police in 1893; retd., Sept., 1894.

HOLMES, WILLIAM CUTHBERT, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 7th Nov., 1877, and served in Madras as asst. mag. and collr., and in Bombay as offg. asst. acctnt.-gen.; head asst., Coimbatore, Dec., 1884; sub-collr. and joint mag., Jan., 1890; district and sessions judge, S. Kanara, Feb., 1893.

HOLMS, JOHN MITCHELL, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 26th Nov., 1883, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1889; junr. sec. to board of rev., May, 1889, and Feb., 1891; asst. commr., Oudh, March, 1892; joint mag., Sept., 1892; acted as registrar, high court, in 1894; offg. joint sec. to rev. board, June, 1895; dep. commr., Nov., 1895.

HOLWOOD, HERBERT, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Uppingham; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 16th Dec., 1879, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Feb., 1890; inspr.-gen. of registrn., Nov., 1890; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1894.

HOLROYD, WILLIAM RICE MORLAND, Col., I.S.C., late Educl. Dept., Punjab.—First commn., as ensign, Dec., 1853; served from 11th Aug., 1858, as inspr. of schools, and was apptd. dir. of public instrn., Punjab, Feb., 1868; under sec. to govt., educ. dept., Oct., 1884; reverted to mil. duty, Oct., 1890.

HOME, ALEXANDER LEFEVRE, Indian Forest Dept.—From 1st March, 1864, served in the dept. in the Punjab, Central Prov. and Bengal, and was apptd. dep. conservator, Oct., 1871; asst. comptr.-gen. of forests, April, 1877; conservator of forests, Bengal, April, 1883; Upper Burma, Oct., 1892; Assam, Dec., 1894.

HOME, FREDERICK JERVIS, C.S.I., Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., 11th June, 1858; arrived, 9th Sept., 1860; served in the public works dept., N.W. Prov., irrign. branch, from Feb., 1861, as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; suptg. engr., Jan., 1883; offg. chief engr., irrign. branch, and joint sec. to govt., N.W. Prov., 1885; on special duty in the Bharatpur state, Oct., 1886; chief engr. and joint sec., Punjab, Dec., 1889; inspr.-gen. of irrign. and dep. sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., Nov., 1890; C.S.I., May, 1892; reverted to mil. dept., Oct., 1894; retd., May, 1895.

HOME, WALTER, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. 1st Oct., 1877, and posted as asst. engr. to State Railways; exec. engr., Dec., 1891.

HOOKER, WILLIAM HENSLOW, Store Dept., India Office.—Supervisor, and grade, India store depot, Aug., 1877; 1st grade, July, 1883.

HOOPER, JOHN, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., and Univ. of London; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 7th Dec., 1871, and served in Oudh as asst. commr.; settlt. officer, Basti, Nov., 1884; mag. and collr., April, 1890; sec., board of rev., Aug., 1890; author of Basti settlt. report,
HOOPER, WILLIAM ROE, Surgn.-Major-Gen., Med. Board, India Office.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establt., Feb., 1859; arrived, Aug., 1859, and served in Bengal, holding various mil. med. charges; from July, 1861, served in the N.W. Prov. as civil asst. surgn., jail supt., Benares, and civil surgn. at Benares and Lucknow; prest. of the India office med. board, Jan., 1895.

HOPE, CHARLES WILLIAM WEEBLEY, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Mannamead Sch., Plymouth, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, and Dec., 1885, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Aug., 1860; asst. commr., Oudh, June, 1891; settl. officer, April, 1893; joint mag., April, 1896.

HOPE, HUGH RICHARD, C.B., Major-Gen.—Joined the service, 4th Nov., 1860; A.D.C. to Sir W. Denison, gov. of Madras, 1863-64; sec. to govt. of Madras, mil. dept., Oct., 1891, to 1st April, 1895, when appt. was abolished.

HOPE, JAMES, B.A., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1861, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; served in Bombay, 1864-67; principal asst. collr., Ganjam, Sept., 1870; from Jan., 1877, served in the jud. dept. as district and sessions judge; retd., 1888.

HOPE, SIR THEODORE CRACRAFT, K.C.S.I., C.I.E., B.L. late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury Coll.; arrived, 5th June, 1853, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and educ. inspr.; private sec. to gov. of Bombay, May, 1860; prest. of committee on finances of educ.dept., March, 1861; joint commr. to receive N. Kanara from the Madras govt., Feb., 1862; dep. commr. of customs, salt, and opium, Oct., 1862; collr. and mag., Jan., 1867; from July, 1875, served as addl. member of the gov.r-gen.'s council, also acting as sec. to govt. of India in dept. of rev., agric. and commerce, and was apptd. addl. sec. for famine, Dec., 1876; reapptd. as addl. member of gov.r-gen.'s council in 1877 and 1878; commr., N. divn., and agent to gov.r., Surat, Jan., 1878; on special pol. duty in England, 1878; provisional member of council, Bombay, Oct., 1880; sec. to govt. of India, fin. and commerce dept., Aug., 1881; ordinary member of gov.r-gen.'s council in charge of public works dept., July, 1882; C.I.E., July, 1882; K.C.S.I., May, 1886; retd., Jan., 1888.

HOPKINS, EGBERT SILAS, Finl. Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, registry dept., 14th Nov., 1883; transf. to finl. dept., Sept., 1891.

HOPKINS, HENRY MAYNE REID, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 24th Nov., 1887, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Aug., 1892; asst. supt. and small cause judge, Dehra Dun, Feb.-Dec., 1893; asst. commr., Feb., 1896.

HOPKINS, JOHN ARTHUR, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 14th Oct., 1861, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., inspr. of schs., and offg. inspr.-gen. of registrn.; mag. and collr., March, 1878; offg. commr., June, 1888; opium agent, Bihar, April, 1893; retd., Dec., 1896.

HOPKINSON, WILLIAM, Col., Bengal Infantry.—First commn., 1859; from 28th Nov., 1867, served in Bengal as asst. commr. and sub-registrar of assurances; cantonmt. mag., March, 1874; small cause court judge, Nov., 1875; dep. commr., April, 1886; again cantonmt. mag., April, 1887; retd., Jan., 1891.

HORDERN, PETER, B.A., late Educl. Dept., Burma.—Apptd. to the dept., 19th Nov., 1861; arrived, March, 1862; asst. prof'r, presidency coll., Calcutta, March, 1862; dir. of public instrn., British Burma, Nov., 1867; fellow of Calcutta univ., April, 1876; retd., 1889; author of a 'Handbook of Rules and Practice of the Educl. Dept., Burma.'

HORMASJI DADABHAI, Khan Bahadur, Bombay Jud. Dept.—Joined the service, 26th April, 1889; judge, Bombay small cause court, July, 1891.

HORN, DAVID BAYNE, F.C.H., A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrign. works in Bengal; asst. sec. to govt., irrign. branch, Feb., 1878; exec. engr., March, 1882; under sec., public works dept., 1885-86; suptg. engr., Feb., 1896.

HORNE, WILLIAM OGILVIE, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 7th Dec., 1882, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and acting dep. registrar, high court; head asst., March, 1890; special asst., Ganjam, Feb., 1893; dep. commr. of salt, &c., rev., Nov., 1893; head asst., S. Kanara, March, 1894; sub-collr. and joint mag., April, 1890.

HORSFALL, JEREMIAH GARNETT, C.I.E., B.L., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Giggleswick Gr. Sch., and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1861; served in Madras, and was apptd. district and sessions judge, April, 1878; collr. and mag., Jan., 1879; retd., April, 1890; C.I.E., May, 1890.

HORSFALL, THOMAS MENDELSSOHN, B.L., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Wilhelms-Gymnasium, Berlin; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 5th Dec., 1876, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Madura, Dec., 1884; also forest settl. officer, Nov., 1885; registrar of high court (appellate side), Sept., 1888; principal asst., Ganjam, Dec., 1890; collr. and mag., Dec., 1891; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1892.

HORSTFORD, NORMAN MACLEOD THOMAS, Col., I.S.C.—Arrived, as ensign, 29th Dec., 1857, and served in the Mutiny campaign (medal and clasp); from Aug., 1861, served in the police dept., N.W. Prov., as asst. inspr.-gen., and district supt.; and from Dec., 1867, in Oudh as asst. commr., junr. sec., and offg. dir. of public instrn.; supt. of encumbered estates, Rae Bareli, 1874-76; offg. supt. of excise and stamps, and inspr.-gen. of registrn., April, 1876; cantonmt. mag., Lucknow, March, 1878; city mag. and wasika officer, Lucknow, April, 1883; district judge, April, 1886; dep. commr., March, 1887; chief commr., Andaman and Nicobars, April, 1892; reverted to mil. dept., Sept., 1895.

HORSLEY, WILLIAM HENRY, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at King's Sch., Canterbury, and Corpus Christi Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 31st Oct., 1870; served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and was in charge of the forests in Khandesh, 1872-74; on famine duty, 1874 and 1877; forest
settlt. officer, Nov., 1878; second asst. collr., Sept., 1883; judge and sessions judge, May, 1887; retd., Jan., 1896.

HORSPPOOL, WILLIAM PADDISON, India Audit Office.—Educ. at the Newark Coll. Sch.; clerk, 2nd class, 19th Aug., 1878.

HÖRST, HENRY, late Survey Dept., Govt. of India.—Librarian and accountant, Thomason coll., Jan., 1833; sub-asst., great trigonl. survey, Sept., 1854; in charge of picket which repulsed night attack on Murree sanitarium, 1857 (medal); transf'd. to topogr. survey, April, 1868; supt., Sept., 1882; retd., 1889.

HORST, WALTER PHILIPS VONDER, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 17th Oct., 1872, and employed on irrign. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; offg. asst. sec., public works dept., 1881 and 1882-84; exec. engr., Jan., 1883.

HOSE, JOHN WALTER, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Dulwich and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1886, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., May, 1891; under sec. to govt., April, 1893; registrar, high court, March, 1894.

HOSKING, EDWARD, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 1st Feb., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., asst. judge and sessions judge, and registrar of the high court; judge and sessions judge, Jan., 1884; acted as jud. commr. and judge of the sadar court in Sind, in 1890-91 and 1892; jud. commr., Lower Burma, Nov., 1892; offg. as judge, high court, Burma, May, 1896.

HOSKINS, WILLIAM HENRY, Col., I.S.C., Police Dept., Madras.—Ensign, Madras infantry, July, 1858; arrived, 7th Sept., 1858; served in dept. from May, 1863, as asst. supt. and supt.; vacated, Dec., 1895.

HOSKYNS, CHARLES REGINALD, Major, R.E., India Public Works Dept.—First commn., 9th Jan., 1873; apptd., 29th Sept., 1876, and employed on the Punjab N. and Indus valley railways; transf'd. to superior accts. establt., and served as dep. examr. and examr.; dep. acctnt.-gen. for inspn. duty, March, 1894; examr., guaranteed railway accts., Bombay, Oct., 1894.

HOUGH, ALFRED LACEY, Burma Commn.—Joined the service, 25th Oct., 1870, as sub-asst. conservator of forests; apptd. to the commn. as extra asst. commr., Oct., 1874; dep. commr., Aug., 1891.

HOUGHTON, BERNARD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at All Saints, Bloxham, Wellingborough Gr. Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 23rd Jan., 1885, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; transf'd. to Burma, as asst. commr., Aug., 1886; dep. commr., March, 1891; author of an 'Essay on the Language of the S. Chins,' and other linguistic works.

HOUSDEN, CHARLES EDWARD, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd. 23rd Oct., 1876, and posted as apprentice engr. to Rajputana; asst. engr., Oct., 1877; transf'd. to Upper Burma, Jan., 1887; exec. engr., Sept., 1887; asst. sec. to chief commr., Feb., 1890; under sec. to chief commr., Dec., 1895.

HOUSE, HENRY FREDERICK, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bristol Gr. Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 10th Nov., 1884, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., asst. supt., Dehra Dun, and asst. commr.; settlt. officer, Nov., 1893; has edited the N.W. Prov. rent act.

HOUSLEY, ARTHUR WILLIAM, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 19th Feb., 1872; junr. clerk, June, 1882.

HOUSTON, JOHN, M.D., Dep. Surgn.-Gen., late Madras Med. Dept.—Apptd., 4th Aug., 1855; arrived, 3rd March, 1856, and served in Mysore in various mil. charges, and also as civil surgn., chemical examnr., and supt. of jail; from July, 1871, served as surgn. to the Mysore commn., and afterwards to the Mysore govt.; retd., March, 1886.

HOWARD, EDWARD STAFFORD.—Educ. at Harrow, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; called to the bar at the Inner Temple, 1875; M.P. for E. Cumberland, 1876-85, and for the Thornbury divn. of Gloucestershire, 1885-86; under sec. of state for India, April-Aug., 1886; apptd. a commr. of woods and forests, Oct., 1893.

HOWARD, WILLIAM STUART, M.I.C.E., late Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 10th June, 1859; arrived, 20th Nov., 1859; exec. engr., Dec., 1865; chief engr., Aug., 1888; sec. to govt. of Bombay, public works dept., June, 1892; retd., Feb., 1894.

HOWELL, ARTHUR PEARSE, M.A., late Bengal C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1857; arrived, 27th Jan., 1858, and served in the N.W. Prov. and in Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; from April, 1864, to March, 1878, served in the secretariat of the govt. of India, in the finl., home, and rev. depts.; commr., Jabalpur, Central Prov., April, 1877; sec., famine commn., March, 1878; commr., Narbada, Sept., 1878; acting jud. commr., Central Prov., 1879-80, and again in 1885; commr., Haidarabad assigned districts, June to Dec., 1882; member of educn. commn., 1882-83; offg. rest., Haidarabad, March, 1888; retd., Aug., 1889; author of notes on educn. in India, and on jails and jail discipline, and of a paper on educn. legislation.

HOWELL, MORTIMER SLOPER, C.I.E., LL.D., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Christ's Hosp., and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 10th Oct., 1862, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; offg. inspr. of public instrn., April, 1867; asst. supt. and small cause court judge, Dehra Dun, March, 1868; joint mag. and dep. collr., Feb., 1871; mag. and collr., Nov., 1879; from March, 1880, served as district and sessions judge in various districts; addl. jud. commr. in Oudh, Dec., 1891; jud. commr., Nov., 1892; retd., April, 1896; author of an Arabic grammar.

HOWLETT, RICHARD ROSS, B.A., Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Westminster Sch., and Christ's Coll., Cambridge (scholar); junr. clerk, 16th April, 1895.

HUDSON, CHARLES WILLIAM MAITLAND, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Doveton Protestant Coll., Madras, Madras Univ., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 1st Nov., 1887, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., May, 1895.

HUDSON, WILLIAM HERBERT, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at
Pembroke Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 17th Nov., 1861; from Jan., 1863, served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; on famine duty in Behar, 1873-75; from May, 1880, served in the jud. dept., N.W. Prov., as civil and sessions judge; retd., Jan., 1890.

HUGHES, ARTHUR JOHN, C.I.E., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 11th July, 1862, and arrived, 7th Dec., 1862; exec. engr., Dec., 1869; asst. sec. to govt. of Bengal, irrign. branch, May, 1872; on famine works, Salem district, Sept., 1877; served under the foreign dept. in Kashmir, 1884-85; suptg. engr., Nov., 1888; suptg. engr. for waterworks, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, 1888-93; offic. chief engr. and sec. to chief commr., Central Prov., April, 1895; retd., 1896; author of a report on the feasibility of improved water communication between the Ganges and Calcutta.

HUGHES, DAVID ERSKINE, M.D., F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Col., late Bombay Med. Service.—Joined the service, March, 1866; arrived, 9th Nov., 1866; served under the mil. dept., and also acted as civil surgn.; civil surgn. and supt. of jail, Belgaum, from May, 1882; civil surgn., Poona, Sept., 1890; reverted to mil. dept., Sept., 1892; and apptd. prin. med. officer, Bombay and Aden dists.

HUGHES, EDWARD WILLIAM MACKENZIE, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., April, 1871, as asst. engr., Punjab irrign.; locomotive supt., Dhond-Manmad state railway, May, 1879; Indus valley railway, Feb., 1881; dep. locomotive supt., N.W. railway, Jan., 1886; on special duty in Mexico in 1887-88; locomotive supt., E. Coast railway, Jan., 1892; retd., Aug., 1893.

HUGHES, GEORGE, late Bengal C.S.(Punjab).—Educ. at the Liverpool Inst., and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 23rd Oct., 1875, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and offic. under sec.; district judge, Aug., 1890; asst. commr., 1st grade, Dec., 1890; retd., Dec., 1891.

HUGHES, JOHN WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the City of London Sch., and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 25th Nov., 1892, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

HUGHES, RALPH BULLER, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Marlborough, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 4th Nov., 1892, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

HUGHES, THEODORE WILLIAM HUGHES, A.R.S.M., F.G.S., late Geological Survey of India.—Apptd. assts., and joined, 11th Nov., 1862; 1st grade officer, April, 1883; suptd. Rewa coal explorations from March, 1883; designation changed to dep. supt.; supt., April, 1887; acted as dir. in 1892; retd., Oct., 1894; author of contributions to the survey publns.

HUGHES, WALTER CHARLETON, M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd July, 1868; arrived, 3rd Oct., 1868, and served in various grades of the dept.; asst. sec. to govt., April, 1882; under sec., March, 1884; sec., Nov., 1888; chairman, Bombay port trust, June, 1892.

HUGHES, WILLIAM, B.A., M.I.C.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd July, 1868, as proby. civil engr.; asst. engr.; Sept., 1870; exec. engr., Sept., 1877; suptg. engr., Feb., 1894.

HUGHES, WILLIAM Gwynne, Col., I.S.C., late Burma Commn.—First commn. as ensign, June, 1883; arrived, 11th Sept., 1885, and was employed on mil. duty and in the police dept., Burma; transfd. to the Burma commn., June, 1864, and served as asst. commr., cantonmt. mag. of Rangoon, town mag. of Akyab, supt. of the hill tracts, Arakan, and dep. commr.; retd., June, 1889; author of 'The Hill Tracts of Arakan.'

HUGHESDON, JOSEPH CHARLES, B.L., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Sutton Valence Gr. Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1862; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., small cause court judge, and sub-collr. and joint mag.; on famine duty, June, 1877; district and sessions judge, Tinnevelly, March, 1880; retd., Aug., 1883.

HULLAH, ARTHUR, India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. asst. supt., 20th Feb., 1869, and employed on various lines; supt., Aug., 1885; in charge, Rajputana divn., April, 1892; personal asst. to dir.-gen., Feb., 1893.

HUME, ALLAN OCTAVIAN, C.B., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1849; arrived, 7th March, 1849; served in N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., Etawah, March, 1858; commr. of customs, N.W. Prov., Punjab, and Central Prov., July, 1867; offic. sec. to govt. of India, home dept., 1870-71; sec. to govt. of India in dept. of rev., agric., and commerce, June, 1871; member of board of rev., N.W. Prov., Oct., 1879; retd., 1882; author of several works on ornithology.

HUMFRESS, GEORGE, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1873, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., May, 1883; employed on N.W. railway from Jan., 1886.

HUMPHREYS, ROBERT, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the Royal Univ. of Ireland and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 29th Dec., 1894, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

HUMPHRYS, ISAAC HUTCHINSON, Accntn.-Gen.'s Dept., India Offic.—Educ. at the Royal Sch., Ratho, and Trinity Coll., Dublin (exhib. and prizeman); clerk, 2nd class, 5th July, 1872; junr. clerk, Feb., 1876; senr. clerk, Sept., 1894.

HUNT, SAMUEL BRADSHAW, Surgn.-Col., Indian Med. Service.—Asst. surgn., 31st March, 1865; arrived, 10th Dec., 1865, and served under the mil. dept., and also as civil surgn. in Madras; surgn., 4th district, and profir. of med. jurisprudence, med. coll., Feb., 1893; reverted to mil. dept., Aug., 1893, and apptd. princ. med. officer, Bangalore and Southern districts.

HUNTER, FREDERICK MERCER, C.B., C.S.I., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., late Pol. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived as ensign, Bombay infantry, June, 1861; asst. pol. rest. at Aden, Aug., 1871; first asst. there, Sept., 1880; also pol. agent for the Somali coast, and collr. of abkari and dep. collr. of salt rev.; pol. agent, Cutch, 1889-93 and 1894; pol. agent, Kolhapur and S. Maratha country, 1893-94 and 1894-95; transfd. to Mahi Kantha, March, 1895; retd. May, 1896.

HUNTER, GEORGE YEATES, M.R.C.S., L.S.A., Brigade-Surgn., late Med. Dept., Bombay.—
Joined the Indian med. dept., 23rd July, 1858; arrived, 9th Sept., 1858, and served in the mil. dept., and as civil surgn. in various stations; civil surgn., Karachi, Feb., 1882; presidency surgn., Bombay, in med. charge of jail, &c., May, 1884; retd., Oct., 1888.

HUNTER, JOHN MUIR, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Pol. Dept., Bombay.—First commn., royal artillery, 12th April, 1864; arrived, 14th Dec., 1865; boundary settl. officer, Baroda and Mahi Kantha states, Oct., 1869; from June, 1872, served as asst. pol. agent in Mahi Kantha, Kolhapur, and Kathiawar; from Feb., 1883, served as supt. of surveys under the rajasthanik court, Kathiawar, and was employed in settling claims in dispute between native states, from Dec., 1884; pres't., rajasthanik court, May, 1891; asst. agent, Baroda, Oct., 1891; first asst. pol. agent, Mahi Kantha, Jan., 1892; pol. agent, Mahi Kantha, July, 1893, to Jan., 1894, and Nov., 1894, to March, 1895; pres't., rajasthanik court, Jan., 1894; pol. agent, Kolhapur, April, 1896.

HUNTER, Sir WILLIAM GUYER, K.C.M.G., M.D., F.R.C.P., F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Gen.—Educ. at King's Coll., London, Aberdeen Univ., &c.; joined the Bombay med. service, 1850; served in the Burmese war and Indian Mutiny; principal of the Grant med. coll., Bombay, 1858; surgn.-gen., Bombay, Feb., 1877; vice-chancellor of the univ. of Bombay, 1879; retd., March, 1880; served on the cholera commn. in Egypt, 1883; British delegate to the international sanitary conference at Rome, June, 1885; M.P. for Hackney (central divn.), 1885 and 1886-92.

HUNTER, Sir WILLIAM WILSON, K.C.S.I., C.I.E., M.A., LL.D., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at the Unvrs. of Glasgow, Paris, and Bonn; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 10th Nov., 1862, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; supt. of labour transport, Kushitia, July, 1865; dir. and compiler of the statistical acct. of Bengal, July, 1869; compiled plan for a statistical survey of India, Jan., 1871; offg. under sec., govt. of India, home dept., Feb., 1871; dir.-gen. of statistics, govt. of India, Sept., 1871; on special duty to England for purpose of compiling statistical acct. of Bengal, and 'Imperial Gazetteer,' 1875 and 1876; on special duty in England, 1877-81; dir.-gen. of gazetteers, Oct., 1877; C.I.E., 1878; dir.-gen. of gazetteers and statistics, June, 1878; dir.-gen. of statistics, Dec., 1881; addl. member, govr.-gen.'s council, 1881, 1883, and 1885; pres't. of the educn. commn., 1882-83; dep'd. to give evidence before the committee of the House of Commons on Indian railways, May, 1884; C.S.I., 1884; member of finance committee, Feb., 1886; K.C.S.I., Feb., 1887; retd., Sept., 1887; author of 'The Annals of Rural Bengal,' 1868; 'A Dictionary of the Non-Aryan Languages of India and High Asia,' 1868; memo. on the older records of the board of rev., N.W. Prov., 1870; 'The Indian Mussulmans,' 1871; 'The Province of Orissa,' 1872; 'Famine Aspects of Bengal Districts,' 1874; a collected edition of 'Essays on the External Policy of India,' by the late J. W. S. Wyllie, 1875; 'A Life of Lord Mayo,' 1875; 'A Statistical Account of Bengal,' 1875-77; a 'Statistical Account of Assam,' 1879; 'The Imperial Gazetteer of India,' 1881; 'The Indian Empire,' 1881; 'England's Work in India,' 1881; 'A Brief History of the Indian People,' &c., &c.

HURRY, ARNOLD EARDLEY, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the City of London Sch. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 25th Oct., 1882, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; from March, 1886, served in Burma as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; re-transf., Dec., 1890; junr. sec. to govt., March, 1895; dep. commr., June, 1896.

HUTCHESON, GEORGE, M.D., C.M., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Indian Med. Service.—Joined the service as asst. surgn., 1st Oct., 1866; served on gen. and mil. duty, and in 1870-71 as chemical analyst; on special duty, cholera enquiry, 1872-73; sanitary commr. and supt.-gen. of vaccn., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, May, 1889; on dep'n. to mil. duty, April-Oct., 1895; author of 'Cholera, its Causes, and Mode of Dissemination,' and 'Cholera as a Preventible Disease.'

HUTCHINGS, FRANCIS SMITH, India Audit Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 23rd June, 1879.

HUTCHINS, SIR PHILIP PERCEVAL, K.C.S.I., B.L., late Madras C.S., Jud. and Public Dept., India Office.—Apptd. to the Madras civil service from Haileybury, 1857; arrived, 27th Feb., 1858; served as asst. collr. and mag., dep. sec. to govt., sec. to board of examrs., and as judge of the court of small causes, Chittur; private sec. to govr. of Madras, Nov., 1863; registrar, high court, March, 1865; district and sessions judge, Madura, April, 1873; called to the bar (Inner Temple), June, 1875; member of rent law committee, Sept., 1882; acting sec., rev. dept., Dec., 1882; on special duty in connection with reorganization of jud. establs., March, 1883; board of examrs., May, 1883; judge of the high court, Madras, Nov., 1883; fellow of Madras univ., March, 1884; member of govr.'s council, Dec., 1886; C.S.I., Jan., 1888; member of the council of the govr.-gen., Nov., 1888; K.C.S.I., May, 1891; retd., Nov., 1893; sec., jud. and public dept., India office, Dec., 1893.

HUTCHINSON, FREDERICK THOMAS, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 25th March, 1871, as asst. comptr.; dep. comptr., May, 1874; examr., Sept., 1881; examr., public works acct., Bombay, May, 1890.

HUTCHINSON, JAMES BIRD, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 26th May, 1864; from March, 1868, served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; district judge, Nov., 1884; dep. commr., Dec., 1884; served under govt. of India, Aug. to Oct., 1887; commr. and supt., Lahore, March, 1894; has publd. a 'Guide to Dalhousie,' and a gen. index of regulations and acts in force in the Punjab.

HUTTON, EDWARD, late Postal Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the service as supt. of mails, Jabalpur, 10th Feb., 1858; supt., travelling post office, Nov., 1877; inspr., field force, Peshawar column, Feb., 1879; presidency postmr. at Calcutta, April, 1881; acted as postmr.-gen. at Lahore in 1890, at Bombay in 1891, and at Calcutta from April, 1892; retd., April, 1893.

HYDE, HENRY, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Madras Med. Dept.—Arrived, 27th June, 1867; surgn., Oct., 1871; zillah surgn. and jail supt., April, 1872; civil surgn., Nov., 1884; retd., May, 1895.

HYNES, GEORGE JOHN, late Postal Dept., Govt. of India.—Entered the dept., 4th May, 1868; asst. dir.-gen. of the post office of India, Oct., 1880; dep. postmr.-gen., Burma,
June, 1887; postmr.-gen., Punjab, Jan., 1891; dep. dir.-gen. of post office of India, July, 1891; offg. postmr.-gen., Bengal, March-Aug., 1894; retd. Jan., 1896.

IBBETSON, Denzil Charles Jelf, C.S.I., B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Coll. Sch., Adelaide, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 8th Dec., 1870, and served in the Punjab as ass't commr., and settlt. officer; dep. supt. of census, Punjab, Aug., 1881; compiler, 'Punjab Gazetteer, March, 1883; offg. dir. of public instrn., March, 1884; dep. commr., April, 1885; offg. supt., Kapurthala state, Nov., 1885; offd. as 2nd finl. commr. in the Punjab in 1890; in charge of Gujranwala settlt., May, 1891; member of Deccan agriculturists relief commn., 1891-92; on special duty connected with the cantonmt. act, 1893; offg. sec. to govt. of India, dept. of rev. and agric., July, 1894; promoted to commr., retaining his offg. appt., April, 1895; C.S.I., Jan., 1896; has publd. 'Census Report of the Punjab (1881); 'Outlines of Punjab Ethnography,' the Karnal settlt. report, and contributions to the provl. gazetteers.

ILBERT, Sir Courtenay Peregrine, K.C.S.I., C.I.E.—Educ. at Marlborough, and Oxford; scholar, and afterwards fellow of Balliol Coll.; Hertford scholar, 1861; Ireland scholar, 1864; Craven scholar, 1864; Eldon law scholar, 1867; called to the bar at Lincoln's Inn, 7th June, 1869; counsel to educn. dept., 1878-82; law member of the council of the govr.-gen. of India, 1st May, 1882, and was pres't. of the council, 3rd Feb. to 8th March, 1886; resigned, 13th Nov., 1886; vice-chancellor of Calcutta univ., 1885-86; ass't. partly. counsel to the treasury, 1886; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1895.

IMPEY, William Henry Lockington, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Wellington Coll.; apptd. after exam of 1876; arrived, 7th Nov., 1878, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as ass't. mag. and collr.; ass't. commr., Naini Tal, Nov., 1886; under sec. to govt. of N.W. Prov. and Oudh, May, 1888; settlt. officer, Oct., 1889; joint mag., April, 1892; sec. to govt., finl. dept., Aug., 1893; also member of legisl. council, Dec., 1893; mag. and collr., and acting sec. to govt., jud. dept., March, 1895; part author of Jhansi settlt. report.

INAM ALI, Maulvi, B.A., Punjab Commn.—Apptd. asst. profr., govt. coll., Lahore, 31st Oct., 1887; probr. under native civil service rules, 4th Feb., 1888; ass't. commr., April, 1891; offg. dist. judge, Mar., 1895; has publd. in Urdu a transl. and an epitome of Hamilton's lectures on psychology.

INCH, George Frederick, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 9th Oct., 1879.

INGLIS, Thomas, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Wellington Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 27th Nov., 1880, and served in Bengal as ass't. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., May, 1890; junr. sec. to board of rev., July, 1892.

INGLIS, William Arbuthnot, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrigtn. works in Bengal; exec. engr., May, 1883; offg. under sec., public works dept., Bengal, 1891-92.

INGRAM, Gerald Constantine Winnington, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bromsgrove Sch., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 13th Dec., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as ass't. mag. and collr.

INNES, James John McLeod, Lieut.-Gen., V.C., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn. in Bengal engrs., 1848; served under the civil engr., Punjab, from 1852; asst. to chief engr., Oudh, Jan., 1857; served during the Mutiny (medal and two clasps, V.C.); exec. engr., Cawnpore, Dec., 1857; garrison engr., presidency, April, 1858; compt'r. and examr. of accts., Lahore, Feb., 1861; offg. acctnt.-gen., public works dept., 1865-66, and 1867-68; suptg. engr., Punjab, Oct., 1869; acctnt.-gen. and dep. sec., public works dept., June, 1870; chief engr., Sept., 1881, and dep. inspr.-gen., mil. works; inspr.-gen., 1882; retd., March, 1886.

INNES, Lewis Charles, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Charterhouse and Haileybury, and apptd. in 1844; served in Madras as ass't. collr. and mag., sub-judge, and civil and sessions judge; judge of the high court, Madras, Feb., 1865, to Sept., 1883, and offd. on several occasions as chief justice; retd., 1883; fellow of the univ. of Madras, 1865-83; vice-chancellor, 1874-80.

INNES, William, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to superior rev. establt., state railways, July, 1884; served on the E. Bengal and the Punjab N. state railways, and was apptd. traffic supt., Burma state railway, Nov., 1885.

IRELAND, William de Courcy, B.A., LL.D., late Burma Commn.—Joined the service as acctnt. in office of commr. of Pegu, April, 1859; ass't. supt. of forests, Toungoo, April, 1860; collr. of customs, Nov., 1860; from April, 1861, served in the commn. as ass't. commr., town mag. and dep. commr.; acted also as inspr.-gen. of police; boundary officer, Akyab district, Sept., 1880; addl. sessions judge, Tenasserim, Jan., 1886; commr., Irawadi, July, 1886, and Arakan, Jan., 1890; retd., Dec., 1890.

IRVINE, George Duncan, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch., and St. John's Coll., Oxford; apptd after exam. of 1861; served in Madras from May, 1865, as ass't. collr. and mag., sub-collr. and joint mag., and acting collr. of sea customs at Madras; district and sessions judge, July, 1882; retd., June, 1891.

IRVINE, Robert Hamilton Grant, late Bengal Police Dept.—Joined the service as dep. mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1861; apptd. ass't. supt. of police, April, 1863; district supt., July, 1869; retd., Sept., 1891.

IRVINE, William, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at St. Anne's Sch., Brixton, and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 12th Dec., 1863, and served in the N.W. Prov. as ass't. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., Dec., 1881; retd., 1888; author of 'Canal Rates versus Land Revenue,' 'The Rent Digest: or the Law Procedure relating to Landlord and Tenant, Bengal,' 'Bangash Nawabs of Farukhabad,' and Ghazipur settlt. report.

IRVING, L. A., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Army Med. Staff.—Med. officer to govr. of Bombay (Rt. Hon. Lord Reay), 1885 to 1890.

IRWIN, Alfred Macdonald Bulteel, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 24th Nov., 1876, and served in the Pun-
JACKSON, ARCHIBALD, India Audit Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 24th Dec., 1892.

JACKSON, ARTHUR MASON TIPPETTS, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Westminster Sch., and Brasenose Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 17th Dec., 1888, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; asst. collr. and inspr. of factories, Bombay, Sept., 1892; 2nd asst., July, 1895.

JACKSON, EDWIN JAMES, Survey of India Dept.—Joined the service, 26th Sept., 1864; asst. supt., Nov., 1868; dep. supt., Oct., 1885; supt., March, 1895.

JACKSON, FRANK ERNEST, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the City of London Sch., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 17th Nov., 1893, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

JACKSON, FREEMAN HENRY, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Pol. Dept., Bombay.—First commn., Bombay infantry, 1861; arrived, 10th Jan., 1862; from Jan., 1867, acted in charge of office of asst. rest., Amreli, and was apptd. to settle boundaries in E. Kathiawar, Jan., 1868; acting asst. rest., Dwarka, and commandant of the Gaekwar's battalion, March, 1869; asst. rest., Baroda, in charge Okhamandal, July, 1874; on duty in Baroda, Jan., 1875; extra asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakai dept., June, 1875; from May, 1876, served as asst. agent to the govr.-gen., Baroda, and from Feb., 1879, as supt. of the Gaekwar's contingent, Kathiawar, asst. in charge of Amreli Mahals, and supt. for the improvement of the breed of horses in Kathiawar; offf. for various periods as rest. and govr.-gen.'s agent, Baroda; pol. supt. of Palanpur, Aug., 1895.

JACKSON, HUGH MILBOURNE, Major, R.E., late Survey of India Dept.—First commn., 19th June, 1877; entered the dept. as asst. supt., June, 1883; dep. supt., April, 1889; served in the Burma expedn., 1886, the first S. Shan expedit., 1886-87, and with the N. Karen column, 1888-89.

JACKSON, WILLIAM GRIERSON, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Manchester Gr. Sch., and Univ. of London; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 12th Nov., 1874, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and in British Burma as asst. commr.; dep. supt. of family domains of Maharaja of Benares, March, 1882; joint mag., Nov., 1887; dep. commr., Aug., 1891; mag. and collr., Sept., 1892; author of Mirzapur volume of N.W. Prov. Gazetteer.

JACOB, EDWARD FOUNTAINE, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, 1st Oct., 1876, as asst. engr.; district traffic supt., Feb., 1880; attached to public works secretariat, govt. of India, April, 1888; dep. traffic supt., N.W. railway, May, 1890; traffic supt., May, 1892.

JACOB, GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch., and Highgate Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 21st Nov., 1879, and served as asst. collr. and mag.; from May, 1883, served as asst. judge and sessions judge, and as asst. agent for sardars in the Deccan; joint judge and sessions judge, Nov., 1886; acting registrar, high court, appellate side, Feb., 1888; 1st asst. judge, Nov., 1891; judge and sessions judge, March, 1894.

JACOB, HERBERT BRUCE, Col., I.S.C., late Jud. Dept., Bombay.—First commn., Dec., 1857; served from 26th June, 1869, in the
educ. dept., Central Prov., and was apptd. inspr. of schools, April, 1871; acting inspr.-gen. of educ., 1882-84; cantonmt. mag., Karachi, 1889-92; retd. to Europe, Dec., 1895.

JACOB, Lionel Montague, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1875, and employed on irrign. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., May, 1883; under sec. to govt., irrign. branch, Nov., 1884.

JACOB, Samuel Swinton, C.I.E., A.I.C.E., Col., I.S.C., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 17th Nov., 1862, and posted to Bombay; services lent to Jaipur state, July, 1867; exec. engr., Sept., 1870; public works sec. to agent in Rajputana, 1886, 1887, and 1889; C.I.E., May, 1890; suptg. engr., Jan., 1893; services specially retained, under Jaipur state, Dec., 1896.

JACOB, Stephen, C.S.I., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Highgate Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 16th Nov., 1871, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., and in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; on special duty, legisl. dept., govt. of India, 1879 and 1880; asst. comptr.-gen., Nov., 1880; under sec., fin. and commerce dept., July, 1882; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, 1883-84, and 1885-86; dep. auditor-gen., 1884-85; sec. to the fin. committee, March, 1886; acctnt.-gen., and commr. of state paper currency, Bombay, May, 1888; comptr. and auditor-gen. and head-commr. of paper currency, Nov., 1891; acted as sec. to fin. and commerce dept., 1892-93, and 1894; C.S.I., Jan., 1895; depd. to England, to give evidence before the royal commr. on Indian expenditure, Sept., 1895.

JACOB, Sydney Long, Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 13th January, 1869, and served on irrign. works in Bombay and the Punjab as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; served through the Afghan war, 1878-79 (medal); suptg. engr., Oct., 1890.

JAMES, Arthur Hutton, Police Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service, 16th Feb., 1863, as asst. supt. of police, Assam; also asst. commr., Nov., 1866; district supt., Oct., 1873; transf. to Bengal, Dec., 1875; asst. inspr.-gen., railway police, Nov., 1884.

JAMES, Henry Evan Murchison, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Cathedral Sch., Carlisle, and Durham Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 14th Dec., 1865, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and as branch inspr.-gen. of registrn., and educ. inspr. in Sind; under sec. to govt. in the rev., fin., and gen. depts., Nov., 1875; postmr.-gen., Bombay, Nov., 1877; postmr.-gen., Bengal, March, 1882; acted as dir.-gen. of the post office in India, 1883-85; dep. dir.-gen., Nov., 1885; senr. collr. and collr. and mag., Ahmadabad, April, 1888; commr., June, 1890; commr. in Sind, Nov., 1892; member of govr.-gen.'s egisl. council, Feb.-March, 1895.

JAMES, Stephen Harvey, late Indian C.S.—Educ. at Probus Gr. Sch., and Shrewsbury Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 30th Oct., 1870, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; junr. sec., board of rev., May, 1875; under sec. to govt., N.W. Prov., Aug., 1877; registrar, high court, May, 1881; legal remembrancer, N.W. Prov., May, 1884; offg. dep. sec. to the govt. of India, legisl. dept., March, 1885; sec. to the govt. of India, legisl. dept., Sept., 1887; retd., Nov., 1896.

JAMESON, Arthur Samuel, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Jan., 1886, and served in the locomotive dept., N.W. railway; transf. to E. Bengal state railway, Aug., 1888; district locomotive supt., July, 1889; locomotive supt., Oct., 1890.

JAMESON, Robert, M.D., Brigade-Surg.-Lieut.-Col., late Sanitary Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the Bengal med. service, Oct., 1865; arrived, 11th April, 1866, and was employed on civil and mil. duty; in 1868 was in med. charge at Calcutta of troops and coolies, en route to Abyssinia; served in Abyssinia with 12th Bengal cavalry; served in Bombay and Punjab, 1868 and 1869, and in the N.W. Prov. from 1870 on civil and jail duty; dep. sanitary commr., Nov., 1886; retd., May, 1896.

JAQUET, Robert Glover, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Junr. clerk, 11th May, 1877.

JARDINE, John, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 30th Oct., 1864, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge and sessions judge; acting under sec. to govt., pol., &c., depts., June, 1869; from May, 1871, served in Kathiawar as pol. asst.; also jud. asst., June, 1873; acting registrar of the high court, Bombay, Oct., 1873; sec. to the Baroda commn. for the trial of the Gaekwar, 1875; sec. to the delegates of the govt. of India in the negotiations for a commercial treaty with Portugal, 1877, also acting as dep. sec. to govt. of India, legisl. dept.; acting sec. to govt. of Bombay, pol., &c., depts., Nov., 1877; from Feb., 1878, served in British Burma as jud. commr.; prest. of the educ. syndicate, Sept., 1881; acting chief sec. to govt. of Bombay, Oct., 1885; judge of the high court, Bombay, Nov., 1885; acted as chief justice in 1895; author of 'Notes on Buddhist Law'; editor of Moung Tet Pyo's Customary Law of the Chin Tribe, also of a reprint of Dr. Tandy's transl. of Father Sangermano's description of the Burman Empire, and a compilation of printed judgments of the jud. commr. of British Burma; wrote a preface to Dr. Forchhammer's 'King Wagaru's Dhamma-Sattham.'

JARDINE, William Ellis, Indian C.S. (Haidarabad).—Educ. at Fettes Coll., Edinburgh, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 20th Feb., 1889, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; second asst. to rest., Haidarabad, Nov., 1893; head ass't. and mag., Bellary, March, 1896.

JARRETT, Henry Sullivan, C.I.E., Col., I.S.C., late Legis. Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Dec., 1856; served during the Mutiny (medal); also in the Mahsud Waziri expdn., 1860 (medal and clasp), and the 2nd Yusufzai expdn., 1863 (clasp); sec. to board of exams., Fort William, March, 1871; in addn., asst. sec., egisl. dept., govt. of India, from Aug., 1875; reverted to mil. dept., June, 1894; C.I.E., Jan., 1895.

JEFFERY, Thaddeus James Passmore, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 15th July, 1869, and employed on irrign. works in Bombay and the Punjab; exec. engr., Feb., 1879; suptg. engr., Oct., 1894.

JEFFREYS, William, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., 8th June,
1854; arrived, 24th Jan., 1856, and served in the irrig. branch, Punjab, and in the N.W. Prov.; on duty in the public works secretariat, govt. of India, 1864-65; transfd. to Bengal, and depd. to investigate a project of irrig. and navigation for the river Gandak, Oct., 1867; offig. asst. to chief engr., and assts. sec. to govt., N.W. Prov., May, 1869; suptg. engr., April, 1872; acting chief engr. and joint sec., irrig. branch, March, 1887; retd., Nov., 1887.

JEHANGIR KAIKHASO NAVROJI KABRAJI, Statutory C.S. (Bombay).—Apptd. probr. under native civil service rules, 14th Jan., 1888; asst. collr. and mag., March, 1888; confd., 24th Feb., 1890; 2nd asst., May, 1895.

JEHANGIR, PESTANJI, C.I.E., Khan Bahadur, late Bombay Uncov. Service.—Joined the service as asst. master, Elphinstone instn., Bombay, 10th Oct., 1853; served in the settlt. dept. from April, 1857; 1st grade dep. collr., Aug., 1869; C.I.E., Jan., 1882; talukdari settlt. officer, May, 1889; retd., 1889.

JENKINS, JOHN LEWIS, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Bristol Gr. Sch., and Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 15th Jan., 1880, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and from June, 1881, in Sind; 3rd asst. collr. in Sind, June, 1885; manager of encumbered estates in Sind, and educ. inspr., Sept., 1885; 2nd asst. collr., May, 1889; 1st asst., Feb., 1892; asst. commr. in Sind, and Sindi translr. to govt., March, 1892; acting collr. of salt rev., Jan., 1893.

JENKINS, LAWRENCE HUGH, B.L.—Apptd. judge, high court, Calcutta, April, 1886.

JENKINS, ROBERT GEDWIN, Col., I.S.C., late Madras Police Dept.—Ensign, Madras infantry, Dec., 1856; arrived, 8th Feb., 1857; served in the Madras police from July, 1863, and was promoted to supt., 1872; reverted to mil. duty, 1890.

JENKINS, THOMAS MORRIS, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—Ensign, 2nd March, 1866; served in the Burma commn. as asst. commr. from 28th April, 1874; acted as port officer and collr. of customs, Basscin, in July, 1881; settlt. officer, 1884-85; dep. commr., Aug., 1886.

JENKINSON, SIR EDWARD GEORGE, K.C.B., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Harrow and Haileybury; apptd. in 1856, and served in the N.W. Prov. as joint mag. and dep. collr. of Benares, and afterwards of Farukhabad; served through the Mutiny (medal); also as settlt. officer, mag. and collr., commr. of rev. in Jhansi, and commr. in Oudh; retd., 1880; was private sec. to Earl Spencer when lord-lieut. of Ireland, and asst. under sec. for police and crime, 1882-85; C.B. in 1883, and K.C.B. in 1888.

JENNINGS, ROBERT HENRY, Major, R.E., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 12th Sept., 1872; arrived, 1st Dec., 1875, and was employed as asst. engr. and in various acting appts. in the Punjab and Baluchistan; served through Afghan war, 1879-80, and the operations against the Maris, 1880; on boundary settlt. duty in Central India, 1883-84; dep. asst. quartermaster-gen., Simla, July, 1885; district staff officer, Meerut, Sept., 1888; dep. asst. adjutant-gen., Meerut, April, 1890; exec. engr., mil. works dept., June, 1890; acting asst. pol. agent and consul, Bassora, Feb.-Aug., 1892; pol. officer with Sardar Ayub Khan, Feb., 1893; reverted to mil. works dept., Oct., 1894; author of an account of a journey through W. Baluchistan, Persia, &c., and of contributions to Persia and Baluchistan gazetteers.

JEROVOSE, ALAN ARTHUR CLARKE, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1856; arrived, 23rd March, 1857, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag. pol. agent and collr. of stamp rev., and acting dep. commr. of customs and opium; junr. collr. and mag., Sept., 1877; senr. collr. and mag., March, 1879; retd., April, 1887.

JEWETT, THOMAS HOPE, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Calcutta Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd. 22nd May, 1872, and posted to mil. works; on famine duty in Mysore, 1877-78; transfd. to Assam, Sept., 1880; exec. engr., April, 1886.

JOHNSTON, SIR ALLEN BAYARD, K.C.B., Gen., I.S.C., late Mil. Dept., India Office. Educ. at Winchester; joined the service (infantry), July, 1846; apptd. to 4th Sikhs as volunteer for service in Burma (medal and clasp for Pegu); in civil employ in Punjab, 1854; served in the Mutiny in 1858 (medal and clasp); asst. adjutant-gen., 1861; mil. dept., Calcutta, 1862; asst. sec. to govt. of India in the mil. dept., 1875; dep. mil. sec., 1876; sec. in the mil. dept., India office, from Jan., 1877; temporarily employed as mil. sec. to the govt. of India, 1879-81; C.B., 1881; retd. from India office and was made K.C.B., May, 1889.

JOHNSTON, THE MOST REV. EDWARD RALPH, D.D., LL.D.—Educ. at Rugby, and Wadham Coll., Oxford; ordained, 1851; vicar of Northenden, Cheshire, 1866-76; archdeacon of Chester, 1871-76; apptd. bishop of Calcutta and metropolitan of India, 14th Dec., 1876.

JOHNSTON, EVANS CHARLES, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 29th Nov., 1867, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; on special duty, Rumpa disturbances, 1879-80; sub-collr. and joint mag., S. Arcot, Jan., 1883; collr. and mag., May, 1886; district and sessions judge, Oct., 1886; collr. and mag. and agent, Ganjam, May, 1890; retd., March, 1893.

JOHNSTON, JOHN, ACCTNT.—Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 17th Feb., 1872; junr. clerk, June, 1882.

JOHNSTON, THOMAS GEORGE, Capt., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—First commn., Aug., 1877; employed in Burma as asst. commr., March, 1884; dep. commr., March, 1891.

JOHNSTON, WARWICK HUSON, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 1st Sept., 1865, and posted to the Punjab; transfd. temporarily to mil. works, April, 1872; and to Bengal on famine relief duty, Nov., 1873; exec. engr., March, 1874.

JOHNSTON, THE VEN. CHARLES FRANCIS HARDING, M.A., late Ecclesl. Dept., Bombay.—educ. at Christ's Coll., Cambridge; junr. chaplain, 13th Feb., 1869; senr. chaplain, Feb., 1879; archdeacon of Bombay, Oct., 1888; retd., Oct., 1890.

JOHNSTON, DAVID LANDALE, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Boston Gr. Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 10th Nov., 1891, and served as asst. commr. and asst. mag. and collr.

JOHNSTON, JOHN CHARLES, A.M.I.C.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service,
11th Feb., 1873, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Jan., 1885.

JOHNSTON, JOHN LEECH, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Royal Sch., Raphoe, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 26th Nov., 1867, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge; judge and sessions judge, Jan., 1884; jud. commr. and judge of sadar court in Sind, May, 1895.

JOHNSTONE, DONALD CAMPBELL, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Edinburgh Acad.; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 10th Nov., 1879, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; junr. sec. to finl. commr., Punjab, Nov., 1888; district judge, Dec., 1891; divl. judge, Aug., 1895.

JOHNSTONE, FREDERICK JOHN, C.I.E., M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Served the Central Prov., from July, 1861, and was apptd. asst. to the chief engr., Aug., 1873; offg. compt. of public works acts, 1875; transf. temporarily to Punjab, Oct., 1879; suptg. engr., Nov., 1880; posted to British Burma, Jan., 1881; transf. to Assam as sec. in the public works dept., Jan., 1884; chief engr., June, 1888; chief engr. and joint sec. to the govt. of Bengal, June, 1891; sec., March, 1892; fellow of Calcutta univ., 1893; retd., Jan., 1896; C.I.E., Jan., 1896.

JOHNSTONE, HUGH, M.A., M.D., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Med.
