Dept., Burma.—Joined the Indian med. service, 30th Sept., 1867; arrived, 2nd May, 1868, and served in Calcutta at the gen. hosp. and as house surgn. at the med. coll. hosp.; in med. charge of the British residency, Mandalay, July, 1869; civil surgn., Akyab, March, 1877; junr. civil surgn., Rangoon, April, 1880, and civil surgn., May, 1890; also port health officer and in charge of the lock hosp. and meteorological observatory.

JOHNSTONE, JAMES WILLIAM HOPE, Col., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 4th Feb., 1853; from March, 1858, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and dep. commr.; offd. as commr. in 1880 and 1883; civil and sessions judge, Peshawar, Sept., 1881; divl. judge, Nov., 1884; retd., Feb., 1896.

JOLL, HENRY, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 26th July, 1867, and served as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; suptg. engr., Nov., 1890; retd., March, 1892.

JOLLIFFE, EDWIN WILLIAM, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 2nd April, 1885.

JONES, GEORGE ALFRED, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 26th Dec., 1894, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

JONES, HOWELL HEWSON, Store Dept., India Office.—2nd class clerk, India store depot, 14th July, 1888.

JONES, JOHN ALFRED, M.I.C.E., Madras Sanitary Dept.—Joined the service as exec. engr., public works dept., Madras municipal commn., Jan., 1877; acted as prest. of the commn. in 1886 and 1888; apptd. sanitary engr. to govt. of Madras, April, 1890; author of 'Switches and Crossings,' and of a manual for district and municipal boards.

JONES, LEYCESTER HUDSON LESLIE, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Hereford Cathedral Sch., and Brasenose Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 6th Dec., 1895, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

JONES, OSWALD ROUTH, Jud. Dept., Madras.—Joined the service, 3rd Sept., 1870, under the mil. dept.; served subsequently in Natal, Mauritius, and in England; in April, 1879, was apptd. to Madras as asst. supt. of police; asst. inspr.-gen., Aug., 1886; supt., Aug., 1889; chief presidency mag., March, 1891.

JONES, RICHARD GODFREY, Major I.S.C., Haidarabad Administration.—First commn., 13th June, 1874; served with 67th Foot till Jan., 1878; entered the Staff Corps, Jan., 1878; insprg. officer, Mysore, Imperial Troops, July, 1890; mil. sec. to the rest., Haidarabad, March, 1895.

JONES, THOMAS, B.L., late Bengal Jud. Dept.—Asst. sec., govt. of Bengal, 7th April, 1866; clerk and offg. 5th judge, Calcutta court of small causes, Jan., 1873; registrar and chief ministerial officer of the court, June, 1882; 4th judge, Oct., 1884; and 3rd judge, Oct., 1889; retd., 1892.

JONES, WILLIAM BRITTAIN, C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1855; arrived, 15th Sept., 1856, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Punjab as asst. mag. and asst. commr.; from April, 1865, served in the Central Prov. as dep. commr., sec. to the chief commr., and acting commr. in various divns.; on special duty for drawing up land rev. and tenancy bills for Central Prov., Sept., 1874; commr., Haidarabad assigned districts, April, 1877; rest., Haidarabad, June, 1882; chief commr., Central Prov., May, 1883; retd., Jan., 1885.

JONES, WILLIAM CHARLES NIGEL, M.I.E.E., India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. asst. supt., 24th Feb., 1870; in charge, Jowaki field telegraphs, 1877-78 (medal); also employed in connection with Kuram valley field force; supt., Aug., 1887; personal asst. to dir.-gen., 1889-90.

JONES, WILLIAM RICHARD SUMPTION, late India Public Works Dept.—Dep. supt., Rurki workshops, Nov., 1867; joined the public works dept., Feb., 1873, as exec. engr., N.W. Prov.; transf. to Rajputana state railways, April, 1879, as dep. locomotive supt.; carriage and wagon supt., Ajmir, Jan., 1880; retd., Dec., 1893.

JONES - BETEMAN, HERBERT BURLETON, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Marlborough; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 16th Oct., 1876, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr. and joint mag.; small cause court judge, March, 1892; district and sessions judge, April, 1892.

JOPP, CHARLES HENRY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Winchester, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 19th Oct., 1873, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; joint judge and sessions judge, Ahmadabad, April, 1892; registrar, high court, Bombay, May, 1893; acting special judge under Deccan agriculturists relief act, Nov., 1893; special duty, Bangalore, from June, 1896.

JOPP, JOHN, C.B., Col., late Pol. Dept., Bombay.—First commn., 20th Oct., 1856; served at capture of fort of Sheik Othman, near Aden, in 1858, in the Abyssinian war of 1868 (medal), and in the Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal); dep. quartermaster-gen., Bombay, May, 1888; pol. rest., &c, Aden, May, 1890; C.B., May, 1894; reverted to mil. dept., May, 1895.
JOSCELYNE, Douglas, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 11th Aug., 1879, and posted to Rajputana; employed in Madras on famine relief, 1878-79; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; transfd. to Burma as asst. sec. in the public works secretariat, July, 1888; under sec., Nov., 1889, to March, 1890; supt. engr., Aug., 1895.

JOSEPH, George John, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Calcutta Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd., 23rd May, 1872, and posted to the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., May, 1883.

JOSEPH, Hugh Gore, M.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Charterhouse, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 7th Nov., 1877, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and in Burma (1886-87) as dep. commr.; returned to Madras as head asst.; sub-collr. and joint mag., Feb., 1890; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1894.

Joubert, Charles Henry, M.B., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1872, and was in mil. employ until 1874; served as civil surgn., rest. surgn., presidency hosp., offig. supt.ofemigration, offig. health officer for Calcutta, and offig. sanitary commr. for Bengal; profr., med. coll., June, 1890; fellow of Calcutta univ., Jan., 1893.

Jowers, Harold, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Shrewsbury, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 15th Nov., 1891, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

Joyce, Alfred, M.I.C.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1874, as asst. engr., and was employed in the N.W. Prov.; transfd. to Madras, April, 1883; exec. engr., Jan., 1886.

Joyner, Robert Batson, M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 8th Oct., 1868, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Jan., 1879; acted as sanitary engr. in 1892; suptg. engr., May, 1894.

Jwala Prasad, Kunwar, B.A., Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. a probr. under the native civil service rules, Dec., 1884; confd., as asst. mag. and collr., Feb., 1887; asst. commr., Nov., 1891; joint mag., Feb., 1896; has transld. Sir Alfred Lyall's 'Asiatic Studies' into Hindustani.

Jwala Prasad, Pandit, M.A., Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. a probr. under native civil service rules, July, 1886; confd., 12th March, 1889, as asst. commr.; joint mag., Nov., 1893.

Jyotsnanath Ghosal, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Metropolitan Coll., Calcutta; Calcutta Univ., and Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 25th Nov., 1895; and served in Bombay as asst. coll. and mag.

Kali Prasanna Mukerji, B.A., B.L., Bengal Jud. Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd Feb., 1866, as munisf.; subord. judge, Feb., 1879.

Kavasjee Jamasjee Badshah, Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Elphinstone High Sch., Bombay Univ., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 12th Nov., 1879, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; postmr.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Feb., 1887; acting dep. dir.-gen. of post office, Jan., 1895.

Kaye, William, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1858; arrived, 8th April, 1858; served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and mag. and collr.; commr. of Agra, July, 1885, and of Rohilkhand, Nov., 1889; on special duty in connection with the police re-organisation commn., 1890-61; junr. member of board of rev., Nov., 1891; retd., April, 1893.

Kay-Shuttleworth, Right Hon. Sir Ughtred James, Bart., M.P.—Educ. at Harrow, and London Univ.; M.P. for Hastings, 1869-80; served for two years on the London sch. board, and was also a member of the royal commn. on reformatory and industrial schools; from 1885, M.P. for the Clitheroe division of N.E. Lancashire; apptd. under sec. of state for India in Feb., 1886, and shortly afterwards chancellor of the duchy of Lancaster; parly. sec., admiralty, Aug., 1892, to Aug., 1895; was for some time vice-pres. of Univ. Coll., London.

Keatinge, Gerald Francis, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Sherborne Sch. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 10th Dec., 1894, and served in Bombay; as asst. collr. and mag.

Keatinge, Richard Harte, V.C., C.S.I., Gen., I.S.C.—First commn., Bombay artillery, June, 1842; from 1847 was employed in civil duties on the N.W. frontier, and was apptd. asst. supt., Nimar, Dec., 1851; served in the Mutiny (medal and clasp and V.C.), including the pursuit of Tantia Topi, 1858-59; pol. agent, Nimar, 1860; pol. agent, Gwalior, and subsequently in Kathiawar, 1862; served in Kathiawar against the rebel Waghirs in 1865; agent to the govrn.-gen. in Rajputana, 1868-74; also ex-officio chief commr. of Ajmir, 1871-74; chief commr. of Assam, Feb., 1874, to June, 1878.

Kedar Nath Mozumdar, B.A., B.L., Bengal Jud. Dept.—Served in the subord. jud. dept. from 16th Dec., 1865, and was apptd. subord. judge, Jan., 1879.

Kedar Nath Roy, M.A., B.L., Statutory C.S. (Bengal).—From 4th April, 1878, served as munisf., and on 27th July, 1883, was apptd. to the statutory civil service as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Oct., 1893; author of three legal works.

Keefer, William Napier, Surgn.-Major, late Indian Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., 1st Oct., 1869; served in the Lushai campaign, 1871-72 (medal and clasp), the Duffla expedit., 1874-75, the Jowaki campaign, 1877-78 (clasp), the Afghan campaign, 1878-80 (medal and clasp), the Zaimusht expedit., 1879, and the Egyptian campaign, 1882 (medal and clasp, bronze star, and 4th class Osmanieh); senr. med. officer, Port Blair, April, 1884; retd., Dec., 1889.

Keegan, Dennis Francis, M.D., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Indian Med. Service.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; joined the Bengal med. service in 1866; acted as residency surgn., Indore, 1877-78; served in the Afghan war, 1879-82 (medal and clasp, bronze star); apptd. residency surgn., Indore, and civil med. officer, Central India, June, 1881; retd., April, 1894; author of several articles and papers on med. subjects.

Keelan, Bernard Callan, Surgn.-Major, L.K.&Q.C.P., M.R.C.S., late Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the Bombay med. service, 1st April, 1867; served under the mil. dept., and
also as civil surgn. and supt. of jail at various stations; took part in the Abyssinian campaign (medal); civil surgn., Sukkur, Jan., 1881; civil surgn., &c., Haidarabad, April, 1884; retd., March, 1891.

KEELAN, Eugene John, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 3rd Oct., 1868, and employed on irrign. works in Oudh; transf'd to state railways, Nov., 1879; exec. engr., Oct., 1880; retd., 1896.

KEENE, Charles James, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 29th Dec., 1874; as asst. traffic supt., Punjab N. state railway; served also on the N. Bengal state railway, the N.W. and other railways; district traffic supt., 1890.

KEENE, Henry G., C.I.E., M.A. (Hon.), late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Rugby, and Oxford; apptd. from Haileybury, 1847; arrived in India, 3rd Oct., 1847; served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., asst. supt. of Dehra Dun, and joint mag. and dep. collr.; supt., Dehra Dun, May, 1856; mag. and collr., April, 1860; civil and sessions judge, April, 1867; offd. as commr. of Agra in 1872 and 1875, and of Allahabad in 1874; retd., 1883; fellow of the Calcutta univ.; author of 'Indian Administration,' 1867; 'Fall of the Mughal Empire,' 1876; 'History of Hindustan,' 1885; 'Life of Madhava Rao Sindhi,' 1892; 'History of India for the use of Students,' 1893; and numerous contributions to the periodical press.

KEENE, Henry George Harris, Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the dept., 14th March, 1874, as asst. acctnt.-gen., asst. comptr.-gen., and asst. comptr., Burma; comptr., Haidarabad, March-July, 1886, and from Oct., 1893.

KEESS, James, M.D., M.R.C.P., L.M., M.R.C.S., Dep. Surgn.-Gen., late Madras Med. Dept.—Served in the subord. med. dept. from 11th Sept., 1848, to May, 1855; asst. surgn., 4th Aug., 1856; from May, 1862, served as civil surgn. and jail supt., Karnul, fort surgn., Madras, profr. in the med. coll., med. inspr. of seamen, &c.; fellow of Madras univ., 1882; principal and profr. of medicine in the med. coll., and senr. physician, gen. hosp., Aug., 1883; retd., Jan., 1887; author of 'Syllabus of Medicine for use of Medical Students,' 'Notes on Zoology and Comparative Anatomy,' 'History of the Madras Medical College,' &c.

KEITH, Stanley, Finl. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Lancing Coll.; writer, India office, 6th June, 1873; clerk, 2nd class, April, 1879; staff clerk, July, 1896; joint editor of the India List, 1885-95, and of the India Office List, 1895-96.

KEITH, Thomas W., late Acctnt.-Gen., India Office.—Educ. at Highgate Sch.; East India house writer, old establ., 20th Aug., 1845; junr. clerk, treasury, 1848; senr. clerk, Sept., 1858; acctnt.-gen.'s dept., 1860; acctnt., Jan., 1872; assessor of income tax, 1872; acctnt.-gen., Feb., 1879; retd., June, 1893.

KELLAKKA COVILAGOM MANAVEDAN RAJA, B.A., Statutory C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Madras Univ.; apptd. probr. for the civil service, 4th June, 1880; confd., Aug., 1882; asst. collr. and mag., July, 1882; head asst., Aug., 1882; sub. collr. and joint mag., Feb., 1895.

KELLEY, William, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 9th Oct., 1879.

KELLNER, Edwin Welsh, C.I.E., late Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the dept., 29th April, 1870, and served as dep. acctnt.-gen., acctnt.-gen., asst. and dep. comptr.-gen., and asst. commr. of paper currency; acctnt.-gen., Punjab, March, 1890; retd., March, 1894; C.I.E., May, 1894.

KELLY, Charles Arthur, M.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 14th Nov., 1861; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and asst. sup't. of survey; small cause court judge, Jan., 1876; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1879; retd., Jan., 1883.

KELSALL, John, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1862; from March, 1865, to Jan., 1867, served as proby. asst. supt. of police, and subsequently as asst. collr. and mag., and principal asst.; district and sessions judge, Aug., 1880; retd., Nov., 1889; compiled the 'Bellary District Manual.'

KEMBALL, Sir Arnold Burrowes, K.C.B., K.C.S.I., Gen., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Educ. at Addiscombe; and lieut., Bombay artillery, Dec., 1837; served in the Afghan war, 1838-39, and was present at the siege and capture of Ghazni (medal); apptd. asst. to the rest at Bushire, Feb., 1842; pol. rest., Persian Gulf, May, 1852; consul gen., Bagdad, and pol. agent, Turkish Arabia, 1855 to 1873; served in the Persian expdn. of 1857 (medal and clasp, C.B.); served with the Turco-Persian boundary commn., 1873; during the Russo-Turkish war, 1876-77, was British mil. attache' at the headquarters of the Turkish army.

KEMBALL, Charles Gurdon, B.L., late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1850; arrived, 25th Nov., 1850; served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., asst. judge and sessions judge, jud. asst. commr. (in Sind), and dep. mag.; collr. and mag., Karachi, Nov., 1861; served as judge and sessions judge, Surat, from Jan., 1866; judge of the high court, Bombay, Aug., 1871; acted as member of council, Bombay, in 1830 and 1831; retd., 1885.

KEMBLE, William, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 8th April, 1858; served in Bengal, and was apptd. mag. and collr., Oct., 1873; inspr.-gen. of jails, July, 1876; offg. opium agent, Benares, May, 1882; opium agent, Behar, May, 1884; offg. commr., Patna, May-Nov., 1890; acting member of board of rev., June, 1892; retd., April, 1893.

KENDALL, Edward Austin, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Bedford Gr. Sch., and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 22nd Oct., 1892, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

KENNEDY, Chessborough Gordon MacKenzie, Assam Commn.—Educ. at Southampton Coll.; sub-lieut., H.M.'s 59th regt., Nov., 1873, to Jan., 1877; in 1879-80 served as transport officer, Naga Hills field force; apptd. extra asst. commr., Assam, 25th June, 1880; dep. commr., April, 1894.

KENNEDY, Hartley, Bombay Police Dept.—Joined the dept., 30th Oct., 1871; asst. supt. of police, Jan., 1871; supt., March, 1876.

KENNEDY, James, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the High Sch. and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1862;
arrived, 14th Nov., 1863, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., settlt. officer, and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., March, 1884; retd., April, 1890.

KENNEDY, JOSEPH, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the High Sch. and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 23rd Oct., 1874, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in Assam (1884-86) as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; mag. and collr., Bengal, Nov., 1892.

KENNEDY, SIR MICHAEL KAVANAGH, K.C.S.I., Gen., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Bombay.—First commn., Bombay engrs., 11th June, 1841; arrived, Nov., 1842; asst. engr., roads and tanks, June, 1843; exec. engr. at Surat, Aden, and Satara, 1848-60; on special duty, Ceylon, Madras, and Calcutta, 1860-61; suptg. engr., S. divn., April, 1862; sec. to govt. of Bombay, public works and railway depts., July, 1863; resigned, 1880; was controller-gen. of supply, Kabul expedit.

KENNEDY, ROBERT GREIG, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1873, and employed on irrigtn. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Oct., 1881; transfed. to Baluchistan, Oct., 1884; returned to the Punjab, Aug., 1890.

KENNEDY, ROBERT MUIRHEAD, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Rugby; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 16th Nov., 1877, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and railway mag., Bandra; 1st asst., May, 1891; in 1891 acted as pol. agent, Mahi Kantha, and as administrator, Rajpipla state; talukdari settlt. officer, Nov., 1891; on depn. to adjudicate on Cutch Morvi, &c., disputes, June, 1894-June, 1896.

KENNEDY, THOMAS JOHN, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the Liverpool Institute, Balliol Coll., Oxford, and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 20th Nov., 1880, and served in the Punjab and Central Prov. (1885-87) as asst. commr., and settlt. officer; district judge, April, 1892; dep. commr., Dec., 1894.

KENNEDY, WILLoughby PITCAIRN, Major, I.S.C., Pol. Dept., Bombay.—First commn., 8th Feb., 1870; from March, 1875, served as asst. to pol. agent, Mahi Kantha, Aden, Zanzibar, Baluchistan, and Kathiawar; asst. to the agent to the govr.-gen., Central India, Aug.-Oct., 1880; special pol. agent, Cambay, 1890-94; second asst. to pol. agent, Kathiawar, Sept., 1893; administrator, Rajpipla state, Oct., 1894; administrator, Navanagar state, July, 1895.

KENNEY - HERBERT, ARTHUR ROBERT, Col., Madras Cavalry.—Cornet, 20th Sept., 1859; arrived, 31st Oct., 1859; mil. sec. to the govr. of Madras, May, 1881, to April, 1884; offg. asst. sec. to govt. of India, mil. dept., Dec., 1881; sec. to the govt. of Madras, mil. dept., Dec., 1885; retd., April, 1892.

KENSINGTON, ALFRED, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Marlborough, and Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 12th Feb., 1878, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., asst. settlt. officer, and offg. under sec.; settlt. officer, April, 1884; on special duty in Ambala settlt., Dec., 1889; under sec. to govt. of India, fin. and commerce dept., April, 1890; retransfd. to Punjab as dep. commr., Dec., 1894; divl. judge, March, 1896; transfed. to N.W.P. and Oudh as acctnt.-gen., class III, June, 1896.

KER, THOMAS, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 16th May, 1874, and employed on state railways in Rajputana; exec. engr., May, 1883; retd., May, 1894.

KERNAN, JAMES, M.A., Q.C., late Jud. Dept., Madras.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; judge of the high court, Madras, 3rd May, 1870; fellow of Madras univ., 1871; vice-chancellor, 1885 and 1887; offd. as chief justice, 1885 and 1888; retd., July, 1889.

KERR, JOHN HENRY, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Glasgow Acad., Glasgow Univ., and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 29th Nov., 1892, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

KERR, THOMAS COULTER, Capt., Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Liverpool Coll.; served during China war, 1860-61, and Abyssinian war, 1868-69, in command of hired troopships; surveyor of shipping, India office, 1st April, 1881.

KERSHAW, LOUIS JAMES, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Belfast Methodist Coll. and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 31st Oct., 1890, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transfed. to Assam as asst. commr., April, 1892.

KETTLEWELL, ARTHUR BRADLEY, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 31st Oct., 1892, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

KEYS, ARTHUR INNES, Indo-European Telegraph Dept., India Office.—Apptd. clerk, London office, Indo-European telegraph dept., 7th Feb., 1880; transfed. to registry and record dept., India office, Jan., 1889; clerk specially attached, Aug., 1891; rejoined Indo-European telegraph dept., June, 1894.

KEYSER, ALFRED, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Guildford Gr. Sch., and Royal Acad., Gosport; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 29th Oct., 1865, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; junr. collr. and mag., and pol. agent, Surat, Dec., 1884; senr. collr., &c., April, 1887; acting commr., S. divn., March, 1890; retd., March, 1892.

KHANDERAO CHIMANRAO BEDARKAR, Rao Bahadur, B.A., LL.B., Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the service, 25th April, 1863, as Gujarati and Marathi translr. and interpreter, high court; dep. registrar and sealer, Feb., 1867; services lent to the Maharaja Holkar, Oct., 1890; judge, Bombay small cause court, Dec., 1890, continuing to be in foreign service.

KHANDUBHAI GULABHAI DESAI, L.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 11th April, 1870, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., April, 1884; is a fellow of the Bombay univ.

KHARSEDJI MANEKJI KHARSEDJI, Khan Bahadur, B.A., B.L., Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Served from 29th May, 1874, as judge of the court of small causes, Ahmadnagar, and subsequently at Ahmadabad; judge, Bombay small cause court, June, 1888.

KHARSEDJI RATANJI BAMANJI, Statutory C.S. (Bombay).—Probr. under the native civil service rules, and asst. collr. and mag., Nov., 1882; confd., 8th Jan., 1885; 1st asst., Jan., 1895; forest settlt. offr., April, 1896.

KHUSHWAKTRAE, RAJ, B.L., N.W.Prov.
Administration.—Apptd. proby. asst. mag. and collr., under the native civil service rules, 8th April, 1890; dep. collr., April, 1894.

KIERNANDER, CHARLES ROBERT CAMPBELL, late Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the dept. 5th Aug., 1864, and served as asst. and dep. acctnt.-gen., inspr. of local offices of acct., and dep. comptr.-gen.; asst. sec., govt. of India, finl. dept., 1884-85; comptr. of Indian treasuries, April, 1885; dep. auditor-gen., Oct., 1886; dep. comptr.-gen., April, 1891; retd., March, 1892.

KILBY, GEORGE CHARLES, B.L., Bengal Jud. Service.—Dep. supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, 28th Feb., 1876.

KILBY, SANFORD JAMES, late Bengal Preventive Service.—Asst. collr. of customs, Chittagong, 30th June, 1865; dep. mag. and dep. collr., July, 1866; from Aug., 1868, served in the police dept.; on famine relief duty, 1873 and 1876; from Dec., 1876, served in the customs preventive service, and also in Madras as dep. commr., abkari and salt dept.; retd., Nov., 1892.

KILGOUR, FREDERICK, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Madras.—First commn., 11th July, 1857; proby. asst. supt. of police, Nov., 1865; asst. supt., Aug., 1873; supt., June, 1874; dep. inspr.-gen., May, 1892; reverted to mil. dept., July, 1895.

KIMBERLEY (EARL OF), RIGHT HON. JOHN WODEHOUSE, K.G., P.C., D.C.L.—Born, 7th Jan., 1826; educ. at Eton, and Christ Church, Oxford; succeeded to title of Baron Wodehouse, May, 1846; under sec. of state for foreign affairs, 1852-56; ambassador at St. Petersburg, 1856-58; under sec. for foreign affairs, June, 1859, to Aug., 1861; on a special mission to the North of Europe, in connection with the Schleswig-Holstein question, 1863; under sec. of state for India, April-Nov., 1864; lord lieut. of Ireland, 1864-66; raised to earldom of Kimberley, 1866; elected gov. of the Hudson's Bay Co., 1868; lord privy seal, 1868-70; sec. of state for the colonies, 1870-74; member of the royal commn. on the penal servitude acts, Feb., 1878; sec. of state for the colonies, May, 1880; held provisionally the office of chancellor of the duchy of Lancaster, on Mr. Bright's resignation, June, 1882; sec. of state for India, Dec., 1882, to June, 1885, and Feb. to Aug., 1886; again sec. of state for India, and also lord prest. of the council, Aug., 1892; sec. of state for foreign affairs, March, 1894, to July, 1895; K.G., 1885; hon. D.C.L. (Oxford), June, 1894; was a royal commr. for the exhibn. of 1886; was for some time prest. of Univ. Coll., London (resigned, 1887).

KINCAID, CHARLES AUGUSTUS, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Sherborne Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1891, and served in Sind as asst. collr. and mag.

KINCAID, WILLIAM, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, Madras army, March, 1849; apptd. to adjust boundaries disputes, Bhopal agency, March, 1864; asst. pol. agent, Bundelkhand, and small cause court judge and catonmt. mag., Nowgong, 1866; pol. agent, Bhopal, Aug., 1876; pol. agent, Bhapawar, and commandant, Malwa Bhil corps, Oct., 1879; pol. agent, Bhopal, June, 1881; returned to Europe, 1887.

KINDERSLEY, JOHN ROBERT, late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1847; served in Madras as asst. mag. and collr. till 1857; when he was apptd. asst. judge of Mangalore; subord. judge, 1859; civil and sessions judge, March, 1865; offg. jud. commr., Mysore, 1866 and 1868; judge of the high court, Madras, June, 1877; retd., 1884.

KING, CHARLES MONTAGUE, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 10th Dec., 1892, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

KING, GEORGE, C.I.E., M.B., LL.D., F.R.S., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 1865; house surgn., med. coll. hosp., Calcutta, 1866; supt. of royal botanical gardens, prof. of botany in Calcutta med. coll., and supt. of cinchona plantation in British Sikkhim, from July, 1871; also quinologist, Dec., 1879; C.I.E., Jan., 1890; in addn., dir. of the botanical survey of India, May, 1891; author of 'Manual of Cinchona Cultivation in India,' and other botanical works; and editor of 'Annals of the Royal Botanical Gardens, Calcutta.'

KING, JOSHUA, M.A., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Hall, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 26th Oct., 1860, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and acting under sec. to gov't.; talukdari settlt. officer, 1874-76 and 1876-77; on special duty, Baroda, 1877-79; junr. collr. and mag., Ahmadnagar, May, 1879; senr. collr. and mag., and pol. agent, Satara, May, 1884; retd., 1886.

KING, LUCAS BLACKER BURNET, M.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 11th Oct., 1860; from Nov., 1861, served in Bengal in various grades, and as supt. of survey, and district and sessions judge; retd., Aug., 1885.

KING, LUCAS WHITE, B.A., LL.D., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Ennis Coll., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 27th Nov., 1878, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; transf'd. to foreign dept. as offg. asst. commr., Ajmir, June, 1885; pol. agent, Oct., 1885; asst. to rest., Mysore, and sec. to chief commr., Coorg, July, 1887; on special duty with Maharaja of Mysore, Dec., 1887; first asst. to agent for Central India, Feb.-July, 1888; retransf'd. to Punjab as asst. commr., Sept., 1890; also pol. officer, Shirani field force, Oct., 1890; dep. commr., Nov., 1893; on special duty with Waziristan delimitation commn., 1894-95.

KING, MAURICE, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Calcutta Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd., 20th Jan., 1868, and employed on irrig. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., April, 1876; transf'd. to Burma as suptg. engr., May, 1893.

KING, WALTER GAWEN, M.B., C.M., D.P.H., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Arrived, 31st Oct., 1874, and served under the mil. dept. in Madras and Burma; apptd. civil surgn., June, 1877; also supt. of jail, March, 1878; reverted to mil. dept., Jan., 1892; acting supt., Madras lunatic asylum, April, 1893; sanitary commr., June, 1895.

KING, WILLIAM, B.A., D.Sc., late Geological Survey of India.—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Galway; apptd. asst. in the geological survey, 4th March, 1857; dep. supt. for Madras, Nov., 1868; served subsequently in the Godavari district and
the Nizam's territories, and discovered the Simgareni coal-field, 1871-72; depd. to Vienna in joint charge of the survey collections at the exhibn., 1873; fellow of Madras univ., 1884; offd. as supt., 1884; apptd. dir., April, 1887; retd., July, 1894; author of contributions to the survey pubns.

KING, WILLIAM HENRY, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 21st Dec., 1868, and posted to Bengal; transfd. to mil. works, April, 1872; exec. engr., Sept., 1879; retransf. to Bengal, 1879; employed in Baluchistan, 1885-88, and acted as joint sec. to govnr.-gen.'s agent; retd., Sept., 1894.

KING-HARMAN, MONTAGUE JOCELYN, Col., I.S.C., Mil. Secretariat, Govt. of India.—First commn., 2nd Oct., 1860; served in Hazara campaign, 1868 (medal), and Lushai expedn., 1871-72; dep. asst. quartermaster-gen., Bengal, 1877; dep. sec., mil. dept., govt. of India, Aug., 1892.

KINGSFORD, DOUGLAS HOLLINSHEAD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Haileybury Coll., and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 28th Dec., 1894, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

KINGSMILL, JAMES, late Central Press, Bombay.—Gen. supt. of the central press, and editor of the 'Bombay Govt. Gazette,' March, 1872, to 1891.

KINSMAN, FREDERICK, B.Sc., India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. asst. supt., 24th Feb., 1870; supt., Sept., 1886; personal asst. to dir.-gen., Feb.-May, 1883; in charge, Upper Burma divn., May, 1893.

KIPLING, JOHN LOCKWOOD, C.I.E., late Educn. Dept., Punjab.—Joined the govt. service as architectural sculptor, Bombay, May, 1865; from April, 1875, served in the Punjab as principal of Mayo sch. of industrial art, and curator, Lahore museum; retd., May, 1893.

KIRK, HENRY ALEXANDER, India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the service as asst. supt., 24th Feb., 1870; supt., March, 1876; served during the Afghan war, 1879-80; in charge, telegraph workshops, Calcutta, Oct., 1885.

KIRKHAM, THOMAS BROWN, B.L., Educl. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the dept., 1st Jan., 1862; arrived, 21st June, 1862, and served as headmaster of the Poona high sch., principal of the Elphinstone high sch., Bombay, and profir. at the Elphinstone coll.; from April, 1878, served as educ. inspr.

KIRKPATRICK, HENRY CLARE, Bombay High Court.—Joined the service 8th Jan., 1878, and served as reporter to the high court.

KIRKWOOD, TOWNSEND MOLLOY, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Bromsgrove Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, and Dec., 1863, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and district and sessions judge; also in the public works dept., 1869-71, and was on famine duty, Bhagalpur, 1874; retd., 1888.

KIRTON, WILLIAM FERDINAND, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Trinidad, Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 10th Dec., 1894, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

KISCH, HERMANN MICHAEL, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 24th Oct., 1873; asst. mag. and collr., Bengal, Nov., 1873; on famine duty in 1874 and 1877; asst. to dir.-gen. of statistics, Feb., 1875; offd. under sec., govt. of Bengal, rev. and gen. depts., May, 1878; under sec., jud. and pol. depts., Jan., 1880; offd. sec. in the finl. dept., June, 1881; offd. under sec., govt. of India, rev. and agriclr. dept., Dec., 1883; postmr.-gen., Bengal, Nov., 1885; offd. as dep. sec., fin. and commerce dept., in 1889, and as dir. gen. of post office of India in 1890-91 and 1893-95; on depn. to Vienna postal congress, 1891; author of statistical acts. of Chittagong and other districts.

KISSORY MOHUN CHATTERJEE, B.A., B.L., Jud. Dept., Bengal.—Offd. as judge of the small cause court in 1888 and 1889, and was confd. in that post, 3rd Oct., 1889; author of a legal treatise on the transfer of immovable property.

KITCHIN, ARTHUR JAMES WARBURTON B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 4th Jan., 1894, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

KITTS, EUSTACE JOHN, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Portland Gr. Sch., Mill Hill Gr. Sch., and Univ. of London; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 29th Oct., 1874, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and in Berar as asst. commr. and small cause court judge; on famine duty in Madras, 1877-78; asst. commr., Ajmir, 1883; from April, 1884, served in the N.W. Prov. as joint mag., asst. commr., and small cause court judge; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1890; author of 'Berar Census Report' (1882), and 'Castes and Tribes found in India' (1885).

KNAPP, ARTHUR ROWLAND, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Westminster, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 20th Nov., 1891, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

KNIGHT, RAYMONT, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. Paul's Coll., Stony Stratford, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 12th Jan., 1885, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and forest settlt. officer; 1st asst., May, 1896.

KNOWLYS, HENRY BOLD, late Berar Commn.—Served as a writer in the Ceylon civil service, Feb., 1859, to Aug., 1866; from Sept., 1866, served in the Haidarabad assigned districts as asst. commr.; small cause court judge, Sept., 1873; dep. commr., May, 1886; retd., July, 1891.

KNOX, GEORGE, late Punjab Adminstration.—Asst. engr., May, 1854; from June, 1856, served in the Punjab commn. as personal asst. to commr., dep. commr., and offd. commr.; retd., 1890.

KNOX, GEORGE EDWARD, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch. and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 21st Nov., 1865, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; from March, 1877, served in the jud. dept. as small cause court judge, and district and sessions judge; member of the provl. legisl. council, 1886 and 1889; legal remembrancer, Sept., 1887; judge of the high court, N.W. Prov., Dec., 1890; author of a 'Digest of the Criminal Law of the Bengal Presidency,' and 'Digest of Civil Procedure,'
The Legal Remembrancer,' 1879-82, and 'Treatise upon the Indian Stamp Law.'

KNOX, HORACE CHALONER, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., May, 1885.

KNOX, HUBERT THOMAS, B.L., late Madras C.S.—Apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 4th Dec., 1868, and served in Madras as asst. mag. and collr., joint sessions judge for trying Rumpa cases, and asst. commr. (Nilgiris); sub-collr. and joint mag., Oct., 1884; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1887; collr. and mag., Nov., 1888; retd., Jan., 1892.

KNYVETT, ALEXANDER VANSITTART, Police Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service, 1st Jan., 1867, as asst. supt. of police; district supt., Dec., 1876; personal asst. to the inspr.-gen. of police, May, 1892.

KNYVETT, CHARLES FREDERICK, Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service, 25th June, 1869, as acting asst. district supt.; confd., Oct., 1873; district supt., Dec., 1878; dep. inspr.-gen. of police, Jan., 1895.

KNYVETT, WILLIAM LEYCESTER NATHANIEL, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Bengal.—First commn., 10th June, 1854; served in the dept. from June, 1863, as district supt.; dep. inspr.-gen., April, 1885; offg. inspr.-gen., July, 1888; reverted to mil. duty, 1891.

KONSTAM, EDWIN MAX, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Marlborough, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 29th Nov., 1890, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

KOUGH, CHARLES, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Kingstown, Dungannon, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 16th Dec., 1867, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., head asst., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; forest settl. officer, March, 1883; collr. and mag., Nov., 1887; retd., July, 1894.

KRISHNA CHUNDER CHATTERJEE, B.A., B.L., Jud. Dept., Bengal.—From 10th Dec., 1865, served in the subord. jud. service, Bengal, and was apptd. subord. judge, May, 1877.

KRISHNA GOVINDA GUPTA, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Maimansingh Zilla Sch., Pogose Sch., Dacca, and Calcutta Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 24th Oct., 1873, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine duty, 1874; joint mag. and dep. collr., Sept., 1884; mag. and collr., Oct., 1889; junr. sec. to the board of rev., May, 1890; commr. of excise, Bengal, March, 1893; mag. and collr., March, 1895.

KYNOCH, GEORGE COLLINGWOOD, Customs Dept., Burma.—Joined the service, June, 1877, and served as asst. sec. to chief commr.; chief collr. of customs, April, 1896.

LAING, JAMES ANDERSON, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 1st April, 1870; arrived, 26th Dec., 1870, and served as civil surgn. and supt. of jail, and acting rest. surgn. at the gen. hosp., Madras; dep. sanitary commr. and inspr. of vaccn., Feb., 1878; commr., June, 1888; retd., Sept., 1895.

LAKSHMAN GOPAL DESHMUKH, B.A., Statutory C.S. (Bombay).—Apptd. probr. under native civil service rules, 16th April, 1881, and asst. collr. and mag.; confd., 19th June, 1885; 1st asst., Jan., 1895.

LAMB, RICHARD AMPHLETT, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Highgate Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 21st Oct., 1879, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; forest settl. officer, Khandesh, March, 1885; served in Burma as dep. commr., 1887-90 (medal with clasp); 1st asst. collr. and mag., Aug., 1892.

LAMBE, WILLIAM, late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, Oct., 1868, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., dep. commr., and mag. and collr.; retd., Nov., 1895.

LAMBERT, SIR JOHN, K.C.I.E., Police Dept., Bengal.—Served from 23rd Nov., 1863, as asst. and district supt.; visitor of the presidency jail, and of the lunatic asylums, July, 1872; dep. commr. of police, Calcutta, Feb., 1874; served under the govt. of India, foreign dept., from March, 1882, to March, 1884, as offg. gen. supt. of the operations for the suppression of thagi and dakit; acted as commr., Calcutta, and prest. of the boiler commn., 1885-86; commr. of police, Calcutta, April, 1889; member of provl. legisl. council, June, 1892; K.C.I.E., June, 1893.

LANE, CLAYTON TURNER, C.I.E., Col., I.S.C., Berar Commn.—Ensign, Bengal army, 11th Dec., 1883; from March, 1863, served in the Punjab as asst. supt. and district supt. of police; transf'd. to Berar police, Sept., 1865; inspr.-gen. of police, &c., Haidarabad assigned districts, April, 1877; C.I.E., May, 1895; rank of dep. commr., June, 1895.

LANE, HERBERT HARDINGHAM, Accntn.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 22nd July, 1892.

LANE, JAMES HORSBURGH, M.I.E.E., late India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd., 1st Feb., 1857; supt., 1st grade, Bombay, Aug., 1870; dir. of traffic, Feb., 1879; dep. dir.-gen., April, 1890; offg. dir.-gen., 1892; retd., June, 1894; compiler of 'Word Code for Foreign Telegrams.'

LANE, JOHN MACDONALD, M.I.E.E., late India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd., 22nd Sept., 1862; supt., Bengal, Oct., 1860; served subsequently in the Malabar Coast, Nagpur, British Burma, &c., divns.; retd., April, 1891.

LANE, WILMOT, B.L., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1854; arrived, 13th Jan., 1855, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr., and in Oudh as offg. dep. commr., Lucknow; mag. and collr., Jan., 1872; civil and sessions judge, Aug., 1877; commr., Sept., 1880; offd. as member, board of rev., N.W. Prov., 1883; retd., April, 1889.

LANG, ARTHUR MOFFATT, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., June, 1852; arrived, July, 1854, and served in the Punjab; exec. engr., March, 1857; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasps); asst. to chief engr., Oudh, April, 1858; asst. sec., public works dept., Oudh, July, 1865; principal, Thomason coll., 1871-77; suptg. engr., dep. inspr.-gen., mil. works, and sec., defence committee, Feb., 1879; sec. to agent to govr.-gen., Baluchistan, public works dept., Feb., 1881; chief engr., and sec. to chief commr., British Burma, public works
dept., Jan., 1883; joint sec., buildings and roads and railway branches, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, July, 1885; retd., Dec., 1888.

LANG, BASIL, Bombay High Court.—Offd. as advocate-gen., May-Nov., 1891, and from April, 1892; confd., 23rd Oct., 1893.

LANG, GEORGE LUKIS, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1858, and served in Oudh as asst. commr. and asst. settlt. officer, and in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., dep. commr., Jhansi, and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., April, 1877; commr. of Jhansi, July, 1889; retd., May, 1891.

LANG, JOHN, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Trinity Hall, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 28th Nov., 1890, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and offg. under sec. to govt.

LANG, RICHARD TICKELL MONTGOMERY, Col., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 20th Nov., 1859; from May, 1862, served in the Punjab as asst. and dep. commr.; offg. commr., 1881-82; retd., March, 1895.

LANGLEY, ALEXANDER, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Christ's Hosp., and Pembroke Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 10th Dec., 1895, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

LANGLEY, EDWARD HARTLEY RAYNSFORD, B.A. (Dub.), M.R.C.S. (Lon.), Brigade-Surgn., late Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the Bombay med. service, 23rd July, 1858, and was employed under the mil. dept., and as acting civil surgn. in various stations; served in China in 1860-62; presidency surgn. and marine surgn., Bombay, Oct., 1876; retd., Nov., 1889.

LANSDOWNE (MARQUESS OF), RIGHT HON. HENRY CHARLES KEITH FITZMAURICE, K.G., G.C.S.I., G.C.M.G., G.C.I.E., D.C.L.—Born, 1845; educ. at Eton, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; succeeded to the marquisate in 1866; a lord of the treasury, 1868-72; under sec. of state for war, 1872-74; under sec. of state for India, April to July, 1880; govr.-gen. of Canada, May, 1883; apptd. govr.-gen. of India, and assumed office, 10th Dec., 1888; returned to England, 27th Jan., 1894; hon. D.C.L., Oxford, 1888; K.G., 1894; apptd. sec. of state for war in Lord Salisbury's third administration, July, 1895.

LARGE, PHILIP TOWNSEND SOMERVILLE, B.C.E., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 21st Dec., 1868, and posted to Bombay; transfd. to state railways, Punjab, Jan., 1870; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; employed on Bengal-Nagpur railway, Oct., 1884; services lent to Gwalior state, Oct., 1892; suptg. engr., Feb., 1893.

LARKINS, ARTHUR BROOKS, India Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. asst. supt., 30th Oct., 1869, and employed on various lines, including Tavoy-Siam line; supt., March, 1886; dir., construction branch, April, 1895.

LARMINIE, JOHN CHARLES, A.M.I.C.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 21st Dec., 1868, as proby. asst. engr.; exec. engr., Sept., 1877; suptg. engr., Aug., 1894.

LARMINIE, WILLIAM REA, M.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 28th Dec., 1860, and served in the Bengal rev. and jud. depts.; commr., Oct., 1886; retd., Aug., 1889.

LARYMORE, ALEXANDER DOUGLAS, Jail Dept., Bengal.—Served in the Behar cavalry as trooper, 1857-58; joined the Bengal police as asst. supt., 31st July, 1862; district supt., June, 1872; on famine relief duty, 1874; jail supt., Jan., 1877; has offd. as inspr.-gen. of jails.

LAST, WALTER ARTHUR WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Westminster, and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 19th Nov., 1891, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; asst. settlt. officer, Sept., 1894.

LATHAM, FRANCIS LAW, M.A., B.L., late Jud. Service, Bombay.—Offd. as remembrancer of legal affairs, 1872-73, and as advocate-gen., and judge of the high court, Bombay, for various periods between 1880 and 1883; advocate-gen., Bombay, March, 1884, to Oct., 1893.

LA TOUCHE, CECIL D'URBAN, Lieut.-Gen., I.S.C., late Bombay Jud. Dept.—Ensign, 29th July, 1850; arrived, 24th Oct., 1850, and served on mil. duty up to Nov., 1883, and subsequently as cantonnt. mag., Poona; returned to Europe, 1888.

LA TOUCHE, JAMES JOHN DIGGES, C.S.I., B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867; served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. settlt. officer, till Dec., 1871, when he was transfd. as settlt. officer to Ajmir; offg. dep. commr., Ajmir; returned to the N.W. Prov., 1875, and served as district supt. of police, settlt. officer, &c.; from Aug., 1886, served in Upper Burma as commr.; rejoined the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as mag. and collr., April, 1890; member of provl. legisl. council, Dec., 1891; commr. and agent, Benares, April, 1893; chief sec. to govt., Dec., 1893; C.S.I., Jan., 1896; author of 'Gazetteer of Ajmir-Mairwara.'

LA TOUCHE, WILLIAM PAGET, Col., I.S.C., late Salt Dept., Bombay.—First commn., Bombay army, Sept., 1854; served in the Persian war, 1856, and the Mutiny campaign; apptd. asst. mag., Dec., 1859, and asst. district supt. of police, Jan., 1865; acting pol. supt., Palanpur, 1867; from Dec., 1867, served as asst. and district supt. of police; and from Feb., 1883, as dep. collr. of salt rev.; returned to Europe, 1887.

LAUDERDALE (EARL OF), Rt. Hon. FREDERICK HENRY MAITLAND, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C.—First commn., 4th Hussars, Feb., 1861; served in Central India in civil employ from 1869 as boundary officer, and pol. asst.; 2nd asst. agent, Indore, 1877; 1st asst., 1878; addl. pol. agent and supt., Charkhari, 1880; retd., Jan., 1886.

LAUGHLIN, ROBERT CAMPBELL, M.I.E.E., late India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the dept. as asst. supt., Oct., 1866; held charge of various divns., chiefly in Madras and Bengal, and of the telegraph stores, Calcutta; retd., May, 1891.

LAUGHTON, DANIEL WILSON, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Berar Commn.—First commn., Jan., 1854; arrived, April, 1854; from Jan., 1865, served in the Haidarabad assigned districts as asst. commr., small cause court judge, and cantonnt. mag.; acted as inspr.-gen. of registrtn., 1873; dep. commr., Feb., 1885; retd., May, 1886.
LAURIE, HENRY MONTAGUE, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1887, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., and offg. under sec.; acted as commr. of excise in 1892; dep. commr., June, 1895.

LAURIE, LEWIS KOSSUTH, B.L., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 27th Oct., 1873, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., and in various acting appts.; under sec., Oct., 1885; judge, small cause court, Jabalpur, Jan., 1890; dep. commr., Dec., 1890; commr. of excise, Jan., 1891; inspr.-gen. of police and jails, April, 1892; sec. to chief commr., April, 1895; commr., Sept., 1895; author of a digest of rulings of jud. commrs., Central Prov., in civil cases (1881), and some manuals relating to the Central Prov.

LAURIE, MAXWELL, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Watson's Coll., Edinburgh, Edinburgh Univ., and St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 9th Dec., 1889, and served in Burma as asst. commr. and settl. officer.

LAW, VICTOR EDWARD, Col., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Madras cavalry, 20th April, 1859; attache, foreign dept., July, 1872; served in Rajputana as supt. of railway police, 1872-77; pol. agent, Jaipur, 1877, and afterwards in Alwar, 1877-83; asst. at Sujangarh to gov'r.-gen.'s agent in Rajputana, Feb., 1884; agent with king of Oudh, and supt. of pol. pensions, March, 1884; in charge of ex-Amir Muhammad Yakub Khan of Kabul, Aug., 1884; rest., Jaipur, April, 1895.

LAWRENCE, ALEXANDER JOHN, C.I.E., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1856; arrived, 10th Nov., 1856; served from March, 1858, in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and settl. officer, and in the Central Prov. as settl. officer of Bhandara; mag. and collr., Oct., 1874; commr., Allahabad, April, 1885, and Meerut, April, 1889; C.I.E., May, 1888; retd., Nov., 1891.

LAWRENCE, EDWARD, B.A., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Rugby, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 12th Nov., 1878, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; also acted as asst. to the pol. rest. at Aden, March, 1882, and as under sec. to govt.; under sec. to the govt. of India, fin. and commerce dept., April, 1880; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, April, 1890; acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Aug., 1894.

LAWRENCE, HENRY JOHN, Lieut.-Col., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 14th Feb., 1862; from Aug., 1866, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and jud. asst.; district judge, Nov., 1884; divl. judge, Jan., 1885; retd., March, 1895.

LAWRENCE, HENRY STAVELEY, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Haileybury Coll., and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1890, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

LAWRENCE, WALTER ROPER, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 5th Dec., 1879, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and in Ajmir and Merwara as pol. asst. and mag.; under sec. to govt., Punjab, 1885 and 1886; under sec. to govt. of India, rev. and agric. dept., Sept., 1886; offd. as sec. in 1888; settl. officer, Kashmir, April, 1889; C.I.E., Jan., 1891; author of 'The Valley of Kashmir,' 1895.

LAWRIE, EDWARD, M.B., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Indian Med. Dept.—First commn., Bengal med. service, 15th Nov., 1872; rest. surgn., Calcutta med. coll. hosp., April, 1874; profr. med. coll., June, 1875; civil surgn., Monghyr, March, 1879; profr. of surgery, Lahore med. sch., and meteorological reporter, Oct., 1879; residency surgn., Haidarabad, Oct., 1885.

LEA, JAMES HERBERT, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Rugby, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 30th Oct., 1888, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1895.

LEAPINGWELL, ARTHUR HENRY, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1873, and was employed under the mil. dept.; from Nov., 1879, served as supt., lunatic asylum, Madras, zillah surgn. and civil surgn.; district surgn., Calicut, March, 1892; Vizagapatam, March, 1893.

LEATHER, JOHN WALTER, Ph.D., F.I.C., F.C.S., Agric. Chemistry Dept., Govt. of India.—Apptd. agric. chemist to the govt. of India, 17th Nov., 1892.

LE BRETON, WILLIAM INGLIS, Major, I.S.C., late Public Works Dept., Bombay.—First commn., royal artillery, Dec., 1864; arrived, 1st Nov., 1865; joined the dept., Nov., 1866, and served in Bombay till Nov., 1869, and subsequently as asst. comptr., dep. comptr., and comptr. of accts. in the Punjab, N.W. Prov., Bombay, and Calcutta; from Dec., 1879, served as examr. of guaranteed railway accts., Bombay; examr., public works accts., Bombay, Feb., 1887; retd., June, 1888.

LEE, WILLIAM HERBERT, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch. and St. John's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 19th Dec., 1887, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf'd. to Assam as joint mag. and dep. collr., Nov., 1895.

LEEDS, ROBERT JAMES, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 25th Sept., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; from Nov., 1879, served in the jud. dept. as civil and sessions judge; retd., April, 1887.

LEEDS, WILLIAM HENRY ARTHUR ST. JOHN, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 9th Dec., 1885, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf'd. to Burma as asst. commr., Nov., 1888; offd. as dir. of land records and agric., 1890-91; dep. commr., June, 1893.

LEES, DONALD HECTOR, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at N. London Coll. Sch., and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 1st Dec., 1890, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf'd. to Assam as asst. commr., Dec., 1892.

LEES, OSWALD CAMPBELL, A.M.I.C.E., India, Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill
Coll.; apptd. as asst. engr., 24th Sept., 1878, and posted to Bengal irrngn. branch; exec. engr., May, 1890; under sec. to govt., March, 1895.

LEE-WARNER, JOHN, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Marlborough Coll., and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1863, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; on special duty, inquiring into condition of poorer classes, N. Arcot and Salem, 1868; special asst. collr., Madura, for the management of the Rammad estate, 1871-78; sub-collr. and joint mag., Jan., 1882; acting collr. of sea customs, Madras, May, 1884; district and sessions judge, Kistna, Oct., 1884; collr. and mag., Dec., 1884; retd., Jan., 1890.

LEE-WARNER, WILLIAM, C.S.I., M.A., late Indian C.S., Pol. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Rugby Sch., and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. to the Bombay civil service after exam. of 1867; arrived, 8th Nov., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., private sec. to govt., and acting under sec.; from Dec., 1876, to Aug., 1878, served in Sind as asst. commr., &c.; member of the educn. commn., Calcutta, 1882; in 1884 acted as junr. under sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., and as press commr.; acting dir. of public instrn., Bombay, March, 1885; on special duty in the Haidarabad state, Nov., 1885; acting pol. agent, Kolhapur, Jan., 1886; also prest. of the regency council, May, 1886; sec. to govt. of Bombay, pol., &c., depts., Aug., 1887; C.S.I., Jan., 1892; addl. member of govt.-gen.'s council, 1893-94, and in 1895; rest. in Mysore, and chief commr. of Coorg, Feb., 1895; retd. from the civil service, Sept., 1895; sec., pol. and secret dept., India office, Sept., 1895; author of 'The Protected Princes of India.'

LE FANU, WILLIAM JOSEPH HENRY, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Kingstown Sch., Tipperary Gr. Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 28th Oct., 1865, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; district and sessions judge, Kistna, Dec., 1885; collr. and mag., Jan., 1886; acted as member, board of rev., 1893; acting collr. of sea customs, &c., April, 1895; compiler of 'Salem District Manual.'

LEGEYT, PHILIP HARRISON, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Pol. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 27th March, 1851; was employed under the mil. dept., including service with the Persian expedy. force (medal and clasp); served subsequently with the Gujarat irregular horse, and also acted as asst. pol. agent, Mahi Kantha; from May, 1863, served in the pol. dept. as asst. pol. agent, Kathiawar and Cutch, and mag. of Bhaunagar; pol. agent, Mahi Kantha, 1872-30; pol. supt., Palanpur, Sept., 1880; returned to Europe, 1889.

LEGGATT, EDWARD OWEN EVERY, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., and Lincoln Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, and Dec., 1885, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. supt. and judge of the small cause court, Dehra Dun; joint mag., May, 1890; district and sessions judge, Oct., 1895.

LEGGATT, ERNEST HUGH EVERY, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., and Keble Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 15th Dec., 1891, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

LEIGH, HENRY PERCY POINGDESTRE, C.I.E., Major, I.S.C., Punjab Commn.—In mil. employ from 11th Nov., 1872; joined the Punjab commn., 23rd April, 1879, and served as asst. commr.; C.I.E., Jan., 1892; dep. commr., April, 1894; author of Barak Tappa settlt. report.

LEITNER, GOTTLIEB WILLIAM, M.A., Ph.D., LL.D., D.C.L., B.L., late Educn. Dept., Punjab.—Served in educn. dept. as principal of the Lahore coll. from 12th Nov., 1864; in 1867 was depd. to Kashmir for a philological exam. of the Kashmiri and Chilasi dialects; attended the congress of orientalists at Florence, 1878; offg. dir. of public instrn., Punjab, July, 1879; on special duty with educn. commn., May, 1882; retd. in 1886.

LELY, FREDERIC STYLES PHILPIN, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Pembroke Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 8th Dec., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; in charge of the Sachin state, Oct., 1881; first asst., Surat, Dec., 1884; administrator of the Porbandar state in Kathiawar, June, 1886; junr. collr., June, 1890; member of Deccan agriculturists relief act commn., 1891-92; senr. collr. and mag., March, 1893; offg. commr., May, 1896.

LEMAN, GEORGE DOWNTON, late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1857, and served in the rev. and jud. depts., Madras; principal asst., Ganjam, Dec., 1866; collr. and mag., Feb., 1872; retd., March, 1888.

LE MARCHANT, FRANCIS CHARLES, B.A.—Educ. at Eton and at Balliol Coll., Oxford (first class in classics, 1866); apptd. member of the council of the Sec. of State, 27th Feb., 1896.

LE MESSURIER, AUGUSTUS, C.I.E., Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Bombay engrs., Dec., 1856; served in the Mutiny; joined the Bombay public works dept., May, 1860; exec. engr., March, 1863; dep. consulting engr. for railways, Bombay, Aug., 1864; served in the Abyssinian expedn., 1868 (medal); dep. consulting engr. for railways in Sind, Aug., 1871; sec. to the railway transport committees, 1875-76 and 1876-77; suptg. engr., May, 1877; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, railway branch, 1877-78; served in the Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal); engr.-in-chief, Mysore state railway, Nov., 1879; joint sec. to chief commr., Mysore, 1880; manager, Mysore state railway, Feb., 1881; consulting engr. to Mysore govt., and sec. to chief commr., Coorg, March, 1882; engr.-in-chief, Bangalore-Harihar railway; offg. consulting engr., railways, Calcutta, Feb., 1888; chief engr. and sec. to govt. of Punjab, May, 1889; reverted to mil. duty, June, 1892; retd. from the army, May, 1893.

LE MESURIER, HAVILLAND, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Rugby, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 9th Nov., 1886, and served in Assam as asst. commr. and asst. sec. and personal asst. to chief commr.; transfd. to Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., April, 1892; joint mag. and dep. collr., May, 1893.

LE MESURIER, JOHN, Lieut.-Gen., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Bombay.—Joined Addiscombe, Feb., 1852; arrived, 26th Nov., 1855, and served in Sind as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; served with the Persian expedit.
1856-57 (medal and clasp); supt. of works, W. Indus, Karachi, Dec., 1873; suptg. engr., Jan., 1879; chief engr. for irrign. and joint sec. to govt. of Bombay, public works dept. (irrign.), March, 1884; suptg. engr. in Sind, Jan., 1886; retd., March, 1887.

LE QUESNE, WILLIAM HENRY, Bombay Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, 1st Oct., 1876; exec. engr., April, 1882; asst. chief engr. for irrign., 1886-87; under sec. to govt., public works dept., in 1891.

LE ROSSIGNOL, WALTER AUBIN, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Victoria Coll., Jersey, and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam., of 1891; arrived, 23rd Dec., 1893, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

LESHELIE, JOHN TASMAN WADDELL, M.B., Surgn.-Major.—First commn., 1st Oct., 1884; in mil. employ to 19th April, 1889, when he was apptd. sec. to inspr.-gen. of jails, Burma; junr. civil surgn., Rangoon, May-Nov., 1890; acting chemical examr. and prof., Calcutta med. coll., 1892; sec. to surgn.-gen. and sanitary commr. to govt. of India, Oct., 1893.

LESHELIE, MORICE, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to Haidarabad; exec. engr., May, 1884; transf'd. to Central Prov., Feb., 1886; asst. sec. to chief commr., June-Sept., 1887; transf'd. to Coorg, Jan., 1893.

LETHBRIDGE, SIR ALFRED SWAINES, K.C.S.I., M.D., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Indian Med. Service.—Joined the service, 30th Sept., 1867; served from March, 1872, as jail supt., ofig. civil surgn., and ofig. sanitary commr., British Burma, and afterwards of Bengal; inspr.-gen. of jails, Bengal, Jan., 1878; C.S.I., May, 1890; pres't. of the factory commn., 1890; and of the native passengers ship committee, 1890-91; gen. supt. of operations for the suppression of thagi and daka'ti, April, 1892; is a member of the viceroy's legisl. council.

LEETHEREN, SAMUEL KEMP, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at King's Coll., London; clerk, 2nd class, India store depot, 6th July, 1877.

LEUPOLT, JOHN CUNNINGHAM, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 10th Oct., 1862, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; civil and sessions judge, Aug., 1882; retd., April, 1889.

LEVESON, HENRY GEORGE ASHWORTH, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll., and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 14th Dec., 1889, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; asst. supt., S. Shan states, July, 1892.

LEVINGE, EDWARD VEE, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 28th Nov., 1888, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec., jud., &c., depts., Nov., 1893.

LEWIS, EDWIN MORRIS.—Supt., Bengal secretariat press, April, 1869; supt. of govt. printing, Bengal, Sept., 1877, to June, 1895.

LEWIS, THOMAS CRAMPTON, M.A., Punjab Educl. Service.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; joined the service as prof'r., govt. coll., Lahore, 18th Oct., 1881; principal, May, 1886; inspr. of schs., Nov., 1891; dir. of public instrn., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Oct., 1894; author of 'Arithmetic for Indian Schools,' and various articles on mathematical subjects.

LIARDET, CHARLES AYLMER, Col., I.S.C., late Rev. Survey Dept., Madras.—Ensign, Madras infantry, Oct., 1855; arrived, 14th Nov., 1855; served in the Madras rev. survey dept. from Oct., 1868; on famine relief works, 1877-78; dep. supt., Sept., 1884; retd., April, 1888.

LIDDERDALE, ROBERT, M.D., Brigade-Surgn., late Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 1858; supt. of vaccn., 8th Nov., 1860; sanitary commr., Bengal, April, 1880; retd., Jan., 1889.

LIGHTFOOT, JABEZ, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. from the Sind, Punjab, and Delhi railway as dep. manager, N.W. state railway, Jan., 1886; manager, Punjab section, March, 1887; Sind section, May, 1887; auditor, Oudh and Rohilkhand railway, Jan., 1889; transf'd. to superior acts. establ., Sept., 1889; acted as manager, Oudh and Rohilkhand railway, in 1890 and 1891; examr. of guaranteed railway acts., Madras, Oct., 1891.

LILLEY, ABRAHAM ROBERT, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 14th Sept., 1870, and employed in the Central Prov. and on state railways; transf'd. to Mysore, Oct., 1875; and to Assam, Oct., 1880; exec. engr., Jan., 1885; employed on railways in Burma from May, 1887.

LILLINGSTON, EDWARD GORDON, Col., I.S.C.—First commn., 30th Aug., 1859; from Feb., 1864, served in Bengal as asst. commr., ofig. pol. agent, Hill Tipperah, supt. of the central jail and the European penitentiary at Hazaribagh, and dep. commr.; reverted to mil. dept., March, 1892.

LINDSAY, BENJAMIN, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Methodist Coll., Belfast, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 4th Nov., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and in Oudh as asst. commr.; asst. supt., and small cause court judge, Dehra Dun, April, 1894.

LINDSAY, JAMES GAVIN, Col., R.E., late Indian Public Works Dept.—Lieut., Madras engrs., Aug., 1855; joined the dept., Dec., 1857; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasp); and subsequently as exec. engr. in Banda and Orissa; dep. consulting engr. for railways, 1863; exec. engr., railway survey, Mysore, April, 1870; ofig. engr.-in-chief, N. Bengal railway, 1872; acted as dir. of state railways, N.E. system, and joint sec. to Bengal govt., 1878-79; engr.-in-chief, Harnai and Gulistan-Karez sections of Kandahar railway, Feb., 1880; served in the Afghan campaign, 1879-80 (medal); suptg. engr. and sec. to rest., Haidarabad, March, 1881; engr.-in-chief, S. Mahratta railway, Nov., 1881; services lent to S. Mahratta railway co., May, 1884; engr.-in-chief, Bolan railway, April-June, 1885; retd., April, 1891.

LINDSAY, WILLIAM, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Winchester; junr. clerk, 31st Jan., 1867; private sec. to parly. under sec. of state, 1877-81; senr. clerk, Jan., 1882.

LIST, GEORGE HENRY, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., 12th April, 1873; exec. engr., July, 1875; ass't. sec., railway branch, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Oct., 1879; served subsequently on various railways; supt.,
way and works, N.W. railway, Nov., 1891; suptg. engr., March, 1892; chief engr., Aug., 1895.

**LISTER, ALLEN LINDSAY**, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Rossall Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1862; served in Madras as asst. and sub-collr. and on special duty in connection with the relief of the poorer classes, S. Arcot, 1868; on famine duty, 1877; colfr. and mag., S. Kanara, July, 1882; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1882; retd., March, 1890.

**LISTER, EDWARD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).**—Educ. at Sheffield Gr. Sch., and Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 26th Dec., 1894, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

**LISTER, WASTEL JAMESON, Major, R.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Educ. at Wellington Coll.; entered the service, 6th Jan., 1872; joined the dept., 26th April, 1875; served with the Kandahar field force in 1881; exec. engr., Sept., 1884.

**LISTON, JOHN, Col., I.S.C.**—Arrived as ensign, 29th May, 1856; served with the Bundelkhand field force in the campaign of 1859; from Aug., 1863, served in Jhansi, Kumaon, and Ajmir as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Lalitpur, Dec., 1879; offg. commr., Jhansi, Aug. to Nov., 1882; retd., Nov., 1889.

**LITTLE, CHARLES, M.D., M.C., L.R.C.S., L.M., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Service.**—Arrived, 1st Nov., 1872, and served under the mil. dept.; civil surgn., Akola, Jan., 1877; sanitary commr., inspr.-gen. of dispensaries, and supt. of vaccn. in the Haidarabad assigned districts, July, 1881.

**LITTLE, FREDERICK ARTHUR, Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at Uppingham Sch.; admitted a solicitor, 1874; acted as govt. solicitor and public prosecutor, Bombay, 1870 and 1883, and was confd. in this appt., May, 1884.

**LITTLE, JOHN ALBERT, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., 9th March, 1867, and served in various divns. in Central India; transfd. to state railways, Feb., 1871; exec. engr., Sept., 1872; dep. consulting engr. for railways, Calcutta, April, 1880; consulting engr., Aug., 1892, with rank of suptg. engr.; reverted to mil. dept., Feb., 1895.

**LITTLE, THOMAS DAVID, C.I.E., M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, June, 1859, and arrived, Oct., 1859; asst. engr., Aug., 1862, and exec. engr., Jan., 1869; suptg. engr., Sept., 1889; member of Bombay legisl. council, 1839-90, and from Jan., 1894; chief engr., Nov., 1891; sec. to govt., public works dept., Feb., 1894; C.I.E., Jan., 1895.

**LIVESAY, JOHN JAMES, late Bengal C.S.**—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 14th Nov., 1861; from Jan., 1863, served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., dep. commr., and mag. and collr.; on famine duty in 1874; retd., March, 1888.

**LLOYD, ERNEST SAMSON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).**—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Lincoln Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 21st Dec., 1894, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

**LLOYD, ERNEST THOMAS, B.A., B.L., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).**—Educ. at Charterhouse, Shrewsbury, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 2nd Feb., 1882, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transfd. to N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Nov., 1885, as asst. commr. and offg. city mag., Lucknow; joint mag., March, 1889; retd., Sept., 1894.

**LLOYD, FRANCIS, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at the Coll. Sch., Gloucester; apptd. from Haileybury Coll., in 1844; served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge and sessions judge; jud. asst. to mag., Satara, 1860; judge and sessions judge, 1861; judge of the high court, Bombay, 1869; retd. in 1873.

**LOBB, THEOPHILUS, late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1866, and posted to the Punjab; transfd. to mil. works, Jan., 1875; and to Haidarabad, Oct., 1876; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; employed in Madras, 1884-86; retd., April, 1895.

**LOCH, JAMES HENRY, M.D., Dep. Surgn.-Gen.—Joined the Bengal med. service, Dec., 1854; served with the Oudh field force in 1855, and at the relief of Azamgarh, 1858 (medal); from Aug., 1859, served in the N.W. Prov. as civil asst. surgn. and civil surgn. in various stations, and supt. of jail; dep. surgn.-gen., Central Prov., Jan., 1884; retd., Jan., 1889.

**LOCH, WILLIAM, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Pol. Dept. Govt. of India.—First commn., March, 1866; asst. pol. supt., Sawantwari, May, 1877, asst. to gen. supt. of operations for suppression of thagi and dakaithi, 1878; 2nd asst. to govrm.-gen.'s agent, Indore, 1879; asst. at Banswara and Partabgarh, 1880; during the Afghan war was on pol. duty with Major-Gen. Sir R. Phayre's force, marching to the relief of Kandahar (medal); 2nd asst. agent, Baluchistan, in charge of Pishin valley, Nov., 1880; asst. rest., W. Rajputana, and boundary settlt. officer in Marwar, April, 1889; acting pol. agent, Bikaniir, April, 1894; pol. agent, E. states of Rajputana, July, 1895.

**LOCH, WILLIE WALKER, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).**—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Glenalmond, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 14th Nov., 1868, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; junr. collr. and mag., Sept., 1888; senr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1890; acting commr. of customs, &c., Bombay, May, 1891; also British delegate for the Portuguese-Indian treaty; acting commr., N. divn., April-July, 1892; acting sec. to govt., rev., &c., depts., Oct., 1894; offd. again as commr. of customs, &c., Bombay, in 1894, and from March, 1895; member of legisl. council, July, 1895; retd. Sept., 1896.

**LOGAN, ALEXANDER COCHRANE, Indian C.S. (Bombay).**—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1881, and served as asst. collr. and mag., forest settlt. officer, and offg. under sec. to govt.; 1st asst., March, 1882.

**LOGAN, ROBERT, late Indian C.S.—Educ. at the Royal Acad., Inverness, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 28th Oct., 1869, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; from April, 1881, served in the fin. dept.; asst. comprt.-gen., Sept., 1881; under sec., govt. of India, fin. and commerce dept., July, 1883; dep. acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Dec., 1885; acctnt.-gen., Punjab Oct., 1889; acctnt.-gen., Bombay, and commr. of state paper currency, March, 1890; on special duty in Kashmir, 1891; offg. comprt. and auditor-gen., April, 1892; retd., Aug., 1894.
LOGAN, WILLIAM, late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Musselburgh Gr. Sch., and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1861, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., sub-collr., and collr. and mag.; fellow of univ. of Madras, March, 1881; acting member, board of rev., Nov., 1882; acting rest of Travancore and Cochin, May, 1883 to Feb., 1884; retd., 1883; publd. a collection of treaties, &c., relating to British affairs in Malabar, 1879; and edited Mr. Graeme's glossary of Malayalam words and phrases, 1882.

LOKENDRA NATH PALIT, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London, and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 13th Dec., 1886, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1893.

LONGE, FRANCIS BACON, Major, R.E., Survey of India Dept.—First commn., 2nd Feb., 1876; asst. supt., survey dept., March, 1880; dep. supt., April, 1888; served in Afghan war, 1879-81, and with the Suakim expedy. force, 1885.

LORD, ROBERT JOHN CORNWALLIS, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. Peter's Sch., Weston-super-Mare, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 2nd Nov., 1892, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

LORD, WALTER FREWEN, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., London, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1881, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; retd., Feb., 1889.

LORIMER, JOHN GORDON, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the Dundee Instn., High Sch., Dundee, Edinburgh Univ., and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1891, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and acting under sec. to govt.; asst. settl. collr., Jan., 1896.

LOVE, HENRY DAVISON, Major, R.E., Madras Educ. Dept.—Educ. at Univ. Coll., Bath, and Royal Mil. Acad., Woolwich; lieut., R.E., 12th Sept., 1872; acted as inspr. of schools for science and art dept., 1875-76; admitted to Madras establ., Oct., 1876; first asst. master, civil engrg. coll., July, 1877; served subsequently in the public works dept., and acted as dep. consulting engr. for railways, and as dep. chief engr. and under sec. to govt.; asst. examr. of accts., Nov., 1879; principal, civil engrg. coll., Jan., 1880; fellow of Madras univ., March, 1881; compiled a 'Manual of Hydraulics,' 1886.

LOVE, ROBERT, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the Royal Acad., Belfast, Queen's Coll., Galway, and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 16th Nov., 1891, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

LOVETT, BERESFORD, C.B., C.S.I., Major-Gen., R.E., late Mil. Works Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., June, 1853; arrived, Sept., 1860; joined the public works dept., April, 1861, and served in the Punjab till Sept., 1866, when he was transf'd. to the Persian telegraph dept.; asst. commr., Seistan boundary commn., Sept., 1870; rejoined public works dept. as exec. engr., Sept., 1872; C.S.I., Feb., 1873; attached to Bori valley field force, 1877-78; served in the Afghan war, 1878-79; transf'd. to Bengal, Feb., 1881; British consul at Astrabad, 1880-83; suptg. engr., Bengal, 1883; transf'd. to mil. works dept., April, 1885; commanding engr., Hazara field force, Sept., 1883; C.B., 1889; retd., Nov., 1894.

LOVETT, HARRINGTON VERNEY, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Sherborne, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 20th Nov., 1884, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr.; joint mag., Dec., 1883; dep. commr., Feb., 1896.

LOVETT-THOMAS, LEWIS HENRY, Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the dept., 5th Dec., 1870; asst. district supt., Feb., 1874; district supt., July, 1877; dep. inspr.-gen., Sept., 1894.

LOW, CHARLES ERNEST, B.A., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Rugby, and Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 19th Dec., 1893, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., and offg. under sec.

LOWIS, CECIL CHAMPAIN, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Newton Coll., Devonshire, Gottingen Gymnasium, and Corpus Christi Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 8th Jan., 1888, and served in Burma as asst. commr. and registrar to jud. commr.; under sec. to chief commr., April, 1891; offd. as sec. to chief commr., from Feb., 1895.

LOWIS, EDMOND ELLIOT, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 1st Feb., 1857; asst. mag. and collr., Aug., 1858; joint mag. and dep. collr., Sept., 1861; dep. commr., W. Duars, Oct., 1867; dep. collr. of customs, Calcutta, Oct., 1867; mag. and collr., Maldah, Dec., 1867; commr., March, 1875; retd., Dec., 1891.

LOWNDES, THOMAS, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Burma.—Joined the Madras army, Dec., 1854; served in the dept. from March, 1861, as supt.; on special mission to Chiengme, 1871; pol. agent, Bhamo, May, 1872, to Oct., 1873; inspr.-gen. of police, British Burma, Jan., 1876; apptd. to special duty in Upper Burma, Dec., 1885; retd., Aug., 1887.

LOWRY, WILLIAM EDWARD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Ley's Sch., Cambridge, London Univ., and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 30th Dec., 1895, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

LUARD, CHARLES HENRY, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., June, 1855; joined the dept., Nov., 1857; asst. principal, Thomason coll., 1863; asst. sec., govt. of India, public works dept., March, 1865; dep. supt., Ganges canal, 1865; dep. consulting engr., Bengal, Oct., 1867; offg. under sec., railway branch, 1873-75; suptg. engr., June, 1874; acted as mint master, Calcutta, 1876; and as consulting engr., Lucknow, 1877, Lahore, 1884, and Calcutta, 1885; chief engr., May, 1886; retd., Jan., 1890.

LUCAS, ARTHUR, Indian C.S. (Haidarabad Administration).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1883, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., forest settl. officer, and W. Bhil, agent; first asst., May, 1884; dep. commr., March, 1896.

LUCAS, WILLIAM HENRY, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 10th Nov., 1888, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; employed in Sind from Nov., 1891.

LUCKSTEIDT, HENRY, A.M.I.C.E., Indin Public Works Dept. — Trained at Thomason
Coll.; apptd., 10th Oct., 1871, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., May, 1884.
