MICHELL, Richard Brooke, M.A., B.L., Madras Jud. Dept.—Called to the bar (Lincoln's inn), April, 1872; admitted an advocate, Madras high court, Feb., 1874; law profr., presidency coll., July, 1881; acting administrator-gen., May, 1893; chief judge, Madras small causes court, July, 1894.

MICHELL, Theophilus, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., Jan., 1875; services lent to S. Indian railway co. in 1888-89, and to S. Indian railway co., 1891-92.

MICHELL, Thomas Bernard, Col., I.S.C., late Assam Commn.—First commn., Feb., 1858; arrived, 29th Jan., 1860; served in the Assam commn. from March, 1866; also temporarily in Bengal as cantonmt. mag., 1877-78; retd., March, 1886.

MICHELL, William, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1876, and posted as asst. engr. to state railways; exec. engr., Feb., 1888.

MIDDLETON, James Russell, M.A., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at St. Andrew's, and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 9th Nov., 1865, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; junr. collr. and mag., Aug., 1883; senr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1886; acted as commr., S. divn., 1889; retd., 1890.

MILES, Samuel Barrett, Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, Bombay infantry, Aug., 1857; from Nov., 1867, served as cantonmt. mag. and asst. rest., Aden; asst. pol. agent, Mekran Coast, 1871; from Oct., 1872, served as pol. agent and consul, Muscat; offl. pol. agent, Turkish Arabia, and consul-gen., Baghdad, 1879-80; pol. agent, Zanzibar, 1881; returned to agency of Muscat, 1883; acting pol. rest., Persian Gulf, April, 1886; pol. rest., Mewar, Dec., 1890; reverted to mil. dept., Dec., 1893; author of several papers on the history and geography of S. and E. Arabia.

MILLAR, Thomas, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—
Educ. at Liverpool Coll., King's Coll., Cambridge, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1893, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

MILLER, Sir Alexander Edward, Kt., C.S.I., B.A., LL.D., Q.C.—Educ. at Rugby and Trinity Coll., Dublin, where he obtained scholarship, 1st gold medal in mathematics and physics and 2nd gold medal in classics, besides the Berkeley medal in Greek; hon. LL.D. in 1875; called to the bar (Lincoln's Inn), 1841; Q.C. in 1872; examr. in law, London univ., 1874-79; and for council of legal educn., 1877-78; legal member of railway commn., 1877-88; master in lunacy, 1880; apptd. legal member of the govt. of India, Dec., 1890; took up his post, 8th April, 1891; C.S.I., May, 1895.

MILLER, Arthur, Library, India Office.—Writer, 11th Oct., 1867; clerk, 2nd class, March, 1880.

MILLER, John Francis James, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 13th Nov., 1868, and was employed on irrigtn. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Sept., 1874; served through the Hazara campaign, 1868 (medal with clasp), and Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal); suptg. engr., Nov., 1890.

MILLER, John Ontario, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at King's Coll., Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 8th Dec., 1879, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.; asst. sec. to govt., Jan., 1883; under sec., May, 1884; private sec. to lieut.-govr., 1886-87; settl. officer, Oct., 1888; dir. of land records and agric., March, 1892; dep. commr., Nov., 1895; mag. and collr., Dec., 1895; offd. as jud. sec. and as fin. sec. to govt. in 1895 and 1896.

MILLER, Leslie Creery, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Charterhouse, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 28th Nov., 1883, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and head asst.; manager, Pittapur estate, 1891-92; princpl. asst. and dist. mag., Nov., 1895.

MILLETT, H., B.L., late Bengal Jud. Service.—Profr. of English law, presidency coll., Calcutta, April, 1870; receiver, high court April to Dec., 1873; offf. asst. sec. to govt. of Bengal, legisl. dept., Dec., 1873, to April, 1875; first judge, Calcutta court of small causes, Jan., 1876; retd., 1889.

MILLETT, Montague, Major-Gen., late Police Dept., Punjab.—First commn., 1857; arrived, 16th Oct., 1857; from Sept., 1864, served in the police dept., Punjab, as asst. sup. and district supt.; reverted to mil. dept., Oct., 1887.

MILLS, Charles Augustus, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll., apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1870, and posted to Bengal; exec. engr., May, 1883; inspr. of works, Behar divn., Nov., 1892.

MILLS, James, Veterinary Capt., Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the dept., 23rd June, 1875; apptd. principal and profr., Bombay veterinary coll., Aug., 1891.

MILNE, Alexander, M.B., C.M., F.C.S., Surgn.-Major, Calcutta Mint.—First commn., and 2nd April, 1881; after serving in mil. employ, and offf. as chemical analyser, Bombay, and civil surgn. at various stations, was apptd. dep. assay master, Calcutta mint, Nov., 1892; dep. assay master, Bombay, March, 1895.

MILNE, William Paul, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at the Calcutta Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd. as foreman of works, Bengal, July, 1874; apprentice engr., Oct., 1874; asst. engr., Sept., 1875; exec. engr., Dec., 1887; transf'd. to state railways, July, 1890.

MILSOM, Boswell Parkinson, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 1st March, 1871, and posted to state railways in the Central Prov.; in 1873-76 was employed in the provl. roads and buildings, and irrigtn. branches; exec. engr., Sept., 1883; employed on Kashmir railway survey, Nov., 1890; offf. dep. manager, E. Bengal line, March, 1891; services lent to Assam-Bengal railway co., Jan., 1893.

MINNS, Walter Hardwick Christopher, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Marlborough, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 17th Nov., 1891, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

MIRZA Abbas Ali Baig, B.A., Statutory C.S. (Bombay).—Joined the service, 8th Jan., 1882; employed in Janjira state, 1886-90; probr. under the native civil service rules, and asst. collr., 1st April, 1890; offf. as 4th presidency mag., 1893; apptd. oriental translr. to govt., June, 1893.

MITCHELL, Horace, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch.; clerk, 2nd class, 27th March, 1885.

MITCHELL, Thomas Candy, M.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 13th Nov., 1875, and served as asst. mag. and collr. in Bengal; from May, 1876, served in Burma as asst. commr. and boundary and settl. officer; dep. commr., Aug., 1886.

MOBERLY, Charles Morris, Col., I.S.C., late India Public Works Dept.—Ensign, 2nd European regt., Madras, May, 1855; joined the dept., May, 1867, and served as examr. of railway acts, at various stations; sec. to railway conference, 1884; reverted to mil. dept., July, 1892.

MOBERLY, Henry, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Bradfield Coll., and King's Coll. Sch., London; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 7th Dec., 1880, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; special asst., Nov., 1888; sub-collr. and joint mag., March, 1894.

MOCKLER, Edward, Col., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Bombay infantry, Aug., 1859; served as asst. rest., Aden, 1866-73; in civil employ, Mekran coast, from 1873; asst. to the govr.-gen.'s agent, Baluchistan, Oct., 1879; asst. agent and consul, Bassora, Nov., 1881; asst. pol. agent, Bassora, 1883-86 and 1887; pol. agent, Muscat, 1886-87 and 1887-91; pol. rest., Turkish Arabia, May, 1892; author of an Arabic grammar, a Baluchi grammar, &c.

MOHENDRO NATH BOSE, late Jud. Dept., Bengal.—From 26th Feb., 1859, served in the subord. jud. service, Bengal; small cause court judge, Feb., 1872; offf. judge, high court, 1882-84; retd., Oct., 1890.

MOHSIN BADRUDIN TYABJI, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. Mary's Inst. and St. Xavier's Coll., Bombay, and at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 28th Oct., 1887, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., Feb., 1895.
MOIR, WILLIAM, M.A., M.B., Brigade Surgn., late Med. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establtn., 20th Jan., 1860; from June, 1863, served in the N.W. Prov. as civil asst. surgn. and supt. of jail; supt., meteorological observatory, Meerut, June, 1868; offg. chemical examr., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, 1878-79; and again in 1883; retd., April, 1891.

MOIR, WILLIAM ROBERT GRAY, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Charterhouse and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 11th Nov., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.

MOLESWORTH, SIR GUILDFORD LINDSAY, K.C.I.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Educ. at the Coll. of Civil Engrs., Putney; in 1852 was chief asst. engr. on the London, Brighton, and South Coast Railway, which he left in order to superintend the construction of buildings and machinery at Woolwich, during the Crimean war; afterwards practised as a consulting engr. in London; engr. on the Ceylon railway, 1859, and chief engr., 1862; dir.-gen. of the railway, 1865; dir. of public works in 1867; consulting engr. for state railways to the govt. of India, April, 1871; acted as dir.-gen. of railways and dep. sec. to govt. of India, March-June, 1880; K.C.I.E., June, 1888; retd., 1889; fellow of the univ. of Calcutta; a British delegate to the Brussels monetary conference, 1892; is the author of many publns. on engrg., monetary, and other subjects, including a 'Pocket-book of Engrg. Formulae,' 'Iron Manufacture in India,' 'Text-book of Bimetallism,' 1886, &c., &c.

MOLLOY, ROBERT ALFRED, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrigtn. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., May, 1883.

MOLONY, EDMUND ALEXANDER, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Marlborough and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 16th Dec., 1886, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. commr.; asstt. settlt. officer, Nov., 1893; joint mag., Nov., 1895.

MONAHAN, FRANCIS JOHN, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at the Oratory Sch., Birmingham, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 13th Dec., 1885, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., offg. under sec., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; transf. to Assam as asst. commr., March, 1892; dep. commr., May, 1894.

MONDY, EDMUND FELIX, A.R.S.M., F.C.S., Bengal Educn. Dept.—Joined the service, 5th Nov., 1880, as prof'r., Sibpur civil engrg. coll.; prof'r., Rajshahi coll., Oct., 1877; and at Dacca coll., Nov., 1887.

MONEY, ALONZO, C.B., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1843; joint mag. and dep. collr., Bakarganj, 1846; supt. of survey, Monghyr, 1850; mag. and collr., Behar, 1857, and afterwards of Shahabad, Tirhut, and Puri; controller of govt. salt-chowkies, 1869; commr., Bhagalpur, 1863; commr. of Patna, and member of legisl. council, 1869; member of rev. board, 1869; also district and sessions judge, Bareilly, 1875; retd., 1878.

MONEY, ROBERT COTTON, Major-Gen., I.S.C.—First commr., 20th March, 1855; from 1st March, 1861, served in Bengal, and was apptd. dep. commr., 2nd grade, April, 1877; manager of the Darbhanga Raj estate, 1876-78, and again, Jan., 1880; retd., March, 1886.

MONEY, WILLIAM JAMES, C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1853; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. supt. of survey, and was employed as civil officer with the troops in the Sonthal insurrection, 1855-56; private sec. to chief commr. of Oudh, Aug., 1857; served during the Mutiny (medal); employed subsequently in Bengal and N.W. Prov.; supt. of rev. survey, 1860; mag. and collr., and salt agent, Cuttack, 1861; district and sessions judge, Majansingh, Sept., 1873; retd., 1879.

MONK, HUGH LEWIN, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apprentice engr., 1st Sept., 1865; asst. engr., April, 1866; transf. to state railways, Dec., 1869; exec. engr., Sept., 1873; engr.-in-chief, Mu valley railway, April, 1891; suptg. engr., Jan., 1892; offg. manager, Burma state railway, March, 1895.

MONRO, ALEXANDER, M.A., B.C.L., B.L., Educn. Dept., Central Prov.—Arrived, 2nd June, 1879, and served as inspr. of schools; fellow of Madras univ., 1885; inspr.-gen. of educn. Central Prov., Jan., 1889; in 1893-94 acted as dir. of public instrn., and member of legisl. council, Madras.

MONRO, JAMES, C.B., late Bengal C.S.—Arrived, 27th Jan., 1883; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., offg. under sec. to govt., joint mag., dep. collr. of customs, Calcutta, and sec. to the board of rev.; mag. and collr., Feb., 1872; district and sessions judge, April, 1874; inspr.-gen. of police, Bengal, Jan., 1878; commr. of the presidency divn., March, 1883; retd., 1884, and was apptd. dir. of criminal investigations in Scotland Yard; in Nov., 1888, was apptd. chief commr. of metropolitan police, but resigned that office, June, 1890.

MONTAGU, JOHN MONTHERMER, M.A., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1876, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., Nov., 1888.

MONTEATH, JAMES, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Royal Acadl. Instn., and Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 5th Nov., 1870, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; under sec. to govt., rev., &c., dept., May, 1884; private sec. to the govt., Oct., 1886; junr. collr., Aug., 1891; senr. collr., May, 1894; sec. to govt., rev. and finl. depts., July, 1896.

MONTGOMERY, JAMES ALEXANDER LAWRENCE, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 26th Feb., 1868; from Nov., 1870, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and settlt. officer; dir. of settlt. and rev. records, Dec., 1883; dep. commr., May, 1887; wrote the Hoshiarpur settlt. report.

MOORE, EDWARD JAMES, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd July, 1868; transf. to state railways, Nov., 1869; exec. engr., April, 1874; services lent to Bengal-Nagpur railway co., Nov., 1887; to Gwalior durbar, Dec., 1890; and to Assam-Bengal railway co., Oct., 1892; suptg. engr., July, 1892; engr.-in-chief, Bezwada-Madras railway survey, March, 1895.

MOORE, ERNEST ANDREW, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Bradfield Coll. and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived,
25th Nov., 1889, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

MOORE, GEORGE MONTGOMERIE JOHN, C.I.E., Lieut.-Col., late R.A.—Mil. sec. on personal staff of the govr. of Madras (Sir M. E. Grant Duff), 1884-86; prest. of Madras municipal commn., Dec., 1886; retd., Jan., 1887; C.I.E., Jan., 1894.

MOORE, HARRY CHRISTOPHER, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Bradfield Coll., Balliol Coll., Oxford; and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 24th Dec., 1895, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

MOORE, JOHN GEORGE, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1856; arrived, 6th Nov., 1856, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and in Sind as asst. commr., &c.; junr. collr. and mag., Oct., 1876; senr. collr. and mag., Sept., 1877; prest. of the jail commn., 1878; acting commr. of customs, &c., May, 1887; commr., central divn., July, 1888; temporary member of govr.'s council, March, 1890; retd., Nov., 1891.

MOORE, Lewis, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Royal Sch., Armagh, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 7th Nov., 1869, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1888; compiled 'Trichinopoli District Manual.'

MOORE, LEWIS GRENVILLE, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Worcester Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 12th Dec., 1892, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

MOORE, Ross ARTHUR LESLIE, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Dulwich, and Peterhouse, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 7th Nov., 1882, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 1st asst., Nov., 1893; administrator, Sachin state, May, 1895; resig. mag. Bandea, Nov., 1895.

MORELAND, WILLIAM HARRISON, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 11th Nov., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., and acting under sec. to govt.; asst. settl. officer, Nov., 1893; asst. commr., April, 1894.

MORGAN, CHARLES, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—East India house writer, old establ., 22nd April, 1857; asst. to registrar, Oct., 1874; despatch clerk, Oct., 1892.

MORGAN, HENRY TILSON, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bath Coll. and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 12th Dec., 1894, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

MORGAN, JOHN WILLIAM AKERMAN, Veterinary Capt., India Civil Veterinary Dept.—Joined the (home) service, 12th June, 1878; served in the Zulu and Afghan wars; supt., civil veterinary dept., Bombay, May, 1892.

MORGAN, SIR WALTER, late Madras High Court.—Called to the bar, Middle Temple, 18th Nov., 1844; clerk of legisll. council of India, 1854; master in equity of the supreme court, Calcutta, 1859; puisne judge of Calcutta high court, 1862; chief justice of the high court of the N.W. Prov., 1866; and of the high court of Madras from 1871 until his retirement in 1879.

MORIARTY, ARTHUR STEPHEN, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 8th Dec., 1880, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge; judge and sess. judge, Feb., 1896; offlg. remembrancer of legal affairs, July, 1896.

MORISON, WILLIAM THOMSON, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Fettes Coll., Edinburgh, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1881, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; transfd. to Burma as asst. commr., 1887 (medal with clasp); dep. commr., May, 1889; retransfd. as 2nd asst., Nov., 1891; administrator, Porbandar state, March, 1894.

MORLEY, GEORGE STREATFIELD, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1877, and posted to Bombay as asst. engr.; lent to Delhi municipality, Oct., 1879; transfd. to Punjab, Jan., 1882; exec. engr., March, 1886; transfd. to Hyderabad, May, 1894, and to Assam, Jan., 1896.

MORRIS, JOHN GEORGE, Major, I.S.C., late Berar Administration.—Joined the service, 28th Feb., 1874; acted as boundary settl. officer, Bhopal, 1880-82; cantonmt. mag., Saugor, March, 1883; asst. commr., April, 1887; dep. commr., Jan., 1893; retd., May, 1894.

MORRIS, SIR JOHN H., K.C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1847; arrived, 4th Jan., 1848; served in the Punjab as asst. restt., Lahore, asst. commr. and asst. settl. officer in the trans-Sutlej divn.; settl. officer, Multan, 1854; mag. and collr., Allahabad, May, 1862; settl. commr., Central Prov., Sept., 1863; jud. commr., Central Prov., June, 1868; chief commr., Central Prov., May, 1870; retd., 1883.

MORRIS, ROBERT, M.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at High Sch., Glasgow, Univ. of Glasgow, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 12th Jan., 1885, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Jan., 1891; dep. acctnt.-gen., Madras, May, 1891; special asst., Vizagapatam, Nov., 1894.

MORRIS, THOMAS WALTER, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Manchester Gr. Sch. and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 17th Nov., 1892, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

MORRISON, FRANK, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the telegraph dept., Sept., 1863; resigned, Feb., 1864; rejoined govt. service, and was employed in the accts. establ. (public works) in Bombay, Sind, the Punjab, and Calcutta; dep. comptlr., Nov., 1874; from Dec., 1875, served as examr. of public works and railway accts. in various divns.; govt. examr. of accts., E. Indian railway, Nov., 1891.

MORSE, FRANK HAMAN WALFORD, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., April, 1870, and posted to mil.works branch; employed in Madras on famine relief works, 1877-79; transfd. to state railways, Sept., 1881; exec. engr., May, 1883; in 1887-89 employed in Burma on provl. works; apptd. to E. Coast railway survey, Dec., 1889; and to open section of same line, March, 1894.

MORSHEAD, LEONARD FREDERICK, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam.of 1887; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1889, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.
MORTON, ANDREW, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., July, 1869; transf'd. to mil. works dept., July, 1872; and to state railways, locomotive dept., June, 1878; district locomotive supt., N.W. railway, April, 1880; offg. dep. supt., Dec., 1890; offg. locomotive supt., E. Coast railway, Aug., 1893.

MORTON, BOYCE WILLIAM DUNLOP, Lieut.-Gen., I.S.C., late Bengal Commn.—First commn., 9th June, 1848; served in Assam from June, 1854, as junr. asst. and principal asst.; dep. commr., Goalpara, April, 1861; supt. of Darjiling, Dec., 1866; on special duty for conducting the prosecution of Captain Playfair, Aug., 1876; dep. commr., 1st grade, Nov., 1879; reverted to mil. dept., Aug., 1885.

MOSCARDI, EDWARD HENRY, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Somerseshire Coll., Bath, and Worcester Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 7th Nov., 1876, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; asst. judge, Dec., 1881; judge and sessions judge, May, 1894.

MOSELEY, HERBERT, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Bishop's Stortford Coll. Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 12th Dec., 1863; from April, 1865, served in the rev. and jud. depts., Bengal, and was apptd. mag. and collr.; retd., Jan., 1891.

MOSS-KING, ROBERT CURZON HENRY, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Eton and Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 13th Dec., 1894, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

MOULE, HORACE FREDERICK D'OYLY, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 14th Nov., 1863; served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and dep. supt. of family domains of Maharaja of Benares; joint mag. and dep. collr., May, 1877; mag. and collr., Dec., 1884; sec., board of rev., 1886; commr., Nov., 1891.

MOUNSEY, CHARLES HERBERT, B.L., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1878, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. sessions judge; head asst., Anantapur, May, 1886; sub-collr. and joint mag., June, 1890; collr. and mag., Dec., 1894; compiled and edited the 'Reports of the Meriah Agents (Ganjam),' and wrote a 'History of the Ganjam Mahihs.'

MOUNTFORD, LEWIS JAMES, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 20th Nov., 1892, and served in Sind as asst. collr. and mag.

MOWAT, M., M.A., late Educn. Dept., Bengal.—Profr., presidency coll., June, 1876; Dacca coll., Jan., 1878; Patna coll., Feb., 1880; retd., 1891.

MOYLE, GEORGE, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., Jan., 1885; services lent to Bengal-Nagpur railway co., Oct., 1887.

MUHAMMAD ABBAS, MIRZA, late Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Probr. under native civil service rules, 16th Feb., 1880; confd., March, 1882, and served in Oudh as asst. commr.; joint mag., Oct., 1888; resigned, Feb., 1894.

MUHAMMAD AFZAL KHAN, C.S.I., Nawab, Khan Bahadur, Hon. Lieut.-Col., late 11th Bengal Lancers.—Apptd. British agent at the court of the Amir of Kabul, March, 1882; retd., 1885; native A.D.C. to govr.-gen., June, 1885.

MUHAMMAD AFZAL KHAN, Nawab, Khan Bahadur, Statutory C.S. (Punjab).—Probr. under native civil service rules, 3rd March, 1881; asst. commr., Oct., 1885; British agent at Kabul, June, 1891, to March, 1894; dep. commr., Nov., 1895.

MUHAMMAD ALI, SAIYID, B.A., Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. proby. asst. mag. and collr., under the statutory rules, 4th April, 1887; confd., 17th April, 1889, and served as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.

MUHAMMAD ASLAM KHAN, Kazi, C.M.G., Punjab Commn.—Offg. extra asst. commr., 10th Sept., 1881; probr. under native civil service rules, Nov., 1882; asst. commr., Nov., 1884; on special duty with Afghan boundary commn., 1884-86; C.M.G., 1887; apptd. Mir Munshi to Punjab govt., May, 1887; native attache to foreign office, April, 1888; asst. commr., March, 1890; dep. commr., March, 1895.

MUHAMMAD HADI, SAIYID, Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. proby. asst. mag. and collr., 5th April, 1890; asst. dir. of land records and agric., Dec., 1891; also supt. of inland emigration, Sept., 1893.

MUHAMMAD HYAT KHAN, Khan, C.S.I., Punjab Commn.—Joined the service, 16th April, 1858; extra asst. commr., Punjab, March, 1862; asst. commr., Jan., 1872; C.S.I., May, 1872; offg. pol. asst. with the Kuram field force, 1878; pol. officer with the staff of Sir F. Roberts, Kabul field force, 1879-80; district judge, Dec., 1886; divl. judge, March, 1890; member of council, Kashmir, 1892-94.

MUHAMMAD ISHAK KHAN, Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. a probr. under native civil service rules, Jan., 1884; confd., Aug., 1885; asst. mag. and collr., April, 1888; asst. commr., Nov., 1889; joint mag., May, 1890.

MUHAMMAD RAFIQ, B.L., Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service, 1st Sept., 1892, as small cause court judge, Lucknow; addl. civil judge there, Jan., 1894.

MUHAMMAD RAZA KHAN, Statutory C.S. (Madras).—Served from 14th Jan., 1874, in the Madras rev. and educ. depts., and in Haidarabad as attache to the rest; apptd. a member of the civil service, 3rd Nov., 1882; asst. collr. and mag., Feb., 1883; head asst., Feb., 1890; sub-collr. and joint mag., July, 1895.

MUHAMMAD SAMI-ULLA KHAN, Maulvi, C.M.G., late Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov.—Joined the service as sub-judge, 1st May, 1873; district judge, May, 1887; retd., Nov., 1892.

MUHAMMAD YASIN KHAN, Berar Administration.—Joined the service, 3rd May, 1876, as attache to the rest, Haidarabad; asst. commr., Berar, Sept., 1881; special asst. commr., May, 1894; services lent to Haidarabad state from July, 1891.

MUIR, ARCHIBALD MUNGO, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 30th Sept., 1868; served in the Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal and clasp); private sec. and A.D.C. to lieut.-govr. of N.W. Prov., Aug., 1878; served in 1878 as asst. agent to the govr.-
gen. in Rajputana, pol. officer at Kandahar, and as asst. gen. supt. for thagi and dakaiti; asst. boundary settlt. officer, Central India, Nov., 1883; and in Rajputana, Nov., 1885; cantonmt. mag. at Nasirabad, April, 1886, and afterwards at Haidarabad; 2nd asst. and asst. sec. for Berar, Jan., 1889; pol. agent, S.E. Baluchistan, July, 1890; pol. agent, Bhopawar, April, 1892; pol. officer in charge of ex-Amir of Kabul, March, 1893.

MUIR, JOHN FAIRLIE, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Edinburgh Acad., and Rugby Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 10th Oct., 1867, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; 1st asst., May, 1880; junr. collr. and mag., Belgaum, April, 1887; senr. collr., June, 1890; collr. and mag., Dharwar, and pol. agent, Savanur, Aug., 1893; retd., May, 1896.

MUIR, JULIUS WOOD, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Dumfries Acad., and Edinburgh Univ.; called to the bar at the Middle Temple; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 1st Nov., 1871, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; asst. commr., in Oudh, Sept., 1885; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1889.

MUIR, SIR WILLIAM, K.C.S.I., D.C.L., L.L.D., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Kilmarnock Gr. Sch., and Edinburgh and Glasgow Univs.; apptd. from Haileybury, 1837; arrived, 16th Dec., 1837; settlt. officer in Cawnpore and Bundelkund, 1840-43; offg. collr., Fatehpur, 1844-45; sec. sadar board of rev., 1847; sec. to govt. of N.W. Prov., 1852; member, board of rev., 1856; in charge of intelligence dept. at Agra during Mutiny, 1857; sec. with Lord Canning at Allahabad for N.W. Prov., 1858; reverted to board of rev., 1859; member of legisl. council of govr.-gen., 1864; foreign sec., govt. of India, 1865; lieut.-govr. N.W. Prov., 1868-74; finl. member of govr.-gen.'s council, 1874-76; member of council of sec. of state, 1876-83; principal, Edinburgh univ., 1885; hon. D.C.L. of Oxford, and L.L.D. of Glasgow and Edinburgh; author of 'Life of Mahomet and History of Islam to the Era of the Hegira,' 1858; 'Annals of the Early Caliphate,' 1883; and other works on the same subject; of a pamphlet on indigenous educn. in Fatehpur, 1845; and of papers on rev. settlt. in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, &c.

MUIR, WILLIAM JAMES WEMYSS, Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Lieut., Bengal artillery, Dec., 1858; asst. agent to govr.-gen. Rajputana, Sept., 1863; asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakaiti, June, 1864; pol. supt., Sirohi, Sept., 1865; pol. agent, Murshidabad, 1876; cantonmt. mag.; Nimach, 1879; Haraoiti and Tonk, 1880; Ajmir, Merwara, May, 1889; offg. pol. agent, Alwar, Aug., 1890; retd., June, 1892.

MUIR-MACKENZIE, JOHN WILLIAM PITT, M.R.A.C., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Eton; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 28th Nov., 1876, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., asst. pol. agent in charge of Jath state, and forest settlt. officer; on famine duty in 1876 and 1877; 2nd ast., Nov., 1887; acting dir. of land records and agric., Feb., 1888; under sec. to govt. of India in rev. and agric. dept., March, 1889, to April, 1893; on special duty to Réunion, April, 1893; 1st asst. collr. and mag., Aug., 1893; junr. collr. and collr. of salt rev., Feb., 1895; junr. collr. and mag., March, 1896; offg. sec. to govt. rev. and fin. dept., July, 1896.

MUKERJEE, SATIS CHANDRA, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. in India and at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 16th Dec., 1892, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

MULES, HORACE CHARLES, Sind Rev. Commn.—Educ. at Wellington Coll.; joined the service, 18th May, 1876, as supy. dep. collr.; asst. collr. and mag., April, 1883; head asst. collr., Feb., 1894; dep. commr., Nov., 1895.

MULLALY, CHARLES MYLNE, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Southampton Gr. Sch., Hartley Instn., Southampton, and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 3rd Nov., 1879, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Nov., 1887; sub-collr. and joint mag., Jan., 1892; collr. and mag., April, 1895.

MULLALY, JOSEPH JOHN, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrig. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Oct., 1882.

MULLEN, DOUGLAS FRENCH, M.D., Surgn.—Major, Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1877; arrived, 25th Oct., 1877, and served from April, 1878, under the foreign dept. in med. charge of the Mewar Bhil corps, and offg. residency surgn., Mewar; confd. in latter appt., Nov., 1885; civil surgn., Ajmir, and med. officer of Merwara battalion, March, 1893.

MULLINS, JOHN, Lieut.-Gen., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—2nd lieut., Madras engrs., 8th Dec., 1848; arrived, 28th Oct., 1850, and served in Madras as asst. civil engr., and district engr.; consulting engr. for the irrig. and canal co., Madras, 1864-69; under sec. to govt., public works dept., Feb., 1869; chief engr. for irrig. and joint sec., Nov., 1870; prest., irrig. committee, famine commn., 1878-79; on special duty for drawing up the Bangalore water supply scheme, Oct., 1883; reverted to mil. dept., 1884; retd., 1886; author of 'Madras Irrig. Manual.'

MULOCK, FRANCIS BERRY, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Portora Royal Sch., Enniskillen, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 2nd Nov., 1871, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; on special duty for imperial assemblage at Delhi, 1876; asst. commr., April, 1886; joint mag., Ballia, April, 1887; dep. commr., Lucknow, Oct., 1892; mag. and collr., Feb., 1890; offg. commr., Fyzabad, April, 1896.

MULOCK, HENRY PILKINGTON, late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Kingstown Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 1st Nov., 1865, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine relief duty, 1873-74; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1878; district and sessions judge, Aug., 1886; retd., Nov., 1895.

MULOCK, WILLIAM BURY, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 28th Nov., 1862, and served in Bombay as asst. registrar of the high court, and asst. collr. and mag.; from April, 1873, to Nov., 1876, served as asst. commr. and branch inspr.-gen. of assurances in Sind, also as inspr. of educn.; junr. collr. and mag., Jan.,
1880; senr. collr. and mag., March, 1885; acting commr., N. divn., Sept., 1888; retd., Nov., 1889.

MUNRO, JAMES HUME, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Newcastle-on-Tyne Gr. Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 21st Nov., 1886, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., March, 1893.

MURDOCH, DAVID DOIG, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Univ. of Aberdeen, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 7th Dec., 1882, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., April, 1890; dep. commr. of salt, &c., rev. (S. divn.), and sec. to the commr., July, 1894.

MURPHY, MATTHEW JOSEPH, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., Blackrock, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 21st Dec., 1881, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

MURRAY, ALAN, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Oudh Commn.—Arrived, 4th Feb., 1857, and served during the Mutiny (medal and two clasps); served in the Oudh police dept. as asst. supt. in 1866-67, and subsequently as asst. commr., and asst. settl. officer; junr. sec. to chief commr., 1874-78; attache in foreign office, 1876-77; district judge, April, 1886; dep. commr., Kheri, April, 1886; retd., March, 1887.

MURRAY, FREDERICK CHARLES, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Calcutta Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd., 24th May, 1872, and employed in the Punjab in mil. works branch; transfld. to that prov., Nov., 1879; exec. engr., Oct., 1881.

MURRAY, JOHN, M.A., M.D., Inspr.-Gen. of Hosps., late Bengal Med. Service.—Educ. at Peterhead, and Marischal Coll. and Univ., Aberdeen; asst. surgn., Indian med. service, 1832; field surgn. at the battle of Alwal, 1846; surgn., 1848; dep. inspr.-gen. of hosps., 1858; inspr.-gen. of hosps., 1865; retd., Jan., 1871; has written various papers on cholera and its treatment.

MURRAY, ROBERT DAVIDSON, M.B., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—First commn. 31st March, 1875; served as civil surgn. at various stations from April, 1876; 1st rest. surgn., Calcutta Gen. Hosp., March, 1886; civil surgn., Howrah, Dec., 1895.

MYLNE, RIGHT REV. LOUIS GEORGE, M.A., D.D., Eccles. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 4th July, 1876; installed as Bishop of Bombay, 6th July, 1876.

NAFAR CHANDRA BHATTA, B.L., Bengal Jud. Dept.—Joined the service, 26th July, 1865, as munisif; subord. judge, Oct., 1877; small cause court judge, July, 1887; subord. judge, 1st grade, Oct., 1893; has edited the Indian evidence act.

NARINE, CHARLES EDWARD, C.B., Lieut.-Gen., R.A.—First commn., 7th Dec., 1855; served in the Mutiny, 1857 (medal), Yusufzai expdn., 1863, Afghan war, 1878-79 (medal), and Egyptian expdn., 1882 (medal and star, C.B., and 3rd class Medjidie); commandant and supt., sch. of gunnery, Shoeburyness, 1885-87; inspr.-gen. of artillery in India, 1887-92; major-gen., Bengal, 1892-93; commander-in-chief, Bombay, and second in council, Sept., 1893, to the abolition of that post, April, 1895; lieut.-gen. commanding the forces in Bombay, April, 1895.

NANDA KRISHNA BOSE, M.A., Statutory C.S. (Bengal).—Employed in the educn. dept. from Aug., 1878; apptd. asst. mag. and collr. on probn., Jan., 1880; confd., Sept., 1881; joint mag. and dep. collr., June, 1890; mag. and collr., Aug., 1894.

NANNEY, LEWIS CHARLES, L.F.P.S., L.S.A., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 31st March, 1886; served under the mil. dept., also acting as civil surgn. at various stations, and as supt. of jail; supt., lunatic asylum, Madras, Oct., 1875; also profr., med. coll., July, 1876; med. officer, Coonoor and Kotagiri, 1879-81, and at Utakamand, 1881-83; special sanitary officer, Utakamand, Aug., 1881; civil surgn., Cannanore, July, 1883, Trichinopoli, June, 1884, and Karnul, May, 1890; retd., May, 1892.

NAPIER, ALAN BERTRAM, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Rossall Sch., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 24th Sept., 1889, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; registrar of the jud. commr.'s court, 1890-91; under sec. to chief commr., April to July, 1892; settl. officer, Sept., 1894.

NAPIER, Hon. GEORGE CAMPBELL, C.I.E., Lieut.-Col., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 14th Dec., 1861; from July, 1867, served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; on special duty in Persia, 1874, and at Kandahar, 1881; private sec. and A.D.C. to lieut.-govr. of N.W. Prov., April, 1882, to Sept., 1883; jud. asst., Feb., 1883; dep. commr., Nov., 1884; supt., Kapurthala state, April, 1885; retd., April, 1887.

NARAIN DAS, Rai Bahadur, late Oudh Jud. Dept.—Served in the postal dept. from June, 1855; temporary extra asst. commr., March, 1867; sub-judge, Oct., 1881; judge of the small cause court, June, 1882; retd., Sept., 1892.

NARENDRA NATH, Diwan, M.A., Punjab Commn.—Apptd. prob. under native civil service rules, 3rd Feb., 1888; asst. commr., Feb., 1890; has translid. Mill's 'Liberty' into Urdu.

NARSINGRAO BHOLANATH DIVATIA, B.A., Statutory C.S. (Bombay).—Apptd. prob. under the native civil service rules, Jan., 1844; confd. as asst. collr. and mag., Feb., 1886; 1st asst., May, 1895.

NARUL HUDA, SYED, B.A., LL.B., B.L., Statutory C.S. (Bengal).—Joined the service, 4th Aug., 1886; asst. mag. and collr., Jan., 1887; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1893.

NATHAN, ROBERT, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 20th Dec., 1888, and served in Bengal as asst.;
mag. and collr., and on settlt. work in Orissa; joint mag. and dep. collr., Nov., 1894; offic. under sec. to govt. of India, fin. and commerce dept., March, 1895.

NAYLOR, JAMES RICHARD, C.S.I., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 28th Oct., 1862, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge; remembrancer of legal affairs, July, 1876; acting chief sec. to govt., jud. &c. depts., 1879-80, and 1887; member of legis. council, Bombay, Aug., 1884; temporary member of council, Bombay, in 1887 and 1888; C.S.I., May, 1890; retd., June, 1892; legal adviser to the Gaekwar of Baroda, Oct., 1892.

NEALE, WALTER ERSKINE, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch. and St. John's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 10th Oct., 1862, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr. and settlt. officer; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1881; mag. and collr., Dec., 1881; commr. in Oudh, Feb., 1890; commr., Agra, Nov., 1893; acted as member of rev. board in 1894, and from Jan., 1895; commr., Meerut, May, 1896.

NEATHAM, ALBERT HENRY JOHN, India Audit Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 22nd Feb., 1879.

NEDHAM, WILLIAM ALFRED, Central Prov. Commn.—Joined the service as asst. commr. 12th July, 1864; served as asst. district supt. and district supt. of police, supt. of sch. of industry, and in 1874 in Bengal on famine duty; in 1882 was dep. supt. of census; judge of small cause court, Jabalpur, Sept., 1889; dep. commr., Dec., 1889.

NEEL, EDMUND, C.I.E., Pol. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Victoria Coll., Jersey; India office writer, old establ., 3rd March, 1859; junr. clerk, mil. dept., 1860; asst. précis writer to the sec. of state, 1868-71; mil. dept., 1871; senr. clerk, Jan., 1872; funds dept., 1874; asst. sec. in the mil. dept., Aug., 1881; asst. sec. in the pol. and secret dept., 1885; offd. as sec., Jan. to May, 1887, Sept., 1889 to May, 1890, and June, 1890 to Jan., 1891; C.I.E., May, 1890.

NEILL, JOHN WILLIAM, late Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at King's Coll., London, and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 25th Nov., 1864, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., registrar, jud. commr.'s court, and asst. sec. to chief commr.; sec., March, 1877; commr., June, 1880; fellow of the univ. of Calcutta, 1883; offd. as chief commr., Feb., 1887, and Nov., 1890; judicial commr., Jan., 1891; prest of the comm. on the working of the Deccan agriculturists relief act, Dec., 1891; retd., April, 1894; apptd. lecturer on Indian law, Univ. Coll., London, July, 1895.

NEILL, LINDSAY, late Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at foreign schs., King's Coll., London, and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 31st Oct., 1867, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; under sec. to govt. of India, home dept., April, 1877; inspr.-gen. of registrn., supt. of stamps, and commr. of excise, Central Prov., Dec., 1877; dep. commr., June, 1880; addl. commr., Jan., 1883; sec. to the chief commr., March, 1883; commr., April, 1890; retd., Oct., 1894.

NELSON, JAMES HENRY, M.A., B.L., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., acting registrar of the high court, and small cause court judge; from June, 1872, served as civil and sessions judge; retd., Nov., 1887; prepared the Madura district manual.

NELSON, REGINALD ARBOUIN, B.A., LL.B., B.L., Madras Educl. Dept.—Educ. at Clare Coll., Cambridge; called to the bar (Inner Temple), July, 1886; joined the service, 2nd May, 1891, as principal, law coll., Madras; also acting law reporter, April, 1894.

NELSON, ROBERT EDWARD, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 2nd Oct., 1869, and posted to Central India; exec. engr., Jan., 1881; temporarily in state railways branch, 1883-84; transf. to Assam, Nov., 1885; and to Burma, March, 1890; asst. to chief engr. and under sec. to chief commr., 1892-93, and from April, 1895.

NESFIELD, JOHN COLLINSON, M.A., late Educn. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Educ. at Merton Coll., Oxford; from 22nd Jan., 1867, served in Bengal as profr., Krishnagarh coll., and at the presidency coll.; from May, 1872, served in Lower Burma as dir. of public instrn., and inspr. of schs.; transf. to Oudh, March, 1874, as dir. of public instrn.; principal, Benares coll., May, 1878; inspr. of schs., Nov., 1879; fellow of the Allahabad univ., 1887; dir. of public instrn., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Aug., 1892; retd., Oct., 1894; author of 'An Essay on the Kanjar Tribe,' 1882; 'On the Results of Primary Educn.in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh,' 1883, and 'On the Tharu and Bagsha Tribes,' 1883; 'Brief View of the Caste System of the N.W. Prov. and Oudh,' 1883; 'Two Essays on the Mushera Tribe,' 1888, &c., &c.

NEWBERY, HENRY JAMES, B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861; served in the Bengal rev. and jud. dept., and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1st grade, Dec., 1885; retd., April, 1887.

NEWBOULD, BABINGTON BENNETT, B.A., Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Bedford Sch. and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 28th Nov., 1888, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf. to Assam as asst. commr., April, 1894.

NEWCOMBE, ALFRED CORNELIUS, B.A., A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrign. works in the Punjab and the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; served in the superior accts. establ., 1878-81 and 1886-90, and in Assam, 1881-86; services lent to Nizam's govt., 1891-95.

NEWILL, JOSEPH HENRY, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 4th July, 1865; arrived, 25th Dec., 1865; served under the foreign dept. in the thagi and dakhaiti branch, from May, 1872; cantonmt. mag., Jan., 1882; 2nd asst. to rest. at Haidarabad, March, 1884; from March, 1887, served as pol. agent at Bhapawar, and afterwards in S.E. Baluchistan; pol. officer in charge of Sardar Ayub Khan, Nov., 1889; acting pol. agent, Jhalawar, Nov., 1892; cantonmt. mag., Nasirabad, Feb., 1895; offg. rest., W. states of Rajputana, March, 1895.

NEWMAN, JOHN HENRY, M.D., Surgn.-Col., Bengal Med. Establ.—First commn., 1867; served in the Abyssinian war, 1868, and Afghan
war, 1873-79; civil surgn., Ajmir, April, 1879; offd. as agency surgn., &c., in Rajputana in 1884 and 1885; residency surgn. and chief med. officer in Rajputana, Arg., 1892; offg. inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., Bengal, July-Nov., 1893, administrative med. officer and sanitary commr., Central Prov., March, 1895.

NEWMARCH, FRANCIS WELLES, B.A., Mil. Dept., India Office.—Matriculated at Balliol Coll., Oxford, Jan., 1873; scholar of Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford, 1873-78; junr. clerk, mil. dept., India office, 18th May, 1877; senr. clerk, March, 1892; rest. clerk, 1895-94; compiled jointly with Mr. Herbert, the India office cypher code.

NEWMARCH, LINDSAY SHERWOOD, Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Educ. at Haileybury and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; first commn., 13th Aug., 1879; from Feb., 1885, served as asst. agent at Indore, Ajmir, and Quetta; asst. rest., Mysore, Oct., 1889; first asst. to agent, Rajputana, Oct., 1892; and in same capacity, Central India, Aug., 1893.

NEWMARCH, SIR OLIVER RICHARDSON, K.C.S.I., Major-Gen., late I.S.C.—Ensign, Bengal infantry, March, 1855; admitted to the Bengal staff corps, July, 1857; 3rd asst. sec. to govt. of India, mil. dept., 1871; dep. acctnt.-gen., mil. dept., 1875; acctnt.-gen. and ex-officio dep. sec. to the govt. of India, April, 1878; sec. to govt. of India, mil. dept., July, 1886; retd., Nov., 1887; C.S.I., Jan., 1888; sec., mil. dept., India office, May, 1889; K.C.S.I., May, 1894.

NEWNHAM-SMITH, EDWARD DEEDES, B.L., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Bombay Jud. Dept.—First commn., 27th Feb., 1869; served through the Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal and clasp); cantonmt. mag., Disa, Oct., 1887; and at Poona and Kirkee, Oct., 1888.

NEWTON, HENRY, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Shrewsbury Sch., and Haileybury Coll., from which he was apptd. in 1844; served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge; jud. asst. to commr., Satara, 1854; joint judge and sessions judge, 1858; registrar, court of sadar diwani, Nov., 1859; acting puisne judge of the sadar court, Jan., 1860; judge of the high court, Bombay, 1863; acted as chief justice, Bombay, 1868; retd. in 1871.

NEWTON, JOHN, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 9th Oct., 1879.

NEWTON, WILLIAM GYLLICH, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1876, and employed on state railways and in the Central Prov.; on famine duty in Madras, 1877; exec. engr., Jan., 1885; transfd. to Burma, Aug., 1887.

NICOLETTI, HENRY SAMUEL, late Haidarabad Administration.—Arrived, 20th Jan., 1858, and served in the telegraph and police depts.; district supt. of police, Berar, 1868; asst. commr., May, 1872; judge, small cause court, Sept., 1882; dep. commr., Nov., 1888; retd., April, 1896.

NICHOLL, BERNARD VINCENT, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Beaumont Coll., Windsor, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 9th Nov., 1889, and served in Assam as asst. commr.

NICHOLLS, GEORGE JASPER, LL.B., B.L., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Exeter Gr. Sch., and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; called to the bar at Lincoln's Inn; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 29th Nov., 1864, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and in various acting appts.; transfd. temporarily to Bengal on famine duty, 1874-75; small cause court judge, Jabalpur, Sept., 1880; dep. commr., March, 1883; from July, 1883, served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as manager of the Awa state, and district and sessions judge; retd., June, 1895; author of 'The Law of the Central Prov.,' 'Digest of the Circulars and Standing Orders of the Chief Commissioner, Central Prov., 1862-80,' 'An Economic Gazetteer of the Central Prov.,' &c.

NICHOLSON, FRANCIS COBHAM, M.B., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 1st Oct., 1869; from March, 1873, served in Bengal as civil surgn. at various stations, also as med. inspector of labourers, acting supt. of the Campbell med. sch. and hosp., &c.; civil surgn. Patna, April, 1892; retd., April, 1896.

NICHOLSON, FREDERICK AUGUSTUS, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Royal Med. Coll., Epsom, and Lincoln Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 4th Dec., 1869, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mg., acting sub-sec. and sec., board of rev., and principal asst.; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1889; collr. and mg., Oct., 1889; compiled district manual of Coimbatore.

NICHOLSON, WILLIAM GUSTAVUS, C.B., Brigadier-Gen., R.E.—First commn., March, 1865; arrived, Dec., 1871; joined the public works dept., Feb., 1872, and served as asst. engr.; Haidarabad, and in the Punjab irrig. branch; transfd. to mil. works branch, 1873; exec. engr., March, 1876; served in the Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal and 3 clasps, bronze star); sec. to defence committee, April, 1882; served in Egyptian expdn., 1882 (medal and clasp, bronze star, 4th class Osmanieh); ex-officio asst. adjutant-gen., 1885; suptg. engr., March, 1886; served in Burma expdn., 1886-87; mil. sec. to commander-in-chief, July, 1890, to April, 1893, when he reverted to the mil. works dept.; chief engr., April, 1894; dep. adjutant-gen., Punjab, April, 1895.

NIGHTINGALE, WALTER HAWKINS, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 23rd July, 1868, and posted to Bengal; exec. engr., March, 1873; divl. supt., district works, 1882 and 1887; inspr. of local works in various divns., 1887-91; suptg. engr., March, 1892; sec. to chief commr. of Assam, public works dept., June, 1895.

NISBET, ROBERT PARRY, C.I.E., B.L., Col., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 20th Nov., 1859; from Aug., 1862, served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and asst. settlt. officer; jud. asst., July, 1876; dep. commr., April, 1877; commr., Rawal Pindi, Nov., 1886; rest. in Kashmir, Nov., 1888; retd., May, 1892; author of Gujranwala settlt. report.

NOBLE, CHARLES SIMEON, Col., I.S.C., late Oudh Commn.—Arrived, as ensign, Bengal native infantry, 14th Nov., 1858; from April, 1862, served in the police dept., Oudh, as asst. district supt., and district supt.; and from June, 1866, in the commn. as asst. commr., and dep. commr.; retd., Nov., 1890.

NOBLE, GEORGE JACKSON, Police Dept., Central Prov.—Joined the dept., 15th Dec., 1868; asst. to cotton commr., Sept., 1869; district supt. of police, April, 1874.

NOLAN, PHILIP, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ.
at Stonyhurst Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867; and served in Bengal; joint mag., Feb., 1880; mag. and collr., July, 1884; offg. sec., board of rev., March, 1885; sec., govt. of Bengal, gen., rev., and statistical dept., March, 1887; commr., Rajshahi divn., Dec., 1891.

NORFOR, Cecil Henry Thomas, Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 30th Aug., 1870; exec. engr., May, 1883.

NORMAN, Sir Henry Wylie, G.C.B., G.C.M.G., C.I.E., Gen., I.S.C.—Ensign in Bengal army, March, 1844; served throughout the Punjab campaign in 1848-49; brigade-major and asst. adjutant-gen. in various expeds. on the Peshawar frontier in the years 1850-54; commanded a detachment in the Sonthal campaign, 1855; served throughout the Mutiny, 1857-58, as assts. or dep. adjutant-gen., and the greater part of the time as adjutant-gen. to the army in the field; also in the campaigns in Rohilkhand and in Oudh, in 1858-59, including several actions; in 1860 was apptd. assts. mil. sec. at the horse guards; sec to govt. of India, mil. dept., 1862-70; member of the council of the govr.-gen. of India, June, 1870, to March, 1877; member of the council of the sec. of state for India, Feb., 1878, to Nov., 1883, when he was apptd. govr. of Jamaica; govr. of Queensland, 1888-95.

NORMAN, Matthew James Joseph Patrick, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 17th Oct., 1871, and posted to state railways; transf. to Bengal irrigen., June, 1873; exec. engr., May, 1883.

NORMAN, Thomas, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Royal Sch., Enniskillen, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 21st Jan., 1863; served in Bengal, and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1st grade, Oct., 1886; retd., Dec., 1887.

NORRIE, John Adam, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Watson's Coll., Edinburgh, Edinburgh Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 17th Dec., 1892, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as assts. commr.; assts. settl. offr., Oct., 1895.

NORRIS, John Freeman, Q.C., B.L., late Calcutta High Court.—Called to the bar (Inner Temple), 17th Nov., 1865; Q.C., Jan., 1882; judge of the high court, Calcutta, 17th June, 1882; retd., Nov., 1895.

NORTHBROOK (Earl of), Right Hon. Thomas George Baring, P.C., G.C.S.I., D.C.L.—Born 1826; educ. at Christ Church, Oxford, where he graduated in 1846; was successively private sec. to Mr. Labouchere at the board of trade, to Sir George Grey at the home office, to Sir Charles Wood at the India board, and at the admiralty till 1857; M.P. for Penryn and Falmouth, 1857-66; a lord of the admiralty, 1857-58; under sec. of state for India, June, 1859, to Jan., 1861; under sec. for war, Jan., 1861; again under sec. for India, July, 1861, to April, 1864; under sec. for home affairs, 1864-66; sec. to the admiralty, 1866; succeeded as second baron in the same year; again under sec. for war, 1868-72; viceroy and govr.-gen. of India, Feb., 1872, to Feb., 1876; G.C.S.I., May, 1872; created Viscount Baring, and Earl of Northbrook, 1876; first lord of the admiralty, 1880-85; high commr. on a special mission to Egypt, 1884; a royal commr. for the London exhibn. of 1886.

NORTHCOTT, John Percy Cyril Salt Marsh, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 17th Dec., 1894.

NORTON, David, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Kingstown Sch., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 24th Nov., 1874, and served in Bengal as assts. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; transf. for service in Burma as dep. commr., Jan., 1887; prest. of the Rangoon municipality, May, 1890; commr., April, 1891.

NUGENT, John, C.S.I., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Royal Instn. Sch., Liverpool, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 29th Nov., 1864, and served in Bombay as assts. collr. and mag.; under sec. to govt. in the jud., &c., depts., Feb., 1875; municipal commr., Bombay, Feb., 1881; sec. to govt. in rev., finl., and gen. depts., Dec., 1882; prest. of the central committee for vernacular deptl. exams.; chief sec. to govt., Aug., 1887; addl. member of viceroy's council, Jan.-March, 1891, and again, Dec., 1891, to March, 1892; commr., Belgaum, May, 1891; offg. chief sec. to govt., Nov., 1894; member of council, July, 1896; C.S.I., Jan., 1897.

NUGENT, John, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Stonyhurst Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 6th Nov., 1872, and served in Bengal, and the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, as assts. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; senr. assts. commr., Kumaon, Jan., 1887; supt., Dehra Dun, May, 1888; dep. commr., July, 1891; mag. and collr., July, 1893.

NURAL HUDA, Syud., B.A., LL.B., Statutory Civilian (Bengal).—Joined the service 4th August, 1886, and served in Bengal as assts. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1893.

OAKDEN, Ralph, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Cranbrook Gr. Sch., and at Hertford Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 16th Dec., 1895; and served in N.W.P. and Oudh as assts. mag. and collr.

OATES, Eugene William, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. assts. engr., 26th July, 1867, and posted to Burma; exec. engr., Feb., 1877; suptg. engr., Dec., 1891.

OBbard, Robert, B.A., Indian C.S. (Berar).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 27th Dec., 1873, and served in the Central Prov. as assts. commr.; on famine duty in Madras, 1877-78; special assts. commr., Berar, March, 1887; dep. commr., July, 1890; civil and sessions judge, April, 1891; jud. commr., Oct., 1895.

O'Brien, Bartholomew, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Med. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Apptd. assts. surgn., Bengal med. establ., 1st Oct., 1872; joined the dept. as acting civil surgn. and jail supt., Sept., 1873; confd., Oct., 1875.

O'Brien, Donatus, Lieut.-Col., late R.E., Store Dept., India Office.—First commn., 17th Dec., 1862; assts. inspr. of works, Woolwich arsenal, 1875-80; dep. dir. of public works, Jamaica, 1880-86; assts. inspr. of building works, Woolwich arsenal, 1886-89; supt. of the India store depot, Lambeth, March, 1889.

O'Brien, Joseph, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1870, and was in mil. employ until May, 1881; from that date served as civil surgn. and offg. pref., Calcutta med. coll.; apptd. prof. at the coll., and surgn. at the coll. hosp., April, 1892.
O'BRIEN, Peter Henry, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Malvern Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 6th Nov., 1882, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1891; transfd. to Assam as dep. commr., Jan., 1892.

O'CALLAGHAN, Francis Langford, C.S.I., C.I.E., M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., June, 1862, as asst. engr., Central Prov.; exec. engr., April, 1866; transfd. to the railway branch, 1870, and served as engr.-in-chief on various railway surveys; suptg. engr., Jan., 1880; C.I.E., May, 1883; C.S.I., Jan., 1888; chief engr., April, 1889; consulting engr. to govt. of India for state railways, May, 1889; sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., Aug., 1892; retd., July, 1894.

O'CALLAGHAN, Ignatius, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., Feb., 1873; traffic supt., Rajputana state railway, Dec., 1874; gen. traffic manager, Rajputana-Malwa railway system, April, 1885; retd., 1896.

O'CONNOR, James Edward, C.I.E., M.I.S.I., Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Registrar, dept. of agric. and commerce, June, 1873; asst. sec. in statistical branch of dept. of rev., agric., and commerce, Feb., 1875; asst. sec., dept. of fin. and commerce, Dec., 1879; on special duty in connection with the Melbourne exhibn., 1880-81; C.I.E., Jan., 1891; dir.-gen. of statistics, retaining his post as asst. sec., May, 1895; author of reports on the production of tobacco, vanilla, and lac, and on the cultivation of the ground nut, the carob tree, and the eucalyptus in India.

ODLING, Charles William, M.E., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 20th Oct., 1865; exec. engr., Sept., 1870; under sec. to govt. of Bengal, Feb., 1883; suptg. engr., Nov., 1889; chief engr. for irrign. and joint sec. to govt. of Bengal, March, 1892; sec., irrign. branch, Jan., 1893; transfd. to N.W. Prov. and Oudh as chief engr. and sec. in buildings and roads branch, Dec., 1895.

ODONNELL, Charles James, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at St. Ignatius' Coll., and Queen's Coll., Galway; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 14th Oct., 1872, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine duty, June, 1874; asst. to dir.-gen. of statistics, Feb., 1875; joint mag., July, 1884; mag. and collr., Aug., 1889; provl. supt. of census, Bengal, 1890-91.

ODWYER, Michael Francis, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at St. Stanislaus Coll., Tullamore, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after open exam. of 1882; arrived, 19th Nov., 1885, and was apptd. asst. commr. in the Punjab; settlt. collr., 1889-94.

OFARRELL, Horace Handley, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Westminster; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1875, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; sub-collr. and joint mag., Dec., 1888; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1891; collr. and mag., Jan., 1894.

OGILVIE, George Macartney, late Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1863, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and jud. asst.; dep. commr., Oct., 1881; commr. and supt., Nov., 1888; in 1893-94 and 1894-95 acted as finl. commr.; retd., Jan., 1896.

OHARA, William, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 30th Sept., 1874; arrived, 18th April, 1875, and served in Madras under the mil. dept., and as distric surgeon and jail supt. at various stations; distric med. and sanitary officer, Trichinopoli; May, 1895.

OKELLY, Hilary Martin, B.A., M.I.E.E., India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the service as asst. supt., 21st June, 1866; arrived, 14th Sept., 1866; supt., Jan., 1886; offg. dir., traffic branch, July-Oct., 1894.

OKINEALY, James, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Galway; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 2nd Feb., 1862, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., asst. supt. of survey, asst. commr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; apptd. addl. sessions judge of Bhagalpur, Sept., 1874; district and sessions judge, May, 1875; offg. sec., govt. of India, home dept., Dec., 1877; supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, Jan., 1878; member of legisl. council, 1880; judge of the high court, Calcutta, Feb., 1883; also prest. of the board of examrs., April, 1885.

OKINEALY, Peter, B.L., Calcutta High Court.—Called to the bar at Lincoln's Inn, 1876; apptd. standing counsel, Bengal, 19th April, 1895.

OLDFIELD, Francis Du Pré, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Marlborough and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 17th Nov., 1890, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

OLDFIELD, Sir Richard Charles, Kt., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1848; arrived, 9th Nov., 1848; served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; asst. sec. to govt., and ass't acctnt., N.W. Prov., March, 1856; mag. and collr., Farakhabad, March, 1864; from May, 1869, served in the jud. dept., and was apptd. civil and sessions judge, Jan., 1872; addl. judge, high court, N.W. Prov., Dec., 1874; puisne judge, high court, Nov., 1882; retd., March, 1887.

OLDHAM, Abel John, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 1st March, 1873, and posted to Bengal; employed in Madras on famine relief works, 1877-78; and in N.W. Prov. and Oudh on public works accts., 1881-82; exec. engr., Aug., 1881; transfd. to state railways, Sept., 1886; offg. dep. consulting engr. for railways, Calcutta, 1890; and at Lucknow, 1892-94; public works under sec. to govt. of Bengal, 1891-92; retd., Oct., 1895.

OLDHAM, Charles Evelyn Arbutinot William, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Galway Gr. Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 12th Dec., 1890, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec., jud., &c., depts., March, 1895.

OLDHAM, Francis George, Col., R. E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Dec., 1858; joined the dept., Feb., 1873; comprt. of accts., Haidarabad, April, 1875; examr. of guaranteed railway accts., March, 1878; examr. of telegraph accts., 1883; examr. of accts., Allahabad, Aug., 1885; examr. of accts., mil. works, Jan., 1887; retd., Jan., 1892.

OLDHAM, Richard Dixon, A.R.S.M., F.G.S., Geological Survey of India.—Joined the survey, 6th Nov., 1879, as asst. supt.; dep. supt., Sept., 1885; on special duty in connection with Tibet mission, 1886; supt., Oct., 1891; has revised the 'Manual of the Geology of India,' and contributed largely to the survey publns.
OLDHAM, WILLIAM BENJAMIN, C.I.E., Indian C.S.(Bengal).—Educ. at Kingstown Gr. Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1865, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Oct., 1874; dep. commr., Nov., 1879; on famine relief duty, 1866, and 1874, and at Bellary, 1877-79; mag. and collr., Aug., 1883; commr. of Chittagong, Oct., 1891; C.I.E., Jan., 1893.

OLIPHANT, HENRY LAURENCE, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived 8th April, 1858; from July, 1859, served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and dep. commr.; jud. commr., Chota Nagpur, April, 1877; retd., Oct., 1885.

OLIPHANT, JOHN S., late Funds Dept., India Office.—East India house writer, old establ., 22nd June, 1853; junr. clerk, minuting branch, 1855; private sec. to chairman and dep. chairman, 1857-58; India office, secretariat dept., 1859; asst. private sec. and précis writer to the sec. of state, 1863-65; senr. clerk, funds dept., April, 1866; asst. sec. mil. dept., 1872, but continued doing duty in funds dept.; also agent to administrators-gen. of India, 1877; acted as jud. and public sec. in 1879; dir. of funds, July, 1879; retd., Dec., 1893.

OLIVER, EDWARD EMMERSON, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept. as asst. engr., 8th Oct., 1868; offg. asst. sec. public works dept., govt. of India, May, 1874; exec. engr., Sept., 1874; asst. sec. to govt. of Punjab, public works dept., Aug., 1883; under sec., March, 1884, and again in 1890-90; suptg. engr., June, 1891; offg. chief engr. and sec. to govt. of Punjab, public works dept., April-May, 1894; and again from Oct., 1894; and as sec. to the chief commr. public works dept. Cent. Provs. from Mar., 1896; has publd., 'Reh Swamp and Drainage,' 'Coal and Iron in the Punjab,' 'The Decline of the Samanis and Rise of the Ghaznavis,' 'The Chagatai Mughals,' 'The Safavis in Persia,' 'Across the Border; or, Pathan and Biluch,' besides various papers in the Journals of the Royal Asiatic Society and the Bengal Asiatic Society.

OLIVER, JAMES WILLIAM, Burma Forest Dept.—Arrived, 4th Dec., 1874, and was apptd. asst. conservator; dep. conservator, July, 1880; conservator, May, 1891.

OLIVIER, HENRY DACRES, Major, R.E., A.M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Entered the service, 15th Dec., 1871; joined the dept., 1st June, 1875; employed in Baluchistan, 1878-80; exec. engr., and dep. consulting engr. for railways, Bombay, March, 1883; employed on Soudan railway, 1885; under sec. to govt., public works dept., 1889-91; agent to the Bombay, Baroda, and Central India railway co., Aug., 1894.

OLLIVANT, ALFRED, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., N.W. Prov.—Arrived as ensign, 20th April, 1857; medal for services during Mutiny, 1857; apptd. to Jhansi mil. police, July, 1858; from May, 1861, served as district supt. of police; dep. inspr.-gen., June, 1883; inspr.-gen., Jan., 1890; returned to Europe, 1891.

OLLIVANT, SIR EDWARD CHARLES KAYLL, K.C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Bombay.)—Educ. at Marlborough; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 21st Nov., 1868, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; on special duty at Baroda in connection with estate of Mir Zulfikar Ali, Jan., 1870; asst. commr. branch inspr.-gen. of registrn. in Sind, and Sindi translr. to govt., Sept., 1880; also dep. supt. of census in Sind, Jan., 1881; municipal commr. for Bombay, May, 1881; on special duty in England in this connection, 1883; C.I.E., May, 1883; pol. agent and collr. of stamp rev., Kathiawar, April, 1889; K.C.I.E., May, 1892; offd. as commr. in Sind from April, 1895.

OMMANNEY, HENRY TRAVERS, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 12th Nov., 1870, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., railway mag., cantonmt. mag., and second asst.; acting under sec. to govt., rev., &c., depts., April, 1886; and acting inspr.-gen. of police, May, 1888; junr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1891; senr., Feb., 1895; member of hemp drugs commn., 1893-94; retd., Oct., 1896.

ONSLOW (EARL OF), RIGHT HON. WILLIAM HILLIER ONSLOW, G.C.M.G.—Born in 1853; educ. at Eton and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. partly, under sec. of state for the colonies, Feb., 1887; acted as vice-prest. of the colonial conference, 1887, and as a delegate to the conference on sugar bounties; K.C.M.G., 1887; partly, sec. board of trade, Feb., 1888; govr. and commr.-in-chief, New Zealand, 1889-92; G.C.M.G., 1889; apptd. partly, under sec. of state for India, July, 1895.

OPPERT, GUSTAV, Ph.D., late Educn. Dept., Madras.—Profr. of Sanscrit, presidency coll., and curator of govt. oriental manuscript library, 14th Nov., 1872; fellow of Madras univ., 1873; Telugu translr. to govt., Sept., 1878; retd., April, 1893.

ORMOND, ERNEST W., B.L., Bengal Jud. Dept.—After serving temporarily in 1891-92 as asst. sec. to the govt. of Bengal, legisl. dept., was apptd. to act as 2nd judge, Calcutta small cause court, March, 1893; confd., Dec., 1894.

ORR, JAMES PETER, Incan C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Hurstpierpoint, and Caius Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 12th Oct., 1889, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag. and forest settl. officer.

ORR, JOHN WILLIAM, M.A., B.L., Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Served from 7th May, 1860, as acting dep. clerk of the crown, clerk to the chief justice, &c.; prothonotary and eccles. and admiralty registrar, May, 1866; registrar, high court, original side, Feb., 1886; reverted to his post as prothonotary, &c., March, 1894.

OSBORN, WILLIAM, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late Bombay Public Works Dept.—First commn., 18th Dec., 1861; asst. engr., Nov., 1864; served in the Abyssinian campaign, 1867 (medal); exec. engr., Jan., 1869; suptg. engr., Jan., 1893; retd., May, 1894.

OTTLEY, JOHN WALTER, C.J.E., Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Jan., 1864; arrived, Nov., 1868; joined the dept., Feb., 1870; asst. to chief engr. for irrign., Punjab, April, 1870; exec. engr., Sept., 1872; asst. to chief engr. for irrign., Bengal, Feb., 1874; re-transf. to Punjab, irrign. branch, June, 1875; asst. sec., irrign. branch, Punjab, July, 1881; supt. of works, Bari Doab circle, April, 1882; suptg. engr., Dec., 1884; chief engr. and joint sec. to govt. of Punjab, public works dept., Nov., 1890; C.I.E., May, 1892; sec., irrign.
branch, Sept., 1892; inspr.-gen. of irrign. and dep. sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., Oct., 1894.

OWEN, EDWARD, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, and class, 17th Feb., 1872; staff clerk, July, 1896.

OWEN, WILLIAM, M.D., Surgn.-Major, Opium Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1877, and was employed under the mil. dept. and as second med. officer, Port Blair; from 24th May, 1882, served in Bengal as supt. of vaccn., dep. sanitary commr. and civil surgn.; principal asst. to opium agent, Behar, April, 1889; factory supt., Behar, May, 1891.

OXENHAM, ROBERT G., M.A., late Bombay Educl. Dept.—Arrived, 9th Sept., 1863, and served till Nov., 1874, as prof. at the Deccan coll., Poona, and subsequently as principal; principal and prof. of history and pol. economy, Elphinstone coll., Dec., 1890; acting dir. of publininstrn., May, 1893; retd., April, 1894.

OZANNE, EDWARD CHARLES, M.R.A.C., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Elizabeth Coll., Guernsey; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 11th Nov., 1872, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine relief duty, 1874, 1877, and 1879; dir. of agric., July, 1883; survey and settlt., commr., May, 1887; survey commr. and dir. of land records and agric., April, 1893.

OZZARD, HUDSON HENRY, Major, I.S.C., Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—First commn., 13th June, 1874; arrived, 1st Nov., 1874; and was employed on mil. duty, including service in Perak expdn. (medal and clasp) and Afghan war, 1878-79 (medal); acting cantonmt. mag., Feb., 1888; confld., April, 1890.

PAGE, HORACE, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. Olave's Gr. Sch., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 19th Dec., 1893, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

PAGE, WILLIAM HUMPHREY, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Nottingham Gr. Sch., and Winchester Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 10th Dec., 1868, and served in Bengal; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1879; district and sessions judge, Oct., 1885; retd., April, 1895.

PAINTER, EDWIN DYKE, India Audit Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 25th March, 1895.

PAINTER, HAROLD LISCOMBE, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Clifton Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 9th Dec., 1895, and served in Bombay.

PALLE CHENTSAL RAO PANTULU, C.I.E., late Supt. of Stamps and Stationery, Madras.—Served from Feb., 1851, in the jud. and rev. depts., Madras; from July, 1859, served as dep. collr., special asst. to the inam commr., and dep. collr. of salt rev.; sheristadar, board of rev., May, 1872; fellow of Madras univ., 1875; supt. of stamps and stationery, July, 1882; C.I.E., Feb., 1887; retd., April, 1887; member of Madras legisl. council, July, 1887.

PALLISER, HARRY GEORGE, M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Educ. at Chiswick Sch.; joined the dept., 28th Oct., 1867; exec. engr., Nov., 1872; suptg. engr., Feb., 1894.

PALMER, CHARLES GEORGE, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 7th Oct., 1868, and employed on irrign. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., May, 1876.

PALMER, Sir ELWIN MITFORD, K.C.B., K.C.M.G., late Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the finl. dept., Nov., 1871; asst. to acctnt.-gen., British Burma, Dec., 1873; transf. to Bombay, April, 1876; asst. to comptr.-gen., Oct., 1878; served under the Egyptian govt., 1878-79; from Jan., 1880, served in Madras as offg. asst. and dep. acctnt.-gen.; comptr. Haiderabad, Dec., 1882; asst. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, Nov., 1884; asst. comptr.-gen., Dec., 1884; transf. for service under Egyptian govt., Aug., 1885; K.C.B., Jan., 1897.

PANTIN, ROBERT GERALD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Bradford Coll., and Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 21st Dec., 1894, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

PARGITER, EDWIN HERMANN, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrign. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., May, 1883.

PARGITER, FREDERICK EDEN, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Taunton Coll. Sch., and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 6th Nov., 1875; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., settlt. officer, commr. of the Sundarbans, and offg. under sec.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Jan., 1887; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1893; author of 'The Revenue History of the Sundarbans from 1765 to 1870,' and of a transln. of the Markandeya Purana.

PARKER, EDWIN WOODALL, Punjab Administration.—From 20th Oct., 1863, served in the Punjab as extra asst. commr., and small cause court judge; district judge, Simla, May, 1887, to Jan., 1888; registrar of chief court, Oct., 1888; author of 'Outlines of the Constitutional Law of India,' and 'Outlines of Jurisprudence.'

PARKER, SIR GEORGE ARTHUR, late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Uppingham Sch., and Trinity Hall, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 9th Dec., 1863, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., sub-collr. and joint mag., and district and sessions judge; judge of the high court, Madras, Dec., 1886; retd., 3rd Feb., 1896.

PARKER, JOSEPH, C.S.I., late Dir.-Gen. of Stores, India Office.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; East India house writer, old establ., 9th July, 1851; junr. clerk, marine dept., Aug., 1858; store dept., 1860; senr. clerk, Nov., 1866; asst. to dir.-gen. of stores, Jan., 1890; dir.-gen. of stores, June, 1891; retd., Aug., 1896.

PARKER, WILLIAM HENRY, M.I.C.E., late Public Works Dept., Bengal.—Apptd., 24th Aug., 1860; from Nov., 1873, served in the railway branch, and was employed on various lines; offg. chief engr. and joint sec., Bengal, railway branch, July-Oct., 1885; served subsequently as engr.-in-chief on various railway surveys; retd., Jan., 1892.

PARKER, WILLIAM JACKSON, Col., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 16th Dec., 1858; from July, 1867, served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and jud. asst.; district judge, Nov., 1884; dep. commr., Sept., 1887; divl. judge, Oct., 1891; reverted to mil. dept., Nov., 1894.

PARKES, BENJAMIN, M.I.C.E., M.E., F.C.H., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and posted to state railways; transf. to Punjab provl. establ., Jan., 1879; exec. engr., Oct., 1881.
PARKIN, Henry, Capt., I.S.C., Burma Police Dept.—First commn., 11th May, 1878; served in the Zhob expdn., 1884, and in Burma, 1886-87 and 1887-89 (medal); asst. dir. of police supply and clothing, Burma, 15th Aug., 1888; dep. inspr.-gen. of police for supply and clothing, June, 1890.

PARLETT, Leonard Montague, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Bradfield Coll., and Keble Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 21st Dec., 1891, and served in Burma as asst. commr., and settlt. officer.

PARRATT, Charles, Indo-European Telegraph Dept., India Office.—Apptd. to the London office of the Indo-European telegraph dept. as clerk, 26th March, 1881; transfd. to India office, 1st Jan., 1889.

PARROTT, Benjamin Alexander Napier, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—First commn., July, 1868; arrived, Nov., 1868; served in the Lushai expdn., 1871; from April, 1872, served in the Burma commn. as asst. commr., asst. town mag., and settlt. and boundary officer; dep. commr., Feb., 1886; commr., Oct., 1894.

PARRY, R., late Educ. Service, Bengal.—Joined the service, 14th Jan., 1865; served as head-master, profr., and offg. principal at various colls., and as inspr. of schools (temporary); retd., 1890.

PARRY, Robert, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Bedford Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 15th Nov., 1892, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

PARRY, William Ensor, A.M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 23rd Dec., 1859, and posted to state railways; transfd. to the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, July, 1860; exec. engr., Sept., 1868; retd., Dec., 1895.

PARSONS, Francis Cotton, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Amersham Hall Sch., Reading, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 30th Jan., 1889, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; special settlt. officer, July, 1894.

PARSONS, Henry James, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Eton, and Lincoln Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 21st Nov., 1867, and served in Bombay as asst. mag. and collr., asst. judge, and judge and sessions judge; acted as jud. commr. and judge of the sadar court in Sind, in 1881-82, and again in 1887; judge of high court, Nov., 1887.

PARSONS, James Edmund Bacon, B.L., Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 4th Feb., 1849; from Feb., 1856, served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; reverted to mil. duty, Nov., 1885.

PARSONS, Octavius Sydney, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 28th Nov., 1891, and served in Burma as asst. commr., cantonmt. mag., small cause judge, and settlt. officer.

PARTRIDGE, John George Denman, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Sherborne, and at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 15th Jan., 1887, and served in Madras as asst. to mag. and collr.; senr. asst., Ganjam, Aug., 1893.
