PARTRIDGE, William Reginald, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Blundell's Sch., Tiverton, Sherborne Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1883, and served in Oudh as asst. commr.; under sec. to govt., May, 1883; senr. asst. commr., Garhwal, Nov., 1890; dep. commr., Oct., 1891; also settlt. officer, Nov., 1893; joint mag., Nov., 1894; dep. commr., Nov., 1895.

PASSANAH, Henry George, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 7th Aug., 1872, and posted to N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., June, 1883; served on state railways, 1883-85.

PATCH, James, late Bengal Police Dept.—Joined the service, 17th May, 1863, as asst. supt. of police; transfd. to Assam, Jan., 1869; district supt., Sept., 1870; served with Lushai expdn., 1871-72; returned to Bengal, July, 1884; retd., April, 1894.

PATERNER, George Alfred, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Blairlodge Sch., Univ. Coll., London, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 30th Oct., 1863, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

PATTERSON, Alexander Bleakley, C.I.E., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Belfast Royal Acadl. Inst., and Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 20th Dec., 1863, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., settlt. officer, and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Dec., 1883; acting commr. of Jhansi, July-Oct., 1890; commr. of N. India salt rev., April, 1891; C.I.E., May, 1895; author of Fatehpur and Karwi settlt. reports.

PATTERSON, William Henry, late Survey of India Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Dec., 1851; served as a volunteer during the Mutiny; asst. supt., Jan., 1883; dep. supt., Feb., 1889; retd., Sept., 1893.

PATTLE, Arthur John, Actnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, and class, 17th Feb., 1872; staff clerk, July, 1896.

PAUL, Alfred Wallis, C.I.E., B.A., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Clifton Coll. and Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1870, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and acting inspr.-gen. of registrn.; on special duty in connection with the Thibet mission, April, 1886; dep. commr., Aug., 1887; C.I.E., Jan., 1889; on special duty on Tibetian frontier, April, 1890; British commr. for Anglo-Chinese convention regarding Sikkim and Thibet, Feb., 1891; mag. and collr., May, 1891; on special duty at Darjiling, March, 1892; retd., Dec., 1895.

PAUL, Sir Gregory Charles, K.C.I.E., B.A.—Advocate, high court, Calcutta, 1862-78; advocate-gen., high court, Calcutta, from Sept., 1872; also addl. member, govr.-gen.'s council, 1878-82; member of provy. legisl. council, 1885-92.

PAUL, Josiah Edward, Madras Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, 1st Oct., 1875; asst. to chief engr., and under sec. to govt., irrig. branch, in 1880; exec. engr., June, 1886.

PAUW, Edward Klaas, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 27th Nov., 1891, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Nov., 1894.

PEACOCK, Edward Bovill, Punjab Commn.,
—Joined the service, 23rd April, 1862; apptd. asst. commr., 25th Feb., 1867; offd. as judge of small cause court in 1874 and 1875; district judge, April, 1889.

PEACOCK, HENRY PHIPSON, Major-Gen., late Pol. Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Bengal cavalry, Sept., 1856; served during the Mutiny (medal), and subsequently with the govr.-gen.'s body guard; acted as agent to the govr.-gen. with King of Oudh, and supt. of pol. pensions, on several occasions; pol. agent, Murshidabad, 1878; pol. agent, Alwar, 1882; acting rest., W. Rajputana, March, 1885; offg. rest. at Jaipur and offg. agent in Central India, May, 1888; pol. rest. in Turkish Arabia, Nov., 1891; rest., Jaipur, May, 1892; reverted to mil. dept., March, 1894.

PEARLS, THOMAS CALDWELL, Major, I.S.C., Pol. Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 29th May, 1872; served in the Afghan war, 1878-79, and with the Thal Chhotiali field force (medal); on special pol. duty in Afghanistan in 1880; apptd. asst. commr., Mewar, Nov., 1882; served in the thagi dept. in Rajputana, and on boundary duty on the Mewar and Tonk border in 1884; pol. asst., March, 1886; settl. officer under the Tonk durbar, Nov., 1886; pol. agent, Nov., 1891; settl. officer, Tonk, Dec., 1891; pol. agent, Alwar, March, 1893.

PEARSE, HERBERT GEORGE, B.L. Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Rugby, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 7th Nov., 1871, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and asst. commr.; judge, small cause court, Allahabad, Dec., 1887; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1890.

PEARSON, CHARLES, M.A., late Educl. Dept., Punjab.—Served in the dept. from March, 1861, as profir. and principal, Agra coll.; inspr. of schs., Nov., 1865; offg. dir. of public instrn. in 1873, 1876, and 1883; retd., March, 1886.

PEARSON, FRANCIS BOYCE, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at the Proprietary Sch., Islington, and Haileybury Coll., from which he was apptd. in 1840; served in the N.W. Prov. as asst., joint mag. and dep. collr., mag. and collr., and civil and sessions judge; also as settl. officer, Jalandhar, 1849-50, and as registrar to the court of sadar diwani and nizamat adalat, 1850-53; judge of that court, 1862-66; puisne judge, high court, N.W. Prov., 1866-81; retd., March, 1881.

PEARSON, JAMES RAEE, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch. and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 10th Nov., 1892, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

PEARSON, TINDAL ARTHUR, B.A., B.L., Bengal Jud. Dept.—Joined the service, 3rd April, 1878, as offg. reporter, Indian law reports; confd., Jan., 1880; acted subsequently as dep. supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, registrar of the diocese, and receiver of the high court; apptd. chief presidency mag. and judge of the court for trial of pilots, May, 1894.

PEAT, WALTER SCOTT, Col., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Bombay cavalry, 1859; from Feb., 1883, acted as cantonmt. mag., Mhow; 2nd asst. agent, Baroda, and cantonmt. mag., May, 1885; cantonmt. mag., Mhow, May, 1887; reverted to mil. dept., June, 1894.

PEDLER, ALEXANDER, F.R.S., Educl. Dept., Bengal.—Apptd. to the educn. dept., 22nd Jan., 1873; arrived, 8th May, 1873, and served as profir. of agricl. chemistry, presidency coll.; on special duty, eclipse expedit., March, 1875; meteorological reporter to govt. of Bengal, May, 1889, in addn. to his duties as profir.

PEET, ARTHUR WILLIAM, Forest Dept., Madras.—Joined the service, 18th Oct., 1871, as asst. conservator; dep. conservator, April, 1872; conservator, Oct., 1891.

PEILE, SIR JAMES BRAITHWAITE, K.C.S.I., M.A., late Bombay C.S., Council of India.—Educ. at Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. to the Bombay civil service after exam. of 1855; arrived 8th Oct., 1856, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; on special duty for inquiry into claims of thakurs of Bhaunagar on account of land and sea customs, May, 1859; specially apptd. to inquire into condition of talukdars, Ahmadabad, Jan., 1860; alienation settl. officer, Gujarat, April, 1861; asst. to rev. commr., Dec., 1861; under sec. to govt. of Bombay, rev. dept., April, 1862; on special duty for carrying out provisions of bill for relief of the talukdars, Ahmadabad, Dec., 1862; commr. for revising subord. civil establs., April, 1866; registrar-gen. of assurances, July, 1866; dir. of public instrn., April, 1869; acting municipal commr., Bombay, May-Oct., 1872; acting pol. agent, Kathiawar, Jan., 1873; on duty at Delhi in connection with imperial assemblage, Dec., 1876; acting commr. in Sind, June, 1878; member of famine commn., 1878-79; acting sec. to govt., pol., &c., depts., March, 1879; from April, 1879, served as sec. in the rev., finl., and gen. depts., and acted as chief sec.; on special duty on famine commn. in England, 1879-80; on special duty in India, 1880 and 1881; member of council, Bombay, Dec., 1882; acted as govr. and prest. in council in March, 1885; temporary member of govr.-gen.'s council, Oct., 1886; retd., Nov., 1887; member of council of India, 12th Nov., 1887; vice-pres., 1894-95; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1888; member of royal commn. on Indian expenditure, May, 1895.

PEILE, SOLOMON CHARLES FREDERICK, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Burma Police.—First commn. 9th Aug., 1874; served in the Afghan war of 1878-79 (medal), and in the Burmese expedn. of 1886-87 (medal and clasp); apptd. dir. of police supply and clothing, Upper Burma, March, 1887, the office being subsequently extended to the whole of Burma; dep. inspr.-gen., mil. police, June, 1890; inspr.-gen., Feb., 1892.

PEMBERTON, ROBERT CHARLES BOILEAU, C.S.I., Major-Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Lieut., Bengal engrs., 1853; joined the dept., May, 1857; served during the Mutiny (medal and two clasps), and subsequently in the road dept., Oudh, as exec. engr.; asst. sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., March, 1865; offg. suptg. engr., railway branch, Haidarabad, Sept., 1870; dir. of stores, railway branch, May, 1877; consulting engr. for guaranteed railways, Lucknow, 1880; chief engr., 1st class, March, 1886; dir.-gen. of railways and dep. sec., govt. of India, railway branch, Feb., 1887; sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., April, 1887; reverted to mil. dept., 1890; offg. member of viceroy's council, Feb., 1891, to April, 1892; retd. from the army, Nov., 1892; C.S.I., May, 1894.

PEMBERTON, WILLIAM WALKER, Col., I.S.C., late Burma Commn.—First commn., July, 1853; arrived, 25th Sept., 1853; served in the Burma commn. from Dec., 1859, as asst. commr.,
dep. commr., small cause court judge, and boundary officer; reverted to mil. duty, 1890.

PENNELL, Aubray Percival, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at private schools and at Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 25th Nov., 1886, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and as comprt. of Indian treasuries; transfd. to Burma, Oct., 1889, as asst. commr.; under sec. to chief commr., Oct., 1890; dep. commr., Jan., 1892; settlt. officer, 1892-93; returned to Bengal as joint mag. and dep. collr., Jan., 1895.

PENNINGTON, Henry Francis Dumaresq, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Westminster; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 21st Oct., 1875, and served in Oudh as asst. commr. and sub-judge; joint mag., April, 1887; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1890; also addl. judge, Moradabad, 1893-94.

PENNINGTON, James Burn, B.L., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Sedbergh Gr. Sch., and St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1861; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., sub-collr., sub-sec. to the board of rev., and acting collr. of sea customs at Madras; collr. and mag., July, 1875; rettd., Sept., 1888.

PENNY, Edmund, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and posted to state railways; transfd. to Central Prov., Aug., 1875; exec. engr., May, 1883; planned and carried out scheme for Nagpur water-works, 1890; acted as asst. sec. to chief commr. in 1891.

PENNY, James Champion, M.D., Dep.-Surgn.-Gen., late Med. Dept., Punjab.—Arrived, 3rd June, 1857; from Feb., 1863, served in the Punjab at various stations as civil asst. surgn., and civil surgn. and supt. of jail; rettd., June, 1887.

PENNYCUICK, John, C.S.I., Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—Lieut., Madras engrs., Dec., 1858; arrived, 11th Nov., 1860; served in the dept. from April, 1862; exec. engr., Dec., 1866; served in the Abyssinian expedit., 1867-68 (medal); suptg. engr., Oct., 1881; dep. chief engr., and under sec. to govt., Jan., 1883; supt. of works, tank maintenance scheme, April, 1884; on special duty to England to select machinery for Periyar works project, July, 1888; chief engr. and sec. in the public works dept., July, 1890; member of legislat. council, Nov., 1893; C.S.I., Oct., 1895; rettd., Jan., 1896.

PERCIVAL, Philip Edward, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Charterhouse and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1844; arrived, 25th Nov., 1845, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

PERKINS, Aeneas, C.B., Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., 1851; joined the dept., March, 1855, and served in the Punjab; served during the Mutiny, 1857-58 (medal and clasp); asst. principal and profr., Calcutta civil engrg. coll., 1861; served with the Bhutan field force, 1864-65; acting suptg. engr., N.W. Prov., Oct., 1870; from April, 1872, served in the mil. works branch as suptg. engr.; was also on active service, Oct., 1878, as commanding engr., field force, Cabul, and in Oct., 1879, Kuram divn. (medal and four clasps and bronze star); C.B., 1879; A.D.C. to the Queen, March, 1881; acting dep. inspr.-gen. of mil. works, 1881; chief engr. and sec. to the chief commr., Central Prov., public works dept., Feb., 1883; chief engr. and sec., Punjab, April, 1886; reverted to mil. duty, 1889.

PERKINS, Henry Edmund, late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., London; apptd. after exam. of 1855; arrived, 24th Sept., 1856, and served in the Punjab, and temporarily in Oudh, as asst. commr. and personal asst. to finl. commr., Punjab; dep. commr., April, 1866; commr. and supt., April, 1877; rettd., Nov., 1886.

PERKINS, Norman Chichester, Capt., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—First commn., 13th Aug., 1879; served in Afghan campaign of 1880-81, and in Burma, 1886-89 (medal and clasp); joined the commn. as asst. commr., Aug., 1886.

PERRAM, George James, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 21st Dec., 1868, and posted to Mysore; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; transfd. to Central Prov., March, 1881; to Coorg, Jan., 1887; and to Burma, Feb., 1893; suptg. engr., Jan., 1896.

PERRIN, Charles, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 10th Oct., 1874, and employed on irrigtn. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., May, 1883; under sec. to govt., Feb., 1892; sanitary engr., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, with rank of suptg. engr., July, 1893.

PERROTT, Finch, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Junr. clerk, 24th Dec., 1880.

PERRY, Francis Frederic, F.R.C.S., L.R.C.P., Surgn.-Major, Med. Dept., Punjab.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1879; from March, 1882, served in the Punjab as civil surgn., profr., Lahore med. coll., and chemical examr. to govt.; profr. of surgery, and surgn. to Mayo hosp., Lahore, Dec., 1888; acted as profr., Calcutta med. coll., in 1894.

PERT, Frederick James, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Sidney Sussex Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 15th Nov., 1888, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Feb., 1893; settlt. officer, Nov., 1894.

PETERS, Charles Jasper, M.I.C.E., late Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 26th July, 1867, as proby. asst. engr.; exec. engr., April, 1875; rettd., Nov., 1894.

PETERS, Edward Nicolls, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the Bombay public works dept. as exec. engr., 11th March, 1879; transfd. to state railways, Feb., 1880; served in the Afghan war, 1880-81 (medal); posted to Burma, Sept., 1881; employed on Sind-Pishin railway, April, 1885; transfd. to Central Prov., March, 1888; in 1891 acted as public works sec.; reverted to mil. dept., Nov., 1895.

PETEERSON, Francis William, late Mint Dept., Bombay.—Joined the mint dept., Calcutta; apptd. dep. assay master, Oct., 1881; dep. assay master, Bombay mint, Oct., 1887; rettd., Nov., 1892.

PETEERSON, Frederick William Voysey, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Leicester Coll. Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 7th Dec., 1863, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and dep. commr.; from May, 1877, served in the jud. dept., and was apptd. district and sessions judge, 1st grade, Sept., 1885; rettd., April, 1889.

PETEERSON, Herbert Parsons, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Loughborough Gr. Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 10th Nov., 1875; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in Assam as district and sessions judge, Sylhet; joint
mag. and dep. collr., Dec., 1887; district and sessions judge, April, 1893; retd., Feb., 1895.

PETERSON, Peter, M.A. (Edin.), B.A. (Oxon.), D.Sc., Educ. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, Jan., 1873, and served in the dept. as prof. of oriental languages, Elphinstone coll.; also univ. registrar, Bombay, Jan., 1878; in joint charge with Prof. Bhandarkar in search for Sanskrit MSS. in the Bombay circle, and has publ. several reports on the results; has also edited several volumes in the Bombay Sanskrit Series.

PETHERAM, Sir William Comer, Kt., Q.C., B.L.—Called to the bar (Middle Temple), 1866; chief justice of the high court, N.W. Prov., 1st Nov., 1884; chief justice, Calcutta, 24th March, 1886; vice-chancellor of the univ. of Calcutta, 1887-90.

PETLEY, Eaton Wallace, C.I.E., Commander R.N.—Dep. conservator of the port of Calcutta, and river surveyor, Nov., 1881; post officer and master attendant, April, 1888; hon. A.D.C. to lieut.-govr. of Bengal, and commander, Calcutta naval volunteers; C.I.E., Jan., 1897.

PETRE, Francis Loraine, B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Oscott Coll., and Univ. of London; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 15th Nov., 1874, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, rev. and agric. dept., Aug., 1882; junr. sec., board of rev., N.W. Prov., Nov., 1882; from April, 1885, served as asst. agent to govr.-gen. in Central India; asst. commr., March, 1888; joint mag., Dec., 1888; joint sec., board of rev., Jan., 1891; mag. and collr., July, 1891.

PETTY, Albert James, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk, and class, 16th July, 1883.

PHAYRE, Sir Robert, G.C.B., Gen., I.S.C.—Educ. at Shrewsbury; ensign, Bombay army, 26th Jan., 1839; served in the first Afghan war and the Sind campaign, 1840-45 (medal); dep. asst. quartermaster-gen. in Sind, 1844-50; asst. quartermaster-gen., 1850-55; dep. quartermaster-gen., Bombay army, Dec., 1855; served in the Abyssinian exped. of 1867-68 (C.B., medal, and A.D.C. to the Queen); pol. supt. and commandant of the Sind frontier field force, 1868-72; rest. at Baroda, 1873-74, during which period he brought charges of maladministration against the Gaekwar, which were investigated by a commn. of enquiry; returned to mil. duty after the attempt of the Gaekwar to poison him at the end of 1874; served in the Afghan war in 1879-80 (thanks of both houses of parliament, K.C.B. and medal); acted as commander-in-chief, Bombay, Nov., 1885, to Feb., 1886; returned to England, March, 1886; G.C.B., May, 1894.

PHEAR, Sir John Budd, Kt., M.A., B.L., F.G.S.—Educ. at Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; graduated 6th wrangler in 1847, and was elected fellow, and afterwards apptd. mathematical lecturer and asst. tutor of Clare Coll.; called to the bar at the Inner Temple in 1854; judge of the high court, Calcutta, 1864-76; knighted in 1877; chief justice of Ceylon, 1877-79; unsuccessfully contested the Honiton divn. of Devon in 1885, and the Tavistock divn. in 1886; author of 'The Aryan Village in India and Ceylon,' 'International Trade,' and other works.

PHELAN, Alfred Bernard, B.A., L.C.E., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 15th July, 1890, and employed on irrigtn. work in the Punjab; exec. engr., Oct., 1878.

PHELPS, William Edmondson, Store Dept., India Office.—Entered the royal artillery, 30th Oct., 1869; from Feb., 1876, served in the Bombay and Bengal ordnance depts., including duty with the Quetta field force, 1878-80; supervisor, 2nd grade, India store depot, 17th June, 1884.

PHIBBS, Alfred, Mil. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Stourbridge Gr. Sch.; clerk, and class, 16th April, 1894.

PHILLIMORE, John Ernest, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Westminster and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 12th Nov., 1890, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. settlt. officer.

PHILLIPS, Arthur, B.L., late Bengal Jud. Dept.—Advocate, high court, Calcutta, from 1871; sec. to govt. of India, legal dept., June to Nov., 1877; standing counsel, high court, Calcutta, from Nov., 1880; retd., March, 1895; author of 'Tagore Law Lectures.'

PHILLIPS, Augustus Marshall, Col., I.S.C., late Pol. Dept., Bombay.—Ensign, Bombay infantry, June, 1855; arrived, 13th Dec., 1855, and served with the Persian expedy. force, 1856-57 (medal and clasp); from March, 1863, served as asst. pol. supt., Savantvadi, Mahi Kantha, and Kathiawar, and held various acting appts.; pol. supt., Savantvadi, March, 1889; reverted to mil. duty, 1890.

PHILLIPS, Arthur Noel, Col.—First commn., 8th Dec., 1883; asst. commr., Assam, May, 1862; in June, 1880, transfd. to the N.W. Prov. as offg. cantonmt. mag.; confd., Aug., 1881; retd., April, 1890.

PHILLIPS, Francis Angelo Theodore, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Winchester and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 11th Nov., 1880, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., and personal asst. to the chief commr.; judge, small cause court, Aug., 1891; commr. of excise, Oct., 1891; dep. commr., March, 1892.

PHILLIPS, Henry Arthur Deuteros, India; C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 31st Oct., 1874, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine duty, 1878; joint mag. and dep. collr., Dec., 1883; under sec. govt. of Bengal, Aug., 1886; offg. dep. sec. to govt. of India, legislat. dept., Oct., 1887; mag. and collr., May, 1891; author of 'Our Administration of India,' 'Comparative Criminal Jurisprudence,' and two law manuals.

PHILLIPS, William Watkin, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Winchester and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 25th Nov., 1890, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

PIGGOTT, Theodore Caro, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Kingswood Sch., Bath, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 30th Nov., 1888, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Nov., 1893.

PIGOT, Jones Quain, B.A., B.L., late Calcutta High Court.—Advocate, high court, Bombay, 1870-82; puisne judge, high court, Calcutta, 11th July, 1882; vice-chancellor, Calcutta univ., 1892-93; retd., March, 1896.
PIKE, Herbert Watson, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Honiton Gr. Sch., Winchester, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 17th Nov., 1885, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; under sec. to govt., Nov., 1890; joint mag., April, 1893; dep. commr., March, 1896.

PILCHER, Jesse Griggs, F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Col., late Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 1860; from March, 1866, served as jail supt. at Allahabad and Agra, offg. sanitary commr. for Bengal, and civil surgn. at various stations; dep. surgn.-gen., Central Prov., March, 1890; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., Bengal, April, 1893; ditto, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, May, 1894; retd., March, 1895.

PIM, Alan William, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Leipzig Univ. and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 4th Dec., 1895, and served in the N.W.P. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

PINHEY, Alexander Fleetwood, Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 10th May, 1882; from Feb., 1886, served as asst. pol. agent, Banswara, asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakiati, and supt. for control of Moghias; pol. agent, Haraoti, March, 1885; acting pol. agent, Baghelkhand, May, 1895.

PINHEY, Arthur Francis, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Charterhouse, and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 3rd Nov., 1884, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; and in Burma as asst. commr. (1888-90); head asst., June, 1891.

PINHEY, Edward, Bombay Public Works Dept.—Trained at the Roy. Indian Engrg. Coll.; joined the service 1st Oct., 1876, and served as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Oct., 1886.

PINKERTON, John, M.D., Surgn.-Major-Gen., late Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 4th Aug., 1855; served with Indian navy, during the Persian war in 1857; on civil and mil. duty, 1858-61; acting supt. of vaccn., Sind, March, 1863; supt.-gen. of vaccn., Bombay presidency, April, 1868; surgn. in European gen. hosp. and dep. sanitary commr.; dep. surgn.-gen., Sind, Aug., 1882; surgn.-gen. of Bombay, Feb., 1883; member, legisl. council, June, 1892; retd., Feb., 1893.

PITCHER, Duncan George, Col., I.S.C., Oudh Commn.—Arrived, as cornet, Bombay light cavalry, 3rd Sept., 1859, having previously served in the royal marine light infantry and artillery, 1856-59; served from Aug., 1868, in the Oudh commn. as asst. commr., and small cause court judge, and registrar, Lucknow; dep. dir. of agric. and commerce for Oudh, June, 1882, and for N.W. Prov. and Oudh, July, 1886; dep. commr., June, 1887; dir. of land records, Gwalior, Nov., 1890.

PITMAN, Charles Edward, C.I.E., M.I.E.E., India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the dept. as asst. supt., 16th Jan., 1868; on special duty in connection with Lushai expdn., 1871, and with Afghanistan fieldforce, 1878-79; C.I.E., 1879; supt., April, 1880; chief supt., April, 1891.

PITTAR, Charles William Erskine, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 31st Oct., 1884, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in Assam (1889-95) as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1895.

PLACE, George William, B.A., LL.B., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 29th Nov., 1875, and served in Assam as asst. commr.; from Jan., 1886, served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; district and sessions judge, March, 1893.

PLANCK, Charles, F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Gen.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establt., 4th Aug., 1855; civil asst. surgn., Fatehgarh, July, 1859; supt., central prison, Agra, Feb., 1862; inspr.-gen. of prisons, British Burma, Oct., 1864; sanitary commr., N.W. Prov., April, 1868; also in Oudh, April, 1877; also supt.-gen.-of vaccn., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Jan., 1879; retd., Aug., 1886.

PLANT, William Charles, Col., I.S.C.—Joined the Madras army, and arrived, 6th June, 1855; served in the Burma commn. from March, 1860, as asst. mag. of Rangoon, asst. commr., and dep. commr.; commr., Tenasserim, Sept., 1883; reverted to mil. dept., 1891.

PLATEL, John Joseph, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Calcutta Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 14th Dec., 1892, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

PLAYFAIR, Archibald Lewis, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, Bengal infantry, Aug., 1856; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasp); and with the Haidarabad contingent, 1862-73; served subsequently in civil employ as cantonmt. mag., small cause court judge, and jail supt.; retd., Feb., 1887.

PLOWDEN, Charles Henry, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., Feb., 1854; arrived, 28th April, 1854; served during the Mutiny, 1858-59; served from May, 1860, in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., commr. of excise, &c., and dep. commr.; offg. as commr., Jabalpur divn., 1892; reverted to mil. dept., April, 1893.

PLOWDEN, George Ward Chichele, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Arrived, as cornet, Bengal light cavalry, 4th April, 1854; served in the Mutiny campaign; from Sept., 1874, was employed in the N.W. Prov. as cantonmt. mag. of Bareilly, and subsequently of Meerut; retd., Jan., 1893.

PLOWDEN, Sir Henry Meredith, Kt., B.A., B.L., late Jud. Dept., Punjab.—Served in the Punjab from 17th March, 1871, as gov't. advocate and offg. judge of the chief court; confd. as judge, chief court, Jan., 1878; knighted, Feb., 1877; retd., April, 1894.

PLOWDEN, Walter Francis Courtenay Chichele, Major, I.S.C., Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—First commn., 19th Oct., 1872; served in the Jowaki expdn., and Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal and clasp); offg. cantonmt. mag., Sept., 1888; confd., May, 1890.

PLOWDEN, Sir William Chichele, K.C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury Coll., 1852; arrived, 29th Sept., 1852; from Nov., 1853, served in the rev. and jud. dept. in the N.W. Prov., Oudh, and Punjab; dep. commr., Aug., 1858, and joint mag. and dep. collr., first grade, March, 1863; sec., board of rev., N.W. Prov., July, 1864; on special duty on the census report, April, 1866, and again, May, 1872; mag. and collr., March, 1870; civil and sessions judge, March, 1877; on special duty at
Calcutta as prest. of census committee, Jan., 1878; commr., Meerut divn., Sept., 1879; offg. member, board of rev., Aug., 1880; census commr. for India, March, 1881; addl. member, govr.-gen.'s council, Dec., 1881; retd., July, 1885; M.P. for Wolverhampton (West), 1886-92.

POCOCK, REYNOLDS JOHN MICHEL, late Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Served as a volunteer during the Mutiny; joined the dept., 26th Jan., 1861; asst. district supt., Oct., 1866; district supt., Sept., 1872; retd., April, 1895.

POLLEN, ARTHUR DANIEL, B.A., LL.D., B.L., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Royal Sch., Dungannon, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 26th Oct., 1867, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., asst. judge and joint sessions judge; special judge under the Deccan agriculturists relief act, Jan., 1880; judge and sessions judge, Jan., 1884; retd., March, 1894.

POLLEN, JOHN, B.A., LL.D., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 22nd Oct., 1871, and served as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine relief duty, 1874 and 1878; on special settl. duty, March, 1879; acting under sec. to govt. of Bombay, pol., &c., depts., Dec., 1880; asst. commr. and branch inspr.-gen. of registration and stamps in Sind, April, 1881; also Sindi translr. to govt., Nov., 1881; acting collr. and mag., Haidarabad, May, 1887; junr. collr. and mag., March, 1892; senr. collr., June, 1896; author of 'Rhymes from the Russian,' &c.

POLLOCK, SIR FREDERICK RICHARD, K.C.S.I., Major-Gen.—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch.; apptd. an Indian cadet of infantry, June, 1844; asst. rest., Lahore, Nov., 1847; on the Sikh outbreak in 1848, accompanied the Firozpur column to Multan as pol. officer, and served during the double siege of Multan, under Sir H. Edwardes (medal and clasp); asst. commr. in charge of Kohat district, April, 1849, and afterwards at Peshawar and Bannu; employed in the expdn. under Sir Charles Napier against the Afridis in the Kohat Pass, 1850 (medal and clasp); civil and pol. officer with the expdn. against the Umarzai Waziris; dep. commr., Dera Ghazi Khan, March, 1854, and afterwards at Rawal Pindi; accompanied Brig.-Gen. Chamberlain's expdn. to the border hills as civil officer, 1857; commr. and supt., Peshawar, 1867; pol. commr. with the Hazara field force, 1868; employed in Afghanistan and Persia with the Seistan commn., 1871-72; commr. of Peshawar up to 1878; retd. from the army, May, 1879.

PONNUSWAMI PILLAI, TIRU VENKATA, late Jud. Dept., Madras.—Served from the 15th April, 1854, in various subord. posts in the public works, mil., and jud. depts.; presidency mag. for the town of Madras, Aug., 1883; board of examrs., June, 1883; judge of the court of small causes, Madras, March, 1885; retd., April, 1892.

PONTIFEX, SIR CHARLES, K.C.I.E., B.A., late Legal Adviser, India Office.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; called to the bar, May, 1854; judge of the high court, Calcutta, May, 1872; retd. in 1882 on appt. as legal adviser to sec. of state for India; legal adviser and solicitor, May, 1887; retd., April, 1892; K.C.I.E., May, 1892.

POPE, JOHN VAN SOMEREN, M.A., Educn. Dept., Burma.—Educ. at Trinity Hall, Cambridge; joined the Bengal educn. service, 17th June, 1876, and served as profir. at the Patna and Presidency cols., and as principal, Dacca coll., Oct., 1881; inspr. of schs., April, 1884; fellow of the Calcutta univ., 1886; apptd. dir. of public instrn. in Burma, May, 1889.

POPE, PHILIP JOSEPH, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Oratory Sch., Birmingham, London Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 21st Dec., 1893, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

POPE, RICHARD RODNEY, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Oratory Sch., Edgbaston, and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 1st Nov., 1879; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag., and in Assam as asst. commr., and district and sessions judge; district and sessions judge, Jessore, March, 1895.

POPE, THOMAS HENRY, M.D., C.M., Surgn.-Major, Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1878, and served in Afghanistan, 1879-81 (medal); acting residency surg., Travancore, April, 1885; civil surg., Negapatam, Oct., 1885; asst. physician, gen. hosp., Jan., 1888; also profir. at the med. coll., to Dec., 1888; district surg., and supt. of jail, S. Arcot, March, 1892; supt., ophthalmic hospital, Madras, April, 1894.

POPERT, EDWIN PHILIP, Forest Dept., Madras.—Arrived, 16th Dec., 1872, and was employed in Burma as asst. conservator of forests; dep. conservator, July, 1880; conservator, March, 1887; transf. to Madras, Jan., 1892.

PORTEOUS, ALEXANDER, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Harrow; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 16th Jan., 1879, and served in Assam as asst. commr.; dep. commr., May, 1890; offg. pol. agent and supt., Manipur, Dec., 1892; offg. pol. officer, N. Lushai, July, 1894.

PORTEOUS, CHARLES ARKCOLL, C.I.E., Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Madras.—Arrived, 26th Nov., 1856, and was employed in the suppression of the Mutiny, 1857-59 (medal and two clasps); served in the dept. from May, 1860, as asst. supt., and supt.; in charge of the Madras police at the imperial assemblage, Delhi, Dec., 1876; dep. inspr.-gen., July, 1883; inspr.-gen. of jails, Jan., 1886; inspr.-gen. of police, March, 1891; reverted to mil. dept., Dec., 1894; C.I.E., May, 1895.

PORTEOUS, WILLIAM, M.A., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the High Sch. and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 26th Nov., 1867, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and pol. agent; from Jan., 1874, was employed in Mysore as asst. commr., and in various offg. appts.; from April, 1878, served in Bombay as asst. collr. and acting collr. of salt rev.; junr. collr. and mag. Nov., 1886; senr. collr., April, 1890; acted as commr. in 1894; retd., Nov., 1896.

PORTER, ALEXANDER, M.D., F.R.C.S.I., M.R.I.A., Surgn.-Col., late Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surg., 31st March, 1865; held the civil surgeoncy of Akola, 1866-74, and acted as sanitary commr., Berar, 1870-71; from April, 1874, served in Madras, as chemical examir. to govt., surg., 4th district, and profir. in the med. coll.; fellow of Madras univ., 1883; principal and profir. of medicine, med. coll., Dec., 1886; reverted to mil. duty, July, 1890; retd. July, 1895; author of 'Notes on the Pathology of Famine Diseases.'

PORTER, FORTESCUE WILLOUGHBY, late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Felsted
Gr. Sch., and Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 21st Nov., 1865, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., settl. officer, and joint mag.; dep. commr., Aug., 1885; mag. and collr., Nov., 1886; inspr.-gen. of police, Aug., 1891; retd., May, 1894.

PORTER, GEORGE EDWARD, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Felsted Gr. Sch., and Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 11th Dec., 1862, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., inspr. of schs., and dep. commr., wards' estate, Patna; district and sessions judge, April, 1879; jud. commr., Chota Nagpur, Oct., 1885; offg. judge, high court, Calcutta, Feb., 1886; retd., Sept., 1887.

PORTER, JOHN SINCLAIR, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., settl. officer, joint mag., and dep. commr.; mag. and collr., Shahjahanpur, April, 1879; acted as opium agent, Benares, 1886, and as commr. of Allahabad, 1886; retd., July, 1889.

PORTER, LESLIE ALEXANDER SELIM, M.A., LL.D., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Royal Acadl. Instn., and Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 13th Nov., 1876, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and settl. officer; offd. as dep. sec. and sec. to govt. of India, legisl. dept., 1891; sec. to Deccan agriculturists relief commn., Nov., 1891; dep. commr., Sept., 1892; mag. and collr., Feb., 1894.

PORTER, LUDOVIC CHARLES, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Eton, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 8th Jan., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; city mag., Lucknow, Nov., 1895.

PORTER, WILLIAM NINNIS, Burma Commn.—Joined the service as inspr. of police, 11th Oct., 1870; was apptd. asst. district supt., April, 1875, and district supt., Jan., 1880; asst. commr., April, 1886; dep. commr., Nov., 1890.

PORTMAN, AUGUSTUS BERKELEY, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 11th April, 1860, and was employed on mil. duties till May, 1866; subsequently served in the dept. as asst. supt., district supt., and supt. of railway police; acting inspr.-gen. of registrn. and stamps, 1879, and 1880-83; 1st grade supt. of police, Jan., 1885; retd., Dec., 1890.

POSFORD, JOSEPH, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Christ's Coll., Finchley, and Trinity Hall, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 12th Nov., 1869, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Jan., 1882; district and sessions judge, Aug., 1888; retd., April, 1896.

POSSMANN, JULIUS, M.I.E.E., India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the dept., 11th Aug., 1863; asst. supt., Sept., 1866; supt., Aug., 1869; engr. and electrician, Karachi, Dec., 1886; offg. dir., Persian Gulf section, May-Oct., 1891.

POTTINGER, BRABAZON HENRY, Lieut.-Gen., R.A.—Second lieut., 12th Dec., 1857; sec. to govt. of Bombay in the mil. marine and eccles. depts., June, 1887; retd., Dec., 1892.

POTTINGER, JOHN CURVEN, M.I.C.E., Bombay Sanitary Dept.—Joined the Bombay public works dept., 23rd July, 1868; exec. engr., May, 1875; sanitary engr. and member of sanitary board, Oct., 1893.

POULTON, HENRY DUNBAR, India Audit Office.—Junr. examr., 26th Dec., 1873; designation changed to junr. clerk, Oct., 1892.

POWELL, WALTER JOHN, Commander, R.I.M., Marine Dept., Madras.—First commn., 10th Dec., 1864; presidency port officer, Madras, 18th Feb., 1893; retd., Feb., 1896.

POWER, AMBROSE WILLIAM BUSHE, B.L., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. in Germany, and at Kingstown Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and dep. commr. and pol. agent, Hill Tipperah; mag. and collr., Aug., 1877; commr., Bardwan, Dec. 1891; retd., April, 1894.

POWER, GUY FRANCIS THOMAS, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Somersetshire Coll., Bath, and Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1875, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., head asst., and addl. sessions judge; sub-collr. and joint mag., May, 1890; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1891; collr. and mag., Jan., 1894; again district and sessions judge, March, 1895.

POWLETT, PERCY WILLIAM, C.S.I., Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, 58th native infantry, Bengal, April, 1855; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasps); asst. commr., Punjab, 1862; and Berar, 1865; asst. to govr.-gen.'s agent, Rajputana, 1868; settl. officer, Alwar, Jan., 1871; pol. agent, Kota, Jan., 1877; pol. agent for the W. Rajputana states, 1880; rest., W. Rajputana, Dec., 1881; C.S.I., Jan., 1891; reverted to mil. dept., April, 1892; compiled the gazetteers of Bikaniar, Alwar and Karoali.

PRAMODA CHARAN BANERJI, B.A., B.L., High Court, N.W. Prov.—Joined the service, 16th Jan., 1872, as munsif; sub-judge, Aug., 1880; after serving as small cause court judge at Agra and Allahabad, was apptd. addl. civil judge, Lucknow, Aug., 1893; and puisne judge, high court, N.W. Prov., Dec., 1893.

PRASANNA KUMAR RAY, D. Sc., Bengal Educl. Dept.—Joined the service, 11th Jan., 1877, and served as asst. profr., Patna and Dacca colls.; profr., presidency coll., Feb., 1888.

PRATT, EDWARD MILLARD, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 21st Dec., 1886, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., March, 1894.

PRATT, FREDERICK GREVILLE, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Hertford Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 24th Nov., 1890, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

PRATT, JAMES, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Aberdeen and London Univs.; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 12th Oct., 1869, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Oct., 1880; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1888.

PRATT, WILLIAM DERING, Police Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service as asst. supt. of police, 6th Sept., 1863; district supt., Aug., 1868; dep. inspr.-gen., May, 1894.

PREECE, HENRY CHARLES, Store Dept.,
India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, India store depot, 5th Dec., 1885.

PRENDERGAST, Sir Harry North Dalrymple, K.C.B., V.C., Gen.—Second lieut., 8th June, 1854; served in the Persian war in 1857 (medal with clasp), with the Malwa field force in 1857, with the Central India field force in 1858 (medal with clasp and V.C.), and in the Abyssinian war 1867-68 (medal); in command of sappers in the Indian expedit., to the Mediterranean, 1878; commanded the expedit. that resulted in the annexation of Upper Burma in 1885-86 (clasp); has received the distinguished service reward; held appts. in the dept. of public works and in the railway dept.; commanded the Madras sappers and miners for 10 years; acted as quartermaster-gen. of the Madras army and as sec. to govt. in the mil. dept.; offd. as British rest. in Travancore and Cochin in 1887, and as British rest. in Mysore and chief commr. in Coorg in 1887 and 1888; agent to the govr.-gen., Baroda, Jan., 1886; offg. rest. and govr.-gen.'s agent in Baluchistan, March to Oct., 1889; offg. rest., Mysore, and chief and jud. commr., Coorg, June, 1891; reverted to mil. dept., April, 1892.

PRESTON, Sidney, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 10th Aug., 1870, and employed in the Punjab on irrig. works; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; offg. under sec. to the Punjab govt., 1885-86; suptg. engr., April, 1893.

PRICE, Gordon, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—Served from 29th July, 1875, as civil surgn. and on jail duty; principal asst. to opium agent, Behar, Nov., 1887, to April, 1889.

PRICE, James Cattrall, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; settl. officer, Midnapur, Dec., 1871; also supt. of survey, March, 1876; mag. and collr., Aug., 1876; author of 'Notes on the History of Midnapur.'

PRICE, John Arthur, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at the Madras civil engrg. coll.; apptd., 14th May, 1869, and posted to Bengal; exec. engr., April, 1882; transfd. to Burma, July, 1887.

PRICE, John Frederick, C.S.I., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Melbourne Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 25th Oct., 1862; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and sub-collr.; collr. and mag., S. Arcot, and pol. agent for Pondicherry, April, 1873; collr. and mag., Chengalpat, Sept., 1878; board of examrs., Jan., 1882; acting dir. of rev. settl. and agric., Madras, April, 1885; sec. to govt., rev. dept., Oct., 1887; member of legis. council, Oct., 1888; chief sec. to govt. of Madras, Nov., 1888; C.S.I., Jan., 1893.

PRICE, William, M.D., M.Ch., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Arrived, 7th Nov., 1869; civil surgn., Vellore, April, 1877; med. officer, Utakamand, March, 1878; zillah surgn., Feb., 1881; senr. physician, gen. hosp., and principal, med. coll., Oct., 1891; retd., April, 1896.

PRIDEAUX, William Francis, C.S.I., Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Bombay infantry, Jan., 1860; asst. pol. rest., Aden, April, 1864; attached to mission to Abyssinia, March, 1865, and was in captivity at Magdala, 1866-68; offd. as pol. agent, Zanzibar, 1873-75; fellow of Bombay univ., 1874; asst. sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., June, 1875; offg. pol. rest., Persian Gulf, 1876-77; pol. agent, Bhopal, March, 1879; agent to the govr.-gen. with the ex-King of Oudh, and supt. of pol. pensions, Calcutta, Nov., 1880; offg. rest., E. Rajputana states, 1882-83; apptd. in 1887 agent to the govr.-gen. for the affairs of the late King of Oudh, and supt. of pol. pensions; rest. at Jaipur, Nov., 1888; acting rest., Kashmir, Dec., 1890; rest. in Mewar, Nov., 1893; acting agent to govr.-gen. in Rajputana, 1893-94; rest., Jaipur, April, 1894; C.S.I., Jan., 1895; reverted to mil. dept., April, 1895.

PRIEST, Henry Halsted, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at the Real-Schule, Marburg; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1879, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and in various acting appts.; judge, small cause court, Jabalpur, Jan., 1891; dep. commr., Aug., 1891; in addn., pol. agent, Chattisgarh feudatories, June, 1892; rev. sec., May, 1893; chief sec. to chief commr., Sept., 1895.

PRINGLE, Robert Keith, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1820; arrived, 1821, and served in the Bombay rev. dept.; supt. of rev. survey and assessment of the Deccan, 1826; sub-collr. and mag., Sholapur, 1831; acting dep. civil auditor and deputy mint-master, 1838; collr. and mag., and pol. agent, Khandesh, Dec., 1840; sec. to govt. of Bombay, gen. dept., June, 1843; rev. commr., July, 1843; chief sec. to govt., rev. and fin. depts., govt. dir. of the Bank of Bombay, and master of the mint, April, 1846; acting member of council, Bombay, April, 1846; chief commr. of Sind, July, 1847; resigned, Feb., 1851.

PRINSEP, Sir Henry Thoby, Kt., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 7th Dec., 1855, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; offg. junr. sec., board of rev., Sept., 1861; registrar of the sadar diwani and nizamat adalat, Feb., 1862, and subsequently of the high court, July, 1862; mag. and collr., 1st grade, May, 1866; served in the jud. dept., from Feb., 1867, as district and sessions judge, and offd. as jud. commr. of Mysore, 1875-76; judge, high court, Calcutta, Aug., 1878.

PRITAMDAS PARSUMAL CHANDANANI, L.C.E., Bo. Public Works Dept.—Joined the service 20th April, 1875, and served as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Nov., 1886.

PRITCHARD, Alfred Bassett, Capt., Indian Staff Corps, Burma Commn.—First commn., 11th Nov., 1878; apptd. to Burma as asst. commr., June, 1887.

PRITCHARD, Sir Charles Bradley, K.C.I.E., C.S.I., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1857; arrived, 24th Jan., 1858, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; collr. of salt rev., Bombay, Feb., 1873; on special duty in Madras as prest. of the salt commn., 1876; on special duty to submit a scheme for the working of the abkari system, 1877-78; commr. of customs, &c., April, 1881; commr. of salt rev., Oct., 1882; C.S.I., March, 1886; acting commr. in Sind, April, 1887; confd., Aug., 1888; temporary member of council of govr. of Bombay, May, 1889; confd., Nov., 1890; K.C.I.E., May, 1891; member of viceroy's council, Nov., 1892; retd., Feb., 1896.

PRITCHARD, Charles Hamerton, Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Educ. at
Clifton Coll.; first commn., 10th May, 1882; from March, 1888, acted as asst. to gov.r.-gen.'s agent, Baluchistan; engaged in boundary settlt. work in Mewar, 1889-90; asst. to rest., Haidarahad, and to the gen. supt., thagi, and dakkai, April, 1890; asst. commr., Merwara, July, 1891; offg. pol. agent, E. states of Rajputana, April, 1893; settlt. officer, Tonk, Feb., 1894.

PROPERT, WILLIAM HENRY, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1856; arrived, 6th Nov., 1856, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag. and pol. agent; from Feb., 1876, served as collr. and mag. and pol. agent, Khandesh; senr. collr., Sept., 1877; commr., April, 1886; retd., April, 1890.

PROTHERO, MICHAEL ERNLEE DU SAUTOY, M.A.—Bengal Educ. Service.—Joined the service as prof., presy. coll., Calcutta, 17th April, 1881; actg. inspr. of schools, April, 1896.

PROTUL CHANDAR CHATTERJI, Rai Bahadur, M.A., B.L., Punjab Chief Court.—Joined the service as offg. judge, 14th April, 1894; addl. judge, July, 1894.

PUCKLE, RICHARD KAYE, C.I.E., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Tonbridge Sch., and Haileybury Coll.; entered the Madras civil service in 1851, and was apptd. dep. dir. of rev. settlt. in 1859; collr. and mag., Tinnevelly, 1866; dir. of rev. settlt., 1874, and member of board of rev., 1879; was engaged for 22 years in preparing data for the re-assessment of the lands, and for the revision of govt. establt., in the ryotwar villages of Madras; employed in famine districts in 1877; C.I.E., 1878; retd. in 1881; publd. a hand-book on rev. matters and the duties of village officers.

PULFORD, JOHN WILLIAM, Store Dept., India Office.—Writer, 3rd Aug., 1865; clerk, 2nd class, India store depot, Aug., 1878.

PULFORD, RUSSELL RICHARD, Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., 23rd Feb., 1870, as asst. principal, Thomason coll.; asst. engr., June, 1873; exec. engr., March, 1874; served through the Afghan war, 1879-80; suptg. engr., March, 1892; offg. chief engr. and sec. to govt., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, July-Oct., 1894; transf. to Rajputana and Central India, May, 1896.

PURSER, WILLIAM EDWARD, late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Enniskillen Royal Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 21st Nov., 1865, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; senr. settlt. officer and dep. commr. of settlt., Jalandhar, Sept., 1880; dep. commr., Dec., 1885; retd., Aug., 1890; author of reports on the settlt. of the Montgomery district, and of the Muktsar and Mamdot parganas.

PURVES, HENRY BLACK, Brigade-Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., late Indian Med. Service.—First commn., 1865; from 12th March, 1867, served as civil asst. surgn., and civil surgn., in various stations in Bengal; retd., Dec., 1895.

PUTNAM, JAMES, Pol. Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, registry and record dept., 26th Feb., 1892; transf. to pol. dept., Dec., 1895.

PUTNAM, PHILIP, Acctnt.-Gen's Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 28th July, 1881.

QUERIPEL, ALFRED ERNEST, Veterinary Lieut.-Col., India Civil Veterinary Dept.—Joined the (home) service, 27th Aug., 1870; arrived in India, 3rd Feb., 1877; served in Afghan war, 1879-80, and with Nile expedy. force, 1884-85; asst. supt., horse breeding operations, Babugarh, 1880-83; reverted to home establ., April, 1884; apptd. to charge of chief station veterinary hosp., Ambala, and instructor, army veterinary sch., Simla, March, 1891; inspecting veterinary officer, E. circle, Dec., 1893; inspr.-gen., civil veterinary dept., May, 1894; author of an essay on stable management and dietetic disease in India, and of a manual of materia medica for veterinary students.

QUICKE, WILLIAM HENRY, Surgn.-Major, Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1883; acted as Bombay port health officer in 1883-89, and as supt. of vaccn. in the latter year; confd. as civil surgn., Kaira, Sept., 1890; and surgn., Jamsetji Jijibhoi hosp., and prodr. of anatomy and curator of museum, Grant med. coll., April, 1893.

QUIN, HENRY OSBORNE, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch., and Trinity Hall, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 13th Nov., 1885, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst., March, 1892.

QUIN, THOMAS JAMES, Col., Oudh Commn.—First commn., ensign, 13th April, 1859; from May, 1869, served under the govt. of the N.W. Prov. as offg. asst. commr. and cantonmt. mag.; dep. commr., Nov., 1889; served during the Bhutan campaign of 1865 (medal).

QUINLAN, FRANCIS PETER, late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the accts. branch, Oct., 1870, and was employed on the accts. of various railways in the grades of acctnt., asst. examr., asst. controller, and dep. examr.; examr., Sept., 1881; retd., March, 1895.

QUINN, CHARLES CAMPBELL, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the Royal Sch., Dungannon, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 8th Jan., 1864; served in the rev. and jud. depts., Bengal, and was apptd. mag. and collr., June, 1882; commr., Bhagalpur divn., Oct., 1891; retd., March, 1895.

QUINN, JOHN, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; dep. commr., Oudh, April, 1877, and mag. and collr., Ballia, Dec., 1881; commr., Lucknowdivn., March, 1884; offd. as jud. commr., Oudh, in 1884; retd., March, 1888.

RADICE, CHARLES ALBERT, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Bedford Sch., and Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 3rd Jan., 1890, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. settlt. officer.

RADICE, EVASIO HAMPDEN, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bedford Sch., and Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1887, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., asst. supt., Tarai, asst. commr. and joint mag.; city mag. and wasika officer Lucknow, Aug., 1892; offg. postmr.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Feb., 1895; joint mag., Nov. 1895.

RAGHUNATH SHIVRAM TIPMIS, B.A., LL.B., Statutory C.S. (Bombay).—Served as subord. judge from July, 1873, and was apptd. an asst. collr. in Bombay, under the native civil service rules, 1st April, 1887; on depn. to the Junagad state, 1893-94; 2nd asst., June, 1894.

RAIKES, FREDERICK DUNCAN, C.I.E., Lieut.-
RAJAGOPALA CHARI, Perungavur, M.A., B.L., Statutory C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Madras Univ.; served in the jud. dept. from 13th May, 1886; dep. collr., Dec., 1887; apptd. probr. for the civil service, 10th Jan., 1888; served as asst. collr. and mag., and was confd., 2nd May, 1890.

RAJANINATH RAY, M.A., Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the dept., Nov., 1872, and served in the Central Prov., and afterwards in Bombay; asst. comptr.-gen., Nov., 1882; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, Aug.-Nov., 1885; dep. comptr.-gen., April-June, 1887; dep. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, April, 1893.

RAJARATHNA MUDALIYAR, Pakam, Dewan Bahadur, Madras Rev. Dept.—Served in the salt dept. from 26th Oct., 1860; head sarishtadar, board of rev., Aug., 1882; sec. to the commr. of rev. settlt. and dir. of the dept. of land records and agric., Nov., 1887; offd. as inspr.-gen. registrn. from July, 1896.

RAM AUTAR PANDE, Pandit, B.A., Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Joined the service as offg. collr., 13th March, 1884; apptd. asst. mag. and collr. under the statutory service rules, 12th Feb., 1887; joint mag., Nov., 1891; asst. commr., Nov., 1895.

RAMACHANDRA AIYAR, Cuddalore, late Madras Jud. Dept.—Joined the dept., 19th Jan., 1860; 4th presidency mag., Madras, March, 1885; apptd. asst. collr. and mag., Feb., 1887; sub-collr. and joint mag., April, 1889; district and sessions judge, June, 1891; retd., March, 1894.

RAMACHANDRA RAO, Raghunatha Rao, B.A., Madras Rev. Dept.—Apptd. probr. under the native civil service rules, 13th June, 1890, and served as asst. collr. and mag.; dep. collr., July, 1892.

RAMA SHANKAR MISRA, Pandit, M.A., Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Offg. probr. of mathematics, Benares coll., Feb., 1877; resigned, Jan., 1878; rejoined as prof., Agra coll., 23rd Aug., 1879; apptd. under the native civil service rules asst. mag. and collr., 29th Dec., 1887; joint mag., May, 1892; asst. settlt. officer, Nov., 1893; asst. commr., April, 1896; author of a 'Treatise on Mensuration' in Hindi, and a 'Manual of Rent and Revenue Law.'

RAMPINI, Robert Fulton, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the Acad., Instn., and Univ., Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 23th Nov., 1864, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; joint sessions judge, Sept., 1875; district and sessions judge, July, 1880; judge of high court, Calcutta, April, 1893; edited Alexander's 'Indian Case Law on Torts,' Field's 'Law of Evidence,' and (with Mr. Finucane) 'The Bengal Tenancy Act.'

RAMSAY, Henry Lushington, Major, I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Feb., 1874; acted as asst. to agent to govnr.-gen., Rajputana, 1877-78; junr. attache, foreign dept., March, 1878; and semi., June, 1880; pol. officer on staff of Sir F. S. Roberts with the Kuram field force, Sept., 1879 (medal and clasp); asst. to agent to govnr.-gen., Rajputana, Oct., 1880; mag. at Abu, and asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakaiti dept., Nov., 1880; asst. agent, Baluchistan, June, 1882; consul at Bassora, May, 1883; cantonmt. mag., Nasirabad, Nov., 1883; British joint commr. of Ladakh, Oct., 1885; pol. agent, Bhopawar, March, 1891; pol. agent, S. Baluchistan, Nov., 1893; pol. officer with Sardar Ayub Khan, Oct., 1894; author of 'Western Tibet.'

RAMSAY, Herbert Maynard, Col., Police Dept., Bengal.—First commn., 1860; from 2nd July, 1863, served in the dept.as asst. supt., distric supt., and personal asst. to the inspr.-gen.; on depn. to report on chaukidari system, 1890-91.

RAMSAY, James, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service 8th Oct., 1868; exec. engr., March, 1871; engr.-in-chief, Indus valley state railway, Nov., 1880, and subsequently of the Sind-Sagar and Muskhaf-Bolan lines; suptg. engr., Feb., 1890; chief engr., Feb., 1892; retd., July, 1894.

RAMSAY, John, Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 9th Sept., 1882; from July, 1886, served at Ajmir and Indore as acting asst. agent; confd. in latter post, Jan., 1889; pol. agent, Haraoti and Tonk, Dec., 1891; 1st asst., Indore, May, 1892; in addn., asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakaiti, Nov., 1892; pol. agent in Bundelkhand, April, 1893.

RAND, Walter Charles, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Dulwich, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1883, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst. collr., Bombay, and inspr. of factories, May-Dec., 1891; 1st asst., Satara, March, 1894.

RANGA CHARI, Sivaram, B.A., Madras Rev. Dept.—Joined the service, 6th April, 1865; asst. commr. of rev. settlt., April, 1887; dep. commr. of rev. settlt., Jan., 1889.

RANKIN, James Thomson, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Glasgow and Edinburgh Univs.; apptd. after exam.of 1890; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1892, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

RANKING, George Spiers Alexander, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1875; appid. sec. to board of examrs., June, 1894; author of a guide to Hindustani for mil. med. officers, a work on Arabic and Persian prosody, &c.

RANSOM, Henry Edward, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Bedford Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, rath Dec., 1885, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in Assam as asst. commr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., June, 1894.

RASTAMJI MERWANJI PATEL, Khan Bahadur, M.A., LL.B., Bombay Jud. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Jan., 1894, as 2nd judge, Bombay small cause court.

RATTON, James Joseph Louis, M.D., M.R.C.S., Surgn.-Major, late Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 30th Sept., 1867; served in the Abyssinian expedn. (medal); civil surgn., Central Prov., 1869-70; on special duty in connection with salt manufacture, 1872-76; on famine relief works, 1876; zillah surgn. and supt. of jail, Chittur, April, 1877; surgn., gen. hosp., Madras, and probr. in the med. coll., Feb., 1885.
fellow of Madras univ., 1886; retd., Jan., 1888; has publ. a 'Handbook on Common Salt,' a 'Treatise on Tetanus,' and a 'Syllabus of Surgery.'

RAVENSROFT, EDWARD W., C.S.I., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at King Henry VIII.'s Gr. Sch., Ottery St. Mary, and Haileybury Coll.; arrived, 25th May, 1851, and served as asst. collr. and mag.; inspr.-in-chief under the cotton frauds act, Bombay, Feb., 1864; prest. of the municipal commn., Bombay, June, 1864; chief sec. to gov't. of Bombay, in the rev., &c., depts., 1877; collr. of Bombay, and supt. of stamps and stationery, March, 1868; member of legisl. council, Bombay, 1871 and 1873; collr. of salt rev., Oct., 1871; senr. collr. and mag., Dec., 1871; member of the Baroda commn. to investigate the charges brought against the Gaekwar; member of govr.'s council, Bombay, April, 1879; retd., March, 1884.

RAVENSHAW, CHARLES WITHERS, Major, I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 8th May, 1872; from Dec., 1875, offd. as asst. cantonmt. mag. at various places; from Feb., 1877, served under the foreign dept. as asst. pol. agent; on special boundary duty in 1879-80; served in Afghan war (medal); supt. of Rajputana railway police, Sept., 1880; asst. commr., Merwara, Dec., 1885; 1st asst. pol. rest., Persian Gulf, July, 1887; cantonmt. mag. and judge, small cause court, Secunderabad, April, 1890; asst. to the rest. in Mysore, and sec. to the chief commr. of Coorg, April, 1891; offf. rest., Gwalior, April, 1895.

RAWLINS, THOMAS WILLIAM, late Indian C.S.—Educ. at Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 11th Jan., 1863, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; small cause court judge, Allahabad, Nov., 1872; served under the govt. of India, fin. dept., from March, 1877; acctnt.-gen., Punjab, and dep. commr. of paper currency, Aug., 1880; acctnt.-gen. and commr. of paper currency, Madras, Oct., 1883; retd., Feb., 1896.

RAWSON, COURTNEY CLARKE, Lieut.-Col., R.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept., 27th June, 1871; exec. engr., March, 1878; served in Afghan war, 1878-79 (medal); acted as dep. chief engr. and under sec. to govt. in 1881 and 1882; suptg. engr., Jan., 1896.

RAWSON, EDWARD CRESCWELL, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Rossall Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 13th Dec., 1880, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head assst., Jan., 1889; sub-collr. and joint mag., March, 1893.

RAYE, DANIEL O'CONNELL, M.D., Surgn.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 31st March, 1866; from 1st Sept., 1875, served as rest. surgn., presidency gen. hosp.; profr., med. coll., and surgn. to the coll. hosp., May, 1881; principal med. officer, Calcutta, Jan., 1895; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., Punjab, March, 1895.

Rayment, GEORGE JOSEPH, Veterinary Major, late Indian Civil Veterinary Dept.—First commn., 24th July, 1872; apptd. aspt., civil veterinary dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, 1st April, 1892; reverted to mil. dept., June, 1894.

REAY (BARON), RIGHT HON. DONALD JAMES MACKAY, G.C.S.I., G.C.I.E., LL.D.—Took his seat as govr. of Bombay, 30th March, 1885; G.C.I.E., June, 1887; G.C.S.I., March, 1890; returned to Europe, April, 1890; was lord rector of the univ. of St. Andrew's, 1884; parly. under sec. of state for India, March, 1894, to July, 1895.

REAY ROBERT WILLIAM, Acctnt.-Gen. sDept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 23rd Oct., 1894.

REBSCH, SAMUEL, A.M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, 1st Oct., 1875, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., April, 1884.

REDFERN, THOMAS ROBERT, B.A., B.L., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at New Coll., Oxford; called to the bar at the Inner Temple; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 2nd Oct., 1870, and served in Oudh as asst. commr. and offf. settlt. officer; joint mag., May, 1885; district and sessions judge, Sept., 1887; retd., Oct., 1895.

REED, JOHN HENRY FREDERICK, B.A., Acctnt.-Gen. s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 17th Feb., 1872; B.A., London univ., 1881; junr. clerk, June, 1887.

REES, FREDERICK WILLIAM JOSEPH, B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Shrewsbury, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 11th Jan., 1863, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., April, 1878; from Dec., 1880, served in the jud. dept. as district and sessions judge; retd., Dec., 1887.

REES, JOHN CHARLES, B.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Calcutta Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd., 8th Aug., 1873, and posted to Burma; exec. engr., Feb., 1882; employed on Burma state railway, 1884-85; received Burma medal and clasp; in charge, Pegu divn., May, 1894.

REES, JOHN DAVID, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., London, and Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 16th Nov., 1875, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; from April, 1882, served in the secretariat as asst sec. and under sec., and in Mysore (1884-85) as acting civil and sessions judge; private sec. to the govr. of Madras, Dec., 1886; fellow of Madras univ., 1887; on special duty in connection with visit of Prince Albert Victor, 1890-90; C.I.E., May, 1890; apptd. collr. and mag. and sessions judge, Nilgiris, Aug., 1890, continuing to act as private sec. until Dec., 1891; acting rest., Travancore, April, 1895; member of govr.-gen.'s legisl. council, Oct., 1895; author of 'Notes of a Journey from Kasween to Hamadan in N.W. Persia,' 'Tours in India by Lord Connemara,' 'The Duke of Clarence in S. India,' and 'Epochs of Indian History: The Muhammadans,' and compiler of 'The Administration of Lord Connemara,' and 'Speeches of Lord Connemara.'

REID, ARTHUR HAY STEWART, M.A., Barrister-at-Law.—Profr. of Law, Muir Coll., Allahabad, May, 1883; offd. as public prosecutor, high court, N.W.P., March, 1895-Jan., 1896; and as judge, chief court, Punjab, April, 1896.

REID, GEORGE BOILEAU, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Harrow, and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 26th Nov., 1867, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 1st asst. collr., July, 1878; settlt. officer at Baroda, in 1879 and 1882; junr. collr. and mag., Oct., 1886; collr. and mag., Nov., 1886; senr. collr., May, 1888; commr., N. divn., Nov., 1892.

REID, JAMES ROBERT, C.I.E., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Edinburgh
Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 13th Dec., 1860, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and joint mag., and offg. dep. commr. in Oudh; from Aug., 1868, served as asst. settlt. officer, and settlt. officer, Azamgarh; mag. and collr., Jan., 1878; sec. to gov't. of N.W. Prov., Dec., 1883; chief sec. to gov't., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, May, 1884; commr., Kumaon divn., Nov., 1888; member of board of rev., Feb., 1890; C.I.E., May, 1890; member of legisl. council, March, 1891; retd., April, 1894.

REID, JOHN WILLIAM, B.L., late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1855; served from July, 1856, in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., sub-judge, and sub-collr. and joint mag.; from June, 1869, served in Malabar as civil and sessions judge; district and sessions judge, Coimbatore, Oct., 1884; retd., 1886.

REID, WILLIAM JAMES, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Glasgow High Sch. and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 25th Nov., 1891, and served in Assam as asst. commr.

REILY, CHARLES HORACE, B.L., late Jud. Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1876, as reporter for the Indian law reports, Calcutta; in Feb., 1882, was apptd. clerk of the crown and law lecturer, presidency coll.; asst. sec. to the gov't. of Bengal, legisl. dept., Nov., 1883; offd. as chief presidency mag. in 1885, and as judge of the court for trial of pilots in 1886-87; resigned, Oct., 1893.

REILY, HENRY MAXWELL, late Police Dept., Bengal.—From May, 1858, served as dep. mag. and dep. collr.; from July, 1863, served in the police dept., and was apptd. district supt., 1st grade, Dec., 1882; on special duty, Garo Hills expnd., Nov., 1872; retd., 1890.

REINOLD, EDWARD KONRAD, late Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd July, 1868, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Jan., 1879; retd., Jan., 1895.

RENDEL, SIR ALEXANDER MEADOWS, K.C.I.E.—Educ. at King's Sch., Canterbury, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge (scholar and wrangler); studied as a civil engr., and in 1856 became engr. to the London dock co., the Leith harbour and dock commrs., the East Indian railway, and other companies; visited India in 1857-58, and on various occasions; built the Shedwall new basin, the royal Albert dock, and other works on the Thames, the Albert and Edinburgh docks at Leith, the Workington dock and harbour, and other works; member of the comm. apptd. by the sec. of state for India in 1870, to determine the narrow gauge for Indian railways; designed the Sukkur bridge over the Indus (opened 1889); is consulting engr. to the sec. of state for India, and to various Indian railway cos.

RENDELL, ALAN WOOD, late Public Works Dept., Bengal.—Arrived, March, 1874; joined the dept. as locomotive supt., N. Bengal state railway, 8th Nov., 1877; locomotive supt. of N.E. system, June, 1881; and of E. Bengal state railway, July, 1884; retd., 1890.

RENNICK, ALBERT DE CLANEY, B.L., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Punjab Commn.—First commn., 6th July, 1864; arrived, 28th Nov., 1866; from Oct., 1870, served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; cantonmt. mag., Dec., 1880; dep. commr., May, 1889.

RENNIE, FRANCIS PEPSY, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Winchester, and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 23rd December, 1895, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

RENNIE, JOHN GEORGE MACKWORTH, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Winchester, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 19th Dec., 1881, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; district judge, Dec., 1892.

RENNY, ROBERT HOME, Bengal Non-Regulation Commn.—Served in the exec. dept. from 12th Nov., 1864, as dep. mag. and dep. collr. and extra asst. commr.; joined the commn., March, 1877; dep. commr., April, 1890.

RENOUF, WINTER CHARLES, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Victoria Coll., Jersey, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 14th Dec., 1889, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

REYNOLDS, CHARLES HENRY, M.I.E.E., India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the dept. as asst. supt., 7th Jan., 1868; personal asst. to dir.-gen., 1870, and 1872; in charge of famine divn., 1874; supt., April, 1886; delegate for India at the Berlin telegraph conference, 1885; dir., construction branch, July, 1886; dir., traffic branch, Dec., 1892; dep. dir.-gen., June, 1894; dir.-gen., April, 1895.

REYNOLDS, GEORGE BERNARD, M.I.C.E., M.I.M.E., M.I.S.I., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to state railways; employed in superior rev. establ., locomotive dept., 1879-91; exec. engr. and manager, Warora colliery, April, 1891.

REYNOLDS, HERBERT JOHN, C.S.I., B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1855; arrived, 24th Sept., 1856; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., supt. of survey, and mag. and collr.; between 1874 and 1880 served as sec. to the gov't. of Bengal, gen. and rev. depts., and as sec. to the board of rev.; member, gov't.-gen.'s legisl. council, 1886, and again in 1882 and 1884; member, Bengal legisl. council, 1881, 1883, 1885, and 1887; board of rev., July, 1884; chairman of port commrs., Calcutta, Oct., 1887; retd., April, 1889.

REYNOLDS, HERBERT WILLIAM WARD, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Cheltenham; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 22nd Dec., 1877, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., asst. sec. to gov't., and junr. sec., board of rev.; joint mag., Aug., 1890; dep. commr., Dec., 1893; mag. and collr., Jan., 1895.

REYNOLDS, PLAYFORD, M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 8th Oct., 1868, and was employed in Khandesh and Gujarat on irrig. works; exec. engr., May, 1879; supt. engr., June, 1890; services lent to Baroda state in 1883-85.

REYNOLDS, WILLIAM HENRY, Survey of India Dept.—Joined the service, 14th March, 1861, and was engaged on survey duty on the N.W. frontier until 1871, including service with the Ambela expdn., 1863; from Jan., 1871, served in the forest dept. as asst. conservator, dep. conservator, and dep. supt. of forest surveys; rejoined the survey dept. as dep. supt., Oct., 1890; supt. of forest surveys, March, 1891.

RHIND, ROBERT HUNTER, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. probr. by the sec. of state, June, 1862; arrived, 7th Dec., 1862, and served in Madras as asst. engr., and exec.
engr.; transfd. to Bengal, Aug., 1872; suptg. engr., Nov., 1886; retd., May, 1893.

RHODES, FRANCIS WILLIAM, D.S.O., Col., late 1st Royal Dragoons.—First commn., lieut., 23rd April, 1875; served in the Soudan expdn. in 1884 (medal with clasp and Khedive's star); also in Nile expdn. of 1884-85, and in the operations near Suakin, 1888 (3rd class Medjidie); mil. sec. to Lord Harris, gov'r. of Bombay, 1890-93; retd., Sept., 1896.

RIBBENTROP, BERTHOLD, C.I.E., Forest Dept., Govt. of India.—Apptd. by the sec. of state an asst. conservator of forests, Dec., 1866; conservator, Burma, Oct., 1876; transfd. to the Punjab, 1883; inspr.-gen. of forests, Jan., 1889; C.I.E., Jan., 1890; author of 'Hints on Arboriculture.'

RICE, PERCIVAL STANLEY PITCAIRN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Winchester, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 8th Dec., 1890, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

RICE, WALTER FRANCIS, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 16th Dec., 1892, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

RICE, WILLIAM GEORGE LEWIS, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Oscott Coll., and Jesus Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 10th Nov., 1882, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; transfd. to Burma, Feb., 1886, as asst. commr.; resigned, Oct., 1890.

RICE, WILLIAM ROCHE, M.D., C.S.I., Surgn.-Major-Gen.—Joined the Bengal med. service Nov., 1856; served during the Mutiny (medal); civil asst. surgn., Central Prov., June, 1859; civil surgn., Jabalpur, May, 1871; acting asst. to sanitary commr., Central Prov., July, 1872; supt., central jail, Jabalpur, April, 1873; civil surgn., July, 1879; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Oct., 1887; sanitary commr. and surgn.-gen. to gov't. of India, March, 1890; retd., March, 1895.

RICHARD, HENRY JOSEPH, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, July, 1868; asst. engr., Rangoon, 28th Oct., 1868; exec. engr., April, 1875; served with the Burma expdy. force, 1885-86 (medal with clasps); supt. of works, Upper Burma, Jan., 1886; suptg. engr., Sept., 1889; chief engr. and sec. to chief commr., Burma, public works dept., Aug., 1895.

RICHARDS, JAMES DAY, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, 1st Jan., 1893; and class clerk, Nov., 1896.

RICHARDSON, EDWARD, Jud. Dept., Burma.—After service in various subord. posts, was apptd. extra asst. commr., 2nd Feb., 1865; first judge, civil court, Mandalay, Sept., 1887.

RICHARDSON, JOHN, M.B., M.A., Surgn.-Col., late Med. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., 27th July, 1859; served with the Bhutan field force (medal and clasp); from April, 1866, was employed under the gov't. of the N.W. Prov. as civil asst. surgn., supt. of vaccn., and sanitary commr.; dep. surgn.-gen., Central Prov., May, 1889; inspr.-general of civil hosps., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, March, 1890; in 1892 acted as surgn.-gen. and sanitary commr. with the gov't. of India; retd., May, 1894.

RICHARDSON, THOMAS WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Brighton Coll., Cheltenham Coll., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 8th Dec., 1886, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec., gen., rev., and statistical depts., March, 1893; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1895; registrar, high court, appellate side, Dec., 1895.

RICHARDSON, WILLIAM PELHAM, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 8th Oct., 1868, and employed on irrigation works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Sept., 1872; retd.

RICHEY, Sir James BELLETT, K.C.I.E., C.S.I., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1856; arrived, 7th Dec., 1856, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., educ. inspr., asst. rev. commr., olfg. under sec. to govt., talukdari settlt. officer, and asst. to the agent and special commr. at Baroda; junr. collr. and mag., Jan., 1879; senr. collr., May, 1880; on special duty at Kharaghoda, 1883, and 1884, and at Baroda, 1883; acting commr. of customs, March, 1884; acting member of council, Bombay, March, 1885, and again, Oct., 1886; chief sec. to govt., pol., &c., depts., May, 1885; confd. as member of council, Bombay, Aug., 1887; retd., March, 1890; K.C.I.E., May, 1890.

RICKETTS, GEORGE H. M., C.B., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Winchester, and Haileybury; apptd., 1847; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and as asst. to the gov't.-gen.'s agent, S.W. frontier; from 1853, served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and dept. commr., and from 1858 in the N.W. Prov. as mag. and collr., and civil and sessions judge; C.B. for service in the Punjab in 1857, and medal for service with the troops; commr., Allahabad divn., 1873; junr. member, board of rev., 1878; retd., 1879.

RICKETTS, MONTAGUE POYNTZ, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—Arrived 22nd March, 1855; served in the Central Prov. from Sept., 1859, as asst. commr.; small cause court judge, Jabalpur, Aug., 1862; dep. commr., May, 1867; addl. commr., Nov., 1883; retd., April, 1890.

RIDDELL, ROBERT VANSETTART, Col., R.E.—Joined Addiscombe, Feb., 1858; lieut., royal engrs., 10th June, 1859; arrived, March, 1861; from Aug., 1862, served in the topogr. survey of India as mil. asst.; dep. supt., Oct., 1867; asst. surveyor-gen. Oct., 1876; apptd. mint master, Calcutta, Jan., 1884; mint master and mint engr., Bombay, Aug., 1889; retd., March, 1895.

RIDGEWAY, THE RIGHT HON. SIR JOSEPH WEST, K.C.B., K.C.S.I., Col.—First commn., Bengal infantry, Dec., 1860; in civil employ from May, 1868, in the Central India and Rajputana agencies; attaché, foreign dept., 1873; ass't. agent to gov't.-gen. in Rajputana, 1875; pol. agent, E. states, Rajputana, Aug., 1876; on special pol. duty with the field force in Afghanistan, under Gen. Sir F. Roberts, 1880 (medal with clasp, bronze star); from Sept., 1880, served in the secretariat of the foreign dept., and was apptd. asst. sec., Nov., 1880, and junr. under sec., Dec., 1881; from Aug., 1884, served as asst. with the commn. for the delimitation of the Afghan frontier, and was apptd. H.M.'s commn. for this purpose, Sept., 1885; subsequently was H.M.'s commn. for same purpose at St. Petersburg; returned to Europe, 1887, and was apptd. under sec. for Ireland; retd. from the army, Aug., 1889; K.C.B., Jan., 1891; envoy to Morocco,
Jan., 1893; lieut.-govr. of the Isle of Man, Nov., 1893; apptd. govr. of Ceylon, Sept., 1895.

RIEU, JEAN LOUIS, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch., London, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 20th Nov., 1893, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

RIGG, ARTHUR EDMUND, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Kingswood Sch., Bath, and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 15th Dec., 1894, and served in Burma as asst. commr.
