RIGG, HENRY, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 13th June, 1862, and arrived, 7th Dec., 1862; asst. engr., Feb., 1864; served in various divns. in Madras, and was apptd. exec. engr., March, 1868; on special duty, Upper Burma, 1885-86 (medal and clasps); manager and engr.-in-chief, Burma state railway, June, 1889; consulting engr. to the govt. of India for railways, central divn., May, 1892; chief engr., Aug., 1892; and consulting engr. for railways, Lucknow, Jan., 1895.

RIGHTY, VANS, M.I.C.E., late Public Works Dept., Bengal.—Apptd. probt. asst. engr., Feb., 1856; exec. engr., March, 1871; from Jan., 1875, was employed on Tirhut state railway, and was apptd. manager and supt. of way and works, Tirhut and Patna Gya state railways, March, 1880; transf. to superior rev. establt., Oct., 1882; supt. of way and works, N.W. railways, 1886; retld., Dec., 1891.

RILEY, HENRY JAMES, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 3rd April, 1882.

RIPON (MARQUESS OF), THE RIGHT HON. GEORGE FREDERICK SAMUEL ROBINSON, K.G., G.C.S.I., C.I.E., P.C., D.C.L.—Born 24th Oct., 1827; attache to a special mission to Brussels, 1849; sat in the house of commons (as Viscount Goderich) as member for Hull, 1852-53, for Huddersfield, 1853-57, and for the W. Riding of Yorkshire, 1857-59, in which year he succeeded to the upper house; under sec. for war, June, 1859; pres. of the royal geographical society, 1860; under sec. for India, Jan.-July, 1861; sworn a privy councillor, April, 1863; lord high steward of Hull, Oct., 1863; sec. for war, April, 1863, to Feb., 1866; sec. of state for India, Feb.-July, 1866; lord pres. of the council, Dec., 1868, to Aug., 1873; K.G., 1869; hon. D.C.L., Oxford, 1870; chairman of the joint high comm., which arranged the treaty of Washington, 1871; created Marquess of Ripon, 1871; viceroy and govr.-gen. of India, June, 1880, to Dec., 1884; was a royal comm. for the London exhib. of 1886; first lord of the admiralty, Feb.-Aug., 1886; sec. of state for the colonies, Aug., 1892, to July, 1895.

RISLEY, HERBERT HOPE, C.I.E., B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester, and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 24th Oct., 1873, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. to dir.-gen. of statistics; asst. sec., govt. of Bengal, Oct., 1877; under sec., rev. and gen. depts., Jan., 1878; offig. under sec., govt. of India, some dept., Feb., 1879; asst. commr., Jan., 1880; supt. of survey of Ghatwali and other service tenures in Manbhum, Feb., 1884; employed on the special duty of compiling statistics relating to the castes and occupations of the people of Bengal, Jan., 1885; dep. commr., April, 1886; sec., police commn., 1890; mag. and collr., May, 1891; sec. to govt. of Bengal, finl. and municipal depts., July, 1892; member of provl. legislat. council, 1892-93, and from March, 1895; C.I.E., Jan., 1892; author of 'Sikkim and Tibet,' 'Tribes and Castes of Bengal,' an 'Ethnographic Glossary,' and other works on ethnology.

RITCHIE, JOHN GERALD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 28th Oct., 1875, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1887; dep. commr., May, 1891; mag. and collr., Dec., 1891; chairman of Calcutta commrs., April, 1895.

RITCHIE, RICHMOND THACKERAY WILLOUGHBY, India Office.—Educ. at Eton, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; junr. clerk, finl. dept., 18th May, 1877; rev., statistics and commerce dept., 1881; private sec. to partly under sec. of state, 1883-92; senr. clerk, Oct., 1892; private sec. to permanent under sec., Oct., 1892, to Feb., 1894; sec. to royal comm. on Indian expenditure, May, 1895, but resigned on appt. as private sec. to sec. of state (Lord George Hamilton), July, 1895.

RIVAZ, CHARLES MONTGOMERY, C.S.I., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Blackheath Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 28th Nov., 1864, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and offig. under sec. and sec. to govt.; supt., Kapurthala state, April, 1877; dep. commr., April, 1885; sec. to Punjab govt., May, 1887; commr. and supt., Nov., 1888; and finl. commr., Feb., 1893; C.S.I., May, 1895; addl. member of legislative council of govt. gen., May, 1896-Oct., 1896.

RIVAZ, GEORGE WILMOT, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Blackheath Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 29th Oct., 1870, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; registrar, chief court, Punjab, 1877-84; district judge, Aug., 1886; divl. judge, March, 1891; edited the and edn. of the circular orders of the chief court.

RIVETT-CARNAC, CHARLES JAMES, Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the dept., 21st May, 1872, and served in the N.W. Prov. and the Punjab; asst. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, Oct., 1882; asst. comptr.-gen. (forest branch), Oct., 1884; asst. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, March, 1885; comptr., Central Prov., Nov., 1891; transf. to Burma, Nov., 1895.

RIVETT-CARNAC, JOHN HENRY, C.I.E., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 12th Nov., 1858, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; offig. under sec. govt. of India, home dept., Sept., 1861; asst. sec. to the chief commr., Central Prov., June, 1862; settl. officer, Chanda and Wardha, Aug., 1864; cotton commr., Central Prov., Sept., 1866, and Berars, April, 1867; commr. of cotton and commerce with the govt. of India, Dec., 1871; member and hon. sec. of central committee of international exhibns.; on duty in England, 1872-73; special commr. of transport, Bengal famine; opium agent, Benares, March, 1875; retd., Feb., 1894; author of reports on Indian cotton cultivation and trade, and on the interchange of traffic on Indian railways, &c.

RIX, HARRY SIDNEY, B.A., Indian C.S., (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Sherborne Sch., and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 28th Dec., 1894, and
served in N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

ROBARTS, HARRY OCTAVIUS WARWICK, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Blundell's Sch., Tiverton, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 15th Dec., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1896.

ROBB, JOHN, M.D., C.M., Surgn.—Major, late Med. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the Indian med. service, 1st Oct., 1868; from Nov., 1873, served as civil surgn., Zanzibar, and acted as asst. pol. agent in 1874-75 and 1881; from July, 1882, served under the govt. of Bombay, as civil surgn., jail supt., &c., at Aden, Surat, and Ahmadabad; retd., Nov., 1889.

ROBERTS, ALLAN SCOTT, Lieut.-Col., Bengal Infantry, late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 2nd April, 1862; from June, 1866, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and jud. asst.; dep. commr., Nov., 1884; retd., Dec., 1894.

ROBERTS, ARTHUR WILLIAM, Col., Pol. Dept., Govt. of India.—Cornet, Bengal cavalry, Feb., 1859; asst. to govt.-gen.'s agent, Rajputana, 1864; cantonmt. mag., Morar, Feb., 1875; asst. commr., Merwara, April, 1881; pol. asst., Sujangarh, Aug., 1881; in 1881-82 was employed in operations against the rebellious Bikaniir thakurs, and received the surrender of the fort of Nahargarh; asst. pol. agent, Banswara and Partabgarh, Aug., 1883; pol. agent and supt., Charkhardi, Sept., 1884; cantonmt. mag., Nasirabad, Dec., 1885; pol. agent, Jacobabad, Dec., 1887; Khelat, March, 1888; Alwar, May, 1888; asst. agent, Mount Abu, Nov., 1888; pol. agent, Kotah, April, 1889; cantonmt. mag., Nasirabad, Sept., 1889.

ROBERTS, CHARLES HAMILTON, Kunnaun Commn.—Joined the service, 25th Feb., 1874, and served as extra asst. commr. and cantonmt. mag.; dep. collr., Jan., 1887; on special duty in Garhwal, April, 1890; supt., Tarai, Sept., 1890; dep. commr., Naini Tal, Oct., 1891.

ROBERTS, DAVID THOMAS, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Liverpool, Liverpool Inst. and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 14th Nov., 1868, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1870; dep. commr., Dec., 1886; mag. and collr., June, 1887; commr., April, 1884; author of 'Ballia Gazetteer' (in part), and of the Ballia settl. report.

ROBERTS (BARON), RIGHT HON. FREDERICK SLEIGH, V.C., G.C.B., G.C.S.I., G.C.I.E., Field-Marshal, R.A.—First commn., Bengal artillery, 1851; during the Mutiny served at the siege and capture of Delhi, &c. (medal and three clasps, V.C.); dep. asst. quartermaster-gen., Bengal, April, 1858; served in the N.W. frontier expdn., 1863 (medal and clasp); asst. quartermaster-gen., Bengal, Feb., 1863; served with the Abyssinian expdn., 1868 (medal), and with the Lushai expdn., 1871-72; dep. quartermaster-gen., Bengal, Jan., 1872; quartermaster-gen., Bengal, Jan., 1875; during the operations in Afghanistan in 1878-9-80, commanded the Kuram valley field force, and subsequently the Kabul field force at the occupation of Kabul and battle of Kharasiab, and in the march to the relief of Kandahar (medal with four clasps, bronze star, thanks of both houses of parliament, created a bart., K.C.B., G.C.B.); commander-in-chief, Madras, and member of govr.'s council, Nov., 1881; commander-in-chief, in India, and member of the govr.-gen.'s council, Nov., 1885 to April, 1893; created a peer, Jan., 1892; G.C.S.I., June, 1893; field-marshal, May, 1895; commander-in-chief in Ireland, Oct., 1895.

ROBERTS, SYDNEY GORDON, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Haileybury Coll., and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 27th Nov., 1893, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

ROBERTS, THOMAS, M.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Cheltenham Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, Nov., 1863, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., jud. asst., and dep. commr.; addl. commr., Jalandhar, Aug., 1884; divl. judge, Nov., 1884; retd., April, 1891.

ROBERTS, WILLIAM HOWLAND, M.D., Surgn.-Col., late Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 23rd July, 1858; arrived, 24th Sept., 1858, and served in the Central Prov. till Sept., 1864, and subsequently in Madras as civil surgn., supt. of jail, &c.; was also in charge of meteorological observatories at Coimbatore and Salem; reverted to mil. duty, Sept., 1885; retd., July, 1893.

ROBERTSON, BENJAMIN, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at the Inst., Elgin, the Gr. Sch. and Univ. of Aberdeen, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 28th Nov., 1885, and served in Bombay as asst. collr.; transfd. to Central Prov. as provl. supt. of census operations, April, 1890; asst. commr., Oct., 1892; commr. of excise, Oct., 1894; dep. commr., Nov., 1894.

ROBERTSON, CHARLES, M.D., Dep. Surgn.-Gen., late Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 4th Aug., 1856; arrived, 17th Dec., 1856; served under the mil. dept. and also as zillah surgn., Masulipatam (1862-65); from May, 1874, served as zillah surgn., and supt. of jail, Cuddalore; retd., Dec., 1885.

ROBERTSON, DONALD, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, royal Scots fusiliers, Aug., 1865; arrived, Oct., 1865; served from Nov., 1869, as asst. commr. in the Central Prov.; transfd. to Rajputana, June, 1872; cantonmt. mag., Nasirabad, May, 1877; offg. asst. commr., Merwara and Ajmir, 1877-78; offg. supt., Jhalawar, 1879; 1st asst. agent, Indore, 1881; pol. agent, Bhopawar, Feb., 1885; pol. agent, Bundelkhand, May, 1885; asst. to the rest, in Mysore, and sec. to the chief commr. of Coorg, Dec., 1886; pol. agent in Baghelkhand, and supt. of the Rewa state, Dec., 1888; rest., Gwalior, Feb., 1894; offg. govr.-gen.'s agent, Central India, April, 1895.

ROBERTSON, ELPHINSTONE POURTALES, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 27th March, 1851, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., dep. commr. of customs, salt, and opium, and sub-collr. and joint mag.; senr. collr. and mag., Dharwar, Jan., 1873; rev. and police commr., Nov., 1876; commr. of the central divn., Jan., 1878; retd., 1886.

ROBERTSON, FREDERICK ALEXANDER, B.L., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 5th Dec., 1876, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; special duty,
Maler Kotla settlt. operations, Nov., 1883; dir. of land records and agric., Dec., 1889; author of 'Customary Law of Rawalpindi District,' and of reports on the revised settlt. and forest settlt. of that district.

ROBERTSON, Sir GEORGE SCOTT, K.C.S.I., Surgn.-Major, Indian Med. Service.—Educ. at Westminster Hosp.; joined the service, 30th March, 1878; served through the Afghan war, 1879-80; civil surgn., N.W. Prov., 1880-88; on depn. to Gilgit, June, 1888; agency surgn., Gilgit, July, 1889; on special duty in Kafiristan, 1890-91; chief pol. officer, Hunza-Nagar expdn., 1891; C.S.I., May, 1892; offg. agent, Gilgit, May-Oct., 1892; mission to Gor and capture of Chilas, 1892; in charge, Chitral mission, 1893; agent, Gilgit, Jan., 1894; K.C.S.I., July, 1895, for his defence of Chitral fort.

ROBERTSON, GRAHAM, Bengal Marine Dept.—Joined the service, 25th Feb., 1891; 2nd marine surveyor, Calcutta port, Nov., 1892; 1st engr. and shipwright surveyor, June, 1895.

ROBERTSON, JAMES CASAMAJOR, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1854; arrived, 31st Jan., 1855, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., asst. supt., Dehra Dun, small cause court judge, and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Allahabad, Oct., 1871; offg. inspr.-gen. of registr., and commr. of excise and stamps, July, 1876; civil and sessions judge, April, 1879; commr., Jan., 1882; offd. as member of the board of rev. on various occasions; retd., Jan., 1890.

ROBERTSON, JOHN HERBERT, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Sir Roger Cholmeley's Sch., Highgate, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 25th Nov., 1889, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

ROBERTSON, Laurence, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Glasgow Acad., Glasgow Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 23rd Dec., 1893, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

ROBERTSON, WILLIAM, Funds Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, India audit office, 27th Feb., 1886; transfd. to funds dept., India office, 3rd Dec., 1894.

ROBERTSON, WILLIAM ROWNTREE, M.R.A.C., late Madras Educn. Dept.—Arrived, 21st Nov., 1868; supt., govt. farms, Nov., 1868; supt. of the sch. of agric., Saidapet, Oct., 1876; fellow of Madras univ., May, 1882; supt., govt. farms and sch. of agric., and agric. reporter to govt. of Madras, Nov., 1882; principal, agric. coll., Saidapet, April, 1884; retd., April, 1889.

ROBINSON, ALEXANDER, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Royal Sch., Armagh, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 9th Nov., 1865, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag. and dep. collr., and dep. commr.; mag. and collr., April, 1887; retd., Sept., 1892; author of 'Memoirs of the Ballia and Jaunpur Districts.'

ROBINSON, William, B.A., Mil. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Carmichael Sch., Queen's Coll., Cork, and the Royal Univ. of Ireland; junr. clerk, 11th June, 1894; rest. clerk, Dec., 1894.

ROBSON, SAMUEL, M.A., Bengal Educn. Dept.—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ.; joined the dept., 20th Dec., 1878, as prof'r., presidency coll.; transfd. to Patna coll., June, 1880; and to Hugli coll., Jan., 1883; again prof'r., Patna coll., Aug., 1883.

ROE, Sir CHARLES ARTHUR, M.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1863, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; dep. commr., Nov., 1878; addl. commr., Lahore and Rawal Pindi divns., May, 1883; divl. judge, Nov., 1884; addl. judge, chief court, Nov., 1888; judge, April, 1889; chief judge, Dec., 1895; Kt., Jan., 1897; author of 'Customary Law of the Multan District,' and of three settlt. reports.

ROE, Francis Reginald, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 8th Nov., 1890, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

ROE, WILLIAM ALEXANDER CRAWFORD, Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Med. Dept., Punjab.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1859; in mil. employ till 22nd March, 1878, when he was apptd. offg. civil surgn., Jalandhar; in 1879 served with the Kuram valley field force; confd. as civil surgn., Sept., 1880; med. adviser to Maharaja of Kapurthala, April to Oct., 1885; sanitary commr., Punjab, May, 1894.

ROGERS, Alexander, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1845; arrived, 9th Nov., 1845; served in the Bombay rev. and jud. dept., and was apptd. 1st asst. collr. and mag., Broach, Oct., 1851, and afterwards at Ahmadabad, Oct., 1852; settlt. officer, Gujarat, Nov., 1852; collr. and mag., Ahmadabad, March, 1860, and afterwards at Surat; rev. and police commr., N. divn., April, 1865; member of council, Bombay, June, 1872; retd. in 1879; author of a transl. of three modern Persian plays, a 'History of the Land Rev. Settlt. of Bombay,' and a transl. of 'Yusuf and Zuleika'; has also edited the 'Bostan' of Sa'adi.

ROGERS, ERNEST, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch. and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 25th Nov., 1887, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.

ROGERS, Henry Thomas, Major-Gen., R.E., late Madras Rev. Survey Dept.—Second lieut., Dec., 1849; arrived, 28th Aug., 1852; served in the public works dept., Bengal, 1853-59, and subsequently in Madras as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; fellow of the univ. of Madras, 1872; principal, civil engrr. coll., April, 1871, to Jan., 1880; from Nov., 1879, served as supt. of rev. survey, Madras; retd., July, 1886.

ROGERS, Malcolm William, Col., R.E., Survey of India Dept.—Lieut., royal engrs., Dec., 1861; arrived, Oct., 1865; asst. surveyor, great trigonl. survey, July, 1866; served with the Quetta field force as survey officer, 1878-79 (medal); dep. supt. of survey, July, 1882; asst. surveyor-gen., May, 1884, to Sept., 1887; supt. (new scale), Aug., 1892; again asst. surveyor-gen. in charge of surveyor-gen.'s office and mathematical instrument office, from May, 1889.

ROGERS-HARRISON, Augustus Napoleon, Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1879, and was employed under the mil. dept. until Dec., 1880, when he was apptd. civil surgn. and supt. of jail and lunatic asylum, Vizagapatam; civil surgn., Salem, June, 1887; district med. and sanitary officer, Oct., 1895.

ROLLAND, Alexander Tulloch, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Madras.—Ensign, Madras in-
fantry, April, 1856; served in the dept. from Dec., 1862, as asst. supt., and supt.; dep. inspr.-gen. of police, Feb., 1885; acted as commr. of police, Madras city, in 1889; reverted to mil. dept., Oct., 1893.

ROLLO, JAMES THEODORE, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 7th Oct., 1870, and posted to Rajputana; transfd. to Assam, June, 1880; exec. engr., May, 1881; transfd. to Burma, June, 1892.

ROMESH CHUNDER DUTT, C.I.E., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Colootola Branch Sch., Calcutta, Presidency Coll., Calcutta Univ., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 28th Sept., 1871; served in rev. and jud. depts., Bengal, and was apptd. mag. and collr., March, 1883; acted as commr., Bardwan, 1894-95; member of provl. legisl. council, Jan.-Oct., 1895; has publ. 'Three Years in Europe,' 1872; 'Peasantry of Bengal,' 1876; 'Literature of Bengal,' 1877; a 'History of Civilisation in Ancient India,' 1883-89; a 'Brief History of Ancient and Modern India,' 1891; 'Laws of Ancient India,' 1894; &c., &c.

ROMESH CHUNDER MITTER, Sir, B.L.—Puise judge, high court, Calcutta, 30th March, 1874; acted as chief justice in 1882; retd., 1890; member of the govt.-gen.'s legisl. council to Aug., 1891.

RONSON, WILLIAM TOMLINSON, Rev. and Statistics Dept., India Office.—Writer, 1st Sept., 1873; clerk, 2nd class, Feb., 1879; junr. clerk, Feb., 1894.

ROPER, CAMPBELL ROWLEY, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Shrewsbury Sch., Trinity Coll., Dublin, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 10th Dec., 1894, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

ROSE, BENJAMIN JAMES, Rev. and Statistics Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Williams' Gr. Sch., Clapham, and the Birkbeck Instn.; entered the India office, 23rd Feb., 1871; technical asst. in the rev. and statistics dept., June, 1882; also clerk to the special asst., 1891; awarded gold medal at Amsterdam exhibn. for statistical diagrams shewing the condition and progress of British India; prepared abstract catalogue of the Indian section at the same exhibn.; also reports on wheat and Madras tobacco.

ROSE, EDWARD, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Folkingham Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 7th Nov., 1868, and served in the N.W. Prov. and in Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and asst. commr.; mag. and collr., Aug., 1887; offg. commr., Gorakhpur, April-Oct., 1894; and at Agra, Jan., 1895.

ROSE, FRANCIS ERNEST, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 1st Sept., 1865, and posted to Central Prov.; transfd. to the Punjab, Nov., 1866; exec. engr., Jan., 1877.

ROSE, GEORGE PRINGLE, C.I.E., A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1877; posted to state railways, Nov., 1878; exec. engr., Feb., 1891; C.I.E., 1892; lent to Nizam's govt., April, 1895.

ROSE, HORACE ARTHUR, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch. and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 4th Oct., 1888, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

ROSS, ALEXANDER, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at the Acad. and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. from Haileybury, 1836; served in the jud. and rev. depts. of the N.W. Prov., and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1853; special commr., Farakhabad, Dec., 1857; civil and sessions judge, 1858; commr.of rev. and police, Agra divn., May, 1859; judge of the sadar court, N.W. Prov., 1862; judge, high court, N.W. Prov., 1866; retd., Oct., 1871.

ROSS, ALLAN, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Beaumont Coll., Windsor, and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 7th Jan., 1892, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

ROSS, DAVID (Burma Comm.).—Joined the service, March, 1886, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

ROSS, SIR EDWARD CHARLES, Kt., C.S.I., Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, 3rd European regt., Bombay, May, 1855; served in Central India during the Mutiny (medal and clasp); asst. to pol. agent, Muscat, 1863; asst. pol. agent, Gwadar, 1869; pol. agent and consul, Muscat, April, 1871; pol. rest., Persian Gulf, Oct., 1872; also consil-gen. for Fars and the Persian Gulf, Nov., 1878; offg. rest., Haidarabad, April-Oct., 1886; reverted to mil. dept., 1891; Kt., Jan., 1892; author of several reports and memoranda on subjects connected with the Persian Gulf.

ROSS, GEORGE CUMBERLAND, Surgn.-Col., Bengal Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 2nd Oct., 1865; arrived, 11th April, 1866; served from Nov., 1867, as civil surgn. in various stations in the Punjab; administrative med. officer and sanitary commr., Central Prov., Jan., 1894; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., Bengal, March, 1895.

ROSS, HENRY THOMAS, M.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Perth Acad., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 26th Oct., 1873, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; special asst., Malabar, Sept., 1884; acting subsec., board of rev., Aug., 1885; registrar, high court, Feb., 1886; sub-collr. and joint mag., Sept., 1888; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1889.

ROSS, HERCULES GREY, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1856; arrived, 16th Nov., 1856; from April, 1858, served in the N.W. Prov. and in Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., asst. commr., and city mag. at Lucknow; supt., Dehra Dun, Dec., 1869; mag. and collr., Benares, Oct., 1882; settl. officer, Dehra Dun, Oct., 1883; commr., Kumaon, April, 1885; retd., Nov., 1888.

ROSS, WILLIAM.—Apptd. supt. of govt. printing, India, 1st May, 1891.

ROSSITER, CHARLES ARTHUR, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, 1st Jan., 1893.

ROUSE, ROBERT, Dep. Surgn.—Gen., late Med. Dept., Punjab.—Joined the Indian med. dept. in 1854; from May, 1869, served as civil surgn. and offg. supt. of jail in the Punjab; retd., Sept., 1885.

ROUTH, REGINALD SAMUEL JOHN, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. 1st October, 1876, and posted to State Railways as asst. engr.; exec. engr., June, 1889.

ROWE, FREDERICK JAMES, M.A., Educn. Dept., Bengal.—Joined the service, 15th June, 1870, and served as prof. at Krishnagar, Dacca,
and Hugli colls., also as inspr. of schs.; profr., presidency coll., July, 1880; joint author of various educ. works, &c.

ROWE, JOSIAH EBENEZER, late Punjab Commn.—Joined the service, 20th March, 1858, and served in the Punjab in various capacities; extra ass't. commr., Oct., 1865; small cause court judge in 1874, 1875, and 1881-84; extrajud. ass't., Nov., 1884; retd., Nov., 1894.

ROWLANDS, PERCY JONES, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—East India house writer, old establ., 1st Sept., 1858; asst. to registrar, June, 1877.

ROXBURGH, JAMES, Finl. Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 30th Dec., 1895.

ROY, MADHUR CHUNDER, B.A., B.C.E., M.I.C.E., Rai Bahadur, late India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Calcutta Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd., 16th Sept., 1862; and posted to Bengal; exec. engr., March, 1872; retd., 1894.

ROYLE, JOSEPH R. E. J., C.I.E.—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., London; entered Indian army from Addiscombe, 7th June, 1861; ret'd., Jan., 1867; on the extra staff of the India museum, 1st Jan., 1867; sec., Indian commn. for Vienna exhibn., 1873; supt., India museum, 1874; clerk to the special asst. in the statistics and commerce dept., India office, 1879-91; exec. commr. for govt. of India, Amsterdam exhibn., 1883; asst. sec. for India to royal commn. for the Colonial and Indian exhibn., 1886, and official agent for the govt. of India; C.I.E., 1886; curator of Indian section, Imperial Inst., 1891; author of the official reports on the Indian sections of the Amsterdam and Colonial and Indian exhibns.; also of a lecture before the Society of Arts, June, 1882, on the 'Production of Tea, Cinchona, Wild Silks, and Rhea in India.'

RUNDALL, FRANCIS HORNBLOW, C.S.I., Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Madras engrs., 1841; asst. civil engr., 1844; civil engr., public works dept., Ganjam, 1854; district engr., Rajamahendri, May, 1855; consulting engr., Madras irrig., and canal co., Oct., 1859; chief engr. of irrig., and joint sec. to govt. of Bengal, July, 1867; chief engr., 1st class, Aug., 1869; inspr.-gen. of irrig., and dep. sec. to govt. of India, April, 1872, to April, 1874; C.S.I., Dec., 1875.

RUNDALL, JAMES WILLIAM, M.I.C.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—Joined the dept. as supernumerary engr., 2nd Aug., 1855; exec. engr., July, 1863; supt. of works, Kistna, Aug., 1880; suptg. engr., Oct., 1881; retd., 1889.

RUSSELL, ALEXANDER SHERWOOD, Madras Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, 1st Oct., 1875; asst. to chief engr. and under sec. to govt., irrig., branch, in 1882; exec. engr., April, 1886.

RUSSELL, CHARLES LENNOX SOMERVILLE, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Rugby, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 1st Dec., 1893, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

RUSSELL, EDGAR GEER, M.B., B.Sc., Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1872, and served on gen. and mil. duty, and in various offg. appts.; civil surgn., Patna, March, 1890; Darjiling, April, 1892; Dacca, March, 1894; profr., Calcutta med. coll., Sept., 1896; author of a work on 'Malaria and Injuries of Spleen.'

RUSSELL, SIR EDWARD LECHMERE, K.C.S.I., Gen.—Ensign, 12th native infantry, Bombay, Jan., 1838; served in the Afghan war of 1842, and the Sind campaign of 1842-43; fort adjutant, Bombay, Jan., 1855; remount agent, May, 1857; commanding brigade, Disa, March, 1863, and subsequently at Bombay; pol. rest. and commanding brigade, at Aden, Dec., 1867; commanding northern divn., Bombay, 1870-76; placed on unemployed list, July, 1881.

RUSSELL, GEORGE WILLIAM ERskine.—Educ. at Harrow, and Univ. Coll., Oxford; M.P., Aylesbury, 1880-85; parly. sec. to local govt. board, 1883-85; alderman of the county of London, Feb., 1889; M.P. for N. Bedfordshire, 1892-95; under sec. of state for India, Aug., 1892; under sec. of state, home dept., March, 1894, to July, 1895; author of a 'Life of Mr. Gladstone,' and editor of 'The Letters of Matthew Arnold.'

RUSSELL, ROBERT VANE, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Winchester, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 5th Sept., 1893, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

RUSSELL, SAMUEL, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Santry Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 7th Nov., 1877, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; special asst., Ganjam, Feb., 1885; sub-collr. and joint mag., April, 1890; district and sessions judge, Chengalpat, Feb., 1893.

RUSTAMJI DHANJIBHAI SETHNA, B.A., LL.B., B.L., Bombay High Court.—Joined the service, 27th March, 1886, as acting profr., Bombay law sch.; confld., Feb., 1889; registrar of the high court, appellate side, July, 1895.

RUTHERFORD, DAVID, Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, July, 1867, as proby. asst. engr.; exec. engr., Feb., 1873.

RUTHERFURD, JOHN MURIC, late India Public Works Dept.—Trained in Europe for the telegraph dept., and apptd. asst. supt., Oct., 1869; arrived, 8th Jan., 1870, and served in the Punjab, and in Rajputana; transf'd, to state railways, March, 1880, and served as district traffic supt. on the Rajputana state railway; Indus valley state railway, March, 1882; dep. traffic supt., N.W. railway, July, 1886; traffic supt., Oct., 1888; retd., 1891.

RUTHERFURD, JAMES, Col., late Mysore Rev. Survey.—First commn., ensign, 4th Aug., 1850; joined the Mysore rev. survey dept., Jan., 1855; dep. supt., April, 1881; reverted to mil. dept., Nov., 1892.

RYLAND, WILLIAM HENRY, late Jud. Dept., Bengal.—From 10th Dec., 1852, served in the subord. exec. service, Bengal; offg. collr. of stamps, and supt. of abkari rev., March, 1868; offg. asst. sec., govt. of Bengal, May, 1869; from Dec., 1874, served in the jud. dept. and was apptd. judge of the small cause court at Sealdah, April, 1875; offg. supt. of stamps and stationery, April, 1880; retd., April, 1887.

RYVES, ROBERT HUGH, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 15th Nov., 1891, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and acting under sec.

RYVES, THOMAS JAMES, Local Capt., late Police Dept., N.W. Prov.—Served as a volunteer in the Mutiny (medal); adjutant of mil. police, Bijnaur, 1859; asst. inspr.-gen., Rohilkhand,
April, 1861; from Aug., 1861, served as supt. of police in various districts; asst. inspr.-gen., railway police, June, 1888; dep. inspr.-gen., June, 1892; retd., Jan., 1895.

SABONADIERE, ALFRED, Indian C.S., N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Charterhouse, and St. John's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 10th Jan., 1883, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., March, 1893.

ST. CLAIR, THE HON. LOCKHART MATHEW, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1876, and posted to Central Prov.; exec. engr., Jan., 1884; services lent to Nepal state, 1889-92; transfd. to Assam, April, 1894.

ST. QUINTIN, WILLIAM ASTELL, India Audit Office.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Blackheath Proprietary Sch.; temporary clerk, 31st Dec., 1866; junr. examr., Dec., 1868; senr. examr., Nov., 1878; designation changed to senr. clerk, Oct., 1892.

SAIYID MAHMUD, B.L., late High Court, N.W. Prov.—Educ. at the Delhi Govt. Coll., Queen's Coll., Benares, and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; joined the service as district judge, Oudh, 1st Aug., 1879; served under foreign dept., 1881-82; district judge, Rae Bareli, Nov., 1883; judge of high court, N.W. Prov., May, 1887; retd., Dec., 1893; author of 'The Law of Evidence in British India' (in Hindustani).

SALAMAN, SELIM MYER, M.A., M.D., M.Ch., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bombay Jail Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1869; civil surgn. and supt. of jail, Bijapur, Nov., 1870; from Feb., 1872, served under the mil. dept. until June, 1874, when he was apptd. ofig. civil surgn. and supt. of jail, Shikarpur; supt., Yeravda central jail, May, 1878; in addn. supt., Poona city jail, Dec., 1878.

SALE, EDWARD LITTLE, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Bury St. Edmunds Sch., and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 22nd Dec., 1894, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

SALE, S. G., B.L.—Entered the service as ofig. judge, high court, Calcutta, March, 1893; confd., Jan., 1896.

SALIG RAM, Rao Bahadur, late Postal Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Served in the dept. from March, 1847; inspr., post offices, Agra divn., July, 1876; supt., Agra divn., April, 1881; postmr.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, June, 1884; retd., 1887.

SALISBURY (MARQUESS OF), RIGHT HON. ROBERT ARTHUR TALBOT GASCOIGNE CECIL, K.G., P.C., D.C.L., LL.D., M.A.—Born in 1830; educ. at Eton and Christ Church, Oxford, where he graduated, and was elected a fellow of All Souls' Coll. in 1853; represented Stamford in the house of commons from 1853 to 1868, when he succeeded to the upper house; sec. of state for India, July, 1866, to March, 1867; chancellor of the univ. of Oxford, Nov., 1869; in 1871-72 acted with Lord Cairns in conducting the investigation into the affairs of the London, Chatham, and Dover railway company; sec. of state for India, second time, Feb., 1874; was sent as special ambassador to the Sublime Porte in 1876, and acted with Sir Henry Elliot as joint plenipotentiaries of Great Britain at the conference of Constantinople, Dec., 1876; was apptd. sec. of state for foreign affairs on the resignation of Lord Derby, April, 1878, and afterwards accompanied the Earl of Beaconsfield to Berlin, as representative of Great Britain at the congress held there; K.G., July, 1878; prime minister and sec. of state for foreign affairs, June, 1885, to Feb., 1886; prime minister and first lord of the treasury, Aug., 1886; prime minister and sec. of state for foreign affairs, Jan., 1887, to Aug., 1892; and again from July, 1895; lord warden of the cinque ports, Oct., 1895; has served on the royal commiss. on historical manuscripts, 1882, on the housing of the working classes, 1884, and for the Indian and Colonial exhibn., 1886; is hon. col., Bedfordshire regt., and an elder brother of the Trinity House.

SALMON, ALEXANDER MCDONALD, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Madras Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd. 24th Sept., 1869, and posted to Bengal; employed in Bombay on famine relief works, 1877; district engr., Patna, 1889-95; exec. engr., Aug., 1893.

SALMON, WILLIAM ARTHUR, COL., I.S.C., late Pol. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 11th May, 1859; served from March, 1867, in the pol. dept.; asst. pol. agent in Kathiawar, June, 1870; from Feb., 1879, served as asst. pol. agent, Janjira; joint administrator of Rajpipla, July, 1884; and of Sangli, Feb., 1885; asst. to the govrn.'s agent, Baroda, in charge of the Okhamandal district, and commandant Waghir corps, Nov., 1887; pol. agent, Mahi Kantha, Jan., 1892; pol. supt., Palanpur, July, 1893; acting pol. agent, Kolhapur, June, 1894; reverted to mil. dept., Aug., 1895.

SAMMAN, HERBERT FREDERICK, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Edward VI.'s Sch., Stratford-on-Avon, and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 4th Nov., 1892, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transfd. to Assam as asst. commr., April, 1894.

SAMPSON, ARTHUR BISKS, B.A., late India Public Works.—Asst. sec., public works dept., govt. of India, May, 1859; under sec., Sept., 1869; retd., May, 1887.

SAMUELLS, CHARLES ARCHIBALD, B.L., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., Blackheath Proprietary Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 25th Nov., 1869, and served in Bengal as asst. mag., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; on famine duty at Champaran, March, 1874; ofig. port commr., Calcutta, April, 1886; mag. and collr., Oct., 1886; ofig. commr. of excise, Bengal, April to Aug., 1892; retd., March, 1895.

SAMUELLS, WILLIAM LEYCESTER, COL., I.S.C.—First commn., 20th Nov., 1857; served from 18th Dec., 1864, in the non-regulation commn., Bengal, as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; special boundary commr. (Rewa and Chota Nagpur), 1868-71; ofig. cantonmt. mag. and small cause court judge, Barrakpur, April, 1873; ofig. pol. agent, Hill Tipperah, April, 1875; retd., April, 1890.

SANDELL, JOSEPH WILLIAM HENRY, Indian Postal Dept.—Joined the service, 1st March, 1862; chief asst. to dep. acctnt.-gen., Assam, Dec., 1878; chief supt., fin. dept., Jan., 1881; transfd. to office of acctnt.-gen., Bombay, Sept., 1881; comptr., Calcutta post office, Jan., 1890.

SANDEMAN, JOHN EDWARD, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Survey of India Dept.—Joined at Adiscombe, 1860; ensign, Bengal infantry, 7th
June, 1861; studied at Rurki Coll., and obtained certificate qualifying for engr. public works dept., Sept., 1864; apptd. to the survey dept., Oct., 1864; served with the Hazara expdn., 1868 (medal); dep. supt., Jan., 1879; supt. (new scale), Aug., 1892; dir. of Bengals surveys, April, 1892; promoted to dep. surveyor-gen. (in charge, rev. surveys), in addn., March, 1895.

SANDERS, EDWIN, Surgn.-Major, late Bengal Med. Dept.—Served under the govt. of Bengal from 1st Nov., 1869, to May, 1871; offic. civil surgn., Chittagong, March, 1881; civil surgn., Murshidabad, June, 1889; retld., Jan., 1891.

SANDERS, JAMES, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Coll. Sch. and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1879, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. commr.; offic. city mag., and wasika officer, Lucknow, 1886, 1888 and 1889; joint mag., March, 1888; dep. commr., April, 1894; dist. and sess. judge, Feb., 1896.

SANDERS, RICHARD CARELESS, M.D., F.R.C.S., Brigade-Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 1866; in mil. employ till July, 1874, from which date he served as surgn. and civil surgn. at various stations in the N.W. Prov.; ophthalmic surgn. and prof., med. coll., Calcutta, Aug., 1886.

SANDHURST (BARON), RIGHT HON. WILLIAM MANSFIELD, G.C.I.E.—Born, 1855; educ. at Rugby; sub-lieut., Coldstream guards, 1875; succeeded his father (who had been chief of the staff during the Indian Mutiny, commander-in-chief, Bombay, 1860-65, commander-in-chief in India, 1865-70, and commander-in-chief, Ireland, 1870-75) in the title in 1876; resigned his commn., 1879; acted as a lord in waiting to H.M. the Queen from Sept., 1880, to June, 1885; under sec. of state for war, Feb.-Aug., 1886, and again from Aug., 1892; succeeded Lord Harris as gov. of Bombay, 18th Feb., 1895.

SANDIFORD, CHARLES THOMAS, M.I.C.E., M.I.M.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the dept. from Sind, Punjab, and Delhi railway as locomotive supt., N.W. state railway, Jan., 1886.

SANFORD, GEORGE EDWARD LANGLEHAM SOMERSET, C.B., C.S.I., Major-Gen., R.E., late India Mil. Works Dept.—Lieut., R.E., Oct., 1856; served in the China war, 1858 (medal and clasp); served in the public works dept. (mil. works), April, 1872, to Jan., 1878, as asst. and exec. engr., and in the Jowaki campaign, 1878 (medal and clasp); ass't. quartermaster-gen., Bengal, 1878-80; during this period served in the Afghan campaign (medal and clasp); dep. quartermaster-gen., Bengal, 1880-85; commanded royal engrs. in Burmese expdn., 1885-86; C.B., Nov., 1886; inspr.-gen. of mil. works, March, 1886; chief engr., March, 1887; C.S.I., Jan., 1890; dir.-gen., mil. works, Sept., 1890; chief engr., mil. works, Bombay, April, 1893; commanding at Meerut, Sept., 1893.

SANKEY, Sir RICHARD HIERAM, K.C.B., Lieut.-Gen., late R.E.—Ensign, 11th Dec., 1846; arrived, Nov., 1848; offic. suptg. engr., Nagpur subsidiary force, 1850-53; supt. of the east coast canal, 1850-57; addl. under sec., govt. of India, public works dept., March, 1857; on outbreak of Mutiny proceeded with special appt. to Allahabad, acting for a time as suptg. engr. and consulting engr. for railways, N.W. Prov. acted as field engr. at Cawnpore, and was subsequently senr. engr. officer with the Gurkha force under Jung Bahadur; exec. engr. and supt. of convicts, Maulmain, Jan.-Nov., 1859, and subsequently garrison engr., Fort William; asst. to chief engr., Mysore, June, 1861; chief engr., Mysore, 1866-77; services placed at disposal of govt. of Victoria for reporting on the waterworks of the colony, 1871; dep. sec. to govt. of India, Sept., 1877; commanding engr. of the S. Afghanistan expedy. force under Lieut.-Gen. Stewart, C.B., 1878-79; sec. to govt. of Madras, public works dept., April, 1879; fellow of Madras univ., March, 1881; resigned the public works dept. in 1883; retd. from the army, Jan., 1884; chairman, board of works, Dublin.

SAPTE, BRAND, C.B., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Winchester; apptd. from Haileybury, 1843; served in the rev. and jud. depts. in Bengal, the Punjab, and N.W. Prov.; mag. and collr., 1857; C.B. in 1859; from 1864 to 1865 served as judge of Ghazipur, and subsequently of Farakhabad; retd., 1871.

SARGEAUNT, CHARLES CHESTER, Col., I.S.C., late Rev. Survey Dept., Madras.—Ensign, 31st May, 1856; arrived, 25th Sept., 1856; served in the dept. from Feb., 1867; dep. supt., Dec., 1881; on special duty to revise and republish the survey manual, April, 1886; supt. of rev. survey, June, 1886; retd., July, 1887.

SARGEAUNT, RICHARD ARTHUR, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Dec., 1861; joined the Bombay public works dept., May, 1864; ass't. consulting engr. for railways, Nov., 1864; served in the Abyssinian expdn. of 1868 (medal); examt. of railway accts., Bombay, April, 1872; dep. consulting engr. for guaranteed railways, Calcutta, May, 1877; sec. to railway conference, 1879; rev. asst., railway branch, public works secretariat, govt. of India, 1880; manager, N. Bengal state railway, July, 1882; offic. under sec. to govt. of India, railway branch, Feb., 1883; offic. manager, Punjab N. state railway, June, 1884; offic. manager of E. Bengal railway, June, 1887; offic. consulting engr. for railways, and joint sec., railway dept., Bombay, May, 1888; manager, Oudh and Rohilkhand railway, Jan., 1889; dir.-gen. of railways, and dep. sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., May, 1892; retd., Aug., 1895.

SARGENT, Sir CHARLES, Kt., M.A., B.L., late Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; called to the bar (Lincoln's Inn), 1843; apptd. judge of the high court, Bombay, 29th April, 1866; chief justice, Aug., 1882; resigned, April, 1895.

SATYENDRANATH TAGORE, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Presidency Coll., and Calcutta Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 12th Dec., 1864, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., asst. judge, and judge and sessions judge; judge, Sholapur-Bijapur, Aug., 1883; ditto Satara, April, 1896.

SAUNDERS, ARTHUR LESLIE, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at the Oratory Sch., Edgbaston, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1882, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; transfd. to the Central Prov., Oct., 1885; asst. commr., Oct., 1888; judge, small cause court, March, 1892; commr. of excise,
April, 1892; dep. commr., Feb., 1893; also second sec. to chief commr., Feb., 1894; acting chief sec., Nov., 1894, and May, 1895.

SAUNDERS, LESLIE HARRY, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 30th Nov., 1889, and served in Burma as asst. commr., and offig. under sec.; offig. supt., N. Shan states, Sept., 1893, to May, 1894.

SAVAGE, HENRY, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Liverpool Inst.; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 23rd Oct., 1874, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Sept., 1885; mag. and collr., Jan., 1891.

SAVILLE, GEORGE ABREO, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1877, and posted to state railways as asst. engr.; lent to B.B. and C.I. Rly., Jan., 1885; exec. engr., Sept., 1891.

SCANNELL, HENRY, Police Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at King's Coll., London; joined the service, 28th May, 1868, as acting asst. supt. of police; dep. conservator of forests, Feb., 1871; asst. supt. of police, Feb., 1872; supt., Jan., 1874; supt. of police, Great Indian Peninsula railway, Dec., 1890; inspr.-gen. May, 1896.

SCHARLIEB, WILLIAM MASON, B.L., late Jud. Dept., Madras.—Served from 25th March, 1847, in subord. posts, and was apptd. first unconv. asst. to the board of rev., June, 1862; resigned the services to practise at the bar, Oct., 1867; acted as administrator-gen., and as govt. pleader; asst. sec. to govt., jud. and legisl. depts., Dec., 1874; acted as first judge of the court of small causes, Madras, and served from 1885 as presidency mag. for the town of Madras; retd., 1890.

SCHLICH, WILLIAM, C.I.E., Ph.D., late Forest Dept., Govt. of India.—Apptd. asst. conservator of forests, Dec., 1866; conservator, Bengal, Dec., 1872; transf. to the Punjab, 1890; inspr.-gen. of forests, April, 1883; retd., 1888, and was apptd. principal profr. of forestry at Cooper's Hill Coll.; author of 'A Manual of Forestry,' &c.

SCHNEIDER, SIR JOHN WILLIAM, K.C.B., Gen.—Educ. at Christ's Hosp., and afterwards at Addiscombe; ensign, 2nd native infantry, Bombay, 20th Feb., 1841; served in the S. Mah-ratta campaign, 1845; second in command and commandant of the Kolhapur infantry, and also asst. pol. supt., 1852-59; in 1857-58, took part in the suppression of the Mutiny at Kolhapur (medal); served in the Abyssinian expdn. of 1867-68 (medal, and C.B.); judge advocate-gen., Bombay army, 1863-72; pol. rest. at Aden, 1872-77; commanded N. divn., Bombay army, 1877-81; K.C.B., May, 1889.

SCOBIE, MACKAY JOHN, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1876, and posted to Haidarabad as assist. engr.; exec. engr., Aug., 1886.

SCOBLE, SIR ANDREW RICHARD, K.C.S.I., Q.C., M.P.—Called to the bar at Lincoln's Inn, Jan., 1856; held the offices of clerk of the crown and commr. for taking acts, and for local investigations, under the high court, Bombay, 1863-66; advocate of the high court, 1866-76, and successively held the offices of sheriff, 1866-67, legal remembrancer, 1869-72, and advocate-gen., 1872-77; conducted the prosecution of the Gaek-war of Baroda, 1875; was also member of the legisl. council of Bombay, 1870-76; Q.C., 1876; legal member of the govr.-gen.'s council, 1836-91; C.S.I., Jan., 1889; K.C.S.I., May, 1890; M.P. for Central Hackney from 1892; member of royal commn. on Indian expenditure, May, 1895.

SCONCE, GIDEON COLOUGHOUN, B.L., late Jud. Dept., Bengal.—Offig. mag., Calcutta, 12th Nov., 1866; clerk of the Calcutta court of small causes, Dec., 1870; judge of the court, Jan., 1874; chief judge, Oct., 1889; retd., Oct., 1893.

SCONCE, JAMES, Col., I.S.C., late Survey Dept.—Joined at Addiscombe, Feb., 1852; lieut., Bengal artillery, Dec., 1853; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasps); served from Oct., 1859, as asst. and rev. surveyor in Bundelkhand, Central Prov., and Bengal; dep. surveyor-gen. (rev. survey branch), Jan., 1879; offd. as surveyor-gen. of India; reverted to mil. duty, April, 1891.

SCOTLAND, SIR COLLEY H., Kt.—Educ. at the Royal Sch., Raphoe; entered as a student at the Middle Temple in 1840, and was called to the bar in 1843; practised on the common law side of Westminster Hall, and on the Oxford circuit; apptd. chief justice of the supreme court, Madras, 1861, and of the high court of judicature on its estabt. in 1862; resigned, 1871; vice-chancellor of the Madras univ., 1861-71; contributed to the Law Journal reports of cases in the court of Queen's bench, 1848-57, and is joint author of a work 'On the Crown Office Practice of the Court of Queen's Bench.'

SCOTT, ARTHUR GUILLUM, Dep. Accnt.-Gen., India Office.—Educ. at the Royal Agric. Coll., Cirencester, and at private schs.; East India house writer, old estabt., 7th Nov., 1857; junr. clerk, accnt.-gen.'s dept., India office, Aug., 1860; senr. clerk, Jan., 1872; assessor of income-tax, 1892; dep. accnt.-gen., June, 1893.

SCOTT, BUCHANAN, C.I.E., Major, R.E., Bombay Mint.—Joined the service, 2nd Aug., 1871; from Oct., 1874, served as asst. engr. in the Punjab; on field service in the Afghan war, 1878-79 (medal); exec. engr., May, 1883; supt. of works and engr.-in-chief, Zhob valley survey, Aug., 1883; acted as mint master, Calcutta, 1891; mint master, Bombay, March, 1895.

SCOTT, EDWIN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch. and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 15th Jan., 1887, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., July, 1893.

SCOTT, GEORGE BATTY, Survey of India Dept.—Joined the service, 1st May, 1863; asst. supt., survey dept., Nov., 1883; dep. supt., April, 1890; supt. of land record surveys, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Dec., 1894; served in the Black Mountain expdn., Jowaki-Afriki expedn., Afghan war, Zhob valley expdn., &c.; author of a Pushto vocabulary, 'Pathans of the N.W. Frontier,' reports on various parts of Afghanistan, &c.

SCOTT, JAMES GEORGE, C.I.E., Pol. Dept., Burma.—Apptd. asst. commr., 9th April, 1886; on duty in the Shan states, Dec., 1886; asst. supt., Shan states, Dec., 1888; on duty with Anglo-Siamese boundary commn., 1889-90; supt., N. Shan states, July, 1892; chargé d'affaires at Bangkok, Nov., 1893; on depn. with Anglo-French buffer state commn., Oct., 1894; author of 'The Burman, His Life and Notions,' 'France and Tong-king,' 'Burma as it was, as it is, and as it will be,' 'Burma, the Eastern Country, and the Race of the Bramahs,' and 'The Hill Slopes of Tong-king.'

SCOTT, SIR JOHN, K.C.M.G., M.A., B.L., late
Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Judge of the high court, Bombay, 13th Nov., 1832; services lent to the Egyptian govt. from April, 1890; resigned, April, 1891; K.C.M.G., Feb., 1894.

SCOTT, MATHEW HENRY, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 16th Dec., 1863, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag. and asst. judge and sessions judge; judge, Khandesh, Feb., 1881; judge and sessions judge, Ahmadnagar, May, 1882; district judge, Safara, April, 1892; retd., May, 1893.

SCOTT, Ross, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Omagh Acad., the Royal Acad. Instn. and Seminary, Belfast, and Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 26th Oct., 1873, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Nov., 1886; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1890.

SCOTT, THOMAS AUGUSTUS, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., June, 1857; arrived, 29th June, 1857; from Jan., 1862, served in the police dept., Central Prov., and was apptd. district supt., March, 1864; from June, 1865, served as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Dec., 1882; offd. as commr., 1890-91; reverted to mil. dept., Aug., 1894.

SCOTT-MONCRIEFF, SIR COLIN CAMPBELL, K.C.M.G., C.S.I., Col., R.E., retd.—Joined the service as 2nd lieut., Bengal engrs., 13th June, 1856; arrived, 10th June, 1858; served with the Bengal sappers and miners until Feb., 1859, through the campaign in Oudh (medal); joined public works dept., Feb., 1859, and served in the N.W. Prov. in the irrig. branch; principal, Thomason civil engrg. coll., Sept., 1861; asst. to chief engrg., irrig. branch, April, 1869; from Nov., 1869, served on the Ganges canal as exec. and suptg. engr.; in 1877 was sent on depn. to Mysore to serve as chief engr. and famine commr.; C.S.I., May, 1878; again joined the irrig. dept. of the N.W. Prov., Feb., 1879; offd. as sec. to the chief commr. of British Burma, May, 1881; retd., Jan., 1883; K.C.M.G., 1887; under sec., public works ministry, Egypt, to 1892, when he was apptd. under sec. for Scotland.

SCROOPE, HENRY WILLIAM PAUL, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Stonyhurst Coll., London Univ., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 24th Dec., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

SCULLY, JOHN, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Indian Med. Dept.—Joined the dept., 1872; served as med. officer, Kashgarh pol. agency, 1874-76; residency surgn., Nipal, 1876-78; med. officer, Gilgit, 1878-80; acting dep. assay master, Calcutta mint, 1882-83; dep. assay master of the Bombay mint, May, 1884; assay master of the Calcutta mint, May, 1886.

SEABROOKE, JAMES HERBERT, B.A., Mil. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at King's Coll., London (Jelf medallist and associate, 1871), and Queen's Coll., Oxford (scholar, 1871-74); junr. clerk, finl. dept., 13th Jan., 1876; mil. dept., 1877; senr. clerk, June, 1887.

SEALY, CHARLES WILLIAM HENRY, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Bombay Pol. Dept.—First commn., 17th July, 1866; cantonmt. mag., Aden, May, 1875; 2nd asst. to rest., Oct., 1885; asst. pol. agent, S. Mahratta country, May, 1889; 2nd asst. to pol. agent, Kathiawar, Sept., 1889; 1st asst. to rest., Aden, and pol. agent for the Somali coast, Aug., 1893; acting pol. rest., Aden, May-July, 1894; pol. agent, Mahi Kantha, March, 1895; joint compiler of an account of the Arab tribes in the vicinity of Aden, and has transl. Van Den Berg's work on Hadhramuth, and part of Carsten Niebuhr's description of Arabia.

SEATON, WILLIAM JOHN, Col., I.S.C., late Forest Dept., Burma.—Ensign, Madras infantry, Sept., 1855; asst. supt. in the forest dept., Dec., 1860; dep. conservator, 1st class, April, 1865; conservator, Nov., 1867; reverted to mil. duty, 1892.

SECCOMBE, HENRY LAWRENCE, Finl. Dept., India Office.—East India house writer, old establ., 14th May, 1856; junr. clerk, finl. dept., Dec., 1866; senr. clerk, Dec., 1882.

SECCOMBE, SIR THOMAS LAWRENCE, G.C.I.E., K.C.S.I., C.B.—Entered the home service of the East India Co. in Jan., 1829, as a clerk in the dept. of auditor of India accts.; on the transfer of the govt. of India to the Crown in 1853 was apptd. asst. finl. sec.; finl. sec., 1859; dir. of mil. funds, and chairman of consulting committee, 1866; chairman of a joint India office and war office committee for adjusting the charges for services of H.M.'s regts. on the India establ., 1869; and was a member of a similar committee in 1874 and 1879; C.B., Dec., 1869; acctnt.-gen., in addn. to other duties, Feb., 1872; asst. under sec. of state for India, July, 1872; K.C.S.I., June, 1877; apptd. one of three commrs. to represent H.M.'s govt. at the international monetary conference at Paris, 1878; continued asst. under sec. of state until 1881, but resigned his other offices on 31st Jan., 1879; member of a joint India office and admiralty committee on finl. questions connected with the India troop service, 1879 to 1892, when he finally retd. from the service; G.C.I.E., Aug., 1892.

SEDDON, CHARLES NORMAN, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Liverpool Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 25th Nov., 1891, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

SEDGEFIELD, ARTHUR ROBERT WYATT, M.B., Surgn.-Major, Bengal Opium Dept.—In mil. employ from 14th April, 1881; apptd. supt., Chenawau jail, Sept., 1887; civil surgn., Murree, March, 1891; supt., Benares opium agency, Oct., 1891.

SELBY, FRANCIS GUY, M.A., Educl. Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at Wadham Coll., Oxford; arrived, 7th Feb., 1877, and served from that date as profr. of logic and moral philosophy in the Deccan coll., Poona; principal, Deccan coll., Dec., 1890.

SELBY, HENRY OLIPHANT, Lieut.-Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 13th Jan., 1869; arrived, 26th Dec., 1871; on famine duty in 1874; served in Afghanistan (medal), 1879-81, the latter part of the time as supt., signalling lines of communications; dep. consulting engr. for railways, Bombay, Dec., 1883; under sec. to govt. of Bombay in the railway branch, March, 1892; dep. consulting engr., Nov., 1892; also under sec. (railway), Jan., 1894; sec. and consulting engr., Oct., 1894; rank of suptg. engr., March, 1895.

SELLS, ARTHUR, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Merton Coll., Ox-
ford; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 23th Nov., 1860; from Nov., 1861, served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Muzaffarnagar, Aug., 1878, and civil and sessions judge, Cawnpore, April, 1882; district and sessions judge, Meerut, Oct., 1886; retd., May, 1890.

SEN, BIRENDRA CHANDRA, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Dacca Coll., Presidency Coll., and the Univ., Calcutta, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 17th Nov., 1893, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and colir.

SETON-KARR, WALTER SCOTT, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Rugby; apptd. from Haileybury in 1842; arrived, 12th Dec., 1842, and served in Bengal as asst. and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. of Jessore, 1847; under sec., govt. of Bengal, 1847-53; collr. of Tirhut, 1857; civil and sessions judge, Jessore, 1858-60; prest.of indigo commun., 1860; sec. to govt. of Bengal, 1860-61; legis. council of India, 1861; commr. of rev. and circuit, Chittagong, and member of provl. legis. council, 1862; judge, high court, Calcutta, 1862-68; foreign sec., govt. of India, 1868; retd., 1870; vice-chancellor of the univ. of Calcutta in 1868 and 1869.

SEWELL, EBENEZER JAMES, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 1st Nov., 1872, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine duty, 1877-78; senr. asst., Ganjam, June, 1882; sub-collr. and joint mag., Dec., 1887; dis- strict and sessions judge, Oct., 1889; collr. and mag., Feb., 1890; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1891.

SEWELL, HENRY, M.A., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Radley, and Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1861; served in Madras as asst. mag. and collr., acting under sec., and sub-collr.; collr. and mag., Trichinopoly, May, 1875; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1886; collr. and mag., S. Arcot, Nov., 1887; retd., Jan., 1891.

SEWELL, ROBERT, late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at St. Peter's Coll., Radley; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 10th Dec., 1868, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine duty, Oct., 1877, and on special duty in connection with the archaeological survey of the Madras presidency, Jan., 1881, and again, Jan., 1883; sub-collr. and joint mag., Tinnevelly, Sept., 1884; fellow of Madras univ., 1887; from Sept., 1888, served as district and sessions judge, and collr. and mag.; retd., Dec., 1894; author of 'A Report on the Amaravati Tope, and Excavations on its Site,' 'Chronological Tables for S. India from the 6th Century, A.D.,' 'A Sketch of the Dynasties of S. India,' vols. I. and II. of the 'Archaeological Survey Series of S. India,' 'Early Buddhist Symbolism,' &c.

SHADBOLT, ERNEST IFILL, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., May, 1883; services lent to Bhaunagar and Gondal states, 1887-91; engr.-in-chief, Bevada-Madras railway survey, Feb., 1894; employed in same capacity on Madura-Pamban and Tinnevelly-Quilon railway surveys, Dec., 1894.

SHAKESPEAR, ALEXANDER MURISON WAKE, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Harrow; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 17th Nov., 1873, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Aug., 1887; private sec. to lieut.-govr., March, 1888; asst. commr., Jan., 1890; dep. commr., Feb., 1894; mag. and collr., Nov., 1895; dist. and sess. judge April, 1896.

SHAMS-UD-DIN ALI KHAN, Saiyad, Khan Bahadur, Berar Administration.—Joined the service, 1st March, 1869; asst. commr., Jan., 1882; special asst. commr., Jan., 1893; dep. commr., May, 1894.

SHANKER MADHO CHITNAVIS, B.A., Statutory C.S. (Central Prov.).—Apptd. probr. for the civil service under the statutory rules, July, 1885; confd. as asst. commr., 5th Oct., 1887.

SHARP, FREDERICK, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to Mysore; on famine duty, 1877; transfd. to Coorg, April, 1881; exec. engr., May, 1883; transfd. to Central Prov., Dec., 1886; and to Burma, March, 1887.

SHARP, FREDERICK WILLIAM, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Milton Coll., Ullesthorpe; clerk, 2nd class, India store depot, March, 1885.

SHARP, HENRY GRANVILLE, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Horncastle Gr. Sch., Marlborough Coll., and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 27th Jan., 1868; served in the rev. and jud. depts. in Bengal; on famine duty at Madras, 1877; joint mag. and dep. collr., Dec., 1878; mag. and collr., Oct., 1884; retd., Jan., 1894.

SHARPE, CHARLES FERGUSON, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Arrived, as ensign, 1st Feb., 1851, and served under the mil. dept. till Sept., 1858, when he was apptd. to the Oudh mil. police (medal for Mutiny services); from Feb., 1859, served as district supt. in the police dept. in Oudh; reverted to mil. duty, March, 1891.

SHARPE, FREDERIC ROBERT, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Christ's Hosp.; writer, India office, 7th Aug., 1877; clerk, 2nd class, Sept., 1878.

SHARPE, HENRY GRAFTON, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Dublin High Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 12th Nov., 1890, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

SHARPIN, VEN. FREDERICK LLOYD, M.A., late Eccles. Dept., Bombay.—Educ. at Exeter Coll., Oxford; joined the service, Aug., 1865; arrived, 13th Oct., 1865; served as chaplain at various stations in Bombay and Sind; senr. chaplain, Oct., 1875; senr. presidency chaplain, June, 1880; archdeacon and commissary, June, 1886, also chaplain of Satara; retd., Oct., 1888.

SHAW, ARTHUR TREVOR AMBROSE, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 13th Dec., 1883, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transfd. to Burma as asst. commr., Feb., 1886; dep. commr., Oct., 1890.

SHAW, GEORGE WATSON, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Hertford Gr. Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 20th Dec., 1879, and served in British Burma as asst. commr.; dep. commr., May, 1888.

SHAW-MACKENZIE, CHARLES FORBES HUDSON, B.L., late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 21st Aug., 1850, and
served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and acting collr. and mag. up to Feb., 1864; and subsequently as judge and sessions judge in various districts; retd., Sept., 1885.

SHAW-STEWART, JOHN HERON MAXWELL, Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—First commn. as lieut., Madras engrs., June, 1851; arrived, 31st Dec., 1853; served in the dept. from Jan., 1854, as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; served in the China campaign, 1860 (medal and two clasps); dep. sec. to govt., public works dept., Dec., 1863; under sec., Oct., 1866; comptr., public works acct., Madras, May, 1867; consulting engr. for railways, Madras, Oct., 1867; chief engr., Oct., 1870; joint sec. to govt., railway branch, Feb., 1877; sec. to govt., public works dept., Sept., 1883; member of legisl. council, Madras, Sept., 1883; retd., Sept., 1886.

SHEEPSHANKS, RICHARD, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Winchester, and at St. John's Coll., Cambridge, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 27th Dec., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

SHEPHERD, HORATIO HALE, M.A., B.L., Madras Jud. Dept.—Profr. of law at Presidency Coll., Madras, 1st Oct., 1873; fellow of Madras univ., 1881; apptd. govt. pleader, June, 1881; member of Madras legisl. council, March, 1885; advocate-gen. of Madras and offg. judge of high court, Jan., 1888; confd. as judge of high court, July, 1889.

SHEPHERD, CHARLES EDWARD, Col., I.S.C., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 26th Sept., 1864, and posted to Central Prov.; exec. engr., Sept., 1868; transf. to mil. works, Dec., 1872; and to state railways, Nov., 1874; dep. consulting engr. for railways, Lucknow, May, 1891.

SHEPHERD, GEORGE EDWARD, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 4th Sept., 1893.

SHEPHERD, WALTER CURZON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Sedbergh Sch. and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 19th Nov., 1894, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

SHEPPARD, GEORGE FREDERICK, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1854, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; collr. of salt rev., Bombay, Dec., 1871; collr. and mag., Kaira, Feb., 1873; senr. collr. and mag. and pol. agent, Kaira, Nov., 1875; commr., Oct., 1882; retd., May, 1889.

SHEPPARD, WILLIAM DIDSBURY, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Hereford Cathedral Sch. and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 13th Dec., 1886, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd asst. and forest settl. officer, Nov., 1893.

SHERER, JOHN WALTER, C.S.I., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1846; served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. and joint mag., and asst. sec. to govt.; on special duty to report on reh efflorescence, W. Jumna canal, 1856-57; mag. and collr. of Cawnpore, 1857; civil officer with Gen. Havelock's column in 1857, in the advance on Cawnpore; commr. to enquire into claims against ex-king of Oudh, 1864; judge of Allahabad, 1871, and afterwards of Azimgarh and Mirzapur; retd., 1877.

SHERIDAN, PHILIP, Post Office Dept., Govt. of India.—Served in the postal dept., Punjab, from March, 1861; chief supt., travelling post office, Allahabad, Dec., 1873; chief inspr. of post offices, Assam, Dec., 1873; asst. dir.-gen. of the post office of India, July, 1880; inspr. of railway and mail service, Nov., 1885; dep. dir.-gen. of the post-office of India, April, 1888; postmtr.-gen., Punjab, July, 1891.

SHERLOCK-HUBBARD, ISAAC SHERLOCK, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. compiler of telegraph acct., 1st March, 1872; asst. comptr., April, 1872; asst. examr. of telegraph acct., June, 1877; dep. examr., Jan., 1880; examr., Aug., 1885.

SHERMAN, WILLIAM HANBURY PETTINGALL, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 31st July, 1866, and employed in the Central Prov.; transfd. to state railways, April, 1874; exec. engr., Jan., 1877; services lent to S. Indian railway co., Feb., 1889, and to Gwalior durbar for Bhopal-Ujjain line, Feb., 1891; suptg. engr., Nov., 1892.

SHERRING, CHARLES ATMORR, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Westminster and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 11th Nov., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. commr.

SHEWAN, ALEXANDER, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Gymnasium, Aberdeen, and Univ. of Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 23rd Oct., 1873, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag. and asst. pol. agent; on famine duty in 1876 and 1877; from Jan., 1885, served as asst. judge and sessions judge, and acting under sec. to govt.; administrator of Rajpipla state, Nov., 1887; judge and sessions judge, July, 1894.

SHIPLEY, REGINALD HEBER, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Winchester and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 20th Dec., 1883, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; special asst., July, 1890; sub. collr. and joint mag., Sept., 1895.

SHIRRES, LESLIE PITTEDRIGH, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Aberdeen and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 18th Dec., 1882, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec. to govt., Jan., 1888; offd. as under sec. to the govt. of India, dept. of fin. and commerce, in Nov., 1887, and again from April, 1888; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1890; mag. and collr., Feb., 1896; author of 'An Analysis of the Ideas of Economics.'

SHOPLAND, EDWIN REW, Comdr. R.I.M.—Joined the service 13th Feb., 1867; comdr., 1st April, 1887; port officer, Karachi, Sept., 1895.

SHORTREDE, ROBERT, India Audit Office.—Temporary clerk, 1st Feb., 1864; junr. asst., Sept., 1866; senr. examr., July, 1873; designation changed to senr. clerk, Oct., 1892.

SHIRRAM BHIKAJI JATAR, C.I.E., B.A., Rao Bahadur, late Haidarabad Administration.—Served in the Bombay educn. dept. from Jan., 1859, and from July, 1867, in Berar as dep. educ. inspr. and educ. inspr.; dir. of public instrn., Haidarabad assigned districts, Aug., 1884; retd., Sept., 1894; C.I.E., May, 1894.
SHURLOCK, Henry James, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, India store depot, 5th Aug., 1886.

SHUTTLEWORTH, Allen Thornton, Forest Dept., Bombay.—Apptd. to the Indian marine, Nov., 1855; served in the Persian war (medal), and in the operations against the Waghirs in Okhamandal; from Nov., 1863, served in the dept. as asst. and dep. conservator, and was apptd. conservator of forests and supt. of botanical gardens, Sept., 1869; while stationed at Alibag was instrumental in saving upwards of a hundred lives from different wrecks (Albert medal, medals of the Royal Humane Society, &c.).

SIBOLD, Ernest Alfred, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 23rd Dec., 1864, and employed on irrig. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Sept., 1872; in 1874 served in Bengal on famine relief works; retd., Feb., 1895.

SIBTHORPE, Charles, Surgn.-Major-Gen., F.R.C.P.I., Madras Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., 1st April, 1870; arrived, 27th Dec., 1870; civil surgn. and supt. of jail, Banda, July, 1874; from May, 1875, to Nov., 1880, served as rest. surgn., gen. hosp., Madras, and profr. in the med. coll.; also served in the Afghan war, 1878-79 (medal), and in the Burma expdn., 1885-86; from Oct., 1882, served as fort surgn., and profr. in the med. coll.; fellow of Madras univ., 1884; surgn., gen. hosp., and profr., med. coll., Jan., 1888; reverted to mil. duty, May, 1890; surgn.-gen., Madras, May, 1894; author of 'Clinical Manual,' and various papers on med. subjects.

SILBERRAD, Charles Arthur, B.A., B.Sc., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Aldenham Gr. Sch., St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge, and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 10th Dec., 1894, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

SILCOCK, Henry Foster, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Drogheda Gr. Sch. and Kingstown Sch., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 24th Nov., 1874, and served in Bombay as asst. mag. and collr., and forest settl. officer; on famine duty in 1876 and 1877; 2nd asst., April, 1887; 1st asst., April, 1890; collr. and mag., Aug., 1893.

SILCOCK, James Greer, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Armagh Royal Sch. and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 16th Nov., 1872, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; district judge, June-Nov., 1888, and March, 1889; dep. commr., April, 1889.

SIM, Henry Alexander, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1876; arrived, 19th Nov., 1878, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; from Jan., 1883, served as dep. conservator of forests, Karnul, and forest settl. officer; special asst., Malabar, Feb., 1886; employed under govt. of India as offg. dep. acctnt.-gen., Aug.-Nov., 1887; dep. acctnt.-gen., Madras, Jan., 1888; acting sec. to the commrs. of land rev., 1888-90, and again, 1890-92; sub-collr. and joint mag., July, 1890; collr. and mag., April, 1895; dist. and sess. judge, March, 1896.

SIMCOX, Arthur Henry Addenbrooke, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Winchester and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 19th Nov., 1894, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

SIME, John, M.A., LL.D., Educn. Dept., Punjab.—Profr., govt. coll., Agra, April, 1869; from Sept., 1870, served in the Punjab as principal, Delhi coll., till 1877, and subsequently as profr., Lahore coll.; inspr. of schs., Aug., 1887; tutor to the Maharaja of Patiala, May, 1885; dir. of public instrn., Punjab, and under sec. to govt. in the educ. dept., Oct., 1890; author of 'Man and his Duty,' and of works on arithmetic and mensuration.

SIMPSON, Sir Benjamin, K.C.I.E., M.D., Surgn.-Gen., late Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the Indian med. dept., 1853; served in civil employ from 1860, as asst. surgn. in Bengal, and was in med. charge of the Bhutan mission in 1863; on special duty on N.E. frontier, 1867-68; civil surgn., Darjiling, April, 1868; from Jan., 1871, served as civil surgn. of Patna with charge of the Mitapur jail; on special duty to the cinchona commn., Feb., 1871; guardian to the Maharaja of Kuch Behar during his visit to Europe, March, 1878; dep. surgn.-gen., S. Afghanistan field force, 1881; principal med. officer, Quetta, 1881; dep. surgn.-gen., March, 1882; sanitary commr., Central Prov., 1882; surgn.-gen. in the Punjab, 1883-84; surgn.-gen., Bengal, 1884-85; sanitary commr. and surgn.-gen. with the govt. of India, March, 1885; K.C.I.E., Feb., 1887; retd., March, 1890.

SIMPSON, Frank Douglas, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Aberdeen Univ. and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 10th Dec., 1894, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr.

SIMPSON, James Thomas, B.C.E., M.I.C.E., M.I.M.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 4th May, 1896, and posted to Bengal; exec. engr., March, 1896; transfd. to Burma, June, 1897.

SIMPSON, John Hope, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at foreign schs. and at St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 30th Oct., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Nov., 1895.

SIMPSON, Stuart John, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd. 1st April, 1872, as asst. engr., and posted to Oudh; exec. engr., Jan., 1885.

SIMSON, D., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at the Gr. Sch. and Marischal Coll., Aberdeen; apptd. from Haileybury in 1845; arrived, 5th April, 1846; served in the N.W. Prov. and in the Punjab as asst. mag. and collr., asst. commr., joint mag., and dep. commr.; commr. in Oudh, June, 1859; extra judge, court of sadar diwani and nizamat adalat, N.W. Prov., April, 1864; judge, chief court, Punjab, April, 1868; retd., 1872.

SINCLAIR, David, M.B., C.M., Surgn.-Col., Jail Dept., Burma.—Joined the Indian med. dept., 1st Oct., 1869; arrived, 14th May, 1870; from 1871, served in British Burma, and was employed in the analysis of potable waters in cantonmts., 1871-72; served subsequently as jail supt., offg. civil surgn., and offg. inspr.-gen. of prisons; inspr.-gen. of jails, sanitary commr., supt. of vaccn., and chief of civil med. dept., Burma, Jan., 1884.

SINCLAIR, William Frederick, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Armagh Royal Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 21st Nov., 1868, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and was on special duty for demarcation of forests; on famine duty, 1877; first asst.
collr. and forest settlt. officer, Feb., 1883; junr. collr. and mag., and pol. agent, Cambay, March, 1890; senr. coll. and mag., and pol. agent, Thana, March, 1892; retd., June, 1892; author of 'Notes on Arboriculture in the Bombay Presidency.'

SITARAM VISHWANATH PATWAR-DHAN, Rao Saheb, B.A., Haidarabad Administration.—Joined the Bombay educ. service, 14th Jan., 1867; principal, Poona training coll., Dec., 1876; educ. inspr., April, 1885; dir. of public instrn., Haidarabad assigned districts, Sept., 1894.

SKINNER, JOHN ALLAN CLEVELAND, Indian C.S.(Central Prov.).—Educ. at Wellington Coll., and Keble Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 28th Oct., 1885, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., and registrar, jud. commr.'s court; dep. commr., Oct., 1894.

SKINNER, RUSSELL MORLAND, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Bengal.—First commn., 7th Dec., 1855; served through the Mutiny; joined the dept. as asst. supt., April, 1862; district supt., Aug., 1863; retd., April, 1888.

SKIPWITH, GREY TOWNSEND, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., 11th June, 1858; joined the dept., Oct., 1860; exec. engr., April, 1865; asst. sec. to chief commr., Central Prov., and asst. to chief engr., Feb., 1870; asst. sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., Feb., 1872; suptg. engr., Feb., 1880; offd. as chief engr. and joint sec. to govt., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, public works dept. irrign., in 1880; retd., Jan., 1893.

SKRINE, FRANCIS HENRY BENNET, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Blackheath Proprietary Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1870, and served as asst. mag. and collr. in Bengal; on famine relief duty, 1874 and 1877-78 (in Madras); supt. of Salem central jail, Jan., 1878; joint mag. and dep. collr., May, 1884; mag. and collr., Aug., 1887; offg. commr., Bhagalpur, 1893-94; collr. of customs, Calcutta, Oct., 1895.

SLACK, FRANCIS ALEXANDER, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Taunton Coll. Sch., Univ. Coll., Oxford, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 8th Dec., 1876, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; settlt. officer of wards' and attached estates in Chota Nagpur; joint mag. and dep. collr., Jan., 1888; offd. as commr., Chittagong, Sept., 1890; mag. and collr., May, 1892; acted as sec. to board of rev., 1893 and 1896.

SLADEN, JOSEPH, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 19th Nov., 1885, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; and in Sind as asst. commr., and Sindhi translr.

SLATER, ALFRED WILLIAM, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 6th Nov., 1872, and employed on irrign. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; on famine relief duty in Madras, 1877-78; transid. to buildings and roads branch, Feb., 1881; exec. engr., Nov., 1881.

SLATER, JOHN SAMUEL, Bengal Educl. Service.—From Sept., 1870, served in the public works dept., Punjab, on the Bari Doab and Indus canals; from Nov., 1875, served in the Bengal educn. dept. as profr., civil engrg. dept., presidency coll., and, from April, 1880, as profr. of the Howrah engrg. coll.; principal, Sibpur engrg. coll., Dec., 1891.

SLATER, JOHN SANDERS, B.A., B.L., Bombay Police Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd Jan., 1888, as prof. Elphinstone Coll.; apptd. acting chief preside.ny mag. and rev. judge, Bombay, Aug., 1891; contd., March, 1895.

SLIGHT, ANDREW MURE, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Royal Coll., Mauritius, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 12th Nov., 1889, and served as asst. collr. and mag.; dist. mag., Mar., 1896.

SLOCOCK, FRANCIS SAMUEL ALFRED, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Marlborough and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 10th Dec., 1891, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

SLOCOMBE, CHARLES, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 22nd July, 1892.

SLY, FRANK GEORGE, Indian C.S.—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 16th Dec., 1887, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; under sec. to govt. of India, dept. of rev. and agric., Aug., 1895.

SMALLMAN, HENRY FRANCIS, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 3rd Nov., 1868, and employed on irrign. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; services lent to Patiala state, 1885-87.
