SMART, ALEXANDER WILLIAM, Lieut.-Col., R.E., Madras Public Works Dept.—joined the service, 15th July, 1868; from March, 1871, served in Madras as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; asst. chief engr. for irrign., and under sec. to govt., 1883-86; acting principal, coll. of engrg., 1891-92, and in 1894; supg. engr., July, 1895.

SMEATON, DONALD MACKENZIE, C.S.I., M.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at the Abbey Park Instn., St. Andrew's, and St. Andrew's Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 22nd Nov., 1867, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; from May, 1870, served in the settlt. dept.; transf. to British Burma as settlt. sec. to chief commr., April, 1879; sec. to chief commr., Burma, in the land rev. and agric. dept., and dir. of agric., May, 1882; dir. of agric. and commerce, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, May, 1886; offg. chief sec. to chief commr., Burma, April, 1887; commr., central divn., Upper Burma, May, 1888; finl. commr., March, 1891; in May, 1892, and in 1896 offd. as chief commr.; C.S.I., Jan., 1895; author of an annotated edition of the N.W. Prov. rev. act of 1873, 'The Currency of India,' 'The Karens' of Burma,' &c.

SMEATON, ROBERT, M.A., LL.D., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Abbey Park Instn., St. Andrew's, and St. Andrew's Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 5th Dec., 1868, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. settlt. officer; first asst. sec. to govt., July, 1876; under sec., May, 1877; junr. sec., Aug., 1877; sec., finl. dept., May, 1884; member of provl. legisl. council, Dec., 1891; retd., April, 1894.

SMITH, ALBERT CHARLES, Lieut.-Col., R.E., late Madras Public Works Dept.—Arrived, 5th Jan., 1864; joined the dept., Sept., 1864, and was apptd. exec. engr., March, 1870; suptg. engr., Sept., 1889; offg. joint sec. in the public works dept., April-July, 1891; retd., Jan., 1894.
SMITH, ALEXANDER, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Marischal Coll., Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1856; arrived, 16th Dec., 1856, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., and mag. and collr.; senr. supt. of survey, Aug., 1872; commr. of Orissa, and supt. of tributary mehals, Cuttack, Oct., 1879; commr., presidency divn., July, 1884; retd., Dec., 1891.

SMITH, CHARLES JOHN, Col., R.E., late Madras Public Works Dept.—First commn., Madras engrs., Dec., 1855; asst. engr., Jan., 1858; exec. engr., Nov., 1865; dep. consulting engr. for railways, 1870-83; under sec. to govt., public works dept., May, 1872; suptg. engr., 1st class, Sept., 1883; consulting engr. and joint sec. to govt., railway branch, 1883; chief engr., Dec., 1885; re-apptd. consulting engr., July, 1889; reverted to mil. duty, July, 1891; retd., May, 1892.

SMITH, FRANCIS WHITMORE, Mil. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Bedford Sch. and Cheltenham Coll.; temporary clerk, 23rd Jan., 1864; junr. clerk, mil. dept., July, 1866; senr. clerk, Jan., 1880; asst. sec., mil. dept., May, 1895.

SMITH, GILBERT LESLIE, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Twyford Sch. and St. Andrew's Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 6th Nov., 1871, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and settlt. officer; on famine duty in Bengal, 1874; district judge, Jan., 1887; divl. judge, Nov., 1889.

SMITH, HENRY ANDREW FELTON, Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service, 7th Aug., 1861; inspr. of police, April, 1866; asst. district supt., July, 1867; district supt., March, 1876.

SMITH, HENRY BABINGTON, M.A., Private Sec. to the Viceroy.—Educ. at Eton and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; examr. in the educn. dept. (England), Dec., 1887; private sec. to the chancellor of the exchequer (Mr. Goschen), May, 1891; clerk in the treasury, Aug., 1892; sec. to the British delegates at the Brussels monetary conference, Nov., 1892; private sec. to the viceroy, Feb., 1894.

SMITH, HENRY SCOTT, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Stratford-on-Avon, and Keble Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 4th Dec., 1886, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; dist. judge, June, 1894.

SMITH, JOHN MACDONALD, Col., I.S.C., late Jail Dept., Madras.—First commn., Madras infantry, 20th April, 1855; served in the China expdn.; asst. to the agent in Vizagapatam, 1861-68; junr. asst. collr., Ganjam, 1870-78; supt. of jails, Rajahmundry, 1880-82; from June, 1882, served as paymaster of pensioners, Bangalore, and also acted as district mag. and prest. of the municipality; chief presidency mag., Madras, Dec., 1885; inspr.-gen. of jails, Mar., 1891; reverted to mil. dept., Aug., 1892; author of a hand-book in the Khond language.

SMITH, JOHN MANNERS, C.I.E., V.C., Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the service, 10th March, 1883; attache in the foreign dept., Nov., 1887; on special duty to Sikkim, in connection with the negotiations with the Chinese Amban, Nov., 1888; asst. to the officer on special duty at Gilgit, June, 1889; asst. to agent, Rajputana, Sept., 1892; on depn. to Kotah state, Oct., 1892; on duty under the orders of the British agent at Gilgit, April, 1893; on depn. with Kabul mission, Aug.-Dec., 1893; C.I.E., Jan., 1894; pol. agent, Bundelkhand, July, 1894; first asst. to agent in Baluchistan, Nov., 1894.

SMITH, JOSEPH, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 25th Sept., 1861; from Sept., 1862, served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Aug., 1881; offg. district and sessions judge, July, 1886; retd., April, 1887.

SMITH, SIR ROBERT MURDOCH, K.C.M.G., Major-Gen., R.E., late Indo-European Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. to the dept., Aug., 1863; dir. of the Persian section from June, 1865; dir.-in-chief, March, 1887; retd., Feb., 1888.

SMITH, SAMUEL GEORGE, Accntn.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Junn. clerk, 6th Jan., 1883.

SMITH, THOMAS, B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., asst. commr., and dep. commr.; apptd. district and sessions judge, Tipperah, Dec., 1877, and served subsequently in the jud. dept.; retd., Jan., 1888.

SMITH, THOMAS WILLIAM, Store Dept., India Office.—Apptd. 2nd class clerk, India store depot, 23rd May, 1888.

SMITH, TURTON, Police Dept., Punjab.—From 26th March, 1863, served in the dept. as asst. supt. and district supt.; between Dec., 1871, and Sept., 1878, also served in the postal dept. as offg. asst. dir.-gen. of post offices, and as offg. postmr.-gen. at Bombay, Aug., 1876, and at Madras, May, 1878; dep. inspr.-gen. of police, Aug., 1892; acted as inspr.-gen. in 1893-94.

SMITH, VINCENT ARTHUR, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 2nd Nov., 1871, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; from Nov., 1874, served in the settlt. dept.; on special duty in the Allahabad district, Nov., 1880; served subsequently as asst. mag. and joint mag., and was also settlt. officer of Basti, 1883-84; mag. and collr., June, 1889; district and sessions judge, March, 1895; author of 'The Settlement Officer's Manual,' 'Coinage of the Early Gupta Dynasty,' 'Græco-Roman Influence on the Civilization of Ancient India,' &c., and editor of Sleeman's 'Rambles and Recollections.'

SMITHE, EDMUND DU CANE, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and employed on irrigtn. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Dec., 1883; transf'd, to buildings and road branch, Oct., 1894; has acted as under sec. to govt. of India, and to govt. of Punjab.

SMITHER, MAURICE, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Aldenham Gr. Sch. and Caius Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 6th Jan., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and offg. cantonmt. mag.

SMYTH, JOHN WATT, B.L., late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1857; arrived, 20th Dec., 1857, and was apptd. asst. mag. and collr., Agra; transf'd, to Punjab, May, 1859, and served as asst. commr., and as personal asst.; registrar of the chief court, Feb., 1866; dep. commr., Oct., 1869; judge, chief court, March, 1880; retd., 1885.

SMYTH, RALPH GRAHAM, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Lieut., Bengal
engrs., 7th Dec., 1855; from 6th Nov., 1857, served in the dept. in the Central and N.W. Prov. as asst. engr.; served in the Mutiny (medal and clasp); offg. garrison engr., Lucknow, June, 1859; on mil. duty, May, 1861; re-apptd., April, 1862, and served in Bengal as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; suptg. engr., July, 1876; transf. to Haidarabad, Dec., 1881, as sec. to rest. in the public works dept.; offg. chief engr. and sec. to chief commr., Burma, 1885; retd., Dec., 1889.

SMYTH, THOMAS WATT, M.A., B.L., late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 2nd Feb., 1862, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and small cause court judge; registrar of the chief court, 1867-70; dep. commr., April, 1877; commr., April, 1883; divl. judge, Nov., 1884; judge, chief court, Jan., 1887; retd., April, 1890; author of 'Acts and Regulations applicable to the Punjab.'

SMYTH, WILLIAM JOHN, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Bath Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 1st Jan., 1894, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

SNELL, FRANCIS WILLIAM, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Bombay Pol. Dept.—First commn., 23rd Jan., 1869; mil. duty to Jan., 1885; asst. pol. rest., Perim, Jan., 1885; Aden, Aug., 1886; served also at Savantvadi and Baroda; admr., Rajpipla State, Aug., 1895.

SNOW, PHILIP CHICHELEY HYDE, B.L., Indian C.S.(Bombay).—Educ. at Haileybury and Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 11th Nov., 1876; asst. commr., Delhi, Nov., 1876; from March, 1877, served in British Burma as asst. commr., asst. cantonmt. mag., &c.; from Nov., 1881, served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and district registrar; forest settl. officer, Dec., 1885; acting under sec. to govt., pol., &c., depts., Sept., 1886; junr. collr. and mag., June, 1894; municipal commr., Bombay, Mar., 1896.

SORABJI PADAMJI PESTANJI, Statutory C.S. (Bombay).—Probr. under the native civil service rules, 14th Jan., 1880; confd., March, 1882; served as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; 2nd asst., May, 1889; 1st asst., March, 1893.

SPANKIE, GEORGE THEOPHILUS, B.L., Oudh Jud. Comm.—Called to the bar (Lincoln's Inn), 6th June, 1871; apptd. addl. jud. commr. in Oudh, 11th Nov., 1892.

SPANKIE, JOHN PATRICK WALTER, Major, I.S.C., Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov.—First commn., 6th Aug., 1873; served during the Afghan war, 1877-78 (medal); offg. cantonmt. mag., Oct., 1881; confd., Sept., 1882.

SPEARMAN, HORACE RALPH, Col., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—Ensign, 91st Highlanders, 18th Dec., 1857; proby. asst. engr., public works dept., 1866; from Dec., 1862, served in the Burma commn. as asst. commr. and asst. sec. to the chief commr.; offg. asst. pol. agent, Bhamo, March, 1871; dep. commr., Jan., 1877; prest., Rangoon municipal committee, 1883, and 1886, and of the Akyab municipal committee, 1884; commr., April, 1890; returned to Europe, Dec., 1895; author of 'British Burma Gazetteer.'

SPEDDING, ROBERT DECY, M.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 17th Nov., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; dep. commr., Jhansi, April, 1879; mag. and collr., Dec., 1879; commr., Oct., 1889; retd., July, 1891.

SPENCE, JAMES KNOX, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll. and Royal Mil. Acad., Woolwich; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 29th Oct., 1865, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; from May, 1878, to Oct., 1880, served in the postal dept.; junr. collr. and mag., and pol. agent, Kolaba, June, 1885; senr. collr. and collr. of land rev., &c., Bombay, Nov., 1888; acting commr. of customs, &c., Dec., 1889; also British delegate for the Portuguese treaty; commr., Nov., 1891; member of legisl. council, July, 1895; acted as member of council, April-July, 1896.

SPENCER, CHARLES GORDON, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Marlborough and Keble Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 26th Nov., 1890, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

SPENCER, HUGH, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bristol Gr. Sch., and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 17th Dec., 1888, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Nov., 1893.

SPENCER, LIONEL DIXON, M.D., Surgn.-Col., Indian Med. Dept.—Asst. surgn., Bengal med. establ., March, 1865; served under the civil dept. in the Central Prov., and with the Central India horse; from Oct., 1871, served as agency surgn., E. states, Rajputana; on famine duty, 1877, and acted as pol. agent, Karauli, 1877, and Bharatpur, 1878; in 1879 was in med. charge of the Marwar and Jaisalmir agency; from March, 1881, served as agency surgn., Rajputana, and supt.-gen. of dispensaries and vaccn.; reverted to mil. dept., July, 1892; apptd. princ. med. offr., Punjab Field Force, Oct., 1892.

SPIELSBURY, EDGAR CHARLES, Major, R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to Bombay public works dept. as asst. engr., 17th Aug., 1876; served in the Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal); employed on Bombay defences, March, 1883; exec. engr., March, 1886; transf. to Burma, Dec., 1893; to Rajutana and Central India, Sept., 1895.

SPRING, FRANCIS JOSEPH EDWARD, C.I.E., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. 4th Aug., 1870, and employed on irrig. works in the Punjab; transf. to state railways, May, 1873; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; under sec. to govt. of Bengal, railway branch, Sept., 1884; employed on N.W. line, March, 1888; engr.-in-chief, E. Coast railway, Nov., 1890; offg. consulting engr. for railways, Bombay, and sec. to govt., Aug., 1893; employed on Bezwada-Madras railway survey, Nov., 1893; consulting engr. to govt. of India for railways, Assam, Jan., 1894; C.I.E., May, 1894; rank of suptg. engr., July, 1894.

SPRING-BRANSON, JAMES HENRY, B.L., Madras Jud. Dept.—Crown prosecutor and public prosecutor for town of Madras, 4th July, 1885; advocate-gen., Madras, Sept., 1889; member of legisl. council, 1887, 1892, and 1894.

SPRY, ARTHUR HUME, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1857; arrived, 22nd Oct., 1857, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., special officer of income tax, and asst. pol. agent; junr. collr. and mag., Dhawar, Dec., 1878; senr. collr., Kaira, Oct., 1882; on
special duty in the Cambay state, Feb., 1883; retd., 1886.

SRI LAL, Pandit, B.I., Statutory C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. by the govt. of India a probr. under the statutory civil service rules; asst. mag. and collr., 30th March, 1889; confd., 21st May, 1891; asst. settlt. officer, Jan., 1894; joint mag., May, 1896.

SRINAVASA RAGHAVA AIYANGAR, Seshayangar, C.I.E., B.A., Dewan Bahadur, Madras Registrn. Dept.—Joined the service, Nov., 1870; head acctnt., rev. board's office, March, 1873; 2nd asst., Nov., 1879; and 1st asst., Aug., 1880; inspr.-gen. of registrn., Madras, Sept., 1889; C.I.E., June, 1893; member of legislat. council, Nov., 1893; Diwan of Baroda, 1890.

SRINIVASA RAO, PATEKI, Dewan Bahadur, Jud. Dept., Madras.—Served in the jud. dept. in various capacities from 16th Dec., 1844; apptd. police mag., Madras, May, 1871; fellow of Madras univ., 1875; small cause court judge, Madras, April, 1880; judge, Madras city civil court, Dec., 1892.

STACE, EDWARD VINCENT, C.B., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Pol. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 13th Nov., 1862; from June, 1871, served in the Bombay rev. survey dept. as asst. supt., and as boundary settlt. commr.; from May, 1873, acted as asst. pol. rest., Aden, and from April, 1875, as asst. pol. agent, Kathiawar, &c.; second asst. rest. at Aden, Sept., 1880; asst. pol. agent, Kathiawar, Dec., 1887; joint administrator, Rajpipla, Feb., 1885; first asst. pol. rest. at Aden, and pol. agent for the Somali coast, Feb., 1886; acted as rest. at various periods; pol. agent and collr. of stamp rev., Cutch, Aug., 1893.

STACK, GEORGE AUGUSTINE, Bengal Educl. Dept.—Served from 1st Jan., 1868, as profr. at the Agra, Bareilly, and Dacca colls.; profr., Patna coll., Jan., 1883; presidency coll., Feb., 1888.

STACK, OLIVER STOKES, late Police Dept., Bengal.—From 8th June, 1859, served as dep. mag. and dep. collr.; from May, 1862, served in the police dept., and was apptd. district supt., 1st grade, Oct., 1878; dep. inspr.-gen., July, 1885; offg. inspr.-gen., June, 1886; retd., Oct., 1890.

STALEY, ALFRED EVELYN, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., Concord, U.S.A., and St. Peter's Coll., Radley; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 20th Oct., 1875, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; transfld. to Bengal, Jan., 1880; offg. under sec. to govt., 1884 and 1885; joint mag., Aug., 1886; acting junr. sec. to rev. board, March, 1890; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1891.

STANDEN, BERTRAM PRIOR, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Uppingham, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 5th Dec., 1888, and served in Burma and the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; registrar, jud. commr.'s court, Nagpur, March, 1891; settlt. officer, Dec., 1894.

STANSFELD, RIGHT HON. SIR JAMES, G.C.B., LL.B., B.L.—Born in 1820; educ. at Univ. Coll., London; called to the bar at the Inner Temple, 1849; M.P. for Halifax, 1859-95; a lord of the admiralty, 1863-64; under sec. of state for India, Feb. to June, 1865; third lord of the treasury, Dec., 1868; joint sec. to the treasury, Oct., 1869; prest. of the poor law board, March, 1871; prest. of the local govt. board, 1871-74, and again in 1886; G.C.B., 1895.

STANTILL, WILLIAM, Public Works Dept., India Office.—Educ. at the City of London Sch.; clerk, 2nd class, 25th Sept., 1882.

STAVELEY, SIR CHARLES WILLIAM DUNBAR, G.C.B., Gen.—Educ. at the Scottish Naval and Mil. Acad., Edinburgh; 2nd lieut., 87th foot, March, 1835; asst. mil. sec. to Col. W. Staveley, in Mauritius, 1842, and at Hong Kong, 1847-50; A.D.C. to lieut.-gen., Earl Cathcart, in Canada, 1845-47; served in the Crimean campaign of 1854-55 (medal, C.B., Sardinian and Turkish medals, and 5th class Medjidie); brigadier-gen. in N. China, 1860-62 (medal), and was in command of the troops during the operations against the Taepings, 1862-63; K.C.B., March, 1865; from March, 1865, to Sept., 1867, served as brigadier-gen.in the Bombay presidency; second in command in the Abyssinian expdn., 1867-68 (thanks of parliament and medal); major-gen. on the staff, western divn., Devonport, 1869; commander-in-chief, Bombay, and member of the govt.'s council, Oct., 1874, to Oct., 1878; G.C.B., May, 1884.

STEAD, VEN. SAMUEL, M.A. (Oxon.), late Ecclesl. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the service, March, 1863; arrived, 24th April, 1863, and served as chaplain at Karachi, Sholapur, Belgaum, and Poona; senr. chaplain, April, 1873; archdeacon and commissary, Nov., 1878; held charge of the diocese of Bombay, 1877-78, and 1883-84; retd., June, 1886.

STEANE, WILLIAM COPELEY, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Temporary clerk, 9th Nov., 1860; clerk, 2nd class, Aug., 1878.

STEAVENSON, JOSEPH, B.A., Jud. Dept., Madras.—Served from 25th Feb., 1878, as acting registrar of the high court (original side), Madras, and was confd. in this appt., Feb., 1880.

STEDMAN, EDWARD, C.B., Major-Gen., I.S.C.—First commr., 19th Dec., 1860; served in the Hazara campaign, 1868 (medal with clasp); also in the Afghan war of 1878-80 (medal with clasp and bronze star); served in the Burma expdn. of 1886-87, and commanded the operations in the Shan states (two clasps; C.B.); inspr.-gen. of police, Upper Burma, May, 1887; and of Burma, Oct., 1888; apptd. quartermaster-gen. in India, March, 1892; comdg. Burma dist., Nov., 1895.

STEEDMAN, EDWARD BRITTAIN, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Shrewsbury; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 31st Oct., 1871, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; dir. of settlt.s. and rev. records, May, 1887; designation changed to dir. of land records and agric.; dep. commr., Dec., 1889; in 1892 offd. as dir. of land records and agric., and rev. sec. to govt.; author of 'Report on the Settlement of the Jhang District.'

STEEL, CHARLES DENTON, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Wesleyan Connexional Sch. and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 13th Nov., 1876, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; asst. supt. and judge, small cause court, Dehra Dun, in 1888-89; asst. commr., April, 1889; joint mag., Jan., 1890; district and sessions judge, April,
1891; dep. commr., April, 1892; mag. and collr., March, 1894; author of 'Allahabad Gazetteer.'

STEEL, HENRY WILLIAM, late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Caius Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 10th Nov., 1862, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; employed in connection with Punjab N. state railway, July, 1874; jud. asst., Dec., 1878; dep. commr., Nov., 1884; retd., May, 1889.

STEEL, JOHN PHILIP, Lieut.-Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Lieut., Bengalgensrs., Dec., 1855; joined the dept., March, 1860, as asst. engr., Bengal; exec. engr., April, 1868; offg. under sec., govt. of India, public works dept., 1873-75, and again Feb., 1877; suptg. engr. and sec. to agent, Rajputana, May, 1879; offg. chief engr. and sec. to govt., Punjab, March, 1887; offg. sec. to chief commr., Central Prov., Oct., 1887; chief engr. and joint sec. to govt., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, 1888; sec., Dec., 1889; retd., March, 1892.

STEELE, CHARLES EDWARD STAFFORD, Sind Commn.—Educ. at Victoria Coll., Jersey; joined the service, 11th June, 1869, and served in Sind as supernumerary asst. settl. officer; supernumerary dep. collr., Dec., 1871; employed under the Transvaal govt. as fin. and rev. commr., 1879-81; served subsequently as asst. collr. and mag., manager of encumbered estates, acting city mag., Karachi, and acting conservator of forests; head asst. collr., Feb., 1892; dep. commr., upper Sind frontier, Feb., 1894.

STEINBELT, JEAN MARI CONRAD, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861; from Jan., 1863, served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., asst. commr., and joint mag.; from April, 1881, served as civil and sessions judge in Banda, and afterwards at Azamgarh; retd., April, 1887.

STEINBERG, ALFRED FREDERICK, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 12th Dec., 1881, and served in Assam as asst. commr.; transf. to Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., Jan., 1892; joint mag., March, 1892; district and sessions judge, March, 1895.

STENT, WILLIAM KITSON, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 14th April, 1871, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., April, 1880; engr.-in-chief, Bellary-Kistna railway, in 1885 and 1886; services lent to S. Indian railway co., 1891; engr.-in-chief, Delhi-Minchinabad railway survey, Nov., 1892; suptg. engr., Oct., 1894; engr.-in-chief, Kotri-Rohri railway, Oct., 1894.

STEPHEN, ARTHUR, M.A., M.B., Surgn.-Col., Med. Dept., Assam.—Joined the service as probr. at Netley, 30th Sept., 1867; served under the mil. dept. in Abyssinia and the Punjab as asst. surgn. and surgn.; acted at various periods as civil surgn., jail supt., and chemical examr. to the Punjab govt.; supt. of jail, Lahore, Sept., 1875; statistical officer to govt. of India, sanitary and med. depts., Nov., 1880; sanitary commr., Punjab, Nov., 1886; acting principal med. officer and sanitary commr., Assam, March, 1894.

STEPHEN, CARR, B.L., late Punjab Jud. Dept.—Served in the Punjab from 11th June, 1856, as extra asst. commr. and small cause court judge; extra jud. asst. commr., 1st grade, Oct., 1875; offg. divl. judge, 1885-86; retd., 1890; has publd. 'Indian Registration Act,' 'Handbook for Delhi,' and 'Archaeology of Delhi.'

STEPHEN, KENT HUME, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 24th Sept., 1878, and employed on irrig. works in Bengal; exec. engr., March, 1886; under sec. to govt. of Bengal, public works dept., March, 1892, to March, 1895.

STEPHENSON, HUGH LANSDOWN, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Westminster and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 14th Dec., 1895, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

STERNDALE, R. A., late Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Served during the Mutiny as a volunteer, 1857 (medal); from Aug., 1859, served in the Central Prov. as dep. collr. and asst. settl. officer; from June, 1864, served in the finl. dept. in various capacities in Nagpur, Calcutta, and the Punjab; asst. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, Jan., 1884, and Madras, Nov., 1887; retd., 1890; author of 'Mammalia of British India and Ceylon,' 'Denizens of the Jungles,' an 'Account of the District of Seoni,' 'Turkey and India; or Our Indian Moslems,' and other works.

STEVENS, CHARLES CECIL, C.S.I., B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Univ. of Melbourne; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, and Feb., 1862; served in Bengal, and was apptd. mag. and collr., Oct., 1873; offg. sec. board of rev., April, 1882; commr., Aug., 1885; offg. chief sec. to govt. of Bengal, 1890; member of rev. board, Dec., 1891; member of supreme legisl. council, Jan., 1893; C.S.I., Jan., 1895.

STEVENS, JOHN FOSTER, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Birmingham Gr. Sch., at Versailles, and at King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 16th Oct., 1865, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., May, 1876; district and sessions judge, Sept., 1884; jud. commr., Central Prov., April, 1894; acting judge, high court, Calcutta, Feb., 1895.

STEVENSON, EDWARD SHEADE BOYD, Madras Police Dept.—Entered the service, Oct., 1870, and served as inspr., asst. supt. and supt. of police; dep. inspr.-gen., Nov., 1895.

STEVENSON, FRANCIS, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, 1st Jan., 1893.

STEVENSON, GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at King's Coll., Aberdeen, and Glasgow Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 11th Nov., 1872, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and in Assam as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Sylhet, Jan., 1885; returned to Bengal, June, 1889, as joint mag.; mag. and collr., July, 1889; acted as commr., Orissa, in 1895.

STEVENSON, ROBERT CHARLES, Burma Commn.—Entered the service, May, 1871, and served in police dept. till 1886; apptd. to Burma commn. as asst. commr., Mar., 1886; has publd. a 'Vernacular Police Manual for British Burma,' and a revised edn. of 'Judson's Burmese Dictionary.'

STEVENSON-MOORE, CHARLES JAMES, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Felsted Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after
exam. of 1885; arrived, 10th Dec., 1887, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1894; also asst. settlt. officer, Dec., 1894; settlement officer, Feb., 1896.

STEVINSON, JOHN SANDBACH, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Taunton; Pemb. Coll., Oxford, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 8th Nov., 1895, and served in N.W.P. and Oudh as asst. commr.

STEWARD, ARTHUR BENNET, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Rugby and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 5th Nov., 1870, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; second asst. collr., Dec., 1882; acting postmr.-gen., Bombay, 1884-85; acting asst. judge, Poona, and asst. agent for sardars in the Deccan, Oct., 1885; jud. asst. to pol. agent, Kathiawar, Nov., 1887; judge and sessions judge, May, 1891; retd., Aug., 1896.

STEWART, ALFRED JOSEPH, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, pol. dept., 27th Sept., 1892; transfd. to registry and record dept., Jan., 1896.

STEWART, SIR DONALD MARTIN, Bart., G.C.B., G.C.S.I., C.I.E., Field-Marshal.—First commn., Bengal army, 12th Oct., 1840; served against the hill tribes on the Peshawar frontier in 1854-55, and against the Bussee Kheyl tribes in 1855 (medal and clasp); commanded volunteers in Aligarh district, May and June, 1857; dep. asst. adjutant-gen., Delhi field force, June, 1857; asst. adjutant-gen. of army, Dec., 1857; was present at siege and capture of Lucknow, and the operations in Rohilkhand (medal with two clasps); dep. adjutant-gen. in India, Feb., 1863; brigadier-gen., Abyssinian expdn., force, 1868 (medal and C.B.); in command of Peshawar district, July, 1869; chief commr. of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, 1871; in command of Lahore divn., April, 1876; commanding Kandahar and S. Afghanistan force, 1878-80; commanding at Kabul and in N. Afghanistan, 1880, till withdrawal from that country (thanks of both houses of parliament; K.C.B., G.C.B., bart., and medal with clasp); mil. member of govr.-gen.'s council, 1880; commander-in-chief in India, and extraordinary member of the govr.-gen.'s council, 1881; member of council of India, Dec., 1885; on expiration of his term of office in Dec., 1895, was re-apptd. for a further period of five years; field-marshal, May, 1894; member of royal commn. on Indian expenditure, May, 1895.

STEWART, ROBERT BARTON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Dulwich and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 27th Dec., 1886, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; 2nd assts., Feb., 1893; 1st asst., June, 1896.

STEWART, WILLIAM HALL MACKINTOSH, Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 25th May, 1878; from June, 1889, acted as attache, foreign dept., and asst. sec. to govt.; confd. in former post, Oct., 1890; asst. agent, Indore, Jan., 1891; asst. rest., Kashmir, July, 1891; asst. pol. agent, Gilgit, April, 1893.

STEWART-WILSON, CHARLES, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Edinburgh High Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 23rd Dec., 1886 and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Dec., 1890; under sec. to govt., Aug., 1891; from April, 1892, served as offg. postmr.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Bengal (1893-94), and Bombay (1894); offg. dep. dir. of post office, Oct., 1894; postmr.-offg., Calcutta, April, 1896.

STIFFE, ARTHUR W., Captain, late R.I.M.—First commn., Indian marine, 24th Feb., 1849; served in Persian war, 1856-57; on special survey for telegraph cable in Persian Gulf, 1862; on special duty in Turkish Arabia, 1863; engr., Persian Gulf telegraphs, and commanding 'Amberwitch', Oct., 1863; offg. dir., Persian Gulf telegraphs, 1866 and 1866-71; port officer, Calcutta, Aug., 1879; offg. supt. of marine, July, 1880; ex-officio shipping master of Calcutta, Feb., 1882; retd., 1888; has brought out new charts and pilots of the Persian Gulf and Makran coast; also a new chart of Maskat, and a description of the Hugli.

STIMPSON, EDWARD JOHN, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 21st May, 1873; resigned, 24th June, 1879; reapptd., 10th July, 1880.

STOGDON, ABRAHAM WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Uppingham Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 11th Nov., 1864, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; jud. asst., Sept., 1877; services placed temporarily at disposal of govt. of India, mil. dept., Feb., 1881; dep. commr., Aug., 1883; divl. judge, Nov., 1884; judge of the chief court, July, 1894.

STOKER, THOMAS, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Rathmines Sch. and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 14th Nov., 1872, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; dep. supt. of family domains of Maharaja of Benares, March, 1878; 1st asst. sec. to govt., April, 1884; under sec., May, 1884; settlt. officer, Bulandshahr, Sept., 1886; inspr.-gen. of registrm., and commr. of excise and stamps, Nov., 1891; offd. as sec. to govt., from Oct., 1895; author of 'A Gold Standard for India,' and of the Bulandshahr settlt. report.

STOKES, GABRIEL, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Kilkenny Coll., Royal Sch., Armagh, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 28th Oct., 1871, and served in Bombay and Madras as asst. mag. and collr.; acting addl. under sec. to govt. of Madras in the rev. (famine) dept., 1877-79; acting Kanarese translr. to govt., Feb., 1880; dep. supt. of census operations, Sept., 1880; sub-collr. and joint mag., May, 1886; collr. and mag., Aug., 1889; govt. agent, Tanjore, Nov., 1895.

STOKES, SIR HENRY EDWARD, K.C.S.I., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Minehead Diocesan Sch., Kilkenny Coll., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 4th Jan., 1864, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; under sec. to govt. in the depts. under the chief sec., Aug., 1869; acting collr. of sea customs and protector of emigrants, Madras, Jan., 1871; fellow of the univ. of Madras, 1875; sub-sec., board of rev., July, 1875; on special duty with the Madras salt commn., 1876; sec., board of rev., Jan., 1877, to Feb., 1878, and addl. sec. on famine duties, Feb., 1877; district and sessions judge, S. Malabar, Oct., 1879; collr. and mag., Salem, June, 1881; sec. to govt. in the rev. dept., Jan., 1884; member of legisl. council,
Oct., 1886; chief sec. to govt., Oct., 1887; temporary member of govr.'s council, July, 1888; ordinary member, Nov., 1888; C.S.I., May, 1889; K.C.S.I., May, 1892; retd., Nov., 1893.

STOKES, Henry John, B.A., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at St. Columba Coll., Rathfarnham, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1861, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; served in Bombay from Oct., 1864, to Jan., 1870, and subsequently in Madras; principal asst., July, 1871; district and sessions judge, June, 1877; collr. and mag., June, 1879; on famine duty, Madura, Aug., 1877; district and sessions judge, Madura, Jan., 1884; collr. and mag., N. Arcot, Oct., 1884; district and sessions judge, Coimbatore, May, 1886; member of the public service commn., Nov., 1886; retd., July, 1889.

STOKES, Whitley, C.S.I., C.I.E., Hon. D.C.L. (Oxon.), LL.D. (Dublin), B.L. (Inner Temple), late Legisl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Reporter to the high court and acting administrator-gen., Madras, 1863-64; served subsequently as asst. sec. to govt. of India, legisl. branch, sec. to legisl. council, and sec. in the legisl. dept.; law member of the council of the govr.-gen., May, 1877, to May, 1882; prest. of Indian law commn., 1879; in 1868 framed a scheme for collecting, copying, and cataloguing the Sanskrit MSS preserved in India; author of 'Hindu Law Books,' 1865; the 'Indian Succession Act, with a Commentary,' 1865; the 'Indian Companies Act, 1866, with Notes'; the 'Older Statutes in Force in India, with Notes,' 1874; the 'Unrepealed General Acts of the Governor-General of India, with Chronological Tables, &c.,' 1875-76; the 'Anglo-Indian Codes,' 1887-88, and other works.

STONE, Samuel James, late Police Dept., Punjab.—Apptd. asst. district supt. of police, 10th March, 1861; district supt., Nov., 1872; served in Assam, 1884-85; resumed his post in the Punjab, April, 1885; retd., Feb., 1894.

STOREY, Henry Francis, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, Nov., 1868, as exec. engr.; engr.-in-chief, Kandahar state railway, March, 1880; engr.-in-chief, Indus valley and Kandahar railways, Oct., 1881; supt. of way and works, Sukkur, 1883; suptg. engr., N.W. railway, Jan., 1886; sec. to rest., Haidarabad, Dec., 1889; retd., April, 1893.

STOW, Alan Charles, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Apptd. 2nd class clerk, 7th Oct., 1893.

STRACHEY, Arthur, B.A., LL.B., B.L., Bombay High Court.—Educ. at Trinity Hall, Cambridge; called to the bar at the Middle Temple; joined the service, 26th July, 1884, as offg. reporter for the Indian law reports, high court, N.W. Prov.; confd., March, 1877; public prosecutor and standing counsel to govt., Nov., 1892; judge of Bombay high court, Nov., 1892.

STRACHEY, Sir John, G.C.S.I., C.I.E., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1842; served in the N.W. Prov. in the grades of asst. commr. and asst. mag. and collr.; senr. asst., Kumaon, 1848; mag. and collr., Moradabad, 1854; offg. commr. of Kumaon, 1861; prest. of comm. to inquire into cholera epidemic of 1861; jud. commr., Central Prov., 1862; prest. of the sanitary commn. with govt. of India, 1864; chief commr., Oudh, 1866; member of govr.-gen.'s council, March, 1868; acting viceroy and govr.-gen. on death of Earl of Mayo, 9th to 23rd Feb., 1872; lieut.-govr., N.W. Prov., 7th April, 1874; retd. from the civil service, Dec., 1876; finl. member of the govr.-gen.'s council, Dec., 1876, to Dec., 1880; member of council of India, July, 1885, to July, 1895; joint author with Lieut.-Gen. R. Strachey of 'The Finances and Public Works of India,' 1882; author of 'India,' 1888 (2nd edn., 1894), and of 'Hastings and the Rohilla War,' 1892.

STRACHEY, Richard, C.S.I., F.R.S., Lieut.-Gen., R.E.—2nd lieut., Bengal engrs., June, 1846; was employed on irrig. works in the N.W. Prov. from 1840, and apptd. exec. engr., Ganges canal, July, 1843; under sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., 1857; sec. to govt., Central Prov., 1857; consulting engr., railway dept., Sept., 1853; sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., 1862; inspr.-gen. of irrign., and chief engr., 1st class, Dec., 1866; member of supreme legisl. council, 1869; inspgr. engr. of machinery and stores for state railways, India office, 1871; member of council of India, Jan., 1875, to July, 1878; on special duty in India, 1878; offg. member of council of govr.-gen., Jan., 1879; prest. of the famine commn., 1880; re-apptd. member of council of India, March, 1879; prest., royal geographical society, 1887; retd. from the council of India, on his appt. as chairman of the E. Indian railway company, Oct., 1889; apptd. a representative of India at the international monetary conference, Brussels, 1892; member of Indian currency committee, 1892-93; joint author with Sir John Strachey of 'The Finances and Public Works of India,' 1882.

STRAFFORD (Earl of), Right Hon. George Henry Charles Byng.—Born in 1830; educ. at Eton and Oxford; M.P. for Tavistock, 1852-57, and for Middlesex, 1857-74, when he was called to the upper house, as Viscount Enfield; attached to Earl Russell's special mission to Vienna, 1855; parly. sec. to the poor law board, 1865-66; under sec. for foreign affairs, Dec., 1870; under sec. of state for India, Sept., 1880, to Dec., 1882; succeeded to earldom of Strafford, 1886.

STRAHAN, Charles, Col., R.E., Survey of India Dept.—First commn., Bengal engrs., June, 1860; arrived, Oct., 1862; joined the survey dept. as mil. and asst., Sept., 1863; served with the Bhutan field force in charge of reconnoitring party, 1865-66 (medal and clasp); surveyor, Dec., 1867; dep. supt., Sept., 1869; served with the Peshawar field force in Afghanistan, 1879 (medal); asst. surveyor-gen. in charge of cartographic and engraving branches, May, 1884; dep. surveyor-gen. (rev. branch), July, 1892; surveyor-gen. of India, March, 1895.

STRAHAN, George, Col., R.E., late Survey of India Dept.—Obtained commn. from Addicombe, Dec., 1853; arrived, Nov., 1860; served under the mil. and public works dept. till July, 1862, when he was apptd. to the survey dept.; served as asst. in the Gwalior and Central India survey, and afterwards held charges in the Rajputana, Mysore, and Khandesh surveys; dep. supt., Nov., 1867; offg. asst. surveyor-gen.; in charge of engraving and cartographic branches, Calcutta, April-July, 1883; dep. surveyor-gen. (trigonl. branch), Oct., 1889; offg. as surveyor-gen. in 1892; reverted to mil. dept., May, 1894; retd., June, 1895.

STRAIGHT, Sir Douglas, Kt., B.L., late
Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Called to the bar at the Middle Temple, Nov., 1865; counsel to London banks association from 1868; junr. counsel, treasury prosecution, from 1877; M.P. for Shrewsbury, 1870-74; apptd. one of the royal commrs. to inquire into corrupt election practices at Boston, 1875; puisne judge, high court, N.W. Prov., June, 1879; offd. as chief justice in 1883, 1884, and 1886; fellow of Calcutta univ., 1883; and of the Allahabad univ., 1887; retd., April, 1892; Kt., Aug., 1892.

STRAITON, WALLACE CHRISTOPHER RAMSAY, Capt., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt.of India.—First commn., 26th July, 1881; from May, 1885, acted as asst. agent, Rajputana, and asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakaiti; confd. as asst. agent, Mt. Abu, March, 1888; pol. agent and consul, Muscat, April, 1889; 1st asst. rest., Nov., 1889; transfd. to Boshire, Dec., 1889; asst. pol. agent and consul, Bassora, April, 1890; 1st asst. agent, Baluchistan, April, 1891; pol. agent, S.E. Baluchistan, Oct., 1894; author of a narrative of Muscat affairs, 1885-88.

STREATFIELD, CLAUDE ARTHUR CECIL, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Marlborough and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 21st Nov., 1891, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

STREATFIELD, HENRY CUTHBERT, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Marlborough and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 29th Dec., 1887, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec. to govt. in the finl. and municipal depts., Nov., 1890; and in the jud., &c., &c., depts., Oct., 1892; sec. to the jury commn., 1893; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1894.

STREET, BROOKS HENRY GEORGE, Store Dept., India Office.—Writer, 30th June, 1874; clerk, 2nd class, Sept., 1878; supervisor, 2nd grade, India store depot, Oct., 1883.

STREET, HENRY ALFRED, Capt., R.I.M.—Commander of 'Tenasserim,' Dec., 1876, to June, 1880; asst. sec. to govt. of India, mil. (marine) dept., June, 1880, to March, 1882; on duty in Bombay, 1882-84; asst. dir., Indian marine, April, 1884; port officer, Madras, Dec., 1887; presidency port officer, Madras, Aug., 1888, to Jan., 1893, and again from Feb., 1896; offg. in the same post, 1893-94; and at Calcutta, April, 1895.

STICKLAND, WILLIAM ALEXANDER WICKEDE, Capt., I.S.C., Burma Commn.—First commn., Oct., 1880; employed in Burma as asst. commr., Aug., 1886; dep. commr., Jan., 1896.

STROVER, GEORGE AUGUSTUS, Col., I.S.C., late Burma Commn.—Joined the service as ensign, 20th Jan., 1857; arrived at Madras, Feb., 1857; served in the Burma commn. from 14th April, 1862, as asst. commr. and cantonmt. mag.; offg. mag. and small cause court judge of Rangoon, 1866; supt. of hill tribes, N. Arakan, Sept., 1868; from Aug., 1869, to Sept., 1875, served as asst. pol. agent at Bhamo, and pol. agent at Mandalay; from Nov., 1877, served as dep. commr. of Toungoo, and acted as commr. of Arakan, 1883; commr., May, 1889; acted as finl. commr. in 1892; reverted to mil. dept., Oct., 1894.

STUART, ANDREW EDMUND CASTLE-STUART, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Wellington Coll. and Kingstown Sch., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 17th Nov., 1879, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag. and forest settl. officer; special asst. to the collrs. of Nilgiris and Malabar for settl. purposes, Aug., 1886; head asst., July, 1888; sub-collr. and joint mag., Feb., 1893; collr. and mag., March, 1896; compiled a 'Manual of the Wynaad.'

STUART, CHARLES AUGUSTUS, late Postal Dept., Bombay.—Served from 23rd Nov., 1855, as postmr. in Mysore, Madras, and Haidarabad; presidency postmr., Madras, Jan., 1864; from March, 1865, served in Bombay as presidency postmr., and also offd. for various periods as postmr.-gen., Bombay, Punjab, and Madras; retd., Feb., 1892.

STUART, CHARLES JOSEPH, Col., I.S.C., late Madras Rev. Dept.—Arrived, 21st Aug., 1852; served in the Madras rev. settl. dept. from April, 1861, as asst. dir. and dep. dir.; special asst. to collr. of Karnul for survey and settl. purposes, 1871-73, and afterwards in Chengalpat and Madura; retd., 1880.

STUART, GEORGE HENRY, M.A., Madras Educl. Dept.—Educ. at Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; joined the service, 14th Aug., 1882, as principal, Kumbakonum coll.; has acted at various periods as principal and profr., presidency coll.

STUART, HAROLD ARTHUR, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at High Sch., Bishop's Stortford, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1879; arrived, 25th Nov., 1881, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and under sec. to govt.; acting private sec. to govr. of Madras, Nov.-Dec., 1889; provl. supt. of census operations, April, 1890; on special duty to revise district manuals, 1893-94; sub-collr. and joint mag., Aug., 1893; principal asst. collr. and district mag., Oct., 1895; private sec. to the govr. of Madras, March, 1896.

STUART, HARRY, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service as dep. examr. of railway accts., 29th Jan., 1878; examr., Jan., 1882; acted as manager, Tirhut state railway, in 1889 and 1890; govt.examr., Indian Midland railway, Nov., 1890; examr. of accts., E. Bengal state railway, July, 1892.

STUART, LOUIS, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Charterhouse, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 17th Dec., 1891, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.

STURDY, WILLIAM ARTHUR, India Audit Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 27th Dec., 1894.

STURMER, ARTHUR JAS., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., I.M.S., Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, March, 1875; served on regtl. duty, and as civil surgn. till 1893; dist. surgn., Feb., 1894; surgn., 4th dist., and prof. Madras med. coll., April, 1896.

STURROCK, JOHN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the High Sch., Dundee; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 20th Nov., 1864, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; acting sec. to govt. in the rev. dept., Nov., 1873; boundary commr. between Kanara and Mysore, 1873, and 1880-81; Kanarese translr. to govt., Jan., 1874; under sec. to govt. in the chief sec.'s dept., July, 1875; addl. sub-sec., board of rev., for special duty with famine commn., Nov., 1878; sub-sec., board of rev., Oct., 1879; collr. and mag., Oct., 1883; member of legisl. council, March, 1894; member of rev. board,
and commr. of land tax, Sept., 1894; member of legisl. council of Madras, April, 1895.

STURT, JOHN VENABLES, Kumaun Commn.—Joined the service, 24th Dec., 1856; held various non-gazetted appts. till 1860; served as extra asst. commr. from 1862; asst. commr., 1871; dep. commr., April, 1896; retd., 1896.

STURT, WILLIAM NEVILLE, Rev. and Statistics Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Repton; temporary clerk, 1st May, 1862; junr. clerk, store dept., 1862; acctnt.-gen.'s dept., 1863; mil. dept., 1863; private sec. to partly under sec. of state, 1863-64, and 1868-77; senr. clerk, rev. dept., April, 1877; served temporarily in pol. and secret dept., 1890-94; asst. sec. judl. and public dept., March, 1896.

SUBRAMANIYA AIYAR, S., C.I.E., Dewan Bahadur, Madras High Court.—Acted as govt. pleader in 1888-89 and 1892-94; also as judge of the high court in 1891-92, and from Jan., 1895; confd., May, 1895.

SULLIVAN, HENRY EDWARD, C.S.I., late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1850; served in rev. and jud. depts., Madras, and was apptd. small cause court judge, Sept., 1866; civil and sessions judge, Dec., 1866; collr. and mag., March, 1868; offg. dir. of rev. settlt., Feb., 1874; in charge of the inam dept., May, 1876; acting rest. of Travancore and Cochin, 1877-78; board of rev., April, 1878; famine commn., Jan., 1879; 1st member, board of rev., and commr. unconv. civil service exams., Jan., 1879; on duty to England as member of famine commn., 1879-80; member of legisl. council, Jan., 1881; in charge of settlt. dept., Feb., 1881; ordinary member of council, June, 1882; prest. of local self-govt. committee, June, 1882; retd., Dec., 1886.

SULLIVAN, WILLIAM JAMES AUGUSTUS, Madras Police Dept.—Joined the service, 28th Jan., 1869; asst. supt. of police, April, 1873; supt., June, 1882; dep. inspr.-gen., Oct., 1893.

SUMMERS, THOMAS, B.Sc., A.M., I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, Oct., 1877; and served as asst. engr.; exec. engr., March, 1880.

SURYA KUMAR AGASTI, M.A., Statutory C.S. (Bengal).—Apptd. under the native civil service rules asst. mag. and collr., Purniah, on probn., March, 1885; confd., April, 1887; joint mag. and dep. collr., June, 1892.

SUTHERLAND, ALGERNON ROBERT, India Public Works Dept., Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. asst. engr., 1st Oct., 1876, and posted to N.W.P. and Oudh.; exec. engr., Oct., 1890.

SUTTON, ERNEST WILLIAM, Pol. Dept., India Office.—Second divn. clerk, census office, 7th April, 1891; and class clerk, India office, 1st Sept., 1891.

SWAIN, WILLIAM HENRY, B.A., B.Sc., Mil. Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 4th June, 1881; B.Sc. (honours), London univ., 1888; B.A., 1895; joint editor of the 'India List,' 1887-95, and of the 'India Office List' from Oct., 1895.

SWAMINATHA AIYAR, TIRUVARAR MUTTUSWAMI AIYAR, B.A., Statutory C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Madras Univ.; apptd. probn. for the civil service, Nov., 1883; confd., Jan., 1886; asst. collr. and mag., July, 1887; head asst., Feb., 1893.

SWANN, FREDERICK SAMUEL PHILIP, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Berkhamsted Sch. and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 12th Dec., 1894, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

SWETENHAM, EDMUND, Col., I.S.C., late Public Works Dept., N.W. Prov.—Joined the dept. from Rurki coll., Nov., 1853, and served in the Punjab; resigned on obtaining commn. in the army, March, 1857; served in the N.W. frontier campaign, 1858 (medal); re-apptd. to public works dept., Feb., 1859, and served in N.W. Prov., buildings and roads branch; transfd. to British Burma, May, 1872; transfd. to Central India, Sept., 1874; transfd. to N.W. Prov., buildings and roads branch, Aug., 1880; suptg. engr., Sept., 1880; retd., Feb., 1890.

SWIFTE, LATHAM CODDINGTON, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Eton and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 6th Nov., 1892, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

SYAD ALAY MAHOMED, Statutory C.S. (Central Prov.).—Acting extra asst. commr., 26th Jan., 1881; probr. for the native civil service, Dec., 1882; apptd. member of the civil service, and supernumerary asst. commr., 12th Dec., 1883; judge, small cause court, April, 1892; dep. commr., April, 1894.

SYKES, ROBERT, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Giggleswick Gr. Sch. and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 18th Dec., 1888, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and offg. under sec.; junr. sec. to finl. commrs., Dec., 1893 till Dec., 1895.

SYMES, EDWARD SPENCE, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 26th Oct., 1875, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; transfd. to Burma, Aug., 1876, as asst. commr.; personal asst. to chief commr., May, 1879; junr. sec., June, 1881; sec. to chief commr. and officer in charge of Delhi state prisoners, April, 1886; C.I.E., May, 1886; chief sec., April, 1887; commr., Minbu, July, 1890; resumed post as chief sec., Dec., 1890.

SYMNS, ROBERT CORSER MONTFORT, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Westminster, King's Coll. Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 12th Dec., 1888, and served in Burma as asst. commr. and acting under sec.

SYMonds, WILLIAM POWELL, Indian C.S., (Bombay).—Educ. at Hereford Cathedral Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 16th Nov., 1876, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; acting under sec. to govt., rev., finl., and gen. depts., 1884; forest settlt. officer, March, 1887; 2nd asst. collr., and acting dir. of land records and agric., Aug., 1887; postmr.-gen., Bombay, May, 1889; revised the manual of rev. acts, in Bombay.

SZCZEPANSKI, HENRY CHARLES ANTHONY, Col., I.S.C., late Berar Commn.—First commn., Bengal infantry, June, 1857; employed under the mil. dept. up to 1860, including service during the Mutiny (medal); asst. commr., Punjab, July, 1860; on special famine duty, Nov., 1861; transfd. to Haidarabad assigned districts, Nov., 1864, and served as asst. commr., cantonmt. mag. and small cause court judge, and dep. commr.; offd.
as jud. commr. at various periods, and as commr. in 1888 and 1889; reverted to mil. dept., June, 1895.

Tabor, Francis Samuel, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch. and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 26th Nov., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; transf'd. to the Central Prov., May, 1893.

Taheiruddin Ahmed, B.L., Bengal Provl. Service.—Apptd. probr. under the native civil service rules, 9th March, 1890; asst. settlt. officer in Orissa, March, 1891; apptd. to provl. service as dep. mag. and dep. collr., Nov., 1893.

Talbot, Sir Adelbert Cecil, K.C.I.E., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., royal artillery, Jan., 1867; joined the Bengal staff corps, 1869, and served with 4th cavalry, Haidarabad contingent; on special duty with the Afghan commr., Seistan arbitration, 1872-73; ofig. asst. agent, Rajputana, 1873; attache, foreign dept., 1874; ofig. asst. sec. to the govt. of India, legislt. dept., 1875-76; acting asst. rest., and asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakai dept., Haidarabad, 1878; 1st asst. agent, Rajputana, Feb., 1878; fellow of Calcutta univ., 1879; addl. pol. agent, E. Rajputana states, 1881; pol. agent, Bhartpur and Karauli, 1882; pol. agent, Bikainir, 1883; ofig. as rest. in Turkish Arabia, 1883-89; rest., Persian Gulf, Sept., 1891; dep. sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., May, 1894; on special duty to England with Sardar Nasrulla Khan of Kabul, Aug., 1895; K.C.I.E., Aug., 1895; rest., Kashmir, June, 1896; publd. a revised edn. of 'Aitchison's Treaties,' 1876.

Talbot, Gerald Henry, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at St. Peter's Coll., Radley; supervisor, 1st grade, India store depot, 19th June, 1877.

Talbot, Walter, Store Dept., India Office.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, India store depot, 1st Jan., 1893; clerk, 2nd class, June, 1895.

Talbot, Walter Stanley, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Wellington Coll. and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 31st Oct., 1890, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., ofig. under sec. to govt., and ofig. sec. to finl. commrs.

Tanner, Henry Charles Baskerville, Col., I.S.C., late Survey of India.—First commn., Bombay artillery, June, 1854; accompanied the Persian expdny. force of 1855 (medal and clasp); joined the survey dept., Oct., 1862, and was employed on various rev. surveys; dep. supt., April, 1872; accompanied the Lushai expd. in 1871-72, and the Khaibar column in the Afghan campaign, 1878-79; was afterwards in charge of the Darjiling and Nepal boundary parties, Nov., 1882; employed with the Tibet mission from May, 1886; reverted to mil. duty, 1890.

Taplin, Herbert, Registry and Record Dept.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, 1st Jan., 1893.

Target, Charles Albert Bagenal, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the Madras public works dept., 8th Oct., 1868; transf'd. to state railways, April, 1870; and to Mysore, irrigtn. branch, March, 1872; exec. engr., Sept., 1874; employed in Calcutta mint, Feb., 1880; served subsequently in Rajputana, Madras, Burma, and Rajputana.

Tate, Alexander Chambers, M.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Belfast, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1879, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Anantapur, Sept., 1888; principal asst., Vizagapatam, Jan., 1892; sub-collr. and joint mag., Godavari, March, 1894; collr. and mag., March, 1896.

Tate, John, M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 26th July, 1867, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Feb., 1873.

Tate, William Jacob, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Repton; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 25th Nov., 1874, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Salem, Jan., 1883; sub-collr. and joint mag., Jan., 1889; district and sessions judge, March, 1890.

Taunton, Alfred George, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at the Jesuits' Coll., Tournay; writer, India store depot, 29th July, 1868; clerk, 2nd class, Aug., 1878.

Tawney, Charles Henry, C.I.E., M.A., Librarian, India Office.—Educ. at Rugby and Trinity Coll., Cambridge, of which he was elected a fellow in 1860; joined the Bengal educ. dept., Nov., 1864, and served as prof'r., presidency coll., up to Nov., 1876, when he was apptd. principal; acted for various periods as dir. of public instrn.; registrar of Calcutta univ., 1877, 1884, and 1889; librarian, India office, 1st Oct., 1893; has transl'd. from the Sanskrit the Katha Sarit Sagara, the Uttara Rama Charita, the Malavikagni-mitra, the Kathakoça, and two centuries of Bhartrihari.

Tawney, James Walter, late Bengal C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Repton Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 23rd Dec., 1862; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr., Bhutan, till Oct., 1865, and subsequently in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; ret'd., April, 1880.

Tayler, William Vansittart Graham, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 6th Nov., 1855; served in the rev. and jud. depts., Bengal, and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1st grade, Pubna, Oct., 1866; ret'd., 1890.

Taylor, Sir Alexander, G.C.B., Gen., R.E.—Educ. at Hofuzl, Switzerland, and Addiscombe mil. coll.; 1st commn., 9th June, 1843; entered the India public works dept., 26th Dec., 1846; exec. engr., Jan., 1848; supt. of the Lahore and Peshawar road, Dec., 1849; suptg. engr., Nov., 1856; ofig. sec. to the govt. of the Punjab, public works dept., 1856-67, and 1871-72; chief engr., April, 1872; dep. inspr.-gen. of mil. works, 1870-78; prest. of the defence committee of India, 1876, 1877, 1878; prest. of Cooper's Hill coll. from Nov., 1880; served throughout the Sutlej campaign (medal with clasps for Firozshah and Sobraon), the Punjab campaign, 1848-49 (medal with 2 clasps), and the Indian Mutiny (medal with 2 clasps); also during the Ambela campaign, 1863; C.B. in 1855, K.C.B. in 1877, and G.C.B. in 1889.

Taylor, Franklin Eden, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 13th Dec., 1886, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Aug., 1891; under sec. to govt., June, 1893; acting dir. of land records and agric., July-Nov., 1894; joint mag., Dec., 1895.
TAYLOR, FREDERICK BEATSON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Christ's Hosp., and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 30th Nov., 1874, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., April, 1886; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1891.

TAYLOR, GEORGE NOBLE, late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1840; served in Madras as asst. and head asst. collr. and mag., and was apptd. sec. to the coll. and univ. boards, and asst. collr. of customs at Madras in special charge of the salt dept., 1849; sub-collr. and joint mag., Rajahmundry, 1851; acted as collr. and mag. of Nellore in 1857, and of S. Arcot in 1858; inam commr., 1858; special commr. for railways, Calcutta, to report upon the affairs of the East Indian railway, May, 1863, and subsequently held a similar post at Bombay; provisional member of govr.-gen.'s council, 1864; ordinary member of council, March, 1865; retd., March, 1870.

TAYLOR, HERBERT DOUGLAS, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Winchester, and St. Peter's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 7th Dec., 1885, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst. and agent to govt., Vizagapatam, April, 1896.

TAYLOR, JAMES, late Finl. Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the dept., 1st Sept., 1865, and served in Bengal as asst. and dep. acctnt.-gen.; asst. comptr.-gen., June, 1879; retd., March, 1893.

TAYLOR, SAM ARTHUR, Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Epsom Coll.; junr. clerk, 31st Jan., 1867; senr. clerk, Nov., 1889.

TEAGUE, GEORGE FLETCHER, Funds Dept., India Office.—Senr. book-keeper, funds dept., 28th Sept., 1866; head book-keeper, March, 1873; designation changed to senr. clerk, Oct., 1892.

TEBBITT, ROBERT THEODORE, India Store Depot.—Clerk, 2nd class, 8th July, 1866.

TEBBS, FRANCIS ROBERT, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd. 1st Oct., 1877, as asst. engr., and posted to state railways; exec. engr., Dec., 1890.

TEK CHAND, DIWAN, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Punjab Univ. and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 17th Dec., 1895, and served in Punjab as asst. commr.

TEMPLE, HENRY MARTINDALE, Major, I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Sub-lieut., 1st regt., June, 1872; arrived, Sept., 1872; extra A.D.C. to lieut.-govr., Bengal, Dec., 1875; attache, foreign dept., March, 1876; cantonmt. mag., Nasirabad, Feb., 1878; asst. to rest., Haidarabad, and asst. gen. supt., thagi and dakaiti, Oct., 1880; offg. jud. supt. of railways, Nizam's dominions, June, 1881; asst. to agent, Baroda, Nov., 1882; boundary settl. officer, Bundelkhand, Nov., 1884; pol. agent, Khelat, May, 1885; pol. agent, S.E. Baluchistan, May, 1887; and at Khelat, April, 1888; offg. pol. agent, Bikanir, June, 1895.

TEMPLE, JAMES HERBERT, B.A., LL.B., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Burnley Gr. Sch., Repton Sch., and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 20th Dec., 1889, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; acted as collr. of customs, Calcutta, Oct.-Dec., 1893, and as under sec., 1894 and 1895.

TEMPLE, JOHN ALEXANDER, Col., I.S.C., Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., Dec., 1860; arrived, 8th Aug., 1861; from Feb., 1864, served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; small cause court judge, 1872-74, and 1877-80; sessions judge, Oct., 1894; commr., May, 1896.

TEMPLE, RIGHT HON. SIR RICHARD, Bart., G.C.S.I., C.I.E., D.C.L. (Oxon.), LL.D. (Cantab.), late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1846; served in the N.W. Prov. and Punjab as asst. commr. and asst. mag. and collr.; settl. officer, trans-Sutlej divn., 1852; sec. to chief commr., Punjab, 1854; commr., Lahore, 1859; chief commr. of currency and chief asst. to finl. member of council, 1860; chief commr., Central Prov., 1865; rest., Haidarabad, 1867; finl. member of govr.-gen.'s council, April, 1868; pres. of statistical committee, 1868; lieut.-govr. of Bengal, April, 1874; govr. of Bombay, April, 1877, to March, 1880; retd. from the civil service in 1877; chairman of the board of visitors, Cooper's Hill coll., 1880; M.P. for Evesham, 1883-86 and 1886-92; and for Kingston, 1892-95; member of the London sch. board, 1884-94, and vice-chairman, 1885-88; privy councillor, Jan., 1896; author of 'India in 1880,' 'Men and Events of My Time in India, 1882,' 'Oriental Experience,' 1883, 'Cosmopolitan Essays,' 1886, 'James Thomason,' 1893, 'Life in Parliament,' 1893, &c.

TEMPLE, RICHARD CARNAC, C.I.E., Major, I.S.C.—First commn., 4th Jan., 1871; from 11th Aug., 1879, served in the Punjab as asst. cantonmt. mag., and cantonmt. mag.; transf. to Burma as cantonmt. mag., Mandalay, March, 1887; asst. commr., April, 1887; dep. commr., Dec., 1888; provl. supt. of census, 1890; pres. of the Rangoon municipality, Feb., 1891; C.I.E., Jan., 1894; chief commr., Andamanas and Nicobars, Sept., 1895; author of 'Notes on the Transliteration of the Burmese Alphabet,' 'A Dissertation on the Proper Names of Punjabis,' 'Wide-awake Stories' (Punjabi and Cashmiri Folk Tales), and other works; also founded and conducted 'Indian Notes and Queries,' and is an editor of the 'Indian Antiquary.'

TENNANT, JOHN FRANCIS, C.I.E., F.R.S., Lieut.-Gen., R.E.—Second lieut., Bengal engrs., June, 1847; arrived, 7th March, 1849; asst. engr., Ganges canal, 1849-51; asst. in the great trigonl. survey of India, 1851-59; served in the Mutiny (medal with two clasps); govt. astronomer at Madras, Oct., 1859; commandant, sappers and miners, Oct., 1860; served in the public works dept., from Sept., 1863, as exec. engr. in Burma, and in the Punjab and Bengal; apptd. to observe eclipses of the sun, 1867-68 and 1871; served as mint master, Calcutta, from July, 1871, to Jan., 1884; superintended the observations of the transit of Venus at Rurki and Lahore, 1876; C.I.E., Jan., 1879; retd., Jan., 1884.

TEUNON, WILLIAM, Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Univ. of Aberdeen, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 24th Dec., 1883, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf. to Assam as asst. commr., Jan., 1883; dep. commr., July, 1892; dist. and sessions judge, Dec., 1895.

THIBAUT, GEORGE FREDERICK WILLIAM, Ph. D., Educn.Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the dept., 17th March, 1875, as prof'r., Benares coll.; inspr. of schs., Jan., 1878; principal, Benares coll., Nov., 1879; prof'r. of English literature, Muir coll., Oct., 1888; principal, Muir Coll., July, 1895; also supt. of Sanskrit
studies in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Jan., 1863; has transld. the Jatapatala, the Vedanta Entras, with Shankaracharya's commentary, &c., &c.

THOM, WILLIAM, F.R.C.S., Surgn.-Gen., late Bombay Med. Service.—Educ. at Marischal Coll., and Univ. of Aberdeen, and at Univ. Coll., London, and in Paris; fellow of Univ. of Bombay; was apptd. asst. surgn. on the Bombay establ., 1841, and served under the mil. dept.; garrison surgn., and surgn. to the European gen. hosp., 1861; served on the med. board of the India office, 1866-67; dep. inspr.-gen. of hosps., March, 1867; surgn.-gen., Feb., 1874; retd., Sept., 1877.

THOMAS, GEORGE EBENEZER, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. from the E. Indian railway as asst. engr., 28th Aug., 1867, and posted to the Central Prov.; transf'd. to the Punjab N. state railway, March, 1868; locomotive supt., Punjab N. state railway, April, 1875; exec. engr., April, 1876; transf'd. to Indus valley state railway, Nov., 1878; and to British Burma, Nov., 1881; retd., 1889.

THOMAS, HENRY SULLIVAN, late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1855; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., sub-collr. and joint mag., and member of the board of examrs.; collr. and mag., May, 1867; from April, 1878, served on the board of rev., Madras, and acted as sec. to govt. in the rev. dept. in 1878-79; prest. board of examrs., Oct., 1881; member of supreme legisl. council, 1882 and 1883; on special duty in connection with the pearl fisheries at Tuticorin, 1884; 1st member, board of rev., July, 1884; fellow of Madras univ., March, 1886; retd., Jan., 1889; has publd. 'A Report on Pisciculture in S. Kanara,' 1870; 'The Rod in India,' 1881; and 'A Report on Pearl Fisheries and Chank Fisheries,' 1884.

THOMAS, ROBERT MOSLEY BRYCE, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., 6th Jan., 1859; arrived, 26th Feb., 1859; from Oct., 1864, served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr., and cantonmt. mag.; dep. commr., Dec., 1885; inspr.-gen. of police and jails, April, 1894; commr., Chhattisgarh, Oct., 1894; reverted to mil. dept., Sept., 1895.

THOMAS, THOMAS EDWARD, Madras Police Dept.—Joined the service, Aug., 1865, and served in the police dept. as asst. supt. and supt.

THOMAS, WILLIAM CHARLES, Lieut.-Col., late Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service, Dec., 1858, having previously served as a volunteer in Gen. Havelock's cavalry, 1857-58; adjutant of mil. police, Oct., 1859; inspr. of district police, Jan., 1861; district supt. of police, May, 1861; junr. dep. inspr.-gen. of police, May, 1886; senr., Jan., 1890; retd., March, 1893.

THOMASON, CHARLES SIMON, Major-Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Lieut., Bengal engrs., June, 1852; joined the dept., July, 1855, as dep. supt., Ganges canal; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasp); exec. engr., Oct., 1858; supt., Rohilkhand canals, Dec., 1864; oflg. suptg. engr. and dep. sec., public works dept., N.W. Prov., Sept., 1873; on special duty to Madras, in connection with harbour work, 1877-79; suptg. engr. and sec. to agent, Central India, Aug., 1880; reverted to mil. dept., May, 1888; retd., Jan., 1890.

THOMPSON, ARTHUR, M.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at St. Cuthbert's, Ushaw, and Univ. of London; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 20th Nov., 1876, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and district and sessions judge; head asst. collr., Cuddapah, Nov., 1884; sub-collr. and joint mag., Jan., 1890; district and sessions judge, N. Malabar, June, 1891.

THOMPSON, ARTHUR, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Appleby Gr. Sch. and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 21st Dec., 1894, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

THOMPSON, CHARLES THOMAS, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Educ. at the City of London Sch.; clerk, 2nd class, 19th March, 1883.

THOMPSON, DANIEL ROBERT, C.I.E., M.D., M.R.C.S., L.M., Surgn.-Major, late Madras Med. Service.—Joined the Indian med. service as asst. surgn., 1st April, 1867, and served under the mil. dept., also acting as zillah surgn. and supt. of jail; rest. surgn., gen. hosp., Madras, and profir. in med. coll., March, 1875; surgn., 1st district, Madras, med. inspr. of emigrants, &c., May, 1875; C.I.E. (for special famine services in 1876-78), Jan., 1879; retd., May, 1883.

THOMPSON, DAVID WILLIAM, late Educn. Dept., Punjab.—Served in the dept. from March, 1862, as master in the zillah schs. at Lahore and Amritsar; inspr. of schs., May, 1870; retd., Dec., 1892.

THOMPSON, FREDERICK C., Public Works Dept., India Office.—Jnr. clerk, accts. branch, 9th March, 1872; public works dept., Aug., 1875; editor of 'India Office List,' 1885-87; senr. clerk, Feb., 1890.

THOMPSON, GEORGE, B.A., Educl. Dept., Central Prov.—Head master, Saugor high sch., Sept., 1866; served from Oct., 1875, as inspr. of schs., Central Prov.; oflg. inspr.-gen. of educn., Oct., 1893.

THOMPSON, HENRY EDWARD, M.I.E.E., late India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the dept. as Morse asst., 12th May, 1857; arrived, 12th Sept., 1857; supt., Dec., 1866; held charge of various divns., including Malabar, Bangalore, Arakan, Nagpur, and Rajputana; retd., Dec., 1892.

THOMPSON, HENRY MUNGO, B.A., M.I.C.E., Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, July, 1866, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., April, 1871; supt. engr. in Sind, June, 1892; transf'd. to N. divn., April, 1895; chief engr., June, 1896.

THOMPSON, HERBERT, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at St. Peter's Sch., York, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1891, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; sec. to finl. commr., March, 1895.

THOMPSON, RICHARD HORATIO ELY, Forest Dept., Central Prov.—Joined the service as overseer of the govt. tea plantation, Gurhwal, Oct., 1855; asst. supt., Kumaon forests, Jan., 1860; asst. conservator of forests, April, 1864; transf'd. to Central Prov., Aug., 1871; dep. conservator, Oct., 1871; services lent to govt. of Ceylon, June, 1887; conservator, April, 1892.

THOMPSON, ROSS, Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—First commn., June, 1858; arrived, 14th Jan., 1861; joined the dept., Aug., 1863; exec. engr., April, 1867; district engr., presidency, April, 1875; consulting archt. to govt., May, 1875; commanded Queen's Own sappers and miners throughout the Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal); acted as dep. chief engr.
and under sec. to govt., Oct., 1831, and served subsequently in various divns.; retd., Dec., 1894.

THOMPSON, THOMAS MOORE LANE, India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 1st Aug., 1872, and posted to Bengal; exec. engr., Sept., 1886.

THOMSON, ALEXANDER, late Educn. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Served in Oudh, Aug., 1866, as inspr. of schs., and acted as dir. of public instrn. in 1866 and 1868; from April, 1877, served as prof. of English literature in the Agra coll.; principal, July, 1883; retd., April, 1892.

THOMSON, ARTHUR SACKVILLE, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 24th Sept., 1878, and posted to Bengal; exec. engr., Nov., 1889.

THOMSON, CAMPBELL, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 15th July, 1869, and posted to Bengal; transfd. to state railways, Sept., 1872; exec. engr., Jan., 1880; services lent to Mewar durbar, Jan., 1885; suptg. engr., June, 1894.

THOMSON, GEORGE, C.B., M.B., Surgcn.-Col., late Med. Dept., Central Prov.—Arrived, 7th April, 1866; apptd. offig. civil surgn. in the Punjab, Aug., 1879; confd., Sept., 1880; med. adviser to the Maharaja of Patiala, in 1882, 1888, 1889, and 1890; administrative med. officer and sanitary commr., Central Prov., April, 1893; reverted to mil. dept., April, 1893, and apptd. princ. med. officer, Lahore district; C.B., Jan., 1896.

THOMSON, JAMES, M.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Aberdeen Gr. Sch. and Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 24th Nov., 1871, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; sub-collr., joint mag., and principal asst., Godavari, June, 1885; collr. and mag., Nov., 1889; rest., Travancore and Cochin, July, 1895.

THOMSON, JOHN BROWN, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at the Acad., and Univ., Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, Nov., 1870, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; dep. supt. of family domains of Maharaja of Benares, Nov., 1882; registrar of the high court, May, 1884; mag. and collr., April, 1889; ofld. as sec. to govt. in 1889 and 1890; inspr.-gen. of police, May, 1894.

THOMSON, ROBERT GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Islington Proprietary Sch., and Univ. of London; apptd. after exam. of 1872; arrived, 13th Nov., 1874, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settl. officer; junr. sec. to finl. commr., Dec., 1882; senr. sec., March, 1886; postmr.-gen., Punjab, Feb., 1888; junr. sec. to govt. of Punjab, April, 1890; rev. sec., April, 1892.

THOMSON, SAMUEL JOHN, Surgcn.-Major, Med. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service as surgn., 1st Oct., 1877; arrived, 27th April, 1878, and went through Afghan campaign, 1880 (medal); dep. sanitary commr., May, 1885; sanitary commr. (pro tem.), April, 1895; author of 'Sanitary Principles.'

THOMSON, WILLIAM BOYD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the Belfast Methodist Coll., Trinity Coll., Dublin, and the Royal Univ. of Ireland; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 16th Dec., 1892, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. settl. officer.

THORBURN, SEPTIMUS SMET, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 24th Nov., 1864, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and settl. officer; jud. asst., 1st grade, Jan., 1881; dep. commr., April, 1883; commr. and supt., Jan., 1892; author of 'Bannu; or, Our Afghan Frontier,' 'David Leslie,' 'Asiatic Neighbours,' 'Musalmans and Money-lenders,' and a report on the settl. of the Bannu district.

THORBURN, WALTER MILLER, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Dalhousie Coll. and Univ., Halifax, Univ. of Edinburgh, and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 26th Nov., 1875, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst., Oct., 1884; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1890.

THORNHILL, GEORGE, C.S.I., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Rugby and Haileybury, and apptd. in 1842; arrived, 7th April, 1843; served in Madras, as asst. to collr. and mag. in various districts, and was employed as civil officer in connection with the construction of the Godavari and Kistna anicuts; principal asst., Ganjam, 1856; collr. and mag., Kistna, 1861; member of board of rev., 1870-78; was also apptd. dir. of bank of Madras, and commr. for uncov. civil service exams., 1875; retd., 1878.

THORNHILL, HENRY BEAUFORT, Major, I.S.C., Jud. Dept., N.W. Prov.—First commn., 23rd April, 1873; arrived, 1st Nov., 1873; on field service, Afghanistan, 1878-79 (medal); cantonmt. mag., Feb., 1887; dep. supt., Port Blair, May, 1888; cantonmt. mag., N.W. Prov., June, 1891.

THORNHILL, JOSEPH HELEN, M.E., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., 15th July, 1869, and employed on irrign. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Sept., 1879.

THORNTON, ARTHUR PARRY, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, 14th foot, 14th Sept., 1867; admitted to the Bengal staff corps, Sept., 1871; on famine duty, 1874; served under the foreign dept. from Jan., 1875, and acted as asst. agent, Rajputana, and as mag., Mount Abu, and asst. gen. supt. for thagi and dakaiti; attacheé to foreign office during Delhi durbar, 1876-77; on mil. duty, 1878-79; from March, 1879, served as cantonmt. mag. at Morar, and at Nasirabad; asst. to govt.-gen.'s agent, Rajputana, Jan., 1882; cantonmt. mag. and small cause court judge, Secunderabad, Feb., 1884; pol. agent, Bhopawar, May, 1886; Haroati and Tonk, March, 1889; offig. commr., Ajmir, March, 1895.

THORNTON, EDWARD LABOUCHERE RUTHVEN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Marlborough, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 5th Dec., 1891, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; acted as manager, Jaipur estate, 1893.

THORNTON, JAMES HOWARD, C.B., B.A., M.D., Surgcn.-Col., late Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 1856; from 9th Nov., 1861, served as civil asst. surgn. and civil surgn., besides service under the mil. dept.; principal med. officer with the Indian forces, Egypt, 1885; C.B., Aug., 1885; dep. surgn.-gen., Punjab frontier force, June, 1886; retd., Aug., 1891; author of 'Memories of Seven Campaigns,' 1895.

THORNTON, LESLIE MELVILLE, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Marlborough, and Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1878; arrived, 1st Jan., 1881, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and
collr.; asst. sec. to govt., Oct., 1883; under sec., Oct., 1886; offd. as finl. sec., 1891; joint mag., Aug., 1891; offg. legal remembrancer, and member of, and sec. to, provl. legisl. council, Dec., 1892, to March, 1893; dep. sec. to govt. of India, home dept., Oct., 1894.

THORNTON, THOMAS HENRY, C.S.I., D.C.L., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch., and St. John's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1855; asst. commr., Punjab, 1857-59; personal asst. to finl. commr., Punjab, 1859-60; personal asst. to jud. commr., 1860-62; small cause court judge, Lahore, 1862-63; dep. commr., Delhi, 1863-64; sec. to the govt. of the Punjab, 1864-78, and was on two occasions temporarily in charge of the administration of the province; acted as foreign sec. to the govt. of India, 1876-77; member of govr.-gen.'s legisl. council, 1877-79; judge, chief court, Punjab, 1878-81; retd., 1881; fellow of univ. of Calcutta, 1875; vice-pres., univ. coll., Lahore, 1879; author of a life of Sir Robert Sandeman.

THUILLIER, SIR HENRY EDWARD LANDOR, Kt., C.S.I., F.R.S., Gen., R.A., late Survey of India.—Educ. at Addiscombe, 1831-32; first commn., Bengal artillery, Dec., 1832; served in the survey dept. from Dec., 1836, and conducted the surveys of Jaintia, the Puri divn. of Cuttack, and the district of Cachar, and part of Sylhet; dep. surveyor-gen. of India, Jan., 1847, to March, 1861, when he was apptd. surveyor-gen.; retd., Dec., 1877; C.S.I., May, 1870; knighted in 1879; col. commandant, R.A., Jan., 1883; joint author of the 'Manual of Survey for India.
