THUILLIER, SIR HENRY RAVENSHAW, K.C.I.E., Col., R.E., late Survey of India.—Entered Addiscombe, Aug., 1855; lieut., Bengal engrs., June, 1857; apptd. to the survey dept. as asst. in the great trigonl. survey, May, 1859; dep. supt., Sept., 1860; offg. supt., great trigonl. survey, April-Oct., 1876; dep. surveyor-gen. in charge of the rev. survey branch, Oct., 1884; surveyor-gen., Feb., 1887; C.I.E., June, 1893; K.C.I.E., Jan., 1895; retd., March, 1895.

THURBURN, JAMES WHITE, Lieut.-Col., R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 7th May, 1872, and employed in the mil. works branch in the Punjab; served in the Afghan war, 1878-79 (medal); reverted to home establ., Nov., 1880; re-apptd., Jan., 1884, and posted to the Punjab; exec. engr., Feb., 1884.

THURSTON, JOHN NEVILLE OLDFIELD (Burma Commn.)—Joined the service, March, 1886, and served in Burma as asst commr.

TICKELL, CHARLES, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and employed on irrign. works in the Punjab; exec. engr., Nov., 1884; under sec. to govt., public works dept., 1890-92; services lent to Kashmir state, 1892-94.

TIDY, WILLIAM MEYMOTT, M.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 28th Nov., 1860; served in the N.W. Prov. from Aug., 1862, as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Sept., 1878; retd., 1886.

TILLY, HARRY LINDSAY, A.M.I.C.E., Burma Commn.—Joined the public works dept., 1st Oct., 1877, and served in Burma as asst. engr., personal asst. to chief engr., and exec. engr.; transf. to the commn. as asst. commr., Dec., 1885; sec. to finl. commr., 1893-94, and 1894-95.

TINNEY, GEORGE FREDERICK, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 4th July, 1882.

TODD-NAYLOR, HENRY PAUL, C.I.E., B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Shrewsbury, and Univ. Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 14th Dec., 1882, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transf. to Burma as asst. commr., March, 1886; dep. commr., May, 1890; C.I.E., Jan., 1890.

TODHUNTER, CHARLES GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Aldenham Gr. Sch. and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 26th Nov., 1890, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; dep. registrar, high court, July, 1895, acted as registrar, appellate side, from May, 1896.

TOLLINTON, HENRY PHILLIPS, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Leamington Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 17th Dec., 1894, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

TOMKINS, WILLIAM PERCIVAL, C.I.E., Major-Gen., R.E., Mil. Works Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., June, 1860; joined the public works dept., June, 1863, as asst. engr., Assam; transf. to British Burma, Jan., 1865; acted as asst. to chief engr. and asst. sec. to chief commr., 1865; exec. engr., Oct., 1866; transf. to mil. works branch, Nov., 1873; asst. sec. to govt. of India, civil and mil. works branch, April, 1880; suptg. engr. and sec. to agent, Baluchistan, 1882; suptg. engr., Aug., 1883; took part in Zob valley expdn., Sept., 1884; C.I.E., Jan., 1890; chief engr., Sept., 1890; dir.-gen. of mil. works, April, 1893; returned to Europe, June, 1896.

TOMLINSON, THOMAS ARMSTRONG, late Madras Rev. Survey Dept.—Apptd., 10th Aug., 1859, and served as asst. supt.; dep. supt., June, 1886; on special duty, Pudukottai boundary, 1887, and in 1888; retd., April, 1895.

TOOGOOD, JOHN HENRY, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Calcutta Civil Engrg. Coll.; apptd., 11th Oct., 1871, and employed on irrign. works in Bengal; on famine relief duty in Madras, 1877-78; exec. engr., Nov., 1881; offg. under sec. to govt. of Bengal, public works dept., April-Nov., 1894.

TOTENHAM, LOFTUS RICHARD, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury; arrived, 11th July, 1856, and served in Bengal as asst., joint mag. and dep. collr., and mag. and collr.; also as supt. of stamps and stationery, Jan., 1866, and registrar of the high court, Dec., 1866; from Jan., 1874, served in the jud. dept. as district and sessions judge, and offd. as supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, Feb., 1878; judge of the high court, Calcutta, July, 1879; retd., March, 1893.

TOWERS, ROBERT MASON, M.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 21st Jan., 1863, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; from July, 1867, served in the jud. dept. as small cause court judge and district and sessions judge; from Jan., 1878, to Feb., 1880, served as offg. jud. commr., Chota Nagpur; retd., 1888.

TOWLE, ARTHUR HENRY, Store Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 12th Dec., 1892.

TOWNSEND, STEPHEN CHAPMAN, C.B., Surgn.-Gen., late Bengal Med. Service.—Educ. at Ottery St. Mary Gr. Sch., and the London Hosp. Med. Sch.; asst. surgn. in the Indian
med. service, June, 1852; served in the Burma campaign, 1852-53; civil surgn., Nagpur, Jan., 1865; sanitary commr., Central Prov., March, 1868, and offic. as sanitary commr. with the govt. of India, 1877-78; dep. surgn.-gen., Dec., 1878; principal med. officer with the Kuram field force under Gen. Sir F. Roberts, April, 1879; and was wounded in action, Sept., 1879; surgn.-gen. with the Punjab govt., April, 1880; C.B., Feb., 1881; retd., Dec., 1883.

TOYNBEE, GEORGE, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 27th Nov., 1865, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; supt. of canal rev., Oct., 1871; on famine relief duty, Nov., 1873; offic. sec., board of rev., lower prov., Dec., 1874; second inspr. of registrm. offices, April, 1877; joint mag., Dec., 1877; mag. and collr., Feb., 1884; commr., May, 1887; author of 'Sketch of the History of Orissa from 1803 to 1828,' 'Sketch of the Administration of the Hugli District from 1795 to 1845,' and 'A Chowkidari Manual.'

TOZER, HENRY JOHN, M.A., Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 19th Jan., 1882; B.A. (honours), London univ., 1889; M.A. (phil. and pol. econ.), 1893.

TRACY, THOMAS BURROWES, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1857; arrived, 29th Dec., 1857, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Muttra, April, 1877; from Feb., 1883, served as civil and sessions judge, and acted as jud. commr. in Oudh, 1884-85; retd., Sept., 1887.

TRAFFORD, RICHARD WYME, late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Rugby; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 28th Nov., 1864, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and jud. asst.; district judge, Nov., 1884; divl. judge, Dec., 1886; retd., Oct., 1891.

TREASURE, WILLIAM HOUSTON, Legal Adviser's Dept., India Office.—Clerk to the legal adviser to the sec. of state, June, 1877; solicitor of the supreme court, 1877; asst. to the solicitor to the sec. of state, Aug., 1892.

TREMENHEERE, CHARLES WILLIAM, C.B., Lieut.-Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Educ. at Addiscombe; 2nd lieut., Bombay engrs., 11th Dec., 1829; served as civil engr. in Dharwar, 1833-40, and as exec. engr., Surat and Broach, 1843-46; asst. exec. engr., Aden, 1846-47; from Dec., 1848, served in Sind as exec. engr., Karachi; dockyard, Bombay, March, 1850; on special duty, Bombay, designing reclamations, docks, and fortifications, Jan., 1854; dep. consulting engr., railway dept., Jan., 1855; garrison engr., Bombay, and acted as suptg. engr., Poona circle, 1856-57; served in the Mutiny (medal with clasp for Central India); mil. C.B., March, 1861; suptg. engr., S. prov., Feb., 1860; chief engr., Sind, May, 1862; chief engr., presidency, Nov., 1866; pol. rest., Aden, Dec., 1870; retd., July, 1874.

TREMENHEERE, JAMES HENRY APPERLEY, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Lancing and Cheltenham Colls.; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1875, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; in 1883 served in Mysore as acting civil and sessions judge; served subsequently in Madras as head asst. collr., and acting asst. sec. to gov't.; offic. private sec. to the gov't., May to Aug., 1885; sub-collr. and joint mag., Aug., 1888; collr. and mag., Nilgiris, July, 1890; district and sessions judge, Aug., 1890; collr. and mag., Kistna, Jan., 1894.

TREMLETT, JAMES DYER, M.A., B.L., late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Sidney Sussex Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 17th Nov., 1860, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and dep. commr.; commr., Nov., 1880; addl. judge, chief court, April, 1884; divl. judge, chief court, Punjap, Sept., 1886; retd., March, 1889.

TRETHEWY, ANTHONY WILLIAM, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Winchester, and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, and 2nd Dec., 1885, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and asst. commr.; dep. commr., May, 1895.

TREVELYAN, ERNEST JOHN, B.L., Calcutta High Court.—Advocate, high court, Calcutta, 1875-85; offic. sec., board of examrs. for pleaders, &c., 1875-82; offic. mag., Calcutta, N. divn., 1876; judge, high court, Calcutta, 12th Jan., 1885; also pres., board of examrs. for pleaders and mukhtars, 1886.

TREVOR, ARTHUR CHARLES, C.S.I., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Lincoln Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 28th Oct., 1861, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and dep. commr. of customs and opium; collr. of customs, Bombay, April, 1879; senr. collr., Dec., 1884; collr. of salt rev., Oct., 1835; commr. of customs, salt, opium, and abkari, and reporter-gen. of external commerce, Sept., 1888; also British delegate for the Portuguese treaty; commr. in Sind, Nov., 1890; member of Bombay council, Nov., 1892; C.S.I., May, 1894; temporary member of govr.-gen.'s council, April-Oct., 1895; confd., April, 1896.

TREVOR, CHARLES BINNY, late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. in 1830; arrived, 12th June, 1832; served in Bengal, in the grades of asst. commr., asst. collr. and mag., and joint mag.; mag. of Bakarganj, June, 1840; supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, 1849; judge of sadar diwani and nizamat adalat, presidency, 1859; judge of the high court, Calcutta, 1863; retd. in 1867.

TREVOR, EDWARD WALTER, Col., I.S.C., late Sind Commn.—First commn., April, 1835; arrived, 8th May, 1855; from Nov., 1864, served in Sind as dep. collr. and mag., and acting district supt. of police; on mil. duty, 1879-81; dep. commr., Upper Sind frontier, Jan., 1881; collr. and mag., Haidarabad, Dec., 1884; at various periods acted as commr. in Sind; reverted to mil. dept., April, 1893.

TREVOR, FREDERICK GEORGE BRUNTON, Dir. of Funds, India Office.—Educ. at St. Peter's Sch., York, and Marlborough Coll.; E. India house writer, old establ., 10th March, 1853; junr. clerk, public, educ., and ecclesl. depts., Aug., 1860; senr. clerk, July, 1875; jud. and public dept., 1877; asst. sec. in that dept., June, 1887; dir. of funds, Feb., 1894.

TREVOR, GEORGE HERBERT, C.S.I., Col., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt of India.—Joined the Madras artillery, 5th April, 1853; from June, 1862, served in the Central Prov. as inspr. of schs., cantonmt. mag., asst. sec. to chief commr., and asst. commr.; from Oct., 1867,
acted as asst. rest., Haidarabad; sec. for Berar, April, 1877; depd. to accompany Sir Salar Jung on his tour to Europe in 1867 as pol. officer; offd. as rest. at Haidarabad, May-June, 1882; rest. and commr., Ajmir-Merwara, Nov., 1887; agent to govr.-gen., Rajputana, and chief commr. of Ajmir-Merwara, March, 1890; reverted to mil. dept., March, 1895; author of 'Rhymes of Rajputana.'

TREVOR, Salisbury Thomas, Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Dec., 1852; arrived, 2nd Nov., 1854; from Jan., 1855, served in British Burma as asst. engr., exec. engr., asst. to chief engr., and asst. sec. to chief commr.; transfd. to Bengal, Oct., 1863; served as garrison engr., Fort William, and suptg. engr., and was apptd. sec. to chief commr., Assam, public works dept., July, 1869; chief engr., and joint sec., public works dept., Bengal, March, 1881; on depl. in connection with international exhibtn. buildings at Calcutta, July, 1883; chief engr. and sec. to govt. of Bengal, public works dept., railways and roads and buildings, Jan., 1884; retd., March, 1889.

TREVOR, William Spottiswoode, V.C., Major-Gen., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Second lieut., Bengal engrs., Dec., 1849; arrived, 5th Feb., 1852; served in the Burmese war, 1852-53 (medal with clasp); employed on the Pegu survey, 1854; exec. engr., Bassein, Nov., 1855; was subsequently posted to Darjiling and Dinajpur; garrison engr., Fort William, 1861; comptr. and examr. of accts., Bengal, May, 1863; served in the Bhutan campaign, 1865 (medal and V.C.); suptg. engr., Calcutta, Jan., 1867; consulting engr. to govt. of Bengal, irrign., Jan., 1868; suptg. engr., mil. works, Calcutta, 1872; addl. chief engr. for famine relief works, Bengal, 1874; offg. chief engr. and sec. to govt.-gen.'s agent, Indore, April-Dec., 1875; offg. chief engr. and sec. to chief commr., Burma, Feb., 1876; confd., Dec., 1878; dir.-gen. of railways and dep. sec. to govt. of India, March, 1881; sec. to govt. of India in the public works dept., Feb., 1882; retd., Feb., 1887.

TROWARD, Thomas, late Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Victoria Coll., Jersey; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 9th Oct., 1869, and served in the Punjab as asst. cantonmt. mag., asst. commr., and offg. jud. asst.; dep. commr., Jan., 1887; divl. judge, May, 1889; retd., March, 1896.

TRUEMAN, Thomas, Col., I.S.C., late Bombay Jud. Dept.—Arrived, 23rd Nov., 1856, and served in the Mutiny campaign under Sir Hugh Rose (medal and clasp), and subsequently as asst. cantonmt. mag. at Poona and Kirki, and cantonmt. mag., and city mag., Karachi; cantonmt. mag., Ahmadabad, April, 1877, and subsequently at Belgaum; on famine duty, Sholapur, Sept., 1877; retd., Nov., 1888.

TUCKER, Alexander Lauzon Pendock, Indian C.S.—Educ. at Winchester, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1880; arrived, 28th Dec., 1882, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; forest settlt. officer, Bijapur, Feb., 1886; asst. to rest. at Haidarabad, and asst. sec. for Berar, April, 1888; on depl. to Khetri state, 1888-89; asst. to the govr.-gen.'s agent, Central India, April, 1890; in 1891 acted as under sec. to govt. of India, for eign dept.; 1st asst. to rest., Haidarabad, and sec. for Berar, Oct., 1893; pol. agent, Haroali and Tonk, Dec., 1895.

TUCKER, Henry St. George, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1865, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; jud. asst., Dec., 1883; dep. commr., Nov., 1884; commr. in Burma, May, 1886; retd., Sept., 1890; author of reports on the settlt. of the Dera Ismail Khan and Kohat districts.

TUCKER, Henry Pendock St. George, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1842; arrived, 14th April, 1843; served as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge in various districts in the Bombay presidency, and acted as dep. registrar of the sadar court in Bombay in 1845-46; acting first asst. acctnt.-gen., Bombay, July, 1858; acting civil auditor, Bombay, 1858-59; collr. and mag., N. Kanara, July, 1862; judge and sessions judge, Konkan, Aug., 1862; offg. judge of the high court, Bombay, June, 1863; member of council, Bombay, April, 1866; retd. in 1876.

TUCKER, Louis Henry Emille, C.I.E., Col., Police Dept., Punjab.—First commn., 1860; arrived, 11th April, 1861; from Sept., 1864, served in the police dept., Punjab, as asst. supt. and district supt.; on special duty in connection with Kabul war, Nov., 1878, and again, Sept., 1879; dep. inspr.-gen., March, 1888; chief commr., Port Blair, Sept., 1888; re-apptd. dep. inspr.-gen. of police, Punjab, May, 1890; C.I.E., Jan., 1891; inspr.-gen. and under sec. to govt. home (police) dept., Dec., 1894.

TUCKER, William Roxburgh, Oudh Commn.—Joined the service, 12th Sept., 1871, as acting asst. commr.; confd., June, 1873; dep. commr., July, 1894.

TUDBALL, William, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Bedford Modern Sch. and Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 12th Nov., 1887, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., March, 1892; asst. commr., Feb., 1896.

TUDOR-OWEN, Edward, B.A., Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Christ Church, Oxford; apptd. junr. clerk, 18th June, 1894.

TUPP, Alfred Cotterell, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Univ. Coll. Sch., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 29th Nov., 1862, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. supt. of Dehra Dun; also subord. judge from March, 1873; held charge of provl. gazetteer, 1876-77; joint mag. and dep. collr., Azimgarh, Aug., 1877; transld. to the finl. dept., govt. of India, Nov., 1878, and served in Madras, Bombay, and Bengal; acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Nov., 1883; Bombay, Dec., 1887; N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Nov., 1888; retd., Oct., 1889; author of 'The Indian Civil Service and the Competition System,' 1875; 'The Statistics of the N.W. Prov.,' 'The Paris International Monetary Conference of 1881, and Bimetallism,' &c., &c.

TUPPER, Charles Lewis, C.S.I., B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Harrow, and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 1st Nov., 1871, and served in the
Punjab as asst. commr. and asst. settlt. officer; under sec. to govt. of Punjab, April, 1877; offig. under sec. to govt. of India, dept. of rev., agric. and commerce, Sept., 1878; junr. sec. to govt. Punjab, March, 1882; sec., Nov., 1883; chief sec. to govt., March, 1890; on special duty in foreign dept., govt. of India, 1893-94, and from April, 1895; commr. and supt., Sept., 1895; C.S.I., Jan., 1897; author of 'Customary Law of the Punjab, vols. I-III, and of 'Our Indian Protectorate.'

TURNBULL, PETER STEPHENSON, M.D., Surgeon-Major-Gen., Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st Oct., 1860, and was employed under the mil. dept. until April, 1864, when he was apptd. supt. of vaccn., central circle; served in the Abyssinian campaign, 1867-68 (medal); examr. of med. accts., Feb., 1876; acted at various periods as supt.-gen. of vaccn., dep. sanitary commr., and inspr.-gen. of prisons; sec. to surgn.-gen., Bombay, Aug., 1882; dep. surgn.-gen., Sind, Feb., 1888; surgn.-gen. with the govt. of Bombay, Feb., 1893; retd., March, 1896.

TURNBULL, WILLIAM SATOOR, late Bombay Rev. Survey Dept.—Educ. at King's Coll.; joined the service, 14th Aug., 1865, as supernumerary asst. settlt. officer in Sind; asst. supt., rev. survey, Berar, Oct., 1869, and afterwards in Bombay; dep. supt., Konkan survey, Dec., 1891; supt., Deccan rev. survey, April, 1894; retd., Feb., 1896.

TURNER, SIR CHARLES ARTHUR, K.C.I.E., M.A., Council of India.—Educ. at Exeter Coll., Oxford (fellow, 1855); called to the bar (Lincoln's Inn), 1858, and went the western circuit; apptd. judge of the high court, N.W. Prov., and arrived, May, 1866; acted as chief justice in 1870, 1875, and 1878; chief justice of the high court, Madras, Jan., 1879; fellow of the univ. of Madras, Jan., 1879; member of the Indian law commn., Bengal, 1879; vice-chancellor of Madras univ., 1880 and 1882; retd., July, 1885; member of the public service commn., 1885-86; member of the council of India, Feb., 1888.

TURNER, EDWARD, late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Shrewsbury, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 20th Nov., 1864, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine relief operations, 1877-78; sub-collr. and joint mag., April, 1882; collr. and mag., Cuddapah, Jan., 1885; district and sessions judge, Cuddapah, Feb., 1885; collr. and mag., Madura, Jan., 1886; retd., April, 1895.

TURNER, FREDERICK CHARLES, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.)—Educ. at Christ's Hosp., and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 19th Dec., 1895, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.

TURNER, HENRY GRIBBLE, B.L., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1863; asst. collr. and mag., April, 1866; from Aug., 1866, to Dec., 1867, served in the police dept. as asst. supt. and district supt.; postmr.-gen., Madras, March, 1875; district and sessions judge, N. Arcot, June, 1884; collr., &c., at Vizagapatam, Nov., 1885; retd., July, 1890.

TURNER, LAWRENCE HERBERT, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at City of London Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 18th Dec., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.; offig. under sec. to govt., May, 1894; joint mag., Dec., 1894.

TURNER, SAMUEL COMPTON, Col., R.E., Mil. Works Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 17th April, 1866; arrived, 18th Dec., 1868, and joined the public works dept. as asst. engr. in Bombay, Jan., 1869; exec. engr., Feb., 1873; from Dec., 1873, served under the govt. of India; took part in Mahsud-Waziri expedit., 1881; offd. as asst. sec., mil. dept., in 1886 and 1887; suptg. engr., March, 1890; chief engr., mil. works, April, 1895.

TUSON, FRANCIS EDWARD, Port Blair Administration.—Joined the service, 25th Dec., 1868, as extra asst. supt., Port Blair; asst. supt., Dec., 1882; 1st asst. supt., April, 1891.

TWEEDIE, JOHN, B.L., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 13th Dec., 1860, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; offig. supt., Chittagong hill tracts, June, 1863; dep. commr., Dec., 1864; offig. postmr.-gen., Bengal, 1870-73; joint mag. and dep. collr., Oct., 1867; from June, 1874, served in the jud. dept., and was apptd. judge of the small cause courts, Krishnagar, Ranaghat, and Mirpur, Oct., 1876; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1877; retd., Dec., 1895.

TWEEDIE, MAURICE, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Arrived in India as ensign, 23rd Oct., 1856; during the Mutiny served with the field force in Central India, and subsequently with the mounted police in Oudh, and on the Nepale frontier (medal and clasp); from June, 1860, served as district supt.; junr. dep. inspr.-gen., Jan., 1890; senr. dep., March, 1893; reverted to mil. dept., Sept., 1894; author of a chapter on the fauna of Oudh, for incorporation in the Oudh gazetteer.

TWEEDIE, WILLIAM, C.S.I., Major-Gen., I.S.C.—First commn., Bengal infantry, Jan., 1857; served during the Mutiny (medal and clasps); adjutant, 1st cavalry, Haidarabad contingent, March, 1859; acted as asst. to rest., Haidarabad, from 1863; served in the Abyssinian expedit., 1868 (medal); 1st asst. rest., Haidarabad, and gen. supt., thagi and dakai dept., Oct., 1868; agent to govt.-gen., Murshidabad, 1876-77; pol. agent, Gwalior, 1878-79; during the Afghan war was senr. pol. officer with Major-Gen. Bright, during advance on Kabul, and was in charge of Jalalabad divn., March, 1880 (medal, C.S.I.); offig. pol. agent, W. Rajputana states, 1880-81; acted subsequently as rest. in W. Rajputana, in Gwalior, and Turkish Arabia; offig. commr., Ajmir, March-June, 1885; rest. in Turkish Arabia, March, 1886; reverted to mil. duty, Oct., 1891; author of 'The Arabian Horse,' 1894.

TWEEDY, GEORGE ALFRED, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 8th Dec., 1879, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and cantonmt. mag.; joint mag., Nov., 1887; asst. commr., March, 1890; supt., Dehra Dun, April, 1891; dep. commr., April, 1894; district and sessions judge, Jan., 1896.

TWEMLOW, EDWARD D'OYLEY, Major-Gen., R.E., late Mil. Works Dept., Govt. of India.—Joined the Indian establt., 9th Dec., 1859; apptd. asst. engr., July, 1862; exec. engr., Dec., 1865; served in Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal); transf'd,
to mil. works dept., Sept., 1887; suptg. engr., west of India coast defences, Feb., 1888; transfd. to Lahore and Sirhind command, April, 1892; and to Rawal Pindi, Nov., 1892; re-transf. to Lahore and Sirhind, Feb., 1893; sec. to govnr.-gen.'s agent, Baluchistan, June, 1895; reverted to mil. dept., Oct., 1895; retd., May, 1896.

TWIDELL, JOHN COOK, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the Oxford High Sch. and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam.of 1893; arrived, 27th Dec., 1894, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

TWIGG, JOHN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Repton, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1879, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; special asst., Dec., 1887; head asst., Dec., 1890; sub-collr. and joint mag., Nov., 1891; collr. and mag., Oct., 1895.

TWIGG, JOHN HILL, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Royal Sch., Dungannon, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 12th Dec., 1862; from May, 1864, served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine duty, 1874; joint mag. and dep. collr., 1st grade, May, 1880; mag. and collr., Hamirpur, April, 1882; addl. commr., Benares divn., April, 1889; retd., July, 1890.

TWISADAY, CHARLES EDWARD JAMES, Indo-European Telegraph Dept., India Office.—Apptd. to the London office of the dept., 29th July, 1869; accompanied the dir.-in-chief to Constantinople in 1880, as personal asst., and to the Persian Gulf in 1885 with the third Persian Gulf cable expdn., and afterwards to India; transfd. to India office, 1st Jan., 1889.

TWOMEY, DANIEL HAROLD RYAN, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at St. Stanislaus' Coll., Tullamore, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 22nd Dec., 1884, and served in British Burma as asst. commr.; under sec. to chiet commr., Jan., 1889; dep. commr., April, 1891; offg. junr. sec., March-July, 1892; offg. sec., March-Sept., 1893.

TYLER, HECTOR GRANVILLE SUTHERLAND, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Charterhouse and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 14th Dec., 1895, and served in N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

TYLER, SIR JOHN WILLIAM, Kt., C.I.E., M.D., F.R.C.S., late Jail Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service as offg. civil surgn., Etah, 6th May, 1863; apptd. also civil surgn. and supt. of jail, Mainpuri, March, 1866; supt., Meerut jails, April, 1873; supt., Agra jails, April, 1876; C.I.E., June, 1886; on special duty in Dholpur state, Dec., 1886; accompanied the Maharaja of Bharatpur to England for H.M.'s Jubilee, 1887; Kt., 1888; inspr.-gen. of prisons, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Sept., 1890; retd., July, 1896.

TYRRELL, WILLIAM, B.A., late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov.).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1858; arrived, 12th May, 1859, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; registrar, high court, N.W. Prov., Aug., 1870; mag. and collr., Jan., 1878; civil and sessions judge, Jan., 1882; puisne judge, high court, N.W. Prov., Nov., 1882; retd., Nov., 1894.

UDNY, RICHARD, C.S.I., M.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Univ. of Aberdeen, and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 25th Nov., 1869, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and jud. asst.; dep. commr., Feb., 1885; C.S.I., Jan., 1894; on special duty with Indo-Afghan boundary commn., Aug., 1894; promoted to commr., Dec., 1894.

UMESH CHUNDER BATABYAL, M.A., Bengal Provl. Service.—Master in the Sanskrit coll., Calcutta, Aug., 1873; dep. mag. and dep. collr., Feb., 1880; apptd. member of the statutory civil service, May, 1888; asst. mag. and collr., June, 1888; dep. mag. and dep. collr. in provl. service, May, 1893; mag. and collr., April, 1896.

UNDERWOOD, WALTER GREGORY, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Rossall Sch., and Chester Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1868; arrived, 17th Sept., 1870, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; on special duty to the Laccadives, Nov., 1881; sub-collr. and joint mag., Dec., 1885; collr. and mag., Jan., 1889; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1894.

UNWIN, ARTHUR HAMILTON, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at King's Sch., Sherborne, and Tonbridge Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 8th Nov., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; from Feb., 1873, served in British Burma as asst. commr. and inspr. of schs.; from Jan., 1880, served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge; judge and sessions judge, May, 1887; retd., Feb., 1896.

UPCOTT, FREDERICK ROBERT, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, Dec., 1863, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Nov., 1874; suptg. engr., Dec., 1890; engr.-in-chief, Bengal-Assam railway, N. section, Nov., 1891; consulting engr. for railways, and joint sec. to govt., railway branch, Madras, Feb., 1893; rank of chief engr., Oct., 1894.

UPENDRA CHANDRA MALLIK, B.L., Jud. Dept. (Bengal).—Joined the service, 3rd May, 1867 as munisf.; subordinate judge, Dec., 1878.

UPTON, ROBERT LEYCESTER.—Govt. solicitor, high court, Calcutta, from 4th March, 1881, to June, 1895.

UPTON, SAMUEL RICHARD, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Writer, India office, 3rd Feb., 1876; clerk specially attached, Sept., 1892.

VAN GEYZEL, JOHN LAWRENCE, M.B., Surgn.-Major, Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, and Oct., 1880; civil surgn., Negapatam, Jan., 1888; chemical examr. and profr. of chemistry, med. coll., Madras, Feb., 1890.

VAN SOMEREN, GODLIEB JAMES, Col., late Forest Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Madras infantry, Sept., 1850; apptd. to the forest dept., May, 1864; conservator, Mysore and Coorg, May, 1869; transfd. to Punjab, 1881; asst. comptr.-gen. of forest accts., Feb., 1883; conservator, Berar, Jan., 1885; also dir. of the forest sch. from Aug., 1889; retd., Feb., 1892.

VARADA RAO, TUMALAPALLI, B.A., B.L., Statutory C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Madras Univ.; profr. for the civil service, July, 1885; asst. collr. and mag., Dec., 1886; confd. in civil service, 17th Aug., 1887.

VARLEY, FREDERICK JOHN, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Westminster and at
Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 25th Nov., 1895, and served in Bombay.

VAUGHAN, ERNEST LLEWELLYN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Blackheath Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 10th Jan., 1888, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and acting asst. acctnt.-gen.; head asst., Nov., 1894.

VAUGHAN, JOHN PERCIVAL, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Charterhouse and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 10th Dec., 1894, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

VAUX, ALFRED ROBERT BRICKWOOD, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Writer, India office, 29th June, 1874; clerk specially attached, Sept., 1892.

VENGAL VENUGOPAUL CHETTI, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Madras Christian Coll., Madras Univ., and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 21st Nov., 1890, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

VENNING, FREDERICK, late Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 24th Nov., 1864, and served in the Punjab and Central Prov. as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; inspr.-gen. of police and prisons, Central Prov., June, 1880; commr., Aug., 1881; acted also as jud. commr.; retd., April, 1894.

VENTRIS, HENRY, Rev. and Statistics Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Highgate Sch., and Brighton Coll.; supernumerary writer, 2nd Feb., 1860; temporary clerk, Dec., 1860; clerk in registry dept., Feb., 1864; junr. clerk, rev. dept., Jan., 1873; employed in records branch, 1879-83; senr. clerk, June, 1885.

VERNER, WILLIAM HENRY, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll., and Victoria Coll., Jersey; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, and Dec., 1863; served in Bengal as offg. asst. sec., board of rev., joint mag. and dep. collr., and district and sessions judge; also served as inspr. of schools, April, 1866, and offd. as under sec., govt. of India, home dept., and as postmr.-gen., Bengal; retd., Dec., 1888.

VERTUE, WILLIAM, Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—First commn., June, 1857; from 2nd Dec., 1862, served in the police dept. of the Central Prov. as acting district supt., and personal asst. to the inspr.-gen.; from May, 1865, served as asst. commr.; cantonmt. mag., Saugor, Jan., 1877; small cause court judge, Nagpur, Jan., 1882; dep. commr., Sept., 1883; reverted to mil. dept., Nov., 1894.

VIBART, HENRY MEREDITH, Col., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—First commn., Dec., 1857; arrived, 30th Nov., 1859; asst. engr. in the Madras public works dept., Sept., 1861; exec. engr., Dec., 1866; on special duty in Bangalore, 1877-78; in special charge of the restoration of Tirumal Naick's palace, Madura, 1878; acting dep. chief engr. for irrigtn., and under sec. to govt., public works dept., March, 1879; supt. of works, presidency, April, 1880; suptg. engr., April, 1884; retd., Dec., 1891; author of 'The Mil. History of the Madras Engrs.,' and 'The History of the East India Co.'s Mil. Coll. at Addiscombe.'

VIBERT, ARTHUR LIONEL, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Victoria Coll., Jersey, and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 8th Nov., 1893, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

VIDAL, GEORGE WILLIAM, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Eton, and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 26th Oct., 1867, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and forest settl. officer; first asst., Dec., 1878; member of the mixed commn. at Goa, 1880 and 1885; pres. of the Bombay forest commn., Dec., 1885; collr. and mag., Panch Mahals, and pol. agent, Rewa Kantha, Sept., 1886; collr. of salt rev., Bombay, Sept., 1888; sec., pol., &c., depts., Feb., 1895; acting chief sec., April, 1895; member of legisl. council from June, 1894; chief sec. pol. dept., July, 1896.

VINCENT, CLAUDE, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and posted to Madras; asst. chief engr. and under sec., March-Oct., 1880; exec. engr., May, 1883; acting private sec. to govr. of Madras, March, 1889; under sec. to govt. of India, civil works branch, Dec., 1889; transfd. to Central Prov., 1892; acted as dep. sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., in 1892 and 1893; services lent to govt. of Straits Settlements for Krian irrigtn. scheme, in 1894.

VINCENT, HENRY ALEXANDER, Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., 9th Nov., 1866; prest., council of regency, Rampur, Nov., 1863; pol. agent, Baghelkhand, and supt., Rewa state, April, 1894.

VINCENT, ROBERT WILLIAM EDWARD HAMPP, C.I.E., Bombay Police Dept.—Joined the service, 1st March, 1869, and served as inspr. of police; asst. supt., May, 1875; supt., March, 1876; commr. of police, Bombay, Sept., 1894; C.I.E., Jan., 1894.

VINCENT, WILLIAM HENRY HOARE, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Christ Coll., Brecon, and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1835; arrived, 10th Dec., 1837, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1894.

VOWELL, CHRISTOPHER HENRY, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Cheltenham; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag. and dep. collr.; mag. and collr., July, 1884; retd., March, 1893.

WACE, ALFRED AUGUSTUS, late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Eton, and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1868; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Nov., 1884; in 1891-92 served in Assam as acting judge and commr., Assam valley districts; commr., Bardwan, April, 1894; retd., Sept., 1895.

WADDELL, LAWRENCE AUSTINE, M.B., Surgn.-Major, Bengal Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 31st March, 1880; offg. civil surgn., Jhelum, April, 1881; rest. physician, med. coll. hosp., Calcutta, Feb., 1883; supt. of vaccn. and dep. sanitary commr., March, 1885; chemical examr. to govt. and prof. of chemistry, med. coll., Calcutta, Jan., 1896; author of 'The Buddhism of Tibet,' &c., &c.

WADDINGTON, GEORGE, late Bombay C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1857; arrived, 21st Dec., 1857, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; junr. collr. and mag., Dec., 1878; senr. collr. Aug., 1881; retd., Nov., 1891.
WADE, EDWARD JOHN, M.A., India Office.—Educ. at Rugby, and Trinity Coll., Dublin (scholar and exhibr.), first senr. classical moderator and gold medallist); asst. librarian, India office, 23rd May, 1881; was for some time editor of 'Allen's Indian Mail.'

WAHAB, ROBERT ALEXANDER, Lieut.-Col., R.E., Survey of India Dept.—First commn., 29th April, 1873; asst. supt., survey dept., Jan., 1883; dep. supt., July, 1888; served in the Afghan war, 1879-80, in Mahsud Waziri expdn., 1881, Zhob valley expdn., 1884, and with Hazara field force and Miranzai field force in 1888 and 1891.

WAIT, LEWIS GORHAM, India Postal Dept.—Joined the service, 28th May, 1870; asst. dir.-gen., foreign post branch, Calcutta, Dec., 1880; first asst. dir.-gen. of post office, Sept., 1890; dep. postmr.-gen., Sind and Beluchistan, April, 1892.

WAKE, HERWALD CRAUFURD, C.B., late Bengal C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury in 1851; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. of Shahabad, 1858; C.B., May, 1860; mag. and collr., Patna, 1861; supt., Darjiling, 1862; retd., 1868.

WALCH, GEORGE TURNER, M.I.C.E., late Madras Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 31st March, 1866; exec. engr., April, 1873; suptg. engr., March, 1887; chief engr. for irrign., Sept., 1889; joint sec., public works dept., with charge of irrign. branch, July, 1890; retd., April, 1893; author of 'Notes on Some of the Navigable Rivers and Canals of the United States and Canada,' 1876.

WALES, JOHN ADOLPHUS GATGENS, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Lincoln Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 11th Dec., 1894, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

WALKER, ALEXANDER COULL, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., and Pembroke Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 30th Oct., 1893, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

WALKER, FRANCIS BLENNERHASSETT, late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the Bombay public works dept., Sept., 1863; exec. engr., July, 1868; transf. to Punjab, Jan., 1870, and employed on state railways; transf. to Bombay, March, 1881, and subsequently to Bengal; engr.-in-chief, N. Bengal and Tirhut railway extensions, March, 1883; suptg. engr., Dec., 1885; engr.-in-chief, E. coast railway survey, Nov., 1889; chief engr., Jan., 1892; consulting engr. for railways, Madras, Oct., 1892; retd., Feb., 1893.

WALKER, GEORGE CASSON, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Winchester Coll., and New Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 6th Jan., 1878, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; from April, 1883, served in the finl. dept. of the govt. of India, and was apptd. asst. acctnt.-gen., Punjab; transf. to office of acctnt.-gen., Bengal, Dec., 1883; from Feb., 1884, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and offg. district judge; served under the govt. of India from Sept. to Nov., 1886, as under sec., fin. and commerce dept.; settlt. officer, Lahore, Feb., 1888; also offg. dir. of land records and agric. in 1892, and offg. commr. of excise, &c., 1894; commr. of excise, &c., Nov., 1895; dep. commr., Jan., 1896.

WALKER, GEORGE HERBERT DACRES, B.A., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. sec. to govt. of N.W. Prov. and Oudh, 1st May, 1874; served subsequently in accts. branch; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., May, 1887.

WALKER, GEORGE WARREN, Gen., R.E., late Public Works Dept., Madras.—Second lieut., Madras engrs., 9th Dec., 1842; asst. civil engr., 1847; district engr., Kanara, Sept., 1859; suptg. engr., Coimbatore, May, 1863; chief engr., and sec. to govt. of Madras, public works dept., May, 1872; retd. from the dept. in 1876.

WALKER, HARRY BRUCE, Store Dept., India Office.—Matriculated at London Univ., 1875; clerk, 2nd class, India store depot, 6th July, 1877; 2nd grade supervisor, July, 1888.

WALKER, JAMES, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at the Univ. of Aberdeen and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 1st Dec., 1886, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; transf. to Central Prov. as asst. commr., Dec., 1890; dep. commr., Jan., 1895.

WALKER, JAMES WILLIAM, LL.B., B.L., late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 5th Dec., 1868, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge; acting remembrancer of legal affairs, 1880; judge and sessions judge, Feb., 1885; retd., Nov., 1893.

WALKER, THOMAS GORDON, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at the Gymnasium, Old Aberdeen, and Univ. of Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 4th Nov., 1872, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and was settlt. officer of Ludhiana, 1878-84; also acted as under sec. to govt., registrar of chief court, &c.; senr. sec. to finl. commr., Feb., 1888; commr. of excise, and inspr.-gen. of registrn., &c., Nov., 1888.

WALKER, THORNTON, M.A., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ. and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 8th Dec., 1885, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and 2nd asst.

WALKLATE, HAROLD THORNTON, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, India audit office, 31st Oct., 1892; transf. to record and registry dept., India office, 9th Aug., 1894.

WALL, RICHARD, M.A., LL.D., B.L., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Cork; apptd. after exam. of 1856; arrived, 16th Dec., 1856; served in N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; mag. and coll., Benares, Feb., 1877; commr. of excise and stamps, and inspr.-gen. of registrn., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, Feb., 1882; retd., Oct., 1891; author of stamp, excise, and registrn. manuals.

WALLACE, ALFRED CHARLES, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 17th Feb., 1872.

WALLACE, SIR DONALD MACKENZIE, K.C.I.E., M.A., LL.D.—Educ. at the Univs. of Edinburgh, Heidelberg, and Berlin, and the Ecole de droit, Paris; was 'Times' correspondent in Russia, Austria, and the East, 1878-84; private sec. to the govr.-gen. of India (Lord Dufferin), 1884-88; member of mission to Kabul, 1888; accompanied the Czarewitch during his visit to India, 1890-91; author of 'Russia,' 'Egypt, and the Egyptian Question,' &c.
WALLACE, JAMES, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1877, and posted to state railways as asst. engr.; transfd. to Burma, March, 1883; exec. engr., Nov., 1889; re-transf. to state railways, Oct., 1893.

WALLACE, WILLIAM ARTHUR JAMES, C.I.E., Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Dec., 1866; asst. engr., public works dept., April, 1864; asst. consulting engr., Calcutta, Feb., 1870; exec. engr., Sept., 1870; dep. consulting engr. for guaranteed railways, Calcutta, Oct., 1871; on special duty in connection with imperial assemblage at Delhi, acting as under sec. to govt. of India, 1876-77; on depl. to England in connection with Paris exhibn., 1878; sec. to railway conference at Calcutta, Oct., 1878; acting under sec. to govt. of India, railway branch, 1878-79; served in the Afghan war, 1879 (medal); engr.-in-chief and manager, N. Bengal state railway, Nov., 1879; served in the Egyptian campaign, 1882 (medal and clasp, and bronze star, 4th class Osmanieh); ofig. consulting engr. for guaranteed railways, Lahore, Oct., 1884; dir., N.W. railway, May, 1887; depd. to Switzerland to examine the Abt system of railways, 1887; C.I.E., Jan., 1890; reverted to mil. dept., Oct., 1892.

WALLER, RICHARD MAUNSELL, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll., and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1878; dep. commr., April, 1879; mag. and collr., Aug., 1885; retd., Jan., 1895.

WALLIS, BERESFORD GAHAN, L.C.E., A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., 17th July, 1871, and posted to the Punjab; exec. engr., Oct., 1881.

WALMSLEY, HUGH, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 28th Dec., 1894, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

WALPOLE, SIR HORACE GEORGE, K.C.B., Asst. Under Sec. of State, India Office.—Educ. at Eton; temporary clerk, India office, 12th Dec., 1862; junr. clerk, June, 1863; store dept., 1863; acctnt.-gen.'s dept., 1863-64; public works dept., 1864; rest. clerk, 1870-77; senr. clerk, April, 1877; private sec. to the permanent under sec. of state (Mr. Herman Merivale, C.B.), 1866-74, and to the sec. of state (the Marquis of Salisbury, 1874-78, and Viscount Cranbrook, 1878-80); C.B., 1880; also served as clerk of the council from 1877, and was apptd. asst. to the underscs. of state in addn. to his other duties, Sept., 1881; asst. under sec. of state, Nov., 1883, continuing to be clerk of the council; royal commr. for the Colonial and Indian exhibn., 1886; sec. to the royal commn. on civil estblts., 1886-90; K.C.B., Aug., 1892.

WALSH, ERNEST HERBERT COOPER, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Trent Coll. and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 11th Dec., 1884, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Nov., 1891; mag. and collr., Sept., 1895.

WALTON, FREDERICK THOMAS GRANVILLE, C.I.E., M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to dept. as engr.-in-chief, Oudh and Rohilkhand railway, 1st Jan., 1889.

WAPSHARE, ARTHUR, Major, I.S.C., Bor-

bay Jud. Dept.—First commn., 28th Oct., 1871; served in the Soudan expedit., 1884-85 (medal, clasp and star); ofig. cantonmt. mag., Karachi, 1887-88; cantonmt. mag., Deesa, Sept., 1888.

WARBURTON, HARRIS GRANT, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Dover Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1885; arrived, 5th Dec., 1887, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.; from Oct., 1891, to Aug., 1893, was employed under the govt. of India as asst. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, and asst. comptir.-gen. (paper currency); joint mag., March, 1895; asst. commr., Feb., 1896.

WARBURTON, JOHN PAUL, Police Dept., Punjab.—Joined the service, 28th May, 1864, as asst. district supt. of police; district supt., April, 1873; asst. inspr.-gen., railway police, June, 1874.

WARBURTON, ROBERT, C.S.I., Brevet-Col., I.S.C., Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 24th Oct., 1862; from Sept., 1869, served in the Punjab as asst. commr.; on special pol. duty in Khaibar, July, 1879; employed with Kabul force, Oct., 1879; pol. officer, Khaibar, Feb., 1882; C.S.I., Jan., 1890; author of 'An Account of the Boner and Amazai Tribes,' 'A Report on the District of Sugghan,' &c.

WARBURTON, WILLIAM PLEACE, M.D., Surgn.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the Indian med. dept., 31st March, 1866; civil surgn., Jalandhar, April, 1868; acted as supt. of central jail, Lahore, 1872-73; med. officer to the Maharaja of Kapurthala, June, 1874; principal med. officer and sanitary commr., Assam, Jan., 1884; inspr.-gen. of civil hosps., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, April, 1895.

WARD, ALFRED WILLIAM, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, acctnt.-gen.'s dept., 2nd Aug., 1892; transfd. to registry and record dept., Dec., 1894.

WARD, GEORGE ERNEST, B.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., asst. supt. of Dehra Dun, and joint mag.; mag. and collr., Jaunpur, July, 1879; commr., Jhansi divn., July, 1885; retd., July, 1880.

WARD, HENRY CONSTANTINE EVELYN, C.I.E., Col., I.S.C., late Central Prov. Commn.—Arrived as ensign, April, 1855; was employed under the mil. dept. up to 1864, including service in the Mutiny (medal and clasp), the Yusufzai expedit., 1858, and the campaign against the Mahsud Waziris, 1859-60 (frontier medal); asst. commr., Central Prov., Dec., 1864; dep. commr., May, 1870; acting inspr.-gen. of registrn., &c., Nov., 1873; addl. commr. in Kalahandi, June, 1882; special commr. for the repression of dakaiti in Narbada divn., Feb., 1886; from June, 1882; served under the govt. of India, as minister of the Bhopal state; commr., Narbada divn., Aug., 1889; reverted to mil. dept., 1892.

WARD, THEODORE METHUEN, Col., late Survey Dept., Sind.—Joined the service, 9th Dec., 1859; lieut., Bombay artillery, April, 1860; admitted to the rev. survey dept., Nov., 1864; supt., Sind rev. survey, June, 1889; reverted to mil. duty, 1890; retd., Dec., 1891.

WARD, WILLIAM ESKINE, C.S.I., M.A., Indian C.S. (Assam).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 29th Nov., 1861, and served in Bengal as asst.
mag. and collr., and joint mag.; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, home dept., 1865-66, and 1866-67; under sec. in dept. of rev., agric., and commerce, March, 1873; from Oct., 1873, served in jud. dept. as acting district and sessions judge; transf'd, to Assam, March, 1876, and served as judge and commr. of Assam valley districts; offd. temporarily as jud. commr. of Central Prov., 1883; fellow of univ. of Calcutta; offg. chief commr. of Assam, July-Oct., 1883, and from Feb., 1885, to Oct., 1887; offg. jud. commr., British Burma, April, 1884, to Feb., 1885; confd. as jud. commr., Burma, May, 1886, continuing to act as chief commr. of Assam; C.S.I., Jan., 1888; took charge of substantive appt. of jud. commr. of Burma, March, 1889; chief commr. of Assam, May, 1891.

WARD-SMITH, WILLIAM, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd., 3rd Dec., 1872, and employed on irrign. works in N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., Dec., 1881.

WARDEN, AUGUSTUS BROOKE, late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at the Kensington Gr. Sch., and Haileybury Coll.; apptd., 1842, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. judge; judge and sessions judge, March, 1856; judge of the high court, 1865; was also pres't. of the deptl. exams. committee for junr. civilians for five years; ret'd., 1871.

WARDEN, CHARLES JAMES HISLOP, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Bengal Med. Service.—First commn., 31st March, 1874; from 18th March, 1876, acted as civil surgn. of Bhagalpur, with med. charge of the central jail; offg. principal asst. to the opium agent, Behar, 1878; prof'r. of chemistry, med. coll., and chemical and opium examr. to govt., Dec., 1879; services placed at disposal of mil. dept., April, 1892; med. store-keeper to govt., Bengal command, April, 1894.

WARDEN, FREDERICK, Commander, late R.I.M.—Joined the Indian navy, 2nd March, 1852; from Dec., 1865, served as port-master of Canning, and asst. collr. of customs; from Dec., 1866, acted as asst. master attendant, and agent for govt. consignments, Calcutta, and from March, 1870, as agent for transports; also govt. prosecutor for trial of pilots, May, 1873, to March, 1876; asst. port officer, Aug., 1879; examr. in navigation, Nov., 1879; transf'd. to Rangoon as port officer, &c., March, 1882; ret'd., Sept., 1890.

WARDEN, JOHN LODWICK, B.A. (Oxon.), B.L., late Jud. Dept. Bombay.—Arrived, 8th March, 1852, and served in the Bombay cov. civil service as asst. collr. and mag., and dep. mag. in charge of the adalat, Haidarabad; resigned the civil service, May, 1858; apptd. extra asst. sec. to govt. of Bombay, jud. dept., Dec., 1866; asst. judge, April, 1867; from Jan., 1869, served as small cause court judge, and was apptd. third judge, Bombay, Dec., 1874, and second judge, May, 1888; ret'd., 1889.

WARING, MICHAEL, LOUIS, Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Clifton Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 24th Dec., 1894, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

WARRE, SIR HENRY JAMES, K.C.B., Gen.—Obtained commn. from Sandhurst, 1836; ensign, 54th foot, 3rd Feb., 1837; from 1839 served as A.D.C. to commander of the forces in British N. America (Sir R. Downes Jackson, K.C.B.); during 1845-46 was employed in Canada under the colonial office; served in the Crimea (medal with clasp, C.B., 5th class of the Medjidie and Turkish medal); in 1858 was in command of a mixed force on the Tapti River in co-operation with the Central India field force, and was subsequently apptd. brigadier at Mihow; mil. sec. to the commander-in-chief in India (Lieut.-Gen. Sir Hugh Rose, K.C.B.), June, 1860; served in the Maori war in New Zealand, 1861; was subsequently in command of the troops on the west coast, and in the prov. of Taranaki 1863-66 (medal); from 1870-74 was stationed in Ireland as brigadier-gen.; commander-in-chief, and member of govt.'s council, Bombay, Nov., 1878, to 1881; ret'd., Jan., 1886.

WARRY, WILLIAM, M.A., Pol. Dept., Burma.—Educ. at Exeter Coll., Oxford; in 1878 passed the competitive exam. for student interpreterships in China; was acting asst. Chinese sec. at Peking from Oct., 1881 to July, 1882; employed on special service under the govt. of India from Dec., 1885; received the Burma war medal for active service, 1887-88; apptd. pol. officer on special duty in Burma, 10th Feb., 1887; adviser on Chinese affairs, April, 1892; author of a transl. of the Peking Gazette, 1881-82.

WATERFIELD, SIR HENRY, K.C.S.I., C.B., Finl. Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Westminster; junr. clerk, India board, 1st Sept., 1853; finl. and railway dept., 1853; pol. and secret dept., 1856; private sec. to pres't. of the India board, 1858; India office, finl. dept., 1858; asst. private sec. and précis writer to the sec. of state, 1860; finl. dept., 1863; senr. clerk, April, 1863; asst. sec. in the mil. dept., 1867; public works dept., 1871; sec. in the statistics and commerce dept., 1874; sec., finl. dept., 1879; C.B., Dec., 1885; sec. of the Indian currency committee, 1892-93; K.C.S.I., July, 1893; author of the first report on the moral and material progress of India, 1866, and of a memo. on the census of British India of 1871-72, both of which were presented to parliament.

WATERFIELD, WILLIAM, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Westminster; apptd. from Haileybury, 1852; arrived, 19th Nov., 1852; served in Bengal in the rev. and survey depts. till 1859, when he was transf'd. to the finl. dept. as 1st asst. to the acctnt.-gen. for India; acted as sub-treasurer, Madras, and as civil auditor and supt. of stamps, Madras, Calcutta, and Bombay; from 1864 to 1877 served successively as civil pay-master, dep. acctnt.-gen., and acctnt.-gen., N.W. Prov. and Oudh; comptr.-gen., 1877-80; ret'd., 1881.

WATERFIELD, WILLIAM GARROW, C.S.I., B.L., Col., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 20th Nov., 1852; from Sept., 1857, served in the Punjab as personal asst. to commr. of Delhi, and asst. commr.; small cause court judge, Sept., 1863; asst. settl. officer, Gujrat, Nov., 1865; dep. commr., Dec., 1867; commr. and sessions judge, Peshawar, Feb., 1878; commr. and supt., Sept., 1878; on special duty, Nov., 1878 (with the Kuram field force); served under the foreign dept., 1881-82; reverted to mil. dept., Nov., 1888; author of a report on the settl. of the Gujrat district.
WATERHOUSE, James, Col., I.S.C., Survey of India Dept.—Lieut., Bengal artillery, June, 1859; arrived, 11th Oct., 1859; asst. rev. surveyor, Lower Prov., June, 1866; asst. surveyor with superintendence of the photozincographic operations in the office of the surveyor-gen. of India, July, 1866; asst. supt. of survey, June, 1870; on special duty with the Indian eclipse expdn., 1871-72, and for observing the transit of Venus, 1874-75; in charge of Indian eclipse exped., to Nicobar Islands, 1875; asst. surveyor-gen., April, 1874; dep. supt., and asst. surveyor-gen., July, 1882; supt. (new scale), and asst. surveyor-gen., Aug., 1892; in charge of photolithographic office, Calcutta, from Dec., 1886; author of a pamphlet on 'The Application of Photography to the Reproduction of Maps and Plans,' and other reports and handbooks on professional subjects.

WATERS, George, L.R.C.S., L.R.C.P. (Ed.), Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bombay Med. Dept.—Joined the Bombay med. service, 1st Oct., 1869; arrived, 27th May, 1870, and served in the mil. dept., and as acting ophthalmic surgn., Bombay, and civil surgn. at Beshire; surgn. to govr. of Bombay, May, 1877; from Oct., 1881, served as physician and registrar, Jamsetji Jijibhoi hosp., curator of the pathological museum, and prof., Grant med. coll.; presidency surgn., 3rd district, Nov., 1889.

WATKINS, Lawrence Augustus, Jud. Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 10th Dec., 1863; served in the dept. from Jan., 1865, as dep. registrar of the high court, clerk to the high court judges, and commr. for taking affidavits.

WATSON, Charles James Knight, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and posted to Bengal; on famine duty in Madras, 1877-78; exec. engr., May, 1883; employed in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as examr., public works acct., 1888-89, and in Madras, 1889-92; transfd. to Burma, Feb., 1892.

WATSON, Hubert Digby, B.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Harrow, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1892; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1893, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr.

WATSON, Sir John, K.C.B., V.C., Gen., I.S.C., late Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., Bombay infantry, 1848; served in Punjab campaign, 1848-49, Bozdar expdn., 1857, Mutiny, 1857-58, and Ambela expdn., 1863; from Sept., 1871, served as commandant, Central India horse, and pol. agent; rest. and agent to the govr.-gen. at Gwalior, April, 1877, also acting as agent for Central India; brigadier-gen. commanding cavalry brigade, Malta expedy. force, 1878; commanding Punjab chiefs' contingent in Afghanistan, 1878-79; in pol. charge of the district of Kuram, 1879-80; rest., and agent to the govr.-gen., Baroda, Jan., 1882; retd. from the dept., March, 1886.

WATT, George, C.I.E., M.B., Rev. and Agric. Dept., Govt. of India.—Apptd., 11th July, 1873; arrived, 4th Nov., 1873; served in the Bengal educn. dept. as profr., presidency, Hughli, and Patna colls.; on special duty in connection with the Burma-Manipur boundary expdn., 1881, and for Calcutta international exhibn., 1883; served under govt. of India, rev. and agric. dept., from May, 1884; apptd. to charge of imperial Indian economic court of Colonial and Indian exhibn.; C.I.E., June, 1886; reporter on economic products, April, 1887; author of several scientific papers, and editor of the 'Dictionary of Indian Economic Products.'

WATTS, George Kemphorne, A.M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1875, and posted to Haidarabad; exec. engr., Nov., 1881; asst. to suptg. engr., and asst. sec. to rest., Sept., 1886; transfd. to Assam, 1895.

WAY, Robert Atwell, M.I.C.E., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1873, and posted to state railways; exec. engr., Oct., 1880; services lent to Bengal and N.W. railway co., 1881; to Bengal-Nagpur co., 1887; and to Delhi-Ambala-Kalka co., 1889; employed on Chittagong-Akyab-Minhlha railway survey, Oct., 1893; suptg. engr., Aug., 1895.

WAY, Theodore Alban Henry, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Portsmouth Gr. Sch., Clifton Coll., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 26th Nov., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr., and asst. mag. and collr.; asst. supt., Jan., 1896; joint mag., Mar., 1896.

WEBB, Charles Morgan, B.A., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 30th Dec., 1895, and served in Burma as asst. commr.

WEBB, William Harold, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Worcester Cathedral Sch. and Hertford Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 10th Dec., 1894, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.

WEBB, William Trego, M.A., late Educl. Service, Bengal.—Joined the service, 6th April, 1875; prof., Dacca coll., May, 1875; prof., Presidency coll., from Jan., 1878; retd., March, 1892; has publ. 'Hints on the Study of English,' 'Indian Lyrics,' and translus.

WEBSTER, Edmund Forster, C.I.E., B.L., late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1857, and served in rev. and jud. depts., Madras; small cause court judge, May, 1867; district and sessions judge, June, 1873; collr. and mag. and agent, Tanjore, April, 1878; on special duty in connection with the famine commn., Oct., 1878, and again, Aug., 1881, as sec. to the famine code committee; sec. to govt. rev. dept., June, 1882; member of legisl. council, 1883, 1885, and 1886; chief sec. to govt., Jan., 1884; fellow of Madras univ., 1884; retd., Oct., 1887; C.I.E., May, 1888.

WEBSTER, Henry Binny, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1854; arrived, 17th June, 1854; served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and asst. settl. officer; mag. and collr., Saharanpur, Nov., 1867, and subsequently at Gorakhpur and Meerut; commr., Jhansi divn., Jan., 1878; inspr.-gen. of police, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, April, 1880; retd., 1886.

WEBSTER, John Edward, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at the Charterhouse and Trinity Hall, Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 26th Nov., 1891, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

WEDDERBURN, Harry George, B.L., Jud. Dept., Madras.—Reporter for the Indian law reports (Madras series), June, 1881; law reporter, March, 1888; administrator-gen., March,
1889; acting advocate-gen., 1891-92; member of legisl. council of Fort St. George, 1893-94.

WEDDERBURN, Sir William, Bart., M.P., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1859; arrived, 25th Nov., 1860, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., asst. judge, acting jud. asst. to the commr. in Sind, and small cause court judge; acting sec. to govt. in the jud., &c., depts., Dec., 1866, and again in 1870 and 1874; under sec. to govt., jud. and pol. depts., May, 1867; acting registrar, high court, Jan., 1869; acting jud. commr. in Sind and judge of the sardar court, 1874-76; judge and sessions judge, June, 1875; acting judge, high court, Bombay, Jan., 1885; acting chief sec. to govt., Oct., 1886; retd., May, 1887; M.P. for Banfishire from 1892; member of royal commn. on Indian expenditure, May, 1895.

WEEKES, Arthur, M.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 2nd Feb., 1862; served in the Bengal rev. and jud. depts., and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1st grade, Aug., 1885; on famine relief duty at Madras, 1877; retd., March, 1888.

WEIDEMANN, George Lever, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch. and Oriel Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1863; arrived, 23rd Nov., 1870, and served in Burma as asst. commr. and dep. commr.; addl. sessions judge, Oct.-Dec., 1890; acted as commr., 1893-95; addl. sess. judge, Jan., 1896.

WEIR, Charles James, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Royal Acadl. Instn., Belfast, and Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 17th Nov., 1879, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and asst. sessions judge, and in Coorg as offg. first asst. commr. and district mag.; acting under sec. to govt. of Madras, rev. dept., Oct., 1886; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, fin. dept., May, 1887; offg. dep. acctnt.-gen., Bengal, April, 1888; head asst. to collr. and mag., S. Arcot, Aug., 1888; sub-collr. and joint mag., Jan., 1891; collr. and mag., Dec., 1894.

WEIR, John William Allen, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Godolphin Sch., Hammersmith, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 12th Nov., 1884, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and administrator of Sachin state; 1st asst., Aug., 1895.

WEIR, Patrick Alexander, M.B., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the service in 1875; offg. 2nd rest. surg., presidency gen. hosp., Aug., 1876; supt. of vaccn., March, 1882; principal asst. to opium agent, Benares, May, 1882; offg. residency surgn., Nepal, May, 1891; offg. agency surgn. and administrative med. officer, Baluchistan, June, 1894.

WEIR, Thomas, B.A., late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Belfast; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 8th Dec., 1867, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; dep. registrar, high court, 1870-72; Tamil transl. to govt., Jan., 1879; head asst., Godavari, March, 1880; registrar, high court, April, 1882; from July, 1883, acted as district and sessions judge, and was placed on special duty in connection with the reorganization of the subord. jud. service, Nov., 1883; sub-sec., board of rev., Feb., 1886; district and sessions judge, Nov., 1887; offg. judge of high court, March, 1890, to Jan., 1891; retd., Oct., 1896; author of 'Law of Offences and Criminal Procedure, as expounded by the High Court of Madras,' and of 'Rules of Practice (Civil) of the Madras High Court.'

WEIR, Thomas Stephenson, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Med. Dept., Bombay.—First commn., Indian med. dept., 1st April, 1870; health officer, Bombay, from 1874.

WELD, Matthew Richard, B.A., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Dublin Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 21st Nov., 1868, and served in Madras as asst. mag. and collr., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; acted as collr. and mag., Kistna, from April, 1885; district and sessions judge, Ganjam, Sept., 1888; Karnul, May, 1889; retd., Aug., 1893.

WELDON, Thomas, C.I.E., Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Madras.—Joined Addiscombe, Jan., 1852; ensign, Madras infantry, Dec., 1853; from July, 1860, served as asst. supt. and supt. of police; senr. mag. of police for town of Madras, March, 1867; chief mag. of police, Madras, April, 1877; chief presidency mag., Dec., 1880; board of exams., Jan., 1882; commr. of police for town of Madras, Dec., 1885; C.I.E., May, 1888; reverted to mil. dept., Dec., 1891.

WELLS, Henry Lake, C.I.E., M.I.E.E., Lieut.-Col., R.E., Indian Telegraph Dept.—Apptd. to the public works dept. as asst. engr., Feb., 1876; transfd. to state railways, Dec., 1876; on special duty in Baluchistan, in opening up Thal Chotiali route, 1879; lent to telegraph dept. for surveys in connection with a telegraph line from Srinagar to Gilgit, 1879; again lent to mil. dept. for field service, 1880 (medal); transfd. to Indo-European telegraph dept. as asst. dir., Persian section, 1880; dir., Jan., 1891; C.I.E., Jan., 1897; author of several reports on tours in Persia, &c.

WELLS, Walter Fox Williamson, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Cheltenham; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 16th Nov., 1875, and served in Oudh as asst. commr.; city mag., Lucknow, Oct., 1885; joint mag., July, 1889; dep. commr., Nov., 1891; district and sessions judge, May, 1894.

WELSH, William Henry, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Haileybury; apptd. after exam. of 1874; arrived, 20th Nov., 1876, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., asst. sessions judge, &c.; head asst. to collr. and mag., Jan., 1885; senr. asst., Dec., 1887; sub-collr. and joint mag., Aug., 1889; collr. and mag., Nov., 1891; district and sessions judge, Cuddapah, Jan., 1894; collr. and mag., S.-Kanara, Nov., 1894.

WENLOCK (Baron), Right Hon. Belby Lawley, G.C.S.I., G.C.I.E.—Educ. at Eton and Trinity Coll., Cambridge; M.P. for Chester, April to July, 1880; was vice-chairman of county council, East Riding; apptd. gov'r. of Madras, 20th Dec., 1890, and assumed charge of office, 23rd Jan., 1891; G.C.S.I., Jan., 1896.

WEST, Sir Raymond, K.C.I.E., M.A., B.L., LL.D., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Queen's Coll., Galway; apptd. after exam. of 1855; arrived, 18th Sept., 1856, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., asst. judge, and offg. under sec.; registrar, high-court, Bom-
bay, June, 1863; jud. commr. and judge of the sadar court in Sind, June, 1872; judge of the high court, Bombay, Sept., 1873; member of the law commission, Calcutta, 1879; vice-chancellor of the univ. of Bombay, Oct., 1886; member of council of govr. of Bombay, 12th Nov., 1887; K.C.I.E., June, 1888; retd., April, 1892.

WESTERN, James Halifax, C.M.G., Lieut.-Col., R.E., late India Public Works Dept.—First commn., Bengal engrs., 1860; arrived, Oct., 1862; asst. engr., public works dept., N.W. Prov., Dec., 1863; exec. engr., Ganges canal, June, 1868; transfd. to Punjab, May, 1882; suptg. engr., Sept., 1882; offg. chief engr. and joint sec. for irrigtn., Punjab, Nov., 1884; services lent to Egyptian govt.; retd., Jan., 1887.

WESTLAND, Sir James, K.C.S.I., Govt. of India.—Educ. at Marischal Coll., Aberdeen, and Wimbledon Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 10th Oct., 1862; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; offg. junr. sec., govt. of Bengal, July, 1866; offg. supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, June, 1870; under sec., govt. of India, finl. dept., Dec., 1870; acctnt.-gen., Central Prov., Dec., 1873; inspr. of local offices of accts., Nov., 1877; acctnt.-gen., Bengal, Oct., 1878; comptr.-gen. and head commr. of state paper currency, Sept., 1881; in England on special duty, 1884; member of fin. committee, March, 1886; offg. member, govr.-gen.'s council, Aug., 1887; temporary member, Nov., 1887; C.S.I., June, 1888; sec. to govt. of India, dept. of fin. and commerce, Nov., 1888; chief commr. of Assam, July, 1889; retd., Oct., 1889; finl. member of govr.-gen.'s council, 27th Nov., 1893; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1895.

WESTMACOTT, Edward Vesey, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Rugby, and Magdalen Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1861; arrived, 8th Jan., 1863; served in the Bengal rev. and jud. depts., and was on famine relief duty, 1874; offg. inspr.-gen. of jails, March, 1884; commr. of excise, Bengal, April, 1889; commr., presidency divn., March, 1892; acting member of rev. board, April-Nov., 1894.

WESTON, Donald, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Stratford-on-Avon, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 26th Dec., 1894, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

WESTROPP, Alexander Sligo Anderson, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Dover Coll., and Magdalene Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1891; arrived, 5th Nov., 1893, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

WESTROPP, George Ralph Collier, Major-Gen., I.S.C., late Pol. Dept., Bombay.—First commn., Bombay infantry, Dec., 1850; arrived, 27th Jan., 1851; was employed under the mil. dept., including service in Khandesh against the rebel leader Tantia Topi, 1858; adjutant, Sawantwari local corps, Feb., 1859; acting asst. mag. in Ratnagiri, May, 1860; asst. to pol. supt., Sawantwari, Nov., 1862; asst. pol. agent, Kolhapur, 1865-66; in charge, S. Mahratta jaghir states, 1869-77; pol. supt., Sawantwari, and commandant of the local corps, Aug., 1877; on special duty in the Savanur state in 1880; retd. from civil employment, 1888.

WHALLEY, Paul, M.A., late Bengal C.S. (N.W.Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Oct., 1861, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., offg. junr. sec., and under sec. to govt.; offg. under sec. to govt. of India, dept. of rev., agric., and commerce, Dec., 1871 to Feb., 1872; joint mag. and dep. collr., 1st grade, May, 1877; dep. commr., in Oudh, Dec., 1877; mag. and collr., Pilibhit, Nov., 1879; retd., Feb., 1890; author of 'A Collection of the Laws and Rules of the Non-Regulation Provinces.'

WHEELER, Frank, Store Dept., India Office.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, 1st Jan., 1893.

WHEELER, Henry, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1889; arrived, 14th Dec., 1891, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

WHEELER, Percy Cotterell, B.L., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 25th Dec., 1877, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; asst. settl. officer, Jaunpur, Nov., 1882; asst. commr., April, 1887; joint mag., Nov., 1888; retd., 1892.

WHISH, Charles William, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Tonbridge Sch., and Blackheath Proprietary Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 1st Nov., 1871, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag., and asst. commr.; dep. commr., Feb., 1890; mag. and collr., July, 1890; author of 'The District Officer in India.'

WHITE, Edmund, late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1865; arrived, 4th Dec., 1867, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and joint mag.; dep. supt. of provl. census operations, 1880; also under sec. to govt. in the census dept.; dir. of public instrn., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, June, 1885; member of lieut.-govr.'s legisl. council, Feb., 1889; retd., Aug., 1892; author of 'Report on the Census, N.W. Prov. and Oudh,' 1881.

WHITE, George Gilbert, A.M.I.C.E., Indian Public Works Dept.—Apptd. from Cooper's Hill Coll.; arrived, 29th Oct., 1878; served in Central Prov. as asst. engr.; exec. engr., Nov., 1886.

WHITE, Sir George Stuart, G.C.I.E., K.C.B., V.C., Gen., Commander-in-Chief of the Forces in the East Indies.—First commn., 4th Nov., 1853; served in the Indian Mutiny, 1857-59 (medal), and Afghan war, 1879-80 (medal and star, V.C., and C.B.); mil. sec. to the viceroy, 1880-81; took part in the Soudan expdn., 1884-85 (medal and star), and was asst. adjutant and quartermaster-gen. in Egypt, 1885; brigadier-gen., Madras, Sept., 1885, and commanded the brigade detailed for service in Burma; from 1886 to 1889, commanded the Upper Burma field force (K.C.B.); commanded Zhob field force, 1890; commander-in-chief in India, 8th April, 1893; extraordinary member of viceroy's council, 12th April, 1893.

WHITE, Henry Frederick, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, 19th Dec., 1859; 1st civil dipl. engr., April, 1865; exec. engr., Oct., 1866; in charge of Mhow mill. works divn., 1872, 1878, and 1880; offg. chief engr. and sec. to chief commr., Burma, July, 1885; offg. suptg. engr. and sec. to rest, Haidarabad, Sept., 1887; suptg. engr., May, 1888; suptg. engr. and sec. to agents for Rajputana and
Central India, public works dept., June, 1892; retd., June, 1895.

WHITE, Henry Richard, B.A., Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 4th Dec., 1872; B.A., London univ., 1882.

WHITE, Herbert Thirkell, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, and Jan., 1878, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; personal asst. to the chief commr.; cantonmt. mag. and small cause court judge, Thayetmyo, April-Sept., 1882, and again in 1883; sec. to the chief commr. for Upper Burma, March, 1886; sec. to the chief commr., April, 1887; chief sec., July, 1890; commr., Dec., 1890; C.I.E., Jan., 1892; offg. jud. commr., Upper Burma, May, 1894; offg. chief sec. to chief commr., July, 1894.

WHITE, John Claude, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; joined the service, 17th Nov., 1876, as asst. engr., and was posted to Bengal; temporarily employed on Behar-Assam railway, 1882; exec. engr., Aug., 1887; pol. officer, Sikkim, June, 1889; exec. engr., Sikkim, in addn. to other duties, April, 1890.

WHITE, John Hubbard, Major-Gen., R.E., late Mint-Master, Bombay.—Second lieut., Bombay engrs., Dec., 1853; arrived, Nov., 1855; from June, 1856, served in the Bombay public works dept. as asst. engr. and exec. engr. (for irrign.); from May, 1865, served as dep. consulting engr. for railways, Bombay; acting chief engr., and under sec. to govt. of Bombay, railway branch, June-Dec., 1874; acting mint-master, Bombay, June, 1876; rejoined the railway dept., Feb., 1878; from March, 1879, served as mint-master and mint-engr., Bombay; senr. mint-master from Jan., 1884; retd., March, 1890.

WHITE, Philip James, Oudh Commn.—Signaller in telegraph dept., July, 1854; served in the Mutiny (medal); dep. collr. and dep. mag., Gorakhpur, Sept., 1858; asst. settlt. officer, Nov., 1859; from March, 1863, served in the Jhansi commn. as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Dec., 1879; settlt. officer, 1885-88; author of a report on the assessment revision of 1861-69, and of three settlt. reports.

WHITE, Walter Hanbury, Major, R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. asst. engr., Jan., 1874, and posted to state railways; asst. dir., north-eastern system, and asst. sec. to govt. of Bengal, Oct., 1878; served in Afghan war, 1878-80 (medal); exec. engr., Jan., 1880; services lent to S. Indian railway co., Jan., 1891; employed on E. Coast line, 1891; offg. consulting engr. to govt. of India for railways, central divn., April, 1893; and at Calcutta, April, 1894; rank of suptg. engr., March, 1895.

WHITE, William Henry, Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 23rd June, 1873, as local fund engr., Surat; asst. engr., April, 1875; exec. engr., March, 1882.

WHITEHEAD, John Edwards, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Apptd. supplemental clerk, 1st Jan., 1893.

WHITESIDE, William Southey, late Madras C.S.—Apptd. from Haileybury, 1855; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., acting dep. sec. to govt., sub-collr. and joint mag., and small cause court judge; collr. and mag., Feb., 1873; served on the board of rev. from Aug., 1882, in charge of the inam dept.; acting prest. of the board of examrs., Nov., 1882; acted as dir. of rev. settlt. and agric., and inam commr., 1884; member of the govt.-gen.'s legisl. council, Nov., 1886; member, board of rev., Jan., 1889; retd., Dec., 1890.

WHITEWAY, Richard Stephen, late Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Univ. of London and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 10th Dec., 1868, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., asst. settlt. officer, and joint mag.; settlt. officer, Aligarh, Nov., 1881; settlt. officer, Ajmir and Merwara, Jan., 1883; dep. commr., March, 1888; mag. and collr., April, 1888; retd., Aug., 1893.

WHITLOCK, Charles James Toller, Col., I.S.C., late Madras Police Dept.—First commn., 20th Feb., 1858; served in the suppression of the Mutiny (medal); joined the dept., April, 1867, as proby. asst. sup't.; confd., Nov., 1868; resumed mil. duty, Aug., 1871; rejoined the dept., April, 1874; supt., Nov., 1881; reverted to mil. duty, April, 1895.

WHITMORE, John, B.L., late Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Merchant Taylors' Sch., and Merton Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 31st Dec., 1868; served in rev. and jud. depts., Bengal, and was apptd. joint mag. and dep. collr., Dec., 1878; offg. jud. commr., Chota Nagpur, Dec., 1881; district and sessions judge, Sept., 1885; retd., March, 1895.

WHITTEN, Richard John, N. India Salt Rev. Dept.—Joined the service in Feb., 1862, as asst. patrol; dep. inspr., internal branch, Jan., 1867; personal asst. to commr. of inland customs, Oct., 1869; collr. of customs, Sept., 1871; employed temporarily under govt. of Bombay in salt inquiries in Cutch and Kathiawar; dep. commr. of inland customs, Dec., 1879; at various periods has offd. as commr. of N. India salt rev.

WHITTLE, George, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 28th Nov., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr. and asst. commr.; joint mag., Dec., 1895.

WHITWORTH, George Clifford, Indian C.S.
