(Bombay).—Educ. at Sandicroft Sch., Northwich, and Queen's Coll., Liverpool; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 5th Dec., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; acting under sec. to govt. of Bombay in the pol., &c., depts., Jan., 1876; under sec. to govt. in the public works dept., for relief purposes, 1877-78; second asst. collr., Feb., 1881; jud. asst. to the pol. agent, Kathiawar, Nov., 1886; judge and sessions judge, Nov., 1887; acting sec., pol., &c., depts., 1893-94; author of 'The Theory of Relevancy for the purpose of Judicial Evidence,' an 'Anglo-Indian Dictionary,' 1885, and the 'Rajkumar Law Lectures,' 1888.

WICKES, Thomas Haines, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., April, 1861; engr. to the suburban municipality, Calcutta, Jan., 1865; re-apptd. as exec. engr., public works dept., Bengal, Nov., 1865; on special duty in the famine districts, 1874; asst. sec. to the govt. of Bengal, April, 1880; suptg. engr., March, 1886; chief engr. and joint sec. to govt. of N.W. Prov. and Oudh, July, 1891; sec. to govt., N.W. Prov. and Oudh, buildings and roads branch, Dec., 1892; retd., Feb., 1895.

WICKHAM, William Allen, Store Dept.,
India Office.—Apptd. 2nd grade supervisor, India store depot, 23rd Sept., 1889.

WIGHT, JOHN KNOX, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Queen's Coll. Sch., Trinidad, and Clare Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 4th Dec., 1872, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; on famine duty, 1874; transfd. to Assam, Dec., 1874, and served as asst. commr. and asst. inspr. of immigrants; dep. commr., March, 1884; returned to duty in Bengal, May, 1890; district and sessions judge, June, 1890.

WIGNER, JOHN MURCH, B.A., B.Sc., Store Dept., India Office.—Educ. at King's Lynn Gr. Sch., and London Univ.; temporary clerk, 17th July, 1862; junr. clerk, Jan., 1867; senr. clerk, July, 1885.

WILCOX, FREDERICK, late Bengal Police Dept.—Joined the service, 25th May, 1862, as asst. supt. of police; district supt., June, 1873; retd., March, 1895.

WILD, ALBERT EDWARD, India Forest Dept.—Joined the service, 11th Dec., 1869, as asst. conservator, and served in Burma and the Punjab; dep. conservator, Oct., 1876; conservator, Jan., 1892; in charge, central circle, N.W. Prov., April, 1892; dir. of forest sch., Nov., 1892; conservator of forests, Bengal, April, 1894.

WILD, CHARLES EDMUND, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at City of London Sch. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1887; arrived, 17th Dec., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. commr.

WILKIE, DAVID, M.B., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col.—Joined the service, 1st April, 1873, and was employed as civil surgn. and jail supt. at various stations in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; statistical officer to govt. of India in sanitary and med. depts., Nov., 1886.

WILKINS, CECIL ANSDELL, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at King's Coll. Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 26th Nov., 1868; served in rev. and jud. depts., Bengal; joint mag. and dep. collr., March, 1884; registrar, high court, March, 1885; district and sessions judge, April, 1886; member of Bengal legisl. council, March, 1894; supt. and remembrancer of legal affairs, Dec., 1894; compiled revised edns. of the high court's rules and orders, in 1881 and 1883.

WILKINS, THOMAS JAMES HACKETT, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Madras Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 30th Sept., 1873; arrived, 29th April, 1874, and was employed in Madras under the mil. dept. (including service in the Burma campaign) and as acting civil surgn.; district surgn., Anantapur, Sept., 1887; Ganjam, Nov., 1894; Malabar, May, 1895.

WILKINS, WILLIAM HENRY, Col., I.S.C., late Survey of India.—Joined the Bengal artillery, Dec., 1857; arrived, Jan., 1858, and served with the Cawnpore field force; studied at Thomason Coll., 1861-62; served in the rev. survey from April, 1863, as asst. surveyor; dep. supt., Oct., 1878; supt. (new scale), Aug., 1892; asst. surveyor-gen., Sept., 1892; offg. dep. surveyor-gen. and offg. dir. of Bengal surveys, April, 1895; retd., Dec., 1895.

WILKINSON, FRANCIS HENRY, late Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Milton Abbas Sch., Blackheath Proprietary Sch., and Pembroke Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 10th Nov., 1863; served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., and acting under sec. to govt.; on special duty as arbitrator of boundary disputes, 1870; sub-collr. and joint mag., Salem, April, 1878; district and sessions judge, S. Malabar, June, 1882; judge of the high court, Madras, Nov., 1887; retd., Feb., 1893.

WILKINSON, THOMAS ORMEROD, late Bengal C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Chudleigh Gr. Sch., and King's Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 3rd Dec., 1865, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and offg. registrar of the chief court; jud. asst., Dec., 1883; district judge, 1st grade, Nov., 1884; divl. judge, Jan., 1887; retd., Sept., 1890.

WILLCOCKS, ALEXANDER JOHN, M.D., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., Med. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Joined the service as asst. surgn. 30th Sept., 1873; served on mil., civil, and jai duty, and was apptd. civil surgn., April, 1877; offg. prof'r., Calcutta med. coll., 1892; hon surgn. to viceroy, Jan., 1894; depd. to Dholpur state in 1894.

WILLIAMS, ALBERT, LL.M., Indian C.S. (Hyderabad Admn.).—Educ. at Uppingham, Clifton, and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 8th Jan., 1886, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and under sec. to govt.; under sec. to govt. of India, foreign dept., May, 1894; pol. agent, Haidarabad, Nov., 1895.

WILLIAMS, SIR EDWARD CHARLES SPARSHOTT, K.C.I.E., Gen., R.E., India Office.—Educ. at the Royal Naval Sch., New Cross, and Addiscombe; first commn., 1848; adjutant of engrs., Fort William, and studying machinery in Calcutta mint, 1850; extra asst. sec., mil. board, 1851; supt., iron bridge yard, Calcutta, 1851-52; served with the Pegu expdn., 1852-53 (medal and clasp); supt., Pegu topogr. survey, 1854-56; principal, civil engrg. coll., Calcutta, 1856-60; member of senate, Calcutta univ.; acted as under sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., during the Mutiny; principal, Thomason Coll., 1861-62; under sec., govt. of India, public works dept., 1863-69; member of Bengal sanitary commn.; in charge of office of inspr.-gen. of forests for one year; acting mint-master and commr. of paper currency, Bombay, 1867; dep. sec., govt. of India, public works dept. (railway branch), 1869-74, and 1877-78; dir. of state railways, 1874-77; C.I.E., Jan., 1878; dep. govt. dir. of Indian railway companies, India office, March, 1880; govt. dir., March, 1892; K.C.I.E., June, 1893.

WILLIAMS, GEORGE ROBERT CARLISLE, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1864; arrived, 21st Nov., 1865, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; dep. commr., Jhansi, March, 1883; mag. and collr., Dec., 1886; commr., Allahabad, Feb., 1894; author of 'An Historical and Statistical Memoir of Dehra Dun,' and 'Gazetteer of Dehra Dun' (part).

WILLIAMS, HENRY CLISSOLD, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Haileybury; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 25th Oct., 1871, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; on famine duty in Bengal, 1874; from Nov., 1878, served in Assam as asst. commr.; inspr.-gen. of police and jails, &c., Assam, Sept., 1885; returned to Bengal as mag. and collr., Nov., 1891;
acting commr., April, 1894; prest. of mining commn., May, 1895; prest. of labour enquiry commn., Dec., 1895; chairman of Calcutta Corporation, April, 1896.

WILLIAMS, RALPH KING, India Public Works Dept.—From Nov., 1869, served in the office of the consulting engr. for railways, Bombay, and was apptd. asst. examr. of guaranteed railway accts. in 1872; served in Madras from Feb., 1873, and was apptd. dep. examr., May, 1876; examr., Indus valley state railway accts., Aug., 1880; transfd. to Nagpur, March, 1885; examr., guaranteed railway accts., Lahore, April, 1885; examr., N.W. railway accts., Jan., 1886.

WILLIAMS, WILLIAM, M.I.E.E., late India Telegraph Dept.—Joined the dept. as asst. supt., 16th Jan., 1868; arrived, 29th Feb., 1868; supt., April, 1880; held charge of various divns., including Indore, Bombay, and Nagpur; retd., 1890; author of 'Manual of Telegraphy.'

WILLIAMS-WYNN, ARTHUR W., B.A., B.L.—Educ. at Westminster Sch. and Christ Church, Oxford; called to the bar (Inner Temple), 1882; apptd. asst. private sec. (unpaid) to the sec. of state (Viscount Cross), Aug., 1886; asst. private sec., Dec., 1889; private sec., June to Aug., 1892.

WILLIAMSON, FREDERICK LENNOX JERVIS, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Dulwich Coll., Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 5th Jan., 1895, and served in the Central Prov. as asst. commr.; J.P., Sept., 1896.

WILLIMOTT, ANDREW BEAUCHAMP, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Lancing Coll., and Wadham Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 6th Dec., 1895, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

WILLIS, JOHN, Funds Dept., India Office.—Writer, 3rd Nov., 1862; junr. book-keeper, Nov., 1868; asst. book-keeper, Dec., 1881; clerk, Oct., 1892.

WILLOCK, WILLIAM ALEXANDER, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Dublin, and Sidney Sussex Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 12th March, 1870, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; sec. to the salt commn., Jan., 1876; from March, 1879, served in the salt dept. as dep. commr., and was also employed in suppressing the disturbances in the Gudum Hills, 1879; collr. and mag., Dec., 1888; collr. and agent, Vizagapatam, July, 1890; acting member of rev. board, July, 1895.

WILLOUGHBY, MICHAEL WEEKES, C.S.I., Lieut.-Gen., I.S.C., late Bombay Secretariat. First commn., Bombay army, June, 1849; acted as sec. to govt. of Bombay in the mil., marine, and ecclesl. depts., from May, 1880, and was confd., Feb., 1881; returned to Europe, 1888.

WILLSON, JAMES, M.A., Bengal Educ. Service (Assam).—Educ. at Ballinasloe Coll., Ranclagh Inst., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; profr., cathedral mission coll., Calcutta, Jan., 1870; asst., geological survey of India, Sept., 1871; profr., Hugli coll., March, 1873; Dacca coll., Jan., 1874; Patna coll., May, 1875; from Jan., 1879, served in Assam as inspr. of schools, and was apptd. dir. of public instrn., Assam, Jan., 1889; has edited Wilson's 'Dynamics.'

WILMER, JOHN RANDAL, Col., I.S.C., late Survey of India.—Joined the service as lieut., royal artillery, 22nd June, 1859; arrived, 27th Oct., 1860; served in the mil. dept., and in Aug., 1869, was apptd. asst. supt., topogr. survey; dep. supt., July, 1882; in charge of Baluchistan survey party, Oct., 1885, to Oct., 1886; supt. (new scale), Aug., 1892; reverted to mil. dept., Jan., 1896.

WILSON, ARTHUR, Legal Adviser, India Office.—Called to the bar (Inner Temple), 11th June, 1862; puisne judge, high court, Calcutta, 1878; vice-chancellor, Calcutta univ., 1880-83; prest. of the Crawford enquiry commn. at Poona, 1888-89; legal adviser and solicitor, India office, 27th April, 1892.

WILSON, DAVID, M.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Hutcheson's Gr. Sch., Glasgow, Univ. of Glasgow, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 4th Feb., 1886, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; dep. commr., Oct., 1894.

WILSON, FREDERICK ALEXANDER, Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commn., as lieut., Bengal artillery, 8th June, 1860; extra A.D.C. to viceroy, Dec., 1860; from Nov., 1870, served under the foreign dept. as guardian and tutor to the Nawab of Jaora, and as pol. asst. in Jaora, in Central India, and at Tehri; tutor to the Maharaja of Mysore, June, 1876; 1st asst. rest., Haidarabad, Oct., 1879; pol. agent, Oct., 1881; agent with the king of Oudh, and supt. of pol. pensions, March, 1882; boundary settlt. officer and asst. to pol. agent, Bundelkhand, Jan., 1883; offg. as rest., Nepal, and pol. agent, Bhartpur and Karauli; pol. agent, Bundelkhand, Oct., 1886; commr., Ajmir, Feb., 1894; rest., Persian Gulf, May, 1894; served in the Bhutan campaign of 1864-65 (medal and clasp), the Hazara campaign of 1868, and the Black Mountain expdn. (clasp).

WILSON, GEORGE, Commander, R.I.M., Marine Dept., Burma.—Commander, Indian marine, Aug., 1878; port officer, Bassein, April, 1882; acting asst. dir. of Royal Indian marine, May, 1889; port officer, Rangoon, Sept., 1890; offg. dep. dir. of Royal Indian marine, Aug., 1890.

WILSON, GEORGE FREDERICK, Major, R.E., India Public Works Dept.—Apptd., May, 1875, and posted to state railways; asst. dir., N.E. system, 1877 and 1879; asst. sec. railway branch of public works dept., Bengal, 1878; exec. engr., May, 1883; served in Soudan expdn. (medal), and was employed on Soudan railway, 1884-85; asst. sec. to govt. of India, public works dept., April, 1888; dep. manager, N.W. railway, April, 1891.

WILSON, JAMES, M.A., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Perth Acad., and Univ. of Edinburgh; apptd. after exam. of 1873; arrived, 14th Nov., 1875, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; offg. under sec. to govt., 1881 and 1884; offg. senr. sec. to finl. commr. in 1885 and 1886; dep. commr., Sept., 1890; author of works on tribal customs in the Gurgaon and Sirsa districts, and of the Sirsa settlt. report.

WILSON, JOHN HATTON, M.I.C.E., late Public Works Dept., Bengal.—Proby. asst. engr., 5th March, 1856; served in the public works dept. in the Central Prov., and temporarily in Oudh (1865-67), as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; also in mil. works branch, 1879; suptg. engr., and transfd. to Bengal, Dec., 1881; retd., 1890.

WILSON, ROBERT HENRY, B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd.
after exam. of 1860; arrived, 2nd Feb., 1862; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and mag. and collr.; offig. under sec. to the govt. of Bengal, Dec., 1870; inspr. of registrn. offices, July, 1872; offig. sec., board of rev., 1877 and 1879; offig. commr., Bardwan divn., Aug., 1884; employed under the public works dept. on the commn. in connection with the Orissa canals, 1884; offig. sec., govt. of Bengal, finl. dept., Feb., 1886; retd., Sept., 1887.

WILSON, THOMAS CORBY, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Clifton Coll., and Trinity Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 26th Nov., 1883, and served as asst. commr., Central Prov.; asst. settlt. officer, June, 1886; settlt. officer, May, 1888; transfd. to Burma as dep. commr., Feb., 1891; dir. of land records and agric., Aug., 1892.

WILSON, WILLIAM, M.A., late Madras C.S.—Educ. at Marischal College, Aberdeen; apptd. after exam. of 1859; served in the Madras rev. and jud. dept., and was apptd. district and sessions judge, Kistna, Feb., 1874, and collr. and mag., June, 1877; dir. of rev. settlt. and agric., Nov., 1882; addl. member, board of rev., April, 1883; fellow of Madras univ., 1885; acting sec. to govt. of Madras in the rev. dept., April, 1885; member of legisl. council, Sept., 1885; acting chief sec. to govt. of Madras, Oct., 1885; member of board of rev., April, 1887; 1st member and commr. of land rev. settlt., &c., Jan., 1889; retd., Oct., 1889.

WILSON, WILLIAM HENRY, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., Bombay.—Arrived, 22nd Jan., 1857, and was employed on mil. duties till April, 1864, when he was apptd. acting asst. pol. agent, Sadra; from Nov., 1864, served as asst. supt. of police, subord. mag., supt. of railway police, and district supt.; commr. of police, Bombay, July, 1888; reverted to mil. duty, Sept., 1894.

WILSON, WILLIAM HERBERT, Ph.D. (Heidelberg), Educ.: Dept., Madras.—Served from 4th Feb., 1875, as prof. of physical science, presidency coll.; fellow of Madras univ., 1880; in addn., registrar of Madras univ., March, 1886; prof. of chemistry, presidency coll., Nov., 1892.

WILSON, WILLIAM JOHN, M.I.C.E., F.C.H., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1874, and employed on irrigtn. works in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh; exec. engr., May, 1883; personal asst. to chief engr., and under sec. to govt., July, 1888, and again, Sept., 1891; services lent to Egyptian govt. from Feb., 1892.

WILTSHIRE, CHARLES PALMER BLUETT, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at the Proprietary Sch., Islington, City of London Sch., King's Coll., London Univ., and Middle Temple; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 8th Nov., 1869, and served as asst. collr. and mag., acting port officer at Karwar, and supt. timber depot, Kanara; boundary commr. between Kanara and Mysore, May, 1873; on famine duty, Dharwar, in 1876, 1877, and 1878; in charge of Huzur treasury in 1880 and 1881; 1st asst. collr., Sept., 1886; also forest settlt. officer, Poona, June, 1891; retd., Aug., 1894; transld. the preliminary chapter of Mills 'Political Economy' into Marathi.

WIMBERLEY, REGINALD JUSTUS, B.L., Col., late I.S.C.—Ensign, 3rd Bengal European regt., 1859; served in the Punjab police force, 1861-67; commissariat dept., March-Aug., 1867; from Aug., 1867, served in Bengal as district supt. of police; in command of police force to quell insurrection in the tributary mehals, May, 1868; 1st asst. supt., Port Blair and Nicobars, April, 1872; dep. supt., Dec., 1884; retd., Dec., 1887.

WINCHESTER, CHARLES BLAKE, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Blundell's Sch., Tiverton; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 23rd Oct., 1873, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; on famine duty, 1877; 2nd asst. collr., Nov., 1886; 1st asst., March, 1890; junr. collr. and mag., May, 1893.

WINCHESTER, ERNEST CHARLES, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Writer, India office, 16th Dec., 1872; clerk, 2nd class, Nov., 1878.

WINDSOR, JOHN, Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Old Trafford Sch., Manchester, and St. John's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1884; arrived, 28th Nov., 1887, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., and acting under sec.; joint mag. and dep. collr., Aug., 1894.

WINGATE, ANDREW, C.I.E., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Elizabeth Coll., Guernsey, Kensington Gr. Sch., Univ. of London, and Univ. of Heidelberg; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 8th Nov., 1869, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; in pol. charge of the Jath state, 1876; addl. sec. in the famine dept., Mysore, Aug., 1877; asst. sec. to famine commn., Aug., 1878; C.I.E., June, 1879; settlt. officer in Udaipur state, Aug., 1879; offig. rest., Mewar, and settlt. officer, Kashmir state, Feb., 1887; junr. collr. and mag., Kanara, July, 1890; acting collr. of salt rev., Bombay, Oct., 1890; also acting commr. of customs, &c., April, 1891; settlt. officer, Udaipur state, 1891-93; senr. collr., Sept., 1893; addl. mem. of legisl. council, July, 1896.

WINGATE, JOHN BRUCE, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at Old Aberdeen Gymnasium, Aberdeen Univ., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 28th Nov., 1890, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; under sec. to chief commr., Sept., 1895.

WINMILL, GEORGE, India Public Works Dept.—Joined the service as second sub-engr., Indus valley railway, 17th Nov., 1875; transld. to N.W. railway, May, 1888; and to Oudh and Rohilkhand line, Oct., 1888; locomotive supt., Oudh and Rohilkhand railway, Jan., 1889.

WINNY, THOMAS HERBERT, India Office.—Apptd. asst. to the surveyor and clerk of the works, India office, 17th Aug., 1885.

WINTER, EDGAR FRANCIS LATIMER, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Harrow, Trinity Hall, Cambridge, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1881; arrived, 20th Nov., 1884, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; under sec. to govt., Nov., 1889; dep. supt., family domains of Maharaja of Benares, April, 1893; supt., April, 1894; dep. commr., April, 1896.

WINTER, HENRY EDWARD, late Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll., and King's Sch., Canterbury; apptd. after exam. of 1866; arrived, 21st Nov., 1868, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag., and acting asst. pol. agent; first asst. collr. and mag., and forest
settlt. and demarcation officer, Poona districts, Jan., 1883; 2nd grade judge, Jan., 1885; junr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1888; senr. collr., Dec., 1890; retd., May, 1894.

WINTERBOTHAM, HENRY MARTIN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Portland Gr. Sch., and London Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1867; arrived, 19th Nov., 1869, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., principal asst., and sub-collr. and joint mag.; collr. and mag., Malabar, Aug., 1888; Tanjore, Nov., 1893; member of rev. board, Sept., 1895.

WOODEHOUSE, THE HON. ARMIN, C.B.—Asst. private sec. (unpaid) to sec. of state for colonies (Earl of Kimberley), 1880; private sec. (unpaid) to sec. of state for India (Earl of Kimberley), Dec., 1882, to 1885; private sec., Feb. to Aug., 1886; and again, from Aug., 1892; private sec. to sec. of state for foreign affairs (Earl of Kimberley), March, 1894, to July, 1895; C.B., July, 1895.

WOLFE-MURRAY, FRANCIS D'ARCY OSBORNE, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Harrow, and St. Andrew's Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1875; arrived, 19th Dec., 1877, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag., asst. sessions judge, forest settlt. officer, and district and sessions judge; sub-collr. and joint mag., March, 1890; collr. and mag., March, 1893.

WOLLASTON, ARTHUR NAYLOR, C.I.E., Rev. and Statistics Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Stockwell Gr. Sch.; entered the India office by open competition as writer, old establ., 3rd March, 1859; junr. clerk, pol. and secret dept., 1880; senr. clerk, Jan., 1873; asst. sec., rev., statistics, and commerce dept., Jan., 1884; in charge of the dept., May to Oct., 1886, and April, 1887, to March, 1888; in 1877 publd. a transl. of the 'Anvar-i-Suhaili, or Fables of Bidpai'; in 1879 edited Sir Lewis Pelly's miracle play of 'Hasan and Husain'; succeeded Sir F. J. Goldsmid as examr. in Persian at the royal staff coll., Sandhurst, 1880; selected in 1881 by the science and art dept. to superintend the transl. of the oriental inscriptions in the S. Kensington Museum; in 1882 publd. an English-Persian dictionary, and in 1889 a larger work of the same kind; C.I.E., Jan., 1886.

WOLLEY-DOD, F., A.M.I.C.E., F.C.H., India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Cooper's Hill Coll.; apptd., 1st Oct., 1876, and posted to state railways; services lent to Kashmir state, 1888-89; exec. engr., Oct., 1889; dep. consulting engr. to govt. of India for state railways, Nov., 1892.

WOMACK, ARTHUR SHAW, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1850; arrived, 5th Dec., 1882, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.; transfd. to Central Prov., July, 1885, and served as asst. commr., and registrar of the jud. commr.'s court; judge, small cause court, March, 1892; commr. of excise, Feb., 1893; dep. commr., April, 1893; also pol. agent, Chhattisgarh feudatories, May-Nov., 1893.

WOOD, ARTHUR LIDBETTER MARTIN, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at St. Paul's Sch., and Christ's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 13th Nov., 1892, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.

WOOD, EDWARD SEPTIMUS, Capt., late For-

est Dept., Oudh.—Arrived as lieut., 93rd Sutherland highlanders, 20th Sept., 1857; from Dec., 1859, served in the public works dept. on irrig. works, N.W. Prov.; offd. as conservator of forests, 1864-66; reverted to his regt., Feb., 1866; apptd. exec. engr., March, 1867; from April, 1867, served in the forest dept., Oudh and was apptd. conservator, Oct., 1868; retd., May, 1891.

WOOD, GEORGE PINCKNEY, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Educ. at Marlborough Coll., and Addiscombe; writer, India office, 25th Jan., 1869; clerk, 2nd class, Aug., 1878.

WOOD, HENRY MACKENZIE MACDONALD, Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Punjab Commn.—Arrived 20th May, 1863; from April, 1867, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and jud. asst.; dep. commr., Nov., 1884; and divl. judge, Nov., 1889.

WOOD, JOHN BARRY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Bengal).—Educ. at Marlborough Coll. and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1893; arrived, 11th Dec., 1894, and served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr.

WOOD, JULIUS JOHN, M.B., Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Bengal Med. Dept.—Joined the service, 1st May, 1868, and served on gen. and jail duty, and as supt. of vaccn.; on famine relief duty in 1874; dep. sanitary commr., Ranchi circle, Sept., 1888; retd., Feb., 1892.

WOOD, RICHARD BOARDMAN, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Bromsgrove Sch., and Hertford Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1894; arrived, 6th Dec., 1895, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

WOODBURN, ARCHIBALD FRANCIS, B.L., Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Ayr Acad., and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1870; arrived, 11th Nov., 1872, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; second asst. collr., June, 1885; 1st asst., Sept., 1888; collr. and mag., Haidarabad (Sind), Feb., 1893.

WOODBURN, Sir JOHN, K.C.S.I., M.A., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Ayr Acad., Glasgow Univ., and Edinburgh Univ.; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 12th Dec., 1863, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr.; transfd. to Oudh, Feb., 1865, and served as asst. commr., asst. settlt. officer, and offg. sec. to chief commr.; dep. commr., Faizabad, Aug., 1879; sec. to govt. of the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, in the Oudh rev. dept. and forest branch, Jan., 1882; also in the Oudh pol. dept., March, 1882; sec. to govt. of the N.W. Prov. and Oudh, jud. dept., May, 1884; chief sec., Nov., 1888; member of provl. legisl. council, Dec., 1886; member of viceroy's legisl. council, Feb., 1891; resumed his post as chief sec., April, 1891; again member of viceroy's legisl. council, 1891-92, and 1893; C.S.I., Jan., 1892; chief commr. of the Central Prov., Dec., 1893; member of govr.-gen.'s exec. council, Dec., 1895; K.C.S.I., Jan., 1897.

WOODCOCK, ELBOROUGH MARTIN, Col., I.S.C., late Police Dept., N.W. Prov.—Arrived as ensign, 9th March, 1856; served with the Persian expedy. force, 1856-57 (medal and clasp); apptd. to Oudh mil. police, 27th Nov., 1858; from March, 1860, served in the dept. as district supt.; reverted to mil. dept., Jan., 1892.

WOODS, ALBERT EDWARD, Capt., I.S.C., Assam Commn.—Educ. at the Royal Naval Sch., New Cross, and Sandhurst; entered the army
WOODTHORPE, ROBERT GOSSETT, C.B., Col., R.E., Survey of India Dept.—Joined the service, 25th June, 1865; entered the dept. as asst. supt., July, 1871; dep. supt., Nov., 1884; on special duty with Gilgit mission, May, 1885; on special duty in Europe, Feb., 1888; dep. quartermaster-gen. for intelligence, Simla, Feb., 1889; supt., April, 1894; attached to the Mekong commn., Oct., 1894; served in the Lushai expdn., the Afghan war, the Burma expdn., &c.; has written various papers on mil. and geographical subjects, and an acct. of the Lushai expdn.

WOODWARD, HILLERSDEN, Indian C.S. (Bombay).—Educ. at Oakham Gr. Sch., and Birmingham Gr. Sch.; apptd. after exam. of 1869; arrived, 28th Oct., 1871, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; forest settl. officer, Sholapur, Nov., 1883; 2nd asst. collr., May, 1885; 1st asst., July, 1888; junr. collr. and mag., Nov., 1892; senr. collr., July, 1896.

WOODWARD, WILLOUGHBY, M.A., late Bombay C.S.—Educ. at Oakham Gr. Sch., and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 26th Nov., 1863, and served in Bombay as asst. collr. and mag.; junr. collr. and mag. and district registrar, Panch Mahals, and pol. agent, Rewa Kantha, Aug., 1887; senr. collr. and mag. and pol. agent, Satara, March, 1886; retd., March, 1890.

WOOTTON, JOHN JOSEPH, Acctnt.-Gen.'s Dept., India Office.—Clerk, 2nd class, 20th Feb., 1872.

WORDSWORTH, WILLIAM, C.I.E., M.A. (Oxon.), late Educ. Dept., Bombay.—Joined the educ. service, May, 1861; arrived, 10th July, 1861, and served as head-master of the Elphinstone instr., Bombay, acting prof'r. in the Elphinstone coll., and asst. inspr. of schs.; from May, 1862, served as principal of the Deccan coll., Poona; principal and prof'r., Elphinstone coll., Nov., 1874; also sheriff of Bombay, Dec., 1885; C.I.E., Feb., 1887; retd., 1890.

WORGAN, JOHN BERNEY, late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Cheltenham Coll.; apptd. after exam. of 1856; arrived, 16th Dec., 1856; served in Bengal as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and mag. and collr.; from May, 1876, served in the jud. dept., and was apptd. district and sessions judge, 1st grade, July, 1879; retd., Dec., 1891.

WRIGHT, FRANCIS NELSON, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Eton, and Exeter Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 15th Jan., 1864; from Dec., 1864, served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and from May, 1870, in the settl. dept.; settl. officer, Cawnpore, April, 1876; offg. dir. of agric. and commerce, N.W. Prov. and Oudh, 1878 and 1880-81; joint mag. and dep. collr., April, 1878; dep. commr., March, 1885; mag. and collr., April, 1885; commr., Allahabad, Nov., 1891; opium agent, Benares, Feb., 1894; author of a memo. on the 'Agriculture of Cawnpore,' 'Cawnpore Gazetteer,' 'Cawnpore Settlement Report,' and 'Report on Wheat.'

WRIGHT, FREDERICK, Police Dept., Haidarabad Administration.—Arrived, 20th Aug., 1859; served as inspr. in the Madras commn. from Jan., 1860; transf'd. to Haidarabad assigned districts, Aug., 1862, and served as asst. supt. and district supt. of police; author of 'Margpradurshuk' (a treatise on the Indian Penal Code), 1878; a police manual of laws in 1883; and a schedule of all the penal acts of the govt. of India, 1841-83.

WRIGHT, FREDERICK CHARLES BUCKLEY, Store Dept., India Office.—Junn. clerk, 4th July, 1867; senr. clerk, June, 1891.

WRIGHT, HENRY NELSON, Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Eton and Corpus Christi Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1888; arrived, 29th Oct., 1890, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Nov., 1895.

WRIGHT, JAMES McCALLUM, M.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Fordyce Sch., Univ. of Aberdeen, and Univ. Coll., London; apptd. after exam. of 1883; arrived, 2nd Dec., 1885, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. mag. and collr.; joint mag., Nov., 1890; asst. commr., April-Oct., 1894.

WRIGHT, JAMES WALKER, M.I.C.E., late India Public Works Dept.—Apptd. to the dept. in July, 1859; served in the Punjab as asst. and exec. engr.; transf'd. to the Punjab prov. list, Nov., 1879; suptg. engr., July, 1886; offg. chief engr., and sec. to chief commr. of Burma, April, 1890; offg. chief engr., buildings and roads branch, and joint sec. to govt. of Punjab, Sept., 1890; sec. to chief commr. of Assam, June, 1891; retd., Jan., 1893.

WRIGHT, WILLIAM CHARLES, India Public Works Dept.—Trained at Thomason Coll.; apptd. prob'y.asst. engr., Oudh, 23rd Sept., 1864; confd., 1st April, 1865; exec. engr., March, 1871; lent to Cawnpore municipality, Sept., 1884; services lent to Rampur state, Jan., 1890; suptg. engr., May, 1891.

WRIGHT, WILLIAM HENRY, B.A., Educ. Dept., N.W. Prov. and Oudh.—Educ. at Corpus Christi Coll., Cambridge; apptd., 7th Aug., 1867, and served as prof'r., Benares and Muir colls.; principal, Bareilly coll., Dec., 1873; prof'r., Muir coll., Jan., 1877; principal, Benares coll., Oct., 1888; has publd. a handbook of the educn. dept., an account of the Muir coll., and various educ. works.

WROUGHTON, ROBERT CHARLES, Bombay Forest Dept.—Joined the service, 18th Oct., 1871; served as asst., and dep. conservator of forests; conservator, Dec., 1895.

WYBROW, GEORGE DIGBY, A.M.I.C.E., Public Works Dept., Madras.—Joined the service, 26th July, 1867, and served in Madras as asst. engr. and exec. engr.; suptg. engr., Jan., 1892.

WYER, FREDERICK, B.A., late Bengal C.S.—Educ. at Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1860; arrived, 31st Dec., 1861; served in the Bengal rev. and jud. depts., and was apptd. mag. and collr., 1st grade, May, 1884; offd. as commr. in 1883 and 1885; retd., May, 1887.

WYER, THOMAS ROWLAND, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Univ. of Glasgow, and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 20th Oct., 1873, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., and asst. settl. officer; asst. commr., Nov., 1884; joint mag., March, 1888; settl. officer in addn., March, 1890; dep. commr., Nov., 1890; district and sessions judge, Dec., 1891; mag. and collr., May, 1894.

WYLIE, HENRY, C.S.I., Col., Foreign Dept
Govt. of India.—Ensign, Oct., 1861; arrived, 15th Nov., 1861; and took part in the N.W. frontier campaign, 1863, the 2nd Yusufzai expdn. (medal and clasp), the Bhutan campaign, 1865 (clasp), the Abyssinian expdn., 1868 (medal), and the Hazara campaign, 1868 (clasp); on special duty in Baluchistan, with Major R. Sandeman, 1875-77; asst. to gov.-gen.'s agent, Baluchistan, 1877; served in the Afghan campaign, 1878-80 (medal); C.S.I., Feb., 1881; asst. to the rest. in Mysore, and sec. to chief commr., Coorg, 1882; pol. agent, Bhopawar, Feb., 1885; Jhalawar, April, 1885; Bhopal, March, 1887; rest., Nepal, Oct., 1893.

WYLLIE, WILLIAM HUTT CURZON, C.I.E., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—Ensign, 106th Foot, Oct., 1866; arrived, Feb., 1867; served in Oudh, 1870-79, as asst. commr.; acted as inspr.-gen. of registn. in 1875, and as junr. sec. to gov't., 1876-77; from Jan., 1879, served under the foreign dept., as cantonment mag., Nasirabad, asst. commr. in Mewara and Ajmir, and as asst. to gov'r.-gen.'s agent, Baluchistan; served in Madras, 1880-81, as mil. sec. to the gov'r., and acted as private sec.; C.I.E., May, 1881; pol. agent, in charge of ex-Gaekwar of Baroda, Mulhar Rao, 1881; asst. rest., Haidarabad, 1882; asst. commr., Ajmir, Nov., 1883; 1st asst. agent, Rajputana, 1884; addl. pol. agent, Kotah, April, 1885; boundary settlt. officer, Mewar-Marwar border, Nov., 1886; pol. agent, Kotah, Jan., 1886; offg. commr., Ajmir, July, 1891; offg. pol. agent, Jhalawar, in 1891 and 1892; offg. rest., states of Rajputana, May, 1893; rest., Mewar, March, 1894.

WYNCH, LIONEL MALING, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Bedford Gr. Sch., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1882; arrived, 7th Dec., 1885, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; sec. to land rev. commrs., Feb., 1894.

WYNDHAM, PERCY, B.A., Indian C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Giggleswick Gr. Sch. and Queen's Coll., Oxford; apptd. after exam. of 1886; arrived, 13th Dec., 1889, and served in the N.W. Prov. and Oudh as asst. commr.; joint mag., Aug., 1893; dep. supt. of family domains of Maharaja of Benares, April, 1894.

WYNNE, SYDENHAM HENRY, B.A., Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at the Royal Naval Sch., and Trinity Coll., Dublin; apptd. after exam. of 1871; arrived, 21st Oct., 1873, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.; head asst. to the collr. and mag., S. Arcot, Oct., 1882; sub-collr. and joint mag., Dec., 1887; collr. and mag., Jan., 1890.

YATE, CHARLES EDWARD, C.S.I., C.M.G., Lieut.-Col., I.S.C., Foreign Dept., Govt. of India.—First commr., 9th Nov., 1867; arrived, 27th Feb., 1868; from Aug., 1871, served under the foreign dept.; on special duty, Sind border, 1872 and 1873; boundary settlt. officer, Mewar-Marwar border, Sept., 1874; and Mewar-Tonk border, Dec., 1875; offd. for various periods as pol. asst., asst. to supt. for suppression of thagi and dakaiti, &c.; supt. of operations for control of Moghias, Sept., 1879; served in Afghanistan, 1880-81 (medal and clasp, and bronze star); subsequently served in the pol. dept. in Bhopal, Central India, and Bhopawar; attaché with Afghan boundary commn., July, 1884; on duty at Heat in connection with the fortifications, 1885; employed on various special services in connection with the Afghan boundary commn. pol. agent, Thal Chotiali, March, 1890; offg. rev. commr., Baluchistan, Oct., 1892; pol. agent, Zhob, March, 1893; on special duty on Russo-Afghan frontier, April, 1893; acting gov'r.-gen.'s agent and consul-gen., Khorassan and Seistan, Sept., 1893; author of gazetteers of Mewar, Banswara and Partabgarh, 'Northern Afghanistan,' &c.

YIELD, HORACE PARR, Surgn.-Lieut.-Col., late Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the Indian med. dept., 1874; was employed in the mil. dept. up to Aug., 1884, when he was apptd. probr. in the assay dept., Bombay mint; transf'd. to Calcutta mint, Sept., 1884; dep. assay-master, Bombay mint, May, 1886, and Calcutta mint, Jan., 1888; dep. assay-master, Bombay mint, May, 1892; retd., Nov., 1894.

YOUNG, GEORGE EDGAR, Registry and Record Dept., India Office.—Apptd. 2nd class clerk, 22nd May, 1888.

YOUNG, GEORGE GORDON, Col., I.S.C., late Punjab Commn.—Arrived, 23rd Oct., 1856; from June, 1858, served in the Punjab as asst. commr., and asst. settlt. officer; dep. commr., Jan., 1873; commr. and supt., Jan., 1881; offg. and finl. commr., 1888 and 1890; reverted to mil. dept., 1892.

YOUNG, HARRY GAVIN, Madras Police Dept.—Entered the service, April, 1874, and served as inspr., asst. supt., and supt. of police; dep. inspr.-gen., Dec., 1895.

YOUNG, JAMES, Bombay Public Works Dept.—Joined the service, 21st Dec., 1868, as asst. engr.; exec. engr., July, 1879.

YOUNG, MATTHEW, Indian C.S. (Madras).—Educ. at Trinity Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 25th Nov., 1892, and served in Madras as asst. collr. and mag.

YOUNG, WILLIAM, C.S.I., B.A., B.L., late Bengal C.S. (N.W. Prov. and Oudh).—Educ. at Heidelberg Univ. and Univ. Coll., London; called to the bar at the Middle Temple; apptd. after exam. of 1856; arrived, 16th Dec., 1856, and served in the N.W. Prov. as asst. mag. and collr., joint mag., and mag. and collr.; civil and sessions judge, Oct., 1880; jud. commr., Oudh, Aug., 1886; acting judge of high court, April-Dec., 1890; C.S.I., Jan., 1891; retd., Dec., 1891.

YOUNG, WILLIAM MACKWORTH, C.S.I., M.A., Indian C.S.—Educ. at Eton, and King's Coll., Cambridge; apptd. after exam. of 1862; arrived, 12th Dec., 1863, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr., asst. settlt. officer, and offg. sec. to finl. commr.; offg. under sec. to gov't., Oct., 1873; settlt. sec. to finl. commr., March, 1875; dep. commr., Jan., 1878; offg. supt., Kapurthala state, Feb., 1878; sec. to gov't., Punjab, Jan., 1880; commr. and supt., May, 1887; offg. sec. to gov't. of India, home dept., Jan., 1888; commr., Jalandhar divn., April, 1888; and finl. commr. of the Punjab, April, 1889; 1st commr., Feb., 1893; C.S.I., Jan., 1890; member of viceroy's legisl. council, June-Nov., 1893; pres't. of the Indian hemp drugs commn., Oct., 1893; rest., Mysore, and chief commr. of Coorg, Sept., 1895; nominated lieut.-gov'r. of the Punjab.

YOUNGHUSBAND, ARTHUR DELAVAL, Indian C.S. (Central Prov.).—Educ. at Rugby, and Clifton Coll.; apptd. to the Bombay civil service after exam. of 1875; arrived, 9th Dec., 1877, and served as asst. collr. and mag.,
talukdari settlt. officer, and asst. pol. agent; acted as private sec. to gov'r. in 1890; and as administrator, Rajpipla state, in 1888 and 1890-91; transf'd. to Central Prov. as asst. commr., Nov., 1891; dep. commr., Jan., 1892; also pol. agent, Chhattisgarh feudatories, Nov., 1893.

YOUNGHUSBAND, ROMER EDWARD, B.A., B.L., Indian C.S. (Punjab).—Educ. at Rugby, Clifton Coll., and Balliol Coll., Oxford; app'td. after exam. of 1877; arrived, 14th Dec., 1879, and served in the Punjab as asst. commr. and settlt. officer; junr. sec. to finl. commrs., March, 1886; under sec. to govt., Jan., 1888, to April, 1890; off'g. junr. sec., May, 1893; dep. commr., Sept., 1894.

YUSUF, MOHAMMAD, Indian C.S. (Burma).—Educ. at the Patna Coll. Sch., and Emmanuel Coll., Cambridge; appt'd. after exam. of 1890; arrived, 12th Nov., 1892, and served in Burma as asst. commr.; asst. mag. and collr., Jan., 1896.

ZORAB, JOHN MANOOK, M.B., C.M., Surgn.—Lieut.-Col., Bengal Med. Service.—Joined the service, 30th March, 1872; served in the mil. dept., and as civil surg'n., Balasor, March, 1887, Cuttack, March, 1891, and Bhagalpur, April, 1896.
